I'll look into it. I usually just listen to music while I run but eventually I get tired of that. Do you have any ideas for a mantra?
The one I used was "Not dead, Cant quit" but i think it's important to find one that fits with you. What type of music do you like to listen to when you run?

persona: I am in the sky.
I have powers.
I am 5.
dialogue: Me and my family went to the park and had some icecream.
What flavors did you all get? I could go for some ice cream right now!
I had chocolate. My wife got vanilla. The girls all got strawberry. It was delicious.
You guys aren't very adventurous with your ice cream! I love cookies and cream, Rocky road, And anything with fudge on top!
We are boring, Aren't we?! ?! Have you tried the new ice cream shop on Main Street? They have home made fudge that is pretty good.
I have not. I will utilize my powers to beam some up right now and let you know what I think.
The park was really relaxing yesterday. It rejuvenated me for the work week.
That's great! You need an outlet to release the stress and berecharged for the week. What did you do at the park?
We tossed a frisbee and the girls went on the swings. The weather was beautiful.
That sounds lovely! What a day of family fun!
It sure was. It was a weekend for the books. One to remember.
I did not do anything noteworthy. You are inspiring me to get some fun plans in the works.

persona: I hate the color orange.
I work at a bookshop. I like to read books about dogs.
I major in Chemistry.
dialogue: Things have been hectic recently at the restaurant, I haven't had time for the motorcycle.
How long have you been riding?
I've been riding motor bikes since my teens. I started riding off road riding motor cross and that's were my competitive edge for racing started.
Oh that's cool, Do you join competitions then? The bookstore was really busy yesterday, But not so much today.

Sometimes I ride competitions like time trials but mostly it is straight head to head racing. I remember the last time we spoke you were very creative with rhymes! How do you spend the time when the shop is quiet?
Oh I see, Do you have a race coming up then? When it's quiet I usually read some of the dog books or brush up on the sciences.
My next race is next month! I've been working on my bike to get it to max performance. There's a lot of tuning and checking to do. I love dogs! Can you recommend any dog books for me to read?
Good luck! I bet it takes a lot to repair your bike, Do you do it yourself? "Dog Years: A memoir" is truly an amazing book to read.

Yes, I've been obsessed with bikes ever since I started riding them. Bikes are my passion. The restaurant is just a means to riding my bikes. Dog Years, Is that the book by Mark Doty? My friend also recommended that to me. Maybe I should read it!

Oh that's nice, I guess books are my passion, Although you seem to be much more passionate about biking. Yes, That's the author. You should definitely read it, It helps you better understand how to care for a dog.
Have you got a copy in stock?
Yes, Two in fact. It's quite popular.

persona: My name is Dirk. I do not have children.
I live in the US. I have a girlfriend.
I have not read any books lately.
I love movies, my favorite is Forrest Gump.
dialogue: I found a new book you may be interested in.
What is it? I watched the Star Wars series again, Have you seen them all?
The book is called The Fault in Our Stars; it's a little similar to Forrest Gump in that it has a universal message about love. It sounded like your kind of book.
Sounds interesting. Have you gotten an ultrasound?
I have had an ultrasound just once.
Cool. My girlfriend thinks it's almost time for us to have a little one.
That's amazing! I guess you won't have too much time to read books, Then. And the subject of the story is probably a little depressing for such a happy time in your life.
You would know, Have you had time to read a lot? Soon you'll need some baby books. Have you gotten the nursery ready?
Well, I don't know if I'll be able to read as much as I currently do. Yes, We're working on designing the nursery.
The audio books are good, You can do things while you listen. I put some on my phone.
Yes. I think there is also an audio book version of the book I recommended to you.
I'll be sure to look for it. Let me know when you get a theme for the nursery so I can send a little something to you.

persona: I like animals. I have a dog and a cat.
I like to party and watch movies.
My favorite movies are comedies. Mean Girl is my favorite movie.
I volunteer at the food bank.
I am afraid of heights.
dialogue: When do you volunteer at the food pantry? Do you think they could use some more help?
I volunteer at the foodbanks on Tuesdays and the weekend. We are always looking for helping hands.
Would it be cool if I joined you sometime? And you're scared of heights? So I assume rollercoasters are not your thing?

Yeah you should definitely join sometime! Yes i am scared of heights but rollercoasters are my exception because it gives me a good thrill. You mentioned you like to cook, What is your favorite dish to prepare?
Great, Mind if I join you Saturday then? Oh that's a surprise, My sisters scared of heights and hates rollercoasters. I love preparing any time of pasta, Especially linguine.

Of course you can join Saturday. I enjoy roller coasters because i am trying to get over my fear so its just one step at a time. I love pasta as well im actually opening a restaurant that will several kinds of pasta.
Great! And wow, That's amazing, Very few people try to conquer their fears, I certainly would never try. Oh that's so cool, What's your favourite dish?
My favorite dish is a family recipe with a creamy sauce similar to alfredo but not alfredo. Add some chicken to that and your favorite pasta and its heaven in a dish. What is your favorite movie?
That sound amazing! Not going to lie, I love 21 Jump street and Oceans 8.
Those are some of my favorite movies great cast and hilarious scripts.
Yeah, Great comedy and jam-packed with action. Do you have any allergies? Scallops and pasta go great together.

I am allergic to some fruits such as apples, Pears, And pineapples. Those fruits give me a rash and make my gums burn, I have never tried Scallops and pasta might have to find a recipe some day. How often do you donate your hair?

persona: I sell cars for a living. I do not like my job.
I love music. I have a wife. I am planning on getting a divorce.
I am forty years old.
Monopoly is my favorite board game.
I love reality TV shows. My favorite reality show is Housewives of New Jersey.
dialogue: I am enjoying planning my beach vacation.
Sounds fun! Which beach are you headed to?
I'm planning on going to Ft. Lauderdale.
I love florida! I used to sell cars there a while ago. What's your favourite part about the beach?
It's just so relaxing. You can forget about all your troubles there. Where in Florida did you sell cars?
I sold cars in Miami. Even though I don't particularly like selling cars, It was a blast seeing so many expensive supercars.
I bet you saw a ton of expensive cars in Miami. Miami was the other place I was thinking of going to.
Miami beach is also a good choice aside from Ft. Lauderdale! Although it can get very crowded sometimes if you're not comfortable with that.
Yeah I don't really like crowds very much. Especially on vacation.
Yeah that makes sense, I don't either. My wife loves crowds, We're very different people. I still love her sometimes but I feel like the divorce thing would be a good idea.
You probably will always love her. But unfortunately some people just grow apart. You have to do what's best for you.
Yes you're right, Thank you for that. Anyway did anything interesting happen at the elementary school?

persona: I am a beekeeper. My wife is a supermodel. My wife is from Italy.
My name is George.
I like papaya.
I am not close to my family.
I keep Italian honeybees.
dialogue: My huskies have an appointment with the groomer this weekend. The weather is warming up, So it's time for a haircut.
I agree. Do u.
Do you have any kids?
Yes, My wife and I have two boys. Ben is five and Cam is eight. Do you like honey?
Yes, I love honey with tea. Do you ever think about getting a dog?
I'll send you some fresh honey from my hives. No dogs for us, My wife is allergic to dogs and cats. She is my supermodel boss!
Oh that's so kind, Thank you! Ahaha, Right wives are definitely the boss. At least you have kids to keep you busy. The weathers nice so you can probably take you family to the park!
True, My wife works a lot and am a stay at home dad. Do you like to read while taking your bubble baths?
Wow, You're life seems less stressful than mine. I'm a realtor agent, So my schedule is always busy. Yes, Definitely, Reading and bubble baths help me relax.
A realtor, Wow the market is so hot right now. I bet you are super busy. Maybe I can bring the boys over to see your dogs, Since Sue is traveling all week. What do you think?
Yeah, The markets been crazy. That's fine by me! I'm sure my boys would love to meet your boys. Perhaps after their haircut over the weekend?
Yes, I think the four of them will get along great. I'll bring the honey back and then maybe we can go out for an early lunch at that new restaurant near your house?

persona: I am the homecoming queen.
I want to study physical therapy. I am a senior in high school. I want to go to college.
I volunteer at the animal shelter. I have volunteered with Habitat for Humanity.
I am an introvert. I do not have a lot of friends.
dialogue: I saw that there is a small animal shelter opening up in the next town. Do you think you'd be interested in volunteering there? They need people to take care of some kittens.
When do you think they would need help? I am pretty swamped at the shelter I currently work at. Not to mention I am trying to get into college.
Yeah, You sound pretty busy. How come you don't have many friends? Because you're too busy?
Well, I don't get out much. It's hard for me to interact well, Especially face to face. I assume you don't have that problem, Especially in your profession?
No, It's obligatory for me to like people, With my job. Have you ever seen professional wrestling?
Oh yes. I love the bravado and flair you guys have in the ring. I am envious of your ability to interact with so many people. Does it hurt?
It hurts, But it's worth the money. What do YOU want to do for a living?
Well it's kind of a coincidence, But I want to be a physical therapist. Do you guys have a lot of them backstage?
Plenty of them. One of my best friends is a physical therapist, Actually.
Awesome. That is what I am going to college for. Maybe, When I graduate, I can use you as a reference?
Sure. Text me. Have you graduated high school yet?
I will this May. Top 10! I will start school this summer to get a head start.

persona: I have grey hair.
The place I live allows pets.
I am in jail because of stealing a cat from the pet store and I have one month left.
dialogue: My cat just did the funniest thing!
What did your cat do?

So my cat likes to jump from counter to counter. Well, I had a visitor who was helping me redecorate and was standing in front of the counter. My cat jumped right on her! She freaked out, But I just died laughing.
Haha that is funny, He's mischevous. What color is he?
I'd say he's mostly blue and grey. It's a really pretty color though. I wish you could come over and see him. When do you get out of jail again?
Oh so you have your favorite colored animal as a pet, Nice. I'll probably get out on good behavior in the next month.
I can't wait. You know we can work at getting you a cat when you come out. I know you have a good heart and want to help all cats, But let's start at the humane society when you get out!
Yes, That is probably a good idea, Atleast they will want me to save a cat unlike the pet store.
I know and it broke my heart when I heard it, But I'm so glad you will be out soon. What do you miss the most since you've been in jail?
I miss good food the most, A home cooked meal will be very welcomed. The food in here is terrible.
I hope to never try it, No offense. I will fix you something special when you are released. Has someone been taking care of your mail since you were out?
No offense taken. Thank you I'm excited to try that. No one is taking care of my mail, I have a PO box which is probably very full.

persona: I have two dogs. One is Springer Spaniel and the other a Lab. I rescued them both.
I work as a mechanic. I have fun as a mechanic.
I am a single man. I do not like being alone. I am 35 years old. I like to go to bars sometimes.
dialogue: Hi there. How are the dogs doing?
They have been together a nonth now, And it seems they are now friends. How long have your two been together?
They've been together for about 3 years now. Though they often fight over food. The lab is quite the stingy one.
Mine are doing that. How do you handle that?
I separate their bowls and feed them one at a time or in different rooms. Often I'll feed one while the other lays on the floor next to the bath as I take one. Afterwards they switch.
Thats a great idea!. Not to be indelicate, But do they get lonely when you take yur bath time? Or do they stay with you?
They often stay with me. They're well behaved and know to leave me to my relaxation. What about yours? Do they seem lonely after you've been gone from their sight a while?
They go absolutely crazy!. Maybe being rescues, They are a little more needy. I cannot close a door on me and them. Do you think that might get better in time?

I'm sure it will. Calm and reassure them whenever you leave that you'll be back and when you return reference that. Saying "See. I'm back." or similar. Dogs are quite smart, They'll catch on eventually. Treats as rewards helps a lot.
Do you find your dogs get jealous if you have company? Do they accept other humans being in your life and home?

I find it highly depends on the person. These two seem to have quite the insight and often know whether I'll like a new person or not before I ever do. Though they'll make themselves known if they feel they're not getting enough attention.
Lol! So they can be your date advisors! Mine seemlike thart.

persona: I live in Florida.
I have dogs, kids, and a wife.
I work finance too. I hope my son enjoys finance as well.
I like american sports.
dialogue: What kind of dogs do you have?
I have a hypoallergenic poodle. My wife is allergic to dogs that shed, So this is the perfect dog for us.
I've never heard of a hypoallergenic dog before! Wow! Where did you get it?
We got it at the pet store. Interestingly, Poodles don't shed at all! Do you have any pets?
Not currently. I've thought about getting a pet, But I don't think I want to leave a pet at home all day when I start school. What color and gender is your poodle?
Our pet is a grey miniature poodle; she's a girl. I can understand why you would be hesitant to get a pet when you are about to go to business school. Are you excited to go?
I don't know if I'm more excited or nervous. It's a big step in advancing my experience for my career. Does she behave well? I've heard smaller dogs are harder to train.

Our poodle is a little fussy, But other than that, She is great. And the kids love having a pet. Don't be nervous about business school; you will learn so much and make some great connections that will help you with your career!
That's very reassuring. It's big school. Surely, It won't take me long to settle in, Though. How many children do you have?

I'm sure it won't take you long to settle in. When you get there, Make contact with the Student Life office and they are sure to help you. I have two daughters and one son; I hope he goes to business school one day too.
It's a great career! It runs in the family, So it's in my blood. I'm sure with the right guidance your son will be interest in it as well. What careers do you hope your daughters land?

That's great that your family has experience with this field! They will be able to help you with your work. How far away is your school from your Manhattan home? I'm not sure what my twin daughters will end up doing, But they are total opposites in personality, So whatever they do will be different from one another.

persona: I like documentaries.
I volunteer at a soup kitchen.
I have never been hiking. I was not wealthy when i was growing up.
I am retired. I was a gym teacher.
I am from Chicago. I like to cook.
I have no pets. Cheeseburgers are my favorite food.
dialogue: What is your favorite documentary that you have seen?
I really enjoyed "The Staircase", It's about Michael Peterson. Have you seen it?
No, I haven't. Was it any good?
It was very good! Michael Peterson was a criminal mystery writer who was accused of murdering his wife. The documentary covers his story.
Oh, I remember his story now. Fascinating stuff. Did you come to a conclusion as to whether he was guilty or not from the documentary?
I assume he was guilty or he wouldn't have taken the plea deal.
Interesting. I will have to check it out as I love that genre. Did you see Making a Murderer? Another fantastic crime documentary in my opinion.
I've only seen the first season, I haven't had time to sit and watch season 2 yet.
I didn't enjoy the second season as much to be honest with you. I found it to be a bit bleak and frustrating.
That's good to know, I may take a pass on it then. By the way, I have an opportunity to visit Colorado, Are there any attractions you would recommend seeing while I am there?

Denver Zoo is a pretty good visiting spot. The Botanic Gardens are very pretty too if you're into that sort of thing. As you've never been hiking I wouldn't recommend Rocky Mountain National Park unless you'd like a challenge.

I'll have to check out the zoo and I might check out the National Park; I've never been hiking, But I'm always up for a challenge and I have heard the scenery is majestic. Can you recommend any local restaurants? I like to eat where the locals go when I travel.

persona: I don't go to school anymore.
I sell watches for a watch company. My family does not really support my career choice.
I enjoy shopping. I own my dream home. I want to get my dream car: a rolls royce.
dialogue: I am almost done shopping for the triplets.
I hope you bought a lot of warm and cozy stuff since they're going to be born in the Winter!! Is there anything you're super excited about that you purchased?
Yes! I have I this cool triplet stroller that is pretty much just three strollers in one. Trying to take care of three children at once is going to be a nightmare though!

I'm sure you're going to just fine!! It sounds like you're getting very prepared for when they come. It sounds like you weren't planning three at the least. Were you trying to conceive or did it just happen?

Well kids were always part of the plan and we were trying for a few months, But we never imagine we would have triplets! I was hoping to have a boy and a girl like a typical family but now we're going to have an extra member!

There's no controlling when or what gender you'll conceive. I'm sure you'll love them all the same. Three does sound like a handful, Though. I hope your husband is the helping type! It does take a village to raise a child as they say! Have you had baby shower for them, Yet?

Yes my husband helps so much with the shopping and getting the house ready for the babies, He does everything I can't do and more! We were actually planning a baby shower for August 20th, Maybe I'd see you there?

That sounds great! I would love to come! Where will you be having it at? Since you've done so much shopping is there anything you need that you haven't purchased, Yet? If not, I'll bring a couple watches. One for the lady and one for the husband. Maybe, Both.
We're just going to have it at our place, Maybe show off the new baby room! We have a registry if you want to check it out but some watches from your company would be a personal touch.
That sounds great. I'll have to check out your registry. Is the baby room a specific theme? I'm sure three cribs is taking up a lot of space. That must be a big room!

We didn't try to go with a theme since the three of them will be living with each other for while and interests might clash haha. It's a decently big room but luckily there were some small triplet cribs that connect together to fit on one wall. We also have a triple bunk for when they're older!

Did you have the triplet items custom made? I've never heard of a bunk bed with three beds-usually they only have two. It sounds like a very convenient way to save space! Which gender do you hope to have two of?

persona: I suffer from heartburn.
I am pregnant with triplets. I am with someone who already had children before me.
I have a new home.
I work at a school.
My favorite food at the moment is strawberry yogurt.
dialogue: I had the craziest night working at the bar last night. Do you want to hear about it?
I would love to hear about your night! What happened?
These guys came in and got up on the bar and started stripping, It was so wild!
That is wild! What did you do?
I gave them a few rounds and sat back and enjoyed the show, But they got the place pretty rowdy. Couple of fights broke out with them later in the night.
That is incredible. Do you know why they were so amped up?
Well they were Australian and coked up I think.
That is definitely more exciting than my night. I spent the evening on the couch binge watching netflix with my feet up.
Nothing wrong with that! The fights were a bit intense, I didn't like it. What did you binge on netflix?
I watched a bunch of "Grey's Anatomy". Don't judge me, It's my guilty pleasure.
I feel like that show has been on for 20 years! I've seen a few episodes, It is good but I didn't get hooked. Is that a Shonda Rhymes show?
Yes it is. I think they are on season 15 or 16 now. So you are pretty close with the 20 years.

persona: I go to school. I am in third grade.
I enjoy singing Disney songs.
Frozen has my favorite Disney songs.
dialogue: I programmed a robot to sing Disney songs!
Yeah? What all songs can your robot sing? I hope it can sing the ones from Frozen.
It can sing songs from Frozen and also from Mulan ( the cartoon one). Are you finished with your state testing yet?
Not yet. I've still got a couple of weeks to go. Can I see your robot? How tall is it?
Yes I would love to show you! It is 5'5" tall. Maybe you can come visit after school is out?
I will definitely do that! I'll get mom and dad to take me to your house. Can I play with the robot?
Yes! My parents said they will make lunch, What song would it like it to sing to you?
Cool! Have it sing Build a Snowman. I'll bring my stuffed Olaf to play with the robot while it sings.
Ha! That will be so cute. Is Olaf your favourite?
Yep! I've got sheets on my bed with him on it. Who is your favorite?
I love Sven, Maybe one day i will try to build a talkingreindeer!
OhHH! That would be really cool! He could sing Christmas songs and light up! What do you think you'll name him?

persona: I like eating all kinds of foods.
I work in construction and I enjoy building houses.
I like music and I play the piano and guitar.
I have cats.I love cats.
dialogue: I just looked at who built our house and it wasn't you.
Oh did you figure out who it was? I might be well acquainted with them!
It was a local company but I can't think of the name of the top of my head. I might be outgrowing it soon.
Ah well that's a shame. How big was the house and any cool features?
Its just a small two bedroom. But my husband and I are thinking about trying for kids and with our cats and working from home we need more.
How many more kids are you planning on having? Two would seem like a handful for me already.
I want at least one. Do you have any kids or just cat kids?
Maybe one someday but for now I'm going to stick with my cats! I have 3 of them and they're a lot of work!
I bet. Cats are the best. What are their names?
I have a russian blue named Loki, A japanese bobtail namedSushi, And a birman named Oreo! What are your cats names?
Sir Frederick Kittywinkles and Jojo. Those are cute names Mine are just a tabby and tortisehell.
Oh those breeds are very cute. Loki always manages to hunt a bird or a squirrel when he gets lets out, It's cute but frightening! Do your cats hunt things?

persona: I want to dye my hair blonde. I work.
I love playing role play games.  dont like blood or shots.
I work in a factory. I want to work at home.
I like to watch youtube.
dialogue: What youtube videos do you like to watch? What role playing games do you enjoy?
I think my favorite RPG game is Skyrim The Elder Scrolls. It's an older game but I still love playing it! I watch a lot of video game channels and music.

Oh, Nice. My cousin loves that game, But I've always been more into sports. It does seem fun, Though! Oh, By the way, When you talked about wanting to dye your hair blonde, It kind of made me want to dye mine as well. So I think I'm gonna go blonde too!
Haha playing sports is probably much healthier than playing video games! Have you ever played sports themed video games? And you should dye your hair blonde too! We can be twins hah.

My cousin always tries to get me into those sports games, But I feel like I'm much better in real life lol. And they don't really do softball games, Do they? Are there any sports games you'd recommend? I really wanted to go with dyeing it purple or something, But I have to keep it natural colors for the Army.

You're right because I don't know any softball video games! I know Madden and FIFA are super popular though. Purple would be fun but I get the army would not allow crazy fun colors! Maybe you could use temporary hair dye in the future!
They are always playing FIFA at my family parties lol. I could definitely try temporary. Are you free to do your hair however in the factory?

My managers could care less as long as I show up to work! I think it would matter more if I was in a leadership role or had to deal with customers and clients. I've tried temporary hair color because it's so easy to just wash out but you still can experiment with your look.
That sounds really fun! I would love to be in an environment like that. But working from home would definitely be best lol.
It's hard to beat the comfort of being at home and saving time without commuting. Do you like the army so far?

persona: I'm tired. I have a new job at a gas station. I like working with my hands.
I grow a vegetable garden. I grow carrots.
I only speak English.
I am adopted. I am a single man.
dialogue: Has the new job gotten any better?
I'm not really sure how I feel about it! It is new, You know? How's teaching going? Do you have any favorite students?
It's going well. We're still early in the school year so it's hard to say. I'm sure eventually a few will stand out. So what do you do at the gas station?
I do a few things. Sometimes, I stock the shelves. Sometimes, I work the counter checking out customers.
Do you work in one of the states where they still have you pump the gas? It's been a while since I've seen a full service gas station.
No. They have to pump their own gas. They have to prepay first, Though. Is there anything that you like about teaching the most?
It's always fun to see their minds really churn on a new idea or concept. Also, When one of them is really into the material.
Is it like watching their eyes light up when they see candy? Haha. Would you change jobs if you had the chance?

Ha, No. Not quite that gleeful. Um... I'm not sure. I suppose it would depend on the position that I was presented with. I really enjoy teaching and if the new job involved teaching and paid well I might consider it. Are you working at the gas station long term or is it just a temporary job?

I think I'm just going to be here temporarily, But who am I to say? I can't predict the future. Haha. I'm hoping to work here until I save up enough money to have enough downtime and find a better job. What if it was college wanting to hire you?

I'd definitely be interested. I hear that unless you're in a tenured position though it can be really tough to make a living as a professor. A lot of work going to adjuncts that are only working part time.
I didn't know that. I suppose you would have to have another job on the side if it were that way? Are there any other occupations you would consider aside from teaching if it came down to it?

persona: I read two books a month. My grandfather raised me.
I like riding horses. I had a horse. He died. He only ate kosher food.
I'm fit. I like reading. I only cook kosher foods.
dialogue: I went on a long ride on my Arabian horse today. The weather was perfect.
That sounds like a nice relaxing day. I used to have a horse.
Really? What kind and what was his name?
He was a Mustang named Soldier. My grandfather got him for me as a child. Unfortunately he passed away a few years ago.
Oh man that must suck losing something you grew up with. Can I ask how he died?
He was just old. He was 20 when he died. He was a great horse. I used to sit outside and read with him.
That sounds very relaxing, Horses are the best! Do you plan on getting another horse so you can ride again someday?
Probably not. I live in the city now and I couldn't really fit a horse in my apartment.
Oh that's too bad. What kind of music are you into? The foo fighters recently released a new album and it rocks!
Growing up in the country I tend to listen to country music. But I must admit I love some 90's pop music.
Oh 90's pop music brings me back. Nirvana and The Backstreet Boys were bangers!
Sometimes I still listen to it to drive my kids nuts while I'm cooking dinner.

persona: I played college football.
I broke an ankle.
I have a coffee blog.
I live in Los Angeles. I like to read poetry and Star Wars. I am a Star Wars fan and attend conventions. I don't like the new Star Wars movies. I did not like Rogue One.
dialogue: Have you discovered any new coffee?
I have actually! There is a coffee shop in LA that just opened up and they import coffee from Peru. Do you have any brands of coffee you like?
When I drink it I really like Dean's Beans brand coffee! I am more of a herbal tea drinker myself.
I should try that brand then someday! Tea is pretty great too. Sometimes I will drink tea during the night time because coffee is too stimulating before bed.
I know what you mean! Once I was drinking thai tea before bed thinking it had no caffeine only to find myself jittering in bed! What have you done today?
Oh no not thai! Also I have just been doing research on upcoming conventions. I want to see if they have any have good Star Wars panels I can attend.
Oh that's cool! Do you dress up when you attend? I like to sit outside convention centers when they have that sort of thing going on. I love the creativity.

I used to when I was younger but not so much anymore. Most people expect outfits from the new series and I am more old-school. But there really is so much creativity from the whole community I can't complain.
Have you ever seen any celebrities out in LA?
I have but I worry I might have missed so many. I can only recognize so many faces! You got any celebrities I should be looking out for you?
Hmmm no... I am trying to think of who would be the most mind blowing celebrity to meet.... Maybe r2d2 haha.
I can totally get you some pictures of r2d2. He doesn't pop out much but when he does, He controls the whole street!

persona: I go to school. I study culinary arts.  I want to be a pastry chef.
I can make paella. I love fish and chips.
dialogue: I decided I'm going to get fish and chips tonight after our conversation.
Oh yeah? I got your mouth watering huh? Maybe I could join you where what restaurant are you going toDine at?

Just a small takeaway place near my house; they don't have any tables, But the food is amazing. Do you go out a lot? Or do you prefer to cook for yourself now that you are learning all the tricks of the trade?
Well I do like to cook for myself, But the only way to learn new techniques used to go out and eat food you've never tried before so I eat out a lot.

I think you would be a fun dining partner; you could tell me if what I am eating is actually worth the price that I am paying. I am a bit picky about produce since I am partial to the vegetables I grow myself. I like knowing exactly where my food is coming from.
Hey have you ever thought about sell8ng your Produce that you grow directly to local restaurants? Because I know it's hard sometimes for restaurants to get good local produce.
Wheat is my main cash crop, But sometimes I sell the excess from my smaller vegetable patch. Not directly to restaurants, Just at a little stand I have by the road.
That is so cool! You have your own farmers market! Wheat flour is very importan5 when making pastries like I am learning. Do you grow organic wheat?
Yes; I had to invest a lot into the certification process, But now I can charge more because my wheat is certified organic. What is the most difficult pastry that you have learned to make so far?
Boy I still have trouble with butter croissants. They are so hard to get that perfect flakiness for me. Maybe I need to use some of your organic wheat flour.
I am a hopeless baker, But I am willing to taste test any time you feel the need to practice making croissants.
They Say practice makes perfect, But in my case practice might make you puke nobody likes my croissants I'm much better at making eclairs.

persona: My bones hurt.
I have kids.
I am in a world domination group.
I am a housekeeper. I painted for 20 years. A lot of my abstract paintings are in our local museum.
I miss painting. I have arthritis.
dialogue: I would love to get one of your pieces for my home.
I have a few works that are available for purchase. What art style are you interested in?
I am interested in your abstract work.
Great! Those are some of my best pieces. I have them in many sizes. I can send you links to some of my favorites if you'd like.
That would be lovely. I have several pieces in my home. I like to collect art.
Who are some of your favorite artists?
I really like Jackson Pollock. Who is yours?
Pollack is one of my favorites as well. I also like the works of Picasso andMiro.
I really enjoy the work of Picasso also!
Some of my art is inspired by Picasso. Let's meet up and I can show it to you sometime!
Absolutely. That would be great. Thank you.
You're welcome! I'd be honored to have one of my paintings hang in your home.

persona: I watch hockey.
I live in a rural area.
I'm a farmer. I have a rural farm with a lot of land.
I have a dog.
dialogue: How was the rest of the hockey game?
Terrible. My favorite team tanked and took a big loss. Have you gone skating recently?
Greetings from Portland! It was a beautiful sunny day :) The temperature was about 80 degrees which seems a little unusual. Spring has certainly sprung.
Has it? We're still seeing some winter here in the more rural areas.
No, I haven't skated yet. Sorry to hear about your team tanking. Wow, I hope the weather is more favorable for you especially for farming. What types of things do you farm?
Around here it's mostly potatoes and wheat. Our winters run much too long for most other crops to survive and thrive.
Yummy potatoes :) I went to a yard sale the other day with my brother. A guy gave him a free DVD. The movie was called Slap Shot. My brother says it's really funny. I can't wait to watch it.
I love potatoes, Especially mashed. I've never heard of the Movie. I assume from the name it's about Hockey?
Yes, Indeed. It's a comedy from 1977. In our area, We have the Penguins hockey team.
Oh, I'll have to watch it sometime. My favorite movies are comedies. Penguins are amazing, I can see why they'd choose that as their mascot.
Tee hee! Yeah, They're great. There was a movie about them too but I think it was a thriller. I can't remember the name of it though.
Paranormal Penguins maybe? I hear that's a movie about a hockey team trapped within a rink as terrifying mutated penguins rise from below the Ice.

persona: I live with two dogs.
I have a massager. I'm a gym trainer and am at the gym often. I train older ladies at the gym.
I love doing the treadmill and rowing machine.
dialogue: My kids came to visit me!
Really? That's great! Did you have a good time with them? Tell me about it!
Yes, They did!!! We had a really great time. I made a nice dinner for them and we talked for hours.
That is really wonderful! I know you must be so happy! So, How are they doing?
They are doing great, Thanks for asking. I'm going to be a grandma in 6 months as well! Do you have any children?
Congratulations! No, I just have my fur babies right now. Hey, Are you going to do a painting for the new baby?
Awww, What kind of pets do you have? Yes, I think I will paint a picture for the baby for the nursery.
I have border collies. They are smart and have a lot of energy. What kind of painting will you do?
Border collies are so adorable! Maybe someday I will get one. I am thinking of painting baby animals, Like pandas, Giraffes and birds.
That'll be cute! I would love to see your painting when you are done with it. Say, Can you paint dogs?
Yes, I can. Would you like me to paint a picture of your dogs?

If you wouldn't mind and it's not a lot of trouble. I mean, I can wait till after the grandbaby of course lol! Just some day when you are not too busy I could either bring them or send you pics of them.

persona: I like watching documentaries.
I live in pennsylvania and have a husband.
I started working as a personal assistant 3 months ago.
I like to read a book every week. I like harry potter.
dialogue: My daughter let me borrow her harry potter book!
Really? That was nice of her! So, Have you started reading it yet?
Yes, I just started, But it is a really long book so it will take me a while.
They are long, But they are good. I don't know if you've watched the movies but the books are way better. There's a lot more in them that was left out of the shows.
Well my step-daughter has really encouraged me to read them so I think I will have to read them all. Are they your favorite books?
I don't know about favorite, But I do like them. I'm surprised with your being a teacher and all that Harry Potter books were never considered by you.
I have mostly spent time reading some of the classics like To Kill aMockingbird and The Great Gatsby.
Oh. Those are good ones! Are they the ones you teach your students too?
Yes, Those and many other great books. They are very receptive to those books as well.
That is good to hear. So many kids these days don't care about the classics or reading for that matter. I guess you teach Shakespeare too?
Some, Primarily Romeo and Juliet, As well as Hamlet and MacBeth.
I remember reading those in school. You know, These classics you are talking about are heavy reading. If you can get through those Harry Potter will be nothing for you!

persona: I don't like sports. I like facebook.
I am fat.
I like battered and fried vegetables.
I don't have a favorite color.
I'm an atheist. I'm a woman. I like the color blue.
I watch cricket. I watch olympic potato throwing.
dialogue: So what exactly is olympic potato throwing?
It is a new sport that will be featured in the Olympics this summer! You must watch! They throw potatoes and the gold goes to whoever throws it the farthest.
Wow. Interesting. I don't think it is hard to throw a potato far.
You would be surprised! Some of these distances are really far! Google some videos on youtube.
I will thanks. Have you gone on facebook recently?
I was scrolling this weekend. I was checking the page of some of my favorite potato throwers. How about you?
I was on yesterday, Just posting my niece birthday wishes. she just turned 15.
How exciting for her! Did she get any good gifts?
She did. She received a newiphone, My sister took her and a few friends to.
That is a great gift! This time next year she will be driving!
Yes she will. She is already practicing. I meant to say they also went to Atlantic City she loved the resort.
I have never been there. It is on my bucket list!

persona: I am new here. I have a family.
I like Mickey Mouse. I have been to Disneyland. I am planning another trip to Disneyland. I like to read.
I have brown hair. I work on a maternity ward. I work the day shift. I wear scrubs for work. I am old.
dialogue: How is the family? Hope you had a lovely time hanging out together.
How is it working in a maternity ward?
It is interesting. The patients are all very friendly. And they let me jam out to good music while working, So I can't complain. How's your hospital?
Not as intersting as yors. The work tends to be pretty hard especially with my old age.
I hear you. It is very physical, Which gets worse with age. But at least we can be in comfortable clothes, Right?
We are only permitted to wear scrubs to work.
I enjoy scrubs. Elastic waistbands are comfortable to me.
With my age i prefer putting on something quite warmer.
I understand that. I am always hot, So I don't ever think about being cold.
Lucky you. You mentioned you like older music. Can you recommend a playlist?
Spotify has some really great ones under rock n roll. EnJOY!!!.
Sure i will definately check them out.

persona: I listen to death metal.
I am a swim coach for my local pool. I like to stay active.
I'm from india. I enjoy the beach.
I have a traditional mother. I am free spirited.
I like indian cuisine and holidays. My favorite indian food is broccoli and tofu in garlic sauce, chicken tikka masala. I usually marinate my broccoli and tofu in garlic sauce dish.
dialogue: I went to try indian food!
How did you like it? What did you get?
I had chickentikka masala. Since you mentioned you liked it.
Yes, It is one of my favorites. How did you like it?
It was nice. It wasn't too spicy.
That is exactly why I like it. It's not too spicy. Did you try anything else?
I had it with naan bread. That was good too. Would you recommend anything lese?
Mmmm. Naan. I make that at home at least once a week. It's super easy to make. Butter chicken is also good. Do you like spicy food?
That's amazing. Maybe you should invite me over for dinner. I don't like spicy food though.
Sure! I would love to have you over. Will your husband come as well?
Definitely! He loves all types of food. When are you free?
How does next week Friday night work for you?

persona: I am a language student. I speak spanish and am going to learn french. I only study languages.
My favorite word in spanish is trabajo.
I like camaros and bumble bee from transformers.
My dad has a mustang.
dialogue: I got my new car for graduation!
That's fantastic! Did you get the Mustang that you wanted?
Yes! I was so excited! Now I have a car like my dad!
Congratulations! So, Tell me about it. What color is it? How fast can it go? Hey, Did you get a convertible?
No. Not a convertible but a beautiful cherry red with back interior! I love it! Not sure how fast it goes but has a lot of power. What does your dad's mustang look like?
His is black and and an older model. He keeps it in mint condition because some day it'll be a collector's item. So, What school are you going to go to?
That is cool! Definitely will be a collector! I haven't decided on schools yet. Where do you study language?
Right now I am taking some online courses from the University of Miami. I'm considering taking brick and mortar classes in the fall.

persona: I own a yacht. I rent my yacht out to AirBnB.
I travel around the world. I like tea. I love food.
I don't know many people.
I am 23 years old.
dialogue: How long have you had a yacht?
I have had it for about a year and a half. Too bad you get anxiety traveling, Otherwise I would say you should come with me sometime.
That sounds like fun, But stressful. How do you handle being out on the ocean for so long?

I usually bring friends or family along for longer trips and otherwise we usually stop at different islands and countries, So it's not really all that lonely at all. It's nice to get in touch with nature too.
I don't know, I think I would freak out if I couldn't see any land, But it does sound awesome. What.
My parents had a yacht when I was little and I would go with them, So I guess I'm just used to the lifestyle. How are your roses doing? What kind do you grow?

That sounds really fun. They are doing well, But I am worried we will have a late Spring freeze and hurt them a little. I like to stick to the traditional red ones, They are my favorite, But I recently got some pink ones, That are smaller. Have you been to any good restaurants lately?

Oh no hopefully they can hold out for you and the freeze didn't ruin them! There was this little family restaurant I just went to in the Dominican. They had the best sandwiches and a bunch of tea too. I'm sure you would like it there.
That sounds really good! I may have to stick to local, Though. How has your AirBnB been going? Are you worried about your yacht when you rent it out?
It has been going well. It pretty much pays for all my trips I take when I'm not renting it out. Yes, I do get worried sometimes, But that's why I have a good insurance policy for that.
That is the best way to do it. Have someone else paying for your trips. I should look into that, But with my house. I think I could make some money, Since I am by the ski resorts.
Oh yes definitely. I'll have to send you the information I had from when I got started. I can see that being a hot spot with skiing!

persona: I enjoy going to the park. I'm searching for a new job. I am a surgeon. I have a 12 year old daughter.
I live in North Carolina.
dialogue: How has the job search been going?
The job search is going well. I expect to have a few interviews shortly. What have you been up to?
That's so good to hear! I haven't been up to much, Honestly. Just making the most of the sun by grilling every meal, Lol1.
That's great. My daughter loves grilled meat. She's loves a good barbecue.
You guys will have to come over one of these weekends. I just got a new Traeger grill and it's awesome. I'd love to cook for you both!
Thanks. It'll be a pleasure. We a free on weekends after I've helped her with her school homework.
Sounds good. Bring over anything in particular you guys want but I have just about every cut from every animal you could imagine in the walk in freezer here. How is her school going?
Thanks. I'll bring some ribeye steak if you don't mind. She's doing well in school but is struggling a bit with maths.
Of course! Oh I don't blame her there, Some people struggle with it. Bring over anything she's struggling with math-wise too and I'll have a crack at it.
That's great. You'll be feeding our stomachs and minds. Thanks a lot.
No worries at all. It'll be nice to have palates that appreciate it, Lol.
Would you like me to bring anything else? Like games or wine?

persona: I hate the color orange. I think fashion is dumb.
I don't go to the gym.
I work in a bookstore. My mother is disappointed. My parents kicked me out of my house. My parents disapprove of my job. I have a chemistry degree.
I have a dog. My dog is very agile. I spend a lot of time with my dog. I don't have time for dating.
I travel to canine competitions with my dog.
dialogue: I almost got into an accident with my new car!
Oh no!! I am sorry! What happened?
I was on my way to the gym and a dogdarted out in front of me.
Oh no! I hope you are okay? Did you hit the dog?

I'm fine, And so is the dog. I thought of you actually. The dog jumped so quick and was so fast, I think he could compete in agility competitions if he was better trained! Have you been doing well in your competitions?
Awww, I am glad both you and the dog are fine. Yes, We won first place last week!
That's so cool! Was the competition local or did you have to travel?
It was local this time. We have a competition coming up next month that is in Florida. I can't wait. I am making it a vacation and we are staying for a whole week.

I'm so jealous! Ever since I moved out of my parent's place I haven't had enough money scraped up to travel. But even though I don't live there, I still get to hear about how I should be married already almost daily.
Oh geesh. I am so sorry about that. Hey, Wanna go with me next month to the competition? I'll pay for everything!
That's so nice of you to offer! I can't get much time off work right now though, The restaurant has been slammed. Are they hiring at your bookstore by any chance?

persona: I have a German Shepard called luke and a pit bull called duke.
I prefer mustang cars. I own two vintage mustang cars.
I work as a construction worker. It is my day off. I have a decent wage from my job.
dialogue: You had many nice rides in the mustangs recently? How are the dogs as well?
They are doing well, I took them to the dog park earlier today.
You didn't mention to me that you have a dog.
I thought I did earlier, Sorry about that. Do you have dogs?
Yes, I adopted a small puppy from the orphanage last week.
That's so kind. You should take it to the dog park, It would be a lot of fun.
Sure. Now that you have mentioned it, Can we plan for this weekend?
Sure, This weekend works. Usually I don't have to work on weekends.
That's superb. My puppy will get to meet your dog and i will also get a chance to meet you in person.
Yes, Does your schedule allow that? Or are you busy?
Sure, I leave work at noon on Saturday. Am very free then tillmonday when i resume back to work.
That's awesome! You should invite your grandchildren too.

persona: I like to have TV in the background.
I would like to work from home.
I have a hearing disability.
I have four cats and one puppy.
dialogue: I learned how to adopt a pet but I am not sure about it yet.
Oh that is wonderful! Might I recommend adopting a cocker Spaniel dog? They are a fabulous breed.
I have looked at those, They are really cute. What do you like about them?
They are energetic but nottiring, And they are very loyal to their owners. And yes, They are cute as a mutton Butt.
Ha! I will definitely look into them. How are your pets doing?

You know it's funny but I want another one. I just have so much fun with them that I and constantly trying to justify ways to add another little pup or kitten to the mix. I guess I'm a regular dr.Doolittle.
That would be awesome. What are you looking for, Another cat, Or a dog?
Well can you keep a secret? I have been taking a fancy to exotic birds. I was thinking about a colorful parrot. You know, The kind that lives 50 or 60 years.
That sounds really cool. Do they need to have a lot of space so they can fly around, Or do they prefer smaller spaces?
I must admit I have not thought that far ahead. I suppose it's unfair to keep a pet bird in a cage. I surely do not know why the caged bird sings.
Some birds are ok in cages, I guess if you did your research you could find one that would work out. I just hope your cats wouldn't take too much of an interest in it. :).
I really appreciate your positive attitude. That type of thing is getting hard and harder to find these days it seems.

persona: I like hiking and watching the sunset.
I turned 18 yesterday. I just got a pet fish as a birthday present from my parents.
My favorite color is orange.
My boyfriend broke up with me two months ago. I feel sad about my breakup. My boyfriend left me suddenly and he is weird.
dialogue: How is your pet fish? What kind of fish is it?
I got a betta fish. It is a so pretty and bright colors. I wish I could send a picture for you to see.
I would like that. I can't afford a fish myself.
I'm sorry have you tried looking for a job to help out.
Yeah but it's hard because I don't have a car and I'm far from public transportation.
That's sucks. If I lived closer I would help you get to and from work.
That's nice. Thank you. Are you going to college?
Yes, Still down about my break up. Can't wait to get to college and meet new people and get over him.
I hear ya. Relationships are tough. I like being alone better.
Being alone is nice then I don't have to worry about making sure the other person doesn't mind if I do something.
And you avoid making some else responsible for your self-esteem. That's what I always end up doing.
Very true my self-esteem has been 100% since we break up.

persona: I know an Italian restaurant that needs servers.
I like sports. I like gymnastics. I like team sports.
I like Italian food. I like garlic bread.
I work out.
dialogue: I stopped in about that server job.
Oh really? How did that go?

I think the interview went well. I mentioned my love of garlic bread, Which seemed to help. The owner also had a daughter who was in gymnastics with my sister back in the day, So hopefully that all helps.
Haha! That's funny. Great job. And believe me, There's plenty of leftover garlic bread so they'll appreciate it not going to waste!
Good thing that we both keep active since we eat so many carbs. How's the new cardio regimen been working for you?
It's been going well thanks! Feels good to get into a rhythm with it. How's basketball been going?

I tweaked my hamstring the other day in a pickup game with some guys down at the gym. And of course we were playing the team full of mouthy Yankees fans. I'm so glad you don't root for them! How is your team doing in the standings?
That sucks, I'm so sorry! I hope you feel better soon. We've definitely had better years but as long as we're not at the very bottom I'll take it, Haha!

I hear ya. You should try being from Chicago and a Cubs fan... Bottom of the heap every year, World Series champs, Then back to the bottom of the division. I swear if sports were a country song, Cubs fans would lose their job, Their girl, Their dog, And their truck.
Hahaha oh ain't that the truth! Living life the hard way, That's for sure. Builds character and all that, I guess. Or at least makes the winning all the sweeter when it finally happens.
That's very true. No matter what sport you play or team you cheer for, That's the lesson you learn. I learned that early in life playing basketball, Baseball and soccer.
I definitely wish I'd done more sports as a kid. Team sports are so much more than just playing with other people. You learn so much about others and yourself.

persona: I visited Alaska not that long ago. I love Alaska.
I was a double in the movie Cliffhanger 2. I have a day job. I had a small part in Cliffhanger 2.
I read a lot about meditation and religions.
I eat kosher food.
I have a strong body. I do stunt work.
dialogue: What do you do for your day job?
Like I said, I do stunt work. Are you feeling more at peace now that you are in Alaska?
Stunt work must be very exciting. I'm at peace but still struggling with the weather.
Hopefully it will warm up soon. I have seen beautiful pictures of Alaska in the summer. So many wildflowers! I imagine there are some fabulous trails to hike. What do you do for your daily workouts?
Yes. I look forward to Summer. I do high intensity interval training for my daily workouts and a bit of yoga.
I like HIIT training. I feel like I accomplish a lot in a relatively short amount of time. I hope you'll soon be able to move your yoga outside onto a deck. Seems like that would be zen.
I can't wait. I do need more activities to help me fill my time. Maybe i could learn more about other religions.
That would be very interesting! I would bet it is fairly easy to find online comparative religion courses from various universities or even community colleges.
Yes, I'm sure there a many sources. The research itself should keep me busy. Do you recommend any religions?

I have friends of all different religions and there are parts of each that resonate with me and other parts that leave me thinking "um, What?" ha ha For me I find a general peaceful and accepting nature to be the way to live. It allows me to be receptive to different ideas. Were you raised in a particular faith?
Yes. I was raised Catholic but I'd love to continue my spiritual journey but learning about many more religions.
I was raised Christian and it is difficult for my family to see me exploring other faiths. They don't understand why I am curious and feel I am turning on them by asking questions.

persona: I go to basketball practice.
I have an older sister. I am going to hear Travis Scott.
My mother is a dentist and volunteers at a clinic.
I am looking for a job at a restaurant.
dialogue: How is the job search going? Any luck?
I was lucky enogh to get a 4 hour shift at a dinner where my mum often goes to.
Congrats! Do you and your mom get along?
Sure, My mom is my best friend and loves volunteering like you. You will love her when you meet someday.
I mostly volunteer because of my Faith, Not because I enjoy it so much.
What do you enjoy doing?
My great passion is playing piano.
Wow, My older sister is excited to learn how to play a piano. She would love to see you play.
Actually I don't really like to perform in front of people. I just teach it and play for myself.
Do you think you can offer classes to her?
If she doesn't live to far away.
Actually we live 3 blocks away from the homeless shelter.

persona: I have horses. I  have some chili.
I live in Kentucky.
I live on a horse ranch. I love riding. I have 3 Aabian horses named Siegfried, Beowulf, and Hector.
dialogue: We want to invite you to our future baptism. What do you think?
That's sounds great! Is the baby a boy or a girl?
A boy! But as long as baby is healthy that's all we care about. We were going to leave it a surprise but then realized it made planning the shower and baptism a little difficult.
Congratulations! I would love to have your family come to my horse ranch in Kentucky. I'm sure you would enjoy meeting my horses!
I would love that! I wish I learnt to ride horses when I was a kid, So the earlier I can get mine used to it the better.
Kids tend to fall in love with horses and it becomes a life-long passion. That's what happened to me!
I would love that to happen. Although I'd need to buy some land if my kids ever wanted their own horses, That's for sure!
Does your new house have a lot of land? Maybe you could keep a horse there.
Sadly not. We have a good sized yard, But it wouldn't be fair to keep a horse or two on it.
There are some other options. I used to keep my three horses in a rented stable until we bought our farm.
Oh really? You'll have to tell me more. That seems like it could be a good middle ground, Especially as I only JUST bought this house!
It is a great option and the best part is, That the stable will also help you take care of your horses when you're not around!

persona: I do not hike.
I do not like dogs.
I only have time for the gym.
dialogue: I found a gym near you that allows parrots if you want to check it out.
No way! I can't believe that's even a thing! Of course I'd like to check it out!
Yes I was shocked when I found out as well! I agree, Lets go next week to check it out.
Sounds good. I need a good workout anyway, And a change of scenery sounds excellent. I just hope the birds aren't too loud!
They shouldn't be to loud! Hey, Maybe now you can get a parrot since they let them into the gym. That way we can still workout but our parrots can hang out also.
That's an idea, Lol. Don't parrots live a really long time? I'm not sure if I'm ready for that responsibility!

It's a huge responsibility but so totally worth it! When you feel ready to get one I will help you learn how to care for it. Have you gone to the gym today? Since I can't make it to the gym, I think I will go for a hike.
That's a good idea. I'd come with you but I hate hiking, Lol. I just know I'll fall and injure myself, And then that's my workouts over!
I understand! I would have invited you but I knew you wouldn't come because you don't like dogs either. I am going to work on getting you to warm up to dogs though lol.
That's fair. And I'm definitely more open to a dog than a parrot, Lol!
Well I am happy to hear that. Honestly, I need to grade my students homework before I even attempt this hike though.
Good idea to get that done first. You definitely won't be in the mood to do it afterwards!

persona: My father had cancer.
I like to sew.
I am from New York.
I went to school at Yale. I plant to go to business school. School is important to me.
dialogue: I just got a new sewing machine!
Oh awesome! Do you have any costumes in mind that you are going to work on?
I am excited! I do not have one picked out yet, Any ideas for me? I would love a new challenging costume to try!
I think something really extravagant would be fun! Something like Marie Antoinette would be a challenge! I need to hop back on the sewing wagon, I have just been so busy looking at business schools.

That is a great idea. I will look for a costume pattern with that in mind. You should get back into sewing, It may help manage the stress of looking for a school! Any front runners on the school search?

No not yet. I keep looking at schools up north when I really need to be looking at school down south where it is warm! I think I might do some sort of embroidery project since I do not have the time to dedicate to a full pattern.
Going to school in the warm weather sounds like a good call if you ask me! I sure enjoy embroidery as well. I love the attention to detail that is needed. Sure helps me relax.
It's true! Does your sewing machine have any new features?
Yes it does, And honestly I have some learning to do! I need to read the manual so I can use it to its full potential. I can even hook it up to the computer to download embroidery patterns.
Oh wow! I can't believe all the things that are possible today! It would be really interesting to embroider the same pattern as the machine and see how much faster the machine is!
That is a fun idea. I may have to challenge myself with that next. I will send you picture of both, And you can tell me how I did compared to the machine.

That sounds like a grand idea! I am sure your hand stitched one will have more heart. Do you have a favorite kind of quilt? I love crazy quilts! I hope to see some historic ones at the textile museum.

persona: I pump gas.
I like movies. I am scared of clowns.
I am single.
I am adopted, my parents are old.
dialogue: Why are you afraid of clowns.
I am not sure! It is really pretty irrational. Do you have any fears?
Cockroaches and silverfish. And apathy. And Republicans.
Oh I like bugs! The other two I agree. What if you met a really empathetic silverfish?
Won't happen. Silverfish are evil. Evil beings don't have any empathy. I do like other bugs. Spiders are cool.
Ha ha fair fair! I always find really big wolf spiders here at the station! I always trap them in a cup and let them free outside.
Do they thank you for giving them their freedom?
No not yet.... But maybe one day I will be thanking them for giving me my freedom.
How would the wolf spiders you release give you your freedom? I don't understand.
Maybe one day I will be trapped somewhere and they will free me because I was kind to them in the past.
That makes sense. What is your favorite movie of all time?
I think it would have to be Fargo. What about you?

persona: I do not play chess.
I like to watch nascar. My dad was a nascar driver.
I work for the US Postal Service.
I am married. I have a german shepard named Barnby.
My favorite color is grey.
dialogue: I just entered into a chess tournament! Want to come watch?
I might be able to, But there are some races coming up. When is your tournament?
On friday night at the golf club opposite the dog park.
Friday night is the big race with Jeff Gordon. He's my favorite driver. If they can televise the race at the golf club, I might be able to do both. How has work been?
Sure, There is a big screen mounted at the bar. Work has been great, Many people are taking mortgage. How about your work?
Work is okay. I am taking a vacation soon though. Does your work give you time off for vacation?
Sure, We get upto three weeks maximum. Where are you going for vacation?
Daytona beach. That way I can catch a race in person and my wife gets to go to the beach.
That is a great fit. I should consider it for my next vacation. Maybe i will meet someone there at the beach.
You never know. They might have dogs to play with your dogs too.
I usually leave my dogs when going for vacation, It's too much work travelling with them. Do yo uusally take yours with you?
Barnby loves car rides so we take him everywhere. I get it since you have two and portugese water dogs are quite sizable. Maybe you can rent a larger SUV.

persona: I am a finance graduate from Yale.
I like beer.
dialogue: I am in Florida in the south now!
That's awesome! How are you liking the change?
I love the palm trees, Ocean breezes and tiny bikinis. Not necessarily in that order! How are you doing?
What's not to love about all that. I am doing well. Thank you for asking.
You're my only Ivy Leagued educated friend. Most of the people I hang out with barely graduated from high school.
University or college isn't for everyone. I get by with help from my friends and with an occasional beer every now and then of course.
You're being modest. I know that you must have worked hard to get where you are. Either that or your parents donated a building or something.
All that hard work is nothing compared to you serving our country. I'm proud of you, Man.
SInce we're in the trust tree. I never even left the country when I was in the army. I was a cook.
Hey more power to you. Is that were you got your awesome grilling skills from?
Exactly. You should see me peel a potato! What are you good at?
I'm good with math! I may not understand women, But I sure can understand numbers.

persona: I go to the gym and lot.
I like going to the city. I have two dogs.
I like using rowing machines and the treadmill.
I like punk rock. I'd like to learn how to play an instrument.
dialogue: My father is giving me one of his old violins, It's probably worth a fortune.
That's really cool! I've always wanted to learn an instrument, Is the violin an easy one to learn?
It was not easy for me. I am a product of extensive practice and training I feel. Some people have a great deal of natural talent though.
I have a very disciplined personality which I usually apply to working out. Hopefully that will help me when I try to learn an instrument.
I think it will. You also need to find a reputable teacher though. Try to avoid people who describe themselves as "self-taught". I would prioritize finding a teacher with respectable training.
That's great advice. Which instrument do you think is the best for a beginner to learn?
I would recommend learning the piano first. I would start with a keyboard before an actual piano though, As the cost and size of a real piano are quite a commitment.
I really love punk rock. Have you ever tried to play that style of music?

I mainly focus on classical music. I am open to trying punk rock though, I would love to expand my repertoire of musical proficiency from just classical. Perhaps this would allow me to focus more on my guitar playing as well.
I visit the city a lot and hear all kinds of music when I'm there. Do you draw any inspiration from trips to the city?
Yes. I have been to Carnegie hall before, Which is basically the Mecca of classical music. I have drawn most of my musical inspiration from concerts performed there.
That's really cool. I've always wanted to go to Carnegie Hall. I'm not sure I could sit through a classical music concert though.

persona: I take dance lessons every week.
I have visited Santa Monica when I was young in 1989. I love the beach.
I listened to New Kids on the Block when I was younger.
I like board games. I have brothers.
I work the night shift at a retail food store.
dialogue: Have you ever learned to dance the Argentine tango at your weekly lessons?
Tango yes, Argentine tango no... Sounds intriguing! With bellydance classes, They mention location too, Egyptian, Etc. Do you dance Argentine tango, And what is distinct about it?
No, But I would like to learn how to dance it. I have Argentinian ancestors, That's why I asked.
Ah, That makes sense. I am looking forward to a few outdoor concerts, Love dancing in the summer air with live music. Any summer plans coming up?
I'm thinking about taking another trip. I haven't visited the beach in a while so maybe somewhere by the ocean. What concerts are you looking forward to?

We have a few big concert festivals where I live, That have been going for decades. Blues is a feature, Although they have many cultures to explore. Love having options. Where's your next trip destination, Possibly?
I might want to revisit California. It's been so long. When is the last time you went?

California is great! I'm listening to a series on Humbolt County right now, So many characters in a fertile, Beautiful landscape. It's been 3 years since I've been to California. Redwoods for sure in the future. That coast drive is beautiful!
Where can I listen to that series? I've been trying to find something to listen to on my daily commute to work.

The series is called "Grown Local" with Billy Wayne Davis, And they talk to local cannabis growers, About their history in the area. It makes me want to visit, As the forest sounds lovely, And the coast. If you have podcast recommendations, I'm listening!
I listen religiously to Trevor Noah's Podcast, But I have been looking to branch out. So thank you for the recommendation, I'll look into it!
Trevor Noah is a solid performer, And I sometimes watch his YouTube feed, Which I think is the same content as the pod. Stephen Colbert too, They both are doing great work now, You think?

persona: I own a BMW.
I spent time in Manhattan when I was younger. I used to walk a lot.
I work in finance. I graduated from Yale in 2011. I am planning to go to business school.
dialogue: How do you like your BMW? I'm thinking of getting a new car to cheer myself up.
I love my new car! You should go down to the dealership and test drive some out! Even if you don't end up buying one it would be great fun.
I hear that. I'd like to drive by my ex's house and see what she's up to.
I don't know if a BMW is a very good stalking car.
What does a good stalking car look like? And where can I get one?
These are thing I cannot answer unfortunately. You should get a BMW so you can score with new ladies! Have you been out on the dating scene at all?
No, Overweight people who work at nursing homes aren't very lucky with the ladies. What about you? Are you with someone?
Yes... I am dating a wonderful nurse who is also overweight. Maybe your low self esteem is what drove your wife away.
Maybe. Her new boyfriend is pretty cocky. But I hate cocky people.
Yeah I don't like cocky people either, Which is pretty weird since I own a BMW.
Ha! I own a Prius, Which fits my low self-esteem.
I saw a bumper sticker that said "cool prius"- nobody. It made me laugh! Do you have any pets?

persona: I have a pet fish named Nemo. My fish is a boy.
I like museums. I have an ex.
I love the color orange. I like to eat oranges. My fish is orange and black.
I am 18 years old.
dialogue: How is Nemo doing, Is he adjusting to his new life in your house?
Yes, He is happy, Would you like to visit me and see Nemo?
I would love to visit, But it will have to be in a few months; the museum will be getting busier with field trips soon. Have you set up an aquarium for Nemo?
No problem I will be waiting you when you are ready, Yes I set up a pretty orange aquarium. What do think about the color?
I like orange a lot, Especially together with other Fall colors like brown and yellow. Are there other fish in the aquarium? Or is it all for Nemo?
I bought two other fishes, But Nemo is the oldest one, He is friendly, I think you love him very much.
Watching fish is so peaceful and relaxing. I recently read an article that said many fish can respond to music; have you tried playing music for yours?
No, I did not know about it but I think it will be a funny idea, What kind of music do you think that Nemo will like?
Maybe you should try classical music first, Or something else that is slow and soothing.
Good Idea, I would like to try it when you visit me and drink fancy tea while watching Nemo.
That sounds like fun! I can bring a few of my favorite tea blends; I have an orange spiced tea that I am sure you would love.
Wow, Great idea .. you made me happy, We will talk again an decide the visit time.

persona: I play basketball.
My favorite rapper is Travis Scott.
My mom is a dentist.
I am unemployed. I am applying for jobs at restaurants.
I love to read.
dialogue: We just got in a new book that I just read and I think you would like it.
Tell me about the book. What is it?
It was clearing up the myth of the big bang and the creation of this universe. I am sure you would like that book, So have you had any success with finding the job?
That book sounds great! As for work, I got a call back for Les Francois Eatery about an hour ago for an interview. I have it scheduled for Friday. Wish me luck!
Well I am sure they have found something interesting in your resume and got interested. I wish you all the best for the interview, Hope you get this job in first attempt.
Me too and thanks! Do you have to work on Friday?
Well I do two different jobs, For my regular I don't work on Friday but I do another part-time work on Friday. Would you be working on weekends for this job?

It looks like it, Though I guess I will hear more during the interview. I was just wondering if you were free for lunch. Maybe I will have good news to share, Or maybe just a friend to share my misery if I don't get it.

I would say to be positive for the opportunity and show confidence and you will get this. Unfortunately I have to work on this Friday, But how about write some notes so don't forget when we meet next time to see how things went.
Absolutely! Maybe I can borrow that book when we get together too? I think I also owe you a night of dancing, But we will figure that out!
Wow that is a good idea and we would have music on from Travis Scott and can have a lovely time.
Oh yeah! The "Place to Be" club loves to play Travis Scott too, So you know it's going to be lit.

persona: I am a high school student and I just won Homecoming Queen.
I do track and field in school. I want to start racing for charity. I enjoy running, and hope to run a 5k this year.
I listen to classical music while doing homework. I am currently getting straight A's.
I want to save my money for college. I do not have a tractor. I want to be a physical therapist.
dialogue: Have you found a charity race to sign up for?
I believe so. I have a couple I'm looking at for the summer time.
Do you have any other summer plans?
I plan on going to the beach the week before the charity race. I've also looked at doing a race while.
Do you enjoy running at the beach?
I do! It's weird getting used to running on the sand tho!
I imagine the wet sand would be easier to run on than dry sand though.
Oh most def. The dry sand is almost impossible. I do good to walk on it haha.
I would go to the beach if it was closer and if I could take a break from work, But the money is addicting.

persona: I play softball.
I have a demanding job in insurance.
My father served 10 years in the army. My mom is no longer alive.
dialogue: I just started my first French lesson.
Wow! How is the lesson so far?
Good! I forgot how difficult it is at the very beginning though. I'm so used to being fluent or at leasy pretty good!
Yeah, Learning a different language is definitely a challenge. Does knowing Spanish help at all with understanding French?
It actually doesn't. The rules for masculine and feminine are kind of different so I'm having to unlearn some stuff I assumed too soon!
Oh wow! That sounds really complex! It seems like it would be a real challenge to have to unlearn things you were used to.
It really is. I know I'll get there though. How is softball going?
You definitely will get there! Softball is going great! It's really a nice way to relax.
That's so good to hear! I wish I was sporty. I was always a book nerd, Lol.
Haha, Well I wouldn't call myself sporty. It's just something I do in my free time to release stress from the day.
Still, If my release was running around rather than sticking my nose in a book I'm sure my respiratory system would be grateful.
Haha, It's never too late to start! Maybe you can find something that combines your love of learning with something more active.

persona: I am a teacher and waitress and don't have any pets.
I love mean girl movie.
My hobby is racing motorbikes.
I visited food bank.
dialogue: Do you want me to sign you up for food bank volunteering? Of course, If you have some free time.
Maybe this summer when school is out! Right now I am swamped with teaching and waitressing on the weekends. How is life going for you?
Life is going well so far. Staying extremely busy at the food bank. It seems more and more people are in need.
It is true! I have been seeing more children with food insecurities come through my classroom then ever before!
It really is a shame. How does the school system handle the insecurities?

There are a lot of kids who qualify for free meals so when school is in session they are getting at least two meals that day (breakfast and lunch). The summers are much harder. On the bright side the school has a new volunteer... A therapy dog kids can read to!
That's awesome. What's the dog's name?
Dr. Woofington McBark! He is 5 years old and is a black lab.
Dr. Woofington McBark... That's so funny. I bet the kids love having him around. Does he sit and listen to them reading?

He usually lays down and sometimes he listens with his eyes closed, But he still is following the story! Yes the kids love having him around but so do all the teachers! He is such a self esteem boost to the kids struggling with sight words and sounding things out.
I can imagine. Dogs are a great comfort and can sense when something isn't right. I know my Roscoe brightens my day each time I see him. So loving and caring.
What kind of dog is he?

persona: I am rich. I eat off golden plates.
My favorite color is green.
dialogue: Have you bought any Bitcoin with your money?
I have bought bitcoin. Just for fun though. I am nervous about it and it is not my main method of investment. Do you own any?
No as its a pretty big leap for me to invest my money just yet. Now that I'm single I need to focus on life and work. How did you come to make your fortune?

I made my money through investing mostly in real estate. Buy your first house and rent it out. Let your roommates pay your mortgage and then save up to buy another house to rent and repeat. You own the house someone else pays the debt.
Very true and smart. The first step is being able to buy the house with little to no work to be done. A turnkey so to speak.
No expect a little work. Make it livable. People who rent generally aren't looking for all the amenities. They want and affordable place to live that is safe and comfortable. Provide that.
Ok I understand, Then the next step is having two houses or own one and rent it then rent somewhere else. That's where is can be tricky as far as affording both between renters.
It can be. Make sure you have enough cash to float you to the next renter, But other than that it is on autopilot. Do you think you will buy a house soon now?
Maybe, The market is great for that right now so trying to be approved for a home loan first. My credit is not bad, But also not great.
