FHA loans are available for 0 down. They will still look at your income to debt ratio as the most important thing, But it is easy to be approved and then it will actually increase your credit while someone else makes payments on your debt. Just find a roommate.
Will do since my fish isn't bring in any money. Nobody wants to pay to see him.
Exactly and you are young, So think about it this way too every dollar you earn is worth 2-3 times as much as each dollar I earn when invested.

persona: I watch youtube movies.
I skateboard.  I drink coffee.
I have skateboarder friends.
I watch football.
I have a girlfriend.
dialogue: Have you been skateboarding lately or were you with your girlfriend?
I haven't been with her today but I have been skateboarding for days now.
Aw, That's too bad. When are you going to see her again?
We having a movie night tomorrow. Have you any sweet poet I can read to her please write one for me.
Oh that's nice. What movie will you watch? Here is a poem. "Roses are Red. Violets are Blue. Sugar is sweet, But not as sweet as you.".
Wow, thanks this sweet. I dont know yet I have to go through whichever youtube recommend for me.
You're welcome. What kind of movies do you like?
I like drama and romantic movies not like war star movies like you.
Hmmmm. I'm trying to think if there are any good movies I can recommend. What about Titanic?
What is the movie about, Hope is interesting?
It's a romantic movie about the ship Titanic that suck back in the early 1900s.
Oh I will check if I can get on youtube. It will be nice to have it with a black coffee.

persona: I'm Charlotte, I've been to Canada.
I am going to retire soon. I work as a librarian.
I am 60.
I travel and have a daughter.
I live in the south and want to go North.
dialogue: My dad and I are starting a band.
That sounds like fun - a guitar and violin duo! Maybe you'll get famous!
That would be so cool, But I will be happy playing with him either way! Does your daughter play an instrument.
No she doesn't but she loves to travel with me when she can.
Thats good. Any quality time with your kids is awesome. Do you have any upcoming travel plans?
Maybe after I retire, Which will be shortly. Has your dad traveled much after he retired?
He has not done much traveling yet. I am sure he is ready to, But being retired he has plenty of time. How long until you officially retire?
Just a few months, Then maybe I'll have the opportunity to travel north like I always wanted to. Maybe I'll put Belgium on the list too.
You would love Belgium! Where do you want to go up north first?
Probably France, Then Belgium. I've got to try some of their lovely chocolate!
France would be amazing! You will have to let me know how that goes, May have to add that to my travel list as well!
Yes I will. Perhaps I will polish my language skills as well. Not Chinese, But French, Haha.

persona: I like old school hip hop music.
I take dance lessons once a week.
I really like New Kids on the Block.
I was born in the 1980s.
I do not work.
dialogue: How are your dance lessons going?
They're going great! I feel a little old compared to the other people in the class, But I'm keeping up, Haha.
What type of dance are you learning in your classes?
I'm learning break dance! It's something I've been wanting to learn since I was a kid but never got the chance to until now.
Awesome, Then you're not too old to learn! Eighties babies are part of the start of break dance!
Aww thanks! I do wish I started earlier, But I'm so happy to have the chance now. Everyone is so supportive!
That's great! I have always wanted to live in the city where break dancing was invented.
Well you should definitely visit! New York is such an interesting and diverse place!

persona: I travel the world.
I like Mexican food.
I have been to the Antarctic. I have a yacht. I like adventure. I rent my yacht out. It costs $5000 a week to rent my yacht.
I do not know about bitcoin.
dialogue: The Aerosmith concert was fantastic! It was one of their best.
That sounds like a lot of fun! It's been too long since I've been to a concert. Do you go to concerts regularly?
Yes! I try to go to as many as I can. Work allowing of course lol.
I've been thinking about changing jobs recently. I feel like I need to get outdoors more, Or at least have a change of venue.
Outdoors is great no doubt. I know it's a different thing, But I much prefer outdoor concerts to inside ones.
They had one in my area this weekend. We have a beautiful outdoor amphitheater and there's usually a summer concert series in town.
Oh that sounds really fun! Did you get to go?
I only walked by because they were sold out. I am hoping to get tickets to one later this summer, Though. I think it would be a lot of fun. Do you have a favorite kind of band to see?
That's a bummer, But hopefully you can check it out later this year! I really enjoy rock concerts.
I think they have them from June through September if I remember correctly. I also love rock concerts, But the last one I've been to live was a long time ago. It's been like 10 years ago.
You should go to one this year! If of course you can find one you want to see.

I think it's a pretty mixed bag for the concert in the park series. I think they have everything from polka to rock. I should check the calendar and see! I know our community is known for having lots of community events and most of them are free. It's a blast.

persona: I like to watch UFC and NASCAR.
I work in construction.
I prefer horchata. I always have horchata when having Mexican food. I prefer chai tea to chamomile tea.
I do not garden.
I build homes for the low-income families.
dialogue: How long have you been working in construction?
About four years, And I love being able to build structures for those who need it. How long have you been a tour guide?
I've been doing it for about ten years. Before that I was a volunteer at the museum. I do like doing the tour guide thing and helping people understand history.
That is very cool! What areas of history do you cover?
It is local history. But that includes the Native American tribe that once lived and owned this land.
That's interesting, Especially since you've been doing it so long. How long have you been gardening?

I grew up with gardens. My mom grew rose bushes and we always had a vegetable garden. There is nothing like picking the vegetables and then cooking them for dinner. I know you said you don't garden, But I always recommend growing a few vegetables, It is so much healthier.
I might get into it. A lot of the meals I like to make at home incorporate fresh vegetables and fruits, Especially my favorite Hispanic dishes. Maybe I could look into growing cinnamon.
I definitely have cilantro in my herb garden for when I make salsa. Did you know that cinnamon comes from a tree?
I had no idea! I've always seen the sticks but I thought maybe there was a cinnamon bush or something. You'll have to send me your salsa recipe as well I'm sure it's delicious.
Oh, I am always tinkering with the salsa recipe. I have never quite perfected it yet. What is your favorite Mexican dish?

I love carne asada. My father had a friend growing up that would make it for Fourth of July and it was always really delicious. If you won't hand over the salsa recipe, Do you have any good tea recipes? I know you mentioned loving chamomile tea.

persona: I am in a family of musicians.
I like walking and exploring.
I live in California.
Mexican food is my favourite.
I volunteer at a shelter. I like volunteering.
dialogue: I've been deployed to assist with a natural disaster.
It must be an honor to serve in the military. Where have yo been deployed at?
I have been deployed many places, Most notably Afghanistan. It was not all bad, I got to try new food which is always nice. How is the volunteer work going?
Volunteering work is great, We get to assist where there is dire need of assistance. Have yo ever tried mexican food?
Yes, I have. I am a big fan of quesadillas. I am sure there has to be some great mexican restaurants in California. Maybe next time I am there we can grab a bite to eat and you can show me around.
Sure there is plenty especially at the shelters where I volunteer. It will be great to show you around.
I look forward to it. Anyone in your family have a show coming up?
Nextsaturday my sister will be having a gig in one of local bars down here in Los Angels. Can you spare some time and come? You can invite your friends from the military.
I probably wont be able to as I will be deployed by then, But once I get back we can definitely set something up. I know my military friends can use some fun.
Sure, You are welcome anytime. How is it serving in the military?
It can be very rewarding, But not always. It is hard seeing the things we do, But knowing we are helping people counteracts the downsides to it. Have you ever thought about joining?
Sure, At some point before I joined college but i got discouraged by some of my friends. Maybe I will try again this year.

persona: I am pregnant with triplets.
I am from Italy.
I have a new house.
dialogue: Do you have any plans to decorate your new house?
Yes! I am going to focus on my bedroom first. I think I'm going to go with an antique theme.
That will be fine about the room for the triplets do you know their gender so you paint in mixed color.
Three boys! I think we're gonna go with a light grey color.
Wow, Three boys hands full boys expect more work to do. Anyway light blue would have done good justice.
We had thought about light blue but we wanted something a bit different.
Okay thats good thou. A light grey wall with a white roof paint sound good.
Yeah, We think so! I'm not sure what the theme is gonna be yet.
The tripple league sound good just a suggestion.
Haha, Yeah it does! I'll have to keep that in mind.
How many month gone are you now?
I am five months pregnant.

persona: I am retired. I have grandkids. I am 40 years old.
I do not like to eat at Burger King. I like McDonald's.
I like it when my children moved out of my house.
dialogue: I just go into a big fight with my parents. They don't want me to quit Burger King, But I just don't know how much longer I can stand to work there. I really hate going to work there.
Could you find better work somewhere and then quit? Maybe they'd agree with you changing careers as long as you have another one lined up?
That's what I'm thinking. I'm looking for other jobs in every spare second I have. I get their point, I'm just so miserable there.
Do you enjoy foodservice or are you looking for a complete change in careers? You could probably get hired at a gas station, Walmart, Or Walgreens with work experience and a good resume.
I don't know, To be honest. I don't really mind what I do as long as I don't hate it. Even retail or food service at a slower pace would suit me fine!
I bet it can get pretty hectic during the rush hour! Maybe a gas station would be a good fit? Or Walmart, They have some great benefits and some places are starting at $15-20/hr. Or a coffee shop?
Oh wow, I'd love pay like that! Benefits would be nice too. Thanks so much for being an understanding ear. How are the grandkids?
They're doing fairly well. I'm disappointed in my grandson's behavior, I'm afraid he's going to waste his scholarship by refusing to apply himself.

persona: I started working is PA.

I am expecting my first child so I don't have time to volunteer. We still don't know the sex. We will probably paint kid's room in lime green. I am nervous about getting a child. My husband is very excited.
dialogue: And have you decided about names maybe? I can help you by giving some suggestions.
Well we still don't know the sex, So we aren't sure about names, But I'd love to hear some suggestions!
I get you. I never wanted to know the sex of my babies either. There is Kathleen for a girl and Patrick for a boy.
I'm actually anxious to know, But it's still a bit too early to determine. I love the name Kathleen! I'll talk to my husband about it.
That was my grandma's name. I wonder what your husband will think of it. When are you due?
Your grandma has a beautiful name! I'm about a month along, So 8 more months, If the baby doesn't come early.
Thank you. Awww, That is so sweet. Do you have morning sickness?
I do! It's terrible, And even though I know to expect, It still catches me off guard, Haha.
Awwww. Try eating some crackers andsipping on ginger ale before getting out of bed.
I'll give it a shot, Thank you for the suggestion!
You're welcome!!! anytime. Glad I could help.
Between suggesting a cool name and a potential ease to the morning sickness, You've been super helpful!

persona: I was poor growing up. My favorite food is cheeseburgers.
I am retired. I was a gym teacher.
I volunteer at the soup kitchen.
I used to skate.
dialogue: I am so excited! I just visited my doctor, And she says that I should be able to get my cast off next week.
Lets goooo!!! That must be exiting for you! Are you going to be skateboarding again?
Absolutely, I actually spend the last 8 weeks while I was in a cast helping my buddy build a ramp in my backyard. I am ready!
That's awesome! My little brother and I used to go down to a skate park in our early teens. We only had one skateboard growing up but we made it work.
I feel like I grew up in a skatepark. I mostly built my own boards so I never had the best, But I actually think not having the best equipment made me a better skateboarder.
The skatepark was the place to be as a kid. Honestly i never thought about building my own board. How was that experience?
It sort of felt like rebuilding a sprocket on a bike a lot of times. We built lots of things. My favorite may have been the cannon we made in metal shop that we actually fired!

That cannon must of been awesome in my college days we went to a friends farm one time and we placed a cannon in the bed of my pickup and we drove around firing at the targets we made. You seem like you built a lot of things are you an engineer?
Nah, Not an engineer, Just a cheeseburger loving dude with an active imagination and willingness to try and fail at things. The cannon thing took 3 times before we were successful!
I could honestly go for a cheeseburger right, I've been wanting one of those burger king crowns recently. But what other projects have you worked on?
Currently working on a potato launcher. Hoping to be able to launch a potato at least 100 yards.
I've seen some cool things been done with potato launchers in the past. With all of these projects you are working on you should open a cheeseburger restaurant that displays all of your creations.

persona: I work in a nursing home and at home on Facebook.
I am divorced. My wife has our kids. My kids are 2, 5, and 7.
I don't believe in God.
I am overweight. I am unhappy.
I like soul music, r & b, and jazz. I don't play piano or guitar.
dialogue: What kinds of things do you do at your nursing home job?
I get the patients what they need, Help turn them over in their beds if necessary, And help with toileting.
Fascinating! How long have you been working at the nursing home for?
About 10 years now. I've met some interesting people, But I would like to get a different job.
That makes sense. What kind of job would you prefer instead? Would you wanna do something music related?
I was just thinking you should start a band and I could be your manager. How fun would that be??.
That sounds amazing! Should I start a folk band?
Absolutely! Or you could be a solo artist. Maybe that's the way to go?
That could work as well. Maybe you and I could come up with our own style combining folk and jazz. What instruments do you play?
I can play the sax, But honestly I'm not very good. I think you'd be much better off without me playing!
Wish my parents believed in me more. We should brainstorm this some more. Maybe you could do a sax solo for one of my tracks.
I don't get why parents can't just support whatever we want to do with our lives. I try to do that for my kids. Definitely, Let's brainstorm. Are you around this weekend?

persona: I play ping pong with friends.
My dad is an electrician.
I'm in high school. I study Chinese. I'm learning to play violin and guitar.
I like video games.
dialogue: Have you played any video games today?
Not today! I am going to my friends to play ping pong shortly though. Have you played any video games today?
I havent been playing any video game for awhile. I was looking for who to play with once am out next month.
You should find my online account when you get out, We can play together. Are you looking forward to being out next month?
Thanks for the offer I will surely do that. Yeah. How good are you now with your guitar?
I am not the best, But I can hold my own. Is the guitar something you would like to learn?
Not sure as studies is my priority. Thinking you be playing for a band soon with your guitar.
I would love to start a band, Possibly with my dad. It would be fun! I think a hobby like guitar would be good for you when you get out.
I will be awwful back singer for you(lol). Thats fine you can set up a band hope your dad can sing beter.
We are both decent with singing but it is not our top talent. Maybe we will hold auditions for a lead singer.
Okay that would be better. What type of music band will you create? Highlife guitar band or hip pop?
Not hip hop. I enjoy classic rock, Light country music the most. Probably something along those lines. What is your favorite type of music?

persona: My family does not support my career choices. I sell watches.
I like shopping at supermarkets.
My dream is to own a Rolls Royce Ghost.
I move often.
dialogue: I am taking a vacation outside of Ohio!
Ohio is a cool place for vacation.
Ha! I wish. I've never left Ohio. I'm so looking forward to traveling out of state!
Why did you leave Ohio?
I haven't yet. I'm taking a vacation soon. How has your job been going?
I'm trying my best.
Well that's all you can do, So keep it up. How is the family?
Family is fine what about yours?
They're doing well. Any plans to move again? I know you don't like to stay in one place too often.
Yeah. Lol no plans for now.
Maybe it will be good for you to set some roots somewhere, Have you thought about it?
I have been giving it a thought lately it is quite a decision.

persona: I love watching NHL hockey.
I have a german shepherd.
I grew up on a farm. I am very familiar with animals.
I don't have a job. I live on a farm.
I have a husband.
dialogue: I've been working on a new folk song. Do you want to hear it?
I would love to hear it! What's the song about?
It's about a dog that I had as a child. Speaking of which, How's that german shepherd of yours?
He's great! He's such a sweet and friendly dog. What inspired you to write the song?
Good to hear! I was walking to work and I saw a dog which was the same breed as my old dog.
Oh wow, That must have been a really nostalgic experience. What kind of dog did you have?
He was a golden retriever! He was so loving and cuddly. Anyway, How's life on the farm?
Aww that sounds amazing. I love golden retrievers! Life on the farm is great and super busy. Between the crops and the animals, There is always something to tend to.
Not to mention the maintenance on that husband of yours! How is he doing?
Haha, You know it! That man needs a lot, But I love him. He's doing well. Working hard, As usual.
That's good to hear! You'll have to send him my regards. You two are so perfect for each other.
Aww thank you! He's actually been asking about your music. Do you have any gigs coming up? We'd love to come see you play.

persona: I'm retired.
I like gambling.
I love grilling outdoors.
I enjoy mowing my lawn.
I am a fan of Taylor Swift.
I have a Buick.
dialogue: Have you made any money gambling since we last talked?
No, But I just placed a large wager on the Chelsea vs Real Madrid soccer match on Wed.
Nice, Who do you have winning?
I have 5K on Chelsea with another 500 on Pulisic scoring a goal. Are you looking for some action?
Yeah! I love soccer i dont gamble often but this might be an exception. What time is the game at?
Game is at 3pm. I have made my biggest gambling wins on soccer. I was able to retire after a huge payday when FC Porto won the Champions League in 2004.
Perfect i don't work that day im defentily going to watch the game. I recently made a killing off Doge Coin so i definitely will be placing a bet on the game.
I wish I knew more about cryptocurrencies. I can't wrap my head around it. The gambling site I use offers betting and payouts in various crytpos.

Crypto's are the worst investment because of the volatility but i am so desperate to get out of customer service i decided to take the risk and purchase doge coin when it wasnt even a penny and sold out recently to a nifty pay day.
Good move on your part. It's funny, I don't have a problem gambling at a casino, Or on sports, But when it comes to investments, I avoid risk and keep money parked inTbills.
I don't usually go to a Casinos mainly because they aren't legal in my state but i love trading in the stock market because i want that financial freedom in my life.
How do you pick winners? I have always had a knack for picking winners in European soccer, But stocks are like a foreign language to me.

persona: I love paella. I also love fish and chips.
I am a student.
I like to travel. I have been to Europe. I don't like packing and unpacking.
I am a relative of Cris Columbus.
dialogue: Where have you been in Europe?
I have been in Italy precisely.
Nice! I love travelling but I have never been in Italy.
Why have you not given it a try.
I have never been to Europe, I could not afford it. Maybe in the future. How many countries did you visit when in Europe?
Ouch. Yeah sorry. I have literally been to 5 countries.
Lucky you! Which one was your favourite?
My all time favorite has been Dubai.. Good food.
Ah, Right! Sorry, I meant in Europe but I did visit Dubai and I loved it.
Oooh... In europe i would pick germany.
I will add it to my list, Thank you! And what was the worst about that long trip?
Nothing really i had a good time.

persona: I got fired a week ago. I got a job as an insurance salesman. I play softball.
My father is in the military. I live with my parents.
dialogue: Have you thought about joining the army yourself?

I've though about joining the military, Unsure if I'd choose Army or Navy, Air Force... Many options. I've thought about being a spy! Some have mixed experience in the military. You been driving your tractor lately?
Being a spy would be amazing! It must be really interesting to come from a military family. Does your father have a preference for which you should join?
Dad is happy with what I choose, As long as I am happy. I'm grateful to have a father who lets me choose my own path. Any tractor stories to share lately?

That's awesome. Some parents can be very pushy that their kid do the same type of service they did, So that's really nice of him. Nothing interesting on the tractors lately, Although I am going to a big show this weekend. Should have some of the biggest tractors in the country!
Tractor shows can be a nice walk. I wander through the different rigs, and get impressed at all the powerful tools. Was listening to piano music lately, What classical music are you into?
I've been trying to got more into Chopin lately. Beethoven is my favorite but I'm trying to expand my collection. How about you?

If you love Chopin, Check out the movie "Impromptu" with Hugh Grant as Chopin, Judy Davis as George Sands, His long time partner. They were very different personalities! Love it. Lately I've been digging Windham Hills music.
I've needed a good movie to watch lately too so that's two birds with one stone! Thanks for the recommendation. I love Judy Davis. She always picks such great roles.
Judy Davis is a force of nature in the role, And is a great balance to Chopin. Chopin's music can just melt you away, Was it the Etudes?
It was the Polonaise, But I need to become better acquainted with the Etudes, For sure.
They refer to the Etudes in that movie, Impromptu, That I mentioned. It's a bit of fiction too, But I love seeing the music through their eyes, In their world. Are their other Chopin songs you like?

persona: I watch television cooking shows. I am a vegan. I like hummus.
I love rollercoasters and sky diving.
I am a bad swimmer.
I like country music. I follow New Kids on the Block's tour dates.
dialogue: The finale of Fear the Walking Dead was incredible!
I didn't see it! I used to watch the walking dead and I watched the first season of fear of the walking dead, But now I stick to food network and HGTV! What made it great?
I love the Food Network but haven't watched it in a while. Chopped and Cutthroat Kitchen are two of my favorites. There were so many unexpected twists and turns and I have questions.
I love a series that ends on a cliff hanger and makes me so excited to see what's going to happen next! Lost made me mad though because I feel like they didn't answer any of the questions!
The finale of that show drove me insane! I'm still so mad at the writers over that ending. I felt I had invested so much time into it for that ending.
I know! I felt the same way. I watched every episode and the end result was so unsatisfying. What a disappointment. I think one of the best series finales was Six Feet Under. Did you see that show?
The ending for season five of FTWD had a wedding, A baby, A ton of zombies, And a cliffhanger. I loved Six Feet Under. The ending was spectacular!

I might have to go back and watch the other seasons of Fear the Walking Dead... That sounds amazing! But I do love my cooking shows lol. Top Chef is my favorite. No zombies, But it is a really good show!
I haven't watched that in a few seasons, But it used to be my go to when I had cable. I decided not to have cable at this apartment and have been loving it, But I might rent the next few seasons.
Not having cable is really freeing! I only have it now because it's included in my rent.Saves me money for New Kids on the Block Tickets!

I used to have it when I worked more, But I think I prefer renting movies/shows when I want to watch them. I'm not a fan of New Kids on the Block but I have heard their shows can be fun. I think generally these days I stick with YouTube subscriptions to replace my TV shows.
You liked them as a kid though, Right? I guess I just never outgrew them! What YouTube channels do you recommend?

persona: I have a mini van.
I have five sons.
I don't like video games. I like wine. I like cabernet.
I like coffee.
dialogue: I love the new maps in Call of Duty.
I just can't get into video game how do you do it?
You have to find something you really enjoy. What are some of the things you like to do?
I like to drink wine and coffee. Not sure how that would help.
I don't think there are many video games based off of drinking. I would suggest sticking with board games with friends and family. What are some wines you recommend?
My favorite are sparkling wines. I love Alma Libre White Blend. Another good one if you are just starting out would be Sauvetage Rose.

Thanks for the recommendations! I find wine hard to get into because the taste is so different from regular drinks. I don't think I"ll be drinking it often, But I think it's good to have something in mind for special occasions.
I hear that a lot. Some people just can't get into wine. I just enjoy a glass after a hard day at work or chasing after my sons.
How are your kids doing now? I imagine that five sons must make for a lot of trouble around the house.
They are good. The twins just got into football so that will be fun.

Cool, Sports are really great. Maybe that would be a good starting point if you want to get into video games. There are quite a lot of video games based around sports that you can play with your kids.
Yeah that is a great idea. Maybe I will look into some or see what is out there. I'm sure there is some game for a mom to relax playing.

persona: I like country music. I am going to a Taylor Swift concert tomorrow. I have met Taylor Swift.
I have a red Nissan Pathfinder.
I go to school for hairstyling. I have short brown hair.
I don't like work.
I enjoy soccer. I am not good at it.
dialogue: Are you excited for your concert tomorrow?
Absolutely! I cannot wait to see Taylor again!
Thats sound good. Which of his song do you enjoy most?
Shake It Off is my all times favourite. Do you like her songs as well?
No just asking I love pop songs. Would you be doing anything before you go for the concert.
Not really, I will be all morning thinking about it. What about your weekend plans, Will you see your friends?
Yes I will be playing soccer with friends. Will you love to join us?
I would love to but you know I am not really good, If you go on Sunday please let me know. Tomorrow I will be too busy with the concert.
We all fair players join us and we improve together am sure I will dribble you thats why you chikening out(lol).
Hahaha, Thank you very much! I totally accept the invite. What time will you be meeting the rest?
3pm so we can have good quality time.
That sounds perfect. Shall I come to your house just before 3pm?

persona: My name is Rose. I have roses in my garden.
I am partly deaf. I live alone.
I'm a museum tour guide. I have blonde hair.
I love to sit outside at night. I drink fancy tea. I drink non alcoholic drinks. I like to shoot pool and play darts.
I don't dance. I love to read. I have a big home library.
dialogue: What's the last thing you read?
Right now, I'm reading a bit of Joseph Campbell's work.
I don't know much about him. Do you have many of his books in your library?

I actually just bought a bunch of his books. I didn't know much about his work either, But I kept hearing people talk about the hero's journey and figured I ought to look into, Since it is so prevalent in so many stories, Past and present, Fiction and nonfiction.
That sounds very interesting. I have a small library in my house which is mostly filled with biographies of great historical characters.
Oh interesting! Who do you enjoy reading about the most?
I have really been into great historical athletes lately, Mainly baseball players. I have read a couple of Jackie Robison biographies this year.
Have you learned anything interesting about them?
I have mainly learned how much hatred he faced and how he was forced, By contract, To never respond to hecklers. He had unbelievable discipline.
Goodness, It really does take considerable discipline to ignore harassment like that and to play as well as he did. I really admire people who are able to focus like that.
I was wondering if you ever have any difficult customers on your museum tours that make it hard for you to focus?
Sometimes I do, But the wonderful thing about being partly deaf is that I can ignore them or they have to get louder and make a complete fool of themselves, Haha.

persona: I'm from New York City. I love where I live. I love to explore.
I love music. I play a few instruments. I play piano. I teach piano.
I'm a volunteer at a local homeless shelter.
I do not have any pets. My father is a professional violin player. I travel a lot with my father.
One of my favorite bands is the Who.
I like to eat pizza.
dialogue: I just booked a flight to come to New York City, I'm so excited to get out of Ohio!
Yeah, I feel the same way about New York.
New York has so many options, Open all night. Would love to check out Broadway some day. What's a favorite New York locale you'd recommend to a new visitor?
I would suggest the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
TheMOMA! Yes. That is a place I've been curious about. You mention your father's music background, Has he ever played violin at a museum, Or in a concert hall?
Actually he plays with the symphony. Have you ever been to a symphony?
We have had a few smaller groups perform here locally, Although that is one reason I'd love to get to New York, More professional musicians. When was the last time you attended a symphony?
I went and saw my dad play last week.
How about that, Your dad performed recently! Makes me curious what the location was, Or maybe what kind of music he performed?
Mostly Mozart. Do you like classical music?
I love going to music performances, And sometimes have been known to get on stage now and again. Yes, Love classical music sometimes, Chopin is a fave. Mozart, Tell me a favorite tune?
I loves me some Requiem. What other genres do you enjoy?

persona: My favorite sports are baseball, tennis and the Olympics.
I'm an author, blogger and freelancer. I earned an undergraduate degree in communications.
I live in St. Lous, Missouri.  am a 44 year old male.
dialogue: Are you going to catch the Olympics this year?
Hopefully, I would love to catch the Olympics.
Are the summer Olympics or winter Olympics your favorite? I think the summer ones are mine.
Awesome! I love them both. I don't have a preference. Were you born in Florida?
I wasn't, I was born in Utah. Do you have a favorite event in the Olympics? I love to watch the figure skating and equestrian events, Myself. Not to mention hockey!
Yes, I love figure skating and gymnastics. Hockey isn't an event that I love either.
I also love to watch the gymnastics, And soccer! It's a lot of fun. I used to do gymnastics and soccer when I was younger.
That's cool! I hope you enjoy the rest of your day!
You too! Do you enjoy doing sports at all, Or just watching them?
Thanks! I only love to watch sports.
Do you have a favorite sport to watch? I love to run, Myself.
Yes I love basketball, It's my favorite sport.

persona: I am not good at spelling. I am a child. I am a girl. My favorite color is white.
I think that I have the ability to stop time. I think that I live in the cloud and I can fly. I want to learn to do handstands.
dialogue: I am trying out for the Olympic gymnastics team next week!
Oh wow! I hope you make the team! You definitely deserve it.
Thanks! I really love gymnastics. Maybe once I finish with the season I can help you learn those handstands.
That would be amazing! Then I'll get to say that an Olympic champion taught me to do handstands!
It is almost as cool as the fact that you can stop time and fly. I wish I could stop time so that I had longer to train.
Flying and stopping time are fun! I've never been able to stop time for other people, Though. I could try.
That would be awesome. Give me a little more time before I have to go to these tryouts.
Sure! Though, I'm pretty sure you don't need it. Your superpower is how well you do at gymnastics. I'm pretty sure you're going to make the team, Regardless.
Thank you for that. Oh, I didn't tell you the uniform this year for the time is mostly white (your favorite color) and some yellow in there also.
Oh my god, It's both our favorite colors! I bet it's so pretty!
I'll have to send you a picture of it. I am sure you will love it.
Definitely send me a picture! Maybe it'll help figure out what kind of superhero suit to make.

persona: I am Tracy. I have a bother and sister living in Alabama.
I have two dogs.
I have a cat Grace.
I like chicken tacos.
My dog is Earl.
dialogue: How are the dogs and cat? I hope they've been behaving themselves.
The dogs have been great. My little Grace has been sick though. I need to take her to the vet. Has your Grace been behaving herself?
Yes, She is very sweet. I have a lot of fun with her. I'm taking the dogs to the vet tomorrow. It's nearly impossible to wrangle them all, So it should be an adventure.
Four dogs can be a handful. I struggle with just my two. Will Anna be able to help you get them all together?
I'll manage. What's the matter with your Grace?
She just hasn't been eating like normal. She seems to not have a lot of energy. I think she got in to my chicken tacos the other night and now her little stomach just isn't right.
I feel so bad for them when that happens. Have you tried feeding her rice and pumpkin? That works for my pups when they have a belly ache.
That is such a good idea. I will try that. I want to get her feeling better before I go to see my brother and sister in Alabama next week.
Is she going with you?

She, Like most cats, Don't travel in the car to happily. I am bringing the dogs though. They love the trip and my sister has two dogs that they get to play with. It's so much fun to see them all together.
I bet! I hope she's back to herself before then. It would be hard to leave a sick cat at home.
I agree. If she's not feeling better, I may postpone the trip for a week or two. What has Earl been up to lately?

persona: My name is Chrissy. I live in Minnesota. I build robots for work.
I'm allergic to water. I'm a recluse.
I stream on Twitch.
I like finance and Starcraft.
dialogue: Oh man, The kids were all over the place at school today.
It must be verytiring to work as a teacher.
It definitely keeps me on my toes. Kindergarteners are full of energy!
I bet so, How is the weather in illinois?
We have some great seasons here, We get a little bit of everything. Getting warm now. I bet Minnesota is cold!
That's cool, It's freezing in here.
Since it's so cold, I bet you get a lot of chance to work on your robots.
I do, The cold weather makes me more focused for some reason.
I don't know if I'd be able to live in the cold. I love to go on walks too much!!.
Yes, That's a downfall of living in cold cities, I'm thinking of relocating soon.
Try not to move too far south, The heat can be overwhelming. I don't want you to be stuck indoors again!
Thanks for the advice, What do you think of New York?

persona: I have children that don't live with me. I wish they'd visit. I have a husband.
I'm a housekeeper. I used to be a painter.
I'm 56 and don't run.
I have a poor diet.
dialogue: Have you thought about painting again or some diet changes?
I'm sure I'll start painting when I can find the time.

Finding time for our passions, Can be a bit of work, In between our other tasks. I try to do some hobby, At least once a week, To stimulate my mind a little differently. Been thinking about going to a museum lately, Do you like art?
I like the Impressionists? What is your favorite kind?

Ah yes. I have seen a Monet painting, Of water lilies, That was really impressive, In person. The painter raised the oil to little wave crests, So in the light, When you walk by, The canvas appears to move, Like water. I prefer Realism or Naturalism with art. Frida Kahlo is a fave, How about you?
I likeDali a lot, But not many others in that genre.

Surrealism is a bit of work sometimes, AndDali's realistic work, Especially religious themes, Are pretty stunning. He would paint on Christian themes too, From a different perspective. What do you think ofDali's melting clock?
Its one of my faves.
He can imagine practical things, In very different light. He also did a movie or two, That were difficult to watch.Dali has an intensity. Any otherDali faves?
Most of his early stuff. What other painters do you like?
Ah, I see. Frida Kahlo, As I mentioned earlier, Although classics like da Vinci open my mind. Love how he studied the human form, You know what I mean?
Yeah, The body is an amazing subject. So is nature.

persona: I was born here. I'm at college for nursing.
I work nights at a local bar.
I like to cook. I don't like chicken. I don't own a home.
I have two blond, blue-eyed kids.
dialogue: I'm excited to try a new recipe for my family tonight.
Wow! What are you cooking?
It's a new home made chicken alfredo dish!
Oooh! That sounds delicious! How are you making it?
Pretty straight forward. Regular fettucine and chicken but the sauce is a secret recipe I got from a close friend.
Oh, That's nice of them to share the secret with you.
Yea, I was super excited because I've had it before and we loved it. I hope mine is the same.
I'm sure it will turn out great. You are a great cook.
Thanks! Cooking is one of those things you can always find ways to do something better.
For sure! What's your favorite dish to make?
It's not anything special but pot roast in the crock pot with lots of vegetables1.
Oh that sounds nice. Very hands off, But still delicious.

persona: I currently work for the Army.
I like the color blue.
I dropped out of highschool. I donate to charities.
dialogue: What sort of charities do you like to donate to?
I mostly like to donate to environmental charities, Especially remediation projects. Things like clean waterways and air.

Those are a great focus, To be sure. It is important to think about keeping what we have, Working, And sometimes that takes extra help, With a non profit or charity. Do you spend much time in waterways, The forest?
I spend as much time outdoors as possible. I think sometimes, It's the only thing that makes life better on those bad days. It always makes me more at peace.
I hear you there, And am really grateful we have forests in the area, To hike in. They are a favorite part of where I live. Do you have a favorite place to get outdoors?
I thankfully live in a neighborhood with lots of trees, And several parks. There's a state park in my area that I love to go to.
State parks are a good thing, And lately it seems the fees are changing. Maybe we need to offer more money to support these resources. Do you do volunteer work?
I do sometimes. I used to volunteer for the Forest Service but haven't had the opportunity recently. I'm incredibly blessed, The state park in my area is free.

Fantastic. I sometimes used to volunteer to do trail maintenance in a few local forests, And have some bicyclists friends who love trail riding too. Good to be mindful of what use though, Some places are delicate.

I used to live in a town with a lot of bike paths in the woods that were specially made. They were wood chip lined and I used to love running/biking there. I'm going to have to look into volunteer opportunities when I get a chance. Do you have a favorite charity to donate to?

Usually it's my time I'll donate the most, And I like to volunteer at local humane societies. Also, We have a child advocacy group called CASA, For foster kids, That I like doing work with. And running trails on wood, Great cushion!

CASA is a great charity to be a part of. I've seen them do some great things. That reminds me to apply to walk dogs for the humane society this summer! Thanks for the reminder. I used to have more money but I developed cancer and my energy is just gone.

persona: I like kayaking.
I have basic survival skills.
I don't like war. I love nature.
I am not retiring soon.
dialogue: Maybe one day we can go kayaking together if you want!
Yes please! That would be so much fun! You have yet to go kayaking and it would be such a great experience.
Is there anything necessary that I would need to know before I kayak?
I feel like if I told you it would ruin the experience LOL where we can possibly go they will have a lesson for the first half of the day and then we can be on our own the second half of the day.
That sounds fun! Hopefully there's a campground nearby and we can add it to the schedule. I want to test those survival skills of yours!
I feel like I need to test my survival skills as well LOL without Practice Things fade away and I feel like you and I can definitely enhance our survival skills on a good weekend trip.
For sure, We can teach each other what we know, Bring a few survival guides, And we'll be like Bear Grylls in no time!
Haha What have you been up to this week? Any exciting news to share?
Well some crazy stuff happened at the soup kitchen. I think one of the homeless was on something because he just ran out of line and took some poor guys food. It was nuts.

Oh no! What happened after? I hope nobody got hurt. The crazy thing that happened at my work today was that a patient came in to have surgery and instead of having a ride to take her home she decided to come with her baby. So we had to wait for the baby's babysitter to come and get her and also be the patient's ride home.

We had to restrain the man so we could let them both eat, We weren't going to leave him hungry of course. Was the surgery urgent? That would be understandable if it was but either way that must have taken a while to figure out.
It was oral surgery so it could have wait, I just wish it was more prepared, But we did tell her that we are running ahead of schedule so we kind of threw her off with babies.

persona: I have short hair.
I have two dogs.
I eat when I am bored.
I go to the gym often. I enjoy the treadmill and rowing machine at the gym.
dialogue: I got a new construction job today!
That's amazing! Congratulations! You are getting so much experience! What is it this time?
I'm building a new office building downtown. Laying the foundation.
Oh, I saw the sign and was wandering what they are building over there. I walk my dogs in that area sometimes/.
Yeah; it's hard work right now but I'm learning new skills on the job.
I will definitely ask for your advice when I am ready to built a house. How is your wife?
Thanks for asking. My wife is a little bit depressed. I think she is having difficulty adjusting to life in the United States. She is homesick.

I am sorry to hear that... I can totally relate as I went through that when I moved here ten years ago. Maybe I can hang out with her? We could go for dinner together. Or hit the gym. That's the best therapy for everything!
That would be really nice. I think my wife could use some new friends. Although she's not too used to going to the gym. That is not so common in Somalia.
No worries at all! I understand. We can just go for dinner then. What kind of food does she like?
Well, As you can expect, She likes food from our home country! Maybe you can take her out to a Somali restaurant?
Definitely! I have never tried Somali food so it will be a fun experience for me as well. Maybe your aunt can join us as well?

persona: I like sushi. I hate chicken.
I am in college.
I like jazz.
I live in Malibu.
I don't have pets. I want to be a nurse. I work in a dive bar.
dialogue: My cat threw up on my socks today.
Sorry about that. What's the gender of your cat?
My cats a boy. The throw up was not fun to clean up.
I can't say I've been there as I do not have one, But I'm certain its no fun as you said.
Exactly, Not fun at all. Do you have any pets?
No I do not, Mentioned that earlier. Did you go to work today?
Actually today is my day off from the supermarket. I was thinking of stoping by the dive bar later will you be working?
Sure, I'll be working today. What time will you be stopping by?
Im thinking this afternoon around 3ish. I want to run and grab lunch first.
Okay, I'll be seeing you then.
Alrighty I should get on it so Im not late see you soon.
Okay. I hope I would be able to study tonight.

persona: I'm not very busy.
I'm a professional athlete (Tennis). I am wealthy. I like swimming for exercise.
I think I'm a really good tennis player.
I'm married to a an international doctor.
dialogue: How many Tennis tournaments have you won?
I have won 7 so far. How many wrestling tournaments have you won?
I've only started recently, And my best result so far is 2nd place overall. What was your first win like?
It was like I had just climbed Mount Everest and was looking at the world around me. How often do you train?
Oh I train everyday. My personal trainer and I have great chemistry. We've been working hard to get me prepared for the next tournament. How about you? How often do you train?
I train 6 days a week. I like to rest on Sundays. Do you like to swim?
I do like to swim, But it's part of my training! Haha. I do find it relaxing compared to my other training regimens. Do you swim for fun?
I do. I have a personal indoor pool. It is great when you need some low impact activity. I can feel my stress melt away while swimming.
Yeah I know what you mean. Competing and training can be quite stressful. Do you have any tips you can share for stress management during competitions?
Yes. Stay focused and don't let the opponent psyche you out. Have confidence you can win.
I bet the first tournament win was also a big confidence booster. There's a big difference between thinking you can win and knowing you can win.
That is true. My wife was very nervous the first patient she treated. Now she has confidence she can diagnose any problem.

persona: I like classical and christian music. I like youtube.
I value saving money.
I am low maintenance.
My sister is an exotic pole dancer.
dialogue: I found some new music on youtube that I want to share with you.
Great. What type of music is it?
It is A group called Lazarus Hazardous. They are a contemporary chorale that sings gospel songs in a classical style.
You know what I like. Do you like their music?
Yes I found myself humming this song is quite frequently throughout the day.
Please send it to me. I can't wait to hear their music.
Already done my friend. Check your inbox ASAP. Hey do you ever venidero investing your savings?
Thanks. I'll check it. Investing sounds risky. A simple savings account has been enough for me. Is it safe?

persona: I do not like sports. My favorite animal are cats. I own three pet cats.
I work construction. I know how to build things.
I do not have any children.
dialogue: I've decided to try and build my children a tree house. Any tips on how to get started?
How old are your children? If you want we can sketch out a plan for the tree house, If you're free.
I have 3 kids of the ages of 4, 6, And 10. Id love to see a sketched out plan for the tree house.
That's cool. I don't have any children yet, But I'm excited to do build their tree house. How do you manage such a big house hold, I feel you and your wife are always busy.
Thank you so much. I usually do most of the work since im home often. But when ever i train my sister watches them or they sometimes tag along and they usually play around the club with my sister.
Wow, That's a good management and balance! I should seek you some advice when it comes to family matters!
Definitely im always down to help others out! Do you own your own construction company or do you work for a company?
Right now I work for a company, But I will go independent soon. I've just been building my portfolio and clienteles to start my own company. Do you do any other sports besides tennis?

I play golf and basketball every now and then. Depending on your job with the treehouse i could help you independent if you'd like i know people who are wanting to do some construction projects here in the next few months.

That's really great, I don't do any sports that's why I'm very curious. Hearing you want to help out makes me really happy and positive. I would do my best with the tree house, That's why we should meet for the planning so I can know what your kids like and what to put.

I am free for the rest of the week so what ever day works for you is when we can meet. Just by talking to you i could tell that you are a hard worker and are great at your trade so i have no doubt in your ability to build.
Thank you, I really appreciate it man. Things are really turning around. I hope I can also support you by going to your tennis match. When will be the next one?

persona: I like rock climbing.
I do not have children. I do not have a partner.
My pet dog is a black lab. I go hiking with my dog.
I work as an engineer.
dialogue: Where is your favorite place to go hiking with your dog?
I love going to Lewis Creek atleast twice a month. Have you ever tried hiking?
No I have not yet. I would love to get a dog I can do stuff like that with, But I am not sure what breed would be best. Any recommendations on dog that are active and good with kids?.
My friend from work is an expert on dogs. If yor schedule allows, You can come over to my work places, Check out some water pipes leaks then i will hook him up with you. As from 14:00hrs.
That can work. I usually have some free time during the week because i do plumbing jobs occasionally. How is the engineering job going?

It's great, We are currently working on a new prototype of an industrial machine that uses less power but great output. When you come we can grab ice cream as i take you round. How old is your eldest child?
That sounds wonderful. I love Chocolate ice cream. My oldest is 13. She wants to be an engineer when she get older so maybe you could give me some pointers. Do you want kids in the future?
Wow, That's wonderful. You can tag her along when you visit. I would love to have kids once i get married. I am really craving for a home with kids running around. I hope i will get a partner soon.

She would love that! I am sure you will find the right person to start your family with. You have a lot of great qualities going for you. Kids are great but a lot work also. Good thing you rock climb because that will help burn some of their energy.
Haha, It will surely keep them busy. What does your wife do?
She is a homemaker. I must say, I dont know what I would do without her. She manages everything so well and keeps the kids on a great schedule.
I love that. Am so happy for you. I hope i get to meet her soon.

persona: I do not like to go to the dentist. I work in a nursing home.
My wife left me. The kids live with me.
I spend a lot of time on Facebook.
I do not believe in God.
My favorite singer is Enrique Iglesias.
dialogue: Do you have any fun weekend plans with the kids?
Yeah! I'm planning on bringing them into the nursing home to put on a concert. The folks there love the small moments.
That's wonderful! What will your kids perform at the nursing home?
Mozart. They're part of a string quartet in real life! And that's what they'll be doing there. What about you? Had any dates recently? ;-).

I love Mozart. Cool beans. I'm not sure what I'll be doing. I might go hiking in the park. Naw, I haven't had any dates recently. Do your kids let the nursing home residents check our their instruments? Music is very therapeutic.
Naw, They don't really let people touch their instruments. After "the incident", I ended up having to buy a new cello... And since then, I've had them be protective of their craft.
Tee hee, It's interesting the way you mentioned that your children are a part of a string quartet "in real life". What did you mean by"in real life"? Just curious.
I mean, That's their official job. They play at events, Charity concerts, And more. It takes up a lot of their time.
Oh, I understand now. Thanks. I'm an avid music lover. Did you ever see the movie Amadeus?
Not really, No. It's not the sort of movie I'd like to watch. I have seen Mr. Holland's Opus, However. I've also seen a concert given by the New York Philharmonic! They were amazing.
Awesome! The Philharmonic... Boy do I miss seeing a concert. What is the name of your children's group?
Fourte. They were going for original, And I think they got it.

persona: I am in my mid-20s.
I have trouble with self-control. I do not want to talk to a professional about my self-control issues.
I live with my mom but she is very busy.
dialogue: When you say you have trouble with self-control, What do you mean? Do you have a specific example?
Yeah, Sometimes I get frustrated for no reason and I just lash out. Has that ever happened to you?
Yes of course. Sometimes at work I take things out on a couple of the girls there. We are generally good friends so there doesn't seem to be hard feelings.
That's good. Do you like to go running when you get frustrated? I bet that can be a good way to let off some steam.
Oh absolutely. My husband always tells me to go for run when I'm stressed after work. When I get back, I feel so much better, Especially if he made dinner.
Wow sounds like you have a great husband. What's your favorite meal that he makes for you?
He does a great job with Italian dishes. Maybe a quick sauce or maybe something more elaborate.
Mmm sounds delicious. I like my husband's chicken anddumplings. It reminds me of my moms.
My mom taught me alot of dishes, But my husband doesn't like them.
Aww that's too bad. I bet I would like your mom's dishes. :).
Well, She does come by and cook once in a while. My husband takes one for the team. Does your mom like to cook?
Yeah, My mom loves to cook. She's taught me almost everything I know about cooking. And my husband taught me the rest. Lol.

persona: I live on the moon.
dialogue: I just bought a bottle of vitaminD. I hope it helps me.
I could use some vitaminD. It's hard to find on the moon.
Yeah i could imagine its quite hard to find anything on the moon, How do you survive?
How does anyone? Haha! It's quite expensive and requires me to get items from NASA.
That is very true. What made you decide to live their if it so hard to gather items you need? Especially food!
It's okay we have major support from earth. It was my chance to be one of the first in human history to do something major. I couldn't resist.
Oh wow yeah that is defiantly once in a lifetime opportunity. Do you feel as though you will ever come back down to earth?
It's hard to say. The journey is dangerous. 1 out of every 6 supply shipments doesn't make it.
Omg that would defiantly make it a hard decision on wether to stay there or come back home. Do you miss your family though?
Well I'm in my 70s now and never had kids. So there aren't many left to miss.
Oh ok well living your retirement on the moon will defiantly leave an imprint on earth and what a legacy you will be to the world. What would you say you miss most about living on earth?
I miss trees and beaches.

persona: I used to teach gym. I am retired.
I love cheeseburgers.
I like war documentaries.
I was poor when I was young.
dialogue: I have a wrestling match this weekend.
Awesome! Please let me know how it goes. Have you been successful lately?
Not really, I feel like the booker is too concerned about elevating his friends rather than the people who are most talented. It hurts both the promotion I am involved in, And myself, In my opinion.
I'm sorry. Have you talked to him about your concerns? Perhaps he can be persuaded to change.

Yes. Given that the outcomes are pre-determined in Pro Wrestling, There is a great deal of politicking and sucking up that is expected. The people who determine the outcomes always seem to want favors, While I just want to go where my talent takes me. My conversation with him revealed that I would need to compromise and start sucking up, Which I do not want to do.

Good for you for sticking to your guns! But I have to say, Maybe it's time for a change? I grew up poor, You know. I lived from job to job as I built up savings so that I could be stable. But I was happy. I did what I liked, And I felt I made a difference in the world.

That is one of the major issues. Professional wrestling is basically a monopoly now, With one company far above all others. There are not any other viable companies to go to, So the choice I have is basically giving up what I love, Or compromising my values. I do not particularly like either option. I suppose I could try to transition to UFC, I do have a significant amateur wrestling background which got me into professional wrestling in the first place.

I dunno. I hear UFC is pretty brutal. I admit I don't like the idea of anyone getting beat up for a paycheck. But if that job is something you find joy in, Something that makes you feel fulfilled, Then I think it's worthy of consideration. But I teach gym now. It's a job that makes me feel happy because it makes others happy. It's not the main job I would have signed up for at first... But I wouldn't change it for the world.

I would not pursue UFC out of a desire to hurt people, Just to compete with other fighters. What do you typically do during your gym classes? I am always looking for ideas to add some variety to my cardio workouts, Have you done anything interesting or outlandish during your gym classes?

You can probably tell I'm tired when I say I currently teach. I did tell you earlier that I was retired. And I still am. But to answer your questions, I taught children. I tried to keep things interesting by teaching trust-building exercises. I would have the students try out each others' specialties in order to relate to one another. Nothing too outlandish, But for one April Fools' Day... Well, That's a story for another time ;-).

I know how that feels. You get so caught up in a pleasant memory that you think it is still occurring. I asked about your gym class experiences because mine were always so boring and "vanilla". The strangest thing we did by today's standards was dodgeball, Which would probably get a teacher fired nowadays.

Yeah, I never ran into issues with that. We did dodgeball more than a few times. The children liked it a lot. One time we did it in the dark! And THAT time... I did almost get fired when one of the children tripped and sprained their knee.

persona: I'm a twitch streamer.
I'm working on a robot. I'm a video game designer.
I'm allergic to water.
I'm afraid of spiders.
I am a recluse.
dialogue: Are you working on any new exciting video games at the moment?
Yes I am. It's going to be unique. Unfortunately i can't give you too many details.
No details?! Now I am even more interested. If you can't tell me about the game, Can you tell me if you finished building the robot?
Yes I did. The robot is almost human size. I was hoping to make it kinda like a cyborg. Taylor will love it.
I'm sure she will. I haven't told her about it because I want it to be a surprise. Maybe next you can make a giant robot spider for my friends.
Quit playing with me!! No way! You know I am scared of those creatures.
Okay okay. I thought I would at least try! How is your Twitch stream going?
Not bad at all. I am streaming some of my popular games tonight. You should get your friends and Taylor to subscribe.
I'll have to watch the stream tonight. I will ask my friends, But Taylor is pretty busy filming Fast and Furious 10 in LA right now. Do you expect to stream the new game when it's complete?
That's great. They will enjoy it. I know Taylor is too busy for me. I'll only stream my new game after it goes on sale.
Will the game be available on all consoles? I'd like to play it when it's on sale.
Yes. It will be initially released on PlayStation 5. Then other platforms will follow. I can't wait for the world to see it.

persona: I do not party.
I have a dog named Sugar. I like to bake. I make famous sugar cookies. I take my cookies to my county bake sale.
I like to knit.
I am old.
I would like to volunteer at a food bank.
dialogue: Have you found a food bank in your area where you can volunteer?
I did! I started donating some of my cookies too.
That's great! I am so proud of you. What did everyone think of your sugar cookies? If I am being honest, I am a little disappointed that I haven't been able to try any yet haha!
They loved them! One woman said they reminded them of the ones her late mother made. Maybe I should send you some? Can you find good bakeries in the city?
Oh that is beautiful, I am sure you made her day. There are many good bakeries here, But nothing beats something homemade with love. I am a wild child but I also love the comforts of home.
I can understand that. Do you ever take your pets out of the city? I bet they might like the comforts too.

Yes, Part of me has thought about sending them back home to live with my family where they can have a yard to roam in. I don't think it is really fair to keep them cooped up in a small apartment in the city. Eventually I will move out of the city, But it is fun for now.
What will make you take the big step to leave and go back?
I am still young and have a lot of partying left to do. Maybe once I meet someone special and want to start a family, I will think about leaving the city and go back to a quieter life.
Do you think you will find someone in the city who also wants to leave?
That is a good question, And I haven't really thought about that to be honest. I suppose that will be something I need to find out once I meet someone special to see if we are on the same page.
Well I hope you do find that person! Dating can be a difficult numbers game.

persona: My name is Larry.
I'm a chef and a fisherman. In my spare time I like to cook and be outside.
My favorite movie is Spiderman. I read anything with Spiderman.
I love making ice cream, and make it in the restaurant all the time.
dialogue: Oh my goodness, My wife made the best homemade chocolate ice cream last night!
You know how much I love ice cream. Do you think it would be worthy of being part of my menu at my restaurant? I am always looking for new ice cream recipes.
Hello! What have you been up to today?
I went fishing this morning to see if I can find any new fish to put on my menu at work. Have you been fishing before?
I've never been sadly. Do you think it's a good activity for kids? I'm always looking for new experiences for my three children.
Yes I think your kids would love it. It is quite calming and exciting when you do catch one. You could take some ice cream and have some while you are out.
Then I will have to try it with them! Maybe we can stop by your restaurant to get some ice cream after fishing. Are you working on any new flavors at the moment?
That would be a great idea. Yes do come by and have some food. Currently, I am experimenting with a banana and caramel flavour. Do you think your family would like that?
Two of my kids would love to try that. The other one is actually allergic to bananas. How strange is that? What flavor would you recommend to him?
I am sorry to hear about the allergy. How about you send over your wife's homemade chocolate ice cream recipe and I whip something up similar to that for the little one?

I'll have to ask her for it. She may not want to give it to you for fear that you make it better than her. She's a bit competitive like that. I'm sure I can convince her, Though! Hey, What do you think about a little healthy ice cream making competition between the two of you?
That sounds great. If you win I will buy your family a new comic book and if I win you can all come with me fishing sometime? How does that sound?

persona: I watch old horror movies. I like old Dracula movies more than new remakes. My son is in junior high school. My son likes old horror movies.
My dad works at home depot.
I find Nascar exciting. I worked in human services.
I love dogs. I have a rescue dog.
dialogue: My meeting went well, Where did you get your rescue dog?
I got him from a local shelter not too far from home. It's run by a good charity.
Awww. I bet he's so grateful to have a good home. Could you send me the details when you get a chance? I'd like to support a good charity.
No problem. I'll send you the details later today. What are your plans for later? Watching a TCM movie?
Thanks so much. Yes, I think so. They're playing Night of the Hunter, I just love that movie! What are your plans for the rest of the day?
My son and I will walk the dog then watch a horror movie after dinner.
That sounds like fun. We should meet up and take both the dogs for a walk some time. I know mine could do with a good run around with another pup.
That'll be great. I hope we will be able to keep up. Your dog is a big boy.

He is! But he's slowing down a little in his old age. That's why I'm thinking of adopting another pup - get that playful side out of him again. It's so sweet when older dogs really click with another one!
That's a great Idea. By the way, Can I please meet your dad? I'd like to ask him about his Nascar days.
Of course! I'll see if he wants to come on the dog walk with us. He loves talking about his Nascar days so he'll be grateful for the listening ear, Lol.
Wow.. Thanks. I can't wait. We should must agree a day and time soon.

persona: My name is Jerry. I farm bees.
I like to cook. I fly fish.
I have no family close to me.
I like Spawn and Xmen comics.
I love papaya.
dialogue: I found a new recipe that uses papaya.
That's fantastic! What are the other ingredients?
Mango and oranges. Blend them all together to create a sauce, Then pour over anything to enhance a dish!
Sounds delicious! What's it called?
I haven't come up with a name for it yet. I'm not sure what to call it.
How did you discover it?
My children wanted an "exotic" sauce to add to their food. I took what I had on-hand, Added papaya, And bam! A sauce worthy of my childrens' taste buds.
How well does it pair with pasta?
I wouldn't recommend it for hot pasta. It goes great with pasta salad, Though.
What other ingredients would you put in the pasta salad with it?
Carrots, Onions, Broccoli, And a little vinegar to give it that extra kick.
Oooh, I love that! I wonder what fish I could put with it.

persona: I am from California. I love living in California.
I considered being a chef for the army before.
I do not know how to cook shawarma. I cook mostly shrimp, catfish, and other seafoods. I enjoy fishing.
I love school.
dialogue: What do you love about school?
School has been good, Stressful but good. I'm almost finished now, Only 1 more month for the year. How's everything going with the army?
I'm going to be transferred to a new base soon, And I can't wait to get my assignment. I'm not sure where I'll be heading yet, But there are some pretty cool possibilities.
That's awesome! Do you hope to be closer to your home or where do you hope you'll end up next?
I've already seen home, I want to go somewhere new! I joined the army as a way to see the world, So I'm hoping to go overseas somewhere. I might even get to go to Hawaii, Bermuda, Or Japan.
Oh that's awesome! Being from California, I've travelled to Hawaii a few times so that's a wonderful place you could end up. It's amazing. They also have great food over there!
Yeah? What's your favorite Hawaiian dish?
I'm a big fan of the Poke dishes. I mainly like to cook with seafood, So having their Poke dishes was a treat. I try to really incorporate their flavors in my dishes I make.
I don't like seafood much, But I know they're meant to have pretty good pork and ham, Which I do like. Can never say no to some bacon!

Yeah! Bacon is great to cook with, I hope to really start expanding my cooking, Maybe I'll incorporate more bacon! I know you've been the UK, I want to try their food to help expand my knowledge. Did you like the UK?
I did! It was my first time in a foreign country. I wanted to start off somewhere with English as the main language so I wouldn't feel lost! Are you planning a trip soon?
I hope so! Going to different countries is something I want to do more of. I'm glad you get the opportunity to hopefully do that with the military!

persona: I browse the internet a lot.
I am a feminist.
I have solar panels on my roof.
I live in a small home and I only buy organic food.
I am a vegan as well.
I am 32 years of age and retired.
dialogue: What was your profession before you retired?
I was a fictional author. Do you read alot?
I read a lot of online articles on gaming a music. What kind of fiction did you write? Mystery? Romance? Sci-fi?

That is good to hear, It is always fun to read about your passions! I wrote romance novels. Cheesy love stories where the woman was normally the hero, But I love them. Added a different story line to the normal love stories.
That is so cool! A feminist twist on romance is genius! I can't believe you were able to retire at just 32. What do you do with all your free time now besides browsing the internet?
Thank you! It was a risk, But following my gut paid off! I like to cook and research new vegan recipes. Do you have a favorite vegan recipe I can try out next?
I made vegan "chicken" fingers using oyster mushrooms a couple weeks ago! As a fellow vegan, I was really missing the crispiness of fried chicken. Is there anything non-vegan that you really miss?
Wow, That sounds amazing. I will be trying that this week! I hate to admit it but I miss the comfort of a good old cheeseburger from time to time.
That is SO fair. And I feel like it's so hard to find a really good vegan patty. Beyond burgers are okay, But the realness of the "meat" turns me off a little bit. I definitely miss cheese. A lot.
Oh my goodness, Yes I miss cheese too! What made you decide to be a vegan?

A couple things. The environmental impact of meat and dairy products was what started my research into veganism. Then I started to read up on how poorly the animals are treated on dairy/egg farms and decided that I didn't want to be contributing to their pain.
Sounds like perfect reasoning! All similar reasons for me. Does anyone ever give you a hard time about that choice?

persona: I just moved. I like healthy snacks.
I'm vegan. I'm from Germany.
I like hummus.
I love thrill seeking. I want to go skydiving.
I've previously been on a roller coaster. I prefer the roller coasters at Heide Park.
dialogue: Do you have any vegan meal recommendations for me?
I do! A vegetable pizza with broccoli, Peppers and onions. Use fresh ground flour for that fresh taste. When you get the texture of the vegetables just right, It tastes amazing.
How do you recommend I prepare the vegetables?

Steam the broccoli first. Make it a little under the texture you want because it will continue cooking in the oven. As for the peppers and onions, I recommend you fry them on the stove lightly, Just to give them a good char before you set them on the pizza.
That sounds really simple! I'd better make some extra to snack on while the pizza is cooking. What temperature do I need to have my oven on?
I do it at 400 degrees. Others may suggest 350, But I really want to dig into that pizza ASAP lol.
Fahrenheit? My oven only uses Celsius. I thought yours did as well. What is it in Celsius?
My oven actually does use Fahrenheit. Although I'm from Germany, I live in the USA now and the ovens use Fahrenheit here. As for converting to Celsius, It's a simple math problem. 5/9 * (F - 32).
Oh! I didn't realize you were in USA now. Ok, So about 200C. That's simple enough! I like to put olives on my pizza as well sometimes. How do you feel about that?
Olives are great! I try to avoid the salt, However, Since my doctor told me to cut down on that. But they really do pep up a pizza.
They really do! Also some peri-peri sauce and basil can really make it come alive. Can you get peri-peri where you are now?
Not really. I've looked around. It's sold on Amazon, Though, So I don't have to make it myself ;-).

persona: My hopes and dreams are to spend time with friends having fun.
I'm 19.  I work at Burger King.  I still live at home.
I want to move out.  My parents are always on my back.
I like to paint.
dialogue: I've been dreaming about getting back into paintings and making some more money.
I love to paint! That's awesome!
I used to paint futuristic scenes inspired by space. It was very unique. What do you like to paint?
I like abstract works, Such as Jackson Pollock. Did you paint for a living?

Jackson Pollack is great. My kids love to paint like him as he is very abstract. Yes, I used to sell my paintings for a few thousands a piece. I still remember the days when I had galleries full of my work. It was fantastic!
That sounds great! I work at Burger King right now.
What would you like to be when you get older?
I haven't decided. Right now I just like spending time with friends.
That is nice. You are still young, 19 years young, Still long way to go before you are stuck in a career. What are you passions?
Right now I just want to have fun! I'm hoping to move out of my parents' house soon.
Do you hope to move in with friends or live on your own? I went straight to living on my own, It was quite daunting back then.
Oh I will get a place with my friends. It will be so much fun!

persona: I just moved from Germany. I'm getting used to the time difference.
I love rollercoasters and skydiving. I love swimming but I'm a bad swimmer.
I'm vegan. I love hummus.
I'm a software engineer at Boeing. I moved from Germany to live with my family.
dialogue: Do you have any tips for me for when I visit Germany?
I would strongly suggest visiting the Becks beer brewery. They have a wonderful tour.
Oh that would be amazing to do, I do love a good beer. What was your favorite thing to do whilst living in Germany?
I am a big football (European) fan, So loved going to see my favorite club, Bayern Munich.
I am also a big fan of both European and American football. Are you into any other sprts?
I am a big fan of cycling. Really enjoy the Tour de France. One day I would like to run alongside the cyclists as they are biking up the Alped'Huez!
Yes that would be amazing to do. I usually watch that onTv every time. I also a big fan of the olympics i plan on going one year when its closer to me. Do you enjoy watching the Olympics?
Yes, Olympics are great, For me, I prefer the winter ones to the summer ones. I actually attended the 2006 winter olympics in Turin. It was awesome.

Oh wow im so jealous. I enjoy both but for me i would say i enjoy the summer olympics more just because i understand the rules of most of the sports played, Compared to the winter olympics. But i would sure love to try skiing one day.
Skiing is fun, But I am much better at "apres ski" activities!
One day i will try that too. I also so see your into sky diving you are so brave. I would love to try but that one defiantly scares me. Haha.
I was scared too, But after a few tandem jumps you get used to it. I am actually sky diving this weekend if you wanna give it a try.

persona: I'm a musician. I play guitar.
I study languages. I am learning Spanish. My favorite word in Spanish is trabajo. I'm not good at speaking Spanish.
I like tacos.
I teach music to kids and young adults.
dialogue: I think I'm going to start learning Spanish in my free time.
We can learn together. Do you know what a biblioteca is?
I believe that means library. I really only speak English though.
Yes it does. I am learning Spanish at the local library. You can join my class if you want. I am not very good but it is fun to learn.
Thank you for the invite! I am currently in law school so that takes up a lot of my time.
Yes I did think that. Law is a tricky subject to learn and I did wonder if you had time to join. Maybe just download an app and learn on the go.
Yes an app might work! What other hobbies do you have?
I play guitar a lot in my spare time. I am teaching my kids to play at the moment. They are starting to pick it up. Do you play an instrument?
I do not. I spend my spare time with my horses. It's so peaceful.
Horses are amazing animals. Do you have other animals on your farm?
Oh yes. Dogs, Cats, Chickens, And goats. I love all the animals.
Wow so many. I wish I had a pet. Animals are amazing creatures. I think I would love a parrot and see if it would dance to my guitar playing. That would be fun.

persona: My name is Mandi. I hate heights.
I don't have a job. I volunteer at a food bank.
I love to party. I have lenient parents.
I have a cat named gizmo and a dog named dixie. I have a fox terrier that is hyper.
dialogue: My new gas station is doing well!
That is amazing to hear. What is your favorite part so far of owning the gas station?
I like meeting the variety of people who come to buy gas, And also the regulars that are becoming a main stay.
I bet that is a nice aspect, Regulars are the best. Maybe I need to come apply for a job there!
Something to keep in mind when we have a vacancy, To be sure. I appreciate your positive attitude. The location works well too.
Is the station located in a busy area, Or just a heavily traffic corner?
Actually it's in a rather quiet area, But it's close to my home, And I tend to get a lot of farmers, Workers with rigs.
Oh nice. Have you had any problem customers, Or people that have been difficult?
We've been looking at new security systems, Although I invested in locks and good mechanical security.
