Oh, I love it! You know the music I like most, So it's a great environment; best of both worlds! What denomination are you?
My dad is Christian and my mom is Catholic. I don't really know what I want to be though.

persona: I walk dogs as a job and I like reading.
I sing and also dance.
My mom and dad were street walkers. Me and my family used to live in the shelter. My parents were sex workers.
I also love kayaking.
dialogue: Volunteering is keeping me busy and is quite stressful but I love feeling of being able to help someone.
It sounds like it would be a worth while life. How often do you get to volunteer?
I go at least once a week. More if I can, Depending on my teaching and travel schedule. Were you able to finish painting your kayak?
I did. I am letting it dry and cure well. I plan on going down river next weekend. You love traveling. Have you tried taking on an outdoor trip like kayaking?
No, I haven't! Maybe next time I travel I'll look into it. Which river will you be kayaking on?
I am down south in Alabama right now. I am actually kayaking several. They have some smaller rivers that have great scenery. I am excited. Have you every traveled south?
Yes, I have! I love the South. I've never been to Alabama but I found Southeast Georgia and coastal South Carolina to be beautiful. Have you ever done a kayaking trip there?

I have not been to Georgia, But I have traveled to South Carolina several times and not just for kayaking. Charleston is a beautiful city. They have several great music venues too. I bet you would love it.

I've been to Charleston and I did love it! We only got to hear a bit of live music but we had a great time. We stayed at the Francis Marion. What kind of music do you like to sing? Did you find any while you were in Charleston?
I travel with several musicians. We usually stick to acoustic rock. But we also love blues if the time calls for it. What is your preference?
Being a piano teacher I do a lot of work with classical music, Of course. But for live music I like folk, Especially Celtic music. Have you ever gone to a Celtic show?
I have not. A friend of mine I travel with loves it. He plays it a lot when we are on break. I might give it a shot one day.

persona: I play basketball.
I like hip hop. I like Travis Scott.
I love lite bite. I have an older sister.
My mom is a dentist.
dialogue: I heard that travis Scott has a new song out, Have you heard it yet?
Unfortunately I haven't yet, I was out of town so I haven't listened to much music lately :(.
Aw that's too bad. That's nice that you went out of town though! Where did you explore?
My sister and I went to Fort Worth and did our yearly BBQ run, Hit up some delicious eats for a few days.
That sounds like a great time. I've never been but would be curious to. Do they have good places to dance out there?
Oh yes, There's a lot of those! I think you'd have a lot of fun! You're more than welcome to come along next trip we take.
Yeah definitely let me know when it would be! What else are you up to nowadays. Have you been able to play basketball recently?
When the weather is cooperative, Yes! We were supposed to have some time to play yesterday but the rain washed us out.
Yeah weather really hasn't been so great lately. Can't wait for a sunny day to come out.
Same here. I love spending time outdoors with my friends andsipping mimosas but we can't do that right now.
Yeah, I would love a lite bite in some nice sun and warm weather so badly these days.
Let's get together and make that happen then!

persona: I am 56. I am a female.
I paint.  My family does not visit me.
I clean houses.
I like raw steaks. I like eggs.
dialogue: I had the worse day at work yesterday, A lot of the kids got sick and you wouldn't believe what happened.
Sorry about your day. Tell me what happened?
There was a cold going around and I felt so bad for the sick kids.
Sorry dear, But it's beyond your power to do anything, You can only help make them comfortable.
You're right. That is very good advice. Do you have any other life advice for me?
Haha, Just trying to make you feel better. Do you still volunteer?
Yes I still volunteer. I am a social worker and help underprivileged kids.
That's great, Was thinking of joining, Any advice?
You have to have a lot of empathy. These kids are in tough times.
I do have empathy, Can't say a lot, But I know I love kids a lot.
Then you would be a perfect fit!
You think so? I just hope I don't get tired of it.

persona: I love cheeseburgers. I love watching war documentaries.
I am a retired gym teacher. I am not married.
I like to volunteer at soup kitchens.
I grew up poor.
dialogue: I have been working hard at wedding planning these last few days.
Oh, That sounds like a dream! How is it going for you? Will you have everything ready for Spring?
This is a very complicated process planning a wedding but it is so exciting! Maybe we will cook out cheeseburgers at the reception if the spring rain holds off.
Oh, You know you're speaking my language! It's just important to balance the high calories with plenty of physical exercise.
My friend Verna that just passed away was exercising when she passed. Her heart was pressed to far while running a marathon.
I'm sorry to hear that, And sorry for your loss. It can be just as important to take it easy when needed.
So much unpredictability in life. She was good food eater and cheeseburgers were off limits however she will not know the joy of foods that like that.
I couldn't give them up if I tried. You?
Same here. I try to workout a couple days a week to offset the indulgence. How do you exercise?
I like to go back to the basics. Plenty of cardio followed by sports! Do you have a routine?
Yes, Hand weights for upper body and treadmill for cardio. I use a Fit Bit to track my progress do you?
Those are awesome! I have a more generic version. I try to be thrifty.

persona: I've worked in my field for fifteen years.
I am a man born in America. I enjoy sports.
I have dogs. I take my dogs to the beach every morning.
My son is four years old.
dialogue: What kind of things do you like to do with your son?
We play with his toys, I'm trying to get him into football but he's a bit young yet. We also go to the beach together, He loves the sand! Do you live near any beaches?
Aw, The beach is great! One of my favorite places to be. I could help teach swimming!
Yeah, Although I imagine swimming in the ocean is very different from in the pool. I don't go to the pool a lot, I mainly swim in the ocean near my house.
Oh, It's definitely quite a bit different. Good to know the basics, Though. My mother loves the swimming pool to do her exercises, So I'm always happy to be there.
Did your mother move away from India with you? I'm glad you both have an activity you can enjoy together, I hope to have that with my son.

Yes, She did. I was originally going to return to India after getting my degree, But I've fallen in love with this place and encouraged my family to come with me. My mother absolutely loves it. Of course, We still miss many things about India but it's still nice. I'm sure you'll find plenty of activities to bond with your son! Other than sports, What do you think you'll get him interested in?

I'm hoping he also grows up to love animals like I do, He loves our dogs so I think we're off to a good start! I'm hoping he enjoys school as well, I want him to be able to get a good job when he's older.

It's easy to teach children to love animals when you love them yourself. Just keep being that example to him and he'll grow into a great man. Education is so important! There are many different paths to take in life, But no matter which one we take we should always be learning along the way.
You are very inciteful! How are your computer programming studies going, Are you enjoying learning this field still?
It's very exciting work to me! I enjoy very technical fields and it has been the perfect challenge. Have you considered studying anything new or are you quite happy in your current field?

I'm glad you are still enjoying it, I'm sure you're going to go really far in this field, Best of luck to you (not that you need it)! I'm quite happy in my field, I also had to do a lot of studying to get here so I'm happy to keep going for now!

persona: I dance. I work in a bookstore. I studied Chemistry.
I hate the color orange. I use some technology.
dialogue: What kind of dancing do you do?
I do salsa dancing and ballet.
How quickly did you learn the dances?
They were easy to learn, It took me about 2 months.
Do you prefer salsa or ballet? Which is your favorite?
I prefer salsa because it is more fun.
Do you think it's a dance that a Grandfather can learn?
Yes definitely! Anyone can learn it.
I feel like i would need to have some rhythm to do salsa.
Don't worry about it. It will come to you!
How often do you dance?
I dance all the time.

persona: I have a dog walking business.
I do not play any instruments. I kayak for fun.
I would love to visit a foreign country.
I speak a little Spanish. I like to read.
I am a grad student. I like chocolate.
dialogue: I am going back to China soon.
That's great. I am so jealous. Do you have a holiday planned in China?

Yes I do. I'm returning in a few weeks for a month-long vacation, And I may look for work there. I feel like I really need a change in life right now. Are you planning on traveling? I know you had wanted to.
That's exciting. Yes. I hope to visit Spain when i save enough money. Maybe brush up on my Spanish while there.
That would be lovely! What are you studying in Grad School again? If your course load isn't too heavy you could take a Spanish class or even study abroad, Which would help with language and cost!
I am studying Psychology. After my exams i'll have more time to focus on my business and save up. I am done with studying after this post grad.
Oh is this your final semester of grad school? That's exciting. Do you have a job lined up for after you finish your finals?
Yes. Will be finished soon. My dog walking business will be my job for a while till I get back from a holiday. I am not looking for new jobs yet.
That's a pretty successful dog walking business then! Do you have any idea of where you want to apply for the long term? Are you going the clinical psychologist route?

persona: I live in Ohio.
I do not have any kids. I have a musician.
I like to study languages.
dialogue: My job is getting a little bit better. It's still a boring, But it's getting a little less so.
I'm glad your job is getting more interesting! So what kind of job does your husband do? It must be interesting if you'd like to make a documentary about it.
My husband works in construction. He's a foreman.
I can see how that would be interesting especially with the variety of projects to work on. What other kinds of documentaries do you like?
I really enjoy true crime documentaries. Do you watch any?
Yes! I'm watching one right now. Which ones are your favorite? I like Joe Kenda a lot, And the People Investigates series.
I really enjoyed The Ted BundyTapes. The criminal mind interests me.
Me too. Ted Bundy was really scary! Have you watched the documentary on the Golden State Killer?
Yes, I think I've seen them all!
Have you seen any of the ones about people who were doctors/nurses, Etc like Donald Harvey?
I've seen some, But I don't believe I've seen one on Donald Harvey.

He worked in a hospital near Cincinnati. They called him the "Angel of Death". He smothered patients with their pillows. Creepy guy. It was a while ago, Back in the 70s and 80s. He killed a lot of people.

persona: My name is Kim.
I do not like hat-hair. I do not like to sweat.
I am retired. I do not like snow.
I used to work for airlines. I like to grill. I like to gamble. I cut the grass.
I live in Florida. I am old. I fit in where I live.
dialogue: Work was really hard today. We were really busy and I was on my feet all day. I think I need to retire, Like you!
Retirement is good, But sometimes I get bored. I miss having my schedule full with work sometimes.
That makes sense. Maybe I need to find a middle ground - something to keep me busy but not make my feet sodang sore!
Middle ground is always good. From one extreme to the other is always hard. I bet that you meet some interesting people as a waitress!
Definitely. I meet my fair share of you-know-whats that make life difficult, Too, Ha! How's Florida been treating you?
It's hot and humid. Winters are nice - summers are too hot at sticky. Thank goodness for air condtioning. But I guess I can't complain - it's gotta be even hotter in Cairo.
It's very very very hot here, That's for sure! Is it true there are alligators in Florida? I saw footage of one just walking across a golf course once! Crazy!
Yes, It is. Don't let your small dogs go wondering around by the water for sure. I prefer the ocean and not the lakes. There are no alligators in the ocean :) What kine of motorcycle do you drive?
That's absolutely crazy! And I drive a classic Harley. If only some genius could come up with a helmet that doesn't mess up my hair, I'd make them a millionaire!
Ha! Harley has been around for over 100 years, And they still haven't figured out a helmet that doesn't give you helmet head. And I think they never will.
There are some mysteries in life that will never be solved I guess, Lol. Any big gambling wins lately? I wish I had the nerve to bet big!
Yes, I have been very lucky at the tables lately. But you have to bet big to win big.

persona: I used to be in the military.
I volunteer at a bunny sanctuary.
I work at a ship yard.
dialogue: Will you ever consider adopting a bunny?
I would consider adopting a bunny for myself.
I really want to start volunteering now, Is it difficult at the bunny sanctuary?
It is very easy if you have a lot of empathy.
Well i think i do, Does your military background help keeping everything organized?
Yes definitely. Having a military background is great.
Ive always thought of joining, I am a bit clumsy though. I still have this cast on my arm for another 2 weeks.
That's fine. You can work around it.
I guess they would be able to whip me into shape.
It would a great decision to make.
Well i will definitely consider it. How has work been at the shipyard?
It has been fantastic and great.

persona: I am from Alabama. I work in construction. I learned construction from my dad.
I have 5 cats. I rescued the cats. They are very special to me.
I like to cook. Watching the Food Network or following cooks on Facebook is a good way to learn to cook.
dialogue: I tried to watch a cooking show on the Food Network, But it seemed so complicated. Do you have any suggestions on how I should begin to learn how to cook? What type of food should I start with?

It seems complicated haha, But you are definitely in the right direction. Watching the food network or facebook cooking is a great way to learn how to cook. I suggest starting with whole carbs such as pasta liguene, An Alabama favorite.
It is complicated but i have a passion to learn. How quickly do you think i will be an acceptable cook if i put a lot of effort into it?

One thing I learned about passion is that it takes more than that to do anything. I worked in construction, Taught by my dad, And I succeed intill my work ethic surpassed my passion. For cooking you have to get out of your comfort zone and work hard. If you work hard you will have acceptable cooking in a matter of days, Maybe even weeks.
Cooking is cool, But construction is even cooler. Do you build from group up, Or do you do smaller jobs?

Yeah construction is really cool, I one time even rescued some cats by working on the house for a new family. I do group ups and had to work my way up the scale with my work ethic which got me better, Similar to cooking!
It must be nice to build things. It's definitely a lost skill!
Truly, It all started off with me finding 5 cats in a house too. Before that I wasnt even thinking about construction bu it definitely pays well and is also very interactive.
I'm a cat lover too, So i definitely understand. It's nice to do jobs where you are you own boss and responsible for yourself.

Yah those five furry felines are very special to me. Back to the discussion of the job thats how I was raised in Alabama, To find a job that is for you and bossed by you. It makes you the happiest in the end!
I agree. I wish i had those skills.
Just start working on it and I promise you will prosper. What is your job field? Is it similar to construction or completely different because it similar you may have a shot at construction skills.

persona: I live in the city. I used to live on a farm.
I have a drinking problem.
I use to teach dancing. I live in a box.
I am 45. My mother is dead.
dialogue: I might start pole dancing again.
Wow that sounds like a big change back. What brought that up?
I decided that I want to be my old self.
Sometimes you do just have to go with what you think will make you happy. Im still struggling with that.
Really? Tell me about your problems.
Well im still homeless, I havent gotten over my moms death, And i just cant give up the booze.
That's tough. Just remember to keep on going and it will all work out.
You are right but its tough. Maybe i should get out of the city and move back to the country. Open up a dancing studio.
Yeah that is a pretty smart idea.
I just have to figure out a way to make the money. Im sure if i could find the support to stop drinking that would be a good start.
True, Best of luck with that.
Thank you and i hope your new career works out too! Are you still keeping in touch with your dad?

persona: I have a red and blue striped race motorbikek. I have been racing on my motorbike for 10 years.
I wear a helmet and safety eyewear when I ride my motorbike.
dialogue: I am getting stronger every day. Today I was able to get up and walk around the block. Maybe next week I'll be well enough to ride a motorbike? Not!
I have heard of others with the same thing about their heart as a kid and they had multiple surgeries in their life. How many heart surgeries in total have you had?
I've had a lot. This one was my seventh and I hope it will be the last for a long time! I already feel like an entirely new person. So hey, When's your next race coming up?
I'm glad you are recoverying well! I have an event scheduled in 2 weeks from this Friday. I am so excited. My buddy and I both race, We have a bet for this one. Have you ever ridden a motorcycle?

No, I never have. My doctors didn't think it was a great idea because of all the surgeries. Maybe when I'm fully recovered I can ask again, Because I'd love to try it. Where's your race going to be, Anyplace fun?

It will be in Birmingham, Alabama. The race track is called Barber Motorsports Park. It is a good drive for my buddy and I, We live in Tennessee. We will get there early and do some sight seeing. Have you ever been to Alabama?

No, I never have. I've heard that it's really nice there. Do you race on dirt, Or is it a paved track? Is it like I see on tv sometimes, With hills and jumps and all sorts of wildness? That looks like so much fun.
This one is on pavement. If you cant ride a motorbike, Maybe you should attend a race, It is really thrilling. What kind of hobbies do you have?

Mostly indoor stuff like reading, Cooking, Decorating, Things like that. When you have to hang out in the house a lot you get motivated to make it more pleasant! I'm looking forward to taking up more outdoor stuff like fishing and hiking and horseback riding. And maybe motorbiking!
Do you ever grow the food you cook? Or do you have great farmer's markets in your area?

We have great farmer's markets here, I live in rural Pennsylvania. I go every week and get lots of veggies and locally-farmed meat. The only thing I can't get there is fish/seafood. That's why I want to learn to fish, Haha!
The other day, I read an article about a Bacon festival in Pennsylvania. Speaking of food, I would love to go to that! Too bad you can't fish for bacon.. Lol.

persona: I enjoy the sunrise.
I have a fish as a pet.
I have an ex-boyfriend.
I had a birthday recently. I am 18 years old.
My parents forgot my birthday. My parents are self-absorbed. I do not get along with them.
dialogue: How is life with your fish? Does it have a name? Gone on any good walks recently?
It's been nice, His name is Finley. And yes! I went on a really nice sunset walk last night with some friends.
Finley is a great name! What kind of fish is he? And I'm jealous of a sunset walk, Where did you all go?
He's a Betta fish! We went to this really nice park about a half hour from us. It was really nice. Have you gone on any of your morning walks recently?

Oh Bettas are lovely, And that sounds wonderful! I actually did a sunrise walk on the beach with my girlfriend two days ago. It was really wonderful, Since it was our anniversary. I got us matching dresses and she surprised me with a mini beach day trip, On which we went for a sunrise stroll.
Oh wow, That sounds lovely! Did you catch a pretty sunrise?
Yeah we did! We got to see an absolutely beautiful sky. I definitely want to go back.
I just love sunrises and sunsets! My whole camera roll is a bunch of pictures of the sky, Lol. I may watch the sunrise sometime this weekend!
Same! I have so many photos of the sunrise/sunset. It's such a common thing, I mean there are two every day, But it's always unique and beautiful.
Defiantly! How's your middle school kids been?

They've been good! I love teaching, And its always rewarding to see them learn new things. Plus, I love that I can be an example of an LGBT person for these kids, Since some come from homophobic homes. I had a student come out just yesterday, And I was so proud that I can create a space where these kids feel safe to be themselves.
Wow, That is amazing! You are a great role model to them, I love that. I bet it's such a great and rewarding feeling.

persona: I garden. I do outdoor walking.
I have a dog.
I am a school teacher.
I go to church every week.
dialogue: Which subject do you handle and for which level?
I cover senior chemistry. It's always a fun time during lab day.
That sounds really awesome, No doubt a lot of fun. What's the most interesting experiment you've taught so far in your career?
One time we turned on a light bulb with a potato. That was a pretty cool one. How has your job been? I might come see you soon. I need a cut.

That's amazing. I have not the slightest clue of how that's even possible - sometimes the switch is enough of a problem. It has been pretty good, Busy and steady so no complaints. Let me know when you have a better idea of when you'd like to swing by and I'll slot you in.
Busy and steady is great. Still making time for the aerobics classes? Maybe I can come by after church this Sunday?

Here and there still, Yeah. I've cut back to one class a week to accommodate work and other things, But you're in luck as it's every Sunday afternoon. Just make sure you're prepared to throw knees and elbows at the air.

Oh man I was still talking about the hair for sunday afternoon! That's okay though, I'm definitely down for the class instead. The walking I've been doing isn't shedding these extra pounds around my hips! Maybe I can get my haircut on Friday.

Oh, My bad. Yeah, Sundays are my day off so that won't work, But Friday I can definitely book you in. Sorry to hear about the walking not having the desired result, But I'm glad you'll give the classes a try! It's a lot of fun and a little more intense.
Perfect, That's just what I need. Karen went to your class a few weeks ago and was raving about it to me. I'm excited to get in on the action.

Did she? That's actually great to hear. Sometimes I think I'm being a little too animated in trying to hype everyone up but I guess I'm just psyching myself out. You'll love it, There's only about a dozen of us that show but they're all mutual friends so it won't feel awkward.
Awesome, This will be fun. Maybe after a few dozen of these classes I can finally look as good as you do in skinny jeans.

persona: I have cats. My cats and I watch the birds.
I did not drink coffee. My doctor said not to drink coffee.
I am sad when the holidays are coming. My kids do not come. I am old.
I am on a special diet.
dialogue: Can you list out the special diet you follow?
I am on the carnivore diet thanks to Joe Rogan.
Oh wow, That is interesting. Has it been working out for you?
It has been working and my skin has cleared up.
Thats great im glad its doing well! How have your cats been?
My cats have been doing great.
Im glad, Have you seen any interesting birds lately?
I have seen a blue jay in my backyard.
I love bluejays. I put up a feeder after the last time we talked, Though im just getting crows.
Oh man, Bird watching is so fun!
It really is. They are some crazy little creatures.
I love bird watching with my mom!

persona: I'm a watch dealer cashier at a pawn shop.
I love shoes. I want a Rolls Royce one day.
My parents won't let me work as a stripper. A queen paid me to dance. I strip because my parents won't buy me a Rolls Royce.
dialogue: I started a painting of my dogs in my garden. It's great when your hobbies collide!
That is great. What type of dogs do you have?
German Shepherds. So loyal but so furry, Lol! It's crazy how much hair they shed.
How many do you have? I've always wants a dog, But haven.
I have 3 now. I would happily get more in a heartbeat. You should totally get one!!.
I'm think about it! What's the best part about having one?
Just the unconditional love, Really. They're always down to do whatever you want to do, Whether it's high energy or taking a nap.
That's sweet. Maybe i should start out with a small dog first and see how it goes.
They definitely require less exercise, But they can also live longer, So it can be a bigger commitment strangely!
Good points. Smaller dogs do live longer. I would like to have a companion that gives me unconditional love!
Dogs are for you then! I don't think I could be without one at this point. A house just doesn't feel like a home without a dog.
Do yours stay inside or are they outside dogs?

persona: I am not married. My girlfriend has a chihuahua. We are mixed race couple.
I work in the west virginia coal industry.
I enjoyed playing sport when I was younger.
dialogue: I just got a major client who I will be teaching how to play tennis. Hint, He is a famous celebrity.
That's awesome! Is he an actor or artist?

Hes and doctor turned professional tennis player. He reminds me of my spouse, As she is a doctor too and they always speak in scientific terms haha. Good guess though. I myself even player tennis professionally but I retired so now I just teach it.
Awesome, What kind of doctor is your wife?

My wife is a cardiologist, Her pay is why we can afford such a large house haha. They are an amazing type of doctor but it is truely hard to do, Hence why the paycheck is so great. She was originally a vetinerian once we got dogs but she decided to change careers pathways.
It looks like it worked out well for y'all. What type of dogs did y'all get?
Oh! We have a large family of dogs. We have 2 golden retrievers, 1 greatdane, And 2 little puppies that are of mixed breed. They are rare too. My 5 children love to play with them.
Wow, How do you and your wife manage such a large family? We can barley handle our Chihuahua haha.

Our family is nothing new to us. We were both born into large families with multiple pets, Plants, And children just running around. Our brother and sisters can atest haha. How is your chihuahua doing? And have you decided to settle down with your girlfriend yet?

persona: I am dreading the holidays.
I like watching birds with my pet cats. I spend a lot of time advocating for animal rights.
I love star wars. I dyed my hair like a rainbow for the last movie.
I am older than your grandparents.
dialogue: What do you specifically like in star wars?
I like all the cool lights and fighting scenes.
Those can be really amazing. Today is a great day for us star wars lovers. May the fourth be with you!
Yes of course! It is a great day today!
I dyed my hair half for the rebels and half for the empire today.
That's awesome! I dyed my hair like a rainbow!
Oh that brings me back to my football days. I had my hair dyed like that too. Its so much fun!
I want to grow my hair out super long. Do you think it is a good idea?
I think that would be a wonderful idea. More canvas for your next idea to dye your hair.
You are so right! My favorite color is blue.
Blue is a great color. Would you prefer a darker or more electric color?
I would like a more electric color.

persona: I eat lot of chocolates.
I am 5 years old. I like to talk.
I wish to be a dog when I grow up.
I like to play with blocks and sing the alphabet.
dialogue: What are the things does your mom shop for you?
Almost everything, I'm still very young to shop for myself.
That makes sense! I'm sure you would want to buy toys lol.
I love Lego, I love puzzles also.
What are your favorite kind of legos your mom shops for?
Starwars, Architecture, Cars. What's the name of your dog?
Star Wars is the best! His name is Rover.
Yes it is. Nice name, What breed?
He is a german shepherd husky mix.
I love German shepherd. I love dogs so much.
They are a great companion to have. Some dogs can even go shopping with their owners.
Yeah, I have seen a few with the owners while shopping with mum.

persona: I like riding hourses.
I have a fafm field.
I love rock music. My favorite band is ACDC. I like indie.
dialogue: Have you finished your preparation for winter season?
Oh yes, It's all set up. So how are you and your cats doing?

They get into everything! If I don't come home from work on time, They start knocking over things in the house. I bet you are glad your horses are outside animals... Could you just imagine?! How many horses do you own?

I have three. It's a good number in case I have friends come over and they can keep each other company. I can't imagine if they came inside, It would be a giant mess but I bet it would be cute as heck. I had cats when I was younger and it's great to have them come and sit with you. Have you ever gone riding?
I have never gone riding before. I wouln't know the first thing about it. How long have you been riding?

I rode off and on as a kid but didn't have my own horses til I was an adult. I went through that horse-crazy phase starting at about 10 and just never got out! Riding can seem scary because you're sitting up so tall but you get used to it really fast and it's great fun. I mostly ride through woods and fields, I'm not into jumping very much although we jump over stuff on the trails.
That sounds so adventorous! Do you ever take your horse out hunting, Or is that even a thing?

It's a thing, You can do either a "live hunt" where you're actually chasing after foxes/rabbits with dogs, Or you can do a hunt that uses a scent bag that's dragged along and the dogs chase that, And then you follow the dogs. I've done the scent-bag hunt a couple times but I wouldn't do the live hunt. I like foxes and rabbits too much. :) I don't think I'd hunt again though, I like riding in smaller groups and hunts are huge.
I learn something new every day! I don't think hunting would ever be my thing unless you call hunting for a great restaurant a thing. What kind of restaurant is your fave?
You know, I've eaten all kinds of food but if I had to pick one kind of restaurant for all my life it'd be a good old Southern meat-and-three restaurant. How about you?
I would choose an Asian restaurant if I had to pick just one kind. I have been wanting a bowl of Vietnamese Pho lately. I would love to travel the world just for food.

Yes, A food trip around the world would be amazing! What's your favorite kind of Pho? I like it with the little meatballs and (sorry if this is gross) the tendon in it. And alllll the condiments/toppings!

persona: I like Bach. I like rock music.
I am a farmer. I have three Arabian horses on my farm. I love riding horses.
I enjoy equestrian.
dialogue: My tractor broke down, Do you know anyone who can repair it?
I can help with that, Though my farm is mostly for my horse i do tend to some crops.
Are you sure? I'd really appreciate it! I'llmuck out your horses as a thank you.
Oh it really wouldnt be a problem. I know you love horses, How bout i let you ride one of my Arabians?
You're way too kind but I won't say no! Arabians are so beautiful it would genuinely be my honor!
Ha i knew youd like it. You will like this too, I am preforming a new routine with one of them to the music of Bach!
That sounds incredible! I can't wait to see it! Sometimes I wish I had less corn and wheat and some space of horses, But my goodness they're expensive aren't they?
Oh man are they expensive. Though id give my last cent to them if it came down to it!
That's the best way to be though. Nothing worse than seeing people with pets - especially as majestic as horses - that don't care for them properly.
I know it is heart breaking. Do you have any pets or farm animals on your farm?
A few barn cats that keep the mice away, But that's all. Maybe when I'm headed towards retirement a horse or two is a good idea!
Gotta love those barn cats. I know you wont regret getting a horse! Oh hey, Hows your sister been?

persona: I plan to buy a home next year.
I have a girlfriend. She doesn't want to have a baby.
I have a tight work schedule.
I have a thing for women who eat a lot.
I like watching movies. I like listening to music.
dialogue: My daughter just made the most beautiful art project at preschool. I'm so proud of her.
Oh how precious of her, I bet you are proud. What was her art project on?
It was of our new house! We just got a dog.
That is lovely. What type of dog breed did you get?
A golden retriever, They are great for families, Especially since I am having twins soon!
Oh i had a golden retriever growing up he was an amazing dog, Great choice for a family. I bet your excited to adding two new additions to your family, Do you know what your having yet?
Yes! A boy and a girl. Im very excited. Has your girlfriend changed her mind about children?
That amazing congratulations to you and your whole family. No not yet, We are both very focused and busy with our careers right now maybe a few years down the line she will reconsider.
What do you do for work? Something in the music field? I know you said you're a big fan of music.

I actually do work in the music industry, I work for a music label and help create the backing music for the songs, Its a very fun job to have. Music is my life for sure. Do you listen to anything other that jazz?
Thats so awesome, I would love to hear sometime. I like a lot of music such as classical and even some old rock music. I couldn't imagine doing it for a career though. I am a accountant now.

Oh for sure i will send you a demo for one i did recently for a new artist we have just gotten. Thats cool i am in to all the genres of music but nothing beats sitting down will a glass of wine listening to a bit of classical. Yeah it defiantly no a job for everyone. I did someone course of accounting in college for extra credits it was good but musics my passion. How do you like being an accountant?

persona: I live in a city. I used to live in Canada. My home is surrounded by buildings.
I vacation is South Carolina. I don't like Florida or California.
dialogue: Do you have any plans to vacation to South Carolina soon? We should meet up there sometime!
Yeah, Thinking towards the end of the year.
That's pretty cool. Georgia isn't very far away, And I'd love to get out of here for a little bit.
Why don't you like it there? I heard they have cool weather over there.
Georgia is one of the least friendly gambling states, So I have to leave just to have fun.
Oh, That's pretty understandable. Do you play poker?
I really love black jack but also gamble on things like horses from time to time? Did Canada have a lot of gambling opportunities?
Well I wouldn't know, I suck at gambling, So I don't bother trying.
Haha, I can understand that. The trick is to never gamble something you're not willing to use.
That's true, I find myself always tryingt recover loses and end up losing more. I just had to stop before I get addicted.
That's the danger. I've seen a few who go too far in my time. So, How's the city life?
Pretty much same, Loud, Meeting different type of people daily.

persona: I teach elementary school, like my parents did.
I love board games.
My favourite band is up, I've been to a concert of theirs.
dialogue: Do you teach the same grade as either of your parents?
Yes! I teach the 3rd grade, But I've been considering going to older grades. Just how diverse is your music taste?
I enjoy everything from classical to heavy metal! I am not familiar with up but they are probably great. Have you seen them in concert?

That is pretty diverse. I have seen them in concert, They're one of those bands that sounds just as good in person, I can't wait to go to more! I think you'd like them, Considering your music taste. How is your studies going?
If they are performing near me, I will try to see their show! My studies are going well and I am working on my thesis. What is your favorite subject to teach?
What is your thesis covering? I love teaching all subjects, But I'd have to say I love teaching reading the most.

I am writing about non-verbal communications. Its probably something you could use with your students! Kids are great at communicating without words. I agree that reading is a great subject. I read a lot of science journals. What do you have your students read?

Well, Besides their textbooks, I have a little reading area with nonfiction and fiction books. I let them choose, And they seem to gravitate toward fictional fairy tales and sci-fi far more than factual writings, But that's normal. What type of science journals do you read? You're very intellectually stimulating to talk to!

persona: I don't have children but do have horses. My job is working on my family farm. Our farm has sheep, cows, and pigs on the way besides the horses.
I like rock music.
I am looking for ideas to help my horses. I feed my horses mix of grain and grass.
dialogue: I found some new classical songs that you may like for your horses.
Oh that's great thanks, Who is the artist?
The artist is Mozart. Have you heard of him?
Oh yes, I have heard of him of course! I usually listen to more rock but I'm sure my horses would appreciate it.
Who are some of your favorite rock artists?
Oh I like the classics but my favourite artist at the moment is Greta van Fleet.
I love Greta Van Fleet! Highway Tune is my jam.
That's so cool, I love that one. Got any plans with the kids tonight?
They keep me on my toes. I am doing a puzzle with them tonight.
That sounds fun, My horses are like my children haha! What did you make for dinner?
I made chicken and rice.
Noveg? I thought that was your bag! I've been growing all sorts on the farm.

persona: I'm a farmer that grows crops. My father is a farmer.
I like pizza.
I like music, especially rock music.
I have three Arabian horses. I prefer horses to cars. I don't get sore from riding my horse.
dialogue: I was about to make a burger but my boyfriend came home early from work lol.
What did your boyfriend want you to eat today?

Just a salad, Nothing else. Though I should say ex-boyfriend, Since we finally broke up. Some friends have been showing me how abusive and controlling his rules about my food habits were, And I finally ended it.
Oh wow are you still living together with your boyfriend? I really like to eat a salad with fresh vegetables from my farm but it could be topped with a burger and it would be a burger salad.

No, I'm moving in with some friends for the short term and I'm gonna figure something out in the future. It's for the best though, I hadn't been attracted to him for a while, And I might actually ask out a girl I like a bit more, Though I'm still shell shocked from this break up. And I think eating is about balance, You can have a burger one day and a salad the next.

It is good to wait some time before moving on even though it sounds like you already knew it was time to end it. It must be hard to have to move though. Yes food can be delicious and healthy at the same time, I really likeveggie burgers.

Veggie burgers are great! These are the kind of options I wanted to be able to eat, And now I can. Relationship control is so hard to see until you get out of the relationship. It is hard, But II have good friends who care about me. I will say that while I've always identified as bisexual, This relationship has really killed my interest in men. Maybe I'll start identifying as Lesbian going forward, Because I doubt I'd date another man.

There are so many options now with both vegan options and relationship status. You really don't have to identify as anything anymore just be you. As long as you are happy with yourself how you identify shouldn't matter. I took a seminar on equality the other day it was very interesting there were so many terms I wasn't even aware of in the LGBQT++ community.
Thank you, That really means a lot! It helps to hear that. How was the seminar? What did you learn?

The seminar was about equality but it was put on by some members of the LGBQT community. It was very interesting learning about people's experiences. Things are changing with the new generation they no longer identify as attracted to one specific gender and in the future things will change people will like people for who they are not what they identify as. I also learned that it is easy to make people feel more comfortable buy putting unisex bathroom signs on single stall bathrooms so people don't have to decide if they are male or female.

persona: I have never been to Alaska.
I often feel isolated.
I practice meditation.
I received a heart transplant. I have telekinesis.
dialogue: I was thinking a lot about your special abilities. When did you first discover you could move things?

I discovered telekinesis after years of hard meditation and the receiving og my heart transplant. After the life changing altercation I know I was a special person and meant to be something. I started practicing for years and years. With telekinesis it takes time, But it is a crazy ability to have.
It's an awesome ability to have. With some training you could become an actual super hero that fights crime. How often do you meditate?

I meditate everyday and before that I have to go a few minutes without speaking to anyone. I remember yesterday you said you have not spoke with anyone in 3 months. Why is that? Does it help your meditation skills. Lol and im the first person you spoke to in that three month period?

I haven't spoke to anyone because i've been in a remote part of Alaska living in a cabin. It has helped my meditation skills. And your the 3rd personive spoken too. I called my Mom and Dad to give them an update.

WOah interesting, I have never been to Alaska in my life at all. I Often feel isolated myself and sometimes dont feel great mentally. I am glad I am the 3rd person you have spoken to. Do you have a job in alaska? Why did you quit your last one?
Sorry to hear that, Alaska is a nice place to find yourself. I quit my last job because i got tired at working in customer service. I am going to start at an Oil Well in 3 weeks.
Yeah I heard Alaska pursues a lot of sprituality. Whats that about? That is one of the most interesting places I have ever heard of for that reason alone!
It beautiful and the climate is just relaxingduing the summer. Idreccomend it sometime.
How does Alaska affect sprituality? Will it increase my spirtuality if I stay there?
I feel more at peace and i think the reason for that is because when you are there living in nature you have no worries at all. Your real world problems just seem to disappear.
I might have to go to Alaska it sounds like a great place to be at. Do you suggest any certain places or spots to go there?

persona: I am a teacher. I am a woman.
I exercise. I have dogs:one is a hound, one is a pitbull.
dialogue: One of my outdoor cats went missing!
Oh no!!! What can I do to help? Have you put up flyers?
Yes, Some of the people at the soup kitchen and I made some flyers and posted them at several places. Oh I'm just beside myself. How are your pups? I hope they are all accounted for!
They are - right in my sight sound asleep on the sofa. I bet that you are besides yourself with worry. Can I call aournd at the shelters for you?
I've already been calling and they have her picture. Little claws has people looking out for her. I greatly appreciate your willingness to help! It sure is a comforting feeling!

I just know that if I was in your postion, I would want all the help I could get until my baby came home. I feel so badlya nd can only pray she makes it home safely. Maybe you can watch the other cat and see if it leads you on a trail to her?
Possibly, That's a great idea! Well, Besides all that excitement, How.
How am I? Doing good, Ready for the school year to be over. As a retired teacher, I am sure that you know that feeling!

Yes, That's exactly what I was going to ask you! Sorry I hit the return button on accident! Oh Lord yes! I can totally relate! It can be a little overwhelming towards the end of the year! But the most exciting part about it getting ready for a new group of kiddos!
I'll be excited about it after the summer break :).
I always was excited and ready to teach! You meet some interesting characters teaching... Some can be a little tough to break but I've always had a way with the tough kids@.
I so enjoy seeing their faces light up when they totally get what I am teaching them.

persona: My name is Blob. I like to eat raw. I recently bought a house.
I like the Rolling Stones.
I am an economics major. I am thinking about going back to school for another degree. I like economics. I am interested in studying science.
dialogue: I'll be singing at a music festival next week. You should come!
That sounds cool! I may have to go, But I am a little money conscious right now because of the house...
Oh boy, Yes! You know, Before you buy a house you think "I buy the house and move in and maybe do some painting" but I found out the hard way it's never that simple! What kind of a house did you buy?
Yep! Well, The economy was right, So I was able to get the dream house; a mountain lodge! You'll have to see it sometime if you roll through on tour!
Oh I'd love to! How big is it? What kind of decor are you doing? I love the mountains so I bet it's a beautiful property!
It's a two story, But the top is like a loft. Not a huge foot print, But cozy. Still lots of decorating left to do. I'm thinking rustic.
Probably good for a lodge. And nice solid wood furniture will last you a long time! So how is your school going?
Just in the planning phase for now, But it would be great to learn about something I'm passionate about. Are you in school?
No, I'm done with school. I majored in History and Anthropology because I love learning about people. Are you still thinking about trying a science?
Yes, Something in the ecology field. I think we share a love when it comes to nature and the parks!
I think you might be right! Do you like Great Smoky Mountains National Park?
Isn't that at least partially in Tennessee? I love the Smokies! Gatlinburg is a great place to vacation, And not too far from the Nashville music scene either.

persona: I work for myself. My job is walking dogs. I have three dogs.
I think scorpions are scary.
My dad was a door-to-door salesman.
I'm not really into makeup.
dialogue: I've been doing a lot of relaxing and TV watching today since I'm off work.
That's great, What have you been watching.
Been watching the NASCAR races. Man do i love it.
Sounds interesting. I haven't seen it.
I grew up in it, I think i told you my dad was a driver. Hows the dog walking going?
Well, I can't complain about it. Some dogs are just pretty stubborn, Some days I have so much fun other days stressed out.
Yeah i guess it can be like that for anything. At least you are doing what you love though.
Yeah, You are right. speaking about jobs, You said the last time your job is stressful, Why is it?
Oh well with all the cuts from last year, We have to do 3 peoples work. Delivering mail has never been so hard.
Sorry about that, I won't say I understand how you feel completely though.
Its ok its just a bit frustating, Ill live heh. Oh i know we talked about being afraid of scorpions, But did i ever tell you the time my dad had to drive with one in his car!
Yeah, I'm pretty scare of scorpions, Lol. No you didn't tell me about your Dad.

persona: I love sports. My parents are athletic.
I speak another language.
I love running in marathons.
I eat without slurping or making a mess.
I am a life coach.
dialogue: Are you planning on running in any marathons soon?
Yes, I'm training for one right now that I'll run on Memorial Day! I'm looking forward to it. I'll probably take off for a few months after that because of the heat.
Oh Wow! I hope you have a great time. Is it for any particular cause?
Yes, This one is to support homeless Veterans. I try to pick good causes when I run but I do non-charity runs too sometimes. Do they do similar marathons where you're from?
That is an amazing cause! Yes, We have several around here each year.
That's great! I know your sport is pingpong, But have you ever thought about trying running? It's a little hard to get started but it's fun once you're used to it.
I'd really like to but I have some weak ankles. Any tips to get started?

Yes, You should see a podiatrist/foot doctor before you start. They can give you insoles for your shoes that adjust the way you step to make your ankles stronger. After that, Look online for something like couch to 5K. It starts you out very slowly so you don't wear yourself out too early.
Oh ok! Thank you for the tips. I kind of thought I may need to see a doctor but to be honest I was trying to avoid it.

I know, It's a pain to go to the doctor. I had to get insoles myself because I have a really high arch and get plantar fasciitis. Once you go though you'll scold yourself for not doing it sooner, I did!
That gives me hope! I really think I have a case of plantar fasciitis myself. Sometimes its so hard to get up and get moving.
Oh, Especially with plantar fasciitis! The insoles will definitely help. Also you can stretch your toes back toward you for a while before you get out of bed in the morning and that helps.

persona: I'm a professional wrestler.
I've never done a marathon but I'm open to the idea.
I help out at the homeless shelter. I find helping at the shelter to be very fulfilling. I spend most of my time with my job and helping people.
I feel I couldn't be a vegetarian. I like beans I just can't eat many of them.
dialogue: I've been making some really great vegetarian recipes lately if you'd like me to share them with you.
That sounds great since its hard for me to think of vegetarian foods I could make.
Great! I'll email them to you. Also, I think that you could double and triple the recipes to serve at the shelter. Beans can go a long way.
Yeah it's always nice to have new recipes to serve at the shelter maybe I will suggest it next I help out.
Doesn't hurt to make a suggestion, For sure. I bet that you meet a ton of interesting people at the shelter and while wrestling.
Yep there is always interesting stories and you get to meet a lot of different people. How has your training been going for your first marathon?
Gruling for sure. The first few miles are rough and then you get into a rythm. But towards the end, I'm feeling it for sure!
That sounds tough but I would be open to the idea of running a marathon especially if its for an important cause.
The marathon I am training for is to support a local dog rescue group. My husband has done 3 already this year, So I figured I can train and get this done!!.
That sounds like great motivation knowing that you will be helping something you care about.
Exactly... Helps to keep me motivated for sure!!.
I imagine your husband has been a great source of motivation too since he has done 3 marathons this year.

persona: I love horror movies.
My father once worked at Home Depot.
I work in a human service field.
My son is a junior in high school and he is 14.
I've been here awhile. I'm not that old. I'm married.
dialogue: My job is getting busy and stressful, But I'm still enjoying it.
What do you do at the high school. I am sure that environment is very hectic!

I am a library aid, So I help the head librarian plan and run activities for various groups at the school along with regular library duties like checking out and shelving books. My favorite part of the job is helping the students with research; you learn so many interesting things.
That sounds really nice. It is nice to make a difference. That's why I like human resources - to help people.

I've always been pretty introverted, So at first having to interact with so many high-schoolers was intimidating, But now I find myself looking forward to them coming to me for help. I guess my love for helping people bloomed late; have you always been a people person?
I think so. I used to visit my dad at Home Depot and watch him help everyone. I guess it rubbed off on me. I try to teach it to my kid.

That's a lovely lesson to be teaching your child! For me it's been the opposite; my stepson has been guiding me towards being a more helpful person. Our bond is one I never thought I'd have, But now that he's in my life, I don't know what I'd do without him.
That is so wonderfu. I treasure the relationship I have with my child. Although now that he is in high school I am no longer cool.

I'm sure once he leaves home, You'll be the first person he calls whenever he needs help or advice. I've been pleasantly surprised by how wonderful the majority of high-shcoolers are; they certainly don't deserve the bad reputation that so many teenagers are stuck with.
They do get a bad rap at times, But it is not their fault. You cannot generalize everyone.
I agree! I see these young people performing kind acts every day; it's really uplifting.
I like uplifting things. Well, Except for movies. The scarier, The better, For those.

persona: I have cats.
Winter is my favourite season.
I like vanilla ice cream.
I collect hats.
I like ice skating, but am not very good at it.
My favourite movie is Blair Witch 2.
dialogue: What kind of cats do you have?

I have one Russian Blue male and the rest are all plain domestic shorthairs. One is an orange male, One is a black female, And one is an absolutely enormous 20-pound tabby male. How is your job search going? Are you looking for a medical job?
Wow that's so many! How do they get along? My job search its going well, I got a couple of offers from doctor's offices. My wife got a job though, So our financial situation its less volatile.

They all get along really well, They've been together since they were very young. They're all former strays. Three of them (the shorthairs) are all sixteen so it's like a kitty nursing home in here sometimes, Haha. I'm glad the job search is going well, And that the financial situation is more stable. It's so stressful to be short of money!

Good on you for rescuing strays! Are you going to rescue more, Since some are getting older? And it is such a relief. I was worried we were gonna have to explain to your daughters why her moms were so stressed, But I think she doesn't know we were broke for a bit. She is too young to have to hear about family budget issues.

We are going to try to take some time off from cats for a bit after... Well, You know. Nature takes its course. Vet bills for older cats are expensive since they need to go more often and need more testing. We're considering getting a puppy. Our two dogs now are rescues, But I had a Basset Hound that I raised from puppyhood til she died at 15, And I'm finally at the point where I can handle having another. I think it's a good idea to not let your daughter know about the money issues. Kids can really internalize stuff like that as being "their fault" somehow.

Yeah I can imagine it gets hard when they get old. A puppy might be a nice change of pace! We've been thinking about getting a kitten for our daughter now that life is more balanced out. And I agree, kids don't need to reach adulthood too early.
Kittens are great. I think they're actually better for kids than puppies sometimes because kittens will be more companionate and they're easier to care for - no walking!
Oh definitely! They're also more self sufficient, so we don't need to constantly provide a kitten with attention.

Yes. And may I suggest, If you get two, It's not that much more expensive than one once shots are over with, And if the family is out for the day or on a weekend trip they can keep each other company.

That sounds smart. I've heard that cats do prefer to live together as bonded pairs, So once I choose which doctor's office I'm going to join and find my salary, We may look into getting two. It is. Weird being an out of work doctor, But it does mean that once I get a job back we'll have more than enough money. My wife is making enough right now as a professor, But I want us to be financially comfortable.
What field of medicine are you in, And what does your wife teach? My husband is a librarian at a university.

persona: I like board games. I like monopoly.
My cousin teaches high school students.
I love music. I prefer live music.
dialogue: I took my class to a museum for a field trip.
Oh that's so fun! What kind of museum did you take them to?
We went to our local children's museum. They have a lot of neat hands on activities. They have a science section and a physic section.

That's awesome! I bet they had a blast and learned a whole bunch too! My husband and I went to our local science museum last year and really enjoyed it. So, Have you planned your beach vacation for this year yet?
They loved it! They're already asking to go back. I can't lie I can't wait to go back either. No I haven't yet.

I would be the same way! Do you always vacation at the same beach, Or go to different areas each year? My favorite beaches on on the Outer Banks in NC. Have you ever been? Some are so secluded, And you can drive a 4wheel drive vehicle on them with a pass! It's very fun!!.
The Outer Banks is my favorite place to go on vacation on the beach. I also like the florida panhandle very much.

Right?! It's the best! I've never been to a Florida panhandle beach before. Actually the only beach I think I've ever been on in Florida was in Miami. It was beautiful though. I want to plan a trip to FL for next March. Swimming with the manatees is a dream of mine. Have you ever done that?
No, I haven't but Ive always wanted to swim with dolphins. I've been to Miami but not to the beach.

I'd love to swim with dolphins too... Hopefully some day I'll get to! Oh - I wanted to tell you... My last game of monopoly lasted for 3 hours!!!! It was insane. But, Good news! I found a Monopoly card game that is so much fun. I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys Monopoly! You can run thru an entire game in like 15 minutes, And it is just like playing actual Monopoly. Have you ever heard of such a thing?!.
Oh my gosh that sounds fun! How do you play the card game? It sounds like it would be very fun for a group of friends or during a birthday party.

It is very fun with a group, And even with just 2 people. It's called Monopoly Deal. The instructions are pretty simple and easy to learn quickly. I got it from Amazon for like $8. Definitely worth it! I've gotta run for now though. It was great catching up with you again, And I hope we can chat again real soon! Say hi to those 3rd graders for me! Lol.

persona: I am a part-time waitress.
I like to ride my motorbike. I have  a shiny, striped, red and blue helmet.
I don't like pizza. I have big, brown eyes. My skin is light.
I like eating watermelons.
I don't like to act unladylike.
dialogue: What type of restaurant do you waitress at?
I waitress at Jeff Ruby's Steakhouse. Wow 33 brothers that must of been insane growing up.
I love steak! Yes, My home was always full of testosterone and stinky socks, But I love each and everyone of them dearly. Do you have any siblings?
I have 2 brothers they may get on my nerves but i love them so much! They will always look out for me. The watermelons on your head remind me of a Marlon Webb Vine.

It is a joke, Well, Sort of about the watermelons on my head. I ate watermelon one 4th of July and after drinking too much beer, I put an empty rind on my head and walked around for a few hours looking like an idiot. I did make many people laugh that day so it was worth it. Who or what is Marlon Webb Vine?
Vine is a social media platform between 2014 and 2016 Marlon Webb is a influencer on the app.
Oh! Thanks for letting me know. I will check out the app. I need to start wearing a helmet and I was wondering where you bought your shiny red and blue one?
The app doesn't exist anymore unfortunately but TikTok is an alternative today. I got mine off Amazon.
I will check out Amazon for the helmet and I really like TikTok. It is a fun way to spend a bit of time. I work 2 jobs so my free time is limited!
Tiktok is great but it takes up so much of my time. Who's your favorite Rap artist.

persona: I like dog memes.
I prefer pizza to tacos. I think anchovies are yummy.
I'm a professional wrestler.
dialogue: My brother came over the other day. He's considering getting a dog. He got inspired by all the dog memes I've been sharing with him.
We've finally won him over to the dog side.
I read the task instructions, I'm ready for the chat.
What are you talking about?
Well, I said my brother is planning to get a dog.
Yeah you mentioned. Any idea what breed he plans on getting?
Might get a Shiba. Cuz all i shared with him areDOGE memes.
Cool. Do share pictures when he get the dog.
Will do. Maybe i'll create meme templates from our dog next time. So, You still haven't told me the craziest pro wrestling moment yet!
There are lots of moments to share, I'll tell you all when we see.
Okay. You have any idea on adopting any dogs?
It's a pretty simple process, Just visit an animal shelter.

persona: I am 34 years old. I am from Alaska.
I am unemployed. I practice Buddhism. I like to meditate.
dialogue: Meditation looks like it has a lot of benefits. I might look into starting it.
Yes, It's very calming. Being able to center yourself every so often is good for your mind. How are your law studies going?
I'll definitely try it then. They're going well, Being pre-law is hard, But my girlfriend and I study together which makes everything easier. Are you in a relationship?

Not right now. I left a long-term relationship a year ago. No fighting or anything, We just grew apart. I'm kind of enjoying being single and just having friends I hang out with. Sometimes relationships seem like too much drama.

Yeah that's understandable, Though I love being in a relationship. Growing up I went to a religious private school, And being gay was very hard there, So I love that I can be out and in a relationship in college.
Oh my gosh, Yes, I'm sure it must have been rough. I'm so glad you have a place you can blossom now! Have you two ever traveled out of Australia together?

No, But we plan to take a trip during the upcoming winter break, Which I guess is summertime for you Americans. My parents are actually helping cover the costs, Which is nice. They've changed so much and even left the church since I was in High School. I'm so grateful they chose to love their daughter, Me, Over an imaginary man in the sky, And I think paying for this trip is their way to apologize for the years of not being great parents.

It's so good to hear that! Parents can sometimes lose sight of what really matters in their anxiety for their child to turn out whatever they consider "well". Where will you travel? If you come to the US I can really recommend the Southeast. I'm considering moving there at some point. It's a bit cold up here!

Thanks! Also isn't the entire country basically the southeast for you lol? I bet anywhere is warmer than Alaska. We're actually going to London! I love Britain, And. My girlfriend adores theatre, So we thought why not go see shows on the West End and hang out in the UK.
Haha yes! I think even though I was born here I'm just not an Alaska girl. I'll bet you'll really enjoy London and the West End. One day I'll visit the UK. I'd love to see Scotland myself.
Where would you move specifically though? I can see not wanting to stay where you grew up. And I'll let you know how the trip goes, And if I have any recommendations of must do stuff.

I've visited Charleston and Savannah, And I really liked Savannah. The weather is *definitely* a change from here though, Summers are quite hot and sticky. I love that the city has a lot of historical buildings, Restaurants, Etc and I love Low Country food. I'd love to hear your recommendations! How long will you stay there.

persona: I play guitar and violin.
I like chocolate bars.
I hate roller coasters.
I am an electrician. My dad is an electrician.
I am learning to speak Chinese. I would love to visit China.
dialogue: Something happened at the bar yesterday I think you would find interesting.
Oh yeah? Do tell! Something interesting always happens to you!
A guy walks in. He was only speaking Spanish and didn't know I could understand him. Turns out he's a huge movie star in Spain. I got a picture and an autograph.
Oh wow that is so cool and exciting! What did he order?
Just a beer! Sometimes we think these guys are so different but they are just like us... Wanted a cool beer to relax. Have you ever met someone who was famous with your work as an electrician?

I haven't met anyone famous per se.. But I have met a lot of interesting people! For example I met an elderly man who worked on the apollo 11 mission! I got to see all his memorabilia. It was fascinating.
Wow, That is so interesting. I think I would like that better than a movie star. He must have had some good stories.
Yeah it is such a unique experience! I feel lucky that I got to work on his house! I would like to get him a beer! When are you working next? I wanna stop by.
I have a while. I am going on an adventure trip first. I can't wait.
You are such an adrenaline junkie! Where are you off to this time?
I am going to hike some mountains. They are really tall.
Oh cool! Anything in particular you are excited to see while hiking? Like animals or sites?

persona: I like photography.
I live in my parent's house. I am moving. I have a boyfriend.
I speak English, French, and Spanish. I teach languages. I am an elementary school teacher.
I have a studio in my new apartment.
dialogue: How did the move to your new apartment go?
It went as good as it could go.

Moving is never easy, I completely understand that now. Since we last spoke, I too moved out of my parents' house and into my own apartment. It's just a little place, But I love that it's my own! Is your boyfriend living with you now?

That's awesome that you were able to move out of your parent's house. It's such a good feeling to get out on your own. He's not living with me yet, He still has his own place. We will probably end up living together at some point.

Very cool. I'm really enjoying living alone, But that's not to say I wouldn't mind getting a boyfriend at some point in the future. I was promoted to the District Manager at Burger King, So I'm moving up in the world! How are the kids you're teaching this year? I want to learn a new language... Just not sure which one. Lol.

Grats on the promotion at work. Are you still at the Burger King downtown or did they move you? This school year has been pretty good. I seem to have lots of eager learners this time, Which I always appreciate. I think you should pick a language that you like or one that you might be able to use?

I'm at the headquarters in the city now. Got my own company vehicle and an office with windows that overlook the river! That's great that your kids are eager to learn. That must make teaching them SO much easier! I'm thinking about Spanish... I could definitely use that while communicating with employees in the locations I manage. Is it a difficult language to learn? Do you think those audio-type lessons are any good?

Wow, It sounds like you are doing really well! As far as learning a language goes, The most effective way to do is to immerse yourself into the language. The best way is to spend some time in the country where the language is spoken. Don't be afraid to test out your skills with the locals.

Oh how amazing would a trip to Mexico or even Spain be!? I could go for that! Maybe we should plan one for the summer when you're off work! Then you could coach me with speaking to the locals in Spanish! Sounds like a good plan, Right?
That sounds like a lot of fun. It would be my pleasure to coach you on speaking with the locals. I think Spain would be a better choice. It's lovely there.
Great thanks! I'll start researching the trip and email you the ideas I come up with! I've gotta run for now. But it was great catching up with you and I look forward to chatting again real soon!
Yes, So much fun talking with you again! Have a great day!!!.

persona: I live in a small farming community in Indiana.
I have a German shepherd. I like coloring books.
I like hockey.
I like to play blackjack.
dialogue: I also enjoy blackjack. I like playing with the professional set.
Ah, You must play better than I then! No way I could play with the pro set. What's your favorite kosher meal?
It's an awesome game. We should play sometime, I could give you some tips.
That would be great, I hear there's actually quite a bit of money to be made at it. I don't know if I could gamble for "real" money though, It's a bit unnerving!
Yeah if you know the right people and communities then big money can change hands. Do you have a farm out in Indiana or are you just apart of the community?

I have a small farm. It's more like a house on a piece of land, I don't grow crops except for a vegetable garden. I have a few horses and some dogs (my German Shepherd and a Basset puppy I just got a bit ago). It's a nice community to live in even if I have to drive a while for "city stuff" like shopping and restaurants.
Is there a card/gambling community there too is it is mainly just farming? Who do you normally play cards with?

There's not really a card or gaming community. Mainly just farming but a few friends and I get together and play sometimes. It's really just goofing off, We play for chips with no money behind it. So what kind of books have you read lately? I've started reading and I've found some non-fiction books I like.

persona: I like running.
I just got a new job.
I am from Miami. I like to eat clean.
I like to eat salad and meat. My parents were athletic.
dialogue: Have you started the new job?
Yeah I have, I've just started as a car valet at one of the top Casio's in town.
That is exciting! I bet you get to drive some pretty awesome cars! What is your favorite one so far?
On my first night I had a few Bentleys and some other cars such as Ferrari's. It was cool yet quite nerve wracking at the same time. Don't want to damage anything.
Do you have to pay if you do damage or do they keep insurance for you? I would be terrified! I'd also be tempted to take it around the block and see how fast I could get those sports cars going!

The valet company have their own insurance that covers us staff but it would still be bad news if were were to damage anything. I definitely won't be taking any cars around the block as tempting as it would be, The tips are to good to be doing that.
Yeah I don't think I'd want to do that and risk losing my job! I'm sure the people that drive cars like that tip excellent! Have you gone on any good runs lately?

Yeah it only takes one person to have a successful night in the casino to normally land you a nice tip at the end of their night when you hand them their car back. I've not been on many runs lately as I'm arriving back from my job quite early in the morning so that's affected my sleep pattern lately. How are your new shoes? Are they super comfy after wearing them for a few days?

Yeah, I'm finally getting past that breaking in period where you just have to push through them being uncomfortable. Hopefully you can get back on a good sleep schedule and get some running in soon! I'm sure you miss it!

That's good, Always nice when shoes eventually feel like a good pair of slippers. I'll definitely get back on it once my body adjusts to it's new body-clock. I was so close to a new personal best too, And it just makes me feel great.

Do you ever run any marathons? I don't know how people can do that! I wish I had that kind of stamina! I always tell people, If you see me running, You should run too, Because something is chasing us!

persona: I go to concerts. I perform at concerts. I like to relax.
I grew up in the music industry.
My favorite song is You Will Never Leave Harlan Alive.
I walk two miles with my daughter every morning and evening. I have four children.
I make my own apple wine.
dialogue: I got Darrell Scott's latest album yesterday. What do you think of his Hank Williams covers?
Oh my god I love them! I never thought you could do better than Hank Williams but I think I was wrong! Did you have a nice dance to the music with your wife?
Yes and we enjoyed some wine with it as well. How is your latest batch of apple wine coming along?

Great, Sounds like a lovely evening :) It's coming along really well actually, Next time you're over you can take a few bottles - it's quite strong though so be careful! Did you manage to get to the gym this morning?
Yes I did, Still haven't gotten my walk in for the day. How was your walk this morning???????????????????.

You should walk to the gym, Then it would be 2 birds with one stone! It was great, Really nice to see my daughter looking so well - she's not got long left before she has the baby :) When was the last time you saw your kids?
Sorry for all the extra question marks, My keyboard got stuck. My kids were home at Christmas and I probably won't see them until then. Does your daughter know what she is having?

Haha that's ok, Not like we have to worry about the amount of characters like the old days! Do you not miss your kids? I wouldn't be able to only see them once a year - it would break my heart! She's having triplets, But we don't know the gender of any of them yet :) want it to be a surprise! Do you have any grandchildren?

Yes i have two grandchildren, Two boys. It is hard only seeing them once a year, We are thinking of moving closer to them once I retire. Triplets is exciting, I'm sure she is glad that you will be close to help.

Oh that will be nice, You will be roped into babysitting duties all of the time though! It's so exciting - weirdly there must be a gene in the family as her mum is one of triplets, And her mum before that was aswell!!.
I have heard that multiples runs in the family. I can't wait to babysit!
I suppose now you're older you're not out all evening anymore anyway, So would be nice to have the children for company :).

persona: I am a student. I enjoy school. I want to go to law school. I am engaged.
We built a home on my family's farm. My family has over 5000 acres. The farm has been in the family for generations. We have been on the farm for 200 years.
We have a food plot. We have cattle, sheep and pigs.
dialogue: We had an exam in my economics class and I scored the highest grade of the class.
Oh wow! How hard did you study for it?
Yes, I spent hours at it. Evert minute I wasn't doing farm chores, I was studying.
I am glad your hard work paid off! What are you going to do to celebrate?
I think we will go out to eat. I want to have a big special meal. Did you have an engagement party when you got engaged?
Yeah! We rented a cabin out on a lake and had all our close friends come party! It was a lot of fun! What about you?
We didn't have one, But we did have a big wedding. It was at the farm. We set up a big tent. Are you getting married at the farm?
We are! We will be the fifth family member to be married on the family farm. I feel so lucky!
That is so sweet. There is nothing like getting married outside under the blue skies and the sun. Will you be having a big wedding?
Massive! We both have huge families and a ton of friends to invite! It is going to be a huge affair!
Wow. That is what is good about the farm. It can be as big as you want it as long asy ou get a big tent. Do you serve the food from the farm? That is what we did.
Yeah we will probably have a BBQ style buffet using our own stock. It's crazy how much work goes into planning a wedding! No wonder there is such a huge industry behind it.

persona: My favorite watch is the Rolex. My favorite thing is to go shopping for watches and shoes. I work for a watch dealer.
I am a girl. I like shopping.
My family doesn't want me to work for a watch dealer.
My dream car is the rolls royce ghost car.
dialogue: Have you been shopping lately?
I went shopping last week.
What did you purchase?
I bought a new watch. Have you been shopping lately?
Yeah i went to the grocery store and bought some groceries. What watch did you buy?
I bought a new Fossil watch. I like going to the grocery store, Do you shop at Kroger?
Yeah Kroger is my favorite place to go. I know where everything is and they have everything i enjoy for a good price. What watch dealer do you work at?
I work for an independent store, We sell most of the name brands, Josh's, Have you heard of it?
I have not. But i do have a question for you. I am looking for a watch that is nice but something casual that goes with everything. What brand would you recommend?
I love Fossil watches, They are timeless. They look great with jeans and a tee-shirt or dressed up for the office.
What color strap and face would be great for casual wear?
I prefer the silver watches. I just think they are so versatile.

persona: My name is Sophie.
I love the movie Frozen. I like to sing along with movies.
I just started 3rd Grade. I write poetry. I write about Mickey Mouse. I go to Disney World every year with my family.
My Favorite football team is the Steelers.
dialogue: Ok, I finally got around to streaming Frozen. You're right, It's great!
I told you. What was your favourite scene?
I liked the scene where Olaf was singing about being a snowman and when its spring he'll turn into a puddle.
LOL. That is a great scene. I love how he just doesn't know what summer is. He's such a funny character. There is Frozen 2 now. That's good aswell.
I watched Frozen 2 shortly after it was a great movie. What is your favorite attraction at Disney World?
I'll be honest, I like walking around and seeing the characters and just generally being in the place. My family loves it and I love the family vibe there.
I have been there a few times I enjoy the Star Wars park. I even built my own lightsaber there. Why is the Steelers your favorite team?
That's easy. It's the team my dad always followed so that's my team now too. It's funny how that happens but to be expected I suppose. Do you follow football?
I do follow Football, The Houston Texans are my favorite team.
Cool. Do you watch all their games?
Not always because im typically busy but when i do i usually host a cookout at my house.
I love family gatherings and love to spend time seeing my friends, Especially in summer.

persona: I enjoy traveling.
I go to college and am majoring in Art. I enjoy painting still lifes. I love food.
