I am of Italian heritage.
I like to collect things like shoes and lingerie.
I am a dog person, especially big dogs.
dialogue: Are you able to have dogs at your college?
No, I do not have enough money to be able to commit to owning a dog... But I do foster dogs from time to time!
Oh cool! Are you able to find the time to paint and foster dogs at the same time?
Yes they are often my subjects! How are your kitties doing?
They're brilliant thanks, They're really growing recently, One became one year old a short time ago! So cute seeing them grow up.
Aww! Did you have a cat birthday party?
Haha yes I did actually. I got some nice biscuits for her and made a cake... She had some of the cream from the middle!
That sounds too cute! I have seen "wine for cats" before and I have always wanted to share it with some cats at a party.
Damn I should have got some! I've seen it before and it seems like a gimmick but a fun one.
Yeah I feel like whenever I buy cute gifts for my friend's cats they never end up liking them! \.
Haha I know the feeling. You can buy as many toys as you want but the cat will always prefer a cardboard box!
Too true! Next cat birthday party I am invited to I am just going to bring a bunch of empty boxes!

persona: I prefer comedies over horror movies.
I enjoy living alone. I am retired. I have a cat.
I have had cancer.
I like sitting around at home.
dialogue: The horror movie was great and I'd like to tell you about it.
Go ahead! Im curious to hear about this movie.
It was about a Nun, It is part of the Conjuring series I think. There were quite a few jump scares in it.
I've heard about that movie. I personally wouldn't watch it since i live alone. But who do you watch these movies with?
I sometimes watch them with my boyfriend but he doesn't like them much. I just have to wait for my kid to go to sleep first LOL.
How old is your kid?
He is three, Going on 13.
Is he 3 or 13? I am a little confused here.
That basically means he is three with the attitude of a 13 year old, That is quite a popular saying.
Gotcha, I have never heard that saying but i bet a lot of parents say that. How long have you been dating your boyfriend?

LOL, That's OK. Yeah it's basically a reflection of how fast they seem to grow up these day! We have been together for a few ears now. He is OK but not really an active person. I think he needs more hobbies!
Haha what type of hobbies do you think he may be interested in?

persona: I enjoy eclectic music.
I help rescue bunnies. I love bunnies. I donate to a bunny charity.
I tried to learn C a long time ago, but could not understand it.
dialogue: Rescue any bunnies lately? Can I see some pictures?

Yes there was lovely fluffy white one with a dark brown stripe that came in the other day. Sorry I don't have any pictures did you know bunny's don't like to be photographed? I wish we could set up a webcam and watch them all day.
I had no idea bunnies didn't like to be photographer. Why don't they like to have their pictures taken?

I don't know why they don't like to scientifically but they can't seem to sit still. I don't think they like the camera lights. I don't really like to get my picture taken so I can relate. Are there bunnies in India?
I live in the city, So I don't see much in the way of wildlife around here. You can see a few at the zoo or a pet store.
Oh yes we have special places for bunnies here they are not in the streets. There are squirrels everywhere outside though. Do people in the city have house pets there?

Yes, Small house pets are popular. Many people care for hamsters, Reptiles and amphibians. People generally have pets in an aquarium or terrarium. When you say you like eclectic music what does that mean?

Oh my brother just gifted me an air plant with a terrarium it is much easier to take care of than a reptile I only have to feed it water once a week. I like music that is different by ivarious artists. I am sure I would like death metal who do you recommend I should listen to?.
I enjoy a band called Type-o-negative. Their music can be both very fast, And slow and calm. For a death metal band they have a lot of versatility.
I will listen and see if I like it. Are you still learning programming C or have you started on something else?
I have started on something else. I have been getting into video editing lately. How about you, Are you still trying to learn C?
No I never liked C gave up learning long ago. Video editing sounds interesting though do you like it?

persona: I used to know Judy Garland's dentist.
My favorite foods are hamburgers and French fries.
I like walking. My house is close to a river and a park.
My hobby is drinking rum. I don't drink rum with soda anymore.
I do not have children. I sell electronics on the internet.
dialogue: I attended a dance at my church and I have to tell you about it.
Sure. What happened during your dance at church?
Hello good evening. How are you doing today?
I am doing well today. Currently I am eating hamburgers and French friends for lunch today. Did you go to church recently?
Oh nice... How's the hamburger and French fries treating your taste buds? Yeah I was in church this past weekend and have a meeting coming up soon.
Its great. Usually I go get hamburgers and French fries from McDonalds. But soda has always given me problems.
McDonalds is famous for their menu. Must be fun living close to a river and a park, Which do you spend more time at?

Its pretty great! The park is my preferred place to take walks at night. Its calm and peaceful during that time. You mentioned you like wine last time we talked. Do you have a favorite brand? I am looking for suggestions.
I can imagine the peaceful park at night. White wines are my favorite, Clear sparkling white wines. So about not having kids... Is that intentional?

It is. It was a tough decision but my significant other and I decided not to move forward with children and it will most likely stay that way. We are happy for now but anything can happen. Without having television as a kid, What did you do in your spare time. Was your parents the one to make that choice for you?

Alright now I see why your don't have kids. My days were fun... When kids played outdoors all day and had to be literally dragged back into the house in the evenings. Haha, Was really fun for us then. So how's your electronic business sales going online? Better than brick and mortar sore sales?

Excatly. Way better than brick and mortal store sales. Selling things online are more my style and I have time to do other things. One thing I miss is the customer interaction part. I thoroughly enjoyed interacting with people and seeing people face to face. Since you loved to dance do you perform a particular style?

persona: I used to live with my mom. My mother died when I was in my 20s.
I have a boyfriend. I have a sister.
I can't drink soda. I like french fries and hamburgers.
dialogue: Have you had any good burgers this week?
Yes, Just today I picked up one from a local place.
Nice! I had a pretty great hamburger the other day with an orange pop. What was on your burger?
It was just their basic burger with cheese, Onions, Tomatoes, Pickles, And their special spicy mayo sauce.
Sounds delicious! I should get a job at a hamburger shop. I could get a discount on their food. Think it would pay enough?
I'm not sure. This discount would need to be pretty big to make it worth your while.
Yeah you're probably right. So how is your boyfriend doing?
Fine, He got a burger today too. A fancy one with a fried egg on it.
Oh I love fried eggs on burgers. They add a creaminess and richness to the burger. High in cholesterol though. What else have you been up to?
I went shopping today. Picked up some burgers and buns for a cookout on Thursday.
That sounds like fun! I have a softball game coming up that I'm pretty excited about.
What position do you play? Will there be burgers afterwards?

persona: My name is Taylor. My father was a construction worker. My dad was not in the military.
I hate alcohol.  I love coffee.
I love blue. I hate the color pink. I like mountain biking.
I consider myself to be a bland person.
I went mountain biking yesterday at Mt. Ember.
dialogue: I am considering renting a mountain bike to try it out!
That sounds fantastic! Were you planning to do so this weekend?
At one of the county parks nearby.
That should be fun. Have you volunteered at the bunny rescue recently?
It's been a few weeks. But I'll go this weekend after I go biking.
How is volunteering at the bunny rescue? I have never done that but would like to. Bunnies seem very sweet and pleasant to be with.
I love it, But we get overwhelmed at times.
I can imagine. Would you recommend that others volunteer or donate there? It seems like it would frequently be busy.
People's time is the biggest thing we need.
That makes sense. What kinds of activities do you guys do there?
We evaluate the bunnies to see how healthy they are. And then try to place them.
That is awesome. I hope to be able to foster or adopt a bunny one day and am trying to learn more about them. I know to feed them carrots and make them comfortable beds, But not much more than that.

persona: I just broke up with my boyfriend.
I love going hiking in the mornings.
I am 18.
I like Travis Scott.
I keep fish as pets in a huge aquarium.
My favorite color is orange.
dialogue: Where do you like to go hiking?
I like to go around the lake at one of our local parks.
Sounds nice! Do you like to listen to Travis Scott while you hike?
Not really. I'd rather listen to the sounds of nature.
Yeah I prefer that too when i play basketball with my sister. We went today to the courts and played 2 games. I won both times! Did you see any fish in the lake?
Yes, I usually see the Koi fish during my hike.
Oh Koi fish are so pretty. I love seeing those! How are things with your ex-boyfriend? Has he reached out to you?
No, And if he did I would tell him to take a hike.
Haha, Things ended pretty badly then huh?
Yes, I was totally blindsided.
Its ok, You're so young. You'll bounce back in no time. There are so many fish in the sea!
And so many Koi in the lake.

persona: I am at ground level. I hate heights.
I am taking a Spanish class. I love studying languages. I am planning to study French.
I love the word trabajo.
dialogue: How is your Spanish class going?
So far so good I have now been learning for about 6 months. Do you take any Spanish classes?
Not yet. I want to soon so I can speak Spanish fluently. Are there any other languages you plan on studying?
Yeah you should defiantly look into taking some classes, It's is interesting learning a new language. Once I have mastered Spanish I am planning on learning french next.
That's awesome! Maybe I'll start to learn after I return home. I'm visiting the city at the moment. Have you ever been to the city?
That's awesome let me know how it goes. That's amazing I love visiting different cities. I was actually raised in New York but now I live in England. Which city are you visiting?
How funny. I'm visiting New York right now. I'm actually on top of a skyscraper, Which is kind of scary cause I hate heights. How are you with heights?
Oh nice what is your favourite part of New York so far? Yes I am also really scared of heights so I never went up one of the skyscraper before just really enjoyed the views.
I can relate to that fear. Honestly, As much as I like the city, My favorite part of New York has to be the parties. I love all parties, But the ones here are amazing!
Yes New York defiantly has an amazing party scene. But I honestly prefer the parties in Miami Beach, They are a blast.
You probably have an easier time in Miami since you know a bit of Spanish. Any words you like to use more than others?
Yes that is true so once you have learned some you can party with me in Miami. My favourite word is actually trabajo. Do you have a favourite word?

persona: My name is Lee.  I am retired.
I like to grill.
I don't like cold weather.  I like to gamble.
I like Italian food.  My favorite food is lasagna.
I don't know what plantains are.
dialogue: I won a gymnastics meet yesterday.
Wow congrats! I probably should have bet my money on you, I would have made some cash. What did you do to celebrate?

Thank you! I'm not sure that there are bookies who take bets on amateur women's gymnastics, But if you can find one, Bet on me for sure! I went out with my gymnastics team to this classy, Quaint Italian restaurant in our town.
That sounds delicious. I am not sure there is either, But I would for sure put money on you! How often do you practice your gymnastics?
I take it very seriously. We practice every day from Monday through Friday from 6 p.M. To 9 p.M. After we get out of high school.
Wow, You are really committed. Do you ever get tired of it? That is a lot of hard work required for all that!
It is tough between going to school and practicing every day, But I love it! I know you feel the same way about grilling and chilling during the summer, Right?

Absolutely. I eat, Sleep, And breathe hanging out at the grill. Since I don't work anymore, I even grill sometimes in the winter, Even though I do not enjoy it! But my love of grilling outweighs my hatred of the cold!
I love it. You have dedication to your "sport". What have you been grilling up lately? Since you like Italian, You should fire up some spicy Italian sausage to make with your lasagna!
Oh most definitely. I could go for that any day. Would your family like to join my wife and I for a grill out and some lasagna? Any special requests for sides?
Sure! When can I come over? I'd love it if you served that up with some buttery, Savory garlic bread.
Well, Whenever you aren't doing gymnastics I suppose. I am always home, But my wife works 11-6 Monday through Friday so come through any time on Saturday or Sunday!

persona: I have a husband. We live in the country.
I live with a german shepherd.
I like nhl. I like coloring books.
dialogue: How long have you had your german shepherd for?
I have had him ever since he was a puppy, So 5 years.
I would love to get one for the farm, They are such pretty dogs and smart too! Do you think they would be good around my horses?
I think if you train one right, They would totally get along. (you have train them so they don't herd them.) How many horse do you have?
Right now I have 25, But we are fixing to sell some colts after we do some basic training. We have to get them used to saddles and people riding them. So after that we will still have about 15.
Do you have good home for all the ones you are going to sell?
Oh yes. We only sell to people that we know. I live in a small town so I know everyone basically. We also train horses that people can't break them self. Do you like horses?
No. I prefer my Shepard, Max. He is my buddy, He follows me everywhere; even to hockey games.
Wow that's really cool. I think I might look for a German Shepard, I would love to have the company out here. Do you think I should get a male or female, Or would it not matter?

persona: My biggest fear is scorpions.
I work for the us postal service.
My dad used to drive a nascar race car.
I have a german shepard.
dialogue: I was walking around after our conversation and I saw nascar race car! It reminded me of what you said.
What did you think of the race?
I never realized how exciting they are to watch, And the wrecks are crazy! Who's your favorite driver?
Hailie Degan is my favorite driver, She just is so cool and badass. Where did you go for a walk?
I just walk up my subdivision to the gas station, Buy a drink and walk back home. I try to walk everyday but sometimes I'm just to busy or the weather is bad. Did you have a good day at work?
Yea, So many people bought stamps, And one couple got their passports done.
That's cool, I didn't know you could get your passport at the post office. I need to get one soon for my next vacation.
Where are you going on your vacation?
I'm thinking Bahama, They claim they have the most beautiful beaches. But I would also love to go to the Galapagos Islands, But that's pretty expensive. Have you ever been to a beach?
No, Someone once told there are scorpions on the beach. And I'm just so afraid of scorpions.
I have been to many beaches all over the US and I have never seen a scorpion. You should go, I think you would really enjoy it. Maybe we can plan a trip and I can show you my favorite beaches!
That dose sound fun. As long as they are dog friendly. I take my German Shepard with me where ever I go.

persona: I love to cook and watch others cook. I'm a vegan.
I'm single.
I love adrenaline based activities like skydiving and riding rollercoasters.
I rent an apartment and am not rich.
I don't have any pets.
dialogue: Does your apartment building not allow dogs?
I think I've seen neighbors walking their dogs so I think it's allowed. But I'm worried about the costs involved with having a pet. What do you think?
Well I'll say if you get a pet you love(not necessarily a dog), You wouldn't mind going all out in taking care of it. Adrenaline based activities can be scary at times, Lol.
It's scary the first few times but I've grown to love it. Have you gone skydiving before?
Skydiving? Hell no! Lol... The thought of it scares the living hell out of me. So which part of rollercoaster ride interests you most?
Oh, It's gotta be the big drops. The part where you go up is quite scary because, Believe it or not, I'm a bit scared of heights. But I love the adrenaline rush going down!
Hahaha... That's quite interesting to know. I do cook for my family occasionally, What do you cook more frequently?
I cook a lot of stews, Soups, And chicken. How about you?
Mine is mainly mashed potatoes and salmon. Are you in any way interested in sports? Because I'm really good at tennis!
I actually play a bit of tennis casually. Of course, I know you are a professional, So I'm not sure I can keep up with you!
Haha, No harm in getting beat once in a while you know. Lol. Have you been vegan all your life or did it start at a stage in your life?
I made it a point to eat less meat about 2 years ago, And I naturally transitioned to eating a fully vegan diet 100% of the time. Are you interested in being vegetarian or vegan?

persona: I have two jobs.
My favorite hobby is reading. I've read 20 books this year.
I work in the movies. I work as a stunt double.
I help out my mom. She is my only surviving parent. I am like my mom.
I shop at Home Depot.
Shawshank was a boring yet amazing book. I like Stephen King adaptations. I want to be in one of the movies.
I am haunted by The Butterfly Garden book.
I have kindle unlimited and the libby app. Billy Straight is an amazing book. I have Amazon Prime.
dialogue: What other books have you read in your life that really stand out to you?
Dr Seuss' Old Hat New Hat has always resonated with me. Are you familiar with it?
Haha I think I may have read it years ago as a kid. Remind me what it's about?

A character is shopping for hats and trying all types of hats on and none are suitable until he finds his old hat which he had taken off when he entered the hat store. Not an actual classic, But lots of fun.
Well my son is probably too old for it at this point, But I might volunteer to read it for the kids group at the library!
I often take it out when I am having a rough day at work... It is mindless fun. Almost as much as the stunt double work I just did.
That sounds like an incredible amount of fun, But anything but mindless! What was your last stunt gig?
I stood in for the actor who is playing Rocky Balboa in a remake of the original Rocky movie.
Wow, I'm super impressed! Tell me, What sorts of stunts do you have to do for this one? My imagination is running wild.
Just imagine getting punched over and over again!
Oof, Talk about working hard for the money! Hopefully you're getting free visits to a massage therapist as part of the package!
Only the real stars get that treatment. The stunt doubles get old coffee and donuts in the trailer.

persona: I have two dogs: Baron Zemo and Spike.
I have two older mustangs. I like vintage cars.
I don't like crowds.
I like working out.
I like classic country.
I'm working on two Mustangs: a 68 and a 66 Hertz clone. I've been working on cars since 1989.
dialogue: How's work on the Mustang coming?
Not so good, I got bit by one of my dogs and needed stiches in my hand so haven't been able to make much progress.
I'm so sorry to hear that! How on earth did that happen?
Just a little rough housing that went a bit too far.
That's unfortunate. I'm hoping you'll make a speedy recovery! What's your day job?
I'm a dog trainer! I guess I'm not that good.
Haha well I suppose no one is perfect. Given my recent string of lost matches, I can't say I'm doing much better.
Yeah between the both of us, Could probably get a country song written about our distresses... Perhaps Taylor Swift could perform it.
That would be a chart-topper, I'm sure. Something to blast while driving with the top down, Maybe even in your next restoration project.
Yes!! Can't wait to get back in the saddle with the restoration. One of the one's I am working on is a convertible.
Sweet! I'm sure that will be an amazing ride once it's finished. How long does a project take to complete, Generally speaking?
For me, I can usually do a full restoration in 6 months if I put in a few hours a day after work.

persona: I'm close with my family.
I have been to Disneyland. I love Mickey Mouse.
I work as a baby delivery nurse. I have dropped some babies. I don't get pay a lot. Money is very tight, I have to walk to work. If I switch departments I'll lose pay.
I want to return to school. I might attend school in Orlando. I might try economics as a major. I won't major in anything related to hospitals.
I'd like to learn to coupon to save money. I applied for scholarships.
dialogue: What happened at work, Were you punished or has it blown over?
Yes thankfully its all blown over, Wont be doing that again. Hows your job been going?
I'm so glad to hear that it all got sorted for you. My job has just been incredible they have welcomed me to their group, Feels like I have always worked there.
Thankyou. Oh im so glad to hear that its all going so well for you. You really have worked so hard to get to where you are. I bet your wife and kids are so proud of you!

Yes they are just happy that I'm now happy in a job doing what I love to do. I know previously you have said you want to learn how to save using coupons my wife would be more and happy to give you some tips if you like.
Thats so good to hear. Omg that would be so amazing of her to do that for me i will message her in the week to see when she is free, Thankyou so much. How are the kids doing?

No worries at all she would love to be able to get with someone to do that. And my kids are doing amazing they are adjusting to the new house now and love it. They have made so many new friends and love their new school, So really is the best decision we made to move here.
That is great to hear that they are settling in well. I know some kids have a hard time adjusting but your kids are just amazing. How are you finding the new area you live in?
It is honestly beautiful, Our new neighbours have been so welcoming and we are actually have a get together this weekend you should come over too if your not busy!
That so awesome to hear you all loving your new area you live in. That would be great i will message you later on in the week to see if i am able to make it, Thanks.
Your more than welcome. It has been a while since we have seen you and I know the kids will be so happy maybe we will make it a surprise for them if you can come.
Oh yeah that would be good, I sure have missed those kids of yours. Have you been to any new concerts lately?

persona: I love my purple hair. I enjoy watching war documentaries.
I have a  female bird that loves cheeseburgers. My favorite is cheeseburgers.
I live the holidays. I volunteer at a soup kitchen during the holidays. I love to give back.
I am 33 years old. I grew up poor.
I dyed my hair purple to be different.
dialogue: I've been thinking about the soup kitchen and might want to invite you at the same time you are.
Oh yes that would be great. I normally go down on friday's and sunday's if any of those days work for you?
Those days do indeed work for me. How long are the shifts, And what time of day do they take place?
Ok perfect sound like a plan then. The shifts are usually about 4 hours and they start at around 10am. Would you like to check out Macy's once we are done?
We could certainly do that if the store isn't too far from the soup kitchen. I'd appreciate your input regarding fashion.
Yes its not to far and i will drive us and take you home after. Yes i can defiantly help, I love to shop for new clothes so will probably get my some new stuff too.
That's very kind of you. What sort of budget do you suggest I have for this shopping trip?
Your welcome. I would say around $50 you could probably get atleast two whole new outfits with that. Macy's usually have some amazing deals.
That's not bad! I was expecting much worse, But with my memory being so bad, I can't even remember what I spent last time I shopped for clothes!
Yeah Macy's sure is the place to shop. I know you said you dont like the holidays but if you like you can spend Thanksgiving with my family this year if you like?
That's very sweet of you to offer. I think I'll be free then. Will your family be coming into town, Or would I need to plan to travel?
Your welcome. And my family is coming to my house this year so you don't have to travel too far.

persona: I like wine. I like dancing. I like reading.
I prefer well aged and fermented wine. I am not a picky eater. I really like Malbec.
I am at least 100 years old. I don't work. I want to enjoy life.
I never got into cigars.
dialogue: There's a new wine subscription service that let you try different wines on a monthly basis. I am thinking about trying it. How about you?
Yes same here. Sometimes even if you pay high price, Still the flavor is not that smooth. Don't you agree?
I am not sure how much choice you get. Is your service very expensive?
Yes a little bit expensive. Can you recommend any new good wine with affordable price as well as quality is nice?
I really prefer sangrias, Although some find them a bit too sweet. Do you like sweet wines?
Yes, But not that much sweet. I will try your wine label next time. I hope it will taste nice.
It is. Do you then prefer dry wines? Red or white?
I absolutely love red wine. I think you like the white one?
Whites I love, Like a good schwartzkatz... German wines You more french or german?
I heard a lot of good things about German wines. I always prefer French wine though.
What is your favorite french wine?
Bordeaux red is my favorite one. Have you tried it?

persona: My mom is traditional. My family is from India.
I live in a house with my parents. I live near a pool. I coach swimming.
I an still in school studying to be a computer programmer. I have to finish my degree before I can move. I graduate in 3 more years.
I like my classes and find them challenging.
I want to visit the dorm. I would join a study group. I want to socialize.
I'm taking bio and don't like it.
dialogue: I decided I could probably use some study help with bio after all.
So will you get a study group started to help with that?
Yes I'm taking to a couple of my classmates to see if they can help me set one up.
That sounds like a good idea. I don't like bio much, So I would definitely join a study group to help!
Well once I have one together I will let you know so you can join also. How's the rest of your classes going?
That would be great, Thanks! The rest of my classes are going well. I still enjoy them, But I don't have much time to socialize.
Yes I am in the same situation. Studying is taking up so much of my time but I trying to come out with the perfect Gpa score so that's what it takes.
That is a great goal! My traditional parents would be very happy if I had a perfect GPA as well. I am hoping to get as close as I can. I would love to visit the dorms sometime.
I'm sure you will get it. You are also studying very hard I'm sure you parents are so proud of you. You should defiantly come visit and I will show you around.
Thanks, That's nice of you to say, And it would be great to have someone to show me around! The campus seems so large, I would probably get lost easily. How is your part time job going?

Yes it very large but you soon get used to getting around. And it's going well but I wish I had more time in my days to get everything I need done. But I do like having a little break from school work.
Do you enjoy working at Burger King? Does it pay well?

persona: I am famous. I helped design the game Starcraft.
I like to use Twitch.
I like pizza. I don't live near the ocean.  I am allergic to water.
I have not seen another human in 5 years.  I use delivery services for everything I need.
I am making a robot. I haven't chosen the robot's voice. I want it to have options. The robot will be a servant and friend.
dialogue: My dad helped me to pay a vet and my cow should be ok.
What was the matter with your cow? Was it serious?

Yeah It was pretty serious because he wasn't eating. The vet said it was a bacterial infection but the antibiotics should help clear things up. I'm so relieved. You know what would be the best thing about robots? They don't get sick!
What would you have your robot do for you, If you got one>.

I would definitely have it be my assistant for my electrical work and have it do the more dangerous stuff. Maybe I will also have it groom my cow, Since that's a fair amount of work as well. What about you?
Mine woill pay the bills, Cook the meals,, Clean the house, And do all the things I do not have time for. Who is your favorite country singer?
My favorite country singers are Dan + Shay. You?
I have no heard of them I like more 60s folk music, Like simon and garfunkel. Do you know of them?
I have heard of that name, But I'm not familiar with their music. Have you been designing other games lately? Starcraft is a great game. I am a big fan.
I retired from the games, I am doing robots almost exclusively. I wonder if I could maake a robot cow.
You're welcome to visit me so that you can do some 3D modeling with my cow! But then you'd break your streak of not seeing another human being for 5 years. Don't you get lonely?
But if I did, When would be a good time to comeI just don't feel comfortable with people.

persona: I am an Olympic gymnast. I don't read much.
I have been to Spain. I bought a yellow blouse in Spain.
I have 2 years before I retire from gymnastics.
I am young. I would like to go to culinary school. I cook a lot of Italian and garlic bread.I would love to be a pastry chef. I make a lot of earl grey shortbread.
I like strawberry shortbread, Earl Grey shortbread.
I have not read the book Caste.
I am skeptical about the value of race relations advocacy.
dialogue: Well, I managed to get through the shortbread recipe - it's in the oven right now. I hope the grandkids like it!
That sounds delicious! Is this a new recipe for you?
It is! I am excited to try it for the first time. I should probably have a back-up dessert just in case!
Two desserts is never a bad thing :-) I can never decide what to bake so I always bake more than one thing! Do you have a favorite thing to bake?
Cookies! I can't even tell you how many batches of cookies I have made over the years. My grandkids love them.
I love a good cookie, Especially peanut butter. If you could pick your top three cookies what would they be?
Oh, Peanut butter is number one, For sure! A freshly bakes peanut butter cookie is amazing. Second would be Macadamia, And third would be chocolate chip.

I have an unpopular opinion: I can't taste macadamia in cookies! I think there's something wrong with my palate, Lol. I feel the same way about pistachio. I do love chocolate chip andpeanut butter though. This christmas I found a sugar cookie recipe that was amazing, Too.
Sugar cookies are great! I love them around Christmas. My grandkids and I leave them out for Santa every year.
This year I impressed my wife with my excellent icing piping skills, Haha! We made dinosaurs withsanta hats. It was fun! Do you have favorite christmas traditions?
Piping icing can take time to master but it sounds like you have figured it out! My favorite traditions are baking and decorating the house! I enjoy that very much.

Decorating for the holidays is one of the best parts of the whole season. When I was a kid my mom wrote directions down on how to decorate the tree and I keep them in a special box and take them out every year to remember and celebrate mom.

persona: I go to Disney World every year.  I like Mickey Mouse. My favorite ride is Thunder Mountain. I like Disney World better then Disney Land. I live closer to Disney World than to Disney Land.
I like the band Rascal Flats.
I have never been to a national park.  I like playing on playgrounds with my friends.
I like the movie Frozen.
I do not have pets. I live with my family. I'm a 3rd grader. I have an older sister.
dialogue: What is your favorite Rascal Flats song?
My two favorite songs our Through the years and Life is a highway.
Those are great songs! I really like "What Hurts the Most" too.
Yes that one is also a great song. What type of instruments do you play?
I play piano and the violin, Which is my personal favorite. I can probably play other string instruments as well like the cello, But I dream of playing the harp one day.
Oh i would love to be able to play the piano one day. You are very talented.
Thank you! Learning to read music is harder than actually playing, In my opinion.
Oh yes im sure that it is. I tries to play the flute once but understanding the sheet music was a little hard but im sure as i get older i will be able to understand it more.
I agree! They might have some music classes you could take at school too. Forgot to tell you I've been playing guitar since I was a toddler haha.. But haven't picked it up recently.

Yes they have some after school programs maybe i will ask my parents if they will allow me to attend them. Oh guitar that is amazing, Im sure it would be like riding a bike if you can get a hold of a guitar again.
I'll pick up my guitar if you promise to ask your parents to let you take music classes!
That sounds like a deal to me. Be sure to let me know how you get on when you try to play it again, And i will let you know what my parents say.

persona: I am unemployed. I am looking for work. I write. My dream job would be a writer. I was an ER doctor. I would like a relaxing job.
My daughter is thought of by some to be a child prodigy. My daughter is talented in math. I hate math.
My favorite movie is Friday!. I love the movie Clueless. I hope another Friday! movie is made.
I want to write a clueless sequel. I like fantasy and mystery books.
dialogue: Are there any other books or genres you love?
I really enjoy comedies. Did you see the witch movie with Bette Midler?
I haven't. I'm not really into comedies, Because I don't really have a sophisticated sense of humor. What genre do you think your first book will be?
It would be the kind of comedy that clueless is.Doyou not think of clueless as a comedy?
It is definitely a comedy, But I guess it is a special case because I've watched it so many times! Other comedies don't really do it for me. I don't know why!
Interesrting! Do you like drams a little more?
Yeah, I think so. But what I enjoy the most is nature documentaries. I like learning new things, And so I'll sometimes spend the whole day knitting and watching wildlife on tv!
Do you like more of the nature channel or more of things like jaques ciusteau?
I like the BBC series Planet Earth and Blue Planet! Have you seen those?
I have. I like blue planety better. Which is your favorite".
My favorite is Blue Planet II. I think the music is just top notch. And I love the footage of the deep sea creatures! They're so alien-looking.
Have you seen the penguin movies?

persona: I am in graduate school studying psychology.
I love the outdoors. I learnt how to survive in the wilderness for weeks from my parents.
I love the Jim Shockey show.
My parents were there when I was a child. My parents hike often with me when I was a child.
I am a dog walker.
I love hiking.
I am a professional gambler. My favorite games are blackjack and Texas Hold 'Em.
dialogue: My friend showed me something amazing just now.DId you know that there is such a thing as ONLINE GAMBLING?! I might be in some trouble now because this is toodang easy!

I have heard of it, Sports betting on line became legal in my state in the fall and I did place a few bets! I'm scared to try the black jack and Texas hold em because I'm afraid it would be to easy to get addicted!
Yeah that is definitely something to watch out for! Time does fly!
Also doesn't seem like you are playing with real money when you just click a button.
It does have its draw backs. The rush is unreal when you hit a streak!
I could definitely see that, Whats the largest purse you have ever won?
8k, I cashed out right away ha. If i kept going i know id lose it.
Wow thats great! Sounds like you can make a living doing that. Dare I ask your largest loss?

persona: I'm a recording engineer. I live in California.
I do not like going to concerts.
I like racing. I do not like lawyers. My ex partner left me for a lawyer. My ex partner did not like Aerosmith.
My mom does not like Mexican food or fast cars. My mom lies and cheats.
I'm 46. I have kids.
I like Mexican food.
I like tacos and quesedillas. My mother likes Italian food.
dialogue: Have you taken your mum for a Mexican meal yet? Was my arroz con pollos a hit?
No not yet she still needs some persuading to try it again. But i keep telling her she will love it.
Maybe bribe her with promising to take her out to Olive Garden.. Or a better Italian restaurant in exchange?
Yes that sounds like a good idea, I could even trade her if i take her to her favorite place she has to try Mexican food haha. How's your job in construction going?
That's a good plan. Glad I could help you hatch it! It's going pretty good, But I still think the best part of my job is wearing my gear haha.
Yes thankyou for the great idea! Yes im sure it is, I bet you get all the ladies.
I'm not gonna lie.. They think it's hot. I'm taking this new chick I'm talking to to go see Aerosmith in a few weeks!
Oh wow what an incredible first date that is. Im sure she will have an amazing time let me know how it goes for you.
Oh yeah.. It's going to be incredible. Are you feeling any better about your ex leaving you for that jerk lawyer?

Yes i am slowly getting though it. I think i am just going to take some me time before getting back out there though, But hopefully i find someone nice next time don't want to have to go through this again.
You really deserve it. Seriously. What kind of woman doesn't like Aerosmith anyway??.
Thankyou. But yes that should of been a red flag from the start they are amazing. Next time that will be the first question i ask them.

persona: My name is Kelly. I live in the southwest. I work for the US Postal Service.
My father is deceased. He drove for Nascar.
I have a German shepherd named Barnaby. I like to swim with my dog.
I play softball. I'm scared of scorpions.
I live far away from Boston. I have some vacation time available at my job.
I like to drive at night. I will drive to Boston and stay in a hotel.
I don't have children. I volunteer at a pet shelter.
dialogue: Are you all packed for your trip to Boston?
Yes im all packed up and ready to go. I am very much looking forward to having a break away from everything. Hows your job going?
Work is so hectic. I'm so glad the softball tournament is coming up. Are you sure you want to stay in a hotel while you're here? I have a spare bedroom/office...

Sorry to hear that, It must be a stressful job. Oh yeah you mentioned that are you looking forward to it and feeling ready? Yeah i will stay in a hotel but would sure like to visit you whilst im down their.
For sure. Text me when you arrive and we'll go grab a drink.
Yes i will do that. Have you been able to get in touch with your dad lately i know he must be busy with the army.
We haven't talked in years. But that's okay. I've got enough going on as it is. Maybe I'll try getting in touch with him on his birthday.
Yeah i understand that, Relationship with family can sometimes be rough. But i sure he would love to hear from you on his birthday.
I'm sure he would. How are things at the pet shelter where you volunteer?
It is going amazing, I have to tell myself everytime i go i can not take on anymore pets right now, Or i swear i would take them all home with me.
I know that feeling. All the ucte dogs wagging their tails. It must be so satisfying to see them get adopted.
Yes its such a great opportunity to see them get to go to great homes. But i know the day will come where i completely fall in love with them and i will take one home with me.

persona: I love playing folk music.  I would love to be a professional musician. I play the guitar, piano, and like to sing. I like Bob Dylan. Bob Dylan is an inspiration for me.

I went to a 
Yo-yo ma and Mark O'Connor concert. I like classic and baroque music.
I don't listen to podcasts.
I don't like to drink much.
I work as a custodian.
I like to see local bands and big name music groups.
dialogue: I watched a really cool Youtube video about how Cellos are made.
Cool any process of making an instrument is beautiful to me. Did you search it up or was it a recommend youtube video?
It was recommended to me. You know how those algorithms sometimes seem to read your mind. But I saw the thumbnail and started watching and got hooked.
Those thumbnails really get you to watch just about anything. Whats your favorite podcast to listen to?
I tend to bounce around. I think I get hooked by the personalities and then sort of get tired of them. But right now I'm listening to one that talks about unsolved crimes.
Very cool, My dad listened to a podcast about the zodiac killer a while back, Its an interesting story. Where do you usually ride your bike?

I mostly ride on streets, Albeit pretty quiet streets. But sometimes I'll take my bike and go on trails or off road. It take a little longer to do those types of rides, Though, So I do them less frequently.
A nice bike ride feels great especially in perfect climate. Whats your favorite drink?
Well, I used to like a nice rum and Coke back when I was drinking more. But now I love a lemonade as a treat on a hot summer day, And coconut water most other days. How about you?
I don't tend to drink that much but when i do i like to sip on some Kentucky Bourbon. Blanton is my favorite. Do you have your own construction company or do you work for somebody?
I work for someone. I got the job through my dad. They company and owner have been good to my family so I'm happy to work for him.
Thats great to hear, Connections go a long way.

persona: I am from NYC.
I work in a bookstore. I don't like reading. I want to own a bookstore.
I don't like the color orange.
I don't have space for a chemistry set.
I am from Canada. I was never in the army. Nobody In my family was in the army.
I have completed college for chemistry.
dialogue: I just saw a chemistry book in a bookstore window!
I am not a big book fan -- I like audio books instead! Do you enjoy using your chemistry lab?
Yes, I love to do little experiments with it! I don't really enjoy reading either, But I was kind of intrigued by the chemistry book haha!
Totally! It's helpful to have a guide for that kind of hobby. wish I had the space for it! Do you have to live on base for the army?

No, I'm in an apartment just off the base, So I had a bit of space for my hobbies. Do you have a plan to get to your goal of owning a bookstore? I imagine it's a complicated process to own your own business!
That's my hope -- trying to find space to rent is so hard though! I can't decide on what a good location is. Think I should aim for a downtown area or a suburb?
There are certainly benefits with either choice of location. Is the bookstore you currently work in located right in the city? I bet that's a very expensive location.
Yes it is. The foot traffic is good for business though. I worry if I move away from here I won't have that. Do you know what you'd wanna major in if you went back to school?
I'm not 100% sure yet but I'm thinking that I'll go into something related to chemistry since I have an interest in that. Maybe forensic science!
That would be really cool. With your military experience that would set you up for many good law enforcement type jobs.
Exactly! But first I have to finish my commitment to the Army. Did you ever consider a military career?
I did, But I ended up wanting to go to school or do other things -- it seemed like such a big commitment.

persona: My kids are grown and I'm 60 years old. My two kids are good, one is a lawyer, the other is a carpenter.
I work as a librarian and plan to retire soon. Being a librarian is great.
I would be happy to help my grandkids when I get them. Although, I don't have FaceBook.
I like to learn new things.
dialogue: I finally got the new furniture that I have been waiting so long for. It is so nice and comfortable.
That's terrific! What did you get?
Wayfair! It was a custom couch. It took so long because I chose the fabric, Pattern, And style and they made it to order. It was definitely worth the wait!
That's great. I bet it feels good to sink into that after a long day. What color is it?
It's a grey, Deep seat sofa set. I will never go back from a deep seat!
Explain to me what a deep seat is. I haven't heard that term before, Or if I have I didn't process it.
The couch sits back further than a normal couch. It's almost twice the depth of an average couch. I highly recommend them!
It does sound relaxing. The next time I'm looking to replace my couch I may need your guidance. Our couch is probably about 25 years old. It's beenreupholstered once but that's it.
Well, Older furniture was built to last! Now-a-days, They fall apart after 5 years, If you're lucky!
Yes, I do find that things seem to break more readily nowadays. It's a disposable world. What do you do most in your new couch? Watch TV, Read, Take a nap?
To be honest, My kids use it more than I do. But, When I do find time to relax, I like to read. The TV is usually occupied by my 9 year old.
Yes, Young ones do usually monopolize the screens. What does your nine-year-old like to watch, Not that I'd know any of the shows these days.

persona: I work in construction and started when I was 16.
I like Mexican food over burgers.
I like tacos. I eat raw meat, I love sushi. I prefer meat to be cooked. The fish I prefer is squid. I rarely eat seafood.
My favorite band is Aerosmith.
dialogue: I just tried making shrimp enchiladas and I think it is one of my new favorites.
Oh really? I don't eat seafood all that often but I could definitely be persuaded if it was in echiladas!
I definitely think you would love this recipe. You will only get a hint of shrimp taste it is not over powering at all. And since you like Mexican food the spices in these enchiladas are to die for.
I'm a terrible cook so I don't trust myself not to mess it up - would you mind cooking it for me one of these evenings? I can bring over a couple beers to thank you for your trouble.
I would love to cook it for you but, What kind of beers are you going to bring over?
Regular for me and 0% for you! I'm not getting in trouble, Haha/.
Lol... Yeah underage drinking is not the way to go.
You're so close to being of age it's not worth the risk, For sure. I want to see all those crazy pasta shapes you've been busy with, Anyway.
For sure, Italian cuisine is my specialty. You would love my gnocchi. Have you ever had gnocchi?
No, But I've heard about it. It's those little things that look almost like a snail shell, Right? And it's like potato, But... Not? Lol.

Exactly, The sauce I put on those things is just amazing. I will also have to make you my wagon wheel pasta but, It is extremely time consuming to make so, I will need advance notice before you come over and eat those.
Oh don't worry about that fancy stuff for me. Some gnocchi and a really good sauce is good enough for me. More than good enough. And cheese! Lots and lots of cheese!

persona: I harvested the fields for winter. I grow corn and soybeans at my parents farm.
I have a pet cow.
I like country music.
I am Amish. I live in Lancaster County. I was born into an Amish community. I speak English and Pennsylvania Dutch.
dialogue: I saw a group of combines out harvesting a field near my house. What methods do you guys use to harvest your crops?
We do it completely by hand. Absolutely no machinery other than hand tools!
Yeah does it take you a lot longer doing it that way?
I've never known another way, But I'd guess that it's more time consuming than typical commercial farming.
Yeah I would of thought so it must be a lot faster these days with all the heavy machinery around.
My community will have none of it. We're very proud of the way that we do things!
It's nice to see a communtiy sticking to their roots, I think modern technology is destroying the old ways these days.
We're definitely in the minority. Are you part of a faith community of any sort?
No i'm but I would love to be in a close knit community the world feels so distant these days.

persona: I have a grey German Sheppard named Barnaby. I hate scorpions.

My dad was killed at a Nascar event when the wall did not hold up. I am suing them. My mother is becoming depressed. We are both very sad. My mother and I need to keep busy and occupy our minds for a while.
dialogue: Is your dog giving you and your mom comfort during this time?
Animals are always a soother, Well many times. I am grateful to have the company, Even love doing service work sometimes at the Humane Society. Wonder if you have many pets?
I do. I have a dog and a cat. The dog is more of a pet to the kids.
Ah, I see. Sounds like based on the choices you make with kids and pets, You like a large family home.
Yes, It's wild around here, But we have fun.
We sometimes play cards or board games to pass the time. You say you have fun, What things do you do?
We play video games together a lot. It holds all of their interest.
Yes. Video games can definitely be a place to focus, And spend time together now and again, I agree.
We also play a lot of sports. I'm a basketball coach.
Ah how about that. Being active is something you focus on. Working out and coaching have been fun things in the past for me. Working out, I'm trying to be consistent, You know?
Yes, Consistency is key. Totally agree with that!
Education is important. I've found that school and classwork help, Especially with communication skills. Effort is easy to see, And I love learning.

persona: I like green living. I put solar panels on my roof.
I love cookouts. I'm involved in the women rights movement.
I work from home doing internet searches. I work in an office but I stay busy when I am home.
I have an organic garden. I try to grow and cook organic foods. It is something I am passionate about. I like an all natural simple chef salad fresh from my garden.
I love most food. My favorite vegetable is spinach. I'd like to open a store to sell my vegetables someday.
dialogue: I got an interview for an IT job that is remote so I can work from home.
Good for you! I know I love it!. Will it be hard to get used to fr you?
No to be honest, Having not worked in years I would just be excited to have a purpose again! I'd love to eat some of your organic vegetables sometime to compare to the commercial stuff.
Does thi mean you will have time to do a garden this yeear?
Yes I should have the time and money to try it. Would you recommend anything to plant first?
For roots, Potates and carrots. Bushh beans and peas. You will have everything you need for abn organic stew, How does that sound?
That sounds fantastic! I really hope I get the job now. Do you have any advice for how to not get bored/stay focused when working from home?
I do! N will they let you control your start and end times?
I'm honestly not sure yet, It is a question I planned to ask at the interview. Is that something your company allow you to do?
Yes. If they will, Start later, And get your garden work done first. Make sense?
Yes completely, I will see what they say at the interview. Do you ever buy supermarketveg or do you grow enough for all your needs?
Grow all my own. Do you know how to flash freeze or can?

persona: I play games.
I am a recording engineer.
I'm 46. I'm a single dad. My favorite recording artist died last year.
I play Counter Strike. I watch Counter Strike professionals play.
dialogue: How long have you been playing Counter Strike?
About a year now. Have you eveer tried it?
No i haven't, Do you recommend it? Since i play first person shooters and enjoy tim consuming RPGs, Its hard for me to move onto the next game.
Soo is call of duty ever played in teams?
Oh yes, They have several way to play it multiplayer, Capture the flag is my favorite one, On Call of Duty mobile i enjoy team death match.
And what is an rpg event?
Imagine the board game Clue, In real life but with a post apocalyptic world twist. You savange for things that you and your team may need, And fight over resources.
And you play professionally. Who is paying you for this?
Yes, Well there's my fans of course, Or followers, And in this day and age if you can conduct yourself professionally, Even in the gaming world, You can score a sponsor or two.
How do I get started getting paid?

At first its hard, But if you just enjoy it, You can grow. Twitch is a great place to start. All you need is a good camera to record yourself, A good comouter to record you playing your favorite game, A challenging game, And you simply upload the video, If people like watching you, They will become your followers. Eventually you can live stream, You play live while people watch you and send you messages, And in occasions they will send you money.
Do they interfere much with your play?

persona: I have a pet cow.
I work for my parents who are dairy farmers.
I like country music and line dancing.
I drive a big Ford F150 truck. I don't transport things often with my truck.
I hardly read.
dialogue: I was looking at trucks and it made me wonder how reliable has your F150 been?
It's been good to me. I know some people don't like em, But I've always been a Ford fan.
How much will it pull? I'm thinking about getting a couple of horses and I know horse trailers are pretty heavy to tow.
Oh I'm not sure about that, I don't pull things too often. But it's never gotten stuck in the mud at my parents farm! Do you have horses?

Not yet! I'd love to get some but I'm not sure how much it will cost in total, You know? Gotta think about all the little things not just feed and boarding. I may just wind up getting big dogs instead.
I've been around a bunch with my parents farm connections, But I don't know a ton about them. They definitely look like a big commitment, Though.
Your parents have a dairy farm, Right? How's that work going?
Pretty good. It's kind of the only work I've ever known, Will probably take over some day. I love taking care of the cows.
Cows seem so sweet. That's good, I suppose, Because they're SO huge! Do they ever frighten you?
They can get a little rowdy at times, But not too frightening. I'm used to it. It's like having big dogs, When you see them come up from calves they're not as scary.
Yeah, I suppose that's true! They're beautiful animals. Are they friendly, Like do they come up for pets and scratches, Or are they more like... Meh?
Depends on the cow. The one that I raised like a pet loves scratches and playing. Others just kinda want to do their own thing.

persona: I majored in chemistry. I owe a lot of student loans.
I hate orange. I don't have a partner.
I like clubbing. I think clubs are not as good now.
I work at a bookstore. My job has been hit pretty hard.
I own a kindle. I prefer physical books most of the time. I like historical biographies and self-help books. I read books on personal finance. I want to read JL Collins' book.
dialogue: So did you have any luck finding Collins's book? I can lend you my copy if you need to read it that badly.
Thanks for asking! Yes, I was able to find it online. It was hard to find it though. What have you been reading recently?
I've been reading John Carter's book on Mastering the trade. It's a bit dense, But has a lot of good advice on how to become financially independent. Maybe you would be interested!
I might need to read that! Especially with how much I owe in student loans, It might give me some ideas of how to improve my finances.
Student loans are a massive burden - I feel for you. Though hopefully your degree in Chemistry has lead to ample job opportunities?

Yes! I am actually working at the lab doing research but this job has huge opportunities for getting skills and promotion. But just looking at how much I owe gives me anxiety. But guess what, One little step at the time, Right? How is your husband doing?

That's amazing to hear about your job. And you're exactly right - one step at a time is the only way to get anywhere! My husband is doing well - he was just promoted to Chief of Surgery, And I could not be more proud of him.
That's amazing! I always thought that he was such a talented surgeon. Has he been even busier because of that?
So kind of you to say! Yes, He is much busier with all of the new responsibilities, So I have a lot of free time these days. Maybe I should join you out clubbing sometime soon!
I always find it relaxing to go out at the end of the stressful week and just dance it out. Let me know when you are ready to join me! Are you thinking of finding a job?

I am totally ready - let me know next time you're going out, And I'm there! As to finding a job.... Well, Since my husband's promotion, He's encouraged me to really take a shot at making my income from day trading, So I've been really studying up. I am a bit nervous that I won't succeed-- but like you said, One step at a time!
I think that's a great idea! And it gives you a lot of flexibility. I think with your knowledge you will be successful. And this is a type of thing that you learn through experience.

persona: I'm in high school. I'm a homecoming queen. I want to be a physical therapist.
I love music.
I find classical music relaxing. My favorite music is chilled out Ibiza classics.
I am a runner. I use the app Strava for running.
dialogue: I found a good app for tracking my runs!
Nice! What do you like about the tracking app?
I like that it tracks all my steps. It's very useful. What about you? Have you been running lately?
I've been training for a 5k, And I've found that Strava helps me keep track of my progress.
Wow! That's amazing! I bet that's a lot of hard work!
Haha it really is! But I like to run first thing in the morning with some good music before school. It helps me get into a good mindset for the rest of the day.
Do you also listen to classical music while you run, Or would you rather listen to something less relaxing?

While I do listen to classical to relax, When I'm running I like more upbeat stuff, Like club music. Do you listen to rock when you run? I find that music helps me stay focused and motivated when I get tired.
Yes! And it's upbeat enough to keep me motivated and focused. I agree with you about music helping.
Do your horses like rock? I think I read somewhere that animals generally prefer classical music, But I'm curious what your experience with your horses has been.
Generally, Horses like classical music but I think it's all in what they listen to while they grow. Yes, My horses love rock music!
That's so fun! Do they have any favorite rock bands?

persona: I am in remission.
I have many kids and grandkids.
I make clothes for my family.
One of my grandkids dropped my phone and broke the screen. It is hard for me to afford fixing it. I am not going to let my grandchildren use my phone anymore. I don't like YouTube.
dialogue: Okay, I just sent my backup phone, So you should be expecting a package!
Thank you! My grandchildren are not the most responsible.
Thats okay! They are kids so what can you expect? Have you made any clothes lately, I'm interested to hear more about what you can make.
I made dresses for my granddaughters just last week. I can make most anything.
Very cool. I'm surprised you don't like youtube, They have alot of videos about making close I bet.
I learned to sew at a very young age. There is just a lot of nonsense on YouTube, In my opinion.
Oh I see, Yes you're probably right.
Pretty awesome you help with the homeless.
Oh thanks, Yes I like to donate clothing, But also I like to give my time cooking and serving the homeless at my local church.
That's great. I like to make things for the cancer hospital I used to go to.
Oh thats nice, It must have felt good to help people in similar situations as you.
Yes, Definitely feels good to give back.

persona: I like vegetables.
I come from Australia. I grew up in Sydney.
I have a job. My family moved here when I was 15.
dialogue: Do you do any gardening?
Yes, I grow my ownveg. I grow tulips too. Do you like any other sports?
That's good, I primarily like NASCAR. It is a great a sport to me, I like that speed and the thrill that comes along with the sport. Do you watch any motor sports or sports in general?
I like motorbikes. I'm a big fan of MotoGP. You have a favourite driver?

I do have a favorite diner, I like tacos. But that's fun! Yeah I'm trying to get into motorbikes and those grand prix style sports and events. They appear so thrilling. Have you ever ridden a motobike?
I used to ride the dirt bikes when I was a kid in Sydney. Loved the speed and competing. Haven't got back into it here.
Oh nice that's fun! Yeah that's the reason I love NASCAR the speed is so fun. I hope to try out dirtbiking some time!
You'd recommend catching some NASCAR races in person? Or do you just watch on tv? I should check it out.

I would watch it on TV first to get a feel for how it goes, But if you like speed it is so exhilarating. But there is nothing like being there in person and getting a feel for just how fast these cars are going. I'm sure it's the same for motor bike riding, But they can sometimes get up to over 200 mph which is something crazy to witness in person!
That is insane! Must be pretty awesome to see in person. MotoGP bikes are around 200mph too, But I've never seen that in person.

Yeah with how fast they go, They need so much protective equipment too! I know that NASCAR drivers are primarily wearing fire prevention suits. I think they wear way more protective gear in motor bikes! Can never have too much protection when you could easily fall onto the road! Haha do you have a lot of your own equipment then?

persona: My name is Sara. I am 7 years old. I have secret powers. I can freeze time. I have a wild imagination.
I love Christmas.
I am lonely. I live in an orphanage. I have friends who I think have secret powers. I believe that we protect the orphanage.
I want to find a family that also has powers. I want to use my powers for good. I am scared of supervillains.
I want a dog as a sidekick.
dialogue: I've met a nice dog I think you'd like. He was fully trained to help his blind owner. He's almost a superhero himself!
Wow, He sounds like he'd be the perfect sidekick! What type of dog was he?
He was a yellow lab. He was very friendly and loved people. What type of super powers do you think your friends have?
We all have different powers that help us work together. One can go invisible and another stretches and another can move really fast. Today we foiled a plot to poison the food in the orphanage.
I'm glad you were able to stop the bad guys. Have you had any luck finding a dog as a sidekick? You would have loved my lab.
No, We aren't allowed to have pets here. But one day when I find a family and get out I just know I'll get a brave dog to fight crime with me. I worry about losing my friends though.
I'm sorry to hear that. I live alone so I don't really know what it's like to have a family. I wish I was able to make friends, But I've never been very good at it so I understand your concern.
Did you never have a wife or children? I think that's too bad but I'd love to come visit you sometime, Or you could come to the orphanage and visit me if you're able.
I had a wife and two children. You would like them. They have imaginations like you would not believe. Sometimes I think the stories they tell me are actually true.
I love to hear stories. Perhaps you could tell me some of the stories that they tell you. Or maybe you should write a book full of their stories.

They are amazing. They are always going on adventures to different worlds and meeting new people or creatures. I could certainly fill a book full of their stories. I must admit I am not much of a writer, But I do love reading. Do you read a lot?
Yes, There are a lot of books here at the orphanage and a lot of time to read them. I like fantasy stories and comic books, Though I sometimes am told I shouldn't read so many comics.

persona: I am in Massachusetts. I work on roofs. I am handy with hammers. I build and fix houses.
I take after my father. My dad taught me to use a hammer. I work for my dad. I will probably own the business one day.
I have six cats. I love my cats. I got two sibling cats at one time. Four of my cats are rescues. I would get more cats.
I do not have kids.
dialogue: I played a show at a bar last night.
Nice! Do you do covers or original work?
These days I seem to be doing more cover work because it's popular. I have done some original stuff in the past though.
That's amazing. I wish I knew how to play the electric guitar. Do you have any advice on how to get started?

Go online to YouTube and do some searches. There are a lot of amazing channels on there with instructional videos. It takes time though to really get good, So don't be impatient. Stick with it and put the practice in.
That's a good idea! Maybe I'll start with acoustic to see if I enjoy that, Then invest in electric if I ever get decent at it. How long have you been playing?
Sheesh, I've been playing for probably 20 years or so at this point. I'm not even sure. Maybe you'll like bass instead. Might want to look into that as well.
It's funny you mention bass, When I was a kid, I wanted to learn how to play the bass! Unfortunately, My school didn't have a band. It was a very small school.
Sounds like you should give it a go now! I think that's where I would start if I were you. If you don't like bass you can always try something else later.
That is true. Thank you for the advise! Now off to search some videos on YouTube!
As far as bass goes I would look updavie504 on YouTube.
Thanks! Ill look him up now.

persona: I am angry. I hate school.  I don't have good grades. I have more than one parent.
I don't have that many friends. I am a 12 year old girl. I stay away from other girls.
I have long red hair and blue eyes. I don't bleach my hair. My hair goes down to my waist.
My favorite class is art. I want a career in art or design. My favorite types of art are sculpture and pottery. I practiced a lot making pottery.
I don't have a pet.
I am not responsible. I don't complete my chores on time.
dialogue: If you are really passionate about art, Go for it! Follow your heart.
I will but I don't want to be in school to do it.
I can understand that. But maybe school would help you make connections with people so you can make moves in the art world?
I guess so but many great artists are dropouts. I want to work. I can teach you pottery.
That would be really cool. I've always wanted to learn. Don't I need a lot of stuff to do it, Though?
Not a lot.. I can take you shopping for the essentials. That'll get me out of the house. I am bored.
That would be fun. Is it easy to find the supplies one needs for pottery?
I guess so. We will find out together. Hey.. Do you ever combine dog training with dancing? Lol.
I have not! But that would be a hoot. Do you think the dog could dance?
I bet dogs can do anything. You can also dress the dancing dog with the latest quirky fashion. What an act.
I just today saw a hilarious post of dogs wearing fishnet stockings! Have you ever dressed a dog up in a costume?
Nope. My parents wont get me a dog. They think I wont take care of it.

persona: I live in America but My family live in South America.
I have a friend named Noah till 1 year and can speak Hmong. I have 2 friends who speak a different langues.
I use Hmong but my dad is bilingual.
I'm in school and very busy. I text my family every day.
I've never been to San Francisco, but I'd like to.
I speak Hmong and English is my second language. I am not very good at it and use my computer and phone to translate.
I loved visiting NYC. I like all the people and things to do in NYC.
dialogue: I've made my final choice, I'm going to New York City!
Congratulations! What is your plan?
I am planning to move there next month. I am currently looking at apartments to rent in the area. What part of NYC did you like best when you visited?
I enjoyed the whole Manhattan island, But personally i enjoy coney island for the hotdogs.
Oh, I will have to check that out when I get there. I am excited that I will have a lot of different options compared to where I am at now.
What do you plan on doing in NYC? You mentioned wanting to be a lawyer, Are you going to attend law school there?
Yes, I am enrolling in school in NYC and I also plan to get a job to help support me while I am in school. Do you have any plans to visit your family?
Yes i am planning on going back next month for my mothers birthday. I am exciting to go see my family. What burrow are you planning on moving to?
I am not sure yet, I am still researching apartments. Do you have any recommendations?
I say anything in Hells Kitchen is nice, Brooklyn, And if you want a more diverse setting i recommend Harlem.
Thank you for the recommendations! I will look into them. How is your schooling going?
Its going great next week are my finals and i am feeling good about them.

persona: My name is Leigh. I am 34.
I live in a city. I like to explore the city.
I play trombone, alto saxophone, baritone, and trumpet. I want to learn to play violin. My father plans violin.
I don't run. I work at a shelter. I started volunteering in high school.
I didn't go to homecoming.
I can't run a K.
dialogue: Did you find any interesting food during your last trip to the Chinatown street?
I found a new place, Well... New to me, That served the best steamed buns. I will go back there again. Do you like Chinese food?
I do! It's one of my favorite quisines. Do you like indian food? That's my other favorite.
I have yet to experience a lot of India cuisine, What are some dishes you would recomend?
My favorites are saag andtikka masala. It's a really interesting flavor palate with so many spices and cool things to try. You live in a city so there must be a lot of cool restaurants near you!

There is so much to explore here and I am trying to widen my verizons. I use to be to very picky about my food. But I have found out,,,,, I like more food than I originally thought. I bet you stay fit no matter what you eat due to the running.

It's good you're willing to explore new things! The hard thing with running is it makes you hungry but you can't always eat when hungry or you'll eat back more than you burn so it is a delicate balance. But I love to have a cheat day once a week to eat whatever treats my heartdsires!
How often do you get a cheat day?
Usually onc e a week, Sometimes twice if i've worked out a lot. I usually track my calories but on cheat days I don't, And let myself have whatever I want for the most part.
Is it difficult to track your calories? Do you have a good App that helps?
It isn't hard once you just get used to doing it. I use myfitnesspal and I like it. It's free and easy to use.
Do you set yourself goals or rewards that are not food related? I have been thinking about getting back on the healthy path.

persona: I am 4 years old and enjoy coloring.
My mom is a pole dancer.  My mother works until late into the night. I have a pet turtle. My dolls and turtle are my only friends.
I spend most of my time inside.
I sometimes have to eat food from the alleys.
I have a doll named Katie that is a ballet dancer. I have three dolls named Katie, Sally and Ken.
I have a turtle named Miley who tells me stories.
There is shooting every night in my neighborhood.
dialogue: My favorite subject was dance. I did very well, So well, In fact, That I just received word that I got the job I wanted as a dance coach at a high school!
Omg that is great, I would love to be a dancer when I am older.
If you work hard, You could totally do it! It's best to start young!
My mom cannot afford to put me in classes. We can barley afford food.
Maybe she could be your teacher? Since your mom is a dancer, You have a unique advantage!
She does not do the style of dance I would like to do. I want to be a ballerina. What style of dance do you do?
I do ballet! A friend of mine owns a studio where they offer some scholarships. Your mom should look for something like that in your area!
Wow that is so cool. Yeah I will ask her next time I see her to see if she can apply for me thank you.
Absolutely! I really love seeing young people pursue their dreams. It's why I took this job!
If I dont get in maybe you could help me a little bit if you have the time.
I'd be happy to! Perhaps you can put me in touch with your mother and I can help her work something out for you.
Thank you so much, You just made me so happy. I cannot wait to tell my mom.

persona: I go to the gym a lot. I enjoy the treadmill and a rowing machine.
I live in Ohio.
I will be moving soon for personal reasons. I am from a small town. I am moving to a bigger town.
I have 2 dogs, a springer spaniel and a labrador.
I want to find an area with nightlife and parks. I don't want to drive much.
dialogue: I found a city that you might like to move to!
Oh really!? What were you thinking? Hopefully it's got lots to do in walking distance.
It is in vermont. There are lots of places for hiking.
Oh sounds nice, I've never been. How are the winters there? Does it get cold?
Yes, A little bit colder than Ohio. You have to wear winter gear to hike in winter. But there are lots of places where you can hike with your dogs.
Yeah, I bet they'd love that. My lab slows down in the summer a lot. I'll have to plan a visit soon. Have you ever been?
I think I will try to find a romantic partner online. What do you think about it?
That's a popular place to look. I have some friends who met that way and seem pretty happy. I'd so go for it.
Yeah, I don't think I will cheer up by keeping indoors and alone. Maybe I should get a dog too, What do you recommend for a first dog?

They're great to have around. Depends on your activity level and space. Big dogs are super friendly, But of course need more walking, And more space. Any dog can be a great dog if you train it right. Spend some time at your local shelter and look around!
That is a good idea. It is that how you got your dogs?
Yeah, I think they have so much personality. You can really tell how much they appreciate their lives after the shelter I think.

persona: I love hamburgers and french fries, but not soda.
I am married and i own a house.
I might get a dog this weekend. I want a big dog. I met a lab at the shelter, and I havne't stopped thinking about him.
I have a decent sized yard and there is a dog park in my neighborhood.
dialogue: I have to know! Did you get a dog last weekend?
I did! I got the lab that I met and he's adorable :) his name is Ben! Do you want to come around and see him next weekend if you're not too busy walking other dogs?!.
I'd love to! I may have a dog with me, Is he friendly with other dogs?

Yeah he's friendly with other dogs, He is really calm and placid! Did you manage to do any kayaking this week? I've always wanted to try it but i'm not that strong of a swimmer - would that be a problem?
I haven't yet. I want to soon though with the weather getting nicer. I could show you some weekend, It's not too hard and lots of fun.
That would be amazing, I look forward to it! Do you Kayak in open water, Or on rivers? I don't suppose the dogs could fit in the kayak as well could they?!.
I find rivers, But we could find a local lake or something to practice on. If we bring a friend they could sit with the dogs. Does your lab swim at all?

Nice, I bet rivers are a bit more complicated and dangerous? My husband would definitely come with us, So he could mind the dogs :) He does swim, But I'm not sure he enjoys it that much .. He always looks really flustered when he comes out .. a bit like me!

It's not too dangerous depending on where you go. This sounds like a nice day though. I'll pick up some food and we can have lunch or something. I can bring some balls and the dogs can chase them around.

Aw that sounds soo good I can't wait! I haven't seen you since you said you were going to start your PHD - did you get all of that sorted? I bet you can't wait - are you going to keep walking dogs or move into a different career using your qualifications?
I am excited, It's been a long time in the works. I think I will. I'm staying in town, So I think it will be a nice way to take a break from studying.

Yeah sounds like a plan, You need something else to take your mind off the everyday grind! So how many dogs do you tend to walk at a time? I can't imagine walking more than one - he's an absolute nutter even when he's on a lead!

persona: I like cooking and eating mexican food. I like trying new food. I like cooking shows.
I have visited a lot of countries.
I need to get a job. I'm thinking about teaching economics online so I can still travel the world.
My favorite region is the Caribbean. I like Jamaica, St. Lucia, Aruba, The Dominican Republic, and Barbados. I think cruises are the best vacation.
I have a yacht that has a satellite internet system, so I can teach from it.
I watch documentaries on Netflix. I have seen Free Solo but not Dawn Wall.
dialogue: Have you applied to teach economics anywhere?
Not yet but I am considering my options. Have you seen any good war documentaries recently?
Yes, I have seen a few and I haverewatched a couple that I have found really interesting over the years. Do you have any upcoming travel plans?
No plans at the moment, I want to sort out my teaching platform first. But once that's done I will start planning for real.
Okay, That is so nice that you will be able to teach from your yacht! You will still be able to travel all over the world.
That's the plan! I love the carribean but can't wait to travel to Australia and the Maldives.
I have always wanted to go to both of those places, I really wish that I would take more time to travel.
Won't you have time to do that now that you are retired?
Yes that is what I am hoping for but I always seem to make an excuse for why I can't go. I really need to make it a goal. Have you tried any new food recently?
Oh, I went to this new fusion restaurant, It was indian-chinese! Interesting combination but it was delicious! Quite spicy. How about you?
We recently got a new hamburger spot in town. They put anything you can imagine on their burger but I just stuck with what I usually get. The burger was still very good.
You're making me hungry. I haven't had burgers in ages.
