persona: I received powers from surgery I had last week. My heart is outside my body, it has a metal frame so I have little worries with it beyond avoiding crowds
I also had a brain transplant and can move objects with my mind.

I claim to be telepathic, but it's difficult to use my powers to protect myself so I mostly use them to help others. People are often freaked out by me and/or my claimed powers. I claim to have saved a pedestrian by stopping a car with my powers.
I would like help with my appearance.
dialogue: Aside from your awesome new superpowers, How are you feeling doing with the recover of your surgery? It was what, Only about two weeks ago. Did you also gain powers to help you heal?
I mean it is an adjustment to take in these new capabilities. I was thinking that maybe I could help you redecorate and you could help me with my appearance?
I think that's a fair trade-off! What in particular do you need help with?

I could ask the same of you! What would you like help with in your house? I would like help with covering my heart since it is now outside of my body. Do you have any suggestions on this metal contraption that protects it?

As I always say, If you've got it, Flaunt it! Try wearing clothes that accentuate that unique feature! I could use some help with hanging heavy objects like chandeliers and such. Your powers would be very helpful.

Yes, They really could be of use! I don't mind helping you lifting heavy objects so that we can redecorate your house! I appreciate your suggestion on my appearance. Maybe we could set a date and time to get together and tackle both issues at once?
I think that's a good plan! What does your schedule tend to be like?
I am pretty open to be honest. What sort of heavy objects would we be working with though? I may need to plan and prepare before we get together.
I have a few chandeliers, And there are some heavyurns and sculptures that I need to move out of my garage.

Okay, That doesn't sound too daunting. I am thinking maybe early next week we could probably get everything in order, If your schedule will allow? Are you going to be referencing a theme or anything for your new house decorations?
That would work perfectly! I'm going for a classical theme. Lots of marble and plaster and such. I think you'll like it!
That does sound lovely! I think maybe we can take inspiration from your home decorating to my appearance possibly?

persona: I love country music. I have met taylor swift.
I am a manager in convenience store.
I drive nissan but I need new one.
I am 40 year old woman.
I like frogs and frog legs.
I have listened to Maggie Sajak songs. I have been listening to reggae lately. My favorite song by Protoje is "Who Knows" featuring Chronixx.
dialogue: I finally checked out Protoje. You were right! He's great! Can you recommend some other artists you like?
Ah, What a great artist. I really like a lot of his music. I also like Jesse Royal when I'm listening to that type of music. I can send you my playlist!
Ah fair enough, He's a man though and I don't listen to male artists! I think I saw you working in the store last weekend - do you know if you guys managed to get any organic vegetables in this week?

Fair, I'm sure there are plenty of great female artists too. I just think of the vocals like an instrument in the mix rather than a gender. We get our shipments on Tuesdays. So come early Wednesday morning for the good stuff!

Yeah I understand, But I feel that the music industry is just too male orientated so I want to show support to just females ya know! Great news, I'm glad you guys finally got on board with the Organic food, I can't stand the taste of the mass produced stuff! Did you see the new electric car that came out last week, I definitely think you should replace your Nissan with this one!
I have to agree with that, Support diversity on all fronts where you can. Hmmm I haven't. I was thinking about electric. I don't drive it very far and I think it'd be a good idea. Who makes it?
It's made by Honda, So it's still Japanese which is good, And seemingly reliable :) If you had a charging station at your house it would be perfect - especially if it was solar powered!!.

I was looking at solar panels too. We still have some good tax credits here, But I get a decent amount of shade. Who installed yours? I'd love to have a few, Even if they only end up accounting for a bit of my power. Was it expensive to install yours?

It did cost a little bit to set it up, I can't remember the name of the company to be honest, I'll have to have a look and let you know! Apparently it takes about 5 years to recoup the cost, But then it starts paying you for your energy! All the frogs legs you can cook without having to worry about the power you're using ;).
Haha, Yeah I'd be a good long term investment, And probably increase the value of my house as well. I'd appreciate that yeah, Gotta start going green.
I rarely use any power now anyway, Since I stopped shaving my body hair keeps me warm - I can even use my armpit hair as a scarf when it gets too cold!
Wow, That's intense. What do you do in the colder months?

persona: I like eating tacos and watching nascar.
My coworkers make great tacos on fridays. I started working in construction when I was 16.
Fish tacos are my favorite. I like pineapple salsa on top of my tacos.
I think it's great to spend time with your coworkers. I work in construction. I wish I had gone into engineering instead.
dialogue: I came across reviews for a taco spot online that i think you should check out after your race.
Absolutely, What is its name?
It called Taco Jacks. They do some really good chicken tacos there.
Awesome, Chicken tacos are the gold standard. Have you ever had fish tacos? They give a really good twist on the traditional taco.
I actually have not. If we go to Taco Jacks I will try one. Are you ready for your race?
I am always ready to race. There is something about the excitement of going fast that I can not get enough of. Have you ever been to nascar?
Thats an awesome perspective to have, I admire that. I have yet to been maybe I come down and watch you.
Yes you should come and watch. I cannot promise to win though, I just love the feeling of going fast.
Im sure you will have an good outcome though. You work so hard. But that sounds like a plan I will be cheering you on.
I will look out for you at the side. Sometimes I wish I had gone into engineering as a career, Then I could get to work on the race cars as well.
Maybe you do an online course that way you can do it when you have time too, That way you will just become a car master.
Thanks, That's a great idea. I never thought about doing an online course. It would certainly help learn while I still work. Do you think online works for engineering subjects though?

persona: I can't cook well so it is hard to eat healthy. I am fat because of travelling and trying local food.
I own a yacht. I travel a lot. I am a sailor.
Last time I ran was 10 years ago when I was 13.
I want to improve my fitness.
dialogue: Have you been out sailing in the last few days?
Not yet, I've been getting the boat prepped. It needed some repairs, But I plan on going this weekend!
Since you're not sailing how about joining me for a short run?
Man, I really should but I'm so slow. I'd don't want to hold you back.
I'd love the company and we'll definitely take it slow. I'm still recovering from yesterday's run.
Well I appreciate the help. I don't know how long I'll be able to go. I have no idea how you run marathons.
You dont need to.. Ok let's start with a brisk walk. We can get a subway sandwich on the way. They have loads of healthy food.
That'd probably be good too. I need to eat healthy too. Well in return for all the help, I'll have to bring you on the yacht sometime.
Deal. I have never been on a yacht. Thanks.
It's really peaceful and enjoyable. Ok, So what else do you recommend? You're motivating me. Eat healthy and run, What else should I be doing?
I can also teach you how to cook healthy meals that are also delicious. Then maybe we can explore some easy fun exercises.
That'd be great. I am sorta ashamed of it. I used to be in pretty decent shape, Then life and other things took over and before I knew it I was huge haha.

persona: I like wine and coffee.
I coach little league. I coach kids from 6 to 11.
I drive a mini van.
I go to photography school. I don't think photography and painting are alike.
I have a husband and 5 sons. We take turns watching the kids.
My older sons play baseball. I organize their team practices.
dialogue: Do you think that your sons and their baseball team would make a good subject for your photography?
I take pictures of them at their games and practices. Every now and then I can capture a movement that is awesome on film.
That sound's good. I imagine a good action shot would look great as a big canvas or something.
I think so. Have you thought about getting back into painting?
Well I have been considering photography - there is alot of amazing street art near me and I think they would make great prints. Any tips for me?
Lighting is important but just having fun with it is more important. Keep clicking until you get the shot you like. What is the street art about?
There is so much of it and it's all very different. There is a whole part about climate change near by with gorgeous scene of wildlife and nature. What is your favorite thing to photograph?

Oh that sounds lovely. I love to photograph nature and the sort of stillness in it. Sunrises, A butterfly on a flower, Things like that. I will take a photo of anything though, Always have my camera with me. My boys always make fun photography subjects. Have you heard from your children?
I think to start out I should try to photograph lots of different things to see what works! Unfortunately not, I was hoping they might call this weekend but no :(.
That's a great idea. When we get together this weekend, You will get a feel for it. Oh, That's a shame. They may be busy, Have you tried calling them?
Yes, I am looking forward to getting all your advice! No, I normally always phone them but I get the sense it's an inconvenience so I don't bother anymore.

Oh. I am sure your not an inconvenience. But I understand always being the one to call... People seem to forget a phone call works both ways. Was thinking we could get something for lunch this weekend... What do you like to eat?

persona: I work  at Burger King. I am 19. I grill in Burger King.
I am drug and booze free.
I play music. I want to be a rock star. I play the electric bag pipes I invented.  I haven't played them in a week because I hurt my lips on them. I'm interested in playing my bagpipes at a cafe.
My name is Cletus Hucklberry.
I like live music. I don't like how live music crowds drink so much beer.
I like Scottish black metal. I play Scottish metal on my bagpipes. I write my own music. I wrote a song called "Shake your Bum Bum".
I still live at home and I'm currently looking for ways to move out. I don't have a new key for my current living situation yet.
dialogue: I got a notification saying the cafe is having another local musician performing soon. You should check it out.
I have been craving a good folk concert, With acoustic or just a small band. Thanks for the news. Curious what kind of music, Or band you may be thinking of?
He's an acoustic guitarist, From what I understand. Plays in the style of Jim Croce. I love Jim Croce!
Classic, Jim Croce. Now I have one of his songs going through his head, "Time in a Bottle" - kind of a haunting song, You think?
Yes, I think Time in a Bottle is one of the most beautiful songs ever! Croce did a lot of story songs too.
I sure hope he was paid for his writing. Actually maybe I should research who wrote Croce's big hits. Do you like to sing?
I think he wrote most of them himself. I envy someone with that talent! I like to sing. Other people don't like me to sing! Haha.
I hear you there! Hehe. My grandma used to laugh and say, "You better be good, Or I'll sing!" She wasn't much of a singer either, But she sang loud sometimes.
Can you sing? Not that I can imagine you can sing while playing your bagpipes, But I mean in generaL.
Actually I love to harmonize with other singers, Love to have just voices, Or a cappella. Love simple melodies and harmonies.
So do I! You do have a fair amount of musical talent! writing, Singing, Playing an instrument. I wish I could do any of those!
It mostly is, For feeling good or just getting emotions out sometimes. Especially those old ballads, Really can work through things. Performers need an audience too, Like you.

persona: I like to swim. I coach swimming.
I am a guy. I live in India. I'd like to go to and work in America.
I am studying on my own to become a programmer. I am not in school.
I am not married. My mom wants me to get married and stay in India. My mom is afraid of discrimination in America.
I want to work with Apple products. I am looking for work as a freelancer.
I do not like snow.
dialogue: Why do you want to work with Apple products?
Apple is one of the most innovative companies in the world. Not only would it pay well but I'd love to help design iPhones and other products.
It does seem like a good job. I imagine it has really strong job security, I don't think iPhones will be going anywhere anytime soon!
I don't think so either. You mentioned that you created music recently? Maybe you could get some of that on iTunes one day!

Maybe so! I'm not sure I'm going to make a hobby out of it though. There seems to be something... Missing. I'm going to keep up with my studies but I think I'll focus more of my hobbies outside. Do you have any outdoor hobbies other than swimming?
I do actually. I like to hike as well. Going for nice walks is a great past time as well. Nothing would ever top swimming for me though. What about you? What do you like to do outside school?
I did track when I was younger. I still run and since I moved here, I've learned to surf. I'm having a lot of fun with it! It took me a long time to pick it up though.

Despite loving the water and swimming, Surfing is not something I really got into. Tell me how it was. I've always been curious and wondered if it was worth trying. Not to mention, Some of my swim students also surf.

Have you ever tried skateboarding? It's a lot like skateboarding in that the main thing is learning how to keep your balance, Only at least in surfing when you fall it doesn't hurt! The equipment can be expensive but when you're first starting out a lot of bigger beaches will have surf outfitters where you can rent everything you need for the day, And they usually have someone to give lessons too!

Well I might have to give it a try. With me being a swimmer, If I fall off, I would surely be okay. I did skateboard when I was younger but I had a small accident and kind of moved away from it. I'm a bit more interested in surfing thanks to you. Any tips you can give me?

Hmm. Well, The way I started off was on a 'boogie board' which is sort of like a surfboard only you rest your upper body on it instead of standing. If you get a good wave with it you kind of feel like Superman! That kind of gets you used to what you have to do and how to move a flat board to maneuver around the wave.

It does look like quite an amazing rush! My students and I went on a trip once to the beach. A couple of them were showing off their surfing skills. They tried and tried to get me to do it. I didn't however and told them no. Now I may be able to surprise them once I learn how. I appreciate the help!

persona: I have a boyfriend. We just rented an apartment and we move in next Tuesday.
I do photography as a side business.
I teach fourth grade. I teach history.
I speak Spanish, English and French.
I prefer muted tones of red and silver.
I go to concerts.
I like to travel. I live near a lake.
dialogue: What techniques do you use to help you keep student's attention when you suspect them getting bored?
I just try and keep the lessons engaging for myself. I sort of look back at them, If I'm bored teaching them or don't look forward to it, My students will probably hate it too!
That's true. I love teaching so i always make it fun for the children. I also throw in singing during classes.

You know, Even the older kids like some of those silly activities. I have friends who teach middle school, And getting the kids up and moving usually helps a lot. I just don't think anyone does good sitting for too long.
I agree. What does your boyfriend do? Does he enjoy concerts and travel also?
He's not as much into the travel, But he'll keep up with me, So I appreciate that. He's actually the one that got me into concerts, Such a fun experience.
I bet there's a lot to photograph during concerts or will that be too much multitasking?
No you're right. Its a lot of fun to try and get some good shots, The hard part is getting close to the stage. Good ear protection and a nice lens helps.
How would you like to come to my gig this weekend? You can bring your camera.
That'd be a lot of fun! I can edit the photos up and you can use them for promotion or something.
Gracias. I cannot wait to see you there. Please bring your boyfriend if he's free.
He'd love it, We'll both be there!

persona: I love snow. I can roll in snow. I can not go to Disney.
I want to be like Pluto. I do not know how old I am.
I would like Mickey toys. I have a lot of Pluto memorabilia. I would like to declutter, but I can't bring myself to get rid of my Pluto items.
I like all kinds of candy. I don't like chocolate.
dialogue: Maybe I should look into selling my Mickey Mouse items.
Honestly now might be a good time to sell, Lots of people seem to be interested in childhood collectables lately. Do you need the money?
I want to buy more Mickey stuff but I really don't have the space for everything so that's why I was thinking of selling.
Ah, That makes sense! I've got the same problem. I'd love to have some new Mickey toys, But I've got so much already and I can't bring myself to get rid of anything. Do you know what you might sell?
I'm not sure yet. I need to sit and go through everything before I decide. I think I should also look at the prices things are currently selling for?

Yeah that's what I'd recommend. If I were going to sell I'd look online to see which of my items would sell for the highest prices and focus on those. I love all of my collectables equally, So I'm okay selling off just the highest price ones and keeping the rest.
Yes, I get that. I really want new things so I don't mind selling some. I will need to do that this weekend before I go to Disney next week.
If you need any help researching what to sell just let me know, I love this kind of stuff! It's so exciting you're going to Disney too, Anything new you want to see this time?
That's great, Thank you. I'm not sure, I think there is a new ride which I haven't been on yet so that's exciting. I generally don't have a plan when I go.

That's cool, Sometimes a big part of the excitement is just walking around and exploring to find what's new rather than relying too much on other peoples' advice. It's really fun to just immerse yourself while you're there.
Definitely I love just walking around taking everything in.
I need to go to Disney sometime, It's sad that my parents haven't wanted to take me and I can't find anyone else to go with.

persona: I live in Ohio. I am a doctor. I am trying to get a job in San Fransisco. I will move there if I get it. My daughter lives there. I am going to move for my daughter. I plan to visit my daughter a lot if I move close to her.
I go to the park for interaction. My favorite movie is Friday. My favorite show is the Walking Dead.
I like to paint.
dialogue: Have you heard back about that job yet?
Yes, I got it. So now I have to plan the move.
Oh wow, Congratulations! So what does your timeline for moving look like? When will you be starting your job?
I start the job in two months. I plan to move in 6 weeks after my notice period is finished.
Do you plan to buy or rent a home in California? Are you looking to be near the water?
I think, I will rent for 6 months until I now the city better and then buy somewhere. I'd like to be near the water.
That sounds like a good plan. How old is your daughter?
She is 3, Almost 4. What are you watching on tv just now?
That's cool, What a fun age! I was actually just watching some fanvid music videos on YouTube set to scenes from The Walking Dead... Some are so amazing!
It is a great age. I love Love Youtube. What is your favourite Walking Dead character?
I always liked Maggie the best. This show is rough though, You lose characters left and right and then way down the road they surprise you and there they are again. Lol.
It really does have a lot of plot twists in it.

persona: I am a dog walker. I like dogs.
I have one young child and I am pregnant. I am due in 4 months.
I like to kayak. I have a kayak trip soon.
dialogue: Turns out I have a new client that also likes to kayak. I told him you were going to teach me how to do it. He said he would give me pointers as well!
Are you sure you want to do it? I can definitely teach you the basics if you are willing to go with me on my next trip.

Yeah definitely! I feel like water sports are the final frontier for me when it comes to athletics. It also seems like a great way to forge bonds with clients. How late in your pregnancy do you expect to keep kayaking?

I'll keep going until I feel like I can't do it anymore. So, Who knows really? Anyway, Do you want to start out kayaking by doing something calm (like a lake) or should we aim for a river with rapids?
Hmm, Do you think it'd be easier for me to learn the techniques in calmer water? Or is it better to jump straight to rapids since that's where I want to end up eventually?
I think it would be better to start out in calm water. Once you have been able to practice the basics for a bit then we go to moving water. I think you'll be fine though.

That sounds reasonable, I definitely want to make sure I really know what I'm doing if I'm going to be kayaking with this client later on. It'd be a bad look for me to not have the fundamentals down before I meet with them.
Did you ever get your kayak that you were talking about buying? If not, I have one that you can borrow for the trip.
I haven't bought anything yet, I was going to hold off until I tried it first to make sure I could do it. It'd be wonderful if you'd let me borrow one! Are you sure it'll fit me? Haha.
Yeah, It'll fit you no problem. I suppose it's a good idea to wait. You don't know yet if you are going to want a kayak for calm waters or for rapids.
Okay cool, Do you know which calm lake we can go to? I'm not very familiar with the places around here that allow kayaking.
There is a pond/lake up by where my trip is going to be. It's also not far from where the river is located. It'll be a great time!

persona: I play video games. I play Fall Out. I am thin and blonde.
I love music.
I wear my favorite band t-shirts for inspiration when baking. I have a great PB cookie recipe.
My favorite band is Fall Out Boy.
I'm in Jersey. I am running a marathon next week.
I have at least one pet.
I played the recorder in school. I like baking and running.
dialogue: Remember those dog cookies I made? This time I also baked dog-safe treats shaped like dogs so I can share with them while I bake!
How do you make this cookies?

It's easy. Pumpkin puree, Peanut butter, Eggs, Whole wheat flour and cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice. You bake starting up to 20 minutes and the longer they are in, The crunchier they get. My dog likes it at 35 minute.
That sounds easy are they safe for human consumption?
They are safe for human consumption because it's all basic grocery items we use in our regular food. I'm not sure they would taste good to a human because there is no sugar in there.
Well what else can you bake?
For humans, I can bake pies, Cookies, Quiches, Cakes, Anything. For pets, I can bake cookie treats.
I would like to have a birthday cake soon can you make me one?

I definitely could. I would need your favorite flavors of cake and icing and if you want any fillings or toppings, How many people to serve and the theme. I would also need to be aware of any allergies anyone consuming it would have.
I would like a black forest cake baked with carrot and chocolate icing.

I could definitely do that for you. That's interesting to add the carrots but sounds like it would be yummy. Would you want the carrots in the cake as well as in the frosting or as a garnish to the frosting? A cream cheese base or a buttercream base and milk or dark chocolate frosting.

persona: I love music.
I just moved here.
I am interested in nursing. I work at a bar.  I go to school.  I pay for school myself.
It's frustrating to not have much free time.
I am shy and am not in any clubs.
Some customers at the bar are rude to me. I want to become a nurse and get out of the bar.
dialogue: So it turns out that my company is under investigation for unsafe working conditions, As of tonight.
Uh oh, So what happens to the mine while it's being investigated? Do you still need to go in to work?
Operations are shut down pending an internal investigation. I have no idea when we'll be able to return to the site.
Dang, That sounds really serious. Are you still getting paid?
Not from my company, I'll have to file for unemployment benefits. I'm going to take this time to look into school as well.
Ouch, I guess you can take this as the sign you needed to get a new job though. Any ideas what you want to study?
I'd like to get a masters in mechanical engineering. I have all my basic classes completed already.
Wow, That sounds like a pretty lucrative field to get into. Will your work experience at the mine help you with it?
Yes, It most definitely will. Especially when it comes to knowing the schematics and machinery that we use in the mine.
That's good. I wish I could say that same about nursing, My experience working at the bar hasn't helped my studies at all, Hahaha.
Are you sure, Taking care of patients and customers! Lol.
I guess you can say that, Though if my nursing patients end up being like my bar customers I think I might be getting into the wrong field!

persona: I volunteer.
I am old and retired. I used to be a fit gym teacher. I walk to stay active.
I love cheeseburgers.
I love war documentaries.
I do not drink wine. I drink beer. I like Lagers.
I live in Denver Colorado and have never been to Detroit.
dialogue: I just saw a trailer for a new war documentary on television.
That's amazing what was the name of the Documentary i need to check it out.
It's called Blood Upon The Snow - Russia's War, It's about Russia in World War 2 and it also gets into Stalin and the beginnings of the Cold War.
World war 2 documentary's are my favourite, Do you teach world war 2 in your class.
Mine too! We get into it at towards the end of our American history class, But only for a couple weeks and I wish I had more time to get into it in greater depth.
That great to hear, Do you teach any other subjects or is it just history.
I get to teach economics as an elective every other year, But otherwise it's just history. I don't mind it though, I really do love history. Did you ever teach anything other than gym?

No unfortunately it was just gym, But i still enjoyed it greatly, It a shame that I'm retired now. But as long as i do walks in should get by, Have you been on any walks recently i want on a long one just last week with my wife here in Denver!
I have actually! Yesterday I went on a wonderful walk along the Detroit river, I hadn't known about the walking path it had until recently!
That sounds wonderful did you take your dog with you.

Yeah of course, He loves going on walks with me. Especially when the weather is nice and cool like it has been in Detroit lately. Have you ever thought about getting a dog as a walking buddy now that you're retired?

I have been thinking about it, It does sound like a great idea but i have to think about the money and how much it's to cost. I also Volunteer at the dog shelter sometimes so maybe i could get one form there. Do you know what the best breed of dog is for someone like me (old and slow).

persona: I am a student. I am 12 years old. I hate school, especially gym.
I have long red hair and blue eyes. I cry a lot at school because the boys make fun of me.
I have gym class next period. We are playing dodgeball.
dialogue: I have a lot of new clients. I am so happy!
That sounds exciting. Have you come across any interesting breeds in your dog walking business? I am curious because I am thinking about getting a new dog myself.
I really like Maltese dogs. They are so tiny and cute. But they can be expensive to buy. Labs are nice if you want bigger. Will your parents let you get a dog?
Yes my parents are actually in favor of it. It will be a therapy dog of sorts because of the trouble I am having at school. They think it will improve my mood and reduce my general anxiety.
I am so sorry that boys are making fun of you. Don't listen to them. Things will get better. A dog will make you feel good. They give you such love.

I appreciate that and hope things will get better for me as well. I like your idea of getting a Lab, I think that breed would suit me well. The question now is whether I should go to a shelter and adopt an older one or get a puppy.

From my work with dogs I would highly recommend you adopt. There are so many beautiful dogs that need homes. You can literally save a life. Then they will be your best friend. You can also get a young dog from a shelter, Especially a lab.

I think I will do that then. I was just somewhat hesitant because I feel like I am letting down all of the other dogs that are also at the shelter. Even though I am helping one dog, I feel guilty that I am not capable of helping all of the dogs that I see there.

persona: I love horses. I own a german shepherd named Barnaby.
I do not like scorpions.
I work for the US postal service.
My favorite color is grey.
I like to paint in my spare time. I paint weekly as requested by clients.
I haven't ridden a horse in the last few months.
dialogue: Do you have any other painting work lined up at the moment?
Yes. Someone commissioned me to paint a seascape. I can't wait to get started!
That's fantastic. Is this for a private client or for a public space like a mural?
It is at a school. I can't wait to inspire them. Do you display any of your photographs anywhere?

Sometimes I post them online. And sometimes I'll frame photos I really like, Or photos of horses I really like. But mostly I just take them for myself. When I'm finished training a horse for someone I'll sometimes give them a framed photo of their horse if I have a good photograph of it.
That must be a great gift for them! I think they would really enjoy it. You should consider selling some. It can be a great way to earn extra money.
I never thought of that, But that's not a bad idea. When you get commissioned to do a painting, How have your clients usually found you? Word of mouth?
At this point people will share my info with others. When you are starting you can tell people about it. You can leave flyers at ranches or wherever. Make an ad online.
That's a good idea. I'll have to try to do that. Every dollar can help since school is expensive. Is your seascape going to be oils or water colors? And how large a painting is it going to be?
I like oils. I like the texture that you can get with that. This one is very large. But I have done things of all sizes. What size are your photos?
I like to get them as big as I can while still keeping the clarity, Of course. My camera is pretty good so I can take print pretty large photos and still keep them quite sharp.
A photograph can really be a work of art. Do you manipulate them after or what you take is the final product? I am always changing my paintings around.

persona: I graduated with a doctorate degree. I work in a hospital.
I haven't traveled far from home.
I like to go to the park, and go to my daughter's piano concerts.
My daughter in on vacation in TX.
I will put in time for vacation to go to Europe. My daughter wants to travel overseas and perform.
I exercise.
dialogue: I have been looking for new places to take you when we go to Europe this year.
Have you found any places we should go yet?
I would love to go to Florence and look at the architecture there, And visit the Duomo. Maybe we can take a train to Barcelona afterward and get some paella!
I have never had paella before, It sounds interesting. I have also always wanted to go to Florence and Barcelona. I am getting more and more excited for this trip.
That's great to hear. Maybe we can scout some fun places out and next time we can bring your daughter as well. I bet she would love gelato. Maybe we can find some piano concerts for her.
That would be great! How much longer do you have left in school?
Just one more year until I graduate. Then I want to work for a bit and maybe go back for a phd. What is your doctorate in?
It is in medicine. I work in pediatrics-it is very challenging but also very rewarding.
Wow, I bet that is rewarding work indeed. I get a lot of children in my candy shop--I hope my candy never makes any children sick!
I hope not either! I am sure they are fine as long as they do not eat too much. How long have you worked at the candy shop for?
It was my father's shop, And I can remember helping him stock the shelves since I was a little girl. Of course, Back then lollipops were only a nickel--not like these days.
Oh how neat! And you don't want to take over when he retires?

persona: I love photography. I love to take close-up pictures of my food. I know a lot about cameras.
I like kids.
I use Instagram and other social media.
I am scared of walking in the woods alone.
dialogue: I'm starting to shop for a red couch for the new place me and my boyfriend are moving in soon.
That is very exciting. I would love to see a picture of how your red couch contrasts with the rest of the decor in your new place.
I'll take a photo and post it on Instagram as soon as have it all set up. It might take me a few days since we'll have to unpack everything. I'm so excited!
I can't wait to see it. You know I can't get enough of Instagram so I'm sure I will see it as soon as you post it. Is your new place near any good walking areas?
Yes, It's walkable to a park and a really cute little smoothie shop. I'll have to show you when we move in. Part of why we got it was how great the location is!
That is so cool. It sounds like it's also by the city and away from the scary woods on the Southside! LOL. Is it close to your school?
Yes! I could actually walk to the school if I wanted, But with all the books and work I have to carry I'll just drive. And yes I guarantee you know scary southside woods over here, Lol!
I am so happy for you and it sounds so conveniently located. How much longer before your summer break?
Only a few weeks thank goodness. I'm exhausted, And I have a ton of homework to mark before then. How's your photography going?
It's been going well. Of course you probably saw the photos of my lunch already, But I also did a little bit of photographing in my backyard. I didn't post everything yet.
I'm excited to see more! You have such a natural talent. I'm a terrible photography so forgive me in advance for the photo of my couch, Haha.
Don't sell yourself short. The science fair pictures were so much fun! I wanted to take all of your students home with me!

persona: I don't like hummus. I'm currently incarcerated. I am scheduled to be released from Juvenile detention center in a month. I am looking forward to sleeping in my own bed. It is my own fault for being here.
I like swimming.
I've never been out of the state or the country. I'm looking forward to good food.
I like all meat pizza with extra pepperoni.
dialogue: I am getting my house all set up. The last of the boxes are unpacked.
That must feel so great to be almost completely unpacked! What state did you end up moving to?

For now I'm in California. I moved here because I'm a pro disc golfer and needed to be closer to the pro tour action. My sponsor suggested I move here so that I can play more and make more money at it.
That makes sense. It must be nice to live somewhere with such gorgeous weather! Do you have any family or friends in the state?
Only the people that I know from disc golf. I'll make some more friends along the way I'm sure. Yes, The weather is pretty nice here and much different than where I'm from in Germany.
I bet there are lots of other differences from Germany besides just the weather. What other differences have stood out to you the most?

The way people act and drive is really different. The food is also quite a bit different. There are also a lot of differences in how things are laid out and organized here vs Germany. I feel like it's pretty chaotic here, But I'll just have to adapt.
I think even people who are native to America would agree that California can be a bit chaotic haha! What do you think of the food? Better or worse than the food you are used to in Germany?

I haven't had a chance to try much in the way of food. There just seems to be such a focus on fast food here, Which I don't really like. Hopefully, I can find some good restaurants that have better food.

California has a wide array of restaurants, And there is a big interest lately in healthier options. I'm sure once you explore the area a bit that you'll be able to find some grocery stores and restaurants that are a bit more appealing.
I've found the grocery stores to be very similar to Germany, Only the brands are different. I've found Aldi here, Which is a Germany chain.

I never realized that! I feel like Aldi definitely has a cult following... I've never really been that impressed with it though. I wonder if the quality of Aldi stores is different in the states versus in Germany. I feel that here, A lot of people like to shop at Whole Foods. Have you ever been?

persona: I am a doctor. I work at a center. I am looking for a new place to work.
My favorite movie is Friday.
I live in Nebraska with my daughter. I live near a park.
I have a 10 year old daughter. I am in the process of changing my daughters school and my job.
dialogue: How often do you bring your daughter to the park?
I take her on the weekends alot when it's not too cold. She enjoys the park a lot.
I really miss visiting parks. There here a little green space at the detention center, But it is not enough. I am looking forward to getting out.
Do you have any idea when you may be getting out?
It will be a little while. They are very harsh here in Texas. But it will happen. One day I could be a dr like you.
Yes you could. You are still young and you have your whole life ahead of you!
I hope so. I also want to have kids one day like you do. It must be great.
It is nice. It's like having a friend who is also a mini version of yourself. I wouldn't mind having another.
How many do you want? I want a lot of kids one day. And they won't go to jail.
Maybe just one more. I don't want too many kids because I still want to live comfortably, Both financially and mentally haha.
They are expensive. First I need to get a job to earn money.
Have you thought of any jobs you'd like to have when you get out?

persona: I have 6 horses. My horse's name is Buttercup. I ride my horse Buttercup the most.
I live in a small town.
I am in high school. I want to go to law school.
My father and grandfather raised horses.
dialogue: Why do you want to go to law school?
My dad had a property dispute when I was a kid and we lost some land because of a law and he wasn't represented correctly. I started looking into it when I was 11.
Wow, That was very precocious of you. I've never had to hire a lawyer, Or be represented by one, Fortunately, But I know they do important work.

There are so many laws out there that most people have no idea about. And of course, Why would most of us need to know. I think about your job, You've been there a long time and do things I have no understanding of. But I don't work at a gas Station. I bet you know so many customers. Do you like the people?

I don't really feel I know them, So I can't say I like them. But I do sometimes get amused observing them. How they dress, What they buy, What they drive, And how they act. It's very impersonal though. But I like to guess what I think they'll buy when they enter the store. Who'll buy cigarettes? Lottery tickets? Health food or junk food? That kind of thing.
LOL,,,, I bet that makes the shift go faster. Do you go back to the farm and have lots of animals to care for after yous shift is done?
No, I moved off a farm last year and into an apartment. That's why I haven't been on a horse in months. I like having my own place but I miss the open space and animals.
Oh. I bet that's closer to work, Anyway. You mentioned that you want to color your hair. What color do you want to dye it?

I was in a pretty bad mood when I told you that and was thinking about dying it whatever color would most annoy my boss. But now I'm thinking something less extreme that still expresses my gloomy mood, Like jet black.
Jet black can look exotic. Does your work limit you on being able to dye your hair or havetats or piercings.?.

There are no formal rules but the boss gives people a hard time about those types of things. I usually try to keep him off my back and look presentable but he's been more annoying recently so I sort of feel like riling him up intentionally.

Haha,,, That made me snicker. I wanted to dye my hair bright pink. I suggested it to my dad and he just gave me that "look". So I will wait. I do wonder how acceptable it is for a lawyer to have pink hair. What do you think?

persona: I'm too young to have a job.
I am having a heart transplant. I have a heart transplant schedule for next month. I believe I have psychic abilities.
I have a facebook account. I like memes.
dialogue: I saw my kids for the first time in a few months!
That is so wonderfu! What did you do?
We went to the park and just spent some quality time together. It was so nice!
That sounds great! I bet they were excited too. I am close with my parents.
It's good to be close to your parents. I was close to mine as well, And it's something I hope to follow with my own kids.
I think things will get better. You can make a custody arrangement so you get more time.
I sure hope so. My wife has really ruined my life it seems. I just can't get over it.
You will. I think you will feel better when you lose weight.
What if I can't though? And I fail just like my wife would expect.
You can if you try hard. Stay positive. That's what I do with my heart.
You are right. Maybe this negative mindset is holding me back.
That's true. Assume you will lose weight. Then work hard.

persona: I am afraid of dying alone.
I usually camp out in the woods. One day I hope to go camping on a beach.
I like to go camping with a small group of friends. I hike.
I don't camp on the beaches near me because I fear being harassed by the police. I didn't know a permit was available for beach camping. I last went camping 2 months ago.
I am planning a 2 week backpacking trip through the mountains this summer. I plan to make multiple stops on my next backpacking trip.
I have never been to the grand canyon. I want to go rafting in the grand canyon.
dialogue: I looked in to rafting the grand canyon and sent you a link to a rafting company that does that.
That sounds really coo, I will have to check it out. How are the rapids? Are they pretty intense?
It depends on the time of year, But they can be intense in places. Do you think you will go with us on this trip? I know you've always wanted to raft the grand canyon.
I really want to. I think I can get work off. What kind of supplies do you bring for food?
You won't have to worry about any of that for this trip. I am going to get the food all taken care of with a friend of mine. He loves to cook and is going to do all of it for the trip.
Wow, That sounds great! What is the weather supposed to be like while we're there?
Right now it looks like there is no rain, Mostly sunny with some cloudy days. We'll see how it pans out. You know how weather can be.
What was your favorite part when you did it last summer?
It rained a lot and the river was up at all time levels. The rafting was intense and I got soaked on more than one occasion. It was a blast for me in these hectic conditions.
What about the gear bags? Did you have any issues with water getting in?
Nope. We always use dry bags. There is no way for the water to get into them.
I guess that helps. How much gear am I limited to? I don't want to overfill the boat...

persona: I work in a shipyard.
I donate money to charity from my salary. I volunteer at a rabbit rescue.
I live in an apartment.
I would like to get started on container gardening.
dialogue: Have you looked into starting your container garden?
I have! Got some seedlings in my windowsill and keep moving them out when they're big enough. How's your garden?
It is going pretty good. I am hoping that the strawberries come in ok, I sometimes have birds getting after them.
We get a lot of birds in our garden too, Do you get netting to protect your fruit?
I need to. I just need to get a frame built to put it over. Do you have any suggestions?
I just use some bamboo canes with netting attached for mine. You still feeling able to get out and do much or have you managed to talk the kids into helping?
Ha! They really don't want to help. They will eat the preserves and salsa I make, But don't want any part of the care and upkeep. How are the rabbits doing?
Haha, Sounds like most kids. Still plenty to look after. People come to adopt them, But feels like two arrive for every one werehome.
I guess they multiply like rabbits! Lol. Do you ever adopt any of them?
I do take some home. That's why I decided to do some container gardening. Easier to stop them from eating everything when they get out!
I bet that would be a hassle. Rabbits can be really cute, Though. Maybe I'll come look at adopting one!
They are really cute! I'll bring some over sometime soon for you to spend some time with. They're quite therapeutic when they're on your lap.

persona: I visited the city.
I am a piano teacher. I play the violin, guitar, drums and piano. Teaching music is my passion.
My father was a professional violin player.
I volunteer at a homeless shelter.
dialogue: How was volunteering at the homeless shelter? Do you plan on learning any other instruments?
It was good. I feel like the time I put in there actually helps someone. There are so many homeless people out there now that shelters like the one I volunteer at can use all the help they can get.

Maybe when the kids get bigger they can help out. Right now they volunteer at the pet shelter, But that is just because pets are not as sketchy as some people are. I want them to be old enough to know basic self defense before letting them work with adults.
That is a good idea! There are some people out there for sure that would hurt a child. What about you? Do you do any volunteer work?

I help with the PTA and we do bake sales and food drives for the famililes in the school that need assistance and cannot get any. It isn't much, But last year we were able to help a single mother get new tires and a radiator with the funds we raised to help her be able to keep her job. It was a good feeling.
That is really impressive! Every bit of help anyone can do for another counts. Have you been playing your violin lately?
No, Not today at least. I do like to play, But kids keep you busy. What about you?
No violin lately. I've been busy with piano lessons. You'd be surprised just how many people out there are wanting to learn to play now!
Oh no, I do know. My daughter wants to learn it, But every time we pay for lessons, She goes for a few of them and then just stops.
Really? Why is that? Is it that she doesn't like the piano or she isn't connecting with the teacher?

We have tried 3 different instructors and she is always excited the first day and then by the third or fourth lesson she says it is impossible to learn, Her hands are too small and she can't stand anything. It is heartbreaking.
Oh no! You tell her that that is not true! Her hands are not too small! She can definitely learn how to play. Why don't you let me give it a try and see if I can get her interested in playing?

persona: I believe in God.
I watch a lot of TV. I am a fan of the walking dead. I love Zombie and Vampire movies. My favorite vampie movie is Twilight. I work out a lot.
I like to go to the gym.
I like working from home.
dialogue: Did you catch that recent walking dead episode? It was great!
No i havnt sen it yet, Please dont give it away just yet.
I won't. But you should watch it asap.
Hey you know the origanal movie was filmed in my town.
The original walking dead movie?
Yes, We celebrated it every year in an event called ZombieCon until a mishap a few years back.
That's cool. What was the mishap though? I have to know now.
50000 people! 1 lone shooter! Killed a high school student during a fight.Messed it up for everyone - no more ZombiCons!
That's not quite what I was expecting to hear. That's awful.
How you doing after heart surgery? That i need to know.
I'm doing well. Just taking it easy and watching lots of tv and movies.
Vampire movies! Its a great way to pass relaxing time, Glad your good.

persona: I'm invincible. I believe in God.
I dance. I do not dance for a living.
I am 100 years old. I am strong for my age.
I do not like radios.
I like the taste of red wine.
I watch a lot of news. I try to balance my news watching by watching equal time from both sides. I am outside a lot. I stay on top of the weather.
dialogue: What are the best news programs for all around news coverage?
I try to get an even balance between CNN and Fox News. I like to see coverage from both sides of politics, And you know how the media is biased based on politics.
That is a good idea. I do not have a lot of time to watch the news with all my work.
I bet. It sounds like your plate is pretty full.
Yes I have so much. But I like being busy.
Keeping busy is what has kept me alive for 100 years. Stay at it, And you should live a long life too!
I want to but riding motorbikes is so dangerous.
It is. Just make sure you always wear that helmet, And ride carefully. Keep a distance between yourself and cars because they may not see you.
I try to be careful. Now I can't ride for a while since I hurt my foot.
Is it feeling any better at all?
A little. I am in a good mood from my birthday. Do you like birthdays.
They get less and less exciting for me. Realistically, I don't have many left so I try to be thankful every year when mine passes.

persona: I love coffee, it's my passion.
I'm teetotal.
I have a wife and 3 kids.
I own a plumbing business.
I like reading and video games but I spend most of my time with my family. I like reading fiction and biographies the most.
Me and my family went to Disney Land.
dialogue: Have you picked up any new books or games recently that you can recommend?
No, I haven't, But I am Interest in comic books.
Oh wow, I haven't picked up a comic book in years! Which ones are your favorites?
I love to read the old Superman comic books. What types of books are you interest in?

I enjoy light, Casual reading. If the book was made into a movie - even better. I don't really have a ton of time to read though. If I have a few minutes of free time, I'm usuallty on my bike on the trail.
What about games, Do you like games, If yes, What kinds of games you most interest in?
I don't have much time for games, Unfortunately. I'd love to find one I can play intermittently. I rememebr you said you were though. Which games do you like to play?
I like games like checker and card games. I would really love to learn chess.
I tried to learn chess once a long time ago, I didn't understand the concept. It's definitely a challenging game to learn. What type of card games do you play?
I only know how to play Black Jack 21, This game more for fun and not for money. About chess, Where I live a person has to pay to learn chess.
Do you pay an individual tutor, Or is it a class you would attend to learn how to play chess?
I pay an individual tutor, I don't pay much, Because he is a friend of the family.

persona: I love dogs, I have two dogs.
I tend to eat when I am bored.
I like summer the most.
I mostly run on a treadmill. I love using the rower machine the most. I'm looking to purchase a rowing machine. I'm a little tight on money currently.
I've started running.
dialogue: How are you finding the rowing machine? Is it helping your exercise?

Yes, I'm quite happy with it. It's in really good shape--better than I expected--and I like having it at home to use when the weather outside isn't conducive to running. So thanks for facilitating the purchase for me with your friends!

I'm so glad you are liking it! I remember when I was training for the olympics, I had to run outside no matter what the weather was. It's great to have an indoor alternative! I still like to run, But not when it's too hot outside!
Yes, I'm sure that for Olympic training there's no choice but to forge ahead, Regardless of how you feel or what the weather's like. Was 1992 the only Olympics you got to compete in?
Yes, I'm afraid so. I ended up with an injury in 1993 and that pretty much ended my competitive career. Now I like to coach other athletes such as yourself.....
Do you currently coach anyone you think has a shot at winning a medal at the Olympics?
No, I just work with local athletes. I have to stay pretty close to home due to my cats, And especially now that one of my cats is ill. I'm really worried about her.
Oh no! Has it not gotten any better? I think you better take her to the vet if she hasn't started to improve by now.
Yes, I've been thinking that. It's hard to take her out of the house but I guess I have to do it. Do you have a near by vet that you trust your dogs with?
Yes, Actually I do. One of my dogs ate a rock one time and had to go to the vet. I really trust them even though I've only been once. Would you like their name and phone number?
Wow that sounds scary! Yes, Please sendme the information if you get a chance. I'm sure if you trust the that they will be able to help me, Hopefully without costing a fortune!

Yes, I don't remember them being costing too much. Of course I was mostly just glad that my dog was okay. I'll have to look for their information though. I'll get it to you as soon as I find it. Have your cat's symptoms been getting worse?

persona: I am still going to school.
I work in a dentist office as a receptionist.
I would love to take one or two bunnies. I don't have a preference between boy and girl rabbits. I get grossed out at the thought of eating rabbits.
I did not really like the quail. I would use a lot of ketchup if I had it again.
dialogue: I got the bunnies from my friend! I have five here, And you can pick one or two that you'd like to keep!
Thanks! I'll do that. What colors do you have?
I have two fawn, Two black, And a lilac.
Do you care which colors I get? Oh, Also, How big are they? I need to know what size cage to get for them.

You can pick whichever one you want. I don't know the sex of them yet though. And they will get to about 5lbs. You should look into getting a big rabbit hutch. They actually don't do very well in the small cages. Not unless you plan to let them free roam the house and just use the cage for when you can't supervise.
Okay, I'll get the hutch. I think I'll take one fawn and one black. That way I can have a variety. Should I get them lettuce from the grocery store or is there something else I should feed them?
They like lettuce and lots of other fruits and veggies. But they also need rabbit pellets to eat. You should do some research on rabbit care before you come pick them up!
I'll do that! You know, I am kind of excited about getting them! I've been wanting a pet rabbit for a while now! I watch videos of pet rabbits on You Tube and they are so cute!
They make great pets! And you can litter box train them too!
I didn't know that! Is it hard to train them? Having them freely about the house could be fun!
It's not hard. Definitely look up training tips though. They love to be a part of the family.
Awww! Then they will be a part of my family for sure! Speaking of, You are not going to eat yours again are you?

persona: I work at a convenience store. I am a store manager.
I drive a Nissan.
I am a huge fan of Taylor Swift. My favorite album is 1989. I once met Taylor Swift.
I really like NWA.
dialogue: How is working at the convenience store going? Do you like being a manager?
Yes. It is so nice to be the boss! Plus I can play Taylor Swift music.
Haha, That is awesome. I dont know if I will ever find a job that lets me do that. It would be like the best job ever.
I know you like her too. What other singers do you like?

A lot really. Pink, Avril Lavigne, The Pretty Wreckless, The Band Perry, Eminem, Katy Perry, Ava Max.... I really like a lot of music. Even classic rock.. Like the Eagles, Dr Hook, David Essex, Guns and Roses and Queen.
Wow! That is a lot. I also like other types of music. I like to meet them.
I met Tracy Lawrence a couple years ago, He came to speak to my high school. I am not really into his music, But it was cool.
That does sound nice. I can't travel too far because my Nissan is old.
I don't have my license yet so I have to catch rides. So I totallly get that lol.
I need to get a new car. What type of car do you want?
I want an old marquis or crown vic. I like big body older vehicles made with real metal, Not the fiberglass crap they have now. I love old cars.
Maybe you could run where you are going. IYour traing should help.

persona: I'm Ben. I'm grounded because I didn't pick up my toys.
I enjoy pizza when my mother orders it. I like tomato sauce on pizza.
I have a turtle named Leo that I got from my best friend living across the street.
I like what Barney sings. I like watching videos, including videos of cartoons and Barney.
I am friends with my neighbor.
I listen to my mother sometimes.
dialogue: My cat Spook did something really funny and I want to tell you about it.
LOL what did Spook do? Did he spook you?
He has been doing this thing where he taps his food bowl on the floor repeatedly when he wants to eat. It's so cute and so funny. I'm going to try to get it on video.
Haha can you send my mommy the video? Cat is my favourite animal but daddy says no cat. What is your favourite animal?
I love cats and dogs equally. They are both great pets to have! Why does your dad say no?
He says they're naughty and that they will scratch me. I had a doggy named Rex but he died last year.
Poor doggy. If you don't mind, What happened to him? Was he just old?
Mommy said he was old and went to heaven because of that. How old is your kitty?

persona: I am new to the United States. I don't know anything about computer programming.
I was born in Somalia. I escaped Somalia with my aunt's help because I was forced to marry young to an abusive husband. I was forced to stay at home as a homemaker while in Somalia.
I like swimming.
I go to church.
I do not currently have a degree. I do not have a job that serves others.
I used to take care of children and locals who were hurt while residing in Somalia.
I have an aunt living in America that is also originally from Somalia. I have a sister that still lives in Somalia.
dialogue: While swimming in a local competition, I was able to connect with a fellow competitor who was happened to be a nursing instructor at a local college. Would you want me to facilitate a meeting between you and this instructor to explore nursing as a potential degree path for you?
That sounds great. Thank you so much for thinking of me.
No problem, I am glad I could help. Is there a certain aspect of nursing you are interested in?
I just want to help other people and think nursing is the way to do that.
Awesome, I will set it up. I think you would be great at that. How is your family doing?
They are doing okay. I've been trying to figure out how to get my sister to the united states though.
That would be a tough process. I hope you are able to get them over here. How has your transition to this country been?
It's been an adjustment with the culture shock. But it's been good to be here.
I bet. What is your favorite part about the country so far? I hope the people have been nice.
It's so hard to pick just one thing. But I think the big selection of different foods has been fun.
Have you ever considered doing catering with Somalian food? I bet people would love that.
That's a great idea. I'd have to get better at cooking first though. Maybe I can teach one of my friends my family recipes.

persona: I milk cows.
My dad is younger than 100 years old.
I like coloring books.
I like to watch hockey with my dad.
I live on a farm. My dad got me a German sheperd to help on the farm as a birthday present.
I do some work in the garden.
dialogue: How is your garden coming along?
It's coming along fine! Everything is growing right on schedule. All of this rain we have been getting lately has been great for it and it keeps me from having to spend time watering!
That is really great! What kind of plants are you growing?

I am growing tomatoes, Yellow squash, Okra, And bell peppers. With summer fast approaching having some fresh vegetables around will make meals light and easy! Hey, I can fed ex you some if you want when they are ready.
That would be great, Are you sure it wouldn't cost too much? Do you preserve any of your vegetables?

No, Don't worry about cost. I'll be glad to do it! I do make salsa and jar it. I get some cilantro, Jalepeno, And onions from a neighbor in trade for some of my okray and squash. Do you want me to send you a couple of jars?
That would be awesome! I love homemade salsa, It always tastes better than store bought. How is your dog doing?
He's fitting in and learning the ropes perfectly! You know, He's really going to be a big help around here. Have you gotten a cat yet?
I am still looking. I have been checking out the local shelters to see if there's a rescue I can adopt.
Wonderful idea! There's always a ton of cats and kittens at the shelters. Are you looking for something specific?
No, Just one that seems to fit me. I think that if I see the one, I'll know. I just need to get out and start looking. Have you been able to train your dog?
I'm working on it. The main thing is to get him used to the cows and know how to handle them if necessary.

persona: I live in Alaska and we don't have many life coaches here.
I've never run a marathon.
My brothers are monks and help me meditate.
Lately I quit my job to join the monastery. They take care of my basic needs.
I started studying meditation when a family member was diagnosed with cancer. She has been in remission for 14 years now.
dialogue: What do you think is the best region of Alaska?
I think southwestern alaska is the best! I love the Peulik Volcano there.
I have never heard of that area. What is so amazing about it? Besides the volcano of course.
Well it also is one of the riches salmon areas in the world! A lot of it is only accessible by boat or small plane, So it is very wild area as well.
Salmon is my favorite food, And the oils in it is good for people with cancer or recovering from it! I bet eating it fresh is amazing. That sounds really cool. How is meditating going?
It's been going good! I have did a few 8 hour meditation sessions last month. How about you?

I am trying to see how cold effects meditation, So if I move up to Alaska, I can see about any outdoor meditation. I even went as far as trying to meditate in a walk in freezer, But I kept getting interrupted. I am trying.
Oh wow that is very interesting! I don't think you have to come as far as Alaska to find cold weather! Have you thought about places like North Dakota or Maine?

Oh no, I already was thinking about going to Alaska. I just wanted to do some trials before going. I am also trying to do meditation with different oils and scents to see how they effect it. I find that peppermint and lavender are not good for meditation. One makes you want to get up and go and the other will put you to sleep haha.
Nice! I go the minimalist route when it comes to meditating, Just however things are in the moment. Where do you currently live?

I live in New Mexico now, But it is not my final destination. I like to move around every six months or so to pass on some lessons and enjoy a different area. I want to see the entire world, One continent at a time.
Oh wow I have never been to New Mexico. In fact I have barely been to many other states!

persona: I move out soon.
I work for Burger King. I often burn the burgers. I am very depressed of working for Burger King.
I hate blue colour. I like blond hair.
I'm working with a guy named Steven. I'm working till 4 this saturday.
dialogue: What kind of games does Steven like?
Steven has been obsessed with Stardew Valley lately. Have you ever played that game?
I have never heard of that game do you know what it about? Maybe it would be a good game to try at the game party I am hosting.
Stardew valley has a multiplayer mode so it would be perfect for your game party. It is about farming, And you roleplay as a farmer who inherits their grandfather's farm.
Wow that sounds awesome maybe I could make a menu around the game. Maybe some farm food. Do you have any suggestions of what else to have with the burgers?

Definitely parsnips and starfruit. Maybe some farm fresh eggs and demon mayonnaise to go with it. Do all 5-6 people eat meat? Maybe there should be vegetarian options if any of your friends are veggies.

Maybe some parsnips but I don't think starfruit grows locally here. Yes there are somevegans in the group probably do some Impossible Burgers. Is it true that the Impossible Burgers are really popular at Burger King?
I have heard they're very popular! Something about how the impossible burger works well with burger king's flame broiled taste.
I am sure I can't cook them as well as Burger King maybe I should just get some from there. Your off at 4 on Saturday right? Do you and Steven want to come to the party?
That sounds like a lot of fun, Thank you for the invite! I'll let steven know too. I can bring burgers if you can provide buns!
That would be amazing I already have the buns I got them from work we don't make burgers at my work but use buns for sandwiches. Maybe you can can help me decide which colour to dye my hair next.
I think your hair looks best the way it is, But i support you if you want a change. Maybe red?

persona: I am 9 years old. I am in third grade.
I like Disney World. I go to Disney World every year.
My dad has a lot of money.
I went to Disney World last February. I prefer Disney World to Disneyland. Space Mountain is my favorite ride. The Brown Derby and Be Our Guest are my favorite restaurants in Disney.
dialogue: The radio station called me! I'm going on my Disney trip in 2 months!
That's exciting! I love Disney World!
I am so excited! I need to know all the places to hit and when the best time to go is. I know I'm going to ride Space Mountain until I get sick!
This is a good time of year to go. Make sure you eat at Be Our Guest.

I'll make a note of it! I still can't believe they called me. I can't wait to tell my students tomorrow. I know a couple already wrote themes about it and another told me just last week that they are going once school is out.
I will be in fourth grade next year!
That's right! You are still at Middleton right? That's such a good school. I wonder if you will Mr. Westbrook or Mrs. Ohtani.
Yes. Are they good teachers?
I think they are both great. Mr. Westbrook is so funny and you won't find a sweeter teacher than Mrs. Ohtani. Are you ready for the summer?
Yes, I'm going to Disney next month.
Wow! You go so often. They probably know your name. Are there any new rides?
There may be this year. I just love Space Mountain.

persona: I volunteer at a church, high school tutoring, and publishing houses.
I grew up poor.
I love animals. I want to volunteer at an animal shelter one day.
I do not like cats because of past experiences with stray cats.
dialogue: I would love to do some communtiy volunteer work with you to help out our community. Where would you like to volunteer at since you are not particularly found of the animal shelter?
I actually want to volunteer at the animal shelter. I think it may help me to get over my dislike of cats if I have some good experiences with them. Plus the dogs are so cute.
Oh, I must have misunderstood! That's a great idea. It's such a good feeling to help out at the shelter... They always appreciate it. When do you want to volunteer?
I'm available this weekend if that works for you?
Oh I'm sorry but I'm getting ready to move and have a lot of packing to do this weekend. Maybe next weekend? I'm hoping to have most of my stuff ready to move in the next few days!
Next weekend will work well. I'll put it on the calendar.
Ok, Hopefully we can work around any other commitments that you have. Are you still volunteering at the church and high school?
I am. But church stuff is on sundays and tutoring is after school hours on the weekdays. So my saturdays are open.
Excellent, I will call them today and see if they need our help on a week from Saturday. Maybe afterwards we could stop for some ice cream?
I'll never turn down ice cream! Sounds like a good plan.
Good, I'll look forward to it. Well, I guess I should get back to packing now. It's a big job to pack up all my model houses!
Packing is always a big job. Hope it goes quickly for you.

persona: My name is Heather. I like chatting.
I have been married for 3 years. My husband was homecoming king in high school.
I like books. I got my degree from college. I'm 27.
I'm going to have a baby boy. I need to start planning for my baby shower, and I need help from others.
I have not run more than 10 miles in my life. I plan to run after having my baby, to get rid of excess weight.
dialogue: I was talking to a friend an hour ago, And they said they would be excited to come with me to help you plan for the baby shower this Saturday. They have experience in planning for various events, Including baby showers. I can send you their number if you want to discuss the baby shower with them in more detail.
Oh that would be great, I would really appreciate that! I am still trying to figure out the theme. What would you and your friend like for lunch?
Glad we could help! Something probably light, How about salads? How do pirates sound for a theme?
Oh, I love salads! Do you both eat meat, Just so I know what protein to add to the salads. Oh a pirate theme could be super cute! And we could have everyone dress up!
Both me and my friend are bothvegans. Glad you like that idea. We could even have some eye patches for people to wear if they wanted!

Ok I am glad that I asked so I didn't serve you a chicken salad! I am sure I can find some good vegan recipes. I love the idea of doing a photo booth and having lots of props like a parrot, Or pirate hats!
Photo booths are super cute. I went to a wedding that had one and it was a lot of fun. I like the idea with all the props!
So fun! I am wondering if I should hire a professional photographer, Or just make it a DIY photo booth where people take pictures with their phones.
That's a good question. I guess it would depend a lot on the price. How many people do you think will come?

It started out small but the list keeps growing with all of the aunts, Cousins, Friends, Etc. I also haven't decided if I will invite all of the men in the family as well, Or just keep it traditional with the women. Right now I am close to 50 people.
50 is a good amount. I think the fancier we make the party, The more it might be better with a professional. Does your husband want guys there? Things can get "rowdier" with men there lol.

He said we should invite the guys because then we will get more presents haha! I said I don't think it will work that way, Because the men coming with their wives are not going to give extra presents. Also, I don't need more things, I am just excited to have everyone I love there to celebrate this new little addition to the crew!

persona: I live in Hawaii. I work from home.
Horror movies are my favorite. I'm creating a Halloween playlist of movies to watch.
I've never seen The Invisible Man. I'd like to visit Maui. I live in Oahu. I've lived in Oahu for a while. I love Oahu. I think Honolulu can get hectic.
I have two dogs: Scott and Scotty.
dialogue: I've been watching a lot of horror movies lately and have more ideas for your playlist.
Really? That sounds awesome! What do you recommend?
The ones I've been watching on old. Sometimes I think older means better you know? So, I recommend Salem's Lot and Poltergeist.
Those sound great! Are both of those adapted from books?

Hmm, Now that I don't know. Salem's Lot is a vampire movie and Poltergeist is basically a haunted house type show. Salem's Lot is really scary but Poltergeist doesn't really get scary until late in the show.
I see. I'll definitely check them out. How's life on Maui? I really need to get over there. I hear the road to Hana is really cool.
Oh it is! Life is great right now and yeah, You should come visit! I'll give you the real tour so you can see Maui's true beauty and not just the tourist stuff.
I would love that. I hear there are a lot of really cool places to cliff jump there.
There are. I didn't know you were interested in that though. Have you been cliff jumping for a while?
Just whenever I travel. I like to go off the beaten path a little, And that's usually where those types of places are. How are your dogs doing?
They are all doing great and thanks for asking! I take them to the beach in the early morning and let them play and swim. They love it!
I bet they love that. Are they pretty well trained?

persona: I am studying the LSAT. I want to be an attorney.
I used to live in New Mexico in a small town.
I  grew up with horses.
I love coffee. I'm open to trying new flavors of tea.
I like Mexican and Thai food. I like Pad Thai.
dialogue: Are there any flavors of tea that are your favorites?
I really enjoy honey tea, But lately I've been drinking earl grey.
Do you have a favorite place to get tea from?
We have a specialty tea store downtown here that I absolutely love! But if I can't get down there, I just get it at the grocery store.
Are there any good restaurants downtown that you go to?
There's a nice one by the tea shop downtown and they also have a big tea selection. I haven't got to try it yet though.
I'll have to check them out. How is your studying going for the LSAT? I would imagine that would be tough!
It is tough, But I'm taking time each day to study a bit that way I don't have to cram it all in one day. Tea helps me get through it haha.
Ya, You would probably need a potent relaxing tea for that! Lol. What type of law do you want to get in to?
I'm leaning toward family law. Helping kids mainly.
That sounds like a good venue of law. You will do great!
Thanks! I really just want to help people.

persona: I'm a huge fan of rock music.I think country is ok.
I go to high school. I just won homecoming queen. I have a gorgeous homecoming queen crown.
I like to run. I'm on the track team. I want to become a physical therapist. I'm running a 10k in Boston next month.I'm not really into running marathons. I feel free when I run.
I'm a male. I'm open to running with someone. I run by a lake between 4:30am and 5:30am. I run at least six miles a day. I run more miles the closer it gets to a race.
dialogue: I've been doing research on what running shoes to get and there are so many options I can't choose.
Let me see if I can help you narrow your choices down. What are your criteria? I mean, Do you want arch support, cushioning, Things like that.
I think that running would give me time to think and compose my music without any distractions. What do you mean by saying that you feel free?
I mean that I don't have any restrictions. I don't have to act a certain way or anything. I am free to go where I want and think about anything I want.

That would be great. I am never really free. I always have someone around making sure that I am not being followed by a fan or to see if I need something. Even b/c they need something. I would love some advice on shoes. I definitely need support and cushioning. I don't want too much arch support b/c my arch is not that high. I would want them to be for running in the woods not on the road.
I am partial to Skechers shoes so I would recommend the Skechers Max. They have great cushioning and are strong enough for running in the woods. Will you have security with you when you run?

Probably I'm not allowed to go anywhere off my property without them. I'll have to check out the skechers max and see how they feel. I'll have someone pick them up for me and try them. Is there anything else that you can think of that I will need?
You'll need some good, Thick socks. You know, I was thinking being free when running. Running could be inspiring for you with your music.

I was thinking that too, But I was feeling like it would at least make me feel like I could be alone for a while. Even if I do have security running with me. Have you ever tried the toe shoes? I always wondered if they would be good for running?
I tried them briefly. There's just not enough cushioning and support with them for running in my opinion. They are like being barefoot.
Oh that wouldn't be good for running in the woods with sticks and stuff. I will definitely stay away from them. Thanks for the advise.
You're welcome! Hey, When you are out there running maybe you could come up with a rock song just for me?

persona: I love being alone. I like Mickey Mouse.
I tried video games and just can't get into them. I have played ''Halo''.
I am in school. I have seven friends in my class that I play with. I play football and tag with my friends.
dialogue: Have you and your friends thought about joining a local league for football? It's fun to compete.
We haven't thought about that, We just play for fun right now. How would be go about joining a league? That sounds like fun.
You can search for local leagues online. And then contact them to see if they are still needing players.
Does it cost a lot of money? I would have to ask my parents as I don't have a job to pay for these things.
The cost depends on the league you join. It is usually affordable though.
It would be cool to wear a uniform! I am fearful that I am not good enough to join a league and have all those people watching me fail.
I'm sure you'll be fine. You just have to have fun and not think about the audience.
Yes, I guess so. Were you ever a part of a sports league?
I did baseball before. But only lasted one season.
I have never played baseball, Is it fun? I have gone to a couple of games with my dad. I got really sick from eating so much hotdogs and ice cream!
It is fun. But it wasn't something I wanted to put a lot of time into.
Yes, I am sure you don't have much time outside of all your Twitch streaming!

persona: I live in Nevada.
I am a store manager. I work on weekends, though my shift ends at 2 pm.
I have short, brown hair.
I like metal music.
I own a Nissan Pathfinder, and believe the car is reliable but bland. I like Psalm John 316. I like Cypress Hill.
I love fish tacos.
