I recently discovered an accordion musician that covers metal music.
dialogue: I think I found the perfect car for me! I saw that my local Porsche dealership was selling a used Boxter for 18K and I jumped on it. It had really low mileage which was great.
No way! That's amazing! I bet you're so excited!
Yeah I can't wait to bring it home! I want to use it as a conversation starter with the ladies! I haven't been on a date in a long time.
Well if that thing doesn't start a conversation with the ladies nothing will! You even have a couple K left over from your budget to take it for a real nice night on the town!
I am tempted to get it all in ones and let it rain as I drive down the street.
You only live once, And you might not get that chance again! I say do it. Are your siblings jealous?
They will be when I hit the local news as a coolest guy in all of alabama!
That's not exactly difficult but still, I'm happy for you. What's the plan for the Jeep Wrangler now?
I'll probably keep it! Nothing is more American than having two cars for one person!
No joke! Guzzle all the gas you can at once! Lol.
I might add another exhaust just to waste more gas! And maybe also add one of those loud whistler things... Do you know what I am talking about?
I think so. Either way, That sucker is gonna be loud and blasting its own hole in the o-zone layer!

persona: I don't like metal music. I like country music.
I had a heart transplant. I was born with my heart outside my body.
I am male. I could not play much as a child. I don't travel much.
I can do magic. I can move things with my mind.
I enjoy swimming.
I volunteer at animal shelters.
I know how to code html.
dialogue: What is your favorite instrument in country music? Have you ever thought about playing guitar?
I like a simple acoustic guitar.
You can't be the simplicity of an acoustic guitar.
Exactly. It is so versatile. What kind of music do you like?
I really enjoy rock music.
I don't mind some of the softer rock songs. Anything too intense gets my heart pumping too fast.
That's understandable! My mom calls it noise. She prefers the softer stuff too.
I'd probably get along well with her. Do you play any instruments?
Unfortunately, No I don't. I've always wanted to learn how to play guitar though.
There are a lot of great tutorials on YouTube.
Yeah, That's true. I haven't thought about that.
I don't get out much, So I spend a lot of time watching videos online.

persona: My parents were murdered when I was 3. I am adopted. I have an adopted father.
I enjoy pop music.
I get scared by clowns.
I work at a gas station.
I am single. I go out on blind dates at music festivals. My blind dates have not been successful so far.
I was raised in a dysfunctional environment. I have tried therapy but it didn't really help. I take long walks to relieve stress.
I like Rascall Flatts.
dialogue: I managed to get four tickets for Rascall Flatts at the local arena in two weeks time. Now we just need to arrange the dates!
Oh that's great news! Do you have any ideas of who you will be asking to go with you yet?
Well, It will be me and you and then we have to find some dates to bring! That's the tricky part.
Do you have any friends who have friends they'd want to set up on a blind date?
I will have to ask around. I am sure someone will be interested, If even just for the free concert tickets. And then we will win them over with our charm anddashing good looks!
Sounds like a good plan. I can't wait! Even if the dates are bad at least we will still have the concert.
Exactly! I noticed that there's a fairground right near the venue, Maybe we can go there before the concert to have some fun.
That sounds fun. Maybe we can go out to eat first too?
Yes, That is a must! What kind of food do you like to eat?
Mexican, Chinese, Italian... I'm not too picky honestly.
Ooh I love Mexican... Actually I think there's a nice restaurant nearby. Tacos and margaritas before the concert?
That sounds wonderful. Hopefully the dates agree.

persona: I like the internet.
I work as a maid/housekeeper.
I am 56 years old woman. I want to retire.
I have children that are grown.
I want plastic surgery. I have wrinkles.
I like plays. Randomness intrigues me. I may apply for a ticket taker position.
dialogue: I quit my job after seeing an abused dog, It was bloody, I can not handle it anymore.
Oh,,,, I am so sorry you had to experience that! Will you see a therapist to talk about this trauma?
Uh nah. I don't like to talk to people like that. It makes me nervous. My anxiety is too bad to talk to someone. But I am looking for another job now.
Did you apply to that theater job you mentioned?
I did. I haven't heard anything back. I am not sure they are even hiring right now, But I am looking around for something less bloody.
I can understand the eww factor of blood! Do you have any other leads for jobs?
I filled out applications at a local gas station, A grocery, And I went to a local employment agency to see if they can find me something. I need a job.
This might be a substantial pay cut from being a Vet. Are you prepared for that?

I mean, I quit my job completely. I took a 100 percent pay cut. The employment agency can get me ok paying jobs if they find one, But even being a grocery stocker would be better than making zero dollars right now.
You are so right! I don't know what I was thinking when I asked that. You have a whole new path in front of you, A new chapter in your life.

Yeah and it is kind of scary. But it helps that I have bought into crypto and stocks over the last few years. If I run out of savings, I can pull some from that. How is everything going with you? Have you decided to retire?
I dream of retiring but that's not for a few years yet. I am doing good but my hands are reacting to a new cleaning product that I am using. I need to go out and get some better gloves.

persona: I just moved into a house and I live with my boyfriend Tim.
I enjoy walks around my neighborhood.
I eat a lot of hamburgers and french fries. I don't like and never drink soda.

The home we moved into is previously owned. Much of the house was built in the 1920s but changes were made to it over the years. We would like to do some reno on the home. One room with glass wall tiles reminds me of a lounge at a Holiday Inn, so we're redoing it. We have a grill in the backyard.
I'm fickle with burger toppings. Sometimes I like salad on top of the patty, sometimes plain ketchup.
dialogue: I've been craving a burger since you mentioned them earlier, So I might have one soon.
Do you prefer to make the burgers yourself or pick them up from a restaurant?
Nothing beats a homemade burger but being so pregnant and taking care of all these kids, I don't think I have the energy.
I don't know how you can handle so many kids. I struggle just taking care of myself some days, Let alone worrying about so many little ones.

Yes, It can be very exhausting, But I wouldn't change it for the world. And the benefit of having all twins is that each kid has a built-in best friend to play with, So they can occupy each other after a certain age.
I never thought of it that way. Do you ever worry that they will gang up on you? One distracts you will the other sneaks into the kitchen to steal the cookies...

Oh, They are already pulling those tricks! Luckily I have a lot of family to help, It takes a village, As they say! Sometimes I have to lock myself in the bathroom to eat my snacks to get a moment of peace, And not have them all want to eat all my cookies! ~.
That's great that you have so much help. My family doesn't live close, So I'd be on my own if I ever have kids. By the way, How are you enjoying the new house?

Do you have any friends in the area? Oh the new house it amazing! We really needed that extra space, The kids are loving having more personal space. They still have to share bedrooms, But only with their other twin,
No friends I'd trust to watch my kids. I'm glad you're enjoying the house. You deserve it.
Thanks, That means so much! Well when the time comes for you to have kids, I will happily take on the role as a babysitter; what's one or two more kids to throw in the mix? Haha!
Lol. Thanks. I will definetly have many questions (if we decide to have kids)..

persona: I don't have a job. I am thinking of going to college. I haven't been to college.
I am always on a diet. I love food. I want to look my best. I exercise.
I considered school boring.
I have a sister.
I don't like to read.  I like parties.
dialogue: I know you're not a big fan of reading, But if you want to read more, You might want to start with topics you love the most.
Thanks for the advice! I will probably start light with some tabloid magazines. Have you had any more auditions?
That would be a great start so that you're not overwhelmed at first! No, Sadly I haven't. But maybe soon!

Oh man I hope you get some soon! Speaking of books and reading I was at the library today scoping out the local male talent and guess what? I saw my sister making out with a librarian in the back stacks!
Wow! Sounds like they weren't doing much reading then, Haha what a thing to use the library for!
Well I want to meet a smart man! Where else am I going to find one if not the library? Plus I figure just being near books will make me want to read more. It's better company than I usually keep.
Lol, That's a good idea! The library is a wonderful resource. You could probably even find some magazines there like you mentioned earlier.
Oh yeah totally! I was browsing through one called "cat fancy" and on the cover it said"free poster inside". So I flip through it, And guess what? Some twerp already stole it!
I love that mag! And I'm not surprised. That sounds pretty common unfortunately.
I was more annoyed that someone was as clever as me and had the idea to steal it. Oh I should track down who stole it! Maybe they are my soul mate!
That would be a great love story! Haha.
You know what! That would make a great movie! I know I don't read much but maybe I can write a screen play and you can audition for it! I foresee many stunts in this romantic action movie!

persona: I like to shop for shoes and watches.I work for a watch dealer. My family does not agree with my career.
I want to own a Rolls Royce. I like cars.
I have children.

I like older music. I don't care much for George Strait music from the 80s. I'm not too into country music. I like the Beatles and Billy Joel. "In My Life" is my favorite Beatles song followed by "Here Comes the Sun.".
I would love to live in a tight-knit quiet community. Most of my family and friends live in the city. I'm not ready to move and leave my family and friends behind.
dialogue: Other than the Beatles and Billy Joel, Who are some more of your favorite musicians?
Joan Jett, She is such a guilty pleasure, Normally, I like a bit softer music but i like her wild side. Who are some of your fav country singers?

She is great! I know you don't like him but I actually really like George Strait, He has been one of my favorites since I was young. I went to his concert just a couple years ago and it was fantastic!
I haven't been to a concert in years. Do you get to go to many?
Yeah, I like to go to a couple concerts a year. I love live music. How is work going for you?

Ticking away.. Lol. I have a business trip scheduled next month. It will be in Vegas. I have never been to this event before nor have I been to Vegas.. But lots of watch dealers will be there. Have you ever been to Vegas?
No, I haven't. I have heard you need to go at least once in your life so I may look into it eventually. It sounds like it should be a good trip for you to take for business!
I am not much of a gambler. But maybe I can take in a show. Do you ever get to travel as an electrician?
Here and there I have traveled for bigger jobs but not farther than a couple hours away. Do you travel quite a bit for work?
I get to roam around my area. Sometimes up to 6 hours away. I don't hate it but I miss my kids when I do that. Do you have any kids?
No I don't. How many kids do you have?
I have 3 and one on the way. It is our first girl. Due in 3 months. I bet her brothers will be protective of her.

persona: My name is George. I live in the country.
Papaya is my favourite food.
I don't live close to my family, but I can see them whenever i want.
I just bought a new stalion called Macho. I own three horses and a donkey. I find horses great for de-stressing. I farm bees with my wife.
dialogue: I sent my acceptance letter to the school, So it's all official now - roll on September!
That's awesome! What city will you be moving to?
I'm going to Law School in New York City. Have you been?
I haven't been personally but my wife, The supermodel, Goes down all the time for shoots.
How does your wife the supermodel enjoy living in the country?
She says she likes it but I am not so sure. She seems distant. I can't explain it. I might have hertailed next time she takes one of her extended trips.
How much does a PI cost these days? It's got to be less than the pony you just bought, Right?

First off he is not a pony he is a stallion. PIs are about the same as they were five years ago when I last hired one for a different issue. They are more expensive in NYC in general, But that's like anything in the city. Have you budgeted that into your move to the city for college?
My apologies to you and Macho the stallion. I'll be getting a stipend, If that's not enough, Luckily, I like instant noodles.
You should try to eat right! I will bring you vegetables and honey from my farm, So you have something fresh and good to eat.
I'll tail your wife in exchange of veggies and honey.
Well I was thinking maybe I could stay on your sofa a few nights so I can do it myself...

persona: I am not good at dancing . I am big and clumsy.
I have a job in the shipyard. I'm volunteering in the pet shelter.
I have not an aunt.
I donate my money from the shipyard to the bunny rescue. They let me pet the bunnies. I haven not a bunny as a pet. I would love to have a pet. I feel too much responsibility for keeping a pet.
My favorite color is blue.
dialogue: I had a great visit with my Aunt, She gave me some good advice about my status in the US.
Thats great news, The sooner you get all of that sorted the sooner it will feel like home here.
Yes, I agree. It takes a long time though to be an actual citizen.
Yes, I think i probably take it for granted having been born here.
I always dreamed that I was born in America. Being from Somalia was not much fun because of so many wars and fighting. I'm so glad I got the chance to come here.
Do you miss anything about Somalia?
Only some family members. I don't miss anything else. Say, Aren't you a volunteer at a pet shelter? That is something that I would like to do. Where do I get started?
I dont really volunteer, But im in with the people at the bunny shelter. I could hand them your email and get them to contact you. They are always looking for people to help out.
That sounds like a good idea. Do you know what kind of things I would doing there at the shelter?
Lots of cleaning i should imagine! Also feeding, Petting the bunnies. Do you have much experience with animals?
No, I don't. It's just something that I've kind of always dreamed about doing if I ever got to come to America. Now that I'm here I want to do it.
Great, Ill hand on your email to them. How are you finding the American cuisine?

persona: My name is George.
I like music.
I am not close to my family.
I am a bee farmer. I like to be isolated.
My wife is an Italian super model. She makes a lot of money and pays the bills.
My favorite food is papaya. I like seafood, especially shrimp.
I'm thinking of selling the honey my bees make.
I'm open to hearing new music.
dialogue: Have you given any more thought to selling the honey from the bees?
Yeah, I kind of overdid it this year and ended up with too much excess honey! I think I might try to sell some a the local farmer's market.
That is a great idea! I wonder how much would you sell honey for at a local farmer's market?
Hm, I guess that depends on the quality! Maybe I should get the honey tested to make sure it's good quality. Have you ever thought about performing one of your songs at a farmer's market?
I never even knew that was an option! You could also use the excess honey to cook with. You could experiment with papaya and honey and make face masks as well. I hear both are good for your skin.
I could use a nice face mask after gorging on seafood. Had any good lobster lately?
Yes, Actually I have! I had lobster tail last week. It was delicious. The hardest part of making the papaya honey face mask for you would be not eating the papaya! Haha. I know how much you like it.
Ahh, The best thing about an all-natural face mask is that it's okay if a little gets in your mouth! Or maybe it's a lot instead of a little, Haha, You know how much i love papayas.
Yes, And shrimp! Maybe there is some recipes you could find to use your honey to cook shrimp?
I bet a ginger honey glaze would work well with grilled shrimp, With some veggies on the side. Thanks for the idea!
Now, I am hungry haha! No problem! Thank you for the idea to sing my songs at a local farmer's market. I am definitely going to look into that.
Good luck! I think that the more you perform, The more confident you will become as a songwriter. Then it wouldn't matter whether your parents approve or not, As long as you are happy with it.

persona: I have grandchildren. I don't have pets.
I had cancer. I am feeling thankful to be alive.
I am Ok at chess.
I like to travel. I would like to travel to Florida. I like relaxing on the beach. I like reading books.
I like hotdogs and smores. I like drinking wine.
My husband is a construction worker.
dialogue: I bought a nice Merlot today that I can't wait to drink later!
Oh that sounds delicioius, Any special occasion or just something to sip on?
I recently won an amateur chess tournament and I used the prize money to treat myself!
Well, That's great! I had some merlot just a few days ago with my husband, He got a raise at work so he wanted to celebrate!
Oh excellent, I'm glad to hear that things are going well for the two of you. He must be doing well in his job to be getting a raise, Is he still enjoying it?
Yeah, He's been doing it for 30 years now, He's moved up to foreman so now he gets to give the orders.
Ah that's good, Seems like he's doing something he loves. Especially for 30 years, That's a very impressive amount of time to be in the construction industry.
Especially with all the ups and downs. You like to eat anything with your wine? Any cheeses or snacks you like with it?
Often a little bit of cheese, Especially as I'm treating myself this evening. Might even get a little something for the dogs!
My 3 cats are cheese crazy, They all seem to like cheddar for some reason!
Haha, Perhaps cats and dogs have more in common than anyone previously thought, Seems they're both fond of a bit of cheddar.
I think so, Everyone loves it. But I like eating havarti with my wine, Or even Muenster :).

persona: I like electronics.
I enjoy spaghetti with vegetarian Italian sausage and garlic bread.
I don like exercising. I work on a robot.
I have a son.
Nike are my favorite athletics brand.
dialogue: I just saw the proofs for my magazine spread with Nike - they look awesome!
That sounds amazing. Any chance that I'm gonna get to see these or do I have to wait?
They just showed them to me I don't have any copies yet. As soon as I do I will email them to you! One of the directors on the shoot was mad cute. I am thinking of asking her out.
So this is for Nike? I love Nike. What else do you get being on a promo deal with them?

Yeah my nike deal gets me lots of perks, Like shoes and clothing and other swag, But I am really hoping to score some love! Hopefully I can get a date with this lady or te ladies will be coming to me now that I have sponserships.
You sound like a busy person winning a gold medal in the olympics and now this magazine spread.
Hey now don't sell yourself short! You have that robot of yours! Tell me how is that going?
It's going pretty good. Lots of work yet to be done. Hopefully by the end of summer there will be some progress. Maybe I can get Nike to sponsor the robot.
Yeah that would be cool! What can your bot do? Is it like a battle bot?
Not much of anything yet. A battle bot might be a good idea.
I always liked the flipper bots. I don't know if that show is still around but we should get Nike to sponsor a bot. That way you have a better shot of your robot getting a sponsorship.
Yeah I can get the swoosh put right on the side of the robot. If the robot is any good it would be a positive experience for Nike.

persona: I like watching documentaries.
I like cheeseburgers and I like cooking.
I used to be a gym teacher and So i care a lot about fitness. I prefer loose fitting clothing over skinny jeans. I need motivation to get fit.
I was poor growing up. I am generous and kind and altruistic. I like volunteering.
I like summer.
dialogue: I have been reading about a programme that trains people for longer distance running. Sounds like something you might like?
Possibly, But running isn't on my mind right now. I broke my ankle 4 days ago :(.
Wow! How did that happen?
I caught my foot in a hole in the front yard and went down. So now I'm in a boot and have to take it easy for a month or so.
Thats not good, Are you still going to be able to work out?
Yeah, At least I can work on my upper body still, That's no problem :) The running just has to wait a bit is all.
Dont try and over do it. You dont want it to get worse or heal funny. But yea you still have to stay active.
I figure I'll be a little sneaky and have a cheeseburger today just to feel better.
You know burgers are my weakness too, I wont tell if you dont.
It'll be our little secret. I'll even cook them for us, I have some crispy bacon to add to it too :).
Toss an egg on there too for extra proteins.
Oh wow that's a great idea! I think that would be awesome, I've never tried that before.

persona: I m from portland, OR.
I like to walk in parks. I don't like soft drinks. I m trying to watch sugar intake. I have a high blood sugar and working on it. I now use honey in my tea or fruits in my smoothie instead of sugar.
I have a boyfriend who's a model.
I don't like death metal music.
I share a house with my boyfriend. My boyfriend has a cat.
I have been able to watch my calories more easily by eating more fruits which helped me feel fuller.
I will love to swim as this will help my fitness level. I don't like to swim when pools are crowded.
dialogue: I just came in from coaching swimming and the pool today was not crowded at all; I thought of you.
Well I appreciate that, The one here by where I live was pretty packed yesterday. I just came back home and soaked in the spa.
Did your model boyfriend go with you?
No, The little sneak! He's off in Cozumel on a shoot right now for a perfume.
Most perfumes gives me a headache, But Cozumel sounds nice. Are you cat sitting? What's the cat's name, Again?
Yeah, The cat's sitting right beside me as we speak. His name is Chester. Chester The MouseMolester lol he likes to slap around the mice before he finishes them off.
That's a great name! Chester sounds like he would be very entertaining. Have you walked him on a leash?
He's not terribly keen on that, We tried it a few times and you'd think he'd die. Jumping up in the air and all haha.
I would keep trying. I've always wanted to walk a cat on a leash. It turns heads.
Yeah it's fun to do, But I don't think Chester is one who appreciates it a whole lot. He likes just laying around the house.
Ahh, To have a cat's life. Just laying around on a sunny spot. Then once in a while do some terrorizing.
Cats are pretty lucky, Treated like gods lol just like my boyfriend.

persona: I like disney and my family visits disney world yearly. I love mickey mouse.
I like the songs from the movie Frozen. My favourite character is Anna.
I study in third grade and I will be in fourth grade soon.
I am entertained easily.
I like singing and dancing. I sang in a Christmas concert last year. I made my own costumes with my mother.
I am scared of heights.
I wish I could read minds.
dialogue: Have you got any plans to visit Disneyland this year?
You told me you are kind of a psychic a few days ago. If you were, You would know the answer to that question. Lol. We are going for my birthday though.
I do have some abilities but they are not that strong, Yet. That is exciting. What ride do you want to go on first?
There are so many to choose from. It will be summer when we go so maybe Splash Mountain so we can cool off. What ride do you want to go on when you're there?
That is a great idea. Cool off first! I love them all! But I think Space Mountain is always a fun way to start it off.
Is it a high ride? You already know I am afraid of heights.
No, It is in the dark and not a high ride. Splash Mountain is higher for sure. What is favorite thing to eat while you are at Disney?
Corn dogs are my favorite. They are hard to get where I live so I am going to eat a ton of them when I am there. Do you have a favorite Disney snack?
The corndogs are great! I love the churros. I will eat a few a day when I am there.
I forgot about churros. Now I don't know what to eat! I didn't realize Splash Mountain was high. Now I don't know what rides to go on. Maybe if I close my eyes!
You could have a corndog first and churro for dessert! I suggest that you go on the rides regardless if they are high or not. Trust me, They will all be worth it.
That's a great idea! Does your sister have a favorite ride?

persona: I am depressed. My wife and kids have left me. I am ready to do anything to not be depressed.
I spend my time working or playing games on facebook. I do not believe in religion and do not visit the church.
I am fat. I believe that losing weight might bring my wife back.
I used to spend alot of time with my kids and used to ride bikes with them.
I do not have a dog. I want a small dog that doesn't shed much.
I live in a rural area.  I have a boring job. I don't like my job. My boss has a bird.
dialogue: You never told me what you do for work? You mentioned it was boring... Have you ever thought about doing something else?
I work a boring middle management desk job. It pays the bills but it is not exciting. I daydream often of having another completely different life.
Maybe one day! Remember you're never stuck forever somewhere.

If feels like this rut is as deep as depression. A never ending abyss. A black hole void of light. Ever pulling me away from happiness. Tell me, Do you feel you have reached your American dream? Or did you find the apple pie had been eaten and digested before you could even open your eyes?

I def. Have felt that way before. It does get better. It just takes time. If you feel like this is a really big rut, Maybe reach out and get some help and start transitioning to get a new job. Have you loooked at any job openings in your area?

It's more than the endless toil of work. It is my wife. Well I should really get used to saying ex-wife, Because that is what she is. It is hard to accept. Maybe I will start a Smiths cover band to get my feelings out.
That's a great idea! An outlet for feelings, Emotions, And words is very important. I'm so sorry to hear about your wife.
I can see it now. Me, Shoe gazing on stage, With a clove cigarette hanging out of my mouth as I sing "Everyday is silent and grey". It's not The Smiths but it is by Morrissey, So I think it counts.
Oh definitely. I think that sounds like a wonderful idea to break the mundane task of work day in and day out.
I can't wait to don all black and smear black lipstick on my kissless lips, Black is slimming after all.. Say how hard is it to keep dog hair off black clothing?
It is quite difficult, But you can use lint rollers. That's what I do atleast haha.
Yeah I probably won't lint rolling bother until I am actually leaving the house. Of course this is if I get a dog. This would be my first dog ever, Fi you don't count my ex wife.

persona: I am trying to achieve my dream.
I grew up in a small town. I want to live in the city. I went to school. I am a lawyer.
I have never seen the movie frozen.
I like horses. My grandparents had a horse farm.
I want to live in Calgary. I like spending time in nature and would like to go to Banff National Park.
dialogue: I saw a documentary on Yellowstone and thought of you. Have you ever been?
No, But I wouldn't mind going sometime! Maybe someday when I can get time off from my practice.
I would love for my parents to take me. I want to see a geyser shoot off.
Those are pretty awesome, I think you'll love seeing it! Speaking of which, Have you got to meet Mickey Mouse yet?

Not yet. I watched something called Mickey Mouse Club on YouTube the other day. It was made years and years ago. They all wore hats and sang. The picture was just black and white. Do you know what I am talking about?
Yeah my parents used to watch that, That's pretty old! Lol.
It was kind of lame. Are those the same grandparents that horses?
Yeah, They all grew up on a farm and raised horses for a living.
I bet they could smash your feet and kick you. Did they have other animals, Like ducks, Or goats?
Well they had a lot of chickens in a pen, They would gather up the eggs for us to eat. That was pretty yummy.
Do the eggs taste different than what my mom gets at the store?
I think they all taste about the same if you ask me, Where you get them doesn't really matter lol.

persona: My name is John and I am in my early 30's.
I don't like chocolate. My wife takes all my money. I am getting a divorce.
My job is selling cars. I don't like my job. I am paid commission on my car sales. I find selling cars really hard.
I used to sing songs when I was 4. I liked the songs London Bridge and Brother John.
dialogue: Did that customer come back again? I hope you can still sell him a car.

Yes! The customer came back and bought the car. However, My soon to be ex-wife took almost all of the commission. I don't know what I ever saw in her. But I am happy that your parents are still married. How are they doing?
Mommy and daddy are doing fine. We are going to Disney world next week!
That is exciting! Who is you favorite Disney princess?
My favorite princess is sleeping beauty. I love her dress. Do you have a favorite princess?
Her dress is lovely. I'm not sure it she is actually a princess but my favorite is Mulan. Any rides you are excited to go on?
Mulan is another one of my favorites! I am excited to go to the Starwars world.
I don't really know anything about the Star Wars world. Can you tell me something about it?
You can build one of those laser swords and explore the galaxy as they say. There are also some fun rides that im excited to go to.

Exploring the galaxy with laser swords, Wow!, That does sound super fun. If my money-grubbing (soon to be) ex-wife, Would stopping grubbing my money then maybe I can go to Disney and go on the Star Wars world. What do you think?
I think you will enjoy it! Disney land is place for everyone!
Ah, One day when this divorce finally goes through. But I know you will enjoy yourself! Maybe you'll also be able to drive a car. I know how much you love cars.

persona: I am studying to be a lawyer.
I am from a small town. I was raised on a horse farm. My family has owned horse farms for several generations. I ride horses all the time. I am used to getting saddle soreness.
I am starting college soon.
dialogue: What college classes are you going to take?
Pre-law classes. Mostly political science.
That's great! I actually taught an introductory political science class for quite a few years. Do you have an idea of what type of law you want to practice?
Wow. I'm interested in criminal law.
Cool! Are you thinking of opening up a firm in your hometown or moving to a bigger city?
That's a hard question. I've always wanted to see that it's like living in the city. I'll probably work in the city and then decide where to open up my own firm.
That makes sense. I know that I had a great time traveling and seeing new cities before I settled down. Wherever you end up, I know they'll be lucky to have an attorney with your dedication.
Aww. Thanks. Where have you been to besides Spain?
I traveled around Europe during my summer breaks in college and I was able to hit most of the major tourist spots like London, Rome, And Amsterdam. I also visited the United States a few years back.
Sounds fun! I can't wait to visit Europe. I heard it's beautiful there.

It is! Everywhere has so much history. I love to walk around and imagine all the people who lived in these same buildings hundreds of years ago. Well, I used to... I don't do much walking around these days!
How come you don't go out for walks anymore?

persona: I like Alabama sports. I am from Alabama. I live in Alabama.
I do not skate. I have 19 dogs. I love my dogs. I have a dog named Foxy.
I like chicken tacos.
I have 3 sisters.
dialogue: How did you end up with 19 dogs?
Well, Buford, He's the hick that lived next door, He got arrested formakin' moonshine so I got his 15 dogs. Now I got 19 dogs lol.
Wow. That is awesome you were able to take them all in. I bet that is a lot of dog food every week!
It is! Plus I supplement their diet with some freshly shotgunned possum too, There's so many possums crawling around here in the woods it's crazy.
That is a smart move. I bet they love possum snacks. Do you have a couple favorite dogs out of the 19?
There's one called "Sniff", He's 100% pure bloodhound. He can smell an earthworm pass gas 3 feet underground, I swear to God.
How cool! I love bloodhounds. I would just be nervous of their loud bark. Are you keeping them all or thinking of adopting some out?
Right now I'm keeping them all, Outdoors of course. No room in this tar paper shack for 19 dogs, Especially with my 3 sisters, Grandma and grandpa, Ma and pa, And my wife Ella May living with me too.
You sure have your hands full, Don't you. I hope your family help out with the dogs. Maybe my fiancee and I could come out and help you sometime.
That's mighty friendly of you! We love company! I'll be sure to have a mess of southern cooking whipped up for y'all when you visit!
That would be awesome. I look forward to it. And maybe we can make you some authentic fish tacos. My fiancees are my favorite.
That sounds delicious, I've never had fish tacos before! Can't wait to try them :).

persona: I own 5 cats.
I have never been arrested. I enjoy playing with my cats.
I do not have any kids. I don't have a girlfriend.
I work construction.
I wont whistle at girls to get them. I will be trying some dating apps to help me to get a girl.
I like a girl that is down to earth who doesn't mind camping. I like a girl who likes cats. I don't want a girl who wants to get married or have kids now; maybe later.
dialogue: Have you tried any of the dating apps yet? I stumbled upon one that I will like to recommend to you.
I tried match com just once, Didnt work out, Oh well...
I am sorry to hear that maybe you should give it one more try then you will really know if it is the app or just bad luck.
Are you in jail now, They let you use social media sites there?
No, No... They let me out on bond. I have a court hearing in two weeks. My lawyer is pretty good and said it was just petty theft so, It should be cleared up rather quickly.
Need some cat toys? Ill be happy to send you some - dont steal.
Yeah well, You know how cats are like family members you need to do your best to keep the happy. Hey by the way, How are your cats doing?
My cats are great thankx,ive never been in life without! They sleep 22 hours a day and keep me up at night when i need to sleep.
That's not fun. I value my sleep way to much... Lol. So, I forgot what you have 5 cats right? What are their names again?
Yes five now, But always 3 at and given time.
I absolutely love playing with my cats. We should get together sometime and have all our cats together. That would be too funny!
Mine are not social, Your are?

persona: I like mountain biking.
I like vintage cars also; preferably Chevy Trucks.
My favorite drink is coffee. I prefer White Iced Mocha Frappuccino to Cinnamon Roll Frappuccino in Starbucks.
I love just about everything at Starbucks including their food. I give myself a treat at Starbucks every couple weeks. I am a nifty shopper; I try to find coupons and discounts online.
I have not tried the new Kiwifruit/Starfruit Refresher. I love free money. I like gifting to friends and family.
dialogue: I have a buddy that has a classic Ford for sale; it looks like a good deal; I might buy it.
It sounds exactly like what you were looking for! Will you need to do a lot of work to fix it up?
Yeah it needs a bit, But thats the fun of it.
Will you drive that to work instead of riding your bike?
With the way people drive around here, Probably not. It will be my fun ride. Plus the more i save riding my bike, The more i can put into the car!
That's a smart idea! I bet you could negotiate with them to buy the car for a lower price since it will need some repairs. I always try to haggle on prices!
Yeah, Wont have to haggle to much, He is a buddy, Pretty much giving it to me at cost. Hey have you had the chance yet to try the kiwifruit refresher?
I went yesterday to try it, And you were right that it is delicious! Do you have any other drink recommendations I can try?
No,ive just been gettin that after a long bike ride. It really is great!
Where do you like to go when you ride your bike? Do you go on paved roads or more remote trails?
Mostly its just paved when i have to run errands, When i do have free time i love to ride the trails at the park.
That sounds fun! I mostly ride my mountain bike on hiking trails. I like to check out difficult trails deep in the wilderness.

persona: I am taking algebra. I am 13 years old. I have a 17-year old brother.
I like our school librarian, who is also the soccer coach.
My family mostly stays at home. We go to visit my grandma Frankie in Ojai on Thanksgiving.
My grandma is not a good cook. My grandma has facial hair that hurts me when she hugs me.
I like someone named Theda Thorpe.
I have never visited Spain. I have never traveled with my family. I might travel with Theda Thorpe one day.
dialogue: What places would you like to visit if you could?
I really want to back pack across Europe. But, The number one country in Europe I would love to go to is Spain. Where do you want to travel?
I've been to Spain a couple of times. It's a great destination. For my next trip, I'm thinking of going to Colombia. I've never been to South America. Where does Theda Thorpe want to travel?

Theda wants to go to Spain as well. She heard that Madrid is beautiful this time of year. Yeah, Colombia would be amazing. That should be the first place you go once you retire. How much are you looking forward to your retirement?

This month is a great time to visit Madrid. The weather is great and not as many tourist. That's a great idea and I am so very much ready for retirement. Have you thought about what you might want to do?

Well, I really have not thought about what I want to do because I am only 13 and wont be able to go any time soon unless my parents pay for the trip. I really don't think that will be the case. My parents are more worried about saving for my college tuition then paying for my travels. Although, I don't really blame them.
Sorry, I wasn't clear. I meant what you are interested in for a career.
Oh, For my career??? I think I want to do something with Photography. It would be amazing to travel the world and take picture for a magazine like National Geographic.
Wouldn't that be the life?! Maybe as a backup, You could consider being a librarian. Books are filled with journeys.
Yeah, That is true. I love reading books. By the way, Do you have any new titles that I should read?
What genre do you enjoy?
I really like thrillers and Sci-Fi. But anything that is good.

persona: I like animals. I operate a business having to do with dogs. I am a dog walker.
I am a salesman. I sell a variety of things. I sell items to my neighbors. I prefer being inactive to being active.
Watching tv is a relaxing activity for me. I am in multiple relationships.
I idolized my dad.
I believe it is important to enjoy life and not get too caught up in work as well.
I donate money to the owners of the dogs I walk. I care about other people.
dialogue: I was inspired by your dog-waking job and put some flyers up in my neighborhood to start my own business.
You will be great at it, Especially since you enjoy walking! Start a social media page too to get the word out.
Good idea! Maybe I can expand to taking care of people's horses one day, Too. That would be amazing!
For sure! I bet that would pay even better than dog walking too.
I would hope so. The poop is a lot bigger to have to pick up, Haha! Watched anything good on TV lately?
Very true. I finally started the new season of The Circle. Have yoy watched it?
I haven't, I've heard great things bout it though. Are you enjoying it? I could use a good new tv show to get lost in.
It's mindless TV. It is not exactly high quality, But it does the trick.
Sounds perfect. I've been stressed out a little and usually exercise does the trick but lately I've needed something a little... Lazier, Ha.
What has gotten you frazzled? I have been too. Maybe it is the change of seasons.
I'm not sure exactly, But let's go with that because having an answer makes me feel better! Sorry to hear you've been a bit high strung, Too.
You have got that right! Doing anything fun this weekend?

persona: My favorite band is metallica.
I try to work out at the gym regularly. I like the treadmill and rowing machine.
I'm done with school. I majored in marketing.
I keep my hair short. I just got a haircut. I tip my hairdresser if i get 100 likes on social media.

I post a lot of positive reviews on social media. I have a lot of followers. I do it as a hobby. I have been active on social media since the time of Myspace. I have friends from myspace that followed me over to FB.
I rarely see bangs anymore.
dialogue: I have decided to go with your hairdresser; I really want the 50% off discount; when can you refer me to her?
I will talk to her today and giver her your info.
I appreciate that. I'm so overdue a haircut it's not even funny. I look terrible!
How short do you think you want it? She is really good at shorter haircuts. I love mine.
I definitely need a lot cut off, As nervous as it makes me... I don't think I've had really short hair since I was a kid, But it'll be good to have a change!
Good thing about hair is it always grows back. I have had a few bad cuts but only took a couple months to grow it out.
That's always good to remember. Did you get enough likes to tip her the last time you got it cut?
I did. She was very grateful. Anything to help local business.
That's good. Do you think I should get bangs? I feel like they're kind of unique lately.
Yes! That would be very unique. I don't know why people don't do bangs anymore! Maybe get some hi lights or low lights.
Good idea! Might aswell get color done while I'm in the chair, Lol. Hi lights for the summer are always nice!
Just make sure you get a clarifying shampoo if you swim in the pool alot. Always turns my hair green without it.

persona: I like being in parks.
I like to watch nascar and UFC.
I'd like to be in the medical field someday.
I've been an usher at an orchestra theatre since age 16. I can get free passes to the theatre.
dialogue: I just found out I will be free next weekend and can come over so we can watch UFC together.

Oh hey, That's great! Maybe some nacho cooking will have to happen as well. What other toppings do you like on nachos besides cheese? I love beef, Beans (black or refried), Tomatoes, Maybe some black olives... The possibilities are endless.
I usually like mine spicey, Would you mind if we threw on some jalapenos?
Hurray! I like spicy as well! Any other preferences? On another note, My cousin saw that there are EMT and paramedic classes opening up soon! I'm thinking about applying.
No i think that would be great, I trust your taste ha. Thats awesome on the classes, You should definitely take them, I know you really want to pursue a career in that field.
Yes, I don't think I could be a physician. I like excitement. Plus even if you get a jerky patient (I'd guess they're usually too busy being sick) they're only gonna be around you for a bit.
True, I know there is a lot of down time but when the action happens it can get intense. You do great in situations like that!
Intense is good. As long as I get a good partner to work with! Any progress for you on the work front?
Oh my i almost forgot to tell you, The clinic called back for an inperson interview! Fingers crossed!
Awesome! What kind of a clinic? Is it like an urgent care? Or more like a primary care clinic?
Its urgent, Like you, I love the excitement of helping people under pressure.
Yeah. People at the theater aren't exactly under pressure. Although it's great being able to see the new movies as they come out. Any new ones you're interested in?

persona: I don't travel much.
I live on a small horse farm. My family helps take care of the horses.
I like history. I have never visited Europe. I'm interested in the Roman Empire.
I have many years left before retirement.
I like eating fish. I prefer land over ocean.
I live near lakes and rivers.
dialogue: I booked a cruise in the next few months.
Where are you planning on going? I'd love to go to Europe!
Well actually, I booked a European cruise. It is going to be so amazing. We are traveling through the Mediterranean Ocean and making several port stops.
That sounds wonderful. I think you will get your fill of fish while your traveling.
I really hope so, I have heard they have some of the best fish in the world. Hey so, How are your horses doing?
They are all pretty happy. They are out grazing in the field right now. They get pretty frisky this time of day and need space to gallop around.
That makes sense but, Letting them out to pasture is truly the best thing for them. Do plan on taking them riding anytime soon?
I like to go near dusk and watch the sun set with my favorite horse. He looks for me every day when it's near that time like clock work.
That is so cool. I would love to own more horses but, They are a lot of work. It is so nice that your family is willing to help take care of them. Well, Should plan a riding trip together some day?
I would love for you to come out! I've got a guest house you can stay if you'd like. Make a weekend trip.
Yeah for sure. I will just have to make sure the horse trailer is serviced. It has been a while since I have had the trailer on the highway. But, Glad I will not have to find a hotel... Lol.
I have a few horses I'd like you to meet. They really have their own personalities and love people.

persona: I love horses. My family has worked with horses for generations. I grew up on a horse farm in a small town.
My dream occupation is to be a lawyer.
I want to move to the city and partake in cultural experiences.
I've brought my mini pony to the children's hospital to volunteer. I often let sick children ride the horses.
I need money for school.
dialogue: How are the horses doing?
My favorite horse, Jericho, Unexpected died two days ago. I'm pretty broken up about it.
Oh I'm so sorry to hear that. Please let me know if there's anything I can do. Do you know what happened?
The necropsy showed that Jericho ate some toxic stuff. Can you distract me by regaling some funny stories from your volunteering?
I wish. It's been nothing but depressing stories at the shelter lately. I still love what I do, But times are really hard for everyone. Again, I'm so sorry about Jericho.
I'm sure he's enjoying his big open pasture in the sky. I'm sorry the shelter has been just depressing lately. Can I ask why you decided to volunteer with the homeless?

My father was actually homeless for a short amount of time, And it really stuck with me when he told me all about it. Just how ignored and invisible he felt, And so I wanted to make sure no one else felt that way.
Oh wow, What a personal connection. It must be tough and emotional. You are doing good work. How long have you been volunteering?
A few years now. It's definitely been a rollercoaster of emotions but I'd recommend it to anyone! Have you been to the kid's hospital lately?
I'm actually going later today. Those kids love ponies. It'll be a good distraction for me.
That's a good idea. Jericho will be watching down happily wherever he is. Did you ever take him with you?
No, I didn't take him to the hospital just the mini pony, Tina. I'm happy I won't have that association. Jericho actually hated kids. Have you been horseback riding?

persona: I have cats. I watch Nascar.
I like mexican food.
I have one hat.
I like UFC. I like classic rock.
I started work at 16. My first job was in a restaurant kitchen, but I soon quit. I didn't go to college because I needed to work to support myself.
I work as a promoter. I have a few bands and artists as clients. I really enjoy my job.
I really like Aerosmith and followed them on tour. I don't know which Aerosmith song is my favorite.
dialogue: I think I just saw one of your bands on TV - great work, Mr Promoter!
Cool, Which band was it that you saw?
I think it was the Aerosmith cover band you promote. What were they called again?
I think the one you're talking about is called Aerospace. They also play electronic music so I think you'd like them too.
Yeah i loved that they mixed that into it as well. I can see them going pretty far!
I hope so, It would definitely be a good thing for my career if they blew up and were successful.
Oh i believe you will get there real soon. You always work so hard. Oh, Did you cath the last UFC fight?
I missed that one, Did you see it? Who won the fight?
Roberts clobbered him in the third round. Was so quick. You didnt miss much ha.
Ufc fights can be over fast sometimes but they're always fun to watch. Is UFC your favorite sport to watch?
I wouldnt say favorite like you but i do enjoy it. Im really looking forward to watch the qualifying rounds for the upcoming Olympics though.
Which Olympic event are you most interested in watching? I like the basketball games.

persona: I live in North Carolina.
I am looking for a restaurant job. I am willing to relocate.
My older sister always wanted to see NY. I have never visited NY. I always had dreams of living in the big city.
I have never had a license.
dialogue: My friend got back to me and says there are two openings at the hotel in Manhattan for you and your sister. You both need to apply ASAP.
That's great to hear, But I can't even find my sister now. No one has heard from her in the last 4 days.
Does your sister usually disappear or not respond for long periods of time?
No, This is the first time anything like this has happened. I hope she's all right.
I imagine. Have you thought of organizing a search with people she knows? Or perhaps contacting local law enforcement?
I'm pretty sure she's with her boyfriend somewhere. They left last weekend to go to a Nascar race.
What of her boyfriend? Have you contacted or tried to contact him?
I don't know how to get in tough with him. I don't even know his real name. His friends just call him Killer.
I would get in touch with his friends and see if you can't get in touch with him through them. If that fails and you're truly worried, I'd advise it would be time to call law enforcement.
It's all very overwhelming. I think I'm going to give it a few more days before I call the police. The scariest thing is that she's 8 months pregnant.
Sometimes waiting can be detrimental. However, This would be your decision to make.
What would you do if you were me? Would you call the police today?

persona: I have ridden a horse.
I run marathons. I have always been a vegetarian.
I have cancer. I have just started a new job for a small insurance company. I'm a life coach for hospitalized kids.
My parents are dead. I had an aunt who died.
I do charity runs for cancer. I got sponsored from my employer last year and we were able to raise $5K.
I worked at the Cleveland Clinic hospital last year.
I have a super loving mini schnauzer. Her name is Harper; she is black and two years old.
dialogue: I just got an invitation to sponsor for a charity run.
That is amazing. I know you were planning on doing something with animals. Did you decide what you are going to do?
I would like to organize a fundraiser for rescuing retired race horses. A lot of times once they are past their prime they are put down. I hate to see that happen to them.

That makes so much sense. The therapeutic horse farm that my parents work at did a fun run but did it along the horse enclosure so that when the people ran by the horses would run along with the people. It was so cool!
That must have been wonderful to grow up around. I love riding horses competitively but I hate the darker side of it. Do you have any tips for raising money? You did so well with your fundraiser.
Yeah, That was mostly my parents doing. I wish I could ask them for some tips. I really miss them since they passed away and it has been much harder for me to raise large amount of money.
Understandable, How old were you when they passed away?

I was in my early twenties so, At least I was able to learn a lot from them. The best thing you can do for your fundraiser is try to do something original but, Coming up with the idea is always the most difficult idea.
I am sorry for your loss! Maybe I could bring my horse to the fundraiser, If that is allowed. That should draw some attention!
Yeah, That sounds like a great idea! You could even ride the horse around at the fundraiser!
Fingers crossed that they would let me do that. If they do, My cousin harper can come ride with me too.
That would be amazing both of you on horses would get a lot of attention!

persona: I plan to go hiking at the Grand Canyon during the summer.
I am a civil engineer. I like to construct unique buildings.
I like Covette.
dialogue: I just realized i will be able to take a few days off during the summer and we can go hiking together at Grand Canyon.
That would be awesome! Now the weather's getting better I'm itching to get outside!
Agreed! This winter was so long, Thankfully its starting to get warm and beautiful outside. I've always wanted to go to the grand canyon but I have never had the chance.
Me too. It's really been a lifelong dream of mine to go. I need to buy a new pair of hiking shoes first though - my old ones are falling apart.
The right pair of shoes makes a world of difference. I used to hike in normal sneakers and by the end of the hike my feet were killing me!
Oh god, I can imagine. I need as much ankle support as possible or I slip all over the place and one of these days I'll break them both. The joys of getting older!
You and me both. Maybe if we are tired from the hike we can do the donkey rides to bring us back up the canyon!
You're full of good ideas today! That sounds awesome. In actual fact let's plan on that, Then I know we have something relax to look forward to at the end!
I'm glad we are on the same page. I like to hike, But lets be real, I work inside all day. I'm not a mountain climber.
For sure, And I'm not exactly known for my physical prowess either, Ha. Aim for a good view, Not a good workout, Right?
Those are words to live by in my opinion. This sounds like it will be a really fun trip. I cant wait.
Me too. We should see if we pass any Corvette and BMW dealerships on the journey there, Might as well treat ourselves to a look at some nice wheels!

persona: I like  yellow  color.
gymnastics is  my  favorite  sports.
I like  swimming. I love  Italian  food and Mexican food.
I am a music teacher. I teaches real music like radiohead.
I like drama.
I like extra guacamole with Horchata.
dialogue: So you teach 5 days a week?
I like to think that I teach my entire life. I can teach at the grocery store or in a classroom.
But do you get paid for teaching at the grocery store?
No, I just get paid teaching in a classroom.
It's great they you want to teach people everywhere. But I think it's important to be properly compensated. What's your favorite Radiohead album?
I like all their music because it's fun.
I've never listened to any Radiohead song. Any suggestion on what I should listen to first?
I personally enjoy the song creep because it's my vibe.
Is it anything like Walk This Way?
It kind of is in the sense that it contains a vibe.
I'll have to check it out. Any other music recommendations?
Please check out my soundcloud. I make music just like this.

persona: I have mutt dogs named Blue and Biscuit.
I go to concerts every weekend. I have some concerts planned from September to January.
I like to work on my two old mustangs.
I live near Dallas.
I love all foods. I like pizza with bacon and olives.
dialogue: Have you had any pizza this week?
I had some yesterday! Are you out of jail?
Yes I am out of jail.
Did you get the pepperoni pizza and meatloaf you said you would get when you got out?
Yes I enjoyed the pizza a lot.
That's great! How are things with your parents now that you're out?
I am doing great with my parents.
Great! Did you all have a conversation about what happened?
Yes we had a great conversation.
What did they say to you about the incident?
They were very sad about the incident.
And that's it? They weren't upset or anything?

persona: I am super high maintenance.
Hair care products are my favorite. I spend a lot of money. I have never used a tanning bed.
I like to play video games, especially the xbox.
I would like to try tanning.
I like strawberry and banana. I would like to go to a concert.
I have a boyfriend.
I work a lot. I have enough money for tickets.
dialogue: Have you found tickets to the concert?
No, Not yet. I am having trouble finding free time since I work so much. When's the Britney Spears concert?
I know you work so much! Its not for another 3 months so hopefully you can find the time.
I'm sure I'll be able to take off work with 3 months notice. Maybe I'll try a tanning bed before the concert so I can look extra good.
Well if you need help picking out a good place or what to try, You know im somewhat of an expert haha.
Yes absolutely! How much does a session usually cost? And will I need more than one session to get the desired effect?
Usually you want your first time to be your base. The place i go to regulary is like 30 bucks.
Oh that's not too bad! Especially since I spend a lot of money as it is- just a small expense. Cool! Maybe we could go together before the concert!
I would love that! It would be great for you to have some time to relax!
Awesome! I look forward to it! And I know, I worked 60 hours last week. I love video games but only get to play like once a week.
Have you gotten to play anything good recently when you have time?
I just got the newest Mortal Kombat game. I'm pretty sure they're making a movie based on the game. Weird, But I will definitely be seeing it!

persona: I used to have diet.
I won gold medal in Olympics.
I have two cats.
I have collect over 1000 hats. I collect military hats.
dialogue: My dog's training is coming along nicely!
What is the training about?
It's just behavioral training and training as a guard dog.
Oh dogs are so much fun, They train well! Be patient and all will work out. Will he be able to attend a game if trained?
No, He's not a service animal, Unfortunately.
Well its good only that your not in need. How many caps in your collection?
I have about 25. You?
None! i wont wear a hat, When i did i lost everyone of them!
Oh no! Well it happens.
Did you mention you weretudying dance classes?
Yes, I study tap and modern dance online.

persona: I am a surgeon. My husband is a detective. I am happily married.
I would like to go to a horror film festival.
I haven't taken time off in a while.
My anniversary is late summer. We may have a getaway. I don't have kids. We may have kids soon.
dialogue: Did you tell your husband about the film festival?
I did! He said he's willing to go with me for our anniversary as long as we go somewhere nice for dinner after the festival is over.
That is great! When is the festival?
It's in August, Around the same time as our anniversary. I'm excited about going!
That sounds super exciting. I hope you have fun!
He also agreed to the one happening this weekend! Are you still planning to go?
Yes I am planning to go.
That's great! Are you bringing anyone along?
Yes I am going to bring my dad.
Oh I bet he'll love that. It's awesome that the two of you have such a great relationship.
Yes I love spending time with him!
I hope my husband and I are able to have a great relationship with our future kids like you and your dad have.

persona: I only eat raw food.
I am married. I have 2 children.
I study economics.
I love the Rolling Stones. I am not a huge Rolling Stones fan. I see the Rolling Stones once per year at least.
I look forward to retirement.
dialogue: Are you doing well in your econ classes?
I am doing pretty well, Thanks for asking. I feel like I already learned a lot of this just by working, But it's nice to get the theories. Did you ever go to college?
I sure did. I went to the University of Florida. Those were the days!!!.
You were a Gator?!? That is so awesome. Any of your kids or grandkids follow toy there?
Go gators! I loved Gainesville. It is a great little town. I wish our football program was still good. My grandson did not get in. He is at UCF in Orlando.
UcF is pretty awesome though too. I bet all those Florida colleges got all the concerts coming to the. Did you see The Boss when you were at Florida too?
No, I had to go to Jersey to see him. Have you ever seen him? He is amazing live.
I never got to. He ended up at a venue about 60 miles from my place, But I just couldn't get it to work. If he would only tour with the Stones, Then you know I'll be their... Front row!
What is your favorite Stones song?
I know it's cliche because it is one of those Vietnam anthems, But I swear "Gimme Shelter" gives me chills every time I hear it.
Great song. I like Angie. It really brings out Mic's vocals.
Oh, You can't go wrong with that. Bruce Springsteen and the Rolling Stones just don't produce bad songs. Even the one's critics pans are better than 90% of the stuff on radio today!

persona: I have a boyfriend. I have moved into a new apartment. I do not decorate well.
Silver and red are my favourite colors.
I teach 3rd grade.
I can speak 3 languages fluently, English, French and Spanish.
I like cats.
I am invited to a rooftop party.
dialogue: Okay, I have news. The guy at work that is really lovely is single and is going to the party. So, We have an objective, Getting him to talk with me.
That's awesome! Have you talked to him before? Or only seen him in passing?
I've talked to him at work, But only casually. I'm hoping that we can talk more in depth at the party.
Are you both in the same department at work?
Thankfully not. Being in the same department would make things messy. I don't actually get to see him that much.
I can see that, Too much time together at work might spoil the time you get together outside of work. Do you know if you guys already have some common ground? Other than work of course.
I have no idea, Haha. That's what I'm hoping to find out at the party. From what I know, Though, He is very open minded and very kind to the people around him.
Well that's definitely a good start! Maybe talk about your pets to see if he is an animal lover?
Ooh that's a great idea. Loving animals is a definite must for me.
Since we'll be on the rooftop, You can always talk about the view too.
Haha true, That could be a good opener, Maybe. How did you and your husband meet?

Oh we're not married yet, But I think that moving in together recently is taking us one step closer to that milestone. We actually met on an online dating website. Being able to view his profile really sped up the "getting to know you" phase.

persona: I like to fish and cook my catches.
I love being on water.
I like comic books and heroes.
I go boating. I fish. I cook fish.
I want to start running.
I am stressed lately.
dialogue: Have you thought more about starting to run. I found a character in my comic that runs everywhere.
Yeah i actually started running last week. I have to say it has helped with my stress a lot!
It can certainly help with physical and mental health.
I think i am really going to stick with it this time. So whats teh character for your comic?
I don't remember the name. It's a new comic.
Oh, Guess it wasnt that great if you cant remember?
It was a while back. So what kind of fish do you cook?
Well its trout season! I actually caught a few yesterday that i fileted they were delicious! You should come over and try some times.
That would be great! I love fried catfish too, But it's not the most healthy.
Yeah not that healthy but delicious! Usually make some hush puppies when i get some good catfish. You a fan of them?
Oh yes! With butter on them!
Haha, Definitely!Dont you have that marathon coming up?

persona: I have a red bike. I compete individually in bike races. I started bike racing as a teenager.
I teach bike riding.
I work in a cafe as a waiter.
I have an upcoming bike racing competition.
My grandad is retired.
dialogue: How many bike races have you won?
Quite a few actually! It was my life as a kid, And now my career as an adult. Do you think you'd get one of your grandkids into it, As the training wheels are coming off?

A lot of it, Is listening to the kid, Seeing where they are strong, And what they are interested in. I want to make sure my grand kids know how to use the breaks before I let them go on their own! Love teaching confidence gradually to them.
That's great! How old is your bike riding grandkid?
He's just started school and is getting down the alphabet and the like. Need to find something to focus all that energy on. Do you have a workout routine for biking, Regularly?

I do - a few miles every day in general, But when I'm training it's far more. I also do a lot of leg work. You may be interested in some biking holidays, Actually, If you're looking for something like that.
Ah, Something that might get the kid interested perhaps. If it's something that makes you happy, Sure feel free to share the biking holidays!
My favourite 'track' (though not really a track exactly) is along the Venice Boardwalk. So much space, All that sea air!

Sounds intriguing. Do you plan your vacations around nice places to bike? I bet Europe would have a few great treks. Riding a bike in my neighborhood, That's just fine too. Where was your last holiday?
I do sometimes, But not always. Sometimes I like to have a chance to simply walk around. My last holiday was to Milan. The food is exquisite, As is the architecture. What about you?
I tend to stay within my region generally, And many times the kids help figure out the destinations. Been thinking about the new season, There are some great forests to explore for hiking and biking.
Sometimes the best places are right on our doorstep - that sounds amazing. Got any favourites specifically?

persona: I don't eat shawarma.
I play the piano. I play the guitar. I like to sing folk songs. My goal is to be rich and famous.
I like explosions. I work as a school cleaner.
I like playing the song Hallelujah.
dialogue: We'll get you some shawarma before we jam. You'll be wondering why it took you so long to try!
That sounds great. I love to try new food.
Great! We'll get you the plate, That way you can get the salad, Rice, Hummus and pita too. I'm thinking about adding some grape leaves and baklava in there too.

Yum! I was going to ask if it was more like a meal. Since we'll be jamming for a while it will be great to start with a full belly. I've had a gyro before, And read it may be similar. Really looking forward. Did we set a time to meet up?
I was thinking we could set a time for 6pm one night. Is there a day that works best for you?
My work at the school ends at 5pm, So 6pm works great. Weekends of course are more flexible, But any day during the week works for me. I already took my guitar out of it's case to get ready.
Haha, We can wait until the weekend. I have a few errands I need to run this evening.
You are always so busy. My sister is coming over tonight bringing me dinner. She is bringing BBQ over. Have you tried Beef Brisket?
I love beef brisket! Is she ordering it or is she making it herself?

She has had it in the smoker overnight. All the talk you & I have been doing about food made me hungry. When she called me earlier to tell me she was using her smoker, It was like perfect timing! I told her I HAD to have some. Lol.
Haha! I wish I could be there! Now I'm getting hungry.
Maybe you can pick up some Shawarma while you're out running errands. My break is about over. Back to cleaning!

persona: My name is Tanya.
I eat when bored. I live alone. I am often bored.
I dont know about money.
I recently had a haircut.
I have two poodles.
I am trying to lose weight. I have a multi-training model exercise machine.
dialogue: I just got my latest exam results for my Finance degree, I got an A.
That sounds great. Bet you put a lot of effort into study. Makes me smile hearing about your success. How far along are you on the degree?
I just have to make up one class during the summer and i am done!
Getting close to that goal must feel fantastic. What particular degree in Finance are you getting? Bachelor, Master, Etc.
Its my BA but i think i will continue to get my Masters. Enough about me heh, Hows your work outs going? The new machine good?

It does the job, Although getting a rhythm can take a bit of work. I'm keeping consistent, Although it takes a bit of time to get going, 2 weeks usually for me before it's regular. Do you work out, And what do you do?
I try to hit the gym when i can butive been so busy. I usually at least try to get a run in every day though. Helps with the stress.
Running can be great, At times I've been a runner. Used to be 3 miles, 3 x a week, Goal was 10 miles a week. What's your distance like?
I think the path i take is about 2. 5miles. So i usually try to get in one round before or after school.

That is a good amount, As it's enough to get your heart rate up to be sure. Many times, I have to be mindful of schedule and location, As it impacts how consistent I am. Bet you have favorite parts of the path. I love setting up goals to run past.
I do have some favorite trails but the path i take is around my apartment. Its close so i can get it done.
Location, And being close, That's helps my exercise. Although many times, Just keeping up with the kids will give you plenty of exercise!

persona: I live in Florida. It is humid where I live too.
I have a job in technology.
I like comedians.
I have kids. My oldest son plays football now. I like football.
I support the University of Florida.
I don't know anything about soccer.
I have dogs and we went for a 3 mile jaunt around the neighborhood this morning.
dialogue: How many dogs do you have?
I have 6 dogs. They're all poodles. We make quite the spectacle when we go out on our walks.
I can only imagine. I've only ever tried to walk two at once and that was hard enough.
You should see me try to give them all a bath at the same time. It's pretty funny.
How would that even work? You must have a massive bathtub! Or do you bathe them outside?
I have a swimming pool. I just drop in a gallon or two of bubble bath soap and then see how things go.
Sounds like a party. Have you ever tried a similar pool party for your kids? Just turining the pool into one big bubble bath to swim in?
Unfortunately my kids all have a rare disease and they're all allergic to water. Have you ever met someone allergic to water?
I've never met anyone allergic to water. I myself have no Allergies so I can only Imagine.
I'm only allergic to cats. My house is a no cat zone. What are your feelings on cats?
I love cats. I love all animals to be honest. It's actually animal therapy that helped me get past my alcoholism.
What was your drink of choice? I'm not much of a drinker, To be honest.

persona: I have a finance degree from Yale. I'm going back to school to study business. I am happy I returned to school. I think I will have more job opportunities. I like the idea of managing people.
My parents are wealthy bankers.
I would like to travel. My parents make me work for things.
I don't have much time for fun.
I just bought my first car: a 2000 BMW.
I am busy. I plan my schedule.
I went to Yale but I would not like to return. I'd like to stay closer to home. I want to work while I attend school.
dialogue: Where have you traveled to in the past?
I've done very little travel to be honest. I've had my nose to the grindstone just focusing on success so I could someday travel. But I've been out to Canada a few times.
I have heard that Canada is beautiful. I like your game plan of working hard now and traveling later. Where is the first place you would wish to go when you are done with school and work?
It is. I love it in winter. The first place I'd like to go is Greece. I've always loved Greek beliefs and culture; not to mention the food is supposed to be amazing!
Oh I would love to go to Greece as well. Talk about an amazing culture. I may have to attempt my hand at learning Greek next.
I've studied a little bit, In preparation you know, But with my current schedule I just don't have a lot of time to commit to it.
I can understand that. If you aren't careful, You will burn yourself out. Do will really have earned a vacation by the time you get around to taking one.
That's the plan. I hope to be able to take a few years to just travel and discover the world and much of what it has to offer. I feel it's required for my future growth.
Again, Your plan sounds amazing! I am sure your parents are very proud of you.
They put a lot of pressure on me to succeed but also allow me to be myself. They're great and they've helped me along the way. I wouldn't be here if not for them and I merely wish to honor that.
That is great to hear. I have a lot of respect for my parents as well and enjoy when others have the same. I always try to honor my parents.
It's the least we can do for those who've brought us into this world and given us a chance to experience life.

persona: Fries are my favorite food. I love to try new restaurants and dance for fun.
I am a kindergarten teacher. I like to paint.
I went to college.
I have a maclaren. I like that car.
I am very familiar with fallout. I used to play fallout. I started the game Kingdom Come: Deliverance. I die too fast to be good at Call of Duty. I play video games when I have time.
I have a boyfriend. I am getting married in July. I am going to go on vacation without taking time off work. I am going to have a small wedding.
I met my boyfriend a couple of years ago at a festival downtown, I hit it off with my boyfriend right away.
dialogue: I am sending you a wedding planning book that was very useful to me.
Did you incorporate your dogs intotje ceremmy?
That is a pretty good idea, Timing was a bit of an issue I think on that one. I like your curiosity. When the chemistry is right, I guess bring the dogs to the ceremony!
How do you think Ii can use my dogs in my ceremony?
I've seen it work sometimes with a basket attached, Small, Light, With rose pedals that slowly spill out or are scattered. Do you have thoughts about it?
Interesting, Just on another topic, Howre your labs doing?
They keep me exercised, That is for sure. They need to be walked daily, And it helps keep me active.
I like my dogs, But I wonde3r, Should.
That last sentence, Looks a bit like experimental poetry? Hehe. Maybe you could type your last text again more clearly. I like how much you love dogs.
I am sorry, What do you think of getting adaschund.
That could work for some people, Although the do have a shorter small build. I love having a dog to hike miles with sometimes. You considering adachshund?

persona: I am 20 years old.
I like cartman.
I like to shop for shoes and watches. I am a watch dealer. I do not go to school. My family does not like my job.
I had fun in third grade. I like the swing sets. I liked kickball a lot when I was younger. I only got an allowance of $1 per week when I was in third grade.
I've never been to Disney World.
dialogue: Where did you travel to when you were younger?
I visited a lot of civil war battlefields like manassas and gettysburg because my father was a big civil war buff.
That sounds fun. What did you like the best about 3rd grade?
I liked reading more challenging books and making friendships with other kids. Do you have any friends in the 3rd grade?
I have a lot of friends in my grade. Do you have a lot of friends being 20?
I have about four or five close friends, But it's harder to make friends at this age, Especially when you're not in school. I've been thinking about joining a kickball team to make more friends.
Can you join a kickball team without being in school? I play kickball, But I play at school. Do you play basketball?

There are kickball teams for grown-up, Although we can't play as often because we have to schedule around people's jobs. I used to play basketball when I was younger, But not anymore. Are you good at basketball?
I'm okay at basketball, But I am better at kickball.
I like kickball because there is not as much running as there is in basketball. I do not like to run.
I like to run, But I'm not very good at running and dribbling the basketball. That's why I like kickball better.
Are any of your kickball buddies going with you to disneyland this summer?

persona: I like Star Wars.
I have been to Helsinki.
I like Ohio State, I am from Ohio.
I drink coffee. I usually get the cheaper coffee from the supermarket. I like more expensive coffee but I don't want to spend a lot of money.
I have been to Paris. They have good coffee. I loved the Louvre building but I really liked the Egypt collection.
I go to veterinary school. School is very consuming. I have not travelled a lot. I went to Europe once with a friend. I graduate in 8 months.
I have a beagle that is about 3 years old.
dialogue: Do you plan to work in a vet clinic when you are done with school?
That's my plan. Eventually, I'd like to open my own clinic.
That sounds like a great plan. Good luck! How did you like Paris?
I really enjoyed Paris! How soon is your trip to Paris?
Still a couple months away. It's a study trip for foreign art and dance.
Oh, That sounds cool! Are you going with a group then?
Yes. It's a school trip. Most everyone in my class will be going. I really hope the trip will bring us to see the home of Josephine Baker.
That would be interesting. Since your trip revolves around art and dance, I assume you will be visiting some museums?
Yes our first stop is the Museed'Orsay.
Oh, I went there when I was in Paris! I think you'll really enjoy it. What other places will you be visiting?
We'll obviously be stopping at the Eiffel Tower, As well as a few other museums. Though I'm also super excited to see the Paris Opera Ballet School.
Yes, Those are also great stops. This conversation is making me want to visit Paris again!

persona: I like to sew.
I am a grandparent. I have four grandchildren. My grandchildren are 10, 12, 15 and 17. I have a grandson who plays baseball.
I am retired. I enjoy my retirement. I have survived cancer.
dialogue: What sort of things do you like to sew?
