I like to sew anything that I can! Pillowcases, Quilts, Designs on shirts and underwear. Ribbons for cancer survivors. It keeps me busy in my retirement. How is your Little League baseball league playing?
It is going great except that the parents like to run things to much.
I think that is normal. Parents are usually so proud of their kids playing abilities, Even if they aren't that good haha. Which one of your 5 sons play on the team?
Just the 5 year old's and they really like it. Now tell me more about yourself. What type of cancer did you have?
I am a survivor of breast cancer. I have been in remission for 30 years.
Wow, Congratulations on being in remission for so long! My husband is in remission from lymphoma so I can understand a little about it. There is always fear that it will come back.
I find that the best way to put the fear of relapse to the back of your mind is just to focus on the small everyday things that make you happy, Such as your little league and your sons.
Yes, Keeping busy is what really helps.
I am sure with 5 sons you keep plenty busy! My grandchildren also keep me very busy as well. Are your twins lookalike twins?

persona: I am involved in a dance class. I like hip hop.
I was born in the early 80s.
I have been a fan of New Kids On The Block since the early 1990s.
I like rap. I don't know much about underground rap.
I like disco fries with mozzarella cheese and gravy. I like to get my fries from the local diner. I go there every Friday evening with my dance class.
I eat Raisin Bran and a banana every morning. Sometimes I have cereal as a late-night snack.
I have a lite brite. I used to play with my Lite Brite but don't anymore.
dialogue: My husband just brought home some fries with gravy and they are amazing.
Nice. I love fries too. What kind fries?
Whole potato fries, Skin and all, With a deep brown meat gravy. Delicious!
Sounds delicious. Is this your dinner?
That and a huge burger with bacon, Jack cheese, Salsa, And jalapeos.
Yum! You're making me hungry.
Hey, It's been awhile since we had lunch. How 'bout next Tuesday. I'll take you to the restaurant the burger and fries come from.....
That sounds great. We should definitely catch up.
Yeah, I'd like that too. I want to hear more about your dance class. I'm a little old, But I think I need to get out and move more...

persona: I like hiking and rock climbing.
I like Italian food. I go to company dinners at Italian restaurants. I like Chicken Alfredo.
I am a mechanical engineer. I do not know much about gymnastics.
I live in Colorado near Aspen.
I go rock climbing not far from Denver. The highest mountain I've hiked is Crestone Peak Mountain in Colorado. I don't hike very tall mountains.I have never gotten altitude sickness.
dialogue: I booked my flight to Aspen for next month!
That's fantastic! Is that for the tournament? How long will you be there?
It is, I'm really looking forward to it! I booked the hotel for 5 nights. Any sites you recommend I visit during the trip?
If you like hiking there's lots of great places. I like Crater Lake Trail. It's also good for running. If you don't mind some hills.
Actually, I love running on hilly terrain! I'm a little worried about the altitude though since I'm quite in the same shape I used to be. Is it really that much harder running in the mountains?

That's a good question. I've always lived here so I guess I'm used to it but if you aren't used to it, It can be rough. Then again, You are in good condition so as long as you pace yourself you probably will be okay.
Yeah I probably will need to take it easy. That'll be hard for me though because I know I'm going to be so amped up from the tournament that it'll be hard to contain that extra energy.
If the weather's nice you can go boating on the lake. It's relaxing but it still uses energy for rowing. Too bad it's not ski weather, Do you ski?
I've never gone skiing before, But it sounds really exciting! Is there a place you recommend?
Snowmass is one of the big ones but it gets crowded. I haven't been up there in a while. Maybe you can come back in the winter and we can explore together.

That might be a better idea. I'll be busy with the tournament during the day, And I don't know when the slopes close in the evening. I'll see how I like the area and I can let you know about a winter trip!
That sounds good. If you have some time while you're here this time maybe we can meet for coffee (or an energy smoothie!).

persona: I do not own a car. I bike everywhere. My bike is a roadmaster. I bike in the state park.
I attend school virtually from home.
I speak 3 languages.
I live in an apartment. I live alone and enjoy it.
dialogue: Have you been on any nice trips on your bike lately?
I have actually. There is this trail nearby that goes straight to the beach that I decided to try out. It was very scenic, And I felt very relaxing to get away from the more urban parts of my city.
Oh, I feel you there. I never get out of the city, But being close to the park at least lets me see some nature. Just too busy to really go anywhere right now.
Going to the park can be really fun once in a while. Do you tend to walk or drive to places like that?

Well, I live right next to the park, So I can just walk over there. Generally, I drive everywhere else though. I sometimes drive down to the Rockaways for some beach time. What did you do at the beach?
I mostly rode around on my bike, The beach was very relaxing and breezy. I then took a bit time of later to eat some food at a local restaurant that sells good seafood.
What did you get?
I got the shrimp plate, Which is grilled shrimp coated in garlic. I also had it with some fried squid as well.
Oh, I love squid. I like to get it breaded and fried. I also really like garlic shrimp. How was it?
It was really tasty and well worth the money. I normally don't get to eat seafood at my apartment, But I really enjoy the times I get to eat it at a restaurant.
Yeah, I don't often eat seafood at home, But I love to get it when I'm out too. How has school been going for you?
Its been going well, I feel I have gotten accust to studying from home. My computer set up is well suited for online classes, And my internet connection isn't too bad either.

persona: I have a Mazda Protege.
I study language and music.
I have no pets. I'm allergic to symbiotic connections. I used to have a black lab named Cooper.
I practice the Left-hand path.
I love learning new languages. I am also studying music.
I wish I could fix cars. I have a Mazda Protege.
I am not usually a fan of animals.
I used to have a black lab. I am scared of other dogs.
I practise the Left Hand Path.
dialogue: So did you want to come over this weekend and I can show you around an engine? I've been reading more about the left hand path, It's really interesting!
I would be happy to come over and learn more about how to fix cars. Its really interesting to hear more about it, I am jealous of those that can repair their own cars.

Its not so hard to fix card. The older ones are the best, They don't have all the technology and computers in them. It makes them so much easier. I'm working on the mustang next week if you would like to come over.
That would be great. What year is your mustang, And when did you get it. Was it in working order when you first bought it or was it in need of a good repair job?
I bought it last year with my Stimulus Money. Its a 1967 fastback. It wasn't running so I got it for real cheap! I plan on painting it fire engine red.
Red is a lovely color for a car. I wouldn't mind giving my Mazda a new paint job when I get the chance. Did you have another car before buying your mustang?

I did, It was a 2000 Ford Mustang GT-8. Driving it was part of the reason why I wanted to get one of the older ones. I loved it! What color is your Mazda now? I have all the painting stuff, If you want we could paint it soon?

My Mazda currently is a blueish grey, It came as it is when I bought it used. I don't think the previous owner painted it before, So I think it would be fine if I gave it a new paint job. Is it hard to paint a vehicle like mine?
Not really. Its more time consuming and messy, But it can be kind of fun. What color would you want to paint it? Would you want it more metallic and shiny or just a single standard color?
I think a metallic color would be cool for my Mazda, I was thinking something along the lines of an indigo color. Would you recommend a metallic or matte?
I think indigo and a metallic shine/finish would look cool! Matte is always so boring to me.
Then a metallic indigo sounds good for my Mazda. I have also been considering installing a spoiler to my car, Do you have experience doing that kind of installation?

persona: I do not live in the Southwest. I like wearing band shirts with no sleeves.
I have short, blonde hair. I am girl. I am skinny. I am in shape.
I do not watch NASCAR. I like to listen to music. I like to play Call of Duty.
I work for an health insurance company. I help elderly people with their insurance policies.
I like Indie music.
dialogue: I bought the car I was looking at.
Great which one did you decide on?
It is Mercedes, What do you think about Mercedes?
They are very good looking cars! But I don't think I could spend that much on a car. Did you insurance go up?
No it is the same, I know that it is expensive but is deserve.
Definitely you work hard! Played any call of duty lately?
Yes the last week, What about going out with my new car and play it together?
Next time I'm up north its a deal! I've used up my vacation for the next six months.
No problem i'm gonna wait you, What kind of cars is your favourite?
I have a convertible volkswagen but that I love, Its yellow!
Great, My one is blue.
Did you get the mercedes suv or the sedan?

persona: I like eating fish but not chips.
I like music. I am a student. I study french and music.
I speak Spanish. My favorite artist is Wagner.
I don't like flying.
I like the band Tool. I don't play any instruments. I don't sing.
I don't cook much.
dialogue: Could you teach me some phrases in Spanish?
Of course! Would you like to start with some basic phrases?
I would love to know how to say some things related to food for the next time I visit Spain.
That's a great idea! How about... "Va a ser un refresco y dos tacos." Can you guess what that means?
Hmm, Something like I would like a drink and two tacos? I'm really bad with language learning.
That's right! You'll pick up the language in no time. When's your next holiday to Spain?
Is it hard knowing/learning two languages like you are? I hope to visit again in the summer depending on airfare and family obligations.

It can be hard, But if you practice a little every day, You'll soon start recognising words and phrases. It's all about becoming comfortable with the language. That sounds good - where in Spain do you want to visit next?
We have family in Barcelona, It's crazy seeing my extended family. I've always wanted to go to Seville or Madrid though!
I bet! I visited Seville a couple of years ago - it's fantastic, And the food is so tasty there!
That's good to hear, I guess that means I have to go now!
Absolutely! There's lots to do there - some great architecture and lots to visit. And it'll be a great chance to practice your Spanish!

persona: I am retired.
I like to mow the lawn.
I know how to grill.
I miss having a pet sometimes. I used to have a dog named Zoey. I thought about getting a cat but I've never had one before. I'm unsure about taking care of them. I am partial to tiny dogs.
I was a tailor before I retired. I worked for a bridal shop. I now spend my days at the casino.
dialogue: Looks like I will have to work overtime next week. I need to find someone to come play with my cats in the middle of the day so they don't get too bored.
Oh I can come over and play with them.
I think it is a great idea but are you interested in doing that?
I'm sure if you teach me I can do it.
Ok, It will be on Saturday, What about meeting on Friday and teaching you!
Sounds great! I can't wait to see you.
Me too, I think it will be a funny day and you will love my cats very much as you loved Zoey.
Cool. Around what time are you free?
What about meeting at 6:00 PM, It will be after finishing my work.
Are you sure? Won't you be tired after your work. I'm sure its physically draining.
No don't worry about that, I used to do shopping and meet my friends after work, Then I pay with cats.
Oh okay. I can make some food for dinner. I love to cook.

persona: I like hamburgers and fries.
I like nature walks.
I have a boyfriend. We go on hikes. We hiked at turning point last weekend. We are hiking this weekend at a place about an hour away from us.
dialogue: My ex boyfriend tried to take my piranha while I went for a hike. The fish bit him.
Oh my gosh, How did your ex boyfriend enter your place? Is he okay?
He still had a key. I made him give it back!!! He was smart enough to wear gloves so he didn't get hurt. I'm just glad he didn't hurt the fish! I took the key back and am changing the locks.
I'm glad he didn't get hurt but that is so crazy! I'm glad you're changing the locks. Aside from that, How was your hike? Where'd you go hiking?
I went in a park near me on Staten Island, High Rock Park. It has lots of trails and a nature preserve. Where are you going to hike this weekend?

We're planning on going to a place about an hour away up north. It's about an hour drive from here but the trails there are incredible. How long were the trails? I'm looking at doing something that has some climbing nearby as well.
Took my friend and me about 2 hours to hike this one but we were going slow at some points. It was a nice hike.
That sounds great! Not too long at all. What was the view at high rock park like? Are there tables and observation areas where you can have a picnic?

persona: My family does not like my job. I like watches and shoes. I want to work for a watch dealer.
I like shopping. I want to own a rolls royce ghost.
I like to run. I like fresh air. Running helps me with depression. I like running when it is cold and misty.
My cat is called Brandy. My cat is named after the song Brandy by Looking Glass. My cat is 16. I have had my cat since I was young.
dialogue: I would love to see a picture of your cat if you have one to hand?
I dont have one right now. I lost my phone when I was shoe shopping last week.
Oh no, Do you think it was stolen?

I think it fell out of my purse at some point. Im so mad, My running place list was on it too. Ill have to make a new playlist. Do you have any song recommendations? What do you like to listen to when you run?

I'm sorry to hear that! Oh yes, I have to listen to music when I'm running - it really gets me in the zone! I know I recommended my favourite song, Brandy by Looking Glass, To you in the past, But I love any uptempo rock songs when I'm running! What about you?
I have a few other songs by looking glass that I like. I also like upbeat songs for running, But sometimes I really want to distract my mind and listen to audiobooks.
Yeah, I know what you mean - I like listening to audiobooks too. I'm currently listening to a Terry Pratchett one - what about you?
The last book I listened to was the Hitchhikers Guide to the galaxy.
That's a great one, I read that when I was younger - it's really funny! Did you enjoy it?
Yes! But for my next book I think Ill listen to something in the self help genre. I was thinking something to help me cope with my depression.
That's a really good idea - there's a lot of useful audiobooks available that I think would be really beneficial.
Ive been thinking about becoming a vegetarian to help my health and maybe improve my running. Do you have any advice on getting started with a vegetarian diet?

persona: I have a brown honda civic called Coco.
I work with artists.
I enjoy listening to country music. I like music by Faith Hill. My favourite song is It's your Love.
I have a Welsh Pony called Charlie. I like pizza. My pony likes pizza. I like pineapple on pizza. I eat meat.
I have a partner of 20 years.
dialogue: What artists have you worked with?
They are all local artists. No one that you would have heard of.
What mediums do they use?
They're all singers or bands. Mostly country or classic rock. Do you like any type of music other than country?
I like top 40 too, But mostly from the 1980s.
That was a good decade. I grew up listening to that music, But switched to country as I got older.
I think its great how many artists end up being cross over these days. Like Taylor Swift, They play her on country stations all the time.
Just like that Osmond song. "I'm a little bit country. -And I'm a little bit rock'n roll.".
That was good song, I guess he and Marie don't record that many songs anymore.
They are gettin gup there in years.
If they were in concert again I would go and see them.
Me, Too. You never know when they might tour again. *crosses fingers*.

persona: I have a bike. I ride motorcycle. My motorcycle is a Harley Davidson. I don't have car.
My skin is pale. I have large brown eyes.
I am not a musically inclined person. I like rock music. I like songs about riding motorcycles.
I live in Florida. I ride my motorcycle almost every day. I am a waitress. I ride my motorcycle to work. I wear pants at work.
I own 3 guitars that a bought a few years ago. I have 2 Fenders and one Ibinezz. I do not play them because my fingers are too small. I'm going to sell my guitars on eBay.
dialogue: Before you sell your guitars on eBay, Would you consider a private sale to me?
Absolutely! Do you want all 3?
No. I think one should be enough. Can I test them out?
Sure. If you want, You can co e over this weekend and try them out. Ill show you my bike too.
Nice. I can play the song I wrote about motorcycles. If you don't mind, Can you give me a ride on your motorcycle? I've always wanted to ride one.
You bet! I have a second helmet you can wear. I cant wait to hear you song.
Great! I'm excited. When are you free?
Im covering an extra shift at the diner on Saturday morning, But Im free that afternoon and Sunday. We can take pictures of the bike and edited a video slideshow with your song.
Sunday sounds good. That'll be fun. We can food after... I'm sure we'll be hungry.
Yes, Im sure Ill be hungry too. Do you want to go to my diner? We have really good pies. You can buy one to go for your parents.
Sure you sure you want to be at your work place on your day off?
Good point. That place near the beach has an open mic night. One of my friends who does folk music is performing, I think youll like her work.

persona: I dye my hair.
I am too old.
I am an animal rights worker. I like to watch birds. I have kitties.
I am trendy. I used to be a hippie.
I dyed my hair dark brown.
dialogue: How is your animal rights activism going?
Well it's seen better days but it's alright. I try really hard at my job, But it doesn't always go well you know?
I feel you. Sometimes working at my gas station gets crazy. What kind of initiative are you working on right now?

Do you mean innovative? Well, I'm not much of a businessman. I never really liked the business industry much, Specifically the food industry. Poor animals. Hey by the way, How's your match profile going?

I'm having a hard time filling it out. I can't think of what to say. I don't have any cute kittens like you to help me out either LOL. If I did, My profile pics would look a whole lot cuter! How are your kittens doing?
Haha yeah, Kittens really help get attention. My kittens are well! They are a very destructive bunch, I've owned lots of cats before but these are crazy lol. Have you thought about getting any pets?
I've thought about it, But my job doesn't pay enough to save up for an emergency fund right now. I don't want to get a pet I can't be sure I can take care of, You know?

Yeah, Sometimes accidents or expensive medical needs need are met... I get that completely. Although there are a lot of healthy animals out there just being put down and having no chance because nobody comes and adopts them. So it still might be okay to adopt even if you don't have crazy funds.
Spoken like a true animal rights activist! No worries, I'd only consider adopting. Did you adopt your kitten?
Haha thank you. I did adopt my kittens. There was a bunch in my local pound so I went ahead and got some to take care of, Lovely creatures.
That's adorable. I should check out my local pound if I decide to get a kitten. How many did you end up adopting?
Yeah for sure, If you're up for it! I got three, Although that's just because I'm really experienced and used cats. Sometimes the little guys can be hectic. Does your dad have any pets?

persona: I live in a apartment. I have new house. I live with my buddy.
I don't like chicken.
I weigh 320 pounds. I eat less.

I want to become a nurse because of how proud I was of my mom when she was a nurse. I have one year left of nursing school.  I find it difficult to go to nursing school while working at a bar as a bartender. I do clinicals and study all day, then I serve drinks all night.
I completed all of my work the first couple of years, so now I am just doing nurse work.    I am not getting paid yet for my nursing work.
I am paying tuition for nursing school. I cannot afford certain things because of my student loans.
dialogue: Have you encountered any interesting medical cases while doing your nursing work? In other words, Have any of the cases you have been part of been out of the ordinary?

Most days in nursing are just routine but there are the occasional things that happen. It is amazing how much strength a small 90 year old woman has while they are confused and medicated. We have to be really careful as they can hurt us.
Have you gone surfing again since your shark encounter?
I am not sure what you are referring too. I just work and eat all the time.
I thought you were in school to become a nurse like your mother. Is your diet over, I had thought you were eating less?
I finish school but I am working as a student now. I am still trying to diet but it is difficult. How are your dogs?
My labrador Agatha is doing fantastic. One of my client brought her a new york strip steak last night. She loves to bark at the neighbor's dog. Do they have any therapy dogs at the hospital?

Wow your clients really treat your dogs well. Hopefully they also bring you food. Yes there is an organization that will bring dogs to the hospital to sit with the clients. The dogs can't stay in the hospital but it is nice when they come visit.

They bring me five guys. I love a cheeseburger almost as much as life itself! Some of my clients are really nice people, Other's can be challenging to work with to say the least. Did you like working as a bar tender?

Your dogs have more expensive taste than you they must be spoiled. Any job seems to have its challenges with clients. Nursing and bar tending seem like they would be so different but in reality they are both about making people feel comfortable. I made a lot of money as a bar tender and it can be fun sometimes its stressful it depends who the clients are.

Clients and customers can make or break a job. I never thought of the similarities between nursing and bartending in the terms you described. I mix cocktails for some of my clients in between recording sessions. It seems to loosen some of them up. Dirty martinis are my drink of choice. What's your favorite cocktail?

I think it is really important to have soft skills no matter what job you are in. Sometimes people are difficult because nobody has taken the time to listen to them its amazing what engaging in friendly conversation with someone can do to a persons mood. Yes a good drink can also help sometimes I like to experiment with drinks I am still working on perfecting one I don't have a favorite but I like to keep trying new things.

persona: I like drawing. I am an actor.
I live on a farm. I do farming. I grow crops. I grow potatoes and onions. I have a dog.
I watch hockey.
I am divorced. I am still in love with my ex-husband.
I like money.
I make income from farming. I find my work rewarding.
dialogue: I have just booked my latest trip overseas to Spain, I can't wait to go.
That is great what are you planning to do in Spain? Is it a vacation or are you going to look for a wife?
It is just a vacation. I plan to do lots of sight seeing and eating. I love good food from small cafes. Do you cook a lot of what you grow on the farm?
Almost everything I eat is from the crops I grow on my farm. My favorite thing to make is stew from my potatoe and onion crops. I add some beef to that and it is delicious.
That sounds amazing. I travel often, But have never visited a farm before. I think it would be fun to visit your farm, Play with your dog, And try your stew. Is it hard running a farm by yourself?

It used to be hard but then I got into a routine for planting and tending my crops and now that I have a routine it can get a bit repetitive. I get so tired some days that I wish I could go on a vacation. You're lucky. You get to vacation in Spain. Did it take long to save up the money for that trip?

It did take a while, But traveling is worth it. I get to see so many new things and take in so much culture. It can also be exhausting too though, With time changes and not understanding the languages. I think we are both lucky in our own way, Doing things we enjoy. I can't have a pet because I travle so much.

I know! Having a dog is great. I love mine so much. But when you want to travel it can be a big hassle because you either have to find a neighbor to watch your dog, Or you have to put the dog in a kennel, Which can be a lot of money depending on how long you are gone.

I would feel bad leaving a pet with someone. I do enjoy the freedom to get and and leave whenever I feel the urge. I work remotely, So I can work from anywhere. It is so relaxing to take my laptop and work from the beach, Or a hotel room. One of my favorite parts of traveling though is the food. Good local food. You must love being able to walk outside, Pick fresh food and eat prepare it right away. It must taste so good!

I do love doing everything local, And don't get me wrong, I wouldn't trade my current life with one where I travel a lot. But every so often, When I talk to people who travel a lot, I get the travel bug. I wish I could go to Spain like you. I think it would be a lot of fun. Oh, I forgot to ask. Are you taking anyone with you to Spain or are you going alone?

I am going alone this time. I sometimes travel with family or friends. I get a lot of frequent flyer miles and companion passes. I don't date much because I travel so often, But once and a while I trave with the person I am dating. I guess I find it hard to settle down with a person, Not too many people can up and leave their jobs as often as I do. I am looking for someone who wants to live a nomadic lifestyle like I do.

Oh, Well then I hope you don't mind me asking, But since you have companion passes, Do you think I could go along with you? Just as friends of course. We just have so much in common, And I'm at a good stopping point with my work at the farm, That I'd like to go on a vacation at this point. Don't worry, I understand if not. I just thought I'd throw that out there.

persona: My hair is short and blonde.
I work at grocery store.
I wear leggings.
I live in North Carolina.
I like country music. I go on road trips.
I'm active and enjoy jogging.
dialogue: When is your next road trip?
My next road trip is going to be to Florida, So i can visit my family. Do you travel often?
That sounds like fun! Where in Florida do they live? I don't travel terribly often, Only for an occasional vacation.
They actually live in Orlando so im going to be doing the Theme parks which should be a ton of fun. I usually try to take at least two big road trips a year.
Wow, That will be a blast! Have you been to the parks before?
Yes i have, But it has been a few years. I am really looking forward to doing Universal studios.
I'm sure you'll have a great time. Are you planning on visiting New York anytime soon?
I am sure i will thank you. Hopefully soon i have not actually been their before, Have you?
A couple times back in college. It's an amazing city, But extremely crowded!
Yes it looks amazing, I would like to at least go their for a few days to see the most popular tourist areas. But it is defiantly a crowded city.
Have you considered getting certification in fitness training? That might be a good first step to finding a job up there!
I have looked into it, I just need to figure out the training schedule with my job to see if i am able to do it.

persona: My father has a construction company and wants me to take it over.
I was given a lot of possessions as a child. My father did not give me love.
I go mountain biking.
I love Whataburgers. I just started a new job at Whataburger. It's temporary until my father starts training me at his construction company.
I suppose I'm trying to earn my father's love by taking  our family bussiness. I'm used to my dad bossing me.
dialogue: How is your new job?
It's going really well so far. I LOVE Whataburger and I get 1 free meal per ship so my belly and bank account are both filling up nicely. How is your new job going?
Hahaha i love to hear the enthusiasm. I imagine the burgers there are amazing and even better if they're free. How are the benefits there? I don't know what it's like to work in food-service.

Haha, Thanks! Free is definitely my favorite ingredient for burgers. The benefits aren't great, To be honest, But will hold me over until I start working with my dad. I still have health insurance through my parents for now, So just saving up as much as I can. Where are you working now?

That's good that you still have health insurance from your parents. I'm in the same boat which has really helped me feel less anxious. I'm working for a friend, Just doing manual labor. Started it recently but am not sure what I want to do for a career. If only wages were higher, Then I could do something I really loved.

If money were of absolutely no concern, What do you think you could see yourself being excited to do for work every day? Maybe landscaping or gardening? Might be hard to do that year round depending on the weather where you live though.

I'd love to actually be a botanist. Studying plants and gardening would have been my passion but college was too much money. My parents didn't have enough money to send me to it. Maybe one day if school becomes free, I'll consider going. What's your dream job?

That sounds like a pretty good plan and glad to hear you have something you are so passionate about. My dream career would probably be working in Counseling so I could help people struggling with relationship problems like I did with my Dad growing up.

That would be incredible. You should seriously look at pursuing a program on the side. I know that there are a few online schools that aren't too pricey for psychology. Would you want to be a therapist or a psychologist?

Whichever one would allow me to buy more Whataburgers.. Just kidding lol. Probably a psychologist, But I would honestly have to look more into the differences as I haven't given it a whole lot of thought before you asked me. Thanks for the encouragement!
For sure!! Seriously let me know if you need help with finding a program. While I am more into manual labor haha I do love challenging my mind!
I definitely will do that. Thanks again for the offer :). Maybe you should be the Therapist, Encouraging me to reach my dreams and all. I hope you have a great night. Enjoyed the chat!

persona: I am a homebody.
I work late.
I am 40 years old. I have been married for 20 years. I have a wife.
I like shoes.
I work in some form of data entry.
I own a home.
dialogue: What are some improvements you and your wife have planned for your house?
We haven't really thought about home improvements for awhile. I suppose it is time to get a new roof. Do you have a solar roof? I am not sure if they have those here it rains a lot.
We do have solar energy, But we also live in the desert. Lots of sun here, Haha.
Does your house stay warm at night? How do you get your organic food in the dessert?
I guess the same way anyone else does... At the grocery store. The house stays warm enough at night. It can cool off quite a bit compared to day time temperatures. I really enjoy my home.
Oh I meant does food grow in the dessert or is it all imported? Are you working on any interesting project in your home?
Some times it grows in winter, But summer is hard on vegetables.
Do you grow anything at home?
Just a few veggies so far. Zucchini, Squash, And watermelon seem ok here. Carrots love the sandy soil.
That's really interesting that all water filled vegetables seem to grow okay there. I would have never expected that. How is the water situation do you have to pay a lot of water in the house?
Yes unfortunately water is very expensive here. Fortunately I live alone so it's not too bad.
Does the solar technology help with water?

persona: I enjoy walking.
I deliver babies in my capacity as a doctor. I make enough money to live comfortably. I enjoy spending time with my family outside of work.
I used to visit Disneyland with my family. Mickey Mouse is my favorite character when visiting. Goofy is also a Disney character I enjoy.
I read books as a form of entertainment. I have seen "Shameless".
My children are younger. I protect my children's mental space. I want to encourage my children to volunteer.
dialogue: Our shelter just got new animals in.
Oh that is cool, Sad, But cool. I wish all animals could have homes. But it is always fun to meet new ones I guess. Tell me about them.

We got a tabby named Cabigail, And a litter of whippet puppies. Their eyes are just starting to open. I'm adopting one, His name is Marky Mark, I plan on putting him in races when he's grown. How is your medical practice doing?
Same as always. Nobody delivering babies today. It is a nice reprieve. I need a vacation soon, I get tired of always having to catch babies after a few months.
They sure do come out slippery! You almost need to put chalk on your hands to get a grip on a newborn. Are you going to take the family to disneyland again?
I hope to sometime next year. Right now I am planning to get my surgery done next vacation, And once I am fully healed, I do plan to go back as often as possible. Do you think you will ever go?
Surgery!!!??? Are you ok? I wish I could go to disneyland but I'm not allowed with 300 feet of schools or parks.
Oh no, Nothing serious. I am fine. Wait, What? Amusment parks count?

That's the funny thing, I thought they didn't count, But you wouldn't believe the hassle I got when I went to 6 flags over Atlanta. Judge Melchenhough made it very clear that I can't be around any amusement parks or Chuck E Cheese restaurants. Some people just like to make things hard on the little guy...
I guess rules are rules. I didn't realize you had such restrictions. Disney land is so fun. You are really missing out.
I'm used to all the rules now. Have you got your family more involved in volunteering?

Not in the last couple of hours no lol. I do try to get them to join and do things, But not every minute. They do some already, But I want them to do more. I am thinking of making them adopt a highway and that would also help my business.

persona: I love french fries and burgers.
I own a house.
I love dogs. I adopted my dog Tyson from an animal shelter. We go on walks.
I have two sons who are 1 and 3. I live in Tennessee. I have a wife. I like my family.
My wife and I don't get enough sleep. I have been a mailman for 3 years. I mostly enjoy my job. My wife stays home with the kids.
I like watching sports. I don't mind gaining weight.
dialogue: We have plans for my family to have a beach day this weekend! It will be my dog's first time in the ocean.
That sounds really nice. Will your grandson take the frisbee the beach? I wish we lived closer to the beach the closest one is a 4 hour drive away and that is too long for toddlers.
My grandchildren aren't coming, Unfortunately. It will just be me, My spouse, And my two children. Tennessee is quite far from the beaches in Florida.

That's too bad your grandchildren are not going I am sure you will miss them. I am sure having a dog will be like watching a kid will the dog go swimming? Maybe when the kids are older we will go on a vacation to Florida for now we enjoy the parks here.

I'm not quite sure if my black lab will go swimming. It would be neat to see him doing the doggy paddle, But yeah, I will have to watch him to make sure he's safe. What do you, Your wife, And your kids like to do at the park?

It will be fun to see how a dog acts at a beach. You know what is is like to have small kids they are always doing dangerous things so my wife and I have to watch them carefully. They really like to go on the slide right now though we just hope to tire them out enough so they sleep when we get home.
I hope they sleep easily too, For your sake. You told me you and your wife haven't been sleeping the best.
Yes it is still difficult managing routines my 1 year old only sleeps a few hours a night. It must be really nice to be a grandparent I can't wait until the kids are older.

You will love it once you're retired and the kids are out of the house. Now that I'm retired, I'm taking it easy, Just enjoying life with my spouse and Chocolate, The dog. How's the Post Office treating you these days?

Florida is a good place for retirement. Post office is good I am used to the routine of the job its not to stressful. Its nice when all the dogs wait in the window to greet me but sometimes they can be a little wild.
Ha! That old cliche about the dog chasing or biting the mailman is true, I see! Have you been keeping up with sports in your nights after work?

Fortunately I have never had a dog bite me but it is true some dogs really don't like mail. I don't know why you would think they would be excited about packages especially if they are dog treats. I have not been watching to much sports I try to give my wife a break by looking after the kids when I get home and then I am tired.

persona: I travel. I like French food. I have been to France 5 times.
I like swimming in the ocean.

I inherited my yacht. I have had my yacht for about two years. A captain sails the yacht for me. I hired my captain when the previous one became too old. I love sailing through San Francisco Bay. I have sailed to San Diego.
I run. I haven't ridden a bike in years. I am on the west coast. I am from Texas.
I like the food at fisherman's wharf.
dialogue: Do you ever miss Texas.
Hmm, Sometimes i do yeah. Although I'm a traveling spirit at heart so i don't ever miss Texas too too bad. Do you travel ever, Besides for marathons?
Occasionally, But I've never gone as far as France. Mostly I travel to good swimming or biking spots up and down the coast. Is the Texas gulf coast good for swimming?

It's down to personal preference but I think it's a fine place to swim, It's not too harsh. Have you ever thought about scuba swimming off a yacht? I'm around so im sure i could figure something out with you.
That sounds amazing. Do you do it in the shallows or do you do deep-sea scuba diving? I love to swim so I'd be thrilled to try either.
Haha I like to do it in the shallows, I'm far too scared to do deep sea stuff. How do you feel about the deep sea, Regardless of wanting to swim there?
I feel like it's beautiful and mysterious and thrilling, And yet also like it kind of wants to suck me in and drown me in a terrifying way. Still love the ocean though, You know?
Haha good way to put it I suppose yeah. So anyway, Is LA the only marathon that you travel for?
It's the only one I regularly commit to every year. I do a few other marathons here and there, But the LA one is the only one I've repeated. Have you ever considered training for a marathon?

persona: I love to shop. I regularly visit the spa.
I do not watch much television. I listen to Brittney Spears.
I monitor my diet. I am a professional model.
I travel. The last place I traveled to was Canada, to model at a fashion show. My trips usually last about a week.
I have never seen a UFC match. I don't really like UFC.
dialogue: Do you have any upcoming trips that you're excited about?
Yes, Next month I'm going to Paris for modeling. I can't wait to go shopping at all the stores. Would you like to travel to Paris one day, Or someplace in the USA?
I wouldn't mind going to Paris someday to visit the Louvre. It's not really high up on my list though. So many other places I'd rather go to first.
Do you travel much for your job? My ex worked in construction and he traveled all the time.
Not as much as I'd like. Most of the work I do is local. One of these days I'll have time to travel for leisure though. I'd love to go visit Florence.
Me too! I'm surprised that you didn't say you want to visit Mexico because you love Mexican food, Lol.

Oh, I wouldn't mind going down there for a relaxing vacation on the beach at some point. That said, I think if I were going south of the U.S. I'd probably head down to Brazil or Patagonia. What places have you not travelled to so far but still want to visit?

Like you I would love to go to Brazil, I think that would be so cool. I want to see the rainforest, The culture, And not to mention the food! I love all different types of foods. I think thats my favorite part about traveling.
Yeah, In my downtime I watch travel shows occasionally and the food in Brazil looked intriguing. I'd love to take a boat trip down the Amazon at some point.
Maybe we can plan a trip together someday if you want. What type of construction do you do?

persona: I am on vacation in Miami, Florida.
I am a 4th grade teacher.
My parents are still alive.
Breyer's is my favorite ice cream brand.
My favorite is going to concert. I like bluegrass and western music.
I don't have or want children.
dialogue: I'm trying to plan my 9 year old's 10th birthday party.
What kind of theme are you going to do? A country music theme would be cool!!.
I think that would be an awesome plan. They really like country music. I pretty much stick to their likes with music anyhow.

You could have them dress up as their favorite country music star. We do this at the school I teach at and the kids love it. And of course you will have to serve chocolate ice cream and birthday cake, Lol.
Chocolate ice cream is my absolute favorite. I don't even care about the brand, Chocolate is my requirement, Lol.
I love all the flavors, Have you ever tried pistachio ice cream? I thought it would be gross but it's so good!
I actually have, I enjoy pistachio ice cream, But for me it's all about the chocolate! Do you find that the kids in your class prefer plain flavors or the crazy ones?

Well we went on a field trip to the Breyer's factory and the kids could get any flavor they wanted too. Most of them went for the weirder flavors and only a few picked the plain. I think kids are drawn to try different things.
Of course kids want weird things! I bet ice cream is wonderful on a hot day in Florida!
It's the best!! So how many kids do you have? Do they all like going to school?
We have 7 kids. I don't know if they like school, They've all been homeschooled. It gives us a lot of freedom.
Oh wow! So you are a teacher like me! I bet that can get stressful some days. How old are they?

persona: I am a wrestler.  I work out.
I like hogan.
I volunteered at the homeless shelter.
I do not hike. I would like to try hiking. I would like to travel more. I want to go to Australia because of my volunteer job. I want to stay in Australia for a month.
dialogue: What part of Australia are you hoping to visit?
I'm really excited to go to Australia. I want to visit the major cities, Like Canberra, The capital, Along with Sydney and Melbourne. I also want to go hiking at Blue Mountains National Park.
Are you worried about all of the wildlife, Like snakes and crocodiles and spiders?

Yes, I certainly don't want to run into one of those nasty, Killer saltwater crocodiles! Also, I've seen videos online of kangaroos attacking humans, Which also scares me! However, I'm going to Australia for my volunteer job, So duty calls.
How brave! I've seen a couple snakes while I was out hiking, But they were pretty far away. I don't think the animals in Seattle are as dangerous as the ones in Australia.
I would imagine that Australia has much more dangerous wildlife! What kind of snakes are there in Seattle? Are there snakes in the lake near your house?

We pretty much just have Garter snakes here. They aren't venomous, But I still wouldn't want to get too close! I've never seen any snakes in the water itself, But there have been a couple in the woods nearby.
Garter snakes are harmless, But I agree, I still don't like them! How's your job at the shelter going? I really enjoyed my time when I volunteered at the shelter.
It's going well. The work is very rewarding, But it can be stressful sometimes. I've been working really hard because I think I'll be up for a promotion soon.
I hope that you get it! You're pretty young to be on the fast track for a promotion!
Haha thanks. It's not a huge deal, Just a shift manager in my department. It will pay a couple more dollars an hour, Though, Which is always nice.
Good for you! With that extra money, You could take a nice fishing trip or something.

persona: I have a German Shephard named Barnaby. I like the country. I like walking my dog on trails.
I had a cow but lost them when my parents sold their farm. Grey is my favorite color.
My family used to own a farm. My dad is a nascar driver.
I work at the post office. I think my job is boring.
I like top 40 and alternative radio.
I have a Ford Taurus and I like it.
I don't really like music.
dialogue: I'm making plans to go to a concert in the summer.
Thats cool, Who are you going to see? Anyone I would like?
I checked the website of the band the Offspring and they're touring in the U.S. This fall! I hope I can get some time off from electrician job to see them! I'd also love to see Lady Antebellum soon!
That sounds like fun!! How is your cow doing, You never told me his name?
My cow's name is Billy. They say "why buy the cow when the milk is free?", but I like having the cow and getting the milk for free! Did you have a name for the cow you used to own?
That's funny! My cows name was Bunny, Because she has fluffy hair. I miss having fresh milk to drink, And make butter and ice cream. Have you ever done that? It's so good.
No, I've only had the milk I've squeezed out of Billy. I'm too busy with work to make butter and ice cream from the milk. Did you work on your family farm while they still owned it?
Oh yes, Everyday from morning till night. That was a lot of hard work. I would cut hay and we also grew tobacco. I had a garden, Farm animals, And bee hives.
That sounds like a really back-breaking, Tough grind. Tobacco interest me. I drive a big truck and listen to country music, So it only makes sense that I'm a smoker too.
Yes it was, That's why my post office job is so boring for me. I'm used to being outside. Tobacco is a hard job with many processes. I also smoke and dip.
There's always time to be outside walking Barnaby along the hiking trails.

persona: I like gardening. I like walking outdoors.
I teach 3rd grade.
I own a golden retriever named Sally. I like to walk my dog.
I like shopping. I am a woman.
I don't know much about valuing old cars.
dialogue: I think I found a Porsche I want to buy.
That's great! I know you've been wanting one. What year is it?
It is a 1965. It is a great blue color. What do you drive?
I don't drive anything too fancy, Just an old Honda Civic. It hauls around the dog which is all I need.
I respect that. Saving on a car payment is always good. I just love old cars so much.
Besides the Porsche do you have any other favorite old cars?
I love Jaguars and old Italian cars. What is your dream car?
I have always dreamed of a Rolls Royce. I've seen them in movies and they just look so comfortable to ride in.
They are dreamy for sure. I can't wait to take it for a nice drive.
I love getting outside. Is there a favorite spot you love to drive to?
I live driving to the mountains even though it still scares me a little bit.
The mountains are beautiful. Is the road a bit bumpy up there? I imagine that wouldn't be good for a Porsche.

persona: I'm a little league coach. I have a mini van.
I drink a lot of coffee. I occasionally drink wine.
I've never kayaked. I'm going to attempt kaying with my sons.
I have five sons. They are 7, 8, 9, 10, and 11. They all play little league together.
I was a pitcher in high school. I have 5 little German Shepherds.
dialogue: When is your sons' next baseball game?
Next Sunday, They're playing the White Stars, Is the undefeated champion team from last year.
That is great, Are they all on the same time or just the same league?
The 3 oldest ones are in the junior league and the 2 young ones are in the mini one.
That must keep you very busy. I hope that they do well against the tough team.
Life advice: DON'T HAVE KIDS... Lol just kidding. But yeah, Maybe not 5. It's definitely drowning but I love them all. Thank you we shall see how it goes.
Five kids and five dogs. I can't imagine. Does each child get their own buddy?
Yes, It's pretty crazy, Eh? And yes, One day they all decided they wanted a dog and instead of getting one we ended up getting five. Do you like dogs?
I do but can't imagine having a whole pack of chihuahuas though. I think chichi likes being an only child. Very spoiled.
Pretty cool name. Is it a she or a he? And how old?
She is a diva at two years of age. Wears sweaters and all. Kind of like that movie I think its Beverly Hills Chihuahua.
Amazing. There's nothing better than spoil our pets, Right? Does she go with you when walking the other dogs or does she has her own time?

persona: My name is George.
I am a bee farmer. I enjoy dancing.
Papaya is my favourite food.
I'm not close to any of my family. I love dogs.
For fun I play shows, record music, and read. The music I record is like the band Radiohead, or slower rock music in general.
I don't know who Thom Yorke is.
I am not interested in band members' names. I have trouble remembering people's names.
dialogue: One time I sold a book to someone famous and I didn't even realize who it was until my coworkers told me after.
That sounds interesting. I wish I could have a witness someone famous because I record music.
Yeah, They told me who it was but I can't remember their name. Have you recorded anything recently?
Yes, I have a recorded a Jingle music for a television advertisement campaign. Have yor dog won any shows?
Yeah, We won the most recent one we did! I got a bit of money from it.
That is fantastic. I wish I have a dog because I love dogs. Suggest me a book to read for reading beginner.
Oh! You should read "The Kite Runner." I love that book! It's about 2 boys in Afghan and their struggles in the local community. It's at my bookstore you can totally check it out!
I love to visit your store one day. Have you witnessed any live music recording?
I've seen AC/DC at a live concert before. What's it like being a bee farmer?
It was refreshing and spiritual being a farmer. Producing food is a liberating experience. I also like french fries. What other food you like?
I love papaya like you do. It's a great food, And I love fruits.

persona: I got a new job as a life coach. My job is not interesting. I am scared of the ocean.
I had cancer. I am going to run a marathon.I wear blue sweatpants when I run.
My parents are athletic.
I like the color green.
I have a black cat. I love my cat. I attend running practice.
dialogue: I just rescued a black kitten and thought of you. Any desire to adopt a new cat?
I love black cats! Is it a boy or a girl?
It's a girl and she is the most playful thing I've ever seen. Just wants to play and be with people.
She sounds adorable. Sometimes I worry that my cat Jackson gets lonely when I'm at work. Is the cat at your rescue or have you been fostering it at home?
I am fostering and think that she needs a cat mentor to teach her the ropes. Right now she thinks she's a person.
Haha, I'd love to give her a forever home. I'll come by this weekend if you're free. How are things at the shipyard?
Shipyard is crazy. Remember that ship that was stuck in theSuez canal? It just came in for repairs!

No way! The Ever Given. That was insane how much commerce that blocked up. I heard it was the bulbous bow that got stuck in the bank that made it such a problem to get loose. Is there a lot of damage?
Not too much damage, But even when there is limited damage, We are required to do a full check of the entire ship and this one is massive.
Sounds like a lot of work! At least it's job security. Did you do the same kind of work when you were in the military?

Similar, But worked on air craft carriers. Those are huge also. There was once a family of bunnies living in the engine room for years before they were discovered! That's were I acquired my love for them.
That's remarkable, A family of bunnies living on an aircraft carrier. Bunnies are adorable and delicious, Like pigs.

persona: My name is Wanda. I am 60.
I am a librarian.
I am not married, nor have any children. I will be retiring in a few years. I am single woman.
I want to retire. I have been to Spain.I like to travel the world. I have plans to visit Iceland. I like to read about traveling.
dialogue: Have you had any luck on the dating platform we talked about the other day?
I have! Lots of matches for women my age, Thanks a million. First date this weekend. Nervous.
That's cool where are you going for your first date?
It's an afternoon date, Going to a local coffee shop downtown. Not sure what to wear. Any suggestions?
That is a perfect time to go on a date. I would wear something nice that says I'm ready tomingle!
Great idea.. I have a little sun dress that makes me feel young and a pair of sandles that I am thinking of wearing if it's nice out. You think that'll work?
Yes! That will be so nice to wear. Hopefully the weather will be nice. You will do fine on your date!
I hope so. He is a college professor and I am a librarian so feels like a good match. I feel like a school girl, I'm so excited.
That is a perfect match you will win him over. Oh yes I remember my first date I was so nervous I threw up before the date.
Goodness, You are too much. Thanks for that, I needed the boost of confidence. I am going to get my hair done before the date.
Lol! You will do fine. What hair style you have in mind? Where would you like to travel this summer?
I am thinking something simple and classy. For the summer, I am thinking of going to Finland... Not quite Iceland, But getting closer!

persona: My parents take me to Disney World every year.
I am a kid and I play on the playground. I am in third grade.
I have seen the movie "Frozen". I saw Frozen 2. I love the "Do You Want to Build a Snowman?" song.
I have two brothers and a sister. My siblings are nine, six and five years old. My older brother takes karate. I don't like karate.
I'll be taking a family trip to Disney this summer.
dialogue: I watched the Frozen movies with my kids finally -- they're really entertaining!
I love the Frozen movies, They so good. Did your son and daughter like them too?
Yes, Remember? They're the ones who finally got me to watch it, Lol! Now I'm even more convinced I should go to Disney World with them...
Disney world is so much fun. I you should absolutely go. They have the best rollercoasters, And you get to meetMicky Mouse and he'll take pictures with you. Who's your favorite disney character?
That little snowman was cute. My son really likes him, But my daughter is obsessed with Elsa. She would love to take pictures with her, I bet!
Olaf is adorable, I like him too. Is your daughter in kindergarten yet, Does she like school?
She starts later this year. I hope she'll like school. There will be other kids really into Frozen like her, I bet. And now I can finally understand what they're talking about lol.

I'm sure she'll like school. Ms. Smith was my kindergarten teacher, She's really nice. There is a after school club with at-ball team. My brother and I like to playt-ball, Maybe you're kids will play when they start going to school.

persona: I am a librarian. When I'm not working I go to Spain. I retire in a few years. I may move to Spain.
I love adult coloring books. I'm in a group for planning and stickers. I am 60.
I have an old farm house. I have cats.
I enjoy the holidays. I love my life.
I have 5 and 3-year-old grandchildren. My grandchildren and I like to spend time indoors coloring and crafting.
I am not very comfortable with the internet. I'm learning the web from my grandson. I have a deep connection with books. I don't mind when I have no internet access.
I like to drink tea.
My daughter punishes my grandkids by taking away their internet.
dialogue: So have you read anything interesting lately that you would recommend?
I actually just finished reading a book called Killing Caleb it had so many twist and turns in it, Was a incredible story to read.
I'll have to put it on my list! What is it about, Generally speaking?
A man gets sent to a mental ward and has to prove he isnt crazy.
That does sound enticing! I haven't read much in the way of literature. How would you suggest I get started?
It has a very good story line, I would defiantly recommend it. Honestly i would just start of with a smaller book of the genre you like to read and go from there.
What's your absolute favorite genre to read? I feel like you've read just about everything, Being a librarian haha!
Honestly anything genre as long as it contains some drama, Nothing beats a good drama story.
I'm guessing you've pushed pretty hard for your grandkids to get into reading?
Yes i started reading to them very young, A few of them love to read now so i will take that as a win.
That's wonderful to hear! You must be so proud of them!
Yes very proud they are a bunch of great kids. How is living on your farm going?

persona: I have a twitter account.
I don't want to go to the playground. I'm busy surfing the internet all the time.
I think women rule the world. I will be attending a feminist march later.
I don't like Mickey Mouse because he is a boy. I favor women more than men.
I have solar panels on my roof. I'm a fan of organic food.
I have a mother. I use Twitter.
I dislike Disney and Mickey Mouse. I am a student.
I like to fish.
dialogue: How was going to the feminist march?
It was incredible!!! Such an empowering movement. I'm looking at writing about it for one of feminism in politics classes at school!
Oh, That sounds really interesting. What did y'all actually do at the march? I have never really gotten to attend any political rallies or marches.
We all brought posters addressing issues with women rights and connected with each other on Twitter! It was great to see and the network is so strong.

Oh man, That sounds really cool. I love making art and posters. Walt Disney was my favorite animator of all time and really inspires me with his creativity to bring so many characters to life. What is Twitter like? My parents are still being bossy and not letting me join.
Ugh that sucks!! I hope you can join when you turn 18. It's let me learn about so many problematic issues. I'm so thankful I'm on it otherwise I would still be eating fast food all the time!!!.
Uh oh! I don't know if I am looking forward to joining as much as I thought I was if it means I have to give up fast food.. Lol. What did you see on there that made you give up fast food?

SOOO many disgusting things about meat quality haha. I promise it's worth it though! I've felt so much healthier since I stopped eating fast food. Organic food needs to be the default though... I hate how easy it is for large companies to decide everything we do.

Hmm, Interesting! I still can't really decide what to buy or anything, But my parents never buy organic food and I seem to be doing fine. I guess you don't really know what you're missing if you've never tried it though.
Dang, Your parents seem quite controlling haha. What else do they decide for you? Agency is so important.

Haha, I know but they do love me and care about me. Well, Like for example, I still have a bedtime, Can only have 1 hour of screentime a day, And have to ask permission to sleep over at my friends house. What does agency mean?
Agency is when you're able to make your own decisions or when you can learn how to make your own decisions. That's fairly standard. The 1 hour of screentime a day must be hard. How do you use it?

persona: I love cars.
I work form home.
I go to the gym with my girlfriends.
I am lazy. I love to binge watch tv.
I love Narcos. Better Call Saul is another favorite. NARCOS is a good way to learn history.
My boyfriend has a girlfriend. They are judgmental about food.
Lamborghini is my favorite kind of car. I love the Lamborghini Aventador. I can't afford a Lamborghini.
I have no park within walking distance. I can drive to a park if I need to.
dialogue: I think I'm going to talk to my tax preparer about the Tesla write-off. Maybe I could afford one after all.
That's awesome! Tesla's are incredible. They literally have so many apps that are on the car. Do you think you'll get the self-driving upgrade?
Interesting! Do you know what apps are available? I guess you have a lot of free time for apps when the car is driving itself, Lol. I am def gonna get a self-driving one if I can afford it.
That'd be super nice! Literally so many apps. I believe there is its own app store, And you can stream content like on Netflix and such. You could watch Narcos!!!.
Wow, I did not know that you could watch Netflix in a Tesla. Please don't tell my husband so I can have some alone time with Pablo as I drive, Girl. You been watching anything new lately?
Yes!! I'm actually currently watching the handmaid's tale. Season 4 just came out and it is crazy!!! How about you?

I have heard so much about that, But haven't started it yet.. Will have to put on my list. I have been getting into Silicon Valley lately, But I am just so busy, It's taking me a while to make it through!
What's it about? I'd like to watch a few more shows once I'm done with this season.

It revolves around a startup tech company in Silicon Valley, Kind of like a poor-man's Facebook, Google, Etc, But it is well written and has good acting! How's your relationship going with your boyfriend?
It's going great! He's actually going to be spending the next two weeks at my place. How's your husband doing? Do you have any plans with him soon.
That's great! Does his girlfriend stay with y'all too when he stays at your place? He is doing fine. We are celebrating our 10 year anniversary soon so looking around for places to go for that.
Yep! She'll be here too. We're talking about just becoming a throuple. Are you all wanting to travel or just go to a fancy dinner?

persona: I love to dance and paint.
I am a mother of two.
I was born in America.
I don't like chili cheese fries.
I go dancing five days a week. I love the samba style of dance. I've taken dance classes. I don't have a lot of dancing skill. I am not a professional dancer. My friends laugh at my dancing.
dialogue: I ordered some chili cheese fries for delivery! They should be here soon.
Oh i'm sure you would like them. I just had my snack. What else did you order besides chili cheese fries?
Bacon double cheeseburger with ghost peppers.
Wow what a meal! I hope you get to exercise after such a heavy meal. How about we dance after your meal?
That'd be great! what's halfway between asamba and a waltz?
Haha i wish I knew. Let's just dosamba first and then some waltz? Samba just makes me so happy!
It's got that upbeat latin swing to it. and a waltz to slow everything down. we won't invite your friends so your friends don't laugh...
You know what at this point I don't even care if they laugh or not. I just enjoy dancing. Dance like no one's watching!
Yeah. we can dance if we wanna. we can leave your friends behind. cause your friends don't dancer and if they don't dance... We'll take off our hats and dance anyway...
I was also thinking if you would like to join me at my dancing classes? Maybe not five days a week but once or twice? What do you say?
Mmm, Maybe. is it ballroom dancing or justsamba dancing or... What?
Well I do Samba there but they have a variety of dance sessions. Whatever suits your fancy! I think they have waltz sessions in the evening!

persona: I still live with my folks.  I live in an urban area. I'm in the 10th grade.  I have great grades. I study biology.
I listen to music while I do homework. I love rock concerts.
I want to train people.
I live with my mom and dad. I get along very well with my dad. We are training to run in a marathon over the summer. I like listening to music while I run
I want to be a physical therapist someday. I want to help athletes, the injured or disabled

I enjoy the subject of Biology. I like to understand natural systems. I'm looking forward to graduating. I have three semesters left in school. In college I will study physical therapy. I want to learn about nutrition. In two weeks, I have Spring break.
dialogue: So what are you planning to do for your Spring Break?
Most definitely keep training for the marathon with my dad... Whats it like being a farmer?
Just like i told you before it's a peaceful life. Except when you fall off from a horse and injure yourself.
Oh dear, That sounds like it hurts... Aaarrgghh. But I guess you must've gotten used to everything about it. Do you have a favorite subject in Biology? Because I do... Genetics!
My favorite? Isn't it obvious it's botany. Thats how i know the nutritional values of the crops we grow. And that's how i stay healthy.
Haha! Yeah quite obvious. Lol, Can I assume you're vegetarian too?
Yup i'm a vegetarian. I do love my veggies in the morning.
I feel like a psychic now for making that right guess.

persona: I sing country music. I can play guitar.  I like to go to national parks.
Rascal Flats is my favorite band. I am a Britney Spears fan. I don't know Rascal Flatts music very well. I like "Hit Me Baby One More Time" by Britney Spears. I like all Britney Spears songs.
I'm nostalgic for my teenage years.
dialogue: What do you miss most about those good ol' teenage years?
I guess mainly just how dumb and naive one can be and doing or saying anything without worrying about the consequences of our actions.

Ha! Don't I relate. I used to love just being able to say "screw it," shut out the world, And hang out with my friends, Listening to Britney Spears. Now we only have hobbies when we have the time. Are you gonna chill anytime soon, Maybe go to a national park again?
I'm happy to hear I'm not the only one!!! Britney is the bomb, Right? Funny that you mention it, Next week I'm going with a couple of friends to Yellowstone, Have you ever been there?
Darn right, She is! That sounds fantastic! I've never been there. Do you usually go with friends, Or do you do solo trips, Too? If I go, I can't decide if I'd rather be alone or not.

I like going with at least someone else, It can go from fun to not-so-fun very quickly if you happen to get stranded or lost or without reception. It happened to me once when visiting the Grand Canyon. I truly felt that was the end.

Oh, God, That sounds terrible. I think that place is too big for me, Anyway. I'd always feel like I'm either about to trip off of a cliff, Or be turned around and get lost. Did you have a guide on your first time? I think that might make me feel safer.

I had the same feeling but didn't trust my instincts. I went there thinking it would be pretty easy to not gets lost, And 36 hours after I was suffering the consequences. If I'm talking to you today is because the hostel I was staying reported me as a missing person. A guide or just a going with a group in your first treks is the best choice, Trust me.

Oh, Jesus. That's like something from a movie. I'm glad you're still okay and with us. Taking that into account, And how sluggish my new diet-change is going, I think it may be a while before I feel up to that, Haha. You know, An upcoming trip that I'd like to make is to a concert. Its been forever since I've been. We should go see Rascal Flats sometime--get you to brush up on them.

If you have watched the movie 127 hours, That's how I felt even if I was really not trapped. Concerts are amazing, As a music enthusiast myself, I aim to attend one or two per year, So sign me up to go and see the Rascal Flats. That sounds like an amazing idea.

Yeah, That's what I was thinking of! But I didn't even want to mention it, Since it's so grizzly. And a true story. Heck yeah, That sounds great! You know my favorite, So I'd love to be formally introduced to your favorite at a concert!
Of course! We can do a double date and enjoy some relax time together and share with you guys in more detail my other crazy stories when going on treks!

persona: My religion is Buddhism. My spiritual journey is important to me.
I live in Alaska. I meditate under the northern lights in Alaska.
I like line dancing with friends. I would like to take salsa lessons in the future.
I don't speak verbally by choice. I communicate with friends and family by phone. I like being non-verbal.
I am employed as a pilot. I am on sabbatical. I haven't flown a plane since becoming non-verbal.
dialogue: My dance teacher believes I can be a professional dance instructor before too long!
That's great to hear! I know you can. And I'd love it if you can teach me, Sometime! I think having a teacher that I know would make me feel more comfortable learning.
I would love that, Maybe you could start flying again since I don't live nearby.

Well, I'm still non-verbal. It's important to me to be strict in my convictions. So, As long as you're okay with that. And sure, I can fly--just not as the pilot. Do you think salsa-dancing is a spiritual dance?
I think any dance is spiritual. It lets you release all your energy. Do you have a song you would like to learn a routine to?

Oh, I always get into the music that you play when we line-dance! And that's usually just stuff from your childhood. So, I'd love to have you teach me something from the 80s! Maybe I can be a practice-student for you, So that you can have an easier time teaching many students.
That sounds like a plan. We will have to get something on the books.
For sure! And when I'm flying again, I'd love to be your pilot on a trip to Alaska. You've got to see the Northern Lights! It's the most spiritual scene in the world. What do you say?
I have always wanted to go and see them. I appreciate the offer greatly. Is there a lot of wildlife around your home?

That'd be great! And oh, Yes. But they keep to themselves. You'll see foxes and such around the home. Moose a bit further past the trees. And truly out there, Is where you'll find the more unique creatures: caribou, Wolves, Beavers, And such. Are there any particular ones you'd like to see?
I would love them all.

Oh, Yes! They're all a marvel. Of course, Wolves and bears would be terrifying to stumble upon. But I love to spot foxes in the wild. They're sneaky little creatures, But they always have heart. I feel they're very spiritual.

persona: I like shawarma.
I live in Canada.  I am in the Army.
I watch American football and my favorite team is the Steelers.
I like to stay fit.  I have a family. I once had health issues from exercising too much.
I'm a football fan. I've tried Fantasy Football but I didn't really like it. I think Najee Harris is a promising football player.
I can watch football on three different cable stations.
I enjoy watching the Olympics. I admire the strength of the gymnasts.
dialogue: I'm excited because there are some gymnastic championships on tonight actually.
On which channel and at what time?
HBO at 7 o'clock. I can't wait.
I'll try to watch, I am impressed by their abilities but I have difficulties following a competition, Do you have any tips?
Just follow one gymnast or one team. Then it's easier.

Yeah, But they are so many events, Like when they spin around bars, Then they jump on a mat, Then they jump on a beam and then they jump over some sort of stool. All those events happen at the same time. It does not make any sense to me.
The vault, Is the stool they jump over. Just try that watching that. Basically, The more tricky the more points you get. But they take points away if you don't land gracefully.
Yeah, But on the TV, They show 3 contestants for one event then they switch to another event. It is very difficult to follow. I guess it is easier to follow when your are on the floor.
I get what you mean. Would you like to come to competition with me? Then you could just follow one event.
I would be great, Where do I to buy a ticket?
You get them online from gymnastics USA. Or If I'm going too, I can get you an extra ticket.
That would be great, I will invite you to a football game next time. When do you have a free weekend?

persona: My wife is a doctor.
I am a professional tennis player.
My wife and I own a three story house and have children.
We also have a black Labrador called Bear. My dog is a very good swimmer. My dog sheds a lot of hair.
dialogue: I talked to my parents, They are willing for me to meet your dog.

That's great. Bear is very friendly so they will love meeting a new friend! I'll bring one of the many tennis balls that they've claimed as their own! Would your parents be happy for us to meet at the park?
I will ask them and let you know! How old is bear?
He's 4 now, Though still acts like a puppy even though he's adult sized. Are you ok with bigger dogs? Some people can find them a bit daunting.
I will get use to him, One of my best friends has a big dog and we get along really well. He drools a lot though!
Aww, What kind of dog does your friend have? We're lucky that Bear doesn't really drool much, Apart from when he's snoozing.
My friend's family has a Bernese Mountain Dog so it is big but very friendly. He does more laying around than playing.
Bernese Mountain Dogs are beautiful; they are the black, White and brown ones right? They've got such friendly faces.
Yes they are black, White and brown. How has tennis been going?
I haven't been training as much as usual as I've been doing quite a bit of work on the house. But in a couple of weeks I'm starting more intense training again. Do you get to play tennis at school?
No, Once I move to the high school I will be able to join the team though. You may have to give me some tips!

I first got introduced to tennis at high school too. I think the first tip I would give is to keep your wrist straight when you hit the ball. If you bend your wrist you can get injured quite easily. Have you ever had a sporting injury?

persona: I listen to classical music.
I am a christian.  I like christian rock.
I ride a tractor.
I like camping. I like the outdoors.
I cook on an open fire outdoors.
I like the color red. I crochet.
I have a sister. My sister is pregnant.
I enjoy reading thrillers. I don't like gore.
dialogue: I am looking up new crochet patterns!
Already? You haven't even finished making your blanket! What kind of patterns are you looking up?
Very true! I'm only halfway through the blanket and keep coming up with other ideas of things I could make. I'm thinking of crocheting a cardigan for summer. Have you ever made one before?
Clothes are too complicated for me to crochet. I just buy sweaters on Etsy. I usually stick to blankets and scarves. How about you? Would this be your first cardigan?

It's great that you buy them from Etsy, I like supporting independant sellers too. I did once crochet a cardigan but it was for a baby so they weren't aware of a couple of mistakes I made! Are you in the middle of any crocheting projects at the moment?

I'm still working on that baby blanket for my daughter so they'll have it when she pops that thing out. I might make her a few of them since babies can get messy. Might try my hand at making some baby booties to keep her feet warm too.
Baby booties are so ridiculously cute! I reckon you'll definitely be able to make some. How long is it until your daughter is due to give birth?

Oh my, My mind is so jumbled today. I meant to say my sister's daughter, Even though she's like a daughter to me. She is due in a few weeks actually. The baby will be here before we know it. Still don't know if it is a boy or girl. She won't tell us. What do you think it will be?

Haha ah yes of course, I should have realised that's what you meant. That's so exciting that the baby is due so soon. I'm not sure if I could deal with the anticipation of not knowing whether it was a boy or a girl! I'm not sure what it might be; does she have any other children?
It is her first. Kinda weird though, Them both being pregnant at the same time. Hope it's not by the same guy! Lol. Now that would be a good book to read!

Wow yes that would be an interesting read! If it's her first, Something tells me it will be a boy. Also since it's her first she might end up being overdue! I've never had children myself, Though I am a godparent to my best friend's kids. Are you a godparent to anyone?
I am not a god parent to anybody. I think having nieces is plenty. A boy would be nice to add to the family though. Mix things up a bit. Do you take your god-children camping with you?

persona: I have superpowers. I can make time stop. I have superpowers that make me feel good.
I am a small young girl.
I am going to be a flower girl in a wedding.
dialogue: How excited are you about being in my wedding?
I am very excited. What are some of the things you need to fo before the wedding?
You could practice walking while dropping rose petals. Do you have any flowers in your yard that you could use?
That is a good idea. I have roses and sunflowers in my yard.
Make sure that your mom doesn't care if you pick them. Have you gotten your dress and shoes yet?
Not yet. We will be going shopping tomorrow!
You should wear your shoes around the house, New shoes always hurt my feet when I first wear them. If you break them in before the wedding you will have a much better time at the wedding!
I will do that. Did you get new shoes for the wedding too?
I haven't gotten them yet. I'm thinking of wearing tennis shoes I don't think anyone will see them below my dress. What do you think?
You could go barefoot. Paint your toenails and if anyone does notice, It will look curer than tennis shoes.
Thats a great idea, Only what if I'm walking down the aisle and I step on something ang get a splinter. I wouldn't be able to dance! Do you like to dance?
We can put a runner down for you to walk on. So no splinters! Yes i love to dance. It is fun.

persona: I have blonde short hair.
I like jeans and leggings. I like shoes, shirts and nirvana shirts.
I play games and listen to music on my PC.

I like country music. I listen to Dolly Parton. I want to go to the Dolly Parton concert at the Boston Civic Center in August. I'm open to going to additional concerts by other artists. I'm open to going to a concert that's more modern than John Denver.
I think Dolly Parton puts on a great show.
dialogue: I've been doing some research and found some great concerts we could attend.
Are we thinking about country this time?
Yes, One of my ideas is a John Denver concert, There's one in August. What do you think?
Oooh, I was really hoping to go to theDolly Parton one actually.
