Hmm, I likeDolly Parton, But I'm not sure I could sit through a whole concert! Is it going to be a long one?
She really makes it interactive, I am sure you could get through it!
I'll consider it! Would you be open to anything else? Maybe a Nirvana concert?
I love Nirvana! Is a concert for them happening soon?
There's one on August 10! I think that might be the same day as theDolly Parton concert so we'd have to choose.
I really like both, Lets go to the Nirvana one if you are not sure about theDolly Parton concert.
That sounds like a plan! I can't wait! What are you going to wear to the concert?
I actually have a few Nirvana shirts. Would you need one?

persona: I have a dog. My dog is a Border Collie named Larry.
I work at Barnes and Noble. I am a Chemistry Graduate student. I enjoy chemistry. I am not working in the field I studied.
I like to dance.
I don't think fashion is important.
dialogue: So when are you looking at taking Larry to his next class, I would like to come along and see if a pet would be good for me.
I think the next class is in two weeks. I will have to check the calendar. I think that is a great plan. What type of dog were you thinking of?
I'm not sure. After getting let go from Petsmart, I feel like I don't even know animals well anymore. Would you recommend a Border Collie? Do you think they're easy to care for?
I think they need a lot of attention. They are great though, Very smart. I'm sorry you got let go. Are you looking for work still?

That sounds good. Maybe taking care of something like that would help me. And I'm good. I'm working as a baker--it just still hurts. I sometimes wonder if I'm not in the right field. Do you feel that way about working at Barnes and Noble? Is it satisfying, Even though it isn't chemistry?
It helps pay the bills and the discount definitely helps when it comes to textbooks. It sounds like a pet would give you a bit of a new lease on life.

Oh, That's a good point. Haha, The perk of being a baker is knowing how to bake! And that's true. I think that's what I'm looking for--more fullness in life. Maybe you should try that too--get more into dancing, Like you've been talking about.
That is so true, I do need to get out more but my coursework is very demanding. Maybe we could go together.
Oh, I feel you, There. I'm still taking courses, Myself, Just in case this whole baking thing isn't endgame. Do you think you'll go for another job, After more schooling?
I plan to apply for job with a biotech company. I want to help find cures for the diseases that don't have them yet. Baking uses a lot of chemistry.

That sounds fantastic! That's really good stuff. Important stuff. I'm still figuring out what I want to do, But it might be something like that--that makes a difference. Maybe just tech security. Both stopping viruses, Eh? Haha, Well, I'll trade you some baking lessons for some help with my homework sometime. Definitely bring Larry by, Too!
I've been dying to learn how to make this salted caramel pie I had the other day. It was expensive but so good.

persona: I live with my mom and dad. I am 19. I would like to move out of my house.
I work at Burger King.
I enjoy hanging out with my friends. I don't drink or smoke.
I've never before seen any eagles in person. I don't have any pets but I want a corn snake. I want to get a snake when I get my own place. My parents won't let me have a snake.
I couldn't feed a snake live mice. I don't want a large snake. I've never owned a corn snake.
dialogue: I've been doing some research and found more interesting bird watching spots near me.
Oh really? We should go bird watching together. I really want to see an eagle!
That would be awesome! Are eagles your favorite animal?
No, I like eagles but I've never even seen one. My favourite animal is a snake! I wish my parents would let me get a pet corn snake.
A pet corn snake? That sounds crazy, Why won't your parents let you get one.
They don't think I'm responsible enough to look after it. It would need feeding live mice and to be honest I would hate to do that, So it would end up being my parents job to feed it!
Oh I understand, I could not fathom feeding live mice to a snake. Maybe you will get one when you are living on your own?
Doesn't your cat bring mice into the house? You must be used to gruesome sights like that. Yeah I might get a snake when I move out! I can't wait to move out, I will have so much more freedom!
Oh no! I treat my cat like my children, And they do not eat other animals. I would have a problem with my cat if they killed mice. I can't wait for you to be independent and free!

You are lucky that your cat is not into catching things, Because I don't think you'd be able to stop her! I know you don't eat meat, But for cats it is natural. I can't wait to be independent too! I am saving up as much money as I can from my job at Burger King.
Slowly but surely, I am sure you'll get there soon!
I will do! I hope it will be worth it - I'm not going on any holidays this year because I want to save the money. How about you, Do you have any holidays planned this year?

persona: My name is Eduardo. I am 13 years old. I have an older brother.
I like playing soccer.
I own a small giraffe called Earl.
I can teach soccer. I cannot win a race.
dialogue: How has your giraffe been this afternoon?
He's not doing great... Because of his height, He has a hard time reaching the leaves in the back yard.
Aww, I'm sorry to hear that. It's hard getting Water MelonDrea to eat sometimes. Do you help him? Can you just give him leaves? We give our turtles lots of chopped lettuce.
I toss in a head of lettuce or two, But giraffes aren't really great at reaching the ground with those long necks either, Even though he's so low to the ground by comparison.
Oh, Jeez. That's really sad. But you're good at helping people, So I think he'll be okay. Have you been helping teach soccer more? I still want to learn.
Well, I'm no runner like you, But my strong point is strategy, So I play the position near the goal. The goal is to make the goalie's job easy.

Oh, That's really smart! I just like kicking the ball, Haha. I get so excited, And I kinda do things without thinking. Sometimes it works, But lots of times it doesn't. Maybe you can teach me to be smarter like that. I want to be better. We can run together, And you can get better at that, Too!
Sounds good. You're not too far off from most of the up-front people on my team, Hehe. Trial and error, After all.

Haha, Yeah. Maybe a good team needs both: fast people and smart people, Haha. Maybe you think too much to run fast, Too. Do you think a lot about how you run, And how you breathe, And how fast the other people are? That might make you slower.
Well, That may be the reason I cannot win a race. What do you think of when running? Your turtles or something?

I think about my dolls! Hahaha, I think aboutmashing them around and ripping them up! It's so much fun, And it gets me so excited! So, I'm usually really excited and happy when I run. You should think about what makes you excited, Too! Like soccer! Just pretend you're running for the ball.
Well, What I tell people to do when I teach soccer, Is basically to think of their pets, Or something simple. It's a lot like driving. Instinct takes over.

persona: I enjoy eating donuts while driving. I ate 12 donuts at once before.
I speak Spanish. I enjoy playing games and my favorite is Call of Duty.
I like role playing on weekends. I have a role playing session this weekend with the setting taking place in a future where magic becomes real. I do role playing with two other people and the GM.
I own a ford pinto. My car is brown with pink dots.
My favorite band is Insane Clown Posses. The only band I've seen live is ICP.
Sausage and peppers pizza is my favorite.
dialogue: I've been looking into new video games to try.
Oh really? What kind of thing are you looking for? Shooter? Arcade?
I'm thinking of an RPG as a few of my friends play things like World of Warcraft. Maybe something like Skyrim, As that seems to have good reviews. Do you play any RPGs at all?
I don't actually, That's the one thing I can't recommend! Although I've heard nothing but good things about Skyrim, So might as well start there.

Yea I'm thinking I might as well go for it as it's on sale at the moment. Let's hope my laptop can run it. I bought it as a gaming laptop but it's quite old now and I'm not sure the graphics card can keep up with newer games! What console do you play Call of Duty on?
I just bought a new gaming setup actually. It took me forever to get hold of all the parts with the shortage, But I've got a shiny new 3090 GPU chugging away and it works awesome!

Ooo I've just looked up the 3090 GPU and even the part itself looks awesome! My laptop has an NVIDIA Geforce GTX sticker on the front half peeling off but who knows what the actual card is! Did you build the new setup yourself?

I was going to, But it was taking so long waiting for each individual part to come in stock and then to beat the bots in actually buying it. It cost me a little extra to buy a ready built-up set up but oh my god are these graphics worth it. I feel like I kill people in CoD when they're still on the loading screen, Lol.

I totally understand, I'd definitely get it ready built too (especially as my electronic skills are basically zero). My wifi has been rubbish recently so I think that sometimes I'm probably the person in the loading screen getting killed immediately!
Haha! Well my bad. When are you going to see Aerosmith?
Haha it's the wifi box's fault, Don't worry! The Aerosmith gig isn't until October. I can't wait to see some live music. Are you going to see any bands this year?
Hopefully I can go to Gathering of the Juggalos and see ICP. I haven't been in a few years and I'm so excited to see some live music too!

persona: I can cook Paella. I enjoy fresh vegetables, Fish and Chips.
I haven't been to Australia. I enjoy sailing. I was raised around water. I am related to Columbus.

My favorite European country to visit is Italy. I hope to go to Europe again this summer. I might visit Italy again and a few surrounding countries. It has been a year or two since I was last in Italy.
I am studying different kinds of art at college. I have a year left until I graduate. I don't plan to be a professor.
dialogue: Have you booked any of your trip to Europe yet?
Not yet but I've been researching places to go in Switzerland and Austria as I love the Alps and it'll be close to get across to Italy. Have you been to Austria or Switzerland before?
No I haven't but I would love to travel to Switzerland. I've heard it's a beautiful country. I hope to travel to Italy and Switzerland one day.

Yes I've heard it's beautiful too. I think I'll have to brush up on some Italian before I make the trip, As I haven't learnt any since I was in high school! I think we had to learn some French too, But I can't remember most of it now. Do you speak any other languages aside from English?

I took Spanish in high school and then traveled to a few Spanish-speaking countries to practice, So I used to be quite good at Spanish, But I haven't used it recently. I'll definitely need a refresher. Have you heard of DuoLingo? That app helps you to learn languages.

Oh that's great that you were able to practice in Spanish-speaking countries; I've heard that the best way to learn is to immerse yourself in the culture! Yes I have heard of Duolingo though I haven't used it before. Do you know if it is free?

I used it years ago and it was free. And yes, Traveling definitely helped with my Spanish, But I may use the app as a refresher before I travel to Italy. Any recommendations of things to do while in Italy if I bring my family there one day?

Great, Well I'll definitely look into Duolingo then. And as there's an app it'll be useful to do on my phone when I get a free moment! In terms of where to go in Italy, I'd recommend the area in the north around Lake Garda as it's just beautiful and there are lots of towns to visit.Tuscany is also lovely with all its rolling hills and vineyards. If your family is into art then Florence is good choice too!

Thanks for all of those recommendations - that's really helpful! I enjoy art, But my kids sometimes get bored by it. What type of art are you most interested in? I enjoy nature photography and painting.

Ha yes I can imagine that the kids might get bored in art galleries! I also enjoy nature photography, And portrait photography too. I'm not very good at painting though! What type of painting do you do (e. G watercolor, Acrylic etc)?.

I like oil painting the most, But I tend to use acrylics more often because the smell of the turpentine needed to get oil paint out of the brushes is really nasty! I don't want to use such a harsh chemical around the kids.
I hadn't thought about how hard it must be to get oil paint out of a paintbrush, I can understand why you don't want to always have to get out the turpentine! What type of thing to you like to paint?

persona: My dog is a Shiba named Gabriel. My dog, Gabriel, is 3.
I enjoy knitting. I learned how to knit from my grandmother when i was young.
I enjoy baking cookies. I volunteer my baking skills for a county bake sale.
I work at an office and have overtime.
dialogue: How is Gabriel doing, Do you cook his food as well?
I believe I cooked it well, He ate it faster than he normally eats his food. Must have been a success.
Well that's good to hear. I meant to ask you for a simple baking recipe if you could recommend one? I want to branch out a little from only eating cookies.
It is always good to branch out. I would love to send you a recipe. What type of food is your favorite?
Anything sweet is good for me! But bear in mind the only thing I know how to cook is soup, So when I say the recipe needs to be basic I mean... *basic*, Ha.
How about a good croc pot recipe to start off? You throw all the items in the pot, Turn it on and stir occasionally?
Oh I meant a dessert recipe! I'd like to branch out into cooking something sweet. I love cookies, So maybe I should start there unless that's too complex?
I have a great 3 layered brownie recipe or I have a croc pot cake recipe. I can send you both and you can try with those first.
Sounds awesome, Then I have both courses taken care of! Thanks so much. I'd starve without you, Lol.
Glad I can help with your cooking needs! Hopefully you share with your roommate. How is school going?
Going well thankyou! But so busy. Maybe that's why I'm itching for a new recipe - sick to death of living off ramen!
I can imagine that gets old rather quickly. But once you become a nurse it will surely be worth it.

persona: I have a job. I graduate from Yale in 2011 at 9 years old. I studied Electrical engineering and computer science at Yale.
I live in Manhattan, New York.
My parents work as bankers.
I have a bamboo. I drive a BMW.
I work for an MNC.
I'm a dog person. I have a spouse who is a cat person. I've been with my spouse for around 12 years.
dialogue: Has your spouse ever tried to convince you to get a cat together?
We have thought about it. While I prefer dogs, I'm not opposed to having a cat.
Have you had many dogs before. Which kind of breeds have you owned in your life?
I've had several dogs, Most of them have been mixed breed mutts haha. How about you?
I haven't I havent had any dogs before in my life, Mostly cats. I have had several types of cats, But recently I got a Scottish fold tabby from a shelter.
Those have an interesting look. Do they need any different care than a regular cat?
In general, They need more grooming than other types of cats, Especially if they have longer hair. I try to brush him at least twice a week to keep his hair untangled.
Does he enjoy being brushed?
He does when he keeps still most of the times, But sometimes he really doesn't want to be brushed. I try not to brush him if he doesn't keep still.
That makes sense. I'm sure he appreciates not being brushed when he's not in the mood.

Yeah, Its important to keep in consideration how your pets are feeling, And to note the times when they are acting different than normal. That way, You can identify when they are sick, And take them to the vet before it gets worse.
That's true, Always want to make sure they're healthy, Just like us.

persona: I started a new job at the gas station.
I like plants and gardening. I garden daily.
I am adopted.
I am scared of clowns.
I am single but my dad keeps trying to get me to go on dates.
I don't agree with the act of stealing. I don't think everyone is selfish.
dialogue: I spoke to someone else in the detention center about gardening and I want to tell you about it.
Really? I'm surprised someone in the detention center knows about gardening. What did they say?
They said it is just like shoplifting in a way, Where there is little room for success.

I don't agree with you at all. Shoplifting is wrong - it can never be called a success. Gardening has unlimited potential - it's amazing to see new life growing and changing every day. I'd call that success.
You don't know where I've been to get here. You won't understand. Once I'm out hopefully I can get you to understand me more.
You've been in and out that detention center, I thought you would have learned by now. When do you get out this time?
I got a few more weeks, I was actually hoping you could get me a job at that gas station...
I don't think it's likely they will take you on, With your history. And I only just started the job so I wouldn't have much influence! You'd have to apply and see what they say.
If they take me, I could get a lot of stuff you know.

Steal a lot of stuff, More like! Do you really think a gas station would take on someone with a history of shoplifting? I wish I could help you but every time I try, You just end up getting arrested again.
Look, I really like stealing... It's no secret. But I think I could get better if I had this job, I just need a chance!
I just don't think they would hire you. You need to get past this stealing habit first! Why don't you try some kind of therapy?

persona: I am older than 30. I am single. I live in a city. I don't drink.
I like chess.
I like dogs. I have 2 dogs.
I live in a pretty large city in the Pacific Northwest. I think my city is the right size for me.
I don't like Twitter. I spend little time on social media. I have Facebook and use it to check in on people I know. I enjoy that we can find many people that share the same interests on social media.
dialogue: What activities do you like to do around your city?

Taking my dogs out to the local dog parks has been fun for me. It lets me meet other people that also have dogs. Plus my city is pretty walkable so I like to go on walks with the dogs. How about you? Do you get out to walk much in your city?
I do get a bit of spare time every now and then to take a walk outside. There's a lot of trails around my house that are good to take, And they can be very scenic.
Same here. The Pacific Northwest is very pretty -especially when the weather is nice. I try to go hiking pretty often actually.
That sounds like fun, I wish some of my friends were more into hiking. Although my family loves hiking, So its not too bad. Do you take your dogs with you when you go hiking?

Only sometimes. It's hard terrain for my older dog to navigate, So mostly they get confined to just neighborhood walks or the dog park. My family are not hikers at all so I tend to hike solo. Do you ever post your hikes for your work?

Of course, I love to keep my followers updated with what I am doing in a given day. Posting hikes seem like a no brainer as well, As many of my followers are into fitness and would love to learn more about what they can do in my city.

That's so true. I don't use much social media other than Facebook, But I like to see what my friends are up to and I would guess the same goes for your followers. What other things do you post about your city?
The food, Attractions, And other sights to see. I would say that my followers are always especially interested in new restaurants or interesting dishes.

I bet that keeps you pretty busy - going to new places and keeping on top of all the trends in your area. Are you adventurous with what you will eat then at the new restaurants? I'm mostly a basic burger and fries kind of person... No quinoa for me.
I do try to get something new every time I go to a restaurant, But I don't mind going to a local place to get some burgers and fries.
My younger niece is just 10 but she is already a "foodie"... I think it's all the Food Network shows she watches. How about your kids? Are they down to try new foods too?

persona: I am in Colorado.  I am outside a lot. I love the outdoors. I hike when it is not cold.
I love farms. I work in an office. I work behind a desk.
I rock climb after work.
I have a lab trooper dog named Max. My lab is black and hangs his head out my trucks window. My dog goes hiking with me.
I have a cabin by the lake in the south Axe Mountain. I unwind by going to my cabin. I see deer often. I love the wildlife in my state.
dialogue: I went outside today and i want to tell you about all the wildlife I came across.
Tell me. I can't wait to hear about it.
I saw more beautiful deer!! A whole family.
Wow! I recently saw a deer too on my way home.
Yes! They make me so happy. Hows Max?
Max is great. We went hiking together last week.
Thats great, Do you think you will do some hiking this weekend?
Yeah, I plan on hiking for a few hours and then staying in my cabin.
Yah I know you like being outdoors a lot. I hope you have a great time!
Thanks. What are your plans for the weekend? Are you planning to drive your truck around town?
I might, Will help my parents in the morning.
Nice. Are you helping with the crops?

persona: I watch Food Network.
I am unemployed. I am looking for work. I recently moved to Germany.
My hobbies are roller coasters and skydiving.
I am in an open poly relationship. My relationship is about one year old. I am a terrible swimmer. My partners like to swim. I do not want to swim naked.
I do not follow sports.
dialogue: I just got a call from my dad. It turns out he does still have one sales contact who might just have some work for you. I'll email you the details.
That's great, Thank you so much! That means a lot to me as I really need to find some work. How's your dog walking business going?
The business is actually doing well! You every think about applying?
Honestly dog walking is not my thing. I like being around people, So I will be much more suited to sales!
Sounds good. Do you want to go swimming soon" Me and a few others are going.
I'm going to have to turn down that offer - I really don't like swimming, And I hear you swim naked? There's no way I would do that! My partners might want to join you though, They like swimming.
Come on, I didn't want to at first, But when I started I just couldn't stop. It is so much fun!
You know I love a thrill, But honestly, Swimming is not my thing! I'd much rather go on a roller coaster or go skydiving!
I'd rather swim, But I'll go with you skydiving.
That would be amazing! Would your partner like to come too?
I could care less what my partners think right now, They are really getting on my nerves lately.
Oh no, I'm sorry to hear that! You've only been with them for 3 months haven't you? Maybe things will improve?

persona: I smoke. I have a mustache.
I worked for the CIA.
I believe in aliens. I think I live on the moon.
I'm traveling for work.
I don't know anything about pregnant horses. I don't have any horses.
dialogue: My horse that was pregnant had her foal, It's a girl!
Congratulations, And that sounds lovely. I hope the mom and foal are bonding well. Love how short their baby tails are! Do they have a name yet?
No not yet. This is the first arabian horse born on my farm and I think the pressure of the right name is getting to me! I'm sure it'll come eventually. How has work been this week?
Work is kind of scheduled, I have to follow a checklist. Exciting sometimes. Feeling a little tired today. I don't know much about horses, So I get curious with your horses.

You'll have to come over and see them sometime. They all just got a full wash and cut so those tails look amazing. Even the little baby one looks majestic! Might be a nice boost for your soul, If you're tired.
Horses are just beautiful to look at, And have strong personalities. Maybe I do need to get to see a few horses. Maybe the horses help with your farm?

Yes and no - they definitely help me pull anything really heavy, But they also create a lot of work and cost a lot of money, So we'll call it even! Horses are so gentle and soothing to be around, I find.

Definitely, A lot of work and money go into maintaining them, Stable fees, Feed and vet fees, Oh yes. It's good when your job can kind of subsidize or pay for your hobbies! Wonder if you would be good at horse training.

I've always wondered that myself. I guess we'll find out with this new horse, Eh? All my arabians came to me fully trained and show-ready, So if this little one turns out to be a terror I guess we'll know I'm terrible at training!
Nature versus nurture I guess. I tend to read and research when I'm building skills. Arabians are beautiful too. Sometimes I have to be careful about sharing what I do for work. I enjoy it though.
Better to be safe than sorry, Right? As long as you enjoy it, That's what matters.
And sometimes we grow and change. Wonder if you knew 10 years ago, You'd have all these horses, And be a recent horse foal caretaker!

persona: I have a job at a nursing home.
I have an 8 year old son. My wife left me.
I don't believe in god.
My son doesn't watch much TV. He plays Fortnite on the computer and plays on his phone.
I went to Disney last year. I posted pictures of the trip on Facebook. I use facebook alot.
dialogue: Does your son want to play Fortnite with me?
I'll ask him next weekend when he's over. My wife has custody of him during the week. How often do you play Fortnite?
I play it every day on weekends or days off school. I play some during the week if my homework is done in time.
Sounds like you're obsessed like my son. Do you enjoy school?
Kind of I like science and art mostly, Does your son like school?
My son hates school, He throws a tantrum most days. Are you well behaved for your parents?
I guess but I get grounded sometimes too which sucks because then I'm not allowed to play Fortnite.
What do you do in your free time when you're not allowed to play Fortnite?
Well if I'm grounded and not allowed to play then I have extra chores that I have to do. I like riding my bike though when I'm not playing games.
I love riding my bike with my son. Are you interested in any other sport?
I like soccer I might join a team this year. I was going to last year but I wasn't old enough yet.

persona: I just went to an AFP conference.
I live in Manhattan. My parents are rich bankers.
I have 4 cars. I have 2 motorcycles. I own a limited edition BMW. I would like to sell some of my vehicles.
dialogue: Have you found a buyer for your cars?
Not yet, But I am still interested in a buy or trade deal.
I am sure you find some buyers soon. My old Mustang is still holding up great! I was thinking of driving up to New York this fall. Is there anything I should see while there?
Oh, I'd hate for you you to drop by the neighborhood without seeing my LT BMW.
Of course! Maybe you can take me for a drive around Manhattan. I'm bringing my bike and planning to do some rides upstate to see the fall color. Do you want to ride along?
It would be a change for me, But absolutely, Let's go!
Great, I am looking forward to it. It will do you good. You mentioned the AFP conference earlier, How was it?
Not much to worry about for us small-timers, But I'd watch out for my coin if I were those men.
I hear you, Things could change pretty quickly. How did you get there; did you take one of your motorcycles?

persona: I build houses. I prefer cooler temperatures.
I like cats. I have 5 cats.
I love outdoor activities like attending sporting events, but I also like reading and cooking. I like hunting and fishing.
My favorite food is steak and fresh crab legs. I love yellowfin tuna.
I live 13 miles from the beach. The area I live in is expensive and has an influx of tourists.
dialogue: I tried the yellowfin tuna you suggested, And I love it!
You did? Did you like it, Or did you feed it to your dogs?
Yeah it was good! I could never find anything fresh around here, But I tried it while visiting a friend in Atlanta.
Nice! I went fishing at the beach yesterday but it was just too cold for me. How's the weather in Alabama?
It's been colder than normal here too, But even that's not really that cold if you ask me. I barely broke a sweat when I took my dogs hiking last weekend.
I haven't been hiking in so long. Don't think the cats would go for it.
Haha, If you ever wanted to go for a hike I could let my dogs look after your cats. I think they might change their mind pretty quickly when faced with some along time with my pups.
Haha! They would certainly prefer hiking at that point, I think. What kind of dogs do you have?
One's a German shepherd, And the other is a lab-mix that I got from the shelter. I still don't fully know what he is actually, But that's okay. What makes you prefer cats over dogs?
I just think they're hilarious. I actually prefer Siamese cats. That's what all five of mine are. And in my opinion, They all act like dogs!

Wow, I don't think I've ever seen a Siamese cat in person before. I can see how they'd be pretty unique and cool. But I just love how active my dogs are, And I don't see how I could ever do so many things outdoors if I had cats.
Well, Cats do tend to take care of themselves mostly, Which allows me to do those types of things. I know you said your brothers hunt, But you didn't say whether you like to hunt or not yourself?

persona: I have been camping. I love kayaking. I love the outdoors.
I grew up in the 90s.
I am in grad school studying psychology. I have been keeping my grades up. I plan to go kayaking during spring break.
I think the song Peaches by Justin Bieber is a good song.
I have no experience with a Lite Brite.
dialogue: I ordered you your very own Lite Brite and you should get it this week.
That's great. I can't wait to play with it. Any thing i should know about it?
Not that I can think of off the top of my head, But if you have any questions when it arrives please don't hesitate! I'm so excited for you. I can't believe you never had one growing up!
I've seen some commercials and retro shows that have shown them, But have never had one.
They're really easy to use. You'll love it, I promise. And it makes such a relaxing environment which I'm sure you need for all that studying. How's school going?
Grad school is intense. I can't wait to be done and get out in the real world and practice what i've learned. Maybe you can be my first patient lol.
Lol don't even joke, I really will be the way my brain's been racing at 3am! Maybe a good camping trip would do me good. Get out in nature and stuff. Have you ever been?
Yes. I actually went kayaking this past week and had a few nights stay in the wilderness.

Oh really?! Kayaking looks like so much fun and I'd love to try it, But it also kind of scares me. What happens if you go fast and tip over and oh my goodness I'm hyperventilating just thinking about it.
It's scary at first, But you get used to it. You need to try it. You will love it.
I'll try it if you come with me? I need to know that someone I'm with is calm even if it all goes wrong, And then I'll be fine, Lol.
Let's do it. You will have the time of your life.

persona: My name is Betsy. I just bought my first home.

I am a teacher. I have 2 step children. I am pregnant with triplets: two boys and one girl. They will be born in three months. I prefer traditional names for children while my husband prefers unusual ones.
I am married. I just moved to the US with my husband. I live in the suburbs.
I am supportive of women who choose not to have children.
I think cellos have a deep mournful sound, and I'd love to learn to play one some day. I don't know how to play any musical instruments.
dialogue: How is the pregnancy going? Have you been able to get enough rest?
I don't think parents ever get enough rest, And carrying 3 babies can keep anyone from getting comfortable. Maybe in like 18 ish years?
You're keeping a sense of humor, That's good. I want things to go well, Healthy mom and kids for sure. And maybe you'll end up with a few friends who want to spoil your kids too.

Oh yeah, Usually there are lots of people wanting to see new babies, But they tend to disappear after the new baby smell wears off. Maybe I will be a lucky one. If I make it through delivery, I am hoping a few of my people stick around. I am not certain how feeding three babies at once even works. I am so scared.
Your feelings make sense, It's going to be a big transition. Sounds like you have a lot to consider. I prefer child free living, And support those that have kids too.

Well, You are welcome to play with the babies any time. I don't mind sharing my kids. I joked about putting them in a play pen and sitting outside walmart to auction them off haha. But I already love all three.
There are probably a few parents that would love to discuss surrogate pregnancies. It's your body, Your choice. Let me know about the next auction, I'll bring potluck.

Bahahahah That would be amazing. I would never want to be a surrogate. Pregnancy is not worth doing just to give up the life you hurt to grow. But I applaud those who can handle it. What would you bring to a baby auction potluck lol.
I was trying to figure that out hehe. At first I thought beer, But then thought that might not be good for the kids. Then thought about bring popcicles... Yeah don't know yet. Cookies might do! Hehe.

I guess any of those things would work. But I don't know if walmart would appreciate such a display. It is fun to joke about crazy things that I can't actually do. I am sure there will be plenty of days where I want to do just what we are discussing. Parenthood is hard enough with my step kids.

Sounds like it gives you plenty to be aware of, I hear you. Sometimes jokes help people cope with tough stuff. I love a good comedian, Making me laugh. Some comedians too, Like Stephen Colbert, Inform, And make you laugh. You like any comedian?

Oh yeah. I watch dry bar a lot on youtube because it is clean for the kiddos. But George Carlin was my very favorite one ever. And I have a few others i really like. There is a counseling minister comedian I love. His name is Mark Gungor. You should check him out.

persona: I am 39 years old.
I am a music teacher. I like to dance.
I love Taylor Swift. I like the album. Folklore and Lover. I have never met Taylor Swift in person. I love the song Enchanted.
I have 2 children.
dialogue: The Taylor Swift concert was amazing!
Tell me everything! I was so jealous when you told me you got the tickets. I bet it was amazing.
She was wearing a nice sequin dress, There was a big crowd, She was absolutely amazing! She sang 22!! My favorite!
Wow! She just seems to real and she is also so talented. Does she sound good live?
She sounds awesome! I prefer live over recorded anyhow. Wish you couldve joined!
Maybe I can make another. My oldest daughter is a big Swift fan and I know her best friend also just came back from the concert. Is it true she said she hoped to come back out a year from now?
Wow! Maybe I seen your best friend there. She did say that! Maybe so, Its a great experience.
I will have to start getting ready! I like to use some of her songs in my class. The kids really like it and it helps get the message across.
Song is a great way to teach! Get the kids into the rhythm, What songs would you use?
I use "Never Getting Back Together" and"22" the most. It's worked so far. It gets the kids to unwind too.
Great choices! Im sure they also forget about some bad things happening in their lives as well. Good thinking!
Thanks! I guess we should thank Taylor for filling us with such positivity and something to strive for!

persona: I have a degree in chemistry.
I have a bus that I sell books from.
On the weekend I like to dance at Billy Bobs Country Line.
I have a dog named Princess Pei Pei.
I enjoy dancing.
My mother was a nurse.
dialogue: What about hospitals scared you?
Hospitals never really scared me because my mother was a nurse, And anywhere she was seemed safe to me. The smell is pretty weird though.
Oh, I thought hospitals scared you. How's it going selling your books? Do you sell just all books like a mobile bookstore?
Yeah, It's like a mobile book store, It's mostly second hand books that I sell. Get some pretty funny customers at times.
That's actually pretty cool. Can I hear one of the funny stories?
When I say funny customers I should say not so much humorous as peculiar. People wearing old clothing, Behatted old gentlemen, Etc.
Oh, Well that's still entertaining. Do you sell many books?
Yeah, I've got to or my book store will run out of gas and stop being mobile. I'm always hoping for a big sale.
What made you decide to start the mobile bookstore after getting a chemistry degree? Seems like you went in the opposite direction after school. Lol.
I had a lot of old useless Chemistry textbooks that I wanted to get rid of. And some of my student friends had other useless university books too. And so the business was born.
That's kind of funny. I guess if it works, It works!
I actually also really love old books, And the antique books are really where the money is. How's your nursing degree going? Anything new?

persona: I am reading a parenting book. I think self-help books can help struggling people.
I like meeting new people. I am a museum tour guide.
I am partly deaf. I can read lips.
dialogue: The visit with my mom went great! I missed her so much!
Thats great! It's been a long time! Have you looked at any volunteer opportunities?
I have been looking at some volunteering opportunities. If I volunteer in the garden I get to go outside a bit more.
Wow, Being in the garden will be a great opportunity to get some fresh air!
It can be really stuffy being inside all day. And the idea of picking some vegetables and getting my hands dirty, Really interests me.
It definitely would be a worthwhile experience compared to your usual day. Do the vegetables get used in the kitchen there?
Yes they do. One of the benefits of being inside is some home cooked vegetables. A cost is not seeing your mom.
Do the home cooked meals help with your stress levels at all?
I can't really tell. It's pretty stressful being locked up and the food's been this way since I've been here.
Do you have any other activities besides volunteering to help with stress?
No. Shouting at guards. Punching the walls. All these things help a little.
Is there a library or anything near you so you can learn to or come to enjoy reading?

persona: I volunteer at homeless shelters. I enjoy volunteering. The shelter I volunteer at is a refuge for women and children escaping domestic violence.
I am a pro wrestler. I like working out.
I like pizza. I am very social.
I have a family.
It has been snowy where I live.
I have never been to a fundraiser.
dialogue: I decided to add some stops at vineyards to my trip through Europe.
That sounds like it will be a great social opportunity to meet new people1.
I hope so! I know you are a pro wrestler. Did your career ever take you through Europe?
It did! I was in some snowy areas of Europe though, Quite similar to where i live now. Are you excited to sample the different cuisines there?
Yeah, I sure am! That's why I asked. I had hoped with your love of pizza, You had some good ideas of where I could stop in Itally!
I do love pizza! Ill have to see if i am able to remember specific places for you to get some good pizza! Im planning a fundraiser for the homeless shelter i volunteer at now, Would you like to help?
I'd appreciate that! That's a great cause! I would love to help if i can fit it in before my trip. What sort of help do you need?
Its a fundraiser to raise money to help victims of domestic violence get shelter and job opportunities! Id appreciate your help!
Count me in! As you know, Charity fundraisers are a passion of mine. Especially one for such a great cause!
Awesome! It will be great to have some more social, Outgoing people to help talk to possible donors!
Well, That's right up my alley! I love to socialize. Just give me a list of who I should contact.
Thats great! Hopefully we can fit it in before your trip next month! Im excited, This will be my first fundraiser!

persona: I have daughters and dogs.
I watch american sports.
I've worked for 15 years. I'm a man.
My family are Chiefs fans. My dogs have Chiefs jerseys.
I'm considering taking music lessons. I want to learn guitar.
dialogue: Are the Chiefs playing this weekend?
Nah, The season is no started yet.
I'm such a dodo when it comes to sports. Remind me of what they play again?
They start to play in the fall, Then there is the final, The Super Bowl, In February. It there an "off-season" in classical music where there is no concert?
There is NEVER an off-season in classical music. Just wish my hectic schedule would allow me the time to enjoy it more. Speaking of music... How are the guitar lessons going?
I still have not decide if I have the time to learn the guitar, How much time do you practice violin each day?

I try to squeeze in at least 4 hours. Two hours of exercises and two hours working on a specific piece. I'd love to have more time for it. I wouldn't worry too much about what time ou have. Any time you can get learning music is worthwhile.

Yeah, But I have a family to care for, A dog to walk, A job and football to watch. I think I don't have time for guitar, Even a few minutes. How do you perform at work if you practice 4 hours per day?
I just try to compartmentalize my life. Of course, I don't have daughters and a dog to care for. I'm sure it makes it hard on you. Sounds like your life is even more hectic than mine!
I think it is because I love what I do, So I don't find find it hectic. I am just very occupied at doing what I love. How do you like your job?
It's a job. Pays the bills. I wish I could love my job the way my sister does hers. I'd rather be playing music to be honest.
Have you thought about making money by playing the violin? Just a little money could enable you to work part-time and have more time for violin.

persona: My heart was placed outside my body. I received a heart transplant.
I am a young boy. I live with my mom. I have a service dog Golden Lab named Jerome. our dog chews things sometimes.
I can move things with my mind. I sometimes use my telekinesis to steal chocolate. I like to pull pranks using my telekinetic powers. I annoy my family with my mischief.
I sleep a lot.
dialogue: The vet gave my dog a clean bill of health!
That is amazing news. I am always worried something bad will happen to Jerome one day.
I know right! I breathed a huge sigh of relief when I first heard the news. How has Jerome been lately?
He has been much better. I have been training him so that he does not chew everything in the house anymore.

That's great news. I love how trainable dogs are, It's quite amazing actually to watch how quickly their behavior can be shifted. So have you been getting any help training him? Or has it all been your doing?
I had a go myself to start with but it did not go very well. I started watching some youtube videos which gave me some really useful tips! Have you trained any of your dogs?
That's smart to use youtube as a guide. My husband was the one who trained our dogs, But that was a long time ago and I'm not really sure how exactly he did it. They sure are wonderful now though!
They must be getting old then. Do you plan on having any more dogs when they have gone? I am really excited about getting another puppy soon.

I think I will have to get another puppy some day. So much of my day is centered around my dogs that I cannot imagine not having them around to keep me company. Do you know what type of puppy you'll be getting?
I know what you mean. If I did not have my dog I think I would easily be able to work a second job with the spare time. I have been looking at something small like a Chihuahua.
Aww, Having a little Chihuahua with a big golden lab like Jerome is going to look so cute! Are you worried at all about the two dogs getting along with each other?
Yes, I am a little worried. However, Jerome has calmed down lots since we started training him. I would be more worried about the little dog causing trouble.

persona: I am close to retirement.
I am a tennis player.
I like outdoor activities including the beach. I have a dog.
I like the cold. I have multiple homes. I am wealthy.
I have a large family. I put my family first.
I have one kid in college and twins on the way. I am having twins in two months. I have a son.
I surfed in Hawaii. I want to go to Hawaii.
dialogue: I tried new exercises that don't aggravate my arthritis.
That's so good to hear! You'll have to show me the next time I see you. I'll need to learn a few moves to keep the blood flowing once I'm retired!
Yes you do. It's good to stay active. Have you been to the beach lately?
Unfortunately not. The wind has been a bit too much, So I figured I.
Well, Hopefully the weather will cooperate and you can go soon. Nothing more soothing that the beach.
No joke! And I desperately need some beach time. Hey how long until the grandkids arrive now? You must be so excited!
3 months and counting down. I'm so excited. My head is in the clouds.
Oh I bet. Have you started shopping for things yet? That's when it finally starts to feel real!
Yes. The Parents are waiting until the birth before we know the sex... So, I'm buying all unisex colors.
Smart idea. Plus if they have more kids no matter what the sex they can reuse the hand me downs! I think I have an old Cartier baby rattle you can have if you want. It's diamond studded.
I will take anything at this point. Hand me downs are a great idea. I hope they continue to have more children so we can have a big family.
I'm sure they will. Once you start it's difficult to stop, Especially when their faces light up when you walk in the room! And being a grandparent is all the joy none of the hassle!

persona: I live in Hollywood. I live in a house.
I did not graduate high school.
I enjoy dieting. Caviar is a favorite food of mine. I like expensive items.
I hardly work. I have a boyfriend who takes care of me. I do not work weekends.
I live in Hollywood. I saw Reese Witherspoon walking down my street. I am a fan of Reese Witherspoon.
My boyfriend is a producer who works for Paramount. I am getting an audition next week. I am on a juice cleanse in preparation for the audition. I have been on a juice cleanse in the past.
dialogue: How is your juice cleanse going? Getting ready for the big audition?
Yeah, The juice cleanse isn't the most fun in the world, But I really want to do wel for the audition!
What are you auditioning for?
It's for a bit part in a Paramount picture. But guess what? My boyfriend told me that there is a chance I might read a scene with....ReESE!
Is Reese going to be choosing someone for your role!? Are you worried you'll be too excited to concentrate?

Well, Stars always have some say in it. But I think I'll be ready to concentrate. I'll just put the excitement into my performance. I wish you didn't have to work so hard. It would be nice if you could come visit. Maybe I could even take you on a studio tour If my boyfriend can arrange it. Maybe you could even meet her yourself!
I was absolutely love to meet Reese Witherspoon. Do you think your boyfriend can put a good word in? Work can wait!
LOL! I'll work on it! The Army has to give you leave sometime! And I know you love to fish. Living on the ocean means some great opportunities for deep sea fishing! I know you'd love that too!
For Reese even going AWOL is a viable option. And I forget that there must be great fishing in Hollywood too! You are pretty lucky.
Yeah, I do feel like I'm living a charmed life. If you can ever make it down here, I promise you won't have to sanitize anything! Plus they seem to love Canucks in this town!
I knew there must be somewhere that loves Canucks! Who'd have thought it was Hollywood. What are your first words to the Witherspoon going to be?
Probably..."um, Excuse me Ms. Witherspoon... I think I have to go throw up!" lol. Or maybe I'll just tell her I have a friend that would like to take her deep-sea fishing! *grin*.

persona: I am 23 years old. I am not familiar with Britney Spears.
I travel a lot and don't have a steady job. I work many different types of jobs.
I love to eat food but I can't cook. I like to try new dishes.
I don't paint.
I like to meditate.
I enjoy African cuisine. I live near a few good restaurants. I like chicken and a little bit of vegetables in my samosas.
dialogue: Besides Ethiopian, Do you recommend any other African country's cuisine?
I would definitely try some of the local favorites that you never hear about. Especially in Kenya!
What makes Kenyan food special do you think?

It's just that local food is so different from what we are used to. There are grubs they gather from trees, For example, That when combined with the right spices and vegetables taste every bit as good as filetmignon.
You know I've never had filetmignon. What is it?

It's an overly priced cut of beef you can get in 4 star restaurants. Personally, I prefer the simpler approach to food. Food is so subjective. I wish I could cook the way you can. I'd be experimenting all the time!
Yes, I've never actually cooked any African food, Except cous cous, Which is not exciting at all.
It's all subjective, Like I said. I happen to love Injera flatbread, For example. But, As you know I love to try anything new. Have you ever tried making samosa yourself?
I have not. Unless you count buying it in a supermarket then sticking it in an oven. Looks like a fiddly dish to make.
They all look fiddly to me since I can't cook! Lol But I'd probably eat anything you could make. Even with the spicy vegetables you like.
You know you're still young! For someone who loves a lot of dishes, If you can get hold of a kitchen you can learn to cook. Just keep trying!
I'm too busy traveling to spend time in a kitchen. And when I am home, It's just easier to go to a restaurant with so many good ones nearby.

persona: I am not spiritual. I like to shop. I buy lots of shoes and clothing.
I like being alone. I like thinking about time and watches.
I work at a discount watch dealer. My work ships watches anywhere. I am busy because it is sale season.
I am working a  lot of overtime.
dialogue: Hold off on that watch I was wanting a bear ate my snowshoes, Luckily I wasn't wearing them at the time.
A bear ate your snowshoes?

I had opened the door to let the fresh air in, Went to the toilet, And by the time I came back a bear had entered my home and was enjoying my best snowshoes as a chew toy. Luckily, I just made a lot of noise and the bear quickly retired. It was not an aggressive bear.
Lucy the bear didn't eat you. That's a good thing.

I do feel very blessed to enjoy this earth another day. It does serve as a reminder, Though, Of how precious time is. Do you feel like clocks make our short lives feel even shorter, Or help live each moment with intention? Is that why you got into the watch business?
They sure show you that time passes faster than we sometimes want. I found the design of watches to be mathematically incredible. But math is not my strong point. Heh.
No? What would you say is your strong point?
I really don't know. I only know that I have always had a problem with fractions. However, I do enjoy geometry.

I understand. Geometry can be very enjoyable to study, Especially for someone who enjoys seeing math represented in the physical world. I have two thoughts that may help with how you perceive and work with fractions. May I share them?
By all means, Do so.

My first thought is that fractions are our friend. They enjoy keeping your work tidy. For instance, While a decimal might decide to repeat into infinity, A fraction is compact and stays put. 1/3 instead of. 33333333333333, For instance. My second thought, And this is more of a question for you to consider, Is would fractions seem more friendly if you always applied them to shapes? For instance, Instead of 1/5, Perhaps one star arm.
One star arm. That's an interesting thought.

persona: I have a dog.
I play professional tennis.
I am nervous about teen years as I feel they could be hard. The idea of having a child who is dating is scary to me. I have children who are too young to date yet.
I am six months pregnant with a baby girl.
I have two children that are already born: a son and a daughter. I am trying to stay healthy with walking. I play tennis, but need to stop soon due to my pregnancy.
I love soccer and swimming.
dialogue: How long before your due date is it recommended to stop playing tennis?
I think it was recommended I stop last week, But I'm still doing a tiny bit of training. Can't help myself.
I'm sure it's hard to just stop, But I'm sure your doctor wouldn't recommend stopping if it wasn't for a good reason.
Yeah the doctors generally know what they're doing but you know what? It's MY body and I think I know it better than anyone else. Although that's just my opinion.
It's true that it is your body, But doing certain things while pregnant can cause complications for you and your baby.
Yeah you're right. Like I'm saying I'm just winding things down, Not really playing just minimal training so I'll be good to keep going briefly. Do you have any advice for a new mother to be?
Enjoy the baby stage even when it's hard. It goes so quickly and soon they will be teenager who is talking back and thinking you are super uncool.
Yeah I think I'm pretty cool right now, But the kid won't agree I'm sure. I've never had a child before so it's a big thing for me.
The sleepless nights with a baby are long, But the years go by so quick and you will miss having that little newborn. Every stage of life has it's good parts and it's downsides though.
I'm sorry if I haven't been clear earlier but my other kids are adopted, I was really lucky to find the father and he'll help me through it as he's been through a pregnancy before with their mother.
Oh well that's good that you have someone with experience helping you through this. Though I'm sure his knowledge is limited as he's not personally gone through it.
Yes it's supposed to be painful, Giving birth. People who say that are exaggerate though, Aren't they?

persona: I just moved to an apartment: a small studio.
I attend college. I work in a bar to help afford school part time.
dialogue: Did you decided what your going to do for spring break? The museum decided to have a special event for it.
No I didn't decide yet. I'm having some real trouble! I know everyone likes to party but I should probably just take it easy, Y'know?
The event at the museum will be low key and not a lot of partying. It might be good for you as I think many college kids typically attend.
I might just take you up on that. I've been working so much at the bar I'm sick of any kind of loud noise, So a museum sounds like a great change of pace! How has work been?
It's good. I always enjoying my time at the museum. Sorry to hear you've been working so much at the bar. How is that working out with your studies?
It's always a very delicate balance! Just trying to do my best. Glad to hear you're enjoying work. How many tours do you generally do a day?
I typically do a couple a day but it depends on the current exhibit. Things tend to be a bit busy in the summer months.
That makes sense, More people coming and going. Is there a particular piece or room that you gravitate towards, Or do you just love it all?
I just love it all. There is just so much to see and learn. I suppose it might seem boring to some people. Have you been to the museum in the past?
I went as a kid but I know I didn't pay the attention the art work deserved. It will be nice to go back and really absorb all the information and atmosphere!
Yes, I think you would appreciate it much more now.
Me too. I could do with some inspiration for decorating my new place, Too, Although obviously on a much smaller budget!

persona: I have a wife and three children.
I live in the country. I have dogs. I love horses. I love animals.
I ride horses. The last time I rode a horse was about one week ago.
My children are just starting to learn to ride horses. I'm not sure how much my children like riding horses, but I know they like ice cream.
Vanilla is my favorite ice cream flavor.
I am a plumber. I feel I am good at my job and that I offer reasonable prices.
dialogue: Ben and Jerry's saw one of my Twitter comments about their Chubby Hubby ice cream, And they reached out to me to be part of their next ad campaign!! Crazy!! I'm so excited!
Wow! That is so exciting! What do they want you to do for the ad?
The want to come to the farm and do a set up for the commercial. I will be riding a horse and eating ice cream. My two favorite things!
That is so cool! I assume you will be riding one of your own horses?
Absolutely. If we need another person in the commercial, I will suggest you. You have a lot of experience in the saddle too. Are you interested?
Sure, That sounds like fun! So will you be eating Chubby Hubby ice cream?
You know it! I wouldn't have it any other way. You can eat Vanilla if you get to be in it too!
Yes, That one is my favorite. I've never tried eating ice cream while riding a horse though. Have you?
No. It may be messy! I guess I will find out.
Yeah, I guess you will! And maybe me too! So what is the name of the horse you will ride?
Trigger. I know it's not original, But it's easy to remember.
Nice! And what kind of horse is Trigger?

persona: I have dogs. They are afraid of bees. I am scared of bees.
I love baked goods.
I dreamed about my creations on the catwalk. I want to be a clothes designer.
I like papaya. I love fruits.
dialogue: I have a new papaya recipe that I discovered and want to share.
Awesome. Is it a savory or sweet recipe?
It is a sweet recipe, I've previously done savory recipes and I wanted to try something new. What are some of your favorite baked goods?
I love apple crumbles. Though I had the best cream pie the other day. It was a salted caramel with chocolate crust.
Oh that sounds delicious, I've had some pretty good apple crumbles before but never a salted caramel cream pie. What types of fruit do you think make the best pastries?
You know I'm not sure. Probably strawberry? I love salted caramel everything. Forget pumpkin spice as the fall flavor.
I do think strawberry makes some pretty tasty pastries. I've got to try salted caramel flavored pastries more. Yes, Pumpkin spice is definitely overrated at this point.
Are you making the papaya recipe for mothers day?
Yes, My mother's favorite fruit is papayas, So I'm trying a papaya tart recipe for mother's day. What are your plans for mother's day?
I am having a brunch at her house. I got her some flowers today that I hope she likes.
Oh that sounds lovely, I'm sure it'll be a nice time. What kind of flowers did you get her?
Im not quite sure to be honest. But they are purple and yellow which are her favorite colors.

persona: I am a kindergarten teacher.
My favorite book is the Hunger Games.
I sing. I like Taylor Swift's music. I would like to go on a talent show. I want to go to Nashville and see singers.
dialogue: How has the singing kindergarten teacher been? Have you arranged your dream trip to Nashville yet?
I've been great. No plans yet, But school is almost off. I think I will sit down and plan out a visit in July. Have you ever been to Nashville?
I have been to Nashville, But didn't make it to the exciting music/bar section. I've heard it's great. Who will you take with you?

I am probably going to take my friend who is actually another teacher at my school. She doesn't love Taylor Swift, But she is a big fan of country music. I think she grew up near Nashville so she is sort of an expert I guess.

You should see who is playing in Nashville in July and plan to see groups you both will like. Who knows perhaps Taylor would be there herself taking in the music scene. There are lots of other interesting things to do in Nashville as well, Maybe take a guided tour of celebrity homes or something similar!
Oohhh wouldn't that be exciting if she was there?!? Thanks for the suggestion because they is a really good idea. What about you? Will your summer involve your African dream?

Well, I'm still looking into it; no plans as of yet.. But you never know! I'm trying to put together a travel plan so I see most everything that I would like while there. It would likely be a several week trip. I still have some classes to finish up at Vet school this summer.
When these summer classes are done will you be a full blown vet? Any thoughts in where you may work after you are finished with school?

persona: I work at Burger King.  I have been gaining weight. I may look for another job.
I would love to move out of my parent's house. My parents nag me.
I don't drink.
I am 19 years old.
I want a dog.
I have a gym next to my work.
dialogue: Tell me, Have you managed to start working out?
Yes. I started. It's been hard, But I'm motivated.
That's great! Getting started is always the hardest part. What kind of exercises are you doing?
I'm doing some cardio, But I'm focused on strength training. Do you have any suggestion or advice for me?
Always try and mix both, You don't want to jump right into weight training without warming up with cardio first. And I can't stress enough the importance of stretching before AND after working out.
I need to stretch more. Do you think so Yoga would do me some good?
I'm afraid I don't have much experience with yoga, But from what I've seen it can be a thorough full body stretch routine. Do you listen to music at all when you work out?
I do listen. I find that it helps me get engaged with what I'm doing.
It makes sense, I read somewhere that they did a study that proved music helps keep you focused and you end up working out longer. I'm a fan of heavy metal when I work out, How about you?
I like heavy metal, Punk, Grunge. They all get me going and help me maintain a good workout pace.
Exactly, I love classic AC/DC, It's the perfect rhythm for running on the treadmill. Have you started looking for a new job, By the way?
I have. I have my resumes out at several places. Wish me luck.

persona: I work as a waitress.
I love celebrating Columbus Day.
I don't like cooking. I like meat and rice. I don't like snails or oysters.
I like to ride motorbikes. I wear a helmet when I ride a motorbike.
I've never been outside of the US.
I'm not very adventurous with cuisines.
dialogue: I'm hoping I can present something in my parents gallery someday soon. That would be amazing to me!
I'd love to come and visit Europe for the first time and see your art! What kind of art would you present?
That would be amazing. I'd probably present a portrait, Those are my specialty.
Wow! Did your dad teach you to paint?
Yes, My dad is a great teacher, He taught me some great techniques. So what type of restaurant do you work in?
Definitely not as fancy as the restaurants in Europe where your parent's gallery is! Do you go visit their gallery often?
Ah, Yes the restuarants there are pretty upscale, Fairly expensive. I can unfortunately only visit twice a year due to my college schedule.
Ah I definitely don't miss being in college! Is it hard being away from your parents for that long?
Yes, College can be a struggle at times. Yes it is hard not being able to see my parents for that long, But it definitely makes it worth it when I do see them. So is it exciting riding a motorbike?
It was very exciting the first few times!! Not so much anymore though. Was it exciting the first time you got to visit your parents gallery?
It sounds a bit scary but at least you protect yourself with your helmet. Yes it was pretty exciting getting to see my parents accomplish something so grand.
I bet!! How long until you will be able to present one of your portraits there?? I can't wait to come see!

persona: I am a postal worker. I play banjo in the band. The band I formed with my fellow postal workers. My music group is called going postal.
My legs are being stung by the scorpions. I have an unending pain from these scorpions.
I really like Bob Dylan.
I love hootenanny country music too.
I wish my CO was a musical type.
dialogue: Have you ever had to go to the emergency room for your scorpion stings?
Yes I have only been to the emergency once for these scorpion stings. Otherwise I use pain reliever.
When I want to get birds to scare away, I turn up the bass very high and blast rock and roll music. Would the same thing work to scare away scorpions?
My band helps scare away the scorpions sometimes. What have you played on your banjo lately?

I don't have it perfected yet, But I am translating the violin part from The Devil Went Down to Georgia to the banjo. I think I want to reimagine it as a banjo competition. A sort of banjo duel, If you will.
That sounds great! Have you played the ukulele?
Sure. Pretty much any instrument I don't have to blow into I can play. I even own a small harp! Do you also play instruments besides the banjo?
Yes, I play the autochord. The scorpions are rising again to sting me!
That is terrible. Why do the scorpions hate you so much?
They live under my refrigerator and sting when I stop playing my banjo.
I see. They don't enjoy the autochord, I take it. Well, Everyone's a critic.
They like when I leave to deliver mail. How is your husband's job?

persona: I work out. I don't like gymnastics.
I love Papaya's. I don't have any local family.
My name is George. I am married to a model from Italy.
I have a job. I am a Bee Farmer. I'm not scared of bee's. My business has a website. My wife made the design for the website. My wife is skittish about bees.
My wife is a model, she is in demand. My wife and I train together.
I have visited Italy and Germany. I have never been to Asia.
dialogue: My trainer set me up with a training partner while I am in Hong Kong, I am so excited to meet them!
That's great. Are you excited to get the training started?
I'm very excited. I'm happy that I'll have someone else to train with so I won't be lonely. How are your bees doing?
They are producing honey like crazy. I need to send you a sample.
I would love that! I checked out the website for your business. Your wife did an incredible job. I'm surprised she has time to design a website when she is so busy modeling!
She is definitely talented. Much more so that me. I wish I could design a website as well as i can get bees to produce honey!
I'm sure she wishes she was as comfortable around bees as you were. I guess getting her to do a modeling shoot with bees is out of the question? I know I would be terrified!
Yes. Lol. I will stick to the bees and she can still to web design and modeling.
Even if you two have opposite feelings about bees, It's great that you can come together to work out. Hopefully my training partner is as supportive.
I hope so too. You have more riding on your training than I do. I'm really excited for you and hope for the best.
Thank you! I can't wait to get Japan and hopefully take home a medal. You'll have to visit Asia someday. China has been beautiful.
I can imagine. I have faith that you will win a medal.

persona: I have three dogs.
I play pot farm.
I don't play many games. I have played StarCraft. I watch twitch.
I enjoy never-ending philosophical debates. I have a dog walking business which I enjoy.
dialogue: I think I may livestream Sekiro sometime soon instead of the usual debates. That way you could check the game out too if you want!
Sekiro sounds awesome, What is your favorite part of the game?
The combat design is excellent, And the addition of the grappling hook adds so much mobility over other souls-like games.
I don't know a lot about the game, But all of those features definitely make me interested in checking them out. What are some other games in that genre that you enjoy?

I'm sure I mentioned Bloodborne before, It's another great take. Just to explain, Souls-like means games like Dark Souls, Which are typically all very challenging. But if you can learn how the enemies work you can dominate and that's super rewarding.
Thank you for explainging what souls-like means, I really had no idea, So it is cool to have a better understanding. Always fun to dominate in a game as well. Do you ever play sport games?
I used to, But they're mostly made by EA and they've gotten a really bad reputation lately, So I'm way less interested. How are your dogs behaving today, By the way?
They have really gone down hill at EA with their games. My dogs are being great, They just went outside and are relaxing right now. What is your favorite type of dog?
I like a mid-size dog, But with a calm temperament, Which is a tricky balance. Golden retrievers are too high maintenance for me, For example. I'd love some recommendations?
Well you might not like my recommendations because I love golden retrievers haha. But I also love german shepards and chocolate labs. My dream dog is a husky however.
Huskies are gorgeous, But also super high energy. I guess I'll have to keep looking. Speaking of dogs, How is the walking business?
It is amazing, I love meeting people and their dogs, And forming business relationships with them. It is such a rewarding experience!

persona: I am an omnivore.
I am pregnant with twin girls.
I own a home. We grow and preserve all of our own vegetables in our house. I built a root cellar in my house.
dialogue: Have you come up with names yet for the twins?
Yes I have, Would you like to hear the names of them?
Of course! How long until your due date?
The names are Olivia and Jeanie, I am due in 12 weeks.
Wonderful, Are they named after anyone special or did you come up with them yourself?
Olivia was my Grandmothers middle name and Jeanie was my late mothers name. So I think they are perfect for the girls.
I concur, Perfect fits. Three months will come up very soon, Will they be sharing a room? I've heard prep work for new children can be very fulfilling.

They will be sharing a room with me at first just for the first couple of months then they will be going into their own room. I just want them close while they are so little so I can always be checking on them. The prep work for new kids is very fulfilling I feel like I am doing it more than working on my garden for all my vegetables. How are things wit you and your girlfriend?

I'm glad to hear that you have your priorities sorted out so well. They are very lucky to have you as a parent. My girlfriend and I have just moved to a new state together. We are enjoying the better climate and greener environment as we came from living somewhere very arid.
Where did you two move to if you don't mind me asking. And the new state sounds amazing.

We moved at the end of last year and it is amazing, Especially because we now have more room to grow and enjoy our organic vegetables. It was hard before but we made it work, It seems effortless in this new place.

persona: I had cancer.
I run marathons.
I'm a clean eater.
my parents are athletic. my parents are health coaches.
I really like helping other people. I have a lot to learn in my new job as a life coach. I just started doing this.
dialogue: Since I want to get a fitness program started at the shelter, Do you have any good ideas on how to get it off the ground?
Surround yourself with good people and don't get disappointed if things don't take off as fast as you would like. Persistence will payoff.
I just really want to help vets, You know? Thank you for your opinion, I value it a lot.
You have a long history with the military and this is a noble cause. What branch of service was your father in?
He was a pilot in the Air Force. Funny that I actually went to wrestling, Instead of piloting myself.
That's cool. Your dad is a hero. What type of wrestling do you do?
I do most types of wrestling, But mostly boxing. Do you have any tips for staying on a raw diet?
Stick with the diet. It's hard, But you will eventually get used to it..... and it's okay to have a cheat meal every once in a while.
Aw man, That's great to hear. How long have you thought about being a life coach?
I have always thought i had something to offer, So it's been many years. I think I have found my true passion.
Well I wish you luck and know you have what it takes. If you ever need anything, I'm here for ya.
That's great. I value your friendship and your kind words.

persona: My favorite hobby is baking cookies. I have a home. I want to open a baking business.
I love to knit.
I have a dog named Ralph. I don't bake with chocolate because I have a dog who can't eat chocolate.
I like cats.
I have a sister. I gave my sister a goldfish.
I'm using yarn to knit with.
We make our own dough.
dialogue: After I talked to you this morning, I told my mom I wanted to make cookies today. We are just now baking them. Mittens is watching us.
Cookies are always in order! What kind are you all making?
We are making chocolate chip oatmeal raisin cookies. They are my favorite. How is Ralph doing?
Those sound tasty! I haven't had any of those in a really long time. He's doing well! Thanks for asking! How does your mom like baking?
She loves it. We bake all the time together. If you don't bake cookies like these, What kind do you like to bake?
Aww how sweet! I like baking sugar cookies and peanut butter cookies.
Peanut butter cookies sound great! I love peanut butter. Can I make them with chocolate?
Of course! There is a recipe for peanut butter chocolate cookies.
That sounds great! Can you send it to me so we can make them?
Sure! I'll have to find it again, But i certainly will!
Terrific. I can't wait to try it. Do you have any other recipes you can send my way?
Definitely! What kind of flavors do you like?

persona: I live on a farm. I live in colorado.
I am a mechanical engineer. I work mostly on farm equipment and trucks.
I like to rock climb.
I have a black Labrador retriever named Trooper. It saved my life as a child.
My favorite dog breed is a Great Dane and Black Labs.
dialogue: I wanted to thank you so much for working on my truck today. I know we will get it up and running soon. It was also great to finally meet Trooper, What a great dog!
No problem at all, I know we will get it running and get you back on the road, Trooper loved meeting you as well, And I really enjoyed talking country music with you!

It's a huge relief to not be stuck at home all the time. I'm starting to look into electrician apprenticeships. I can't stay working on my dad's farm my whole life. Any thoughts on where I could look in the state?

I feel you, It is always nice to take that leap and carve your own path, And I am sure your dad will support your decisions along the way. I am not totally sure where to even start, I know the Denver area has some pretty promising routes when it comes to electrician apprenticeships.
That's a good thought, I've been hearing about a bunch of new housing developments and they always need more electricians. You got any interesting engineering projects coming up?
Nothing too crazy honestly. Mostly as you mentioned housing developments and projects of that sort. What made you want to move on from the farm?

It's not going well with my parents, Dad's not able to take care of the farm the way he used to, And I've talked to my parents about moving into a retirement home. I can't run the farm by myself, So I'm already planning to sell the farm once they agree to move.
That is unfortunate, But I get how stressful that can be, Have you thought about taking the farm over and maybe hiring people? Or is that something you are simply not passionate about?

I've worked the farm my whole life while also fighting for every second I could to go to school and learn my trade. Maybe I'm still rebelling after all these years, But I can't imagine myself still living on this farm when I'm my parents' age. How about you? You happy with the farm life?

I absolutely love farm life, But with that being said, I have always wondered what it would be like to live outside of the farm, But for me I think I am a farm boy for life. Plus Trooper loves all the area.

I guess that's it too, I never settled down, Despite how often my mother tried to set me up. I feel like I'll have a better chance of finding a wife in the city. Sorry things got so heavy, I've been pretty introspective lately.
No problem at all, I enjoy the deep talks, And yes, Getting out there and finding that person is definitely easier when you are not tied to a specific location.

persona: I am an avid reader.
I recently started a new pa job 3 months ago.
I am almost 5 months pregnant with my first child. I am married. I live in pa.
I've been trying to eat healthier while pregnant.
I've had weird cravings for foods such as oysters. My husband has taken great care of me.
I liked the Social Dilemma documentary.
dialogue: My diet is getting slightly easier each day. I've been trying lots of different fruits to keep things interesting.
Is it hard to find lots of different raw foods? Like, What do you eat instead of cheese?

I found it hard at first because it's so limiting, But I'm discovering there's such a huge variety of fruit andveg that after I while I stopped craving things like cheese. I eat nuts too - by crushing them in a food processor I can make something similar to cheese.

Oh, Yeah. I've seen vegan cheese at the supermarket made of nuts. Do you eat strictly vegan, Or do you eat raw meets, Like that Japanese dish that is raw beef?Sashimi would seem like a good option, If you didn't hate all sea food.

I've been eating strictly vegan ever since I started my raw diet - I really don't like the idea of eating raw meat. And as you know, I hate seafood! That reminds me, Are you still having weird cravings for oysters?
Not as much now. Mostly I'm craving fruits and vegetables! I assume I need the fiber.
I guess so! How are you finding your pregnancy so far? You must be so excited to meet your little one!
I can already picture what she will look like. Do your children eat the same diet as you?
No they don't - my wife eats a regular diet and the children follow her example - I don't want to enforce a raw food diet on them at such a young age!
True. They could develop ricketts! Is it possible for that to happen to you?

I'm being very careful to make sure I get all the nutrients I need. I take a few supplements for certain things that are impossible to get from fruit andveg, But you'd be surprised at the variety of nutrients raw fruit andveg contain! As long as I'm careful, I won't get ricketts.
It sounds like you've thought this through very carefully.

persona: I own horses. I live in the country. I want to live in a city.
I want to become a lawyer.
I have worked with horses my entire life. My horses keep me busy.
I have kids. I'm thinking about moving.
I would rather take a taxi than drive.
dialogue: So what made you start thinking about becoming a lawyer?
I have a passion for defending the wrongfully convicted and innocent. I've always wanted to be a defense attorney.
Do you think moving to the city will make it easier to become a lawyer?
