Definately, I think I'll be able to meet more people with similar intrests as me.. Plus going to law school would be alot easier.
And there would definitely be more taxis around! I can't imagine going to school and moving house with kids. You're so brave.
Thank you so much! How's your new job at the nursing home going? I hope they're treating you okay?
It has been wonderful. Everyone is very kind and the patients are always cracking jokes with me, Have you ever visited a nursing home?
I've been to one on a field tripdurning 2nd grade I think. Don't remember much. I hope I'll never have to put any of my parents in a nursing home.

Yeah, It can be a bit sad. I see my kids about as much as the patients do. Its good that you take care of your parents! I wouldn't mind being in a nursing home though because there would be more people my age that I can relate to!

Yeah, I try my best to take care of them as they're getting older. It's a real team effort to make sure they're on top of their medications and everything. I'm glad you found work you enjoy, You deserve to be happy. You should really start dating more often, Maybe find a special someone?
I think I need to hop on the treadmill first. Then I can find my soulmate and die old on the country side. Then horse ride off into the sunset, Youll have to teach me how to ride!
Definately! Come anytime, It's actually easier than you think once you get the hang of it.

persona: I just spray painted my hair.
I am known to be an animal activist.
My grandfather was in WW2.
I am old.
I have cats.  I watch birds with my cats. My cats are black and orange. I love cats. I have had cats in the past. I love orange cats. I prefer the less attractive of pets when adopting.
I have a yard.
I have a kennel I put my cats in for travel.
dialogue: I have been thinking, And I have decided if I do get another cat, I may actually get a young pair of kittens. My two cats are older and would likely not be much into playing together like kittens do. What do you think?
I think it's a great idea. As you know I'm a cat lover. Make sure to send me pics if you get some!
Oh of course! Do you have any idea what type of cat I should look for?
I don't know what breed, But the type i like is usually black with long hair. More hair to clean up, But what's wrong with that lol.
I hear ya, My two cats have had their fair share of shedding! How are your cats doing?
They are good, But like yours.. They are getting older. It's sad to see them age, But they have been great friends to me. I may be getting some more in the near future.
You are thinking of adopting more cats too?
Yes. I will go to the shelter or look for abandon ones. Those are the best!
I think that is a great idea! Good luck, And send me pics too when the time comes!
You know I will! You know how cat people are.
Oh yes, I know very well. I can't believe we are cat people now.
It happens lol. It could be worse. We could be dog people.

persona: I only eat organic food. I like to eat seafood.
I spend a lot of time on the internet. I enjoy using Twitter. I am up to date with gossip.
I am a feminist. I don't like Trump.
I used to fish with my dad.
I like to spend time outside or reading a good book.
I like to hike and camp. I also enjoy running and spending time at the beach.
I am starting to train to run a half marathon. My favorite race was at Asbury Park beach in New Jersey. I have never done a marathon.
I used to have a dog.
dialogue: I want to check-in and see how your half marathon training has been going. Have you been running every week? Have you increase the amount of time and length of your runs?

I have been running every week, When I started training for this event, I started slow, And each week I go up about 2 miles. I may not have the best time when doing this half marathon, But I for sure am dedicated to finishing!
I don't think anyone could win a half-marathon on their first try, But even finishing is a big accomplishment. 13 miles, That's seems like nothing in a car but on foot...
Yeah it is rough, I am at about 10 miles right now, So almost there, Just need to keep pushing. After the race I am definitely going to reward myself with a day on the water.
That's a great idea, As you can guess it's my favorite way to relax. Have you ever tried paella? I've never had it myself but I found a recipe last night and it looks really interesting.
I could tell! Nothing bats a day on the water. And excuse my ignorance what is paella?
From what I'm reading, It's a spanish rice and seafood dish, Seems like a good way to use my latest catches, If I can figure out how this recipe is supposed to go.
Oh my that does sound delicious, Two of my favorite things mixed together. What are some of your latest catches anything good?

Another good cooler-full of trout, And plenty of sunfish that I threw back. I swear I caught the same one five times in a row. How about you? Any fishing lately? Or are you saving that for after the half-marathon?
I haven't been able to get out on the lake as much as I like. I will say I am super excited for a little bit of perch fishing this summer, My area has some amazing perch fishing.

Ah nice, People keep telling me there are Perch in my area but they must not like the color of my boat, As I very rarely catch any. Have you picked a marathon date? I assume there must be a couple coming up this summer.
Yes, I am shooting for early July, Potentially July 4th weekend. I am excited and cannot wait to get to the race!

persona: I love listening to the who.
I work at a local supermarket in Ohio. I have never travelled outside of Ohio.
I want to go to chicago. My favourite food is black olive pizza.
I have a cat called Spook.
I am not into fashion. I wear a uniform to work.
I like indie music.
dialogue: What do you like most about indie musib?
I like the small venues instead of being in large halls and stadiums. It is more personal.
Yea that makes sense, It's probably nice seeing the bands a bit more close up too. Have you booked to see any live music this year?
So far, I just have the one this weekend at the pub called circle jerks. I kind of go with the flow and don't schedule unless I could miss out, And so far nothing like that is happening.

That's fair enough you don't want to book too far ahead. It's good when local pubs also have live music. There's a Irish pub near me which always has some live irish music playing over the weekend! Where I live there are loads of pubs actually; are there many pubs in your area?
Yes, There are quite a few. Good ol' country boy ones and Irish ones mostly.
What drink do you tend to order at the pub? I tend to be a beer person, Unless I'm out for dinner in which case I'd probably order red wine.

Typically I also like beer as well. I like trying new craft beers. I recently tried an apple pineapple cider that didn't even taste like alcohol. Those are my favorite types of drinks where I can't taste the alcohol at all, Lol.
I like craft beers too. Haha, I've never tried an apple pineapple cider, Though I've had a pear cider before which just tasted like sugar. They are far too easy to drink!
That sounds like it would be tasty too. I also feel like the sweet drinks are too easy to drink. Classic pineapple and rum especially easily go down the hatch lol.

Agreed! Pineapple and rum is such a good combination. A pina colada cocktail is just like drinking a dessert! At Christmas I tend to bring out the Baileys too, Which is probably one of the sweetest drinks I can think of.

It really is, Especially the frozen ones, Haha. In my family, My mom never drank through the year, But she did at Christmas and it was Kahluha and milk or cream. Yummy goin to the tummy! Too much not so great for the tummy though, Hehe.

persona: I am learning to read English.
I like to dance.
I lived in Somalia. My aunt helped me escape. I was forced to marry someone in Somalia who I hated. I live in the US now. I am lucky.
I am new to the internet. I have only had is for a few years.
I never was taught about money as a kid. I want to learn more about investing money.
I want to read more books. I would enjoy learning about wisdom.
dialogue: I wanted to let you know that I just picked up a new book myself. The book is titled "Think and Grow Rich." I know you wanted to learn more about money so, I thought this might be another good title for you.
Thank you so much for the recommendation. Have you read it yourself and what tips can you give to get the most from the experience?
I have read a little bit, And the biggest tip I can give from the experience, Is to start investing while you are young. What interrest you about investing?

I want to be self-sufficient and my own boss. Too long have I had to answer to someone else and be dependent upon others for financial security. Were you able to invest when you were young and how did it turn out? I see you may be forced to retire soon so I hope you can do so comfortably.

I was able to invest when I was younger, I had an advisor who helped me with my investments and they did a great job setting me up to be comfortable in retirement. Being your own boss is truly an amazing feeling. Especially when you had to answer to others for so long.

I was thinking of investing in land or real estate as they have the biggest upside and generally least risk. Although I see many people getting rich on stocks such as GME or Cryptocurrency. What is your stance on any of the aforementioned?

Real estate is always safe, Especially if you are in a thriving area. So totally love that. Cryptocurrency is pretty new at the moment, But it definitely has a huge upside, But also presents a lot of risk, But if that risk pays off, You could be set up very nicely for life.

I share the sentiment. Another potential area that is starting to get tapped is collectibles, Specifically trading cards. A box of pokemon cards sold for almost half a million and a single Magic the Gathering card sold for over that.
That definitely is another area where you can strike it rich. Have you considered purchasing any of those cards and selling them?

Yes, I'vedabbled in it and enjoy having them in my possession as they are also unique art pieces and easy to store. I want to take calculated risks now because even if it doesn't work out I am still young and have time to recover should it go south.
Absolutely that is why investing young is so crucial, It allows you the chance to take risk and even make mistakes until you find out what works for you,

There are so many more opportunities in the United States, I'd never even imagine doing any of this in Somalia. Since I am still learning English, What is your favorite word that you do not see people use often enough?

persona: I have 3 dogs.
I also love being around people, and I am in a polyamorous relationship.
I like to hike and be outdoors.
I'm a homemaker. I wanted to be a door to door salesman like my father.
I volunteered in a clean up hike at our local park. I like volunteering. I try to volunteer at least once a month.
dialogue: Do you think you'll ever do any sales work, Even if it's not necessarily door to door?
I thought that I would want to do that but now I am really enjoying being a homemaker! It gives me more time to volunteer!
Well as long as you get to do what you truly enjoy, That's great! Other than the clean up hike, What other types of volunteer work have you done?
I also do a monthly beach clean up with a local non-profit organization! It's great because I get to help the ecosystem and enjoy the beach at the same time!! I love the ocean!
Oh that sounds great, Keeping the ocean beautiful is always good. I wish I had more time for volunteer work.
I think taking care of the planet is everyone's responsibility! How often are you able to volunteer at the moment?

Yeah, I think we should all do our part to keep the planet clean and healthy. Well I don't have too much free time, Between the constant training and making sure I'm not aggravating any previous injuries.
Would you ever consider switching professions? It sounds like your job is very hard on your body!!.
Sometimes I think about it, But wrestling is my passion, I've been doing it from a very young age.
That's very cool that you stuck with your passion all these years! Maybe you can teach me some wrestling moves sometime!
Yeah that sounds great, I'm sure you're already pretty fit from hiking and the volunteer work.
My endurance has definitely increased since I've started hiking! I definitely could always build more muscle though!

persona: I'm living my dream as a life coach.
My parents are supportive when it comes to sports.
I like metal and rap.
I eat clean.
I am a runner.  I do all of the Disney races. I dress in costume to race.
I had cancer and went through chemotherapy.
dialogue: I got a gig playing at the piano bar!
That's so great, Are they paying you well?
Not really that great to be honest. I took the gig because I wanted to get some exposure. Maybe it'll lead to some better gigs in the future.
Still glad to hear it, Any exposure can't help and I guess it's sort of like you're building a resume. I just took on two new clients myself so I'm feeling pretty great.
Wow, That sounds great. What kind of clients are they?
They both came to me for life coaching, I basically just help them advance in their relationships, Career, And life in general.
That sounds like an interesting job. I was kind of shocked at first when you told me what you did for a living. How much do people pay for that kind of coaching?
It depends on the client, How much time we spend and some other factors but it's usually around 200 dollars a month.
Hmm, Doesn't sound like a lot. You must have to have a lot of clients to make a living at it. How many do you have?
At the moment I have 7 clients I see regularly, But that number can go up or down throughout the year.
Do you have them come visit you at home, Or do you just do it online?
We meet in person sometimes, But a lot of my work is done over the phone or through video calls.

persona: I teach piano.
I like the outdoors.  I like to explore new places. I love to hike.
I do not go to church.  I help at the homeless shelter. I do not have time to do charitable services.

I play the violin, piano, clarinet, oboe, saxophone, upright bass, and marimba.  I like to practice on them. My favorite instrument is the violin.  I love the violin.  My dad was a professional violinist. I take after my dad.
I do not have a garden.
dialogue: I saw an orchestra concert on tv last night and the violinist was amazing. They are coming to town for a performance next month.
Wow! I bet my dad would love to go! Are you planning on getting tickets?
Hell yeah! I can't wait. I just wish I could actually learn how to play the Violin and not just listen to the music.
I'd love to join you!! I don't have time to take on any new students but definitely could teach you a little violin some time!
Yes! We should make a night out of it. You could teach me Violin and I can teach you gardening in return. I have these amazing flower beds you have to see!
I love looking at gardens but not so much planting them! Like I said, Too much dirt on my hands! I'll stick to my instruments LOL!
Lol fair enough, We can just stick to hanging out then. I have a trip planned with the church group this weekend but we can probably do something next weekend if you feel like it?
Let's plan on doing a quick violin lesson before the orchestra performance next month! I'm booked with students for the next few weeks anyway!
Sounds like a plan! You work too hard, You should take a vaccation sometimes. We go to this church trip every summer, You should join us?
I'll think about it, I'm not very religious so don't know if it would be a good fit! Thanks for offering though!
No problem, You don't have to be relgious to enjoy a nice trip lol.
Well we can definitely enjoy the orchestra performance together! I love going to see live music!

persona: I do not work.  I stream on twitch.
I used to design video games.
I am an engineering major.
I started avoiding people after I finished school.
I am building a robot clone. I am talented in technology.  I am famous.
I think happiness can be hard to find.
dialogue: How is your twitch channel? I was thinking I should join.

Twitch is going great. Its really great to show everyone what my projects are without actually having to see them. There are many things to enjoy on Twitch is there anything you are interested in watching?
Are there any streams that talk about business, I kinda want to own my own business eventually.
There are different topics many people are full time streamers so they are running a business. What kind of business are you thinking about?
I'm not sure, I just want to do something that makes me happy. Do you have any thoughts on what I should do?

Do you have any idea on what makes you happy? Profitable businesses are more about providing a service to others you have to find something that you are good at or interested in that you can teach to other people. I help people on Twitch by showing them what I am building.
I like almost everything you are talking about. I like to build and stuff... I just don't have many skills. I definitely think I should tune in to your twitch.
It would be great if you followed me. It is hard to find happiness so might as well find money while you are looking for it. What are you building?
I build virtually actually. I use architectural programs on my computer and build houses and things through there.

You could absolutely stream that on Twitch. People watch people playing video games it would be very popular if you streamed. If you are not ready to start a channel maybe you could be a guest on my channel.
That would be awesome! It would help me get a better understanding of Twitch too, Before I potentially start streaming as well!
Yes that would be great I can virtually host you so there is no need to get together in person. I am sure it will be a very popular topic. Can you use the program to build other things like robots?

persona: I do not like hiking.
I have 2 dogs. King is a German Shepherd. Major is an English Bulldog.
I have never been to Colorado. I was born in Central Virginia.
I have a wife.
I have never seen an owl. I take my dogs on long walks. My dogs are energetic.
I do not really like to hike.I do like to bike. I am a heavier set person.
I have a job. I am a baker. I like baking. I enjoy competitive baking. I like to bake cakes, like carrot cake and red velvet cake. I sometimes use recipes to bake. I like to experiment with baking.
dialogue: How was the weather today? Did you go biking?
Not today sadly, Had to take Major to the vet.
Oh. Sorry about that. Could it be that Major is tired of the long walks?
Oh no, The vet actually said it's good that he has been walking so much, It's just a simple virus that should go away in a few days.
I hope it goes away soon. How is King by the way? I suggest you take him to the vet too. You know viruses.
The doctor already gave me some medicine and told me to keep them separate, If King starts showing symptoms they said I'd be fine to just give him the same meds Major is taking.
That's great. I'm thinking you are home watching over Major. You must have done some baking.. Hmmmn yummy.
I haven't started yet today, Got home from the vet an hour or so but I'm planning on changing things up today and making a bundt cake.
You know I could die for cakes. Blow me away by adding cookies.. I'll pick them up when I'm coming home from work.
Sure, I know a pretty good chocolate chip recipe but I think oatmeal raisin is my specialty.
I don't mind trying new stuffs. Who knows, I could get them to replace my favorite.
I wouldn't be surprised if my oatmeal raisin took place as your favorite, It's definitely mine.

persona: I just turned 18.
I like all kinds of music. I like Elvis Presley. I have a pet fish.
I love red tractors.
I just got married. I found true love. I like to hike. I'm in a hiking club.
I have an orange wig.
dialogue: Does your new wife like doing outdoor stuff with you?
She loves too! We actually met in the hiking club I'm in!
Omg I heard! You just got married didn't you!!!!!! Congrats I'm soooo happy for you. Do you have a honeymoon planned?
Thank you! We already had it! We went backpacking in Europe together! It was amazing!
Thats awesome! Where in Europe? I was a soccer assistant in England for a bit, I could have told you about the best local places to visit.
That would have been amazing! We actually were in England for a bit! Are there any outdoor activities you would have recommended?
You can't beat a nice walk at Bournemouth Beach watching the sunset.
That sounds amazing! I love the beach! It always calms me!
Exactly what I'm thinking! Plus it's free. Do you have any plans for the future? Where do you think you're going to settle down?
We're going to be moving soon to Colorado! Hopefully lots of hiking and outdoor adventures there!
That's awesome! Are you planning on renting or do you think you'll try to enter the arena and attempt to buy a house? The market is soo hot right now I decided to wait a year.
We'll be renting! We still need to save more money before we decide to make the big purchase!! It will take a while probably!

persona: I have three horses.
I work on a farm. I work with my father. I have no children.
I am on a raw food diet.
I like the Rolling Stones.
I am newly married. I love being married. My wife is from the city. My wife is a teacher.
I grew up taking care of animals. I love taking care of the animals. I have horses that I sell.
dialogue: How many horses have you sold?
None yet. I seem to be collecting them as I can not bare to part with them. Have you ever rode a horse before?
I have never been on a horse before! What is the best thing about horse riding?
You should definitely have a go, It is really exciting. I enjoy the fact you need to have a really close bond with the horse in order to get it to do what you want.
But as a beginner I'd never have a close bond. It is quite a dangerous activity isn't it?
Actually, The bond mostly comes from the horse. If you have a good horse you can give them your full trust. It is only dangerous if you do something silly that upsets the horse.
Yeah I guess I should really try it out. I actually like taking care of animals too, If you can count my dog.

That is how I got into horses. I always had an interest in them and grew up around them on a farm. It is like working a second job but its worth it. Maybe you could share a horse with another person to get started?
I'd have to get lessons I think, There are a few stables around me, But I haven't looked into even trying to ride.
Most stables will allow a free trial ride so that you can see if it is something you are interested in. If you got a horse where would you keep it?
The horse would have to live in professionally run stables, I just don't have any space or experience at all with horses. My wife loves horse racing but more from a gambling perspective.
That is probably a good idea. Some stables will look after your horse as well. This then allows you to just focus on riding. Does you wife ever win at the horse races?

persona: I do not currently feel well. My wife and I are divorced.
My wife spends a lot of money on coloring books.
I live in close proximity to my job.
I have two kids.  The kids use all of my money.
We have an obnoxious parrot as a pet.
I am scared of horses. I will try to watch Kentucky Derby horse race.
My family life getting me down.
I am Chevrolet dealer. I like meeting different people.
dialogue: I like to ride horse everyday which makes the relationship between us good.
I am scared of riding horses, But watching the races is always fun to me. What color horses do you have?

I only recently started riding the horse but they are fun to feed and pet. I have 3 of them one black, One brown, And one that is a little different it has a purple stripe. I can only fit one horse in the Truck at a time though. Are there any Chevrolet that are big enough for horses?
Haha, I don't think we have a vehicle quite that big, We could get you a chevy with a purple stripe to match your horse. A perfect match!

If I could fit the horse in the chevy then I would be ready to be on a road show. I wouldn't be able to leave my other animals so its good that they won't fit. I really love my Truck. How is your parrot?
My parrot is good, Very chatty at the moment. When your husband lets you have anything you desire does that mean you can get as many horses as you want?

I may have gone a little overboard on getting a horse with a purple stripe. My husband is very patient he didn't say anything but I can tell he is not very pleased. I think I will stick to buying coloring books for a little while. What is your parrot's favorite thing to say?
My parrots favorite thing to say is definitely "polly wants a cracker" cliche isnt it? And haha, Well I am glad he is patient, Get all the coloring books and whatever else you would like as well!

Did you name your parrot Polly because if you did and gave it crackers that would be funny. Yes my husband is a good man but I have to keep him happy to. He understands happy wife is happy life though can your parrot say that?
I definitely named my parrot polly! And that is a smart philosphy to have! My parrot cannot say that but I must teach my parrot that!
Does your parrot like crackers so she really wants a cracker when she says that? That is so good. Yes life is a lot better when we keep everyone happy. Are things any better with your family?
It is a struggle right now, Not great with my family. But I do appreciate you for asking!

persona: I would like to live at the beach.
I like to play board games. I have kids.
I like to go to concerts. I am a fan of walking dead.
I like red pepper.
I am vegetarian.
My parents were culinary teachers.
I love documentaries. I watch vegetarian documentaries.
I will probably go to the beach on cinco de mayo.
dialogue: I just watched the best documentary I need to tell you about.
I would love to hear all about it!
It was about a Hermit who lived in the Canadian wilderness for 60 years. Amazing at what little he got by on.
Oh wow, That sounds very interesting, Do you remember what it was called? People only need a few things to really survive.
I remember his first name was Willard. The title of the documentary was his first and last name. I'm terrible with names. I watched it on Discovery +.

Oh thanks, I will try to find it later and watch it. I love watching stuff like that because it's amazing how much stuff we have in are life that we don't even need. Also it makes me fill grateful. I tried this new hummus today and it was so good, It made me think of you.

So true. I feel absolutely embarrassed some times knowing how fortunate I am compared to others. Oh you know me so well! I had some of my favorite hummus today, Red pepper. It was very good. What flavor did you have?
I had red pepper too, But with vegan seasoned pretzels. It was so good!! You should try it.
I will definitely try it. I had vegan seasoned pretzels just the other day. I found them at the beach close to where I live.
I love them, They are my new favorite!! Was the documentary called Willard (Kitchener) MacDonald or Hermit of Gully Lake? Its the same person just two different story's, His life sounds amazing!
Yes, You found it. He was quite an interesting fellow. I don't wanna say too much and give away the story. How are your plans going for getting a house at the beach?
I will watch it later tonight then! I found a few homes I really like but they are so expensive! I have to save a lot more money than I thought, But I will hopefully have enough next year.

persona: I love the Mean Girls movie.
I have a pug and a cat.
I am currently single. I like to party alot.
I am afraid of heights.
My group and I focus on helping the less fortunate in the community. My group and I take over abandoned buildings to turn them into public housing.
I also love animals.
dialogue: For how many years do you volunteer to help your community?

I have been helping others for a long time but in the group that takes over buildings a few years. It is really great to see the housing we built a few years ago start to develop strong communities. How is the animal shelter I wonder if we could start one in one of the housing communities.
I really enjoy the work I do to help with the animals. It is a very rewarding experience. I think an animal shelter would make a great addition to your housing community.
Animals are great but I am not sure if we can make it happen. I will look into it. How are your dogs?
They are doing great, Thank you for asking. We just got back in from a walk. How is your pug and cat doing? What are their names?
My pug and cat are great they get along just like siblings they fight and make up. There names are Regina and George after the mean girls movie.
Those names are great! You wouldn't believe this, But my two are also named after mean girls characters! Mine are Janis and Cady. Have you been to any exciting parties lately?
That is awesome that yours are named Janis and Cady. I was just at a party where we watched the movie. Have you watched it again lately?
I haven't been able to. I've been pretty busy with work lately. Hopefully I'll get some down time to watch it sometime this week.
I hope you get some down time soon. Are you working on any interesting projects at work?
I'm actually working on a new waterslide design for a local water park. It's going to be a big one! I hope that's not triggering for you, Since you're afraid of heights?

As long as I don't have to go on it sounds amazing. I like to stand firmly on the ground and look at the structure though. I don't know how people are so comfortable going into the sky I need my feet to be touching land.

persona: I like fish and chips. I like shrimp.
I am related to Christopher Columbus.  I like to watch documentaries.
I used to volunteer.
I paint.  I went to art school last year full-time.
I am traveling to Europe for a few weeks. I have European relatives.  I have been to Spain.
I am going to Spain, and will be getting around on the Eurorail. I enjoy sightseeing, train travel, and local cuisine. I am planning to eat one cheeseburger in every country.
dialogue: My cousin is going to join on the trip, But my sister has decided not to come.
Great! So what's your first destination?
I think are first stop on the cruise is the Bahamas. That reminds me I need to go shopping and get a new bathing suit. When do you leave for your trip?
Wow, Bahamas! So exciting! Hopefully you can try a good cheeseburger there;) We are leaving in 3 days. I haven't even started packing!
Yes! I always start to pack 3 days before the trip, I always seem to forget stuff if I don't. I wonder what there cheeseburgers are like.
Lol I feel that. For my trip I have to pack light since I'm backpacking so I'll have to only bring one article of each type of clothing. Have you been to the Bahamas before?
No, This is my first time out of the USA. But I'm so excited about it! Have you ever been to the USA before?
No never! I live in British Columbia so I'm definitely due for a visit to the states. I think Florida will be my first choice. Have you been there?

Yes, And it beautiful there but really hot and muggy. The USA has the best cheeseburgers in the world, So you need to visit. Maybe when we both get back from are trips we can plan something and you can come visit and have so good food.
Oh no I'll definitely have to dress light then. I don't handle hot weather well LOL. And yes let's do it! Cheeseburger date!!.
Sounds good! I will do some research and find some of the best Cheeseburgers for you, Lol. Maybe you should visit Florida in the fall or winter then so it's not so hot.
That's a good idea! Fall is my favourite season, Such pretty colours! I'll bring you some Canadian souvenirs as well ;).

persona: I love to cut grass.
I came south for the winter. I am from down south. I like travel to warm states like South Carolina, Florida, or Texas.
I am recently retired. I need company.
I love to grill southern food.
I have been to Oklahoma. I work part-time in landscaping cutting grass.
I like to gamble. I go to the casino every other month.
dialogue: I was looking up more information on gambling and decided that I would give it a try for the first time.
Gambling can be fun! What games would you play? Slots or table games like blackjack?
I plan to go to a casino for the first time, So I've been studying a bit about blackjack and roulette. I'm going to play the slots, At first, Just to dip my toes into the water.
The slots can suck your money quickly, So be careful there. They are fun but the cost can sneak up on you. Where is the casino you plan on going to?
I've heard that they are a money pit, So I'll just play for a little while. I'll be going to Mohegan Sun in Connecticut. Which casinos do you go to?
I love Las Vegas, But have been to casinos in the states I like to travel. South Carolina and Florida have nice ones. Table games are a nice way to meet other people too. So how is your dog?
Charlie is doing, Great thanks. He's really my best friend, As the old saying goes.
Thats great! Maybe he can help you pick numbers on the roulette table! Ask him for his favorite number and see how many times he barks or wags his tail. haha.
Now that's a strategy that's sure to win me big bucks! How's your landscaping job down in South Carolina going?
It's only part time, So I love it! I don't work too much, But still am able to smell the green grass that I enjoy! Plus being in the warm weather is so wonderful.
Good for you! I love the warm weather, Myself. It's starting to get warmer here on the East Coast. It will be grilling season soon!
I love to grill Southern Food, As you know. Any good suggestions from up where you are??.

persona: I just finished studying. I am studying art in college. I am a painter. I want to be an art teacher.
I enjoy cooking especially paella.
I like to travel. I go to Europe twice a year. Christopher Columbus is a distant relative.
I love painting. I want to be paid artist.
dialogue: Have you tried selling any of your paintings yet? You could start a travel fund with the earnings.
I have. It helps to pay for college along with my scholarship!

That's a great idea! I wish I were into a something that I could use for extra money. I haven't kept up with painting enoug hto be good enough to sell it. How does it feel to be able to paint stuff that people want to buy?
It feels great! You could always try a hand at personal training? Especially with all your gym experience.

Aww, Thank you! I think that might be a good idea. I think something that keeps me busy will help with my eating. I've been a little concerned that my boredom-eating could be an unhealthy habit, Even with my exercise. Do you feel like being an art teacher is still the next step, Or would you want to stick with being a paid artist?

I love to help people find their passion, So I think I want to stick with being a teacher as the next step. But I wouldn't mind selling art on the side while teaching. Do you feel as though your boredom eating could be counteracted with another hobby?

That's really wonderful. And yeah, You can always do both! I'm thinking I might just have to take up painting more seriously to give me something to do. I can only exercise so often without wearing myself out. I might have to be practice for your teaching career, Haha. Do you feel like college is helping you hone it?
I do! My professors are fantastic, And they go the extra mile to help make sure we learn new techniques to develop new skills. I can always help you if you would like!

persona: Frozen is my favourite movie.
I am 8 years old and in third grade. I like playing in the playground with friends. I like going to the park.
I go to disney world every year. Mickey Mouse is my favourite.
I like sorry and monopoly. I like playing board games. My favorite board game is Candyland.
I live in Ohio. I do not have a dog. My family use to have a German Shepard.
dialogue: How was your family movie and board game night? Did you get to play Candyland? I know that is your favorite.
It was so much fun and yes Candyland was our first game.
That is great I'm glad you had a good time! Are there any board games you haven't played before?
Trivia pursuit is a game I always wanted to play but for some reason I can't find anyone to play it with me.
I used to play trivial pursuit with my family when I was younger! It's a great game for learning!
I think so too and there are so many different versions. Which ones have you played?
I played trivial pursuit junior! Honestly, I would love to play it again! It remember it being a lot of fun!
I think I'd like to play the Disney version only because I know about all things Disney. I kind of wish there was a frozen version that would be awesome.
I think Disney is great too a lot of my students love Frozen!!.
I think I've seen it at least thirty times I know all the words to the songs. My favorite character is anna. Do you have a favorite?
Elsa is my favorite because she is so independent! Have you seen frozen 2?
I have not as good as the first one but still a great movie. Which one did you like better? Oh my it's getting late.

persona: I work in construction. I work on the weekend. I am older than sixteen.
I do not have children. I like Nascar and UFC.
I like to listen to music. I like Mexican food.
dialogue: I hope you were able to watch the NASCAR race with past weekend. It was a real nail biter. I haven't seen a race like that all year.
I did catch it and you're right, It was intense! Did you watch with any friends?
Yeah! I had a few friends over and made a party of it. Made my world famous guacamole and chips. What else do you usually watch on TV? Any sports?
That sounds delicious, You know how much I love Mexican food. The only other thing I usually watch is UFC. How about you?
Exactly! You should totally come over sometime and try it, I know you'd enjoy! I've never watched UFC, It's a little too intense for me. I enjoy watching hockey though.
I remembered you'd said you don't watch tv but I wasn't sure if that applied to sports. I.
Hahaha no sports are my one exception! Even better is watching it live but I've been kinda short on money so haven't been able to do that. How has work been btw?

I hear that! I've been in the same boat despite work being pretty steady. Works been okay. We are very close to wrapping up with the road work. How has work been for you? How do you like working for the school board?
Gotcha, After the road work do you get a little break? Work for me has also been good, I'm hoping to get a promotion to be head custodian.
That would be wonderful! I'll keep my fingers crossed that you get it. I'll probably get a few days off before our next project starts. Have you recorded any new songs?
I hope you do!! Maybe you could take a mini vacation to Canada! And yeah I've done some covers, Mainly just Lumineers stuff. What kind of music do you like?
That's an idea. What's in Canada? Do you have any suggestions on places to visit? That's good that you've been recording. I like the Lumineers. I usually listen to alternative music.

persona: I work at a convenience store connected to a gas station. I enjoy my job.
I love gardening. I like eating fresh produce. I have a garden. I grow tomatoes and bell peppers.
I am afraid of clowns.
I am 20. My dad is 70. I was adopted when I was five years old.
My father taught me to cook.
I want to travel to Europe some day. I want to travel across the U.S.
dialogue: I'm thinking of going all the way to Italy in my yacht. It would be an adventure!
You're really lucky to have your own yacht, Especially at such a young age! I've been dying to go to Italy and other European countries for quite some time now.

Yea I try not to forget how lucky I am, I really am so grateful to be able to use the yact for adventure. I would definitely recommend Italy, It's beautiful. Is there any particular place in Italy you want to visit?

I've had my eyes on Venice. I'd love to see those famous canals I've seen in magazines and on TVs. I'd love to sample some authentic, Italian cuisine in Venice and other big cities like Naples, Milan, And Rome.

Venice is on my bucket list too, I'd love a ride in a gondola down the canals! Rome is fantastic of course; lots of historical sites and delicious food so I'd recommend visiting there. Milan is great if you like big cities, And although I've never been to NaplesI I've been to the nearby Pompeii which is fascinating but very eerie! Do you speak any Italian?
Send me a postcard from Italy if you get the chance, Please! I don't speak any Italian or any other languages. How about you?

I do speak some basic Italian and French but only enough to get by in very easy situations. I really should start trying to learn again! I will certainly send a postcard if I make my Italian adventure happen! And vice versa if you get to do your trip across the US! Would you hire a car to make the trip?

Thank you. I'm going to get a week or two off from my convenience store job this summer. I plan to relax for a couple of days and work in my garden. Then, I'm going to hit the road to do a bit of domestic traveling. I'd love to visit you in Seattle!

That's great you're able to get some time off. I know that employers can be difficult when agreeing holiday time. Even though I'm a bit obsessed with my yacht, I love hitting the open road too. There's something freeing about driving alone with the music blaring! Seattle is a great city, I can certainly show you around.

Yes I love being alone in my car with the music blaring, Too. That would be awesome. I'd love to go to the world-famous Pike Place Market to pick up some fresh seafood and local, Quality produce to make a phenomenal dinner with.

Yea the Pike Place Market is such a hub of activity, It's got a great atmosphere. And a great range of fresh produce of course, So I'm sure you'll find some yummy options for dinner! I really do need to build confidence in my cooking skills!
I'm looking forward to visiting now! Cooking is so much fun, And I'm glad my father taught me how to cook at a young age. You should take that cooking class you mentioned!

persona: I am Larry. I am a chef.
I do not like coffee. I like cooking and fishing.
I like Star Wars a little. I like comic books.
Spiderman is my favourite. I like Spiderman's mysterousness.
I just started going to the writing class. I want to write comic books.
I like to watch college football. I don't want to get a hand injury from playing football.
I cannot draw.
dialogue: I wrote some poetry for the first time in forever... Guess I need to attend that writing class you go to!
Wow, I have never tried poetry before. I am not sure I could write a good poem as I am much better at writing comics. Do you have a sample of your poem you can share?

Haha, I'd be way too embarrassed to send you any of the poem I wrote. I am trying to do it for personal satisfaction, But I really want to learn how to be a better writer by studying the techniques that others have used to create poetry. Have you learned about any good resources in your class?

I know what you mean. I have written a few of my own comics but I would be very embarrassed to share. I have only been to one class so far but they told the most important thing is write on paper first. Apparently this helps with your creativity.

Yeah that's good advice. I always write on paper and do find it helps. I actually like immersing myself in a new environment when I write. The only thing I've ever written that I still like was a short story I wrote while I was out fishing on the lake.

That is really important actually. Finding somewhere you can immerse yourself into your writing ideal. I have a place I found near the river. It is very hard to get to but means I am the only one there. I sit there for hours watching the world and writing.
Nice! That sounds super peaceful and right up my alley. So, How has the cooking gig been going for you lately?
Not as well as it used to. I thought being a chef was all I wanted in life but things have been getting very stressful lately. That is why I turned to writing to try and find a way out.

I totally feel you there, I would never want to be a chef. It seems so exhausting for the tiny amount of appreciation you receive in return. Have you tried selling any of your comics that you've wrote yet? Or are you still trying to iron out your style?
They definitely need some extra work but I think I have the right sort of story. I may even rival Spiderman in the future!
That would be so cool if you could break through like that! I feel like this generation has too much exposure to the old time superheroes and needs to come up with its own Spiderman.
Exactly, That is where my comics come in and change the genre. It is just a shame I am not a good drawer as I have some really good ideas for how I want my characters to look.

persona: I work as a stunt double.
I grew up in a single parent household.
I love reading also. I love reading scary books.
I only eat Kosher food. I love to visit farm markets. I don't know how to ride a tractor.
I am not an active person. I love listening to music. I like listening to motivational things. I am a caring person.
dialogue: How long have you been a actor?
I am not an actor. I'm a stunt double. I replace the actor when a dangerous physical activity must be filmed.
I work on a farm. I am thinking of getting a cat.
Pets are pleasant to have around.
What famous actors have you replaced for that you think I'd know?
Tom Cruise. I jumped out of the airplane in Mission Impossible. Do you enjoy action movies?
Oh wow. That was you?! That's awesome. I love action movies. Mission Impossible is one of favorites. Did you watch any movie recently?
I like the Marvel super hero movies. Do you like Spider Man?
Yes. I watch Marvel too. I probably watched Endgame for like 5 times.
Yes, I enjoyed Endgame, As well. But I only got to see it once.
Did you watch it in the cinema?
Yes. I love going to the movie theater. I love the smell of popcorn.

persona: I live in Charlotte, North Carolina.
I work at Bank of America. I like my job.
I have siblings, and they have gotten married. Some of my siblings live in North Carolina but others live in California. I often visit my siblings in California during the holidays.
dialogue: Ok, I figured out how we can live stream the wedding, But it turns out my grandparents don't have a computer or smart phone, Lol. I guess I'll need to buy them a tablet.
Lol, It's going to be fun showing them how it works.
Yes, I think I'll pretty much have to set it up that they just have to push a button when it's time, Lol. I'll probably have to call them right before to make sure the tablet is on!
You also have to make sure that its fully charged.
Very true! So how is the weather now in Charlotte?
It's a nice day, Its partly cloudy and about 73F. Its one of those days that you can drive with the windows down. How's Canada?
We're in the 50's here today. But a bright sunny day helps with any chill in the air. Any travel plans coming up?
I am planning on going to Texas next Friday for a business trip. Do you travel for the army?

Not at the moment, No travel for me. Which is nice because we can plan the wedding, Knowing I'll be here for it (barring any major emergency, Of course). I have never been to Texas but I hear good things. Will you be able to do anything fun, Outside of the business part of your trip?
I am visiting San Antonio so i will be looking at some of the historic sites such as the Alamo. Might even do some ghost tours. Have you been to California?
Never been to California either, But I plan on it one day! I want to see the Redwoods and explore. I hear San Antonio has a very nice riverwalk.
Thats what i have heard as well. The alamo is right by the riverwalk so ill be able to do all these fun events. Have you been anywhere in the states?

persona: My name is Tracy. We live in Florida in an outhouse. I have a second house in Florida.
My dog's name is Snowbird. My cat's name is Grace. I have an old dog.
Work wears me out.
I have been married for 15 years.
I sing. Love baseball, football and soccer.
I play guitar.
My kids are 3, 5, and 6. I'm really busy with childcare. My oldest two kids go to the same school, and the youngest will join them soon.
dialogue: Have you been able to find time to practice your guitar?
Yes thank you, I've been busy practising some new songs! Have you recorded any more music recently?
I'm still having that problem. I have a repairman coming out to look at themics today. I have to find time in between watching the kids.
Oh dear, Hopefully you will get that sorted soon! How are the kids?
They are good, Just so busy. What do you do with your kids?
Great! We have been going on lots of walks in the hills with Snowbird.
That is such a cute name for a dog. How did you come up with it?
Thanks! Well she is white and she likes chasing birds!
That sounds like a good choice. We have been thinking of getting a dog for the kids.
I think they would love that! What breed were you thinking of?
I would like a lab. They can be very friendly. I want something that will make the kids like me since they are always so busy with their mom.
Right! They are known to be very loving! I'm sure the kids will like you for who you are regardless, But a dog can't hurt!

persona: I am single.
My favorite color is navy.
I rescue bunnies in my free time. I like animals。
I work in the shipyard loading up the crates to the trucks. I take my work seriously. My job is difficult.
I operate a crane at work. I hang out with my coworkers after work. We grab a drink after our shift ends.
dialogue: I've been thinking of selling some of my paintings.
Where do you plan on selling them?
There's a local event called trade days. Locals display all their crafts for purchase. How has work been doing for you?
Work has been stressful. It has been a busy day. How long does this event last or is it only on specific days?
It's usually just one weekend a year. I'm looking into some other options as well. I'm sorry work has been stressful for you.
It okay its just part of the job. How many paintings are you planning on selling.
I have about 100 that are complete and I'm always working on new ones. How is the bunny rescue coming along?
The bunny rescue is going great. How's the photography.

persona: I am a doctor.I am looking for a new job. I want to be a park ranger. I love going to parks. I'm not feeling optimistic about my job search.
I have a medical degree.
I have a daughter that is a talented musician. My daughter plays multiple instruments and genres.
I don't have any big plans for the weekend.
I'm a fan of police and crime dramas.
dialogue: Can you remind me when your daughter's big concert is? Maybe I'll be able to make it.
She is playing early in the evening Friday night.
Ok, I think I should be able to make it! Are there any spare tickets left?
Perfect! Yeah there's a few. Would you like me to get you some?
Just one, As it is just me! I am looking forward to it, Do you know which pieces she will be playing? What instrument will she be playing?
She's playing the saxophone at this concert. I think the band is playing Careless Whisper.
That is a great song, And she will play a very important part in that! You must be extremely proud of her.
Yeah, She's amazing! Are you busy this weekend?
I am just working at the restaurant all weekend, But I am off on Friday luckily. Oh! I have an idea! What if we go to my restaurant after the show to celebrate your daughter's big night?
That sounds fantastic! What sort of food do you like?
I like almost everything, But right now I am on a big sushi kick. How about yourself?
Sushi sounds amazing! I really like sea food at the minute so sushi would be perfect.

persona: I work for the USPS.
I like NASCAR. My dad was a race car driver.
I live in Arizona. I don't like scorpions.
I don't have children. I have a German Shepherd named Barnaby who loves to swim and run along the beach.
My favorite food is sushi.
I like fettuccini alfredo. I watch a lot of movies. I especially like sad, romantic movies. My favorite movie is The Notebook.
dialogue: My 10-year-old broke his foot playing soccer yesterday. We spent the entire day and half the night in the ER. We're all wiped out.
Oh my goodness, That is awful! How is he doing today? And how are YOU doing? That sounds like quite an ordeal.
Today, He has been feeling better. The doctor put his foot in a cast and told us it will take 6 weeks to recover. I am feeling stressed, But less stressed than yesterday in the ER!
Oh wow, 6 weeks is a long time! Is he able to get around on crutches or is that even too difficult for him?
He has been getting around on crutches whenever he is not in bed. He is a resilient young man.
I bet he is! Children bounce back easily from injuries like that. I hope he got treated to a nice ice cream cone from the parlor by your house!
How'd you know? He got a free large cone of his favorite flavor, Mint chocolate chip. We got to relax and watch NASCAR together at night.
I had a hunch! Yum, I am craving ice cream now, But I am more of a rocky road lover. I am sure he loved the time spent watching NASCAR with you.
Rocky road is a flavor I love too. My local shop does not have it in stock though! Maybe the three of us could go watch a NASCAR race in person one day?
That would be so much fun! We should plan it for when his cast comes off as a celebration.
Great idea! If we went to dinner, What kind of restaurant would you choose? My son's favorite food is sushi, Like you.
Oh he's my kind of guy! We should definitely go for sushi, In that case. I recommend All You Can Eat, I know of a great place. And they serve a matcha ice cream, Have you ever tried that?

persona: I work in the mornings.
I am a bank teller, but I'm not sure how much longer I'll be working as one.
I have one child, and am pregnant with twins. I will work full time until I am 7 months pregnant.
I don't like to dance. I have a new house.
I used to be vegan, but I crave steak with my pregnancy. This is my second pregnancy. I live in the US.
I would love to move abroad.
I will try to set up a business from home once the twins are born.
dialogue: I've started looking for a new job, I think it's time to find something I will enjoy doing!
Why don't you try something with your dance?
I live on a farm with my family. I also like to read.
If you are a teacher why do you work in a bookstore? Do you want to return to teaching?
You are right, I should try mixing my love for dancing and my ability to teach. Maybe I should teach dance. How is your job going?
It is boring and I have to deal with the general public which to be honest is draining. I'll be on maternity soon though!
I understand that! Are you ready for the twins to come? Is the nursery ready? Do Americans have nurseries?
LOL. We do have daycare centres which tend to be large and full of children if that's what you mean. Twins will be here in a couple of months all things being well.

I was actually talking about the room in which the babies will sleep. I remember getting that room, The nursery, Ready and dreaming about my babies coming. I have two children myself and they bring me such joy. I am excited for you to get to take an early maternity leave.
Yes Ok I know what you mean. The room is ready but to be honest they will probably sleep in my room for the first 6 months or so and then they will be in their own space. I'm excited too!
How is your new house? Do you have the space and functionality you had hoped for? Do you have neighbors?

Much more space yes and the neighbours are nice. It's good to finally be in a nice suburb and I definitely need the extra rooms. I don't know how large families deal living in small places in cities...

persona: My girlfriend is studying to be a financial planner.

I work for a traveling circus. People insult me for my job. I am one of the main attractions in the circus. I have  been employed at my current position for 5 years.  I do not like the job. My job requires increased protein intake.
I move things with my mind.
I love loves Mexican food. I have  never watched NASCAR.
dialogue: I saw an advertisement for a new movie about the circus. Knowing you made me way more interested in watching it.
That's funny. What did you think of the movie. Give me the name and I'll let you know if it is realistic or not!
The movie is called "The Greatest Showman", And it's about the life of P.T. Barnum. It stars Hugh Jackman and Zac Efron.
Circuses have definitely moved on since the Barnum days. Much less freakshow and much more family entertainment. Which is probably for the best.
I feel bad for those "freaks" who get exploited to make money for traveling circuses. What exactly do you do in the circus?

I am a trapeze artist. I need to stay fit and strong for it as you can probably imagine but it is a great way to make a living people are amazed at the stuff I can do. I do have safety nets though. I'm not completely mad LOL.
You are incredibly brave for doing that daring trapeze act! I think I'll continue working in construction and engineering. I couldn't do that job in a million years.
Well you say that but everyone has to start somewhere. I suppose you do need a head for height though. Which you might already have working construction. How long have you done that for??.

I've been doing it since I graduated from college many years ago. It's what I know, And I make good money doing it, So I'm stuck with it. You probably feel the same way about the circus, Though you told me that you don't like it.
It's like anything. It gets boring after a while. Yes it's good when you are putting on a show but that's 5% of the time. The rest is training, Practice and travelling.
I hear you. Maybe when your girlfriend becomes a financial planner, You won't have to work in the circus anymore!
That's the hope yes. Then I can pursue something new.

persona: I prefer dogs over rabbits. I have two dogs.
I am a teacher. I love children.
I don't have a large income.
I have a garden in my house. I love the smell of flowers.
My husband used to be in the marine.
I love puppies.
dialogue: I decided I am going to plant more colorful flowers in my garden thanks for your tip about attracting bees.
No problem. I am glad I could help. What colors did you go with?
I got a variety of zinnias and marigolds. Mostly reds and yellows!
I prefer peonies and hydrangeas for colorful flowers, But zinnias and marigolds are great too!
Ohh, Great choices! I always forget about hydrangeas! I thought about experimenting with roses this year, But I am not sure I am ready for the task.
I have rose bushes and they grow so fast, It's hard to keep up with them. How did you find time to enjoy flowers during your time in the service?

I had my family members, Friends, And neighbors help out when I wasn't home. I am very blessed with a great support system! But I also try not to grow flowers that require TOO much time. That's why I am afraid of roses. How many days a week do you have to spend time with your bushes?

Honestly, I am too busy with the garden in my house to dedicate time to the bushes. There are only two and they are on the front walkway. I only trim them when they get in the way. It's great you had support, But now you work in the shipyard and build boats so you must still not have time to work on the flowers.

Oh nice! Maybe I could handle a rush bush or too. Thankfully, The shipyards do not require nearly as much time as you would think. I have a great work-life balance and I enjoy what I do. My coworkers love when I bring them fresh flowers!

I suppose boats could always use flowers to add contrast to all the cold steel and wood aesthetic. Do you see a future of working with flowers instead of the shipyard? You are already so busy with the animal shelter and underprivileged kids. I don't know how you do it.

No, I don't. I enjoy having my gardening as an escape from reality. It's a nice way to relax. I worry if I made it a job, It wouldn't be as rewarding. What about you? I don't know how you are able to do it with all you do too!
My dogs and my garden are an escape from the little heathens I teach. So, I totally know what you mean about keeping it from being a job. My husband also helps with the dogs, So I get a lot of help.

persona: I'm depressed because I am turning 40.
I am a car salesman. I hate my job. My wife never had a job.
I recently bought a sports car. I own two cars. I am preparing to be single.
I was married for 20 years. I am going through a divorce, which was hard at first. I will be moving soon.
dialogue: I want to see your new car! Is it a convertible? It's supposed to be sunny tomorrow; come over for a spin?
Yeah that sounds like fun it will get me out of the house and not thinking about the divorce.
I agree! Is the divorce almost finalized?
Yes it is. I just want to get it over with already and move into my new place.
I bet, Have you found a place to live?
Yeah I found a house already it's a bit small but its what I can afford right now. We should have a cookout once I'm moved in.
That would be great, I love going to cookouts. How is your job going?
It's okay I just wish I didn't have to interact with rude customers but I don't know what else I would do if I quit selling cars.
I am sorry to hear that, Do you have any interests that could lead to a new job?
Maybe becoming a car mechanic I enjoy working on cars or if not computer repair I think I could get by with the skills I have.
Yes, You seem to really like cars, That may be a good field for you to stay in but switch to being a mechanic so you aren't having to deal with customers.
I will look into it more I need to be sure I have a job lined up before quitting.

persona: My favorite movie is Mean Girls.
I love the Rolling Stones.
I don't like to study. I like to go out and party.
I volunteer at a food bank near my house.
Top Gun is my favorite action movie from the 80s. I love the Batman movie.
dialogue: I just celebrated my anniversary and started work on the new wood floors in my house.
Congrats! Do you need any help with replacing your floors?
Absolutely, If you are offering!! Did you make it to the Stones concert on the 5th?
I'll be happy to help! No... Unfortunately I didn't make it to the concert. The food bank near my house needed urgent help that day, So I had to cancel my plan.
You are a good person. Please give lessons to my two little cretins at home, They have become so selfish since becoming teens.
Haha... I have gone through a lot of things in my early teens. Don't worry too much, I think time will teach them a lesson. What did you do on your anniversary by the way?
Well, We actually did go to the Stones concert for our anniversary, And it was amazing as usual. I should have been studying though. I got aD on my economics test the next day..
I'll definitely make it to the next Stones concert! Oh, That's a bummer. I'm so sorry that you got aD on your test? Do you think you can ask your teacher for some kind of a make up exam?
Lol... I'm pretty sure she wouldn't take being at a Stones concert as a good excuse. Have you been doing anything for fun recently?
Maybe... But asking will not hurt you! Although I said I don't like to study, I've been kind of motivated by you and thinking of studying stocks and shares.
That's where it's at, For sure! You can't go wrong. Gotta go, The kids are waiting for a ride to the movies. I'll call you later about the floors!
Thanks for the encouragement! I hope you have a great time with your kids and look forward to your call! :).

persona: I play and teach the piano. I play guitar, violin, and the flute. I like classical music such as Mozart.
I work in music but I wish I studied architecture.
I don't plan on going back to school.
dialogue: If you did go back to school would it be for architecture, Or something totally different?
Definitely architecture! How are the studies going?
They are going well. I have a big final in one of my advanced Engineering classes coming up soon.
That is great! I'm always impressed with how well you do. Did I tell you your sister dropped by last week to play music? Me on the guitar, She on the piano.

No, You had not. I bet it sounded great. I've been thinking I should start playing my banjo again after my classwork dies down. Did you every take a break from playing guitar and struggle to gain your skills back?
Oh my gosh, Yes. It's like riding a bike though. We should all get together and have a jam session. No Mozart, I promise :-D.
That sounds amazing. And I agree on the no Mozart part, I don't think my fingers would be able to handle that skill level yet. Do you know any songs with guitar, Banjo and piano parts?
Sure, A lot of Mumford and Sons songs, And others in the the same genre. Speaking of your sister, I need to have a teeth cleaning, So I should call the office tomorrow.

persona: I play music. I drink alcohol.
I grew up on a small farm. I miss the home farm.
I played basketball in elementary school.
I enjoyed organized sports. I haven't played any sports as an adult. I was busy with lots of activities while I was in school.
I'd like to make new friends. I love to host dinner parties. My parents had big parties. I grew up on a farm.
dialogue: Have you thought about joining a basketball rec league as a way to make new friends?

Oh gosh, Its been so long since I last played basketball that I think I would need to work off the rust before joining a rec league. How is the skill level in the rec league you're thinking about joining?
The skill level is from beginner to advanced for adults. It is suitable for anyone that wants to play. What skill level were you at when you last played?

I think I'd have to start from square one with my skill level. Hopefully the muscle memory is still there from fourth grade, Lol. Maybe I could play in a pickup game with you and your friends to try to ease into it before joining a rec league.
Fourth grade! So long ago. You are definitely welcome to join us. What other organized sports have you played?
That would be great! I also played a little bit of soccer in high school. Do you play soccer at all?

No I haven't played soccer. I was only into basketball throughout school and then I had to stop as I got older. It is hard to stay in a positive mental place without an outlet. Especially without the peace of the farm.
I hear you. I always felt like the grassy soccer field reminded me of the farm more than being stuck inside playing basketball. I think the fresh air definitely helps to keep a clear and happy mind.
I agree. The alcohol used to get my mind right but it became so easy to abuse. How are you able to keep things in check without an outlet? Or do you have an outlet we haven't talked about?
Music. 100% music. When I start playing my guitar everything just melts away. Have you tried learning to play? It makes for a great cheap hobby.
Yes actually I have tried! I love it but I haven't touched it in a while since my learning was slow. Do you have any suggestions on how to get better?
We should have a jam session and I'll help you get the rust off. I tend to have people over to play and have dinner on some weekends. It would be a great way to meet some new people in the city.

persona: I play ping pong.
My father and I are both electricians.
I live in the south. I love eating chocolate.
I'm currently learning to play Beethoven's Für Elise on the piano. My goal is to learn and master one full song on the piano each week. I practice the piano at least one hour every day.
I play the violin, but only as a challenging hobby; I am more serious about the piano. I've been playing the violin for about 4 or 5 years. I've been playing the piano since I was 8 years old.
dialogue: So, How long have you been an electrician? Have you ever messed-up and gotten a big zap?

I think my dad taught me the basics from an early age. So, I could say almost my wholelife. But there has been a few mishaps where the leak was not intended but you never know when you're gonna get a surprise zap.
I hope you stay safe and practice safety on that. It could be a dangerous field.
It was a silly mistake on my part. I forgot to wear my glove when i touched a open wire which was sticking out.
So play Beethoven's Fr Elise on the piano now?
I don't think I'm up to the mark. It's still mediocre. I took a course from YouTube to get more fluent in using the piano. How's your guitar practice going on?
I haven't played guitar for a long time. I was just seeing if I could play it a little.
Is weed legalized where you live? And have you tried learning guitar lessons when you're high?

persona: I'm am not vegan. I have a brown german shepherd. I love my dog. My dog thinks he's a lion.
I like to eat hummus.
I like to watch NHL hockey.
I have been to Disney world. I like to ride the rollercoasters at Disney. I do not like to sky dive. I'm not brave.
I live in a farming community. I raise my own food. I do not have a pool. I have a television.
My husband is adopted.
dialogue: Have you started your vegetable garden yet? What are you planning to grow?
I haven't started yet, But bought some seeds! I'm planning to sow chickpeas for my hummus and some herb seeds!
You are actually going to grow chickpeas?! We will have to have a hummus party! How is your "lion" doing?

Yes I think it would be great if I can make hummus with my own chickpeas. Would you like to trade your hummus recipe for my chickpeas? Lol My lion is doing good! I think he would be a big help whensowing seeds. He's good at digging.
Oh man, My dog is the worst that way! He just snuck over to the neighbor's pool and went for a swim, Thesnot! Well, If you can swim, Go for it I guess.
Lol But he is still cute, Isn't he? Has your neighbor ever complained about it, By the way?
Not since I offered him sky diving lessons! Want to come on the next lesson? Haha.
I wish I could try but I'm very afraid of heights... I have ridden a roller coaster once, But felt really sick. Do you think there is anything like a medicine that can help?
Oh, I thought you liked roller coasters. I was going to say sky diving isn't much different! Yes, Ginger is a very good anti-nausea agent.
Yes I do like the experience at Disney, But I'm afraid of getting sick after riding roller coasters. :( Thanks for the tip! Do you think ginger beer would work too?
Absolutely it does. Now that hockey season is over, You'll have to invite me over for a Netflix movie. My TV is still broken.
If ginger beer works, Then I will take your offer and take the lesson! I'm free this weekend. Would you come over and watch a movie? I have lots of beers that my friends left the other day!

persona: I have a black lab dog named Trooper.
I am a mechanical engineer. I work long hours.
I love hiking and rock climbing. I climbed Mt. Everest for the first time last month.
I am from Colorado.
I do not speak any other languages. I want to learn Spanish, but it seems hard.
dialogue: My boyfriend finally agreed to go on a hike with me.
That's awesome for you!! After texting you I met with a lady who is also a mechanical engineer she is going to teach me how to speak Spanish.
No way what are the chances?! Spanish isn't too hard to learn I found it to be pretty fun. Does this lady work nearby you?
Yes she is. We are currently working on the same project she is new on the field.
Thats awesome. I have to ask, How was it climbing mt. Everest last month?
It was amazing buttiring as well I am not sure if I would recommend it to you since your boyfriend does not enjoy hiking. What sports do you guys like to do together?

I bet it was! Everything I have heard or read about climbing Mt. Everest has sounded so challenging. Right now my boyfriend and I have been somewhat enjoying throwing a frisbee around. I am still trying to get him to come around to hiking but I think it will just take some time. He's kinda mad at me right now.

Ohh no I am sorry to hear that!! I hope he will get used to it. I may take some time but I think he will understand you better by time. I have never tried throwing a frisbee. And I want to ask where you live maybe we can do something together?

Yea he will come around I am persistent Ha! I am actually near Denver Id love to show you how to throw a frisbee sometime! Once, You get the mechanics down it can be a lot of fun. I'll help you with some spanish too!

persona: I ride horses. I do not have a horse. I like mini horses. I would like to have a horse, but I can't afford one.
I have 2 more years of high school. I don't like high school. I don't get along with my teachers.
I have purple walls. My carpet is lime green.
I am vegan.
I'd like to learn to do jumps and other tricks on horses.
I love Arabian horses. I consider horse riding a tradition in my family. My father is a farmer.
dialogue: How is school going? Will you be taking the PSAT this year?
Yes. I am worried about it becuase I don't pay so much attention because of how much I hate school. But I need to try. I want to be a horse vet.
I know how worried you can be but I can assure you everything is going to be fine if you can focus and believe.
It is just so boring. If only I could do school while out on my horse. Then it would be fun!
It's funny how you want a horse to be involved in everything. I wish you had one. Life would have been really exciting for you.
That's why I have to do well in school - so I can earn money and then buy one. It is so wonderful that you have your horse.
Exactly. You know the key already. I just need you to practice hard and ace the PSAT at once.
I will try. What do you do to motivate your kids to do well in school?
They know I will be happier if they do well. I also get them on vacations of their choice. Even though it might be far and inconvenient, They know I won't say know.
Wow a vacation would be great. I wish we had the money for that! Farmers don't make too much.
If only the world was perfect. You would even have 15 Arabian horses right now.
Well maybe if I become a vet I will! Do you want more?

persona: I go to the gym.
I do not like hiking. I collect vintage cars.
I own an orange alfa romeo owned by Johnny Carson.
I am allergic to dogs. I work from home.
I'm in the market for a car, possibly a Mustang. I own an orange car. I would like my new car to be red.
I work out at a gym. I like cardio workouts as well as weights.
I have a pet goldfish named Bubbles.
dialogue: Nemo died. :( I just went into the living room to find him floating on the top of the aquarium.
Oh no that's terrible! Are you ok?
Yea, Its just sad. I guess I'll have to get another one. What should I name him??.
I like making references to things I enjoy. Maybe name him after a trail you love to hike. Or are there any movies or shows you love?
That's a great idea, Naming him after a trail I love to hike. I was just hiking today! Maybe I'll name him Sunrise. That would actually make me smile every day!
I'm glad. Always sad to lose a pet, But at least they had a good life with you? Do you have one of those nice aquariums? Mine is just in a bowl.
It's pretty big and I have lots of colorful rocks and plants in it. It's calming to look at and watch the fish swim around. Did you get a new car yet?
Not yet. I've seen some cool Mustangs, But not the red one I wanted. My wife thinks we should hold off on another for a bit.
It's hard to hold off on something you really want but sometimes it's for the best. Especially if you don't see the one you want (wait for that red one!).
Yeah, I will. I know you're still young, Have you gotten your first car yet?
Yes, I have a used chevy truck. Not exciting, But it gets me from place to place. I'm not that big into cars.
A truck was one of my first cars. Don't have a need for them, But I did always kinda enjoy having something big and powerful.

persona: I am an accountant. I got a finance degree in 2011. I would like to go to business school to become a manager.
I just got a Yorkie yesterday; my parents bought it for me. I love dogs. My parents are wealthy bankers.
I like listening to punk rock.
I sometimes volunteer.
I own a BMW.  My BMW is the first car i have ever owned. I go on road trips every weekend.
I like spending time with other socially.
I have never been to Miami.
dialogue: I saw the newest model BMW today!
Oh cool! What did you think of it?
I think the front end looks like a pig's snout!
I dont think so i love it, But you are a mustang guy.
Yeah that's true! I do love some of the older BMWs though like the E46 and E92M3s.
They are my favourites much nicer than newer ones, And plenty of room for your dogs.
Agreed! Which one do you have?
I own anM3! Just took it on a road trip.
Awesome! Where did you ride to?
I drove totampa, Not quite Miami but much closer for me.
Cool! I've never been but heard its nice there. Are the roads to it good?
Yeah they are wide open and great to drive in the sun! Theres also loads of country music festivals there that you would love.

persona: I am in Pennsylvania.
I just started a new job as a personal assistant.
I'm pregnant with my first child. My baby is due in 4 months. I'm waiting until birth to learn the sex of my baby.
I have a husband who is into skateboards.
dialogue: I'm so stoked! The doctor cleared me to start skating again. I'm supposed to go easy for the next two weeks, But that should still give me plenty of time to get ready for the X Games.
Thats so awesome! How is your arm feeling?
Its feeling pretty good as of right now, Way better then when it first happened thats for sure! Cant wait to get skating again! Do you skate?
I can't because i'm pregnant and my baby is due soon! My hubsand loves it though.
Congratulations! How long have you and your husband been together?
We have been together three years, Married for one. Is it hard to date when you are part of the professional skateboard scene?
Wow thats great! No it isnt hard. Skating takes a lot of time but I could definitely find someone patient and willing the come watch and be supportive. You should try skating after having the baby!

That would be cool, Like your own fan section!! I think i'd like to try skating! Having healthy hobbies and being in shape is important to me. Might be something my family can all do together once the baby is big enough. When did you first start skateboarding? As a kid?
Yes I was 10 years old when I started skating. It has grown on me and I havent been able to stop.

That's awesome. It's so cool there's something you've loved like all your life! Do you have to cross train for it or does the sport itself serve as enough workout to prep you and keep you safe/healthy?
It is enough workout to keep me safe/healthy. You should definitely make it a family thing.
I'll have to give It a try. Do you ever skateboard with kids?

persona: I'm a cashier at the local supermarket.
I live in Ohio. I've never traveled. I think Ohio is boring.
My favorite food is pizza with black olives.
I like to swim. I like going to the beach.
I have a cat named Spook. He is at least 14 years old. He is a Persian black cat with orange eyes.

My cat sleep over 16 hours these days but he is still very active. He likes to eat pizza with me and makes me happy.My cat only eats the crust and beef topping. He likes to go on walks but just not on sand.
I had 2 dogs and 2 cats that passed away. I used to be a dog person but now I have a deeper connection with cats.
dialogue: So what do you do on the computer? Do you play games?
