I have no pets. Cheeseburgers are my favorite food.
My favorite documentary is The Staircase.
I think Michael Peterson is guilty. I have watched Season 1 of Making a Murderer.
I am going to visit Colorado. I have never been hiking. I like to eat local when I travel.
dialogue: I recently went hiking and found a great beginner trail that might be great to introduce you to hiking successfully.
How long is the trail? I don't have to worry about bears or anything, Do I?
Its about 3 miles round trip. Well you should always be aware but i have never heard of one being seen on this trail.
Is there anything dangerous that could happen on the trail? I'm used to spending most of my time in the city.
No its a flat trail that follows a beautiful river. The midway point leads to an amazing waterfall that is great to picnic at!
That sounds awesome, Are there any fish in the river? Maybe I can bring a fishing pole.
Yeah they stock all the rivers with trout. Thats not a bad idea!
You're getting me very excited to go hiking. Do I need to buy any special gear or can I just wear my sneakers?
For this trail a good pair of tennis shoes will do. Im glad i can spark that interest! Hopefully we can do it soon.
You better be careful, The next thing you know I'll have you climbing Mount Everest with me!
Haha, One step at a time. Oh i know youre a bit of a foodie. There is a great taco truck that sets up in the parking lot of the trail!
I'm sold! I think I'm going to buy a GoPro camera to wear on the hike!

persona: I don't go to school anymore.
I sell watches for a watch company. My family does not really support my career choice.
I enjoy shopping. I own my dream home. I want to get my dream car: a rolls royce.
dialogue: What is your day to day role at the watch company?
I just sell watches so half the time I don't even have to go in to the office. I sell online, And I visit high end shops in person as well.
That sounds awesome! Why doesn't your family support this job?
They are embarassed that I am a sales person, They don't think it is a respectable job.
I'm really sorry to hear that. I hope they eventually change their minds. What have you been up to in your free time lately? Any new stores I should know about?
Just doing work on the house as usual, Never ends when you're a homeowner!
That's what I'm learning right now after buying my house! The work never ends! Do you have any tips for a new homeowner?
Fix the problems asap and don't let them fester---they become much more costly the longer you wait!
That's great advice, Thank you! Are you still enjoying your dream home? Pretty soon you'll have that beautiful new Rolls Royce in the driveway!
No problem! Yes, I love my home and enjoy it greatly. Can't wait for that dream car though, Real soon now!
I'm really happy for you! What do you enjoy most about your house?
The design, It flows wonderfully and offers a lot of precious daylight space.

persona: I suffer from heartburn.
I am pregnant with triplets. I am with someone who already had children before me.
I work at a school.
My favorite food at the moment is strawberry yogurt.
I have a new home. I own a couch. I binge-watch Netflix.
My guilty pleasure is "Grey's Anatomy.".
dialogue: What else do you like to binge-watch on Netflix?

I like to watch a lot of Netflix originals, Since there are some pretty good ones. Have you watched The Umbrella Academy? That was actually really good and I am excited for the next season to come out! Are there any shows you like to watch?
Which stephen king book is your favourate?
I actually don't have a favorite Stephen King book. Why do you ask? I thought we were just talking about movies or shows on Netflix! Do you like to watch his movies?
I enjoy watching scary movies, I thought may be you might enjoy it aswell. So how many seasons does Umbrella Academy have? I might try watch it sometime.

There are only 2 seasons so far, But I think a third is coming out soon. It is really good, And I would even say the 2nd season is better than the first. What kinds of scary movies do you like to watch? I am not one for senseless horror but if it has an interesting plot that could be interesting!
I can't think of one at the moment, But i do watch a lot of horror movies. Only 2 seasons i can finish watching that in just one weekend.
Yes, It is definitely a quick watch. You can't really think of any horror movies that you like? What else do you like to watch on Netflix?

persona: I go to school. I am in third grade.
I enjoy singing Disney songs. Frozen has my favorite Disney songs. I like Build a Snowman song. I have stuffed Olaf toy. Olaf is my favorite character.
I like to play with robot. I live with my parents.
dialogue: My robot is ready for you to play with and you can come anytime after school today.
Oh cool! I will have to ask my parents first. What kind of robot is it?
They are entertainment purpose robots to entertain the humans.
Does the robot have a name yet?
Yes, The name of my robot is Sven.
You should make an Olaf robot next so that they can be friends.
Yes I thought that too and I started doing some work around it. Do you like to build robots?

I have never built a robot, But I do think they're very fun! I would like to try to build a robot when I am older. Maybe in fourth or fifth grade we will make one at school. My dad says he will help me make a robot someday. Do your parents help you with your robots?
No they don't I started building it on my own as they two are always busy with their work.
Oh. I think it would be fun to build robots with my parents. What kind of work do your parents do?
They are doing some work software sectors. What do your parents do?
My mom is a lawyer and my dad is a photographer. Do you ever get to do fun stuff with your parents?

persona: I like eating all kinds of foods.
I work in construction and I enjoy building houses. I am a contractor.
I like music and I play the piano and guitar.
I have three cats. I have a russian blue cat, a japanese bobtail cat, and a birman cat. I love cats.
I am unsure about having kids.
dialogue: How are you and the cats?
Things are not great. My one cat, Hugo is getting really old and we think he is sick. I have to take him to the vet this week.
I'm so sorry to hear that! How old is he?
He is 15 years old, And is the oldest of my three. It is so sad when they get to this age! How old are your cats?

That's so hard! You love giving them a long life but it sure is hard to watch them age. My oldest cat is my tabby, Ginger. She's 11. My tortiseshell Baxter is only 7 but he acts like a grumpy old man already.
Aw, I love how they have different personalities. Have you had both of them since they were kittens? How do they interact with your kids?

Yes, Both as kittens! I got Ginger before my sons were born, But my oldest was one when we got Baxter. They get along well, For the most part since they basically grew up together. Did you get yours as kittens?

Yes, Hugo has been with me since he was only a few weeks old, So he is very special to me. He's my Russian Blue. My Japanese Bobtail is named Potato, And I got her as a kitten as well. The only one I didn't get as a kitten is Frank, My Birman cat, And that's because I adopted him from a friend who found him as a stray. It's adorable that your cats grew up with your kids!

I love the name Potato! I bet she's adorable. I would love to adopt a stray. I think the next cat I take in will be a rescue of some sort. I'm really sorry Hugo isn't doing well. I hope the vet is able to give you some answers at his appointment.
Thank you for the well wishes. I am hoping he is ok too, And am very anxious to hear what the vet says. Are you thinking of getting another cat any time soon?

Well I will be thinking of you two! I'm considering it. We're trying to get pregnant with one more child, But I think if that doesn't happen in the next few months we might take in another cat. Especially as Ginger gets older, I want Baxter to have another companion. Do your cats get along well?

persona: I want to dye my hair blonde.
I like to watch youtube.
I love playing role play games.  dont like blood or shots. My favorite RPG game is Skyrim The Elder Scrolls.  I watch a lot of video game channels and music.
I work at the factory. I am not in the leadership position, I do not deal with customers and clients. I want to work at home.
dialogue: You know, Sometimes I missed my mom so much.
It's never easy losing a loved one, Are you close with any of your other family?
Yes I am very close with my younger brother. He is very special to me.
Well that's good, Do you get a lot of time together. I really enjoy spending time with my brother, Its a bit hard with working at the factory though.
Are your hours long at the factory?
It's a 9 hour day and its very physcally demanding. I get home and pass out, Some nights I get to get some gaming in, But not as much as I would like.
Is your favorite game still Skyrim The Elder Scrolls?
It is! I play it more than any other game even though its older.
I got that game when it first came out. It is one of my favorite games.
I keep finding new things in the game, Plus the mod community keeps adding fresh stuff to the game.
Have you seen the mod where it turns the dragons into Macho Man Randy Savage?
No! That sounds awesome! Ive been playing with a total conversion mod that makes it feel like Lord of the Rings.

persona: I'm tired. I have a new job at a gas station. I stock shelves and work on the check out. I do not pump customer's gas. I like working with my hands.
I grow a vegetable garden. I grow carrots.
I only speak English.
I am adopted. I am a single man.
I am saving money so I can have time off and look for another job.
dialogue: How is your vegetable garden coming along?
Oh good, Things are popping up now as the weather warms up, I've been waiting to see green!
Do you only grow carrots or do you grow other vegetables as well?
My favorite is carrots, But I grow alot. Tomatoes, Peppers, Squashes, Peas, Beans, Etc.
I am not a gardener but I am growing some peppers myself. I love eating peppers so I wanted to grow my own.
Oh thats very cool, Good idea too, You can save a good amount of money growing your own. Do you ever make sauasge and peppers?
Yes I love sausage and peppers. I grew up eating it all the time.
Nice, Me as well. Are you Italian. I am not, Just something my mom liked to make.
No I am Irish but my parents grew up in an Italian neighborhood in NYC so we eat a lot of Italian food.
Right, Makes sense I grew up in a NYC suburb so it was common food around us.
Many people think they are Italian because of their thick accents.
I have an accent too. Do you live in that area now?

persona: I read two books a month. My grandfather raised me.
I'm fit. I only cook kosher foods.

I like riding horses. I used to have a horse.  My horse's was a Mustang and his name was Soldier. My grandfather gave me my horse when I was a kid. My horse died a few years ago of old age at 20. He only ate kosher food.
I liked to sit with my horse and read.
I live in an apartment in the city. I grew up in the country. I like country music. I like some 90s pop music.
I have kids.
dialogue: So did you play some music today while making dinner to annoy your kids?
Yes I love playing music while making dinner. It keeps my mind calm and concentrated.
What type of music did you play?
I like to hear some pop musics.
That's interesting. I like some pop music also; however, I prefer rock as I mentioned before. In what city is your apartment located?
I am located at Connecticut.
Oh Connecticut is lovely. Is that where you were raised?
Yes I were born and raised. Where do you live?
I live in Maine. It's great because there is a lot of land and plenty of room for horses. It's very quiet here, Which I love. Do you live in the city or a rural area?
I live in suburban area which I don't like a lot. I always wanted to shift to a rural area because those places are very silent.
Yes, That's true. The quiet is definitely nice. It makes for a good space to read books. I just read one that I loved. Have you read any books lately?
No I haven't because I got some work to do so.

persona: I played college football.
I broke an ankle.
I live in Los Angeles. I have seen celebrities in LA.
I like to read poetry and Star Wars. I am a Star Wars fan and attend conventions. I don't like the new Star Wars movies. I did not like Rogue One.
I have a coffee blog. I like tea. I drink it at night sometimes instead of coffee.
I have been researching upcoming conventions to see if there are Star Wars panels I can attend. I don't dress up for conventions much anymore, but used to when I was younger.
dialogue: I was thinking about attending the Star Wars convention.
Awesome! When is it taking place?
Next month! Any chance you'll be on the panel?
I'll have to check my calendar, But if I'm free then I'll definitely be there. Maybe we can meet up there while looking for r2d2.
I will find him, Someday. I will! I heard there is a new coffee shop down the street from there too. We could swing by and get something to drink beforehand and you could add a review to your blog.
That would be great! I'm always looking for more content for my blog. Especially when on mini vacations haha! What kind of coffee do you like?
My favorite is from a local coffee shop - 'Cup-a-Joe'. But I'm willing to try this new place to see if it compares. I noticed they sell herbal tea too!
You never know the quality of a new place until you try it. I hope they have peppermint tea, Its my favorite.
That sounds fantastic. I meant to ask - how is your blog doing, Anyhow? Getting lots of traffic?

persona: I go to school. I study culinary arts.  I want to be a pastry chef.
I can make paella. I love fish and chips. I cook for myself. I eat out a lot.
I make butter croissants. I have a hard time getting butter croissants as flaky as I would like. I make terrible croissants. I make good eclairs.
dialogue: I am sending you a box of eclairs and croissants I tried making for the first time overnight mail. Tell me what you think.
Thank you, I hope they are good. Perhaps the croissants are better than mine.
Aw, Don't say that. Just different! How is school going?
Good, I had a couple of exams last week. I am glad they are over. How is farming? Are crops good this year?
Kind of middle of the road - not the best but not the worst, Either. I've been craving some good eclairs lately. I might have you buy some off you.
I am happy to hear this year isn't too bad. Don't worry about buying the eclairs though - I'll send you some! I enjoy making them anyways - it is a good stress relief.
Are you sure? I'm sure the ingredients aren't too cheap, I really don't mind paying you a little. I sure appreciate it! Crops make me kind of crave something chocolatey, Ha.
Yes, I'm sure! And didn't you already say you were going to send me some that you made? Call us even then.
Sounds good! I'll send you some stuff from my vegetable patch. Some great carrots and tomatoes this year. So, Vegetable and fruit patch techincally, Ha. How much longer do you have of school?
Thank you, Always enjoy fresh produce (especially when it is free).
Ha! The price is right. Anything in particular you like? I have free space and I'll plant some for next year.

(Sorry something happened with my computer). I have a sweet spot for zucchini though! But don't worry about it, I am graduating this fall and plan on moving out of my current apartment. I want to find a place that has garden space.

persona: I have kids.
I am in a world domination group.
I am a housekeeper. I painted for 20 years. A lot of my abstract paintings are in our local museum.
I miss painting. I have arthritis. My bones hurt.
I sell art.  I am an artist. My best pieces are abstract pieces.
I like several artists including Pollack, Picasso and Miro. My art is inspired by Picasso.
dialogue: I have decided where to put the artwork I bought from you.
That's terrific! Where did you end up putting it?
I hung it at the Y so that everyone can enjoy it! The kids love it! Have you painted anything else recently?
Not much lately. Still got these old bones. I'm glad you picked that spot where a lot of people can see it. Are you still working out a ton?
I'm sorry to hear your arthritis is still acting up. Yes I still work out a lot. I find that if I put in the time each day I can enjoy my health and lifestyle more.
That is great for you. I should really look into more exercises I can do for my hands. Any recommendations?
Honestly just stretching and massaging would be best. My doctor recommends tart cherry juice for inflammation after I work out. It's great for the muscles.
Oh, Those are great ideas. I'll give those a try. Does it matter which cherry juice or any kind I can find at the store?
Well I think that you can look some up and order it. A health food store might have it. Have you sold any new paintings lately?
I'll look into that. I've got a few people interested, But the last one I sold was the one you bought. Have you picked up any others lately?
No I haven't. Though I did go to a Picasso exhibit put on by locals that recreated a couple of his pieces. It was interesting!
That must have been. Did I ever tell you about the Pollock museum in Florence?

persona: I watch hockey.
I live in a rural area.
I'm a farmer. I have a rural farm with a lot of land.
I have a dog.
I plant potatoes and wheat. I love mashed potatoes.
My favorite movie genre is comedy.
dialogue: How many acres of potatoes and wheat did you plant this year?
120 acres of wheat and 200 acres of potatoes. Can never have enough potatoes!

Haha I agree! I love potatoes too! There is this dish my family makes where you put potatoes, Bacon, Sausage, Vegetables and spices and baked it in adutch oven. Truly amazing! Is anybosy helping you with your farm?
Iv got a few farm hands but mostly i do it myself, Its easy this farming, You just put stuff in the ground at it grows!
I didn't realize it is that easy... I definitely could not do it myself. Have you seen the movie Slap Shot? Someone told me about it and I am wondering if it is any good?
I have not seen that movie, But i just checked imdb and its only got 4. 5/. 10, I guess you should watch and judge for yourself.
Oh, Thanks for checking that. It is a movie about hockey. I guess I will just watch it. Our team is playing Las Vegas Silver Knights this weekend.
Great, Were playing the Canucks this coming Monday. Hopefully im done on the farm in time ti watch it.
Oh yeah, That should be a great game! I might watch it with my friends too. We usually go to this brewery in town to watch games. What do you do?

Usually i get my wife to hand cut some chips, Make me a big bowl of poutine, I sit back in my armchair with a few cold beers and watch until i fall asleep. I dont think iv ever seen the end of a game iv watched at home!
Hmmm I need to make notes for when I get married. Hopefully my wife knows how to cook. How long have you been married?

We've been together since i was 19, Im 40 now, So 21 happy years. You should find yourself a nice wife and get in to farming, Its so easy, You just put stuff in the ground and it grows, there are harder jobs out there.

persona: I live with two dogs.
I have a massager. I'm a gym trainer and am at the gym often. I train older ladies at the gym. I love doing the treadmill and rowing machine.
I have no kids. I have dogs - border collies.
dialogue: So did you start that painting yet?

What painting do you mean? You are the painter out of the two of us! I thought that you were going to paint me a picture of my two dogs whenever you have free time. I would love to take you up on the offer!
You're right! I was just seeing if you remembered. I just started the painting for my grandbaby and I'm hoping to finish it later this month. I could try to do your dogs in June?

That works for me! When are you going to start the painting for the nursery? It sounds like it will be super cute and the perfect gift from your new grandbaby! No rush on finishing it this month though, I know you have plenty of time before the baby is due. Do you know if it is a boy or a girl?

Plenty of time, Yes. We don't know boy or girl yet. They're finding out with a blood test soon so we'll know for sure. I just started the painting and I decided to do Baby Yoda. My daughter is doing a Star Wars themed nursery.
That is so exciting! I bet you are so excited to find out. Are you hoping for a boy or a girl? I love the idea of painting Baby Yoda! I'm guessing your daughter is a huge Star Wars fan.
Huge fan, Yes! We all are. Do you like Star Wars? I'm not hoping one way or another. I'm just excited to be a grandma.

Believe it or not, I have never seen any of the Star Wars movies. I really need to sit down and watch them all one day. I think it is something I would enjoy. Have you been watching them since they originally came out?
Yes! I was twelve for the first one and my father took my for my birthday. He loves science fiction.
That's a great memory to have. So you are from a long line of Star Wars fans, Then. Have you painted anything from Star Wars in the past? Do you have any other types of science fiction that you like?
I haven't painted it before, No, But the baby is a good excuse to do something fun and cute. I like all types of science fiction. It's so much fun. Do you have a favorite genre?
That's so fun! I prefer action movies more than anything. Have you watched any of the James Bond movies?

persona: I like watching documentaries.
I live in pennsylvania and have a husband.
I started working as a personal assistant 3 months ago.
I like to read a book every week. I like harry potter. I prefer the Harry Potter books to the movies. I don't have a favorite Harry Potter book.
I used to read Shakespeare in school.
dialogue: I just moved into a new home.
Did you get everything unpacked? I know how exhausting it can be after moving and unboxing all day.
Finished unpacking the bedroom. Going to order a pizza tonight and unpack the kitchen stuff tomorrow.
Sounds like a good plan. You've gotten a lot done already. Some comfort food and a good night sleep sound great. What kind of pizza?
Double pepperoni with stuffed crust and marinara dipping sause. Maybe some stuffed cheesy bread too, Gotta splurge when I can haha!
I do love a good stuffed crust but I am a sausage and mushroom kind of person. The cheesy bread sounds good and now I am thinking maybe it's a pizza night for me too!

Pizza pals haha! I think I might try to get in a little reading tonight too. I'm about halfway done with the second Harry Potter book and it is way better than I thought it would be! What are you reading nowadays?
I started reading a new series by Nora Roberts. It's been good so far. I'm glad you are enjoying Harry Potter. I love them and they only get better. Is your daughter an avid reader too?
She is only 6 years old so doesn't read much, But loves the movies. I started reading the books to her a little each night so we can both experience the books.
Awe that's amazing. It'll help her love of books grow. In a couple of years you can introduce Shakespeare.
Yeah, Shakespeare is definitely outside her age for now, But someday. She is amazed at how much is in the books that isn't in the movies, And I'm just glad to get some quality time with her.

I had to stop comparing the movies and the books. It started making me feel like a critic to always be pointing out what they missed LOL. I know think of them as the movies or the books cause they aren't exactly alike. It's good quality time you are getting with her. I loved it whenever someone read to me as a kid.

persona: I don't like sports. I am fat. I like battered and fried vegetables.
I don't have a favorite color.
I'm an atheist. I'm a woman. I like the color blue.
I watch cricket. I watch olympic potato throwing. I watch videos on youtube.
I use facebook quite often. I like facebook.
I have never been to Atlantic City but I would really like to.
dialogue: So did you find any more crazy sports on youtube?
Oh, No. I love spending hours on youtube, But the only sport I watch is cricket. What sport do you recommend to people who aren't usually into it?

Thank you for asking. My favorite sport is running. I like doing it, And watching it sometimes too. I learn a lot watching pro runners. Wonder if Atlantic City has any good 5k or 10k runs. I travel for those sometimes.

Oh, Wow. I think I stray from such things because of my weight. I find it uncomfortable watching such fit people perform olympic feats like that. Cricket is much easier to swallow. Though, I might be interested in watching one of those just to visit Atlantic City.

I hear you on body image stuff, And sometimes I have perception issues. It's good to check with a friend, Partner. The best runs are through the forest, Although maybe I'd consider a busy place like Atlantic City. With the right company!

Aww, Thanks for understanding. And yeah, That'd be a great time. Though, A walk through a forest might be nice. I think the exploratory nature of it would make it a better motivator. Though I much prefer vegetables, Maybe you could teach me some dieting tips as well. I'm sure your version of "vegetarian" is better for the body.

I find that if I am patient and allow mistakes sometimes, It helps me keep on track better. Allowing mistakes within a range, Yeah, Perfectionism can take over sometimes. Although not for the reasons people think. Simple food is good. Love chia seeds!

That's really good advice! When I used to diet, Messing up a streak would really kill me inside. And that would make me relapse into really unhealthy foods. I think allowing myself room for error is a good idea. And yeah, I think simple might be good. Can chia seeds and such really fill you up, Though?

I have been eating them for many years. Omega 3 nutrients, Which you find in fish oil too, But this is a natural source. Also, The best benefit is fiber. They fill you up. 1 teaspoon needs 4 ounces water to soak them, Because they get big. You soak them first. Eat them daily here! Do you have a fave?

Oh, Really? I do take Omega 3 vitamins, When I remember! So, That does sound good. Oh, I didn't know that they expand! That seems much more sensible than little seeds. Well, I mostly eat lots of potatoes. Which, I know isn't the healthiest, But it does leave me satisfied. Maybe I cantaper down, And slowly work down my portions with other foods like that. I do enjoy cashews and nuts and such a lot too. I know they're fatty, But of a healthier variety.
Cashews are a fave! And I can eat too much mashed potatoes, If they have a big helping at a dinner. Butter too.

Hahaha, You don't have to tell me! I'm thinking I may try to work in more shakes. Perhaps soy and oats, With some sort of supplement powder. Is that a good way of getting in nutrients without too much calories?

persona: I am new here. I have a family.
I like Mickey Mouse. I have been to Disneyland. I am planning another trip to Disneyland. I like to read.
I have brown hair. I work on a maternity ward. I work the day shift. I am only permitted to wear scrubs to work.
Because I am older, I prefer warmer clothes than scrubs.
dialogue: I found some thermal scrubs that you might be interested in to help keep you warmer at the hospital!
Wow, That's great! I did not even know they made those. Do you think they'll be as warm as your leggings?
Yeah I tend to wear thinner leggings but these are much thicker. I ordered them online thinking they would be comfortable but I just sweat in them!
Oh that's the worst. Where is your favorite place to shop online?
Usually I just do a search online and go to the website of the company. But if I don't feel like sorting through websites then I go to amazon. They have a ton of choices.
That's true. Amazon is always full of choices. Have you tried any of their bath soaks to relax after work?
No I haven't, But i have gotten a ton of rock albums on there. Did you know they have a big selection of vinyl records.
I didn't know that. That's really cool. I have a big vinyl collection from my parents. They loved the Rolling Stones. I like them also. What's your favorite?
I would have to say The Eagles. They have always been my favorite. I know I'm younger but I love the old classic rock bands.
The Eagles are great! Do you have a favorite song of theirs?
I hate to sound cliche but Hotel California is my all time favorite. What's your favorite band?
Haha, That's not too cliche. A ton of people love that song. My favorite band is in the country genre. I really like Travis Tritt.

persona: I listen to death metal.
I am a swim coach for my local pool. I like to stay active.

I'm from india. I like indian cuisine and holidays. My favorite indian food is broccoli and tofu in garlic sauce, chicken tikka masala. I usually marinate my broccoli and tofu in garlic sauce dish. I enjoy the beach.
I have a traditional mother. I am free spirited.
Chicken tikka masala is one of my favorite foods. I like food that isn't too spicy. I make naan at my home at least once a week.
dialogue: My sister just came into town, Would you mind if she joined me and my husband for dinner at your place on Friday?
No, Not at all! I will make sure to make an extra plate for her. Where is she coming into town from?
She lives in Chicago. She's coming into town for business but I would love for her to have some fun while she's here too. She's 5 years older than I.
That is so exciting! How long is she going to be in town? How long has it been since you have last seen each other?
She's going to be in town for three weeks. I haven't seen her in almost five years. Do you have any siblings?

Wow, Five years is a long time! I have two younger sisters and I see them fairly often. They live nearby and we do family dinners every once in a while. What kinds of things do you want to show her while she is in town?

Oh that's great! I have three older brothers, Also. We're all spread out throughout the country so we don't get to see each other often but when we do it's great. I'd love to show her some of the museums in town. Or maybe catch a show! Do you have any suggestions? Ry.

My suggestion would have been one of the museums. I hear there is a great new art exhibit. That could be a lot of fun to bring her to. What kinds of shows would she be interested in? I can ask around to see if anyone I know has any that they particularly enjoyed.
Would you like to join us at the art exhibit? I think any kind of show would be fine... She enjoys doing most anything! It would be a lot of fun if you were to join us.
Thanks so much for the invite. I would love to come, But I don't want to intrude on any family time. Maybe I could bring my sisters and we can make it a whole family event?
That would be so much fun! Maybe we could go to a spa too? Make it a real sisters day!
That would be quite a day. I haven't been to a spa in forever. When was the last time you went to one? Is there one nearby you know of?

persona: I am a college language student. I speak spanish and am going to learn french. I only study languages.
My favorite word in spanish is trabajo.
I like camaros and bumble bee from transformers.
My dad has a mustang.
dialogue: I'm about to pick between Ivy League schools. Harvard, Yale or Princeton.
That's awesome. Which one are you leaning towards?
I haven't decided yet! I'm researching which ones will have the best PT program. What did you look for when you were picking a college?
I looked into each of the academic programs as well as if they had a great band department. If one didn't have my degree plan, I put them in the discard pile.
That's a great idea, To look at extracurriculars. Are you in the band now? What do you play?
I am in the band. I play the french horn during concert season and the mellophone during marching.
I used to play the flute before I started track and didn't have time for band anymore. I miss doing music.
Are you planning on track in college?
I'll keep running as a hobby I think, But I don't want to join a team. I want to focus all on my grades. Any study tips from someone already in college?
Try to stay focused. Plan out time for studying and time to relax. Join tutoring groups if you have problems.
That's great advice. How are your language classes going lately? C'est bien? I think that's right.

Muy bien. I am already advancing faster than I thought. I am looking forward to learning more about the cultures of Spanish and French when I get to that class. We had a CInco de Mayo party, It was a blast.

persona: I own a yacht. I rent my yacht out to AirBnB. I like to sail on my yacht.
I travel around the world. I like tea. I love food.
I don't know many people.
I am 23 years old. I have a close relationship with my family and I like the outdoors.
I've been on the ocean since I was a child.
I like to eat out.
dialogue: Where are some of the places that you've sailed to?
Too many to name! But my favorites have been Spain, Hawaii, And Australia. Have you traveled to any of those before, Or only stayed in your hometown?
I have not traveled due to my anxiety. Do you have any advice on overcoming this?
Maybe you could try small trips first and eventually work up to traveling far from home. How far is the city from your home? You could take a few trips there and see if it's too stressful for you.
It is not too far from my house. Maybe you can come visit with your family and help tend to the garden.
That would be delightful! I'd love to grow some strawberries there if you have any room.
I do. I use them to make strawberry tea. You would love it.
That sounds delicious. Do you cook a lot of meals with food from your garden too?
As many as I can. I bring the leftovers to work.
That's smart - I spend a lot of money at restaurants these days, Maybe I should start cooking for myself too. What's your favorite meal to make?

persona: I enjoy going to the park. I'm searching for a new job. I am a surgeon. I have a 12 year old daughter.
I live in North Carolina.
I have a daughter that loves grilled meat. We do not work on the weekends.
My daughter struggles with math.
I would like to bring something to dinner.
dialogue: How did your job interviews go?

Two of them went well. One hospital where I interviewed is especially promising. They have a very up-to-date surgical ward and give family time off, So I'd have weekends free if you ever want to invite us over to try that grill!

That would be great. I'm sure your daughter would love it! It sounds like you already know which hospital you want to get a job at. Maybe while you're at the barbecue; I can help your daughter with her studies in math?

That would be amazing of you. You'd really be giving me a day off. I could use it after those interviews! What can I bring to go with the meat you grill? I have a few nice wines that would go well with meat, Or I make a mean batch of brownies.
Brownies sound lovely! I don't really need much, So desserts sound great. I have a freezer full of meats, So no worries there! What kind of desserts do you think you could bring?
I can bring some ice cream to go with the brownies. I also heard you can grill pound cake. Want me to bring some to try that on your grill too?
That would be great! Brownies with ice cream on is one of my favorites. Since your daughter struggles with math, Is she failing or does she have a tutor?
She isn't failing, But I haven't hired a tutor. I usually work through problems with her on weekends, Because I'm so busy during the week with work. Do you think a tutor would be a good idea?

I think a tutor would be great. It would probably be better than me trying to help. I'm not very good at teaching people stuff, But doesn't mean it's not worth the try. They would be more likely to get her to understand the methods on how to get to the answer. Probably, Show her easier ways to do it, Too.

Sometimes I feel bad that I can't help her more. You would think a surgeon would be better with math, But it's harder to explain the concepts than to do it in my head. You would probably be better at it than I am. Are you good at Algebra? That's what she's started lately.

Algebra is pretty simple to understand if it's taught to you correctly. It gets confusing when they start mixing the letters with the numbers. I'm sure you do just fine with trying to teach her. Is it harder to teach her the concepts since it's just a message relayed fast in your brain? It does take a lot of math to be a surgeon, Doesn't it?

It took a lot of math classes to my Bachelor's Degree in Chemistry before I went to medical school. It sounds silly, But Algebra has become so automatic for my mind that it's hard to break it down into simpler steps. Maybe if I had more time, I'd be better at it. Did you take many math classes?

persona: I hate the color orange. I think fashion is dumb.
I don't go to the gym.
I work in a bookstore. My mother is disappointed. My parents kicked me out of my house. My parents disapprove of my job. I have a chemistry degree.
My dog is very agile. I spend a lot of time with my dog. I don't have time for dating. I travel to canine competitions with my dog.
I participate in a competitive team sport. I travel to participate in sports competitions.
dialogue: I have to get the brakes on my new car repaired after the accident. Any news about the bookstore?
Some new books just arrived that I'm eager to check into. What happened with the accident?

I got rear-ended leaving a parking lot the other day. It wasn't a bad accident and there was no obvious damage, But unfortunately my brakes have been a little out of whack ever since. I'm so annoyed but it could have been much worse. I just figured I would let you know, But we don't need to get too much into it! Do you usually end up buying a lot of books from the store you work at? What kinds of new ones are you excited about?
I am glad you are ok. Get those brakes fixed ASAP. I don't get to buy books for the bookstore but I get to read and review them. I love a good thriller book. How's your job at the restaurant going?

That's actually a pretty good perk! Do you read them so you can share your recommendations with customers? The restaurant has been somewhat slow this week, But I expect things to pick up over the weekend since we have a lot of good reservations already!

I know right!? That's the main reason I took the job. I love telling people what books are engaging or informative or even boring. I have a little section for my books of the week. Well, I would expect to be busy over the weekend for sure if people are already booking reservations. Hopefully you're not slammed out of control.

Being totally slammed isn't the worst thing in the world! I like to keep busy and to make good tips, But it can be exhausting for sure. How long have you been working at your current job? Is it something you see yourself doing long term?

Well I recently just stumbled upon it. After college and my parents kicking me out I needed to find work. What a better job than turning your hobby and love of reading into a paycheck. I get the idea of being slammed being a good thing. I love it when the store has something going on and we are just slammed with people. I hope I can open my own bookstore one day. I found my passion. What about you and the restaurant? Do you want to be there long-term?

persona: I have a German Shepard called luke and a pit bull called duke.
I prefer mustang cars. I own two vintage mustang cars.
I work as a construction worker. It is my day off. I have a decent wage from my job.
I have dogs.
I have a job. I don't usually work on the weekends.
dialogue: Are you free to meet at the dog park on Sunday afternoon? My grandchildren just adopted a small puppy. Is it okay to bring him to the dog park as well?
A small puppy! That is exciting news. My dogs are great with puppies. I'd be happy to meet on Sunday. What time do you want to meet?
Would after lunch be okay for you? I'm working on Sunday until 1 pm. And I would need time to go pick up the puppy.
That would be great for me. Since you're working, Do you want to meet up for food first?
That sounds like a good plan. What kind of food do you like?
Best Pizza is near the park. We can stop there for a quick slice?
That works well for me. I like pizza! What toppings are your favorite?
I'm a traditionalist. Plain pies for me. Maybe once in a while I'.
Plain cheese is good. I'm one of those weirdos who puts pineapple on their pizza. Hope we can still be friends lol.
Sorry, Hit send too soon last time. I actually do like pineapple! With black olives. Want to do that?
We can do that, Sure! We can split a pie and take home what's not finished.
That sounds perfect. So let's plan for 2?

persona: I like to have TV in the background.
I would like to work from home.
I have a hearing disability.
I have four cats and one puppy. I want another pet.
I may get an exotic bird. I have not looked into specifics of having a bird.
dialogue: Other then thinking of adopting a bird, How are your four cats and puppy doing? If you do end up working from home like you want, You will get to spend a lot of time with them.
Yes, My pets are doing very well! Working from home would be amazing! How are your pets>.
I don't have any pets remember! I'm still thinking about adopting but I'm not ready to commit yet! Do your pets take up a lot of your time?
That's right, I thought by this time--you had adopted your pet already! Have you decided on a pet yet? Yes they keep me very busy!
I think I definitely want a dog but want to make sure I'm ready for the responsibility before I adopt! I hope I can find a dog that will go on runs with me!
Oh that would be so fun! Do you enjoy running alot?
Yes! Running is my favorite kind of exercise outside of the gym. I love being outdoors!
Oh wow, I need to start running again! What other things do you enjoy doing outdoors?
I love going to the lake, Hopefully I'll adopt a dog that loves water as much as I do! Do you like being outdoors?
That does sound nice as well! I actually like being inside! I like reading books and playing games.
Very cool! Do you have a favorite book? I don't read much.
Yes, I love reading the Bible actually! It is really encouraging! Reading is fun to me.

persona: I like hiking and watching the sunset.
I turned 18 yesterday. I just got a pet betta fish as a birthday present from my parents.
My favorite color is orange.
My boyfriend broke up with me two months ago. I feel sad about my breakup. My boyfriend left me suddenly and he is weird.
I will be attending college.
dialogue: What do you plan to study in college?
I've been thinking about becoming a Social Worker. I would love to work with children and families.
I really appreciate the social workers who help me and my foster parents. They're all really good people. Do you think it would be difficult seeing people having a hard time like that?

That is great to hear about your experience. It isn't always so positive, And that is one of the main reasons I am drawn to it. I want to create that positive space in such a trying time. It will definitely be a challenge to separate emotions. Do you keep in touch with any Social Workers from your past?

Not really; they have a heavy caseload so they're usually very busy with the kids and families they're working with now. I think with work like that, It would be super helpful to have a lot of fun hobbies to do in your off time like video games or meeting up with friends.
That's is a great suggestion! Do you have any favorite hobbies that help you escape or relax?

Well I don't get to go out much with transportation and money being an issue, But I do really like to cook. It's not much of an escape but I get to be creative and then, Best part, I get to eat whatever I made!
That is the perfect hobby, And creativity is so fulfilling. Do you have a favorite dish that you make?
It's a little boring but I like spaghetti. I guess it's a comfort meal. What's your favorite food?
I'm not that great of a cook, But I am actually making spaghetti tonight. I'm all about the comfort foods since the breakup.
Yeah, How are you doing with that? Are you over that jerk yet?
I'm getting there. It just seemed so sudden and out of nowhere, But now that time has passed, I realize that there were signs. Like I said, He was weird. Lol.

persona: I know an Italian restaurant that needs servers.
I like gymnastics. I like team sports.
I like Italian food. I like garlic bread. I eat a lot of carbohydrates. I'm on a new cardio regimen.
I work out.
I don't like the Yankees. The team I love is doing pretty well so far this year.
I didn't play many team sports as a child. Team sports help you learn about yourself.
dialogue: My hamstring is really starting to bother me.
While working out I have hurt my hamstring too. Have you been using ice?
Yes but the ice doesn't seem to be helping too much. Do you have any other types of favorite food?
I really love pasta. Especially chicken alfredo.
I like a good chicken alfredo too. Extra cheesy is the best. Do you have any suggestions on good stretches to avoid injuring your hamstring?
I think lunges will help you!
When my hamstring is feeling better I will have to incorporate lunges into my routine.
I think that is a great idea! You can even try it now and it will probably help.
I think when I can move better I will do a couple of lunges. Do you like mushrooms they are really great sauteed in a bowl of homemade pasta.

persona: I visited Alaska not that long ago. I love Alaska.
I do stunt work. I was a double in the movie Cliffhanger 2. I have a day job. I had a small part in Cliffhanger 2.
I read a lot about meditation and religions. I eat kosher food. I was raised Christian.
I have a strong body. I like HIIT training.
dialogue: The weather up here is finally warming up, I did my yoga on the porch this morning.
That's awesome! Nothing beats doing yoga outdoors! What is your favorite time of day to do yoga?
My favorite time is the morning it helps me focus and stretches my body to get me ready for the day. What is HIIT training?

My favorite time of day to exercise is in the morning also. I call it 30 before 7:30 because I try to get in at least 30 minutes of HIIT before then. HiIT is High Intensity Interval Training. It is short bursts of working out as hard as you can, Followed by short periods of resting. Alternating the two back and forth. It'll wake you up first thing in the morning for sure! Have you ever tried anything like that?
Yes I have. It is a pretty effective work. I was wondering what was your day job?
I'm an EMT during the day. It's tough work but definitely rewarding. And requires the fitness. What about yourself?

I am not working at the moment. I am focusing on my spirituality full time. Being here in Alaska closer to nature awakens feelings and desires to be closer to nature and the beyond. Have you ever had a spiritual awakening?

Wow that is amazing! I did actually, Almost a year ago I was introduced to Abraham Hicks, And I've worked with a few spiritual coaches since then. I'm always studying the law of attraction. Do you have any books or spiritual guides you'd recommend me looking into?
The power of now, The spiritual guide which disentangles the soul and the book of joy are pretty good reads.
That's great! Have you read The Secret?
No I have heard of it. Is it a good read?
It is! It's what many of the spiritual leaders base their teachings upon. It's kind of the holy grail of spirituality.

persona: I go to basketball practice.
I have an older sister. I am going to hear Travis Scott.
My mother is a dentist and volunteers at a clinic. My mother is my best friend.
I've started in a diner part time.
My older sister is going to learn how to play piano.
I live three blocks' distance from the homeless shelter. My sister leaves a three-block distance from the homeless shelter, too.
dialogue: What sort of volunteering does your mother do?
My mother volunteers at medical clinic helping those who cannot or do not have medical insurance. It is mostly mothers and children who go there. How is it like volunteering for the homeless?
That's great. It feels good when we help people. I have volunteered homeless children with food and studies. How is your part time going on at diner?

That is amazing. I occasionally go with my mother to help out, It such a satisfying experience to help those who need it. My job is going well thankyou, Just sometimes people can be so rude, I don't get it.
Sorry to hear about it. Things sometimes don't turn out that way we like. That's is ok, Tomorrow will be better, Hopefully.
Yes that is a great way to think. How is your piano playing going? That is a great musical instrument to play, Very impressive.
Great actually, I'm working on making some new musical piece. So you like Travis Scott?
Oh wow that amazing. Do you create your own music? Yes i love travis Scott his music is great.

I try to make it. I love playing and listening to music. In fact I like Travis Scott too. I always listen to music while travelling. Travelling is my most favorite thing to do actually. Recently I have been to Italy. Such a beautiful country I must say. Do you like travelling?
You sure are talented. Yeah music is a wonderful thing, I would like to go to one of his concerts. Omg Italy that is my dream to go there. How long was you there for?
Yeah such a dreamy place it is. I stayed there for a week. Travelled in beautiful city of Rome. You must visit Italy when you get a chance. How is your sister doing?
Italy is defiantly on my list of places i would like to travel too. And my sister is starting to get better at playing thank you for asking.

persona: I have horses. I  have some chili.
I live in Kentucky on a horse ranch. I love riding. I have 3 Aabian horses named Siegfried, Beowulf, and Hector.
I live in Kentucky, on a horse ranch. I have horses.
I fell in love with horses as a kid and have maintained my passion for them.
I have three horses that I used to rent a stable for before I bought a farm to house them at.
dialogue: Do you have any recommendations for farms near me that I could get started at?
I was out riding my horses today and I was thinking about you. Have you had a chance to learn how to ride yet?

No I haven't. I really wanted to but then we decided to have another baby and I just thought it will be better if I wait until after delivery. I guess I will be learning with the kids. Hopefully we can own horses one day.
Horses are amazing with kids! You definitely want to start them off young and they will fall in love!
I agree. It has been my dream to ride horses since I was a kid. I can't wait for all of us to learn more about them. Hopefully I can come to you for advice. How are your horses doing?
My horses are doing great, Thanks! I actually give riding lessons on my ranch, I would love for your family to come out to meet us.
That would be a great way to start! We will definitely plan a trip to Kentucky. And we can learn how to take care of horses from the master! Is it very hard to take care of them and manage the farm?
For sure, Taking care of horses is a lot of work but it is very rewarding! Have you even been to a horse farm before?
I did but only during a school field trip. My parents were always to busy with work to take us and then when I grew up, My life got busy.
I wonder if there are many places to ride horses in Georgia?
I started researching our area and there are couple of farms not too far away. I would love to buy land one day and own a couple of horses myself. What other animals do you have on your farm?
We are mainly a horse farm, But we have a couple of goats and a big fat pig.

persona: I do not hike. I hate hiking.
I only have time for the gym. I need a good workout and would like a change of scenery.
I do not like dogs. I'm not sure if I'm ready for the long-term responsibility of a pet. I'm more open to getting a dog as a pet than a parrot.
dialogue: I haven't worked out yet today if you'd like to try that gym together!
I haven't hit the gym yet today either. That sounds like a good plan. Do you want one that offers classes?
Yes, I do. I like classes because I like working out with other people, And my parrots.
I have never been to a gym with someone and their parrot. This will be interesting. Do you like water aerobics?
Parrots are friendlier than so many other animals, Like dogs. I have tried it before. I actually prefer going out on hikes in the nearby mountains to spending time in the pool doing water aerobics.

Outdoors is always nice. I bet your parrot wouldn't like the pools anyways. I am a little afraid of committing to a pet. I think I would do better with a dog than a parrot but I need more research before I make that desicion.
Why don't you like to hike? I understand your fear of commitment. Dogs can be great friends, But parrots are simply my preference.

I just like the gym better because of the air conditioning. I don't like to be too hot. I bet a parrot is a good pet. I just like dogs the best out of all the pet options. How long have you had your parrot?
I like the loyalty of the parrot. It is a gym buddy who can lift heavy and spot you, Too. I have had my parrot for 6 years now.
Wow 6 years. Do you take your parrot to other places too?
Yes I can take him outdoors to the park or on hikes. I am not afraid of him flying away and leaving me. I trust him. I got him shortly after my wife passed away.
What a good friend and pet. What is his name? I can't believe he is that loyal that he won't fly away.

persona: My father had cancer.
I like to sew but haven't had time for it recently. I'm looking into an embroidery project.
I am from New York.
I went to school at Yale. I plant to go to business school. School is important to me.
I've been researching business schools lately.
I like the south because it's warm.
I love crazy quits. I'd like to see some historic quilts in the textile museum.
dialogue: I think my new sewing machine has brought me superpowers! I've been whipping out perfect items ever since I powered the baby up. Challenge me?
I have never used a sewing machine!
Oh my you should really use one. It cuts the work of sewing in half. Have you picked a school in the south you would like to attend?
I have heard that! What kind of sewing machine do you use? And no I have not yet.
I like swinger sewing machines the brand has been around a long time and can be trusted for the quality of the machine. Which state in the south do you enjoy best. I really am partial to Georgia.
I love Florida. What do you like about Georgia?
The weather the people and the food. I really enjoy southern hospitality. What is it you like about Florida?
I am a big Disney fan.
I have been to Disney world and I can see being in florida would make that happen for a big disney fan like yourself.
How many times have you been there?
I have only been once. How many times have you been to Disney World?
I have been there at least 30 times.

persona: I pump gas.
I like movies. I am scared of clowns.
I am single.
I am adopted, my parents are old.
I like bugs. I am afraid of apathy. I am afraid of Republicans.
I trap wolf spiders in a cup at the station. I let wolf spiders free outside after I trap them.
My favorite movie of all time is Fargo.
dialogue: I have thought about what you said about the spiders maybe saving you some day and I have captured and released my first spider.
That's good, I'm proud of you, You never know what each member of the ecosystem can do for us.
I don't know much about that. What are some of the benefits of spiders to the ecosystem?
They eat a lot of insects that could impact farming, They eat the type of bugs that would get on budding plants and the like.
That's a great benefit. I would hope spiders kill cockroaches and silverfish too! How has work been going at the station?
It's been going okay, I had this one guy who came up, Asked for a full tank and then left to go into the store. He was gone for nearly 10 minutes even after I finished pumping his gas.
Should feed him to the spiders when he gets back! Or maybe the Lions if you go back to the circus.
Ha, Ha! That's a good idea. Let the clowns and the lions deal with him. Maybe he'll be as freaked about them as I am. Have you heard from your aunt? Is she well?
I saw her last week. We never lost contact after she helped me escape. Thanks for asking. I am lucky to have her. Especially when there are bugs around because she gets rid of them for me.
That's good. I love it when, In the early days of spring, I start finding ladybugs around my house. Its a good sign of the changing of the seasons. It'll be voting season soon.
I learned those aren't actually lady bugs. They're beetles, An infestation. Just like... Silverfish. Ew. I cannot vote so I don't know much about voting season.
Ha, Sorry for bringing up bugs so much. I watched Fargo again recently, Did you watch any movies?

persona: I do not play chess.
I like to watch nascar. My dad was a nascar driver.
I work for the US Postal Service.
I am married. I have a german shepard named Barnby.
My favorite color is grey.
I am going on vacation to Daytona beach soon. I am married.
dialogue: I've spoken to the golf club and they will show the race on the big screen. My tournament starts at 6. 30pm. Do you want to come?
I believe I'm open for that date so absolutely. Are you sure it won't mess with your plans? I don't suppose the club allows pets?

Absolutely not, If you're interested in seeing what the game is like, It will give you a chance front and center. I wish I could take my dogs everywhere but no they don't allow pets. I probably will just get a friend to look after them. Sometimes I wish I had a mate to share my life with. What is married life like?
I love it. My wife is my world. She has been there for me in everything. Just keep your heads up. The right person will come along. Hopefully they will love dogs also!

Aww that warms my heart. I want that. Sometimes I think that people worry about age and think it's too late but you're right, It happens when you least expect it. I'll try to remember that. Do you and your wife have children together?

Yes! We have 3 children. It works out great because they love Barnby and look out for him. It has its ups and downs, But there is love always. How much time do you have to socialize? I know banking can be stressful. Add taking care of two pets and you have a full schedule.

Sound like you have your hands full. I usually use my weekends to socialize, Going out with friends or planig short trips. I just took off for vacation actually and went to the grand canyon. I had always wanted to see it.
I have been there and it is beautiful. I love going to places that take my breath away. I hope that Daytona will do that for me when I get there. I plan on touring the track when I get there.
It was very breath taking. Will you be taking your family with you?
Yes I will. We will leave Barnby with my sister till we get back. My family and I will meet our tour guide there the day after we arrive and will get a full tour of Daytona Speedway. I am excited.
I think you're goig to love it. I've been and it took about 4 hours to finish the tour. Are you a racing fan?
Oh yes. I have been to Talladega several times. But this will be my first trip to Daytona. I am ready and willing!!!!.

persona: I am a finance graduate from Yale.
I like beer.
I have friends who help.
I am good at math.
dialogue: I may have met some interesting people in Florida.
Very cool! What are they like?
They are so much more laid back than I am used to. Maybe its all the beaches and sun.
I love spending time in Miami whenever I can, And I totally get what you're talking about. How far are you from Miami, Btw?
Probably about an hour away. I am considering getting a boat and spending my retirement on the sea, What do you think?
That sounds like an adventure! Are you thinking of going power or sail?
Power all the way. I think I am too old now to learn a new skill like sailing. Have you ever sailed before?
Oh yeah, I was on the sailing team at Yale. I'm thinking about getting a 30-40 foot sailboat at some point in the near future.

persona: I go to the gym and lot. I like using rowing machines and the treadmill. I am very disciplined.
I like going to the city. I have two dogs.
I like punk rock. I'd like to learn how to play an instrument.
I love punk rock.
I visit the city. I see concerts.
I want to go to Carnegie Hall. I don't like classical music.
dialogue: My dad gave me the violin and it is in perfect condition.
Oh that's great! Are you going to hold onto it for special performances or play it as your everyday instrument?

I haven't decided yet. Dad, Being the virtuoso he was, Played it every few days. I got my love of music from him. I might follow in his footsteps and continue playing it. But it's so beautiful I'm unsure.
I can understand that. I'd be nervous with something beautiful and expensive. If I learn an instrument, I'm getting something cheap online to start so I don't mess it up.

I know, Right? Honestly part of me feels like I should mount the violin in a clear case and hang it on my wall of my tiny music room I have in my apartment. But my dad did love playing it so much. Getting something cheap online is a great idea. What would you say is the most prominent instrument in punk?
Definitely guitar, Though bass comes in a strong second. I think bass might be easier to learn because it has fewer strings.

Huh, Interesting, Well I've played string instruments a lot during my life. But I'm so use to using them for classical purposes the idea of switching genres kinda scares me because what if I make a fool of myself? Classical is one thing, Punk or any other genre is another.

I don't listen to a lot of classical, But I think it would lend itself well to a lot of different styles right? Because it's so varied with tempo and feel. But I guess classical music also has a lot more "rules" than something like punk.

Yeah it does. If you mess up something like Mozart or Beethoven by even a note some teachers jump down your throat. My dad was always gentle with me regarding it but I had a piano teacher who was very fond of her ruler, Lets say. When I teach, I'm always very gentle with my students. I wonder if I'd still be respected as a teacher if I did punk on the weekends, Ha, Ha.
I think your students would respect you, Can't say for sure about those former teachers!
Ha, Ha! Very true. Well, It's not like I'm doing anything on my weekends anyway so it'd be a good place to start. What's your favorite punk band? What would you recommend to a beginner?
The Ramones are pretty classic punk, Or The Clash but the genre has evolved a lot since they started out in the 70s.

persona: I take dance lessons every week. I like dancing to live music.
I have visited Santa Monica when I was young in 1989. I love the beach.
I listened to New Kids on the Block when I was younger.
I like board games. I have brothers.
I work the night shift at a retail food store.
I listen to a podcast.
dialogue: That podcast was great, Thanks for the recommendation! When is your next dance class? Could I come?
I have a salsa class this week, It's my favorite. Have you ever tried?
I know a little about it but I am very motivated to learn about tango. Do you think it would help me to learn tango?
Of course, I would suggest learning as many different dances as possible. They are literally all fun!
Maybe I am too focused on learning about tango that I dismiss the other type of dances... I think I will you with you, At what hour is your dance class?
My classes are all at night, Usually 8PM. In my last class, We listened to New Kids on the Block which was my favorite band when I was young.
8 PM is perfect for me, I was not a fan of NKOTB when I was young, But I think now that they were very influential. What is the music group today that ressemble them the most?
They were definitely influential towards all those late 90's boy bands like NSYNC and the Backstreet Boys!
Do you think the Korean groups that we see now were influenced by them?
I think so. Even the KPop groups have a very american sound because they know that's what sells.
Do you still listen to them or listen to these new groups? The kids that I teach to don't have any idea about them.

persona: I spent time in Manhatztan when I was younger. I used to walk a lot.
I work in finance. I graduated from Yale in 2011. I am planning to go to business school.
I own a BMW. I have bought a new car.
I am dating a nurse.
dialogue: What sort of job do you do and where do you work?
I am a broker working in upper Manhatan. I love my job because it's fast pace and I get to negotiate deals and the money certainly doesn't hurt. Are you happy in your current career?

I don't love my job and it definitely doesn't pay very well. I don't have any qualifications for anything else, Though. It's frustrating. I want to go back to school I think. Maybe we can go to business school together lol.

I'm sorry to hear that. It is certainly never too late for change. Maybe this is your opportunity to make your dreams come true. What is something you've always wanted to do? I know I'm always learning something new and going to school wouldn't be a bad idea.
I think I want to go back to school to be a nurse. I like helping people and get to do that in my current job, But would like to make more of an impact. I'm not the biggest fan of needles though...

Nurses work very hard and help a lot of people. Good luck with your endevours. I abosolutely hate needles and have avoided them every since childhood. I freak out! Do you have to administer needles at your job?
Not currently and thank goodness for that. I work more with bathing the people I help and feeding them. I guess if I can handle cleaning up elderly "accidents", I can learn to use needles.
I would say so for sure! I'm glad you're helping to enrich others lives. You said you wanted a new car, What kind of car do you want?
Ideally, I'd love a car that is good for the environment. I don't know if I'll ever be able to afford one in this lifetime, But that would be my #1 choice. Do you like your BMW?

Telsa's are so good for that. I love their sleek style too. Very innovative. I don't have one yet but I'm thinking about gettinng one. Right now I have a G-Wagon, It's my dream car. It sits very high up. Bmw are okay too I just never bought one. Do you know which car you would get that's good for the enviornment?
I don't know much about brands that are good for the environment. I know a little bit about Tesla, But I also know they're very expensive. Maybe I.
They are really expensive. I've seen some that were used but still in great condition but better priced. My husband work in sales and he trades them all the time.

persona: I have a new pet fish named Nemo. My fish is a boy. My fish is orange and black. I have an orange aquarium for my new fish Nemo. I have two fish other than Nemo. Nemo is my oldest fish. I think it would be funny to play music for my fish.
I like museums. I have an ex.
I love the color orange. I like to eat oranges.
I am 18 years old.
dialogue: I found a playlist of music that is especially suited to playing music for fish!
Oh my god, That's amazing! What kind of music is on the playlist?
Mainly classical music, They like smooth calm stuff.
That makes sense. I'm sure Nemo will love it! Have you ever owned any fish?
I have, But not anything big. I had a goldfish when I was younger and now I mainly have betta fish.
I figured you would have had a goldfish since you like the color orange so much!
I do! It's such a nice color, It's also why I like bettas so much they're almost universally a mix of bright and dark colors. I love how orange just picks up my mood.
I have always like orange too. It can be such a bold color, I love the statement it makes.
Same with the fruit right? Do you eat oranges for breakfast?
I do eat oranges regularly, They are delicious. I prefer apples and peaches, But I'll never turn down a good orange!
One of the best things to do in the fall is going apple picking. We could go together, Pick some apples, Look at all the nice fall colors and then go back to yours and hang with nemo and make cider.
Sounds perfect! Maybe a quick stop by a museum on our way too!

persona: I play basketball.
My favorite rapper is Travis Scott.
My mom is a dentist.
I am unemployed. I am applying for jobs at restaurants.
I love to read.
I am having an interview for a job on Friday.
I like to go out to lunch.
I like to dance to Travis Scott.
dialogue: I just heard that Travis Scott is going on tour. I'm going to look for tickets. Do you want to go with me?
OmG of course! That would be so amazing! When is he going to be in town?
July 9th and 10th. How amazing is that?
Pretty awesome. I will make sure I don't have to work those days if I get the job. How's work going for you? Will they let you off for a concert?
They should as long as I give them plenty of notice. And I would hope two months is plenty of notice. LOL. The bookstore is keeping me pretty busy.
That's good. I prefer to be busy, It's better than ending up bored.
Absolutely. Where is your interview at?

Les Francois. I'm psyched and also nervous. Though I did get another call for an interview at Mama Lucia's Ristorante. That'll be next week so if the interview on Friday doesn't work out I have something else coming up too.
That's fantastic. What position are you interviewing for?
Assistant manager. I have the bare minimum experience but they called so I hope it goes well.
I am sure it will. You seem very outgoing and professional. You got it, I am claiming it for you.
Thank you! At least one of us is confident lol.

persona: I am a high school student and I just won Homecoming Queen.
I do track and field in school. I want to start racing for charity. I enjoy running, and hope to run a 5k this year.
I listen to classical music while doing homework. I am currently getting straight A's.
I want to save my money for college. I do not have a tractor. I want to be a physical therapist.
I am competing in a charity race.
dialogue: Have you saved up enough money for college yet?
I have but i have also been offered some scholarships so will use my money to buy the things i need for college instead.
That's a good plan. It might even be worth opening up some sort of investment account to put away the excess money.
Yes that is a great plan i shall defiantly look into that. How was pole dancing?
Same as always, Which is to say, A total blast! I did a routine to Debussy's Prelude to the Afternoon of a Fawn.
Omg that sounds like a blast. How did your parent take it that pole dancing was your job?
They were pretty skeptical until they saw how well my sister and I were able to support ourselves with it!
They are very understanding parents. But whatever pays the bills then so be it. Have you been able to buy your own tractor yet?
Hahaha I'm able to, But that doesn't mean that I have. Maybe when I finally buy a farm and retire lol.
Oh that would be a great way to retire. You need to keep your tractor dreams alive, They even do tractor rally's they are a ton of fun.
Yes, Those are intense! I'd love to participate someday. Maybe you can cheer me on!
I would love to cheer you on. It is such an exhilarating experience you would love it.

persona: I have a demanding job in insurance.
My father served 10 years in the army. My mom is no longer alive.
I play softball as a hobby.
dialogue: I aced my French quiz!
That's awesome! What's the next language you are planning to learn?

I haven't really thought that far ahead yet! I really want to get fluent in French first. I guess if I had to choose, Italian would be the most natural progression from here though. Do you speak any other languages?
That's nice to hear! I actually don't know any other languages other than english. My work doesn't give time to learn new things.
That's totally fair. It is a real commitment to learn a new language, Especially when you have a full time job. If you had the time, What language do you think you would want to learn the most?
I actually want to learn French. I always love the way they speak. Im sure i don't understand anything, But it sounds cool.
It is a beautiful language, And I am really enjoying learning it. I would love to visit Paris one day. Have you ever been?
Yes, I actually went to Paris once. But it was so long ago. My mom took me there when i was in high-school.
It's nice that she took you there! What did you do while you were there? Was it just the two of you?
Yes, My dad had his duties, So it was just us. We went to the popular places and the most amazing thing is the Eiffel Tower. We actually spend the whole day there.
Oh, So it was while your father was stationed nearby? Was he actually stationed in Paris or did you just take a trip from where he was?
Oh no, He didn't come. It was just me and my mom. He had this duties while we were planning our trip so he couldn't make it.

persona: I am a teacher and waitress and don't have any pets.
I love mean girl movie.
My hobby is racing motorbikes.
I work with food bank volunteering.
Our school has a therapy dog Dr. Woofington McBark, he is 5 and a black lab.
dialogue: My dog and cat had a little fight yesterday.
Oh no, Did either of them get hurt?
Nah, It was more just like hissing and barking.
Wow... I can just imagine the noises. It was probably really loud. Are they getting along okay now?

Yeah they seem to be getting along now that everything's settled. Mean Girl tried to grab some food from Roscoe's bowl and he wasn't having it. Like he saw her messing around in his bowl and went after her.
I can believe. That. Dogs can be very territorial. How has volunteering been going?
It's been going good, Over the weekend I made a big amount of my mom's famous lemon chicken and brought it over to donate for that night's meal. It was a hit, Thankfully.
Oh, That sounds delicious. We could use your cooking skills at our center.
I could come over to help out for sure. I love volunteering. If I could do it as a career i would.
That would be amazing. We can use all the help we get. Are you available this weekend?
Yeah I am. I just can't leave my dog in my place, Could I bring him with me?
Sure. He would be a big hit with the people coming in. Give them some happiness with their meals.

persona: I am rich. I eat off golden plates.
My favorite color is green.
I bought Bitcoin for fun.  I am nervous about buying Bitcoin.  I did not buy Bitcoin as a main investment. I made my money investing in real estate.
dialogue: How is your Bitcoin investment paying off?
It's going okay, Not the levels I wanted originally.
Bitcoin is such a volatile investment, I don't know how you can stand the swings.
Honestly? It's anxiety inducing as hell. I don't use a lot amount of money, Especially with this.
I get it, I could never handle that stress. That's why I have a pet goldfish - it's very relaxing.
Oh right you were telling me about getting him, How's that going for you? Is he being a good... Fish?
He's a great fish! I named him Nemo after my favorite movie!
Nemo is a really good movie. Did you get him to distract you from the breakup?
Actually, Yes. It was a really difficult time and having something else to focus on was really helpful... Even though he doesn't talk.
He might not talk but I'm sure he's a good listener.
Haha, Yes. Have you ever had a goldfish?
No, I haven't. The only pet I ever had was a cat that I grew up with.

persona: I skateboard. I have skateboarder friends.
I watch football.
I have a girlfriend. I want to impress my girlfriend with a poem.
I like the poem. I use youtube for movie recommendations. I prefer drama and romantic movies, and do not enjoy science fiction movies like Star Wars.
I have never seen Titanic.
I drink black coffee.
dialogue: I bet your girlfriend would also like some chocolate covered strawberries to have during your movie date.
I agree completely! My girlfriend loves chocolate covered strawberries. Do you have any suggestions on where I should buy them?
I usually go to a local candy store and see if they have any fresh. If not I look online. Places that sell flowers usually have treats like that too so you can have it delivered.
There's a candy store not too far from my house, So I'll have to check it out. Do you think I should get some flowers too?
I think it might be a bit too much to do both unless it's a special occasion. Or it will seem like you're trying too hard to impress her. One gesture at a time is best, I think.
Okay, That is good advice. Thank you. Are you in a relationship right now?
Not unless you count my dog. We spend a lot of time together. But no boyfriend or girlfriend at the moment.
I didn't know you had a dog! So do I! I love animals so much. What kind of dog do you have? I love the little fluffy ones.
I have a big Newfoundland named Max. He's three years old.
Aw! Those dogs get really big, I know. Wow. I'd love to see a picture of him sometime!
I will be sure to get you one. I love big dogs.
Big dogs scare me sometimes, But I'm sure Max is a nice dog.

persona: I'm Charlotte, I've been to Canada.
I work as a librarian. I am 60.
I live in the south and want to go North.
I enjoy music. My daughter does not play music. I travel often and my daughter sometimes comes with me.
I will be retiring in a few months and plan to travel once I do. I've always wanted to travel north. I want to go to France, and then Belgium. I enjoy Belgian chocolate.
I speak Chinese and French, but could stand to study French some more.
dialogue: Belgium also makes incredible waffles, In addition to their famous chocolates.
That's the theory, Yes. I wonder if my language skills are good enough to go over there.
I guess there's only one way to find out! Would you take one trip to France and Belgium, Or split them up?
I'd probably split them up, The idea of going to one place and then immediately to the other is kinda intimidating. I've been thinking about asking my daughter to come with me.
How old is she? That sounds like it would be a great way to bond with her.
She's 18, Going to turn 19 next year and she's thinking of taking some time off before going to college so if I keep working until then and take the time to retire we could go together.
Wow, That sounds great! Does your daughter take French in school?

She did actually, She started learning it and I started to help her study for her tests. She speaks much better than I do and was taking about going to France to maybe be an english teacher. I took chinese when I was in school and it's been my passion language.
I'm so impressed with your love of languages. I also learned to speak Chinese to communicate with my some of my clients.

Oh how wonderful. It's always nice to see the relief on people's faces when you can speak in their natural tongue with them. I remember I met a man who had just immigrated, He wanted to check out books on learning english but he wasn't sure how to properly phrase it so when I started speaking to him in his language he looked so relieved!
I agree, I love being able to help people because I can speak their language.
It's such a fulfilling feeling. He still comes by the library to check out books every week and it makes me so happy how comfortable he is coming here and speaking english now.

persona: I like old school hip hop music. I take dance lessons once a week. I am one of the oldest people in the class. I'm learning to break dance which has been a goal of mine since childhood.
I really like New Kids on the Block.
I was born in the 1980s.
I do not work.
I have 8 babies. I wish I had started dance lessons when I was younger but enjoy the opportunity now.
