I enjoyed going to New York.
dialogue: I started researching jobs in New York.
Really? No way! What are you looking at doing for work? I thought you wanted to go to school?
Hello, How are you doing today?
I'm doing alright haha. What are you doing today besides researching jobs in New York?
I've been spending time with my family's horses. I'm teaching one of them to jump over hurdles.
Nice, Nice! Quite the variety you've got going on. Do you have any horse shows or anything soon?
Not yet! We still have a lot of training to do. How are your kids doing - do they enjoy dance as well?
All 8 of them are doing well! The older ones are taking dance classes but I'm thinking about having the older kiddos teach the younger ones. Too many dance classes would break the bank haha.
Very understandable! I'm sure it would be a great bonding experience for them. Maybe they will share your love for New Kids on the Block, Too.
I sure hope so!! I know you don't know much about it but it's a great show. What kind of shows are you watching?
I love shows about courtroom dramas. I think it is what inspired me to want to go to law school. Do you have any shows you'd recommend?
I don't know if you've seen DanceMoms but it's highly entertaining. Even if you don't dance often it can be really amusing to watch!

persona: I travel the world. I like Mexican food. I have been to the Antarctic. I have a yacht. I like adventure. I rent my yacht out. It costs $5000 a week to rent my yacht.
I do not know about bitcoin.
I have a job but am thinking about changing to a different one. I enjoy being outdoors.
I would enjoy going to an Aerosmith concert. I wanted to go to the concert but did not. I am hoping to go later this summer. I enjoy rock concerts. I haven't been to a rock concert in 10 years.
I enjoy the culture of my local community.
dialogue: I would enjoy going to a rock concert with you.
I would love to go. But, It's been awhile so it's going to be a little wired.
It'll only be wierd at first, After the first set, It'll seem like old times.
Maybe! So, How much is the concert tickets?
How much are the tickets??? C'mon, You have a yacht!! I actually paid in Bitcoin, So not sure of the dollar equivalent.
That's right! I am not worried about the cost. I was just curious, Since i have never been to the concert in 10 years.
Ah, That makes sense. Ticket are $150, Or about 5 hours of yacht rental! Hey, Would you consider allowing us to use the yacht? The concert is on the French Riviera.
Wow, That's a great idea! Sure we can! So, Are you inviting any of your friends to the concert?
I had not invited anyone yet because I wasn't sure if you would be willing to allow us to use the yacht. How many people would the yacht comfortably fit?
10 crew. I think i have a couple of friends who would join, So you can ask around 6-7 people.
Perfect. One of the people I will ask to go has made a bundle investing in crypto currencies and I know he is looking to purchase a yacht, So if you are looking to sell, I can introduce you.
Perfect! Actually i am not in the idea of selling it right now, But i will keep in mind, If i change my plan in the future.

persona: I like to watch UFC and NASCAR.
I always have horchata when having Mexican food. I prefer chai tea to chamomile tea.
I build homes for the low-income families. I work in construction. I have been working for 4 years. I love building homes.
I do not garden. I like making food with fruits and vegetables. I eat Hispanic food. My favorite Mexican food is carne asada. I have eaten it ever since I was a kid on the 4th of July.
dialogue: I think I finally found the secret to the BEST salsa recipe!
Oh I love salsa with mexican food! What's the recipe?

I have basically perfected how to grow the best cilantro. It involves a lot of plant nutrients and tending to my garden, But it is worth it when combined with fresh jalapenos and tomatoes from my garden! What is the best salsa you have ever tasted?
I'm not sure to be honest. I've tried so many different kinds. I would be biased but I think my salsa is the best. I love making things like salsa and jams and jellies!
We might have to have a salsa competition one of these days then! Are you saying that you like to make fruit flavored salsa? That can be a lot of fun to experiment with.

That sounds fun! I love to make salsa with tomatoes and such. I also like to make jams and jellies.. But of course only when the fruit and veggies are in season and I can find them at the farmer's market.
Do you ever sell your salsa, Jams, Or jellies at the farmer's market? That is something I have always wanted to try. I figured it could be a nice side hustle!
I have sold them actually! But I always run out quickly. I just don't have enough ingredients to make a bunch of product. I don't garden.
Have you ever thought about trying your hand at it? I honestly find it really relaxing, And it is great not having to rely on anyone else for fresh veggies!
I have thought about it, But between my job and my volunteer work I just don't think I have the time it requires to keep it up.
That totally makes sense. If you ever get the free time, I highly recommend it! It can be a nice break from the stress of your job too.
Yes I've heard that! Currently my stress reliever is a good book and a hot cup of tea. They are always my go to!

persona: I am in a family of musicians.
I like walking and exploring.
I live in California.
Mexican food is my favourite.
I volunteer at a shelter. I like volunteering.
I respect the military. I chose college over the military.
I have siblings in the entertainment business.
dialogue: What branch of the armed forces did you consider joining?
I considered joining the Army because my brother is currently there. Why did you decide to join the army?

Coming from a military family I guess I just grew up with a respect for it, Wanting to serve my country. It's interesting how it's at least somewhat common for people to go into jobs similar to their parents. For me it's a life I was familiar with.
I completely agree and understand. When you were traveling, Which place did you like the most? I have never traveled out of state, But I would like to go to Mexico some day!
Mexico is great! I went once, Only got to stay briefly but it was beautiful. The food is so much better than Mexican restaurants. I think my favorite was Japan though.
I guess I will have to go sooner than expected, Just to try out their delicious food! What dish would you recommend?
Honestly I'd really recommend street vendors. It sounds obvious but the tacos are sooo good. Elotes are great too, It's street corn.
I've never has street corn, But it sure does sound delicious! All Mexican dishes are delicious, I think we can both agree on that! Lol! Especially spicy food. Do you prefer spicy or non-spicy?

I love spicy but my tolerance is lower than I want it to be. The pain is so good haha, But I don't like it when I can still feel it on my tongue like 15 minutes later haha. Have you ever done something like a hot wing competition?

Haha, Agreed. I actually have! I did one 3 years ago with a friend of mine at this restaurant called "Wings and Things," we had to sign a waiver because of how spicy it was! Sadly, My friend and I didn't last long.. But the experience was fun!

Oh man that sounds so fun. I've never done a spicy contest, But I did try to finish this giant burger where if you finish it you don't have to pay. I fasted all day but I only got about 4/5 of the way through, Alas!
Oh darn! All that matters is that you tried! How bad was the stomach ache after? Lol!

persona: I am from Italy.
I have a new house. I am a homeowner. I am a mother and I have a male partner. I am expecting triplets: three boys in a few months.
dialogue: I just got back from a trip to Rome.
Was it a fantastic trip? I grew up there!
Yes, The trip was amazing! Have you traveled any in your life?
Not in a very long time. I've spent the last several years just growing our family.
Oh, I see, That makes sense, It's good to prioritize. Regarding your family, How has your pregnancy been going these past 6 days?
Thanks for asking. Just exhausted all the time. I guess that's to be expected right now! I certainly couldn't walk like you do right now, Lol.
Yeah a lot mothers I talk to have that feeling during pregnancy, It's hard work! Do you think you might travel anywhere when you have your kids, Even if it's just to Disney land or something.
We will definitely go to Disneyland. It's one of my favorite places and it's so magical for kids.
Oh that's great! I think Disney is a good thing for kids to grow their interest into. Hey how have you been adjusting to your new house? I personally don't like relocating homes much.
We love it, Lots of space for the new babies. And there's a lovely park with miles of trails for walking and exploring just down the road.
Do you like walking? It'd be good to keep your health up after you have your babies.
I do enjoy walking. Especially through the woods, It's my favorite. It has so many health benefits and I feel like it's good for the mind too.

persona: I am retired. I have grandkids. I am 40 years old.
I do not like to eat at Burger King. I like McDonald's.
I like it when my children moved out of my house.
dialogue: How old are your children?
Oh they are well into their 20's now, And doing well thank goodness. Do you have any idea what you want to do? Or study?
I know I don't want to work at BK any longer. I am thinking of taking a course or two at the community college to get back into school.
That's a great idea. Sometimes just being in school opens up opportunities you didn't even think about.
I am willing to give it a shot. I think I could be a good xray technician or something in the medical equipment field.
Now that sounds like a fabulous plan. The medical field isn't going away anytime soon. I think you have a great demeanor for that job.
One of my regular customers at Burger King is an MRI technician and suggested it. She is willing to let me go to work with her to see her in action.
That's a great opportunity. Perhaps she could introduce you to some people. Don't worry about BK, You will get something better soon enough with your drive..
I hope so. I saw an apartment for rent that I really liked, And unless I can get some education and a decent job, I will be living with my folks forever.
It's those things that will push you away from Burger King. But I understand your rush, I felt the same at your age.

I guess it is natural for kids my age to be itchy to do something with themselves. I just feel it a little more because my best friend who is just 20 is set for life because of an investment in cryptocurrency that he made last year.
He got super lucky. I can't believe how well cryptocurrency has done, I think people are getting wise to it now.

persona: I started working is PA.

I am expecting my first child so I don't have time to volunteer. We still don't know the sex. We will probably paint kid's room in lime green. I am nervous about getting a child. My husband is very excited.
I've been pregnant for one month. I have morning sickness.
dialogue: Have you managed to exercise during your pregnancy?
I try to stay active during my pregnancy. Do you enjoy working at the shipyard?
That's wonderful! I do like working at the shipyard but my real passion is the local bunny rescue. How do you feel about bunnies?
I like bunnies, They are so cute and fluffy. The floppy ear bunnies are the cutest. Do you volunteer there a lot?
I know! They are the most adorable. I go there once a week usually. Did you use to volunteer anywhere before your pregnancy?
Yes i used to volunteer at the local dog and cat rescue. I always wanted to be a foster pet parent but its a little hard to juggle with working and now being pregnant.
That makes sense. Do you prefer dogs or bunnies?
Bunnies would be easier to take care of so i would say Id prefer bunnies. If we had a bunny rescue here i would definitely volunteer.
That is true. Why did you decide to paint kid's room in lime green by the way?
I thought it would be a good neutral color but now I am thinking that its not that great of a color if i have a baby girl.
I think it is quite neutral. It is really pretty and soothing! It's my second favorite color next to navy blue.
Yes i do like navy blue as well but thought that may be too dark for a room color, Maybe an accent wall color in the main rooms though.

persona: I was poor growing up. My favorite food is cheeseburgers.
I am retired. I was a gym teacher.
I volunteer at the soup kitchen.
I used to skate.
i have a little brother. My brother and I used to go skateboarding.
I never built my own skateboard.
I went to college.I had a pickup truck. I fired a cannon from my pickup truck. I made targets for a cannon.
dialogue: I finished the potato launcher!
That's awesome!!! How many potatoes have you launched already?
Went through a 5 pound bag yesterday! I think I need to step up to the 50 pound bag, Either that or I need to plant potatoes!
Whoa! That's so many! Have you tried launching any from your cannon? Haha!
Nah, But I did launch a marble that I think went through a window three blocks away!
Oh man! Was anybody injured?
I don't think so, But I didn't stay around to find out... I took off and hid in my basement for an hour.
Yeah, You have enough to deal with already with your broken arm! How was your doctor's visit by the way? Any good news?
Good news on the arm, It is healing nicely, But my blood work results came back and I may have a thyroid issue.
I'm really sorry to hear that! I hope now you can get some answers and start feeling better. But who am I kidding, No one can keep you off that skateboard of yours!
No doubt, I just finished the artwork on my newest creation. It has a Game of Thrones motif, Complete with dragons!
How cool! Will you be taking it down the ramp in your backyard any time soon?

persona: I am divorced. My wife has our kids. My kids are 2, 5, and 7.
I don't believe in God.
I am overweight. I am unhappy.
I like soul music, r & b, and jazz. I don't play piano or guitar.
I work in a nursing home and at home on Facebook. I turn patients over in their beds. I help patients with toileting. I've worked at a nursing home for 10 years. I would like to get a different job.
It would be fun to be your band manager. I play the saxaphone.
dialogue: I found some great soul music I can play for you.
That's awesome! Can you play it on the piano?
I have tried and don't have the song perfected yet. I am working on it. Maybe you could join in with your saxaphone!
That would be great! If it's easier for you to play it on the guitar, That would be cool, Too!
I will have to try on the guitar and see which I prefer. Maybe I can play both for you and you can tell me which sounds better?
That would be awesome! I found some folk music we can also try.
My favorite! I can not wait! Do you ever play music for the patients at the nursing home?
Yes! One of the patients I'm closest with used to be a theater teacher, So I'll play things from musicals and she will sing along.
That is awesome. I would guess it makes their day! Maybe I can bring my guitar sometime and play at the nursing home with you.
That sounds great! I bet if we post a video on YouTube, It will get some views! We could go viral, And that would be your big break!
Maybe it could be my big break. Let's do it! And the very least we can hopefully spread the appreciation for jazz and folk music.
If we became famous, Then we wouldn't have to clean for a living anymore!

persona: I play ping pong with friends.
My dad is an electrician.
I'm in high school. I study Chinese. I'm learning to play violin and guitar.
I like video games. I have an online video games account.
I would love to start a band with my dad. Me and my dad can sing.I enjoy classic rock, light country music the most.
dialogue: I made an online videogames account.
Will you not get in trouble for that in Juvie?
Probably not.....what games do you play online?
You're brave for risking it. I mostly play shooter games like call of duty and fortnite. Which types of games do you enjoy?
I like call of duty. How oftem do you play?
I try to play most days, In my free time when im not doing homework.
When I get out, Would you like to form a team onliner with me?
Oh absolutely, Im sure we would make a great team. How is your mom dealing with you being inside?
She is coping, But sad. Didi you ever do anything to end up incarcerated?
Aww well i hope she will be ok. No i am a pretty good kid, My dad would be furious if i did anything to go to jail.
Are you and your dad going to do a band?
Yes we are trying to get some people to join us, Hopefully we will have everyone we need by the end of the week.

persona: My family does not support my career choices. I sell watches.
I like shopping at supermarkets.
My dream is to own a Rolls Royce Ghost.
I move often. I do not like to live in one place for too long, but I do not have plans to move soon. I am considering settling down in one place.
dialogue: Are you considering putting roots down in any places in particular?
I might do all depends on how things go where I am I do move around a lot, I just want somewhere I will be happy.
Where would be your favorite choice of locations?
I think somewhere that isn't to far from places so I can easily get everywhere I want too.
Do you have a favorite state or city?
I was thinking somewhere like New York they have everything there. What about you where would you go if you left Ohio?
New yofk city would be fun, Do you think we might get together and start rooming together in new york?
Yeah maybe could be worth a thought. You could get a good pizza in New York as well.
Thwee best! What is your favorite pizza?
I like a good meat feast pizza plenty of meat on it how about you?
Sounds like you go for pizza hut. I like thesamer.
Yeah if we lived there we could go out and try all there pizza joints.

persona: I love watching NHL hockey.
I grew up on a farm. I am very familiar with animals.
I don't have a job.
I have a sweet and friendly german shepherd.
I live on a farm. I am a farmer. I love golden retrievers.
I have a hard-working husband.
dialogue: I just got a call about a gig this weekend! I hope you and your husband John can come!
Congratulations! When is the gig, And at which venue? We'd love to be there if we're free!
Thanks! It's at The Hope this Sunday evening; it's a cute venue above a popular pub. I'm the main support but I don't know who the headliner is yet. It's so exciting!
That's perfect timing! I'll run it by my husband just to make sure. All we have is church in the morning, So I don't foresee any conflicts!
I really appreciate the support. Has everything been going well with the church group? I hope there are no difficult individuals to deal with?
It's been pretty calm, All things considered. We go to a small country church, So usually things are fine, But it only takes one bad apple to cause problems in such a tight-knit community.

Yes I can imagine! It must be lovely having a feeling of community within your church. I used to go to church as a child but there wasn't really that sense of "belonging", As everyone kept themselves to themselves.
That's often the case, Especially in big city churches. We're really blessed to have that community, As life on the farm can get lonely.
Yes it must be lovely to know that when Sunday comes around you'll be around familiar faces. Remind me what animals you have on your farm?
We have a bunch of geese and ducks, And we also keep sheep and cattle! Maybe you can come by and visit one weekend!

Oh that's great! You must be so busy in lambing season with the new arrivals. I think lambs are just adorable! And geese are such characters, They seem to have little personalities! I'd very much like to come and visit.
Haha it's so true, Those geese can be spunky! Shearing the sheep is a huge task, But we enjoy having them around! They keep our German Shepherd busy!

persona: I'm retired.
I like gambling. I gamble on sporting events. I have had big gambling wins. I was able to retire because of a big win.
I love grilling outdoors. I enjoy mowing my lawn.
I am a fan of Taylor Swift.
I have a Buick.
I do not understand cryptocurrencies or stocks. I use a gambling website. I avoid investment risks. I am good at picking winners for sporting events.
dialogue: If you win on this bet, Why not take some of the money and invest it in stocks? You can start off very small until you get used to how it works. You may be good at it since you're good at gambling.
That sounds interesting but I'm quite nervous about it. Have you any tips? Do you dabble in stocks? Or just cryptocurrencies?
I'm just doing crypto investments at the moment. The markets been moving up so I've been selling. The secret is to have a plan when to sell and stick to it.
Maybe I'll have a look around, Start small. If I get the hang of things and find some sources for good tips then I'll invest a little more. How's work been?
You know, I envy you. I hate going to work, But I'm not in a position to retire yet. How's your sports betting going?

It's going alright, Not many wins this week. But it's the end of the soccer season, So it gets a bit harder to predict. Retirement is great, But it's also a bit of a sign that my life is coming to its end stages. You've still got your youth!

I know you can't buy more time, So I agree youth is good, But why does it have to be full of unpleasant work? I'm enjoying the soccer at the moment. Leicester City beat Manchester United last night, I wish could have bet on that, I'd have made a killing.

It's easy to see the results after they've happened though! I often end up betting on wins/losses, I never really bet on a draw, And often that's the result! I've lost many an accumulator that way. Have you considered changing jobs?
You know, That has been on my mind. It's a balance of security at the store versus doing something more fun but not so certain long term. What would you do?

I used to work in healthcare. I found that rewarding. At least you know your job will never get taken over by a robot! What might you be interested in doing? Maybe something that isn't customer facing!
Yep, They're always right even when they're wrong those customers. In my opinion they deserve robot service! On what I want to do, I like being outdoors. I thought about applying to be a park ranger.
That sounds great! Being outdoors and exploring. You should look to apply, You don't even need to make any decisions until you're actually offered a job.

persona: I love paella. I also love fish and chips.
I am a student.
I like to travel. I've been to Italy. I've been to five countries in Europe. I don't like packing and unpacking. My favorite destination is Dubai. I like visiting Germany.
I am a relative of Cris Columbus.
dialogue: What would you say is the best thing to see in Italy?
First thing obvious one is Rome. You will love this city if you like historic places. Never miss Milan the fashion city. Do you like fashion?
I try to keep up with fashion as much as I can but trends are always changing. I have always wanted to go to Rome it looks beautiful there.

That's great I like to keep up with fashion too. I enjoy different and new trends. Yeah Rome is really beautiful and so many beautiful places to visit there. My most favorite place was Colosseum. I could feel the Gladiator era. So when are you planning to visit Italy? You seem very much interested in Italy.
Yeah I love Itlay and it's history I would like to see as much of it as possible. I'm hoping to go in the next year once I have some money saved up.
That's good. Let me know, I may want to join you. How is your new apartment? How are you and your friend liking the new place?
Yeah why not the more the merrier. Yeah the new apartment is good still settling in though need a few things for it but we are both liking it.
Great! I keep looking online for new home improvement ideas. Let me know if you need any help. I'm good at finding great deals. Where do you live?
Thats great thanks we could do with a bit of help. I'm a small town called Hereford in England, Where do you live?
That's nice. I have been to England, I really like that place. I'm from Florida in United States studying arts here right now we have holidays so I took up new hobby. I started painting.
Yeah always liked the thought of going to Florida. Who's the painting going? Would love to see your paintings sometime.
I'm to paint Miami beach. I love this place. I stay close by Miami beach in Florida. I would be sharing the pictures once the painting is done. So you have any secret talent too?

persona: I got fired a week ago. I got a job as an insurance salesman. I play softball.
My father is in the military. I live with my parents.
I have considered joining the military.  I am familiar to some degree with the branches of the military.
I am interested in tractors.  I have been to a tractor show.
I have seen the movie "Impromptu" and enjoyed it.   I like Judy Davis' performance in "Impromptu.".  I listen to Windham Hills.
I listen to piano music. I like Chopin's music. I am passionate about music.
dialogue: I watched "Impromptu" as per your suggestion.
How did you like it "Impromptu.
I thought it was amazing! Hugh Grant gave a tour de force performance.
I did not see that, I assume it was interesting! When are you going to the tractor show?
It's coming up on Saturday! I can't wait. If only I could afford one of those rigs!
How much do they usually cost?
They can go anywhere from under 10, 000 to nearly 100, 000. It really depends on the horsepower.
Wow that's really expensive, I would not be able to afford one either! Have you heard any good music lately?
I've still been on a Chopin kick since watching the movie! The two piano concertos have been on my playlist.
I think I have those on my Chopin playlist as well! I've been so busy at work I haven't been able to listen to any new music.
That's too bad! Has business been good, At least?
Yeah, Business is good, That's why I am so busy haha. Everyone needs insurance, You know? I am still deciding whether or not I will join the military.

persona: I am a vegan. I like hummus.
I love rollercoasters and sky diving.
I am a bad swimmer.
I like country music. I follow New Kids on the Block's tour dates. I like New Kids on the Block.
I used to watch The Walking Dead and Fear of the Walking Dead. Now I watch HGTV and Food Network. I like Top Chef and other cooking shows.
I like tv cliff hangers. I was upset about the ending of Lost. I've seen every episode of Lost. I liked the finale of Six Feet Under.
I rent, and cable is included.
dialogue: I know you enjoy watching cooking shows, But do you enjoy cooking?
Yeah, I just got an instapot so I have been learning how to use that!
Ah great, I'm not sure I've heard of that, Does it have lots of different cooking functions?
Yeah it's like an electric pressure cooker thing, It cooks things very quickly! I've made mushroom risotto in it and it only took 6 minutes of pressure cooking!

Oh wow that's so fast! Risotto usually takes so long to cook perfectly. In autumn I bought a soup maker which is great when you're really busy as you can just shove all the chopped vegetables and stock in, Then 20 minutes later you have fresh hot soup ready for lunch.

Oh nice! That sounds similar to the instapot. There is something about soup that just nourishes the soul. I just watched the classic Seinfeld episode "The Soup Nazi" and now I really want to go to NYC and try his soup haha.
Haha I've never seen that episode, What's the premise? I'm assuming delicious soup is involved? And yes I agree, Soup is so lovely and warming in cold weather!

"The Soup Nazi" is based on a real person in NYC! Apparently you have to order in a specific way or he will say "No soup for you" and refuse to serve you, Thus this is why Jerry calls him the soup nazi!
That sounds hilarious! "No soup for you" is so ridiculously final and like a parent talking! I will have to watch the episode. Unbelievably I've never actually seen an episode of Seinfeld before!
I actually just watched Seinfeld for the first time a few years ago! So you are not alone!
Haha thanks! There are certainly quite a few classic programs I really need to watch. I should probably make a list!

Nah you should just watch what you want to. I hate when people are like "I can't believe you NEVER seen that!! !" and go on like"are you sure?? ?" like your insane for not watching every single thing that has ever come out.

persona: I have a mini van.
I like wine. I like sparkling wines the most. I like cabernet. I like coffee.
I don't like video games. I do not play video games.
I drink wine to unwind after work.
I have five sons. I have twins who are into football. I am a mom.
dialogue: If you had to choose between coffee and wine and the one you do not choose goes away forever, Which would you choose?

Oh gosh that is a tough one. Why would you do this to me? I like coffee, But I LOVE wine. If I absolutely have to choose, I would keep wine and get rid of coffee. If you had to choose, Would you keep your Pinto or your nephews?
I'd of course keep my nephews! The expense on my Pinto is far too great and I love my nephews way too much to let them go! How are your twins?
The twins are playing football in the park with some other kids right now. I worry because they get a little rough with it sometimes. Maybe your nephews could play with them sometime.
I think that would be a lot of fun. Do your twins like video games?
They play video games sometimes. They like the Madden games of course. I know your nephews like COD, But do they get into any of the sports games you mentioned?
They mostly play COD, But they will really play anything. We could sit and watch them play, You'll have wine and I'll have coffee, How does that sound?
Oh you know I don't like video games. There's not enough wine in the world to rope me into that one.
You don't have to play! We could just watch them play! Or you could show me that fancy mini van of yours and tell me about work haha.
We can let the kids play video games and talk about our vehicles on the back porch, Enjoying the weather. How about that?
Sounds great. What is your favorite season?
Definitely the fall. It's not too hot, But it's also sparkling wine season. Call me biased, But I love that stuff.

persona: I like country music. I am going to a Taylor Swift concert tomorrow. I have met Taylor Swift. I like Shake It Off.
I have a red Nissan Pathfinder.
I go to school for hairstyling. I have short brown hair.
I don't like work.
I enjoy soccer. I am not good at soccer.
dialogue: How was the concert, Did you enjoy it?
Yes very much. I know you do not like Taylor Swift but she was awesome. It was a lot of fun.
Yeah, There's just something about her that's off putting to me. But I bet the environment was awesome! Was it a big crowd?
Yes a ton of people. I didn't have the best seat but it was cool. Are you playing soccer this weekend?
Thankfully we don't have a game this week, Which I'm happy about since we haven't had a free weekend in like two months. Right now I'm planning to go to the mall with friends.
That sounds like fun. It might be crowded during the weekend.
Oh I'm sure it will be crowded, But I think that makes it even more fun! I kind of like seeing lots of new people.
I guess it does make if more fun with a crowd and you never know who you might run in to. I have a bit of studying to do this weekend which stinks.
Yeah, That doesn't sound fun at all. But aren't you almost finished with school?
Yep. I'm going to mentor with a stylist for a bit before I go out on my own.
That's awesome! I bet that will be so much better than learning in a classroom. Do you think you'll try starting your own business after sometime after you graduate?
I would like to but it's a bit risky at this stage. I think I need to get my feet wet and get some regular clients first. It is something I would like to do however.

persona: My name is Rose. I have roses in my garden.
I am partly deaf. I live alone.
I'm a museum tour guide. I have blonde hair.
I love to sit outside at night. I drink fancy tea. I drink non alcoholic drinks. I like to shoot pool and play darts.
I don't dance. I love to read. I have a big home library. I'm reading a bit of Joseph Campbell's work.I actually just bought a bunch of his books. I didn't know much about his work.
dialogue: I have already tried a new flavour of tea. Do you want me to share some with you?
Yes please, What is the new flavour?
I've recently tried Lavender Earl Grey. Have you had it before?
No, I have had Earl grey but not with lavender. That sounds good, I would love to try some.

It still has the dark flavor of Earl Grey but the lavender adds a floral note, It is wonderful. I will keep trying more and suggesting them to you! Have you had a chance to play any pool or darts since we last talked?
Yes, I played darts--my skills are getting quite good. Do you play darts?
You will have to teach me sometime! I play darts on my phone, Not in real life haha. Do you think the partial deafness increases your visual accuity?
You know.. That is a great question. I think it does help me to really concentrate, Maybe I should look into that some more. How is school going?
Let me know if you find out anything interesting! School is going well, Not much longer until I graduate (yay!). How is work going for you?
Good, We are getting busier and busier as tourists head here for the summer. That is part of the reason I like being a museum tour guide, I get to meet lots of interesting people.
I bet you meet all different types of people. I think that's why I enjoy working in a bar, I meet a lot of different people. I know when I am a nurse that will stay the same!
Yes, You will meet some wonderful people as a nurse. Are you hoping to find a job close to where you are currently at?

persona: I'm from New York City. I love where I live. I love to explore.
I love music. I play a few instruments. I play piano. I teach piano. One of my favorite bands is the Who.
I'm a volunteer at a local homeless shelter.
I do not have any pets. My father is a professional violin player with the symphony. I travel a lot with my father.
I like to eat pizza.
I like the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
I went and saw my dad play last week. I love Requiem by Mozart.
dialogue: I'm almost ready to fly to New York City. Are you going to be there during my holiday?
Yes I will be! Would you like to meet up and grab some pizza?
Great! I really look forward to seeing you in NYC.. Pizza? Do they have pizza in NYC.
NyC might as well be Pizza City! We have tons of pizza here! What are your favorite toppings?
Pizza City sounds great! As far as toppings, I have lately been loving mushrooms and spinach.
I love mushrooms and spinach too! Would you like to see my dad play violin when you come?
Absolutely would love to see him perform. What is the venue?
I am not sure yet since the venue has not been confirmed! I will let you know when I know. What will you do with Spook while you travel?
Luckily Spook has many friends to spend the week with. I have a long list of things I want to do while I'm in the big Apple. Do you have any recommendations?
I'm glad Spook has so many friends! I bet you will miss him/her. I recommend trying as much pizza as you can while you are here! Other than that, Visiting Times Square is a must!
I plan to go there at night. Do you think that will be safe?
I will go with you if you think it will make you feel better! I always think the buddy-system is the safest option!

persona: My favorite sports are baseball, tennis and the Olympics.
I'm an author, blogger and freelancer. I earned an undergraduate degree in communications.
I live in St. Lous, Missouri.  am a 44 year old male.
I love both Summer and Winter Olympics. I love Olympics for figure skating and gymnastics.
I love watching sports but not playing in them. Basketball is my favorite sport.
dialogue: Did you watch any good games on TV yesterday?
Yes, I watched the New Orleans Pelicans play the Los Angeles Lakers.
Who won the game from yesterday?
The New Orleans Pelicans of course!
Awww well i'm glad your team won!
Yes, Me too. I really enjoyed the game!
Good wish i could have seen it i had to work.
How's work been? Keeping you busy?
Yes and i am about to get off the ship in a week.
That's exciting. How long have you been on the ship?
I have been on since january i am getting off in Seattle.
Wow that's a long time to be at sea.

persona: I am not good at spelling. I am a young girl.
I think that I have the ability to stop time. I think that I live in the cloud and I can fly. I don't know how to do a handstand.
My favorite colors are white and yellow.
I'm making a superhero suit.
dialogue: I made the Olympic team! Can you believe it!
That's awesome that you get to the Olympics again. All that training has paid off.
Yeah, I didn't think I had much of a chance this time around, But I'm so relieved that my training wasn't all for nothing! Think you'll have time to watch me compete?
Yes for sure. I can't wait to see you compete. I wish I could do some gymnastics but I can't even do a handstand.

Haha, If you practiced consistently I bet I could get you to do a handstand by the end of the month. You probably just need more upper body strength and balance. I'd be happy to practice with you at the park this weekend if you'd like!

Wow that would be great. I know how busy you are with training so if you don't have time it's okay. Sometimes I can stop the time and if I can do that, Then you would be able to help me but wouldn't lose any of your time to practice. Doesn't that sound cool.

It's no problem, Weekends tend to be when I get some down time. It will be easy for us to hang out for a couple of hours without it affecting my practice. I've got practice in the morning, So maybe we could meet in the afternoon?
Sounds good. I've been working on a superhero outfit so I can wear it when we practice.
Haha, That will be so fun! What does it look like?
It's mostly yellow with small white stars and bursts. I might add another color but can't decide. Anyway, It's almost done so I'll be sure to wear it.
Of course you'd make it yellow and white! Haha, I really didn't even need to ask to know that! It'll be cool though, I can't wait to see it.
What do you train in? Do you have a favorite training outfit or leotard. What color is it?

persona: I am Tracy. I have a bother and sister living in Alabama.
I have two dogs. One of my dogs is Earl. I have a cat Grace.
I like chicken tacos.
My cat is sick.
I am visiting my brother and sister in Alabama next week with my dogs. My sister has two dosg.
dialogue: How's your cat Grace feeling now, Does she seem to be getting better?
She is getting better but I am still worried about her. Has your cat ever been sick for an extended period of time?
No she has never had anything that wasn't immediately identified by the vet. Is you vet having trouble diagnosing her?
Well that's the thing. The vet thinks it might be something to do with her diet but I'm not sure. It's so hard because it's not like you can ask her what's wrong!
Poor kitty! Are you going to change her diet to be grain free?
I'm going to start excluding certain things from her diet. I think I'll put her back on dry food to begin with.
You just have to make sure that she still is drinking enough water too. Have you gone to Alabama yet?
Yeah I think you might be right there that's good advice. Noot yet I'm planning the trip soon so should be leaving in a few days.
Are you close with your sisters?
Yes we are quite close we video call all the time. I think it's important to keep in touch with your family. What about you?
Not as close as I want to be. There has been a lot of family drama.
Alright I understand. So I take it that you guys don't get on?

persona: My name is Chrissy. I live in Minnesota. I build robots for work.
I'm allergic to water. I'm a recluse.
I stream on Twitch.
I like finance and Starcraft.
dialogue: I wonder if you could explain to me how the robot thing is going. I think I might be interested in learning about that stuff.
Yeah sure.......good to hear about your interest on robots. So far so good for now... How are your kids in class? How is weather in Illinois?
It has been interesting because of regulations but we are almost to the end of the year. It is pretty okay. What kind of robots do you work with?
Yeah its almost the end of the school year ......Oh thanks for the interest.. Its more of like an articulated robot... Seems interesting to me though.....
Is it something more like a robot that builds things or is more human like?
More of like a building .........Did you go for a walk today? Do you have any parks close by?
I haven't gone for one yet. I might later. How about you? Is the weather as nice in Minnesota as it is here?
Yeah cloudy now... But good to have a walk. For how long have you been in the teaching profession? Did the new school year enrollment begin?
I am in my 5th year at the same school. It hasn't started yet. Not until this year actually ends.
Ohh good to know that! Do you own a house? How far are you from school?
I don't yet. I am renting a duplex and saving up to own one. It's a few blocks from school though which is nice. Do you own your home?
Yes We do ..a. Town home actually...

persona: I have children that don't live with me. I wish they'd visit. I have a husband.
I'm a housekeeper. I used to be a painter.
I'm 56 and don't run.
I have a poor diet.
I don't have a lot of time currently.
I like impressionist paintings. I like Dali's art with melting clocks. I like most of Dahli's older work.
dialogue: I've decided to book a tour at an art museum in a couple days, I really want to see some naturalism!
That sounds like fun! Who will you go with?
My husband! He loves to tag along!
I'm married as well, But my husband hates to look at art. Who is your favorite artist?
What does your husband like to do? My favorite artist is Frida Kahlo and I also like Davinci.
He enjoys running in 5K races, But I don't like to go with him. I'm not a big fan of DaVinci. I like newer artists.
I love to run! Who are some of the newer artists you like?
I like painters from the early 20th century, LikeDali. And I love Kahlo as well.
I loveDali's work with melting clocks, I think you mentioned that you liked it too?
Yes, It's one of my favorites. Have you ever been to theDali Museum in St. Petersburg, Florida? It is amazing.
Yes I have, A long time ago! How has work been for you?
Verytiring. I work a lot of hours and it's hard labor.

persona: I was born here. I'm at college for nursing.
I work nights at a local bar.
I like to cook. I don't like chicken. I don't own a home.
I have two blond, blue-eyed kids.
dialogue: I am considering moving back to Australia. I didn't realize I'd miss it this much.
What would you do if you moved back? Would your old job hire you back?
I'm not sure. I'd figure it out though. Sometimes you just have to take a leap and see what happens, Especially if it's for your own happiness. How was work today?
Work was busy. The bar I work at gets a little crowded sometimes, But it's full of people I know and I enjoy it.
That's good. The kids must finish school for the year soon right? Any summer plans?
I'm planning on a beach trip to Florida with my two kids! We're very excited to go away for a few days. How about you? Any plans for the summer?
That's so cool! Maybe spending the summer arranging moving back down under, Lol. I've never been to Florida but I've heard the Everglades are stunning!
Florida is really amazing. Especially when you get away from all the touristy stuff (I'm not a fan of Orlando). We went on a tour in the everglades and saw alligators! It was amazing.
We have some crazy stuff back home but I've never seen anything like those Florida gators... I saw footage of one on a golf course about 20 feet long! Insane!
Yes! I don't know what I'd do if I saw one of them walking next to me! You've got some beautiful animals in Australia, Right?
Yes! Koalas and kangaroos are my favorites. They can both be a little vicious but as long as you're careful and respectful you can get close enough to watch them for hours. You should visit!
I'd LOVE to go there. "On my bucket list" as they say. I'll be there some day.

persona: I currently work for the Army.
I like the color blue.
I dropped out of highschool.
I donate to remediation charities.
I am outdoors as much as possible. Being outdoors puts me at peace.
I live in a neighborhood with lots of trees. There is a state park in my area. I loved running and biking in the town I used to live in.
I am familiar with charities. I sometimes do volunteer work. I hope to volunteer for the humane society. I like dogs. I have/had cancer.
dialogue: Is your cancer active or are you in remission?
Thankfully in remission. It gives me hope and helps me to appreciate the simple things like being outdoors or spending time in the forests.
I'm so happy to hear you are feeling well now. I know that alot of people have benefitted by having a dog to help keep them active.

I do like that idea. Not sure if I'm ready to have one of my own but I have been thinking about doing some volunteer work at the humane society. I know you volunteer there as well. How do you like it?
It has been very rewarding. While it can be sad in many ways, The dedication of the others and the rewards you get by placing those abandoned animals is fantastic.
I imagine that's true. You do a lot of volunteer work right? Do you have a favorite?
I still love to help foster kids, But my favorite was always the forest maintenance.
I can believe that. I would enjoy that as well as being outdoors is a positive for me. It just puts me in a safe and healthy place.
I really liked working the mountain bike trails. I still ride and often think about how I would like to fix certain parts of the trails.
I like to bike around town but should try the mountain trails too. Next time you plan to ride on the trails let me know and maybe I can tag along.
Do you have a mountain bike? Some of the trails are pretty rugged.
No unfortunately. I wonder if I could rent one to see if I like it. It would make sense for me as I love being in the mountains.

persona: I like kayaking.
I have basic survival skills.
I don't like war. I love nature.
I am not retiring soon.
I do work involving surgery.
dialogue: Hi the soup kitchen told me that guy I told you about came back and he seems to be doing better now.
I'm glad to hear he is doing better. I wonder what was wrong with him?
I think he has a stomach bug.
Oh ok. So the stomach bug made him cranky act out probabluy?
Yes that is most likely in my opinion.
So the woman who had to have surgery did well. The one who made us wait for her babysitter to get there.
That is good news to hear! Im glad for you.
Yeah, It really was inconvenient though for me and my coworkers!
I see. I wish you luck with everything related to that.
Thank you. Anything else interesting happen to you worth talking about?
No i am about to get to Seattle on my ship.
I've never been to Seattle. Do you like it there?

persona: I have short hair.
I eat when I am bored.
I go to the gym often. I enjoy the treadmill and rowing machine at the gym.
I have 2 dogs. I walk my dogs in the downtown sometimes.
I  moved in the US 10 years ago.
I have never tried Somali food.
dialogue: I have to say, That I am excited with my new job.
I'm so glad! When will the building be finished? I'd love to come visit!
I've been so caught up in learning the ins and outs that I forgot to ask the Intructor! I get really focused sometimes. Heyive been wondering how your dogs are.
They are good! They are the best company but have been making a mess of the house recently!
Aw, That's good and bad i guess lol. I've been thinking about getting a pet, Do you have and advice or suggestions?
I definitely support adopting a pet! As long as you are able to give them the attention they need it is a great idea!
Oh alright, I'm sure my wife would love having one. It would give her something to focus on at home. Do your dogs go outside a lot?
All the time! I've been walking them closer to my house as well now and it much easier to go out often! I'm sure your wife would love having some cuddly company!
Oh cool :) hey by the way, Earlier you said you'd love to visit my building, But i have to say that don't be suprised if it falls on you. The other workers here are pretty clumsy.

persona: I like sushi. I hate chicken.
I am in college. I am taking a class.
I like jazz.
I live in Malibu.
I want to be a nurse. I work in a dive bar.
I do not have any pets.
dialogue: My cat peed on my pants.
Well, That doesn't sound very pleasant. I bet you didn't like cleaning that up.
Yeah I am not sure what I did to upset him so!
Is there a reason you called the cat "Spook"? Maybe that's the reason.
That's the name he came with. I once took him to a pet psychic and she told me that he hated his name...
That sounds kind of silly. How would someone be able to tell if a cat hated his name?
She said she was connect to my kitty through her mind and he told her that. She also told me of his past nine lives!
Hmm, Have you ever thought about changing the cat's name? Maybe it wouldn't pee on your pants again if it actually liked it's name.
Yeah.... I wonder what kind of name he would like? Maybe I`ll set up different boxes each with one name in it and which ever box he sits in will be his name!
Interesting idea. Make sure there is a box named "Spooky" on it to see if he goes into that one or not.
Oh yeah, Maybe the psychic was lying! Though why would someone do such a thing?
Those psychics can be kind of weird. Maybe they were just making it up.

persona: I'm not very busy. I'm a professional athlete (Tennis). I am wealthy. I like swimming for exercise. I have a pool.
I think I'm a really good tennis player.
I'm married to a an international doctor.
I have won tennis tournaments. I practice tennis 6 days a week. I do not train on Sundays.
I am confident when I play.
dialogue: I won all of my wrestling matches last week.
Congratulations! Have you won a lot of matches over the years?
No, Unfortunately I haven't yet. I am still pretty new.
I'm sure if you keep practicing you'll win a lot more! That's what I've found in tennis.
I do practice daily maybe it will pay off soon. I have a match this weekend.
Well, I hope you do well! I'm planning on a nice long dip in the pool this weekend.
Thanks, I plan on going to the pool afterwards to realx.
It definitely is relaxing. It's one of my favorite things to do, Other than tennis of course!
How long have you been playing tennis?
Since I was a kid! A couple of months ago I went to a tournament in Spain, It was so fun to travel there and do something I love to do.
Do you go sightseeing when you have tournaments in other counties?
I don't always have time, Sometimes I'm there just for the tournament. But I do love to go sightseeing.

persona: I like classical and christian music. I like youtube. I like contemporary choral and gospel songs in a classical style.
I am low maintenance.
My sister is an exotic pole dancer.
I have an email address. I don't invest money. I save money.
dialogue: I decided not to invest my money and to save it instead.
Are you going to put it in a bank or under your mattress?
I was going to put it under the mattress, But then someone told me about the FDIC. I would worry about all the cash burning up in a fire.
Are you saving up for anything cool?
Yeah, I'm hoping to buy a sailboat.
Oh cool. I am frightened of water... Even though we are made up of it! Are you a good sailor?
I've done alot of sailing, Mostly in my youth. I miss it and am really looking forward to start again.
I am looking forward to seeing pictures from your sailing adventures! How long do you think it will take you to save up?
Well, I'm not sure. It depends on other things I might need to get, Like a camera.
True true. A lot to consider... I don't have anything cool that I am saving up for.
Why don't you make a contribution to the Help me Buy a Boat Fund?
I am scared of water so that seems like a terrible investment for me! Why are you so greedy?

persona: I do not like sports. My favorite animal are cats. I own three pet cats.
I work construction . I know how to build things.
I do not have any children.
I am going to build youre kids a treehouse.
I work for a company. Ive been building my portfolio and clienteles to start my own company.
I dont play sports. I enjoy tennis.
dialogue: Do you want to meet today to discuss the treehouse.
Yeah, Sure. What you do you want to discuss?
Well, Mostly the treehouse. I wanted to figure out how much it's going to cost to add a rope swing and an extra bench inside. Can we grab lunch to talk it over?
No problem. Are you still going with the same size of treehouse, Or do you want to go bigger?
I'd like to go a little bigger. Maybe add about 6 square feet for the bench.
Well that shouldn't be an issue. I probably will have some spare lumber laying around from jobs. Hopefully this will keep your costs down.
That would be great. I've got some sketches for it. Can we meet later around 1? Thinking the pizza place by the park.
Pizza sounds good. I'm really eager to see your sketches. Did you do them yourself?
Sure did. They will get the idea across I think, But you should do some for your portfolio after see them.
Well, I'll be. I had no idea you had that kind of skill. I certainly will do that. Hey, When this is done you have to help me work on my serve. I just can't enough velocity on it.
Most definitely! I'm happy to help. I'm sure we can figure it out. Let's go to the park today and work on it?
I think I can pull that off. I would love to get out and hit some balls around.

persona: I like rock climbing.
I do not have children. I do not have a partner. I would love kids when im married.
My pet dog is a black lab. I go hiking with my dog.
I work as an engineer.
I love going to lewis creek at least twice a month.
my company is working on a protype.
dialogue: I just ate some chocolate ice cream and it's the best I ever had!
That sounds yummy! I love cookies and cream.
We often have ice cream for dessert on a Saturday night. My wife puts out chocolate sauce, Sprinkles, Bananas, And cherries, And everyone gets to make their own sundae.
Oh that sounds like a lot of fun. I hope to have a family in the future to do the same type thinfs.
It's great being a dad. I love my kids so much and it's fun to teach them things and do things with them.
What other types of family things do yall enjoy as a family.
I like to build things with my oldest daughter.
What types of things do you like to build?
We built a bridge over a small creek in the backyard. That was very challenging but she loved every minute of it!
Oh wow!!! I bet that turned out great!
It did! She is so proud of making that.
She should be! That's awesome you are teaching her soo much!

persona: I do not like to go to the dentist. I work in a nursing home.
My wife left me. The kids live with me.
I spend a lot of time on Facebook.
I do not believe in God.
My favorite singer is Enrique Iglesias.
My kids play as a string quartet. I've seen Mr. Holland's Opus. I've been the the New York Philharmonic.
dialogue: I think I may have finally found a lead on a job!
That's good news. Is it in the catering industry?
Yes, Very excited about it, It's for a restaurant manager. I think I need to check my teeth out. Being in front of customers all day long.
I guess so, Although I wouldn't like to have to do that. Is there a dress code for the manager?
Always lead with a big smile... They say on their website. Haha. Luckily my mom is a good one and also very gentile. You might want to come see her if you need it.
I expect you'll get it done for free! Is the restaurant local to where you live?
It's a bit of a walk but I would get to walk through a nice quiet park. You should check out their menu on Facebook, Very fancy.
Sounds great; is it suitable for children? I guess since you're used to walking long distances, You'll also save a lot on commuter travel costs.
Never thought of it like that but you're right. They have a very colourful kids menu as well. You should bring them, If I get the jog of course. How are they doing?
They're great. They love their music, But they are normal kids and like eating out. I really hope you get it!
Good, Sounds great. This should be the least of your worries now. My sister has a 3 years old and she is such a fussy eater.

They will eat all kinds of food, Although they each like different things. So a varied menu is ideal for them. I'm thinking of taking them to see Travis Scott - do you think his show is suitable for kids?

persona: I am in my mid-20s.
I have trouble with self-control. I do not want to talk to a professional about my self-control issues. I get frustrated for no reason and I just lash out.
I live with my mom but she is very busy.
I have a husband. He cooks for me.
dialogue: Sometimes I feel older than I am. Have you ever had such feelings?
100% I think it's pretty normal. Does running help you when it comes up?
Well it isnt a negative thing for me. Running helps in general with working through my emotions. Hows your anger?
I'm working on it. Have some books. Seems like I should probably do some running! How often are you doing it? Maybe I could join?
I run 3 times a week and you can absolutely come run with me!
When are you going next?
Thursday and Friday, You can come either day!
I'll come on Thursday. I'm sure I'll need a break on Friday since I haven't run in many, Many years. I need to buy some running shoes! What time should I meet you?
Around noon is good. I can make us some smoothies afterwards! I got a new blender because my life is very exciting.
That was truly extremely funny. I will enjoy a smoothie afterward. If I can make it that long. I'll see you Thursday at noon!
Well we will take it at your pace so you don't have to worry about it!
Perfect. I appreciate that, But eventually I'll have to catch up so I'm not holding you back.

persona: I live on the moon. I receive items from NASA. I decided to live on the moon to make history. I'm undecided about returning to earth.
I am in my 70s. I don't have any kids.
I most miss earth's trees and beaches.
dialogue: I started talking the vitaminD since the last time we talked. Hopefully it helps my health!
How long ago have you started taking it? I really hope it does help you.
It has only been a few days so I haven't noticed any big changes yet, But I am hopeful since my doctor recommended it.
Fingers crossed for you. Do you think your doctor would be open to you reducing your medication to help ease the hallucinations? That is really concerning.
He doesn't want to right now but he mentioned giving me yet another med to help with the hallucinations. How is life on the moon? Is anyone there with you?
It is a little lonely and a bit boring, But otherwise not really any complaints. Any time I get irritated, I just remind myself that I am on the moon!
That must be so cool! I have always wanted to travel to space but I don't know that I could live there by myself.
It can be unnerving at times because you know that if anything goes wrong majorly, There isn't much anyone can do to help you.
Right, That would be scary. Have you thought any further on returning to Earth?
I don't have plans to return just yet, But I assume I will have to before too long. I am getting up there in age and they'll probably want me to come back for my own health.
That makes sense and you have to see the beaches and trees at least one more time!
Yes, I really hope I get the chance. The environment is pretty sparse up here. I miss the colors!

persona: I love cheeseburgers.
I like war documentaries.
I was poor when I was young. I lived from job to job as I built up savings so that I could be stable. I was happy.
I hear UFC is pretty brutal.
I teach gym. I am tired when I say I currently teach. I was retired. I taught children. I would have the students try out each others' specialties in order to relate to one another.
dialogue: I need to practice for my wrestling match which comes this weekend.
Good luck. Do you think you will win?
With enough practice I think I've got a good shot to win. I don't know who my opponent is yet, So I really just need to focus on preparing myself.
I think you will win. Let me know if you want some workout suggestions.
I'd love to hear some ideas for more variety in my cardio workouts. I think I've got a good routine for practicing my technique, It's just cardio that is always so long and boring for me.
I'll make a list of suggestions and send it to you later. My biggest problem in keeping fit is avoiding junk food.
Great, Can't wait to hear what you come up with! If you want some tips to avoiding junk food, I've got a lot of those. I keep a really strict diet when trying to make weight for a match.

You have more willpower than I do! I used to be better when I was trying to set a good example for my class but it's become tough. Maybe we could meet up and exchange advice on workouts and avoiding bad eating habits.
That could be fun! Perhaps we could set up a time to grab a healthy lunch sometime this week after one of my morning workouts?
I like that idea, I'll try not to distract you from your match preparation too much.
I don't think it will. In fact, It'll be nice to have something to take my mind off of it!
In that case, I'm glad I can help distract you.

persona: I'm a twitch streamer.
I'm working on a robot. I'm a video game designer.
I'm allergic to water. I'm afraid of spiders.
I am a recluse.
I am working on new exciting video games. I was hoping to make the robot like a cyborg.
I will only stream my new game after it goes on sale. I think the game will be initially released on PlayStation 5. Then other platforms will follow.
dialogue: What type of game will you stream tonight?
I will most likely stream Call of duty, Frornite, Or PugB. Which type of video games do you like to play?
I really like role playing and strategy games like Diablo, Starcraft, And other games like that. They are a lot of fun. What kinds of video games do you like to design the best?
Oh okay strategy game are fun. Have you ever playedDont Starve? I like to design a combination of like RPG or Shooter games.
I've never heard of it. What is the premise of that game? What kind of platforms does that game play the best on?
It is set in a dark,Dreary world and you have to survive as long as possible, You play on PS4, Computer, Tablet. I personally played on PS4, It is a fun game.
That actually sounds really awesome. I really liked playing the scary weird games like Resident Evil and The Last of Us a lot. How far along are you on designing your robot?
Resident evil is a great game, Have you played the new one. My robot is no where near done and I still have so much programming left to do, But it will be awesome when it is finished.
I haven't played the new one yet, I don't have much time lately since I started dating Taylor. Would you recommend playing it?
Oh that is true you must be very busy with Taylor. How is it that going so far? I would defiantly recommend that game has me on the edge of my seat.

Oh it's been a pretty crazy time. She is really sweet and I love spending time with her. Obviously she is in the public eye a lot and it's tough to get time with just her. Are you dating anybody right now?
Thats is so great to hear that you are enjoying her company. I am dating but no one that is famous unfortunately.

persona: I do not party.
I have a dog named Sugar. I bake famous sugar cookies. I take my cookies to my county bake sale.
I like to knit.
I am old.
I would like to volunteer at a food bank. I donate cookies. I bake cookies.
dialogue: I made a new friend at a party, And we're going to try going on a date soon. I hope that this will be a good start and that things will work out with them.
That sounds exciting! I think you should do something you enjoy, Like going dancing.
Yes, That would be fun. But I think we're going to take it slow at first. Maybe just meet for lunch, Then see how it goes.
That's probably a good idea. Maybe go to one of the great bakeries in your town.
Yeah, That might be a good first date. Although I may eat too much and scare them off! Ha! How are your bake sales going?
They're going great, Thanks for asking! I sold more oatmeal raisin cookies than ever last week!
Wow! That's wonderful. Are you switching from sugar cookies now? I don't really like oatmeal raisin. They are more of a acquired taste, I think. Chocolate chip and sugar are my favorites.
My sugar cookies are still my most popular, But I've been perfecting my oatmeal raisins. I bet you would love them.
I'm sure I would. And yours would be my favorite, Of course. Changing topics, How is Sugar? I think its cool that your dog's name is Sugar, Especially since your sugar cookies are so famous.
Sugar is my heart, I love her to death! I definitely named her after my cookies and it fits her perfectly because she is so energetic.
Very cool. Biscuit is named after my love of cookies, Too. In England, Cookies are called biscuits, So it's kind of a play on words. Then again, I like biscuits, Too!
Does your cat have a cookie-based name too?

persona: My name is Larry.
I'm a chef and a fisherman. In my spare time I like to cook and be outside.
My favorite movie is Spiderman. I read anything with Spiderman.
I love making ice cream, and make it in the restaurant all the time. I am always looking for new ice cream recipes.
I go fishing. I have a restaurant.
dialogue: Has it been busy at your restaurant lately?
It has been getting much busier as the weather warms up. I'm in the middle of crafting a new summer menu which I think will be great.
Do you have any new ice cream recipes for the summer?
Yes, For sure! I am going to lean more on fruit flavors, Like mango and strawberry. I think customers will really like that.
I'll have to bring my kids to try it out! Maybe you could make a Spiderman themed one?
That would be super cool. Maybe a red, White, And blue colored one to match his costume. I could roll it out around 4th of July, Which the colors would play well with.
Yes! Good Idea. Do you plan to do any fishing over the summer?
I have already been out a bunch this year after things thawed. I try to get out a few times a week to get some fresh seafood for the restaurant. It is always good for specials.
Nice! I don't know anything about fishing, Im not sure if it is seasonal?
It depends on where you live, But it gets pretty chilly here and I don't like ice fishing, So it usually starts in late spring.
Where is your favourite spot to fish locally?
I have a lake nearby that I am able to usually get a decent haul from. It's smaller fish, But still very tasty.

persona: I watch old horror movies. I like old Dracula movies more than new remakes. My son is in junior high school. My son likes old horror movies.
My dad works at home depot.
I find Nascar exciting. I worked in human services.
I love dogs. I have a rescue dog.
dialogue: I know you like horror movies, Do you ever read horror stories too?
Hi yes i like to read them.
What is your favorite horror story?
My favorite is one by RL stine or Zodiac.
I used to love reading RL Stine when I was younger.
Oh yeah? What was your favorite?
I really enjoyed the entire Goosebumps series.
Yeah reminds me of being a teenager really.
Oh definitely brings back memories of the past.
Yeah i want to read them again too.
I'm sure you could find them at your local libary or digitally.
Yeah i have a few in storage too.

persona: My name is Jerry. I farm bees.
I like to cook. I fly fish.
I have no family close to me.
I like Spawn and Xmen comics.
I love papaya.
I like fruit sauces.
I like pasta. I like fish.
dialogue: Do you have a farmer's market close by where you can buy fresh fruit to cook with?
Yes i have several actually, Do you?
It is a little far but close enough. What is your favourite dish to cook?
I like to make spaghetti and meat balls.
That's nice. My kids love that. I would love to taste it one day.
Why don't you make that for them?
I always do, We love pasta in this house. Our favourite is creamy shrimp pasta.
Oh that sounds so good to try to me!!!.
Yes!!! What comic book would you recommend for me to read?
I would recommend to read of mice and men.
I haven't heard of that, But I will definitely check it out.
It is by john steinbeck a very good book.

persona: I am from California. I love living in California.
I considered being a chef for the army before.
I do not know how to cook shawarma. I cook mostly shrimp, catfish, and other seafoods. I enjoy fishing.
I love school. I am in school.
I have been to Hawaii. I like Hawaiian food. I like to eat Poke dishes. I would like to try cooking food from the UK.
I would like to travel to different countries.
dialogue: Have you found a recipe for a UK dish that you want to try? If not, I think I have a good one for you to start with.
No, I haven't. What would you recommend?
Fish and Chips is definitely the most UK think you can make. Do you like fish?
I love fish. Do you have a specific kind of fish that would work best?
I like to go with a very mild fish like cod. It's very versatile and you can really play with a lot of different flavors. You could even give it a Hawaiian twist.
That would be fun! I have a lot of oil from frying catfish. Is the breading anything special for just pretty standard fare?
I usually use a pretty standard breading. The catfish oil would be an interesting touch. I actually don't love seafood though, That's why I usually mix in stronger flavors like bacon.
I know a lot of people eat fish and chips with malt vinegar. I wonder if that would help mask the flavor a little.
I have never thought of that! Another great UK dish is a good Shepherd's Pie. Have you ever tried that?
I haven't. That's sort of like pot pie, But with mashed potatoes instead of pie crust, Right?
Exactly, It's really just meat, Veggies, And potatoes. It's another dish that you can really experiment with.
Yum, I would like to try that. Probably should do so before it gets hot out since it seems like a cool weather meal.

persona: I browse the internet a lot. I am a feminist.
I have solar panels on my roof.
I live in a small home and I only buy organic food.
I am 32. I was a fiction author. I wrote romance novels with a feminist twist. I retired at 32.
I like to cook and research vegan recipes.
I am vegan. I miss cheeseburgers. I miss eating cheese.
dialogue: I just had the most delicious vegan cheese. I think you'd love it.
I wouldn't mind trying it. I like trying new things. I had a tofu burger earlier today and it was crazy good. What are you and your best friend up to lately.

Ooh tofu burgers! I bet that's delicious! My friends and i are pretty active in social justice stuff so lately we've been part of spring cleanup things. What do you do for fun? Do you enjoy vegan cooking?

I like to read. I spend a lot of time reading since I retired. It really relaxes me. I do enjoy cooking but I like to try new things. Cooking the same thing can be repetitive. How are your "chicken" fingers you made? I might try that next.

I love to read too! I agree that being adventurous in the kitchen is fun. The chicken fingers come out great! Surprisingly you can't really taste the mushroom. I find that it's all about using the right type of mushroom -- mild ones hardly taste like what they are, And make great substitutions. What substitutions do you use for vegan stuff?
The usual stuff. I have aquafaba to replace egg whites. I use vegan butter. Obviously I find that the side ingredients are harder to properly substitute. What do you think?
I've never used aquafaba. What is it? And yeah, It can be hard to replace certain things but other things are surprisingly versatile!

It's basically water from a can of chick peas. It has the same density and texture as egg whites. I just recently started using it. I have just started expanding my vegan lifestyle so I am still in the beginning stage if you know what I mean?

Oh MY GOODNESS I never knew that!!!! I should try it some time. I already use chickpea water to make nacho chickpeas (I don't drain them then mix in nutritional yeast and seasoninings). That's so smart of you. For a beginner you already have some great tips! Have you tried using nutritional yeast yet?
I have not!!! What can you do with that? You are turning in to a great resource for my kitchen habits!
Nturitional yeastTASTES like cheese, But is actually a b12 powder.
Oh my goodness. That would be awesome to try. I would imagine all that b12 would give you so much energy.

persona: I just moved. I like healthy snacks. I'm vegan. I like hummus.
I love thrill seeking. I want to go skydiving. I've previously been on a roller coaster. I prefer the roller coasters at Heide Park.
I live in the USA, but I am from Germany.
I was told by my doctor to cut down on my salt intake. I love eating olives.
dialogue: How has it gone so far for your lowered salt intake diet? Have you been able to cut down on salt for most of your dishes, Or do you avoid eating certain meals now?
It's been tough. I've been trying but I definitely crave snacks with salt. I'm trying to replace the salty snacks with fresh vegetable and dips.
That's a smart move! It can be hard to miss that salty taste, Though. I find pickles help me with that. Do you like pickles?
I do, Along with olives. But they are so filled with sodium, I can't have them anymore.

I wonder if garlic and vinegar heavy pickles would be less sodium-y for you. You'd still get that acrid taste. It can be so hard to just cut salt right out! Is that the main dietary change you've been making?
I've cut out a lot of meat as well! I really like eating rice and beans as well as hummus and veggies.
I bet I could easily give up meat. It's not really my thing. I like cheese, Sauce, Etc and other ways to create flavor. And I'm super into hummus, Too! What flavor hummus do you like?
I like the lemon kind, It's sour and flavorful at the same time. What's your favorite?
I love red bell pepper hummus. And I recently found a recipe for buffalo hummus -- it's delicious and it hits that hot wing craving! Do you like spicy stuff?
Not so much. Does the buffalo hummus have blue cheese in it? I'm trying to avoid dairy.
Nope, No blue cheese. It has ranch seasoning and buffalo sauce and garlic and onion powders, Then the traditional hummus stuff. I avoid dairy too -- hurts my tummy!
Ranch has buttermilk in it, I think, So sounds like a no to me, Though it does sound good.

persona: My hopes and dreams are to spend time with friends having fun.
I'm 19.  I work at Burger King.  I still live in my parents' house.
I want to move out.  My parents are always on my back.  I will live with my friends.
I love to paint. I like abstract art, such as the works by Jackson Pollock.
I do not know what I want to do when I get older.
dialogue: I started a new piece of art. It is my interpretation of the "Big Bang" (the birth of the universe). Do you want to see it? Maybe you can give me some ideas to improve upon it.
Sure! I would love to give you my opinion on it. I recently started an abstract piece. I'm trying to combine something that looks like the ocean and the sky colliding.
I like that idea very much. I love anything inspired by outer space. I sold a few paintings like that in my past.
If you don't mind my asking, What is the highest amount you've sold a painting for? I've yet to have the courage to sell any of mine.

My most expensive sale was over $5k, But try not to use that as a guide because I was a professional painter in my old life. I suggest painting for the love of it and take any profits as the cherry on top.
Absolutely! I think if you follow your passion in life the money will follow. Do you attend any art trade shows or go to any museums? Where do you find most of your inspiration?
I don't attend many exhibits anymore. I draw my inspiration from my past. I had a very difficult life and it is very therapeutic to paint about it.
Oh, I'm sorry to hear that. It's great that you've found a therapeutic way to handle that burden.
Thank you. I was actually able to use the profits from my paintings to get away from my troubles and branch out on my own, So art has been a real life-saver for me.

persona: I love rollercoasters and skydiving. I love swimming but I'm a bad swimmer.
I'm vegan. I love hummus.
I'm a software engineer at Boeing. I just moved from Germany to live with my family. I'm getting used to the time difference.
I like European football. My favorite team is Bayern Munich.
I like watching cycling. I watch the Tour de France.
I like the winter Olympics more than Summer Olympics. I went to the 2006 Winter Olympics in Turin.
I like to snow ski. I like to go sky diving.
dialogue: I read a great article on the upcoming Tour de France and it was very eye opening, I would like to send it to you. I think you would enjoy the read.
I'm sure I would enjoy it, Please send it to me. Have you ever went to watch the Tour de France in person?
No I always wanted to go. I think it would be really exciting seeing it in person. Have you?
Yes, A few years ago there was a leg of the Tour inDsseldorf and I was lucky enough to see them go past.
That sounds amazing. I have however been to some football matches, I am excited for the season. I think the Bayern Munich have a good team this year, Do you like their chances?
They are going to win Bundesliga, I can just feel it. They are unstoppable!
Maybe some time I can come visit you in Germany. I'm getting close to being done with Grad School. We can go to a game together!
I like that idea. For now, I think you should take me to an American Football game. You can teach me the rules and tell me who I should support.
I can do that for sure. It's a lot different than European Football but I'm sure you'll catch on right away.
I've tried to learn but there are just so many different players. I couldn't keep it all straight in my head.
You don't have to take it too serious, Just come out and we can have fun. Maybe have a beer or two and just catch up.
Sounds like a great idea. We can organize a time to do it later.

persona: I'm a musician. I play guitar.
I am learning Spanish. My favorite word in Spanish is trabajo. I'm not good at speaking Spanish. I am taking a Spanish class.
I like tacos.
I teach music to kids and young adults.
I have children.
I like horses. I don't have a pet. I like parrots.
dialogue: I've been so busy with school. My animals are feeling a bit neglected. I think I'll go brush my horses to unwind.
I remember you said you have goats on your farm. Is there any special care you have to do for goats?
Every day I have to check on them. That includes feeding, Letting out in the yard, Cleaning their pens, Etc.
Taking care of animals is a lot of work. It does sound rewarding though. How's the spanish going?
With the law school, Horses, Dogs, Cats, Chickens, And goats, I strangely find little time to think in Spanish.
Yes, I can see how that would take over. How much longer do you have of law school?
I should be done at the end of next year. It is very demanding.
What are you plans for your law degree? What is your specialty?
I've been focusing on criminal defense. I think I should like to work for a firm in NYC doing criminal defense.
That would be very exciting and very demanding. Like the TV show Law & Order, Haha. I wish you good luck! I think I'll go play my guitar. Do you play instruments?
