That makes sense. How long will the internship last?
Seven months, But we will see how it goes. What did you learn in school?

Not a whole lot. I went into martial arts pretty soon after high school and most of what I learned in high school has not been very useful in my career. If I went to college, I probably would have studied physical therapy or something like that.
That's amazing. Do you enjoy working as a stunt double?

It's a lot of fun! I've had the chance to meet a lot of really cool and interesting people. Some actors are a lot more chill than others. I met Ryan Reynolds on the set of Deadpool and he was a really awesome guy.
I could imagine. You're very lucky to have met Ryan Reynolds, That would be a dream come true for me.
It was quite honestly one of the best experiences in my life. I was only on set for one day but still amazing. I'm sure you'll end up with some crazy work stories from doing family/divorce law!
Haha yes I actually look forward to that. I will be sure to tell you if I do.
I look forward to it! Are you ready to be done with school? These last two months must be brutal.
Very much so, But very worth it and very important. But I am very excited for the next chapter of my life.

persona: My boyfriend and I will be living together in an apartment on the outskirts of the city Philadelphia. I am excited to live with my boyfriend. I am an elementary school teacher.
I speak fluently English, Spanish, French.
My favorite colors are red and silver.
I like teaching science, especially nature subjects.
I enjoy it. We do a little bit of Spanish and French.
dialogue: Would you like to come with your boyfriend to our place for a barbeque?
Yes absolutely. Should i bring any food or drinks?
That sounds good. Would you mind bringing a dessert? I will take care of the drinks. What do you like?
Yes i can bring a dessert. I would like a beer if you are talking about drinks.
Sounds good, I have some really good IPA's from a brewery I visited on a trip. How is work going?
Its going well. I enjoy teaching about science.
How are your students this year? Have you had any issues?
There is one child that causes problems but the rest are great.
Oh good. How is your new apartment? Have you moved in yet?
Yes i've moved. It is fantastic and i love it.
How is Philadelphia? What do you like about living there?
I love how rude people are and all the cheesesteaks.

persona: I am planning to move to California.
I am a doctor.
I have a lot of student loans to repay.
I have an electric car.
I make  applications to the California hospitals.
dialogue: Are you happy owning an electric vehicle?
Yes I love my EV. I never have to worry about gas or how much is costs or if it's available.
I have always wondered how they work. Do you plan on switching your car anytime soon?
No, Not at all. There are plenty of options for me to recharge and keep my vehicle powered so I don't think I should fix what isn't broke.
I completely understand. What color is your car and is a small? Are all electric cars small?
No, They are not tiny cars at all, Although some are but it's not because they are electric.
If I wanted one do you have any recommendations on which one I should get?
I love my Tesla.. It's large and I have not had any problems at all with it.
I saw a video of a Tesla yesterday. They are absolutely amazing. What feature do you love the most?
I just love that it is electric, Most other features are available in regular cars as well.
I saw that you could watch tv on the screen. I was shocked to find that you could even watch youtube. That's also an awesome feature.
Yeah I don't really care about that stuff. I use my car to drive and not play around. People can do that stuff on their phones\.

persona: I love chocolate.
I prefer music with a bassline.
My favorite color is purple. I like to play ping pong. I have a purple ping pong table.
I have a father.
dialogue: We should play ping pong together.
That would be fun. Ping pong is one of my favorite things to do. Especially on my fancy table... Ha!
So is that it, We definitely playing? Is it game on? :-).
Yep. Can you come over this weekend? We can play some music and then hit the table.
That sounds like a plan do you fancy having a small wager on who will be the winner?
Well, Whatever you want to lose... Ha! Hey, Have you been practicing the electric guitar lately?
I have actually. I standing in awe at the genius of Jimi Hendrix. And Jimmy Page to be honest!
Fun. I'd like to listen to you sometime if you don't mind. I bet you're pretty good.
I am ok I suppose. Why don't I bring my guitar around when we get together and I'll play some music for you? You might need to provide the baseline though!
Sounds like a plan. Let's do it.
Shall we get something to eat like takeout? What kind of food do you like?

How about something easy like pizza. I also have several of the large chocolate bars for desert. My father always picks me up chocolate whenever he's at the store. He's been doing it for years. What a sweetheart.

persona: I walk dogs as a job and I like reading.
I sing and also dance.
My mom and dad were street walkers. Me and my family used to live in the shelter. My parents were sex workers.
I also love kayaking. I have a kayak.
I am in Alabama. I have traveled to South Carolina several times, including Charleston.
I am a rock and blues musician.
I have not gone to a Celtic folk music show.
dialogue: My volunteer work at the homeless shelter is going well, But the volunteering and teaching is keeping me very busy. I can't wait until I can travel again.
Where would you like to go first?
I really want to travel around Europe. So many different countries and cultures within such a small space.
Have you ever been overseas before?
I went backpacking around Thailand once for 6-months. It was like a real adventure. There are some parts of it that people never visit and it is almost undiscovered by the West.
That sounds facinatoing, Do you speak the language there?
No way. Apart from picking up a few simple words it's a very hard language to learn I think. In Europe though I think I've had a good go at speaking French.
I speak some french, And some german. It seems easier in german. When do you think you will be going to europe?
For the summer I think. But it is more expensive to travel in the summertime so I don't know really. I just want to hit the road again!
Have you thought about taking a ship across rather than flying?
I have thought about it actually but I do get seasick.
Deamamine helps, An it gets very exciting. would you like to go together with me?

persona: I like hip hop. I like Travis Scott.
I love lite bite. I have an older sister.
My mom is a dentist.
I have been out of town recently. My sister and I went to Fort Worth for a BBQ. We have BBQs in Forth Worth annually.
I play basketball. I like being outdoors. I like hanging out with friends. I like mimosas.
dialogue: What is the best champagne to use for mimosas?
That's a great question, It doesn't matter too much, Just whatever is cheapest.

Oh really, I would of thought the more expensive the champagne the better taste it would have. But if it tastes just as good with cheap champagne then that's even better! Do you and your friends love mimosas or is it just you? Lots of girls love Gin now don't they?
Who doesn't love mimosas?! Expensive champagne is better but it only makes a small difference. Gin is a good option too! Personally, I save mimosas for brunches and gin for nights out.

Well they do taste great, Especially when the weathers nice, Being able to enjoy brunch in the sun makes all the difference sometimes. It's always great to catch up with some friends after a long time of not seeing each other, There's always some gossip to chat about.
And there's so much to catch up on these days! Nothing like a good brunch or BBQ to bring everyone together again.
Exactly. Bbq's are great to bring family members together as well, Listening to some great music outdoors with a few drinks and some amazing food. How was your annual BBQ? Was it nice weather?
Weather was excellent! The BBQ was really great. What are your favorite things to do with friends?

persona: I am 56. I am a female.
I paint.  My family does not visit me.
I clean houses.
I like raw steaks. I like eggs.
I also want to be a volunteer. I do have empathy. I love kids a lot.
dialogue: It would be so engaging if you show me your paintings!
I would love to! I am pretty lonely these days so it would be nice to have someone come to visit me.
Do you have any paintings that you have done recently?
Yes, I try to paint a least a little bit every day. I have set up a studio in my spare bedroom, And sometimes I even try to go outside and paint the beauty that I see in nature.
Thats great! I love nature paintings. Maybe I could come over and we could grill out some cheeseburgers.
That sounds great! I can also cook up some bacon for the burgers and make a salad with bacon bits in it... Of course! I have a nice fire pit we can sit around.
Yes bring on the bacon! Nights are a little cool these days so a fire pit sounds good.
Do you play any instruments? I find it is nice to have a little sing song session around the fire with my guitar.
I can play the tamborine but thats about it, And you certainly don't want to hear me sing!!.
It's just for fun! I know some great campfire songs and we can even roast marshmallows and makes'mores!
I love smores! Do you like your marshmallows burned or just toasted?
I like them to be almost burnt to a crisp! How do you like yours?

persona: I love cheeseburgers. I love watching war documentaries.
I am a retired gym teacher. I am not married.
I like to volunteer at soup kitchens.
I grew up poor.
I like cardio and sports. I have a generic fitbit.  I try to be thrifty.
dialogue: You mentioned being thrifty. As I continue planning this wedding costs are skyrocketing. Do you have any ideas for how I could save some money?
I have seem but I don't know if you can be interested.
I'm very interested. I would love to hear about what I could do to save money for my wedding.
First it will be good that you avoid unnecessary expenditure and save that money.
That's a great first step. I like spending money but haven't bought anything yet. Are you interesting in getting married?
Yeah some time later thou I have no idea how to go about it can you help?
I would be happy to give you some pointers on how to find someone you can marry. You should start saving money now.
Thanks for the tip is there anything else.
I would start by trying some dating apps. You'll be able to talk to other people who want to get married as well.
Well i would like to know how I can pick somebody interested.
I would start by trying to find someone who also likes cheeseburgers. What other things would you look for?
I like cheese burgers and cakes do you have kids.

persona: I've worked in my field for fifteen years. I'm happy in my current field of work.
I am a man born in America. I enjoy sports.
I have dogs. I take my dogs to the beach every morning.
My son is four years old. I want my son to like football.  I go to the beach with my son. I want to have an activity both my son and I enjoy together.
I live near the ocean.
I want my son to love animals like I do.  My son loves dogs.  I want my son to like school.
dialogue: I just had a space open up in the swim class I teach. Are you interested in signing your son up to learn from me?
I'm not. I used to swim competitively for school.
That's cool! What made you stop?
When i started college I was too busy to stay in the best shape possible for the sport.
That's a good thing to do, What do you do to stay in shape now?
I hike when I have the time.
That's always fun, Do you bring your doggies?
I dont, Im afriad that a coyote will get them.
Aw, They would love to join you! What about your son?
My son is too young to be able to handle the trails unfortunately. I do have a work friend that goes with me from time to time.
Fun stuff, How are you doggies doing with the son? I'm guessing they've been getting along swimingly!
Definitely, They keep him entertained and they also keep him safe while were distracted.

persona: I work in a bookstore. I studied Chemistry.
I hate the color orange.
I do salsa dancing and ballet. It took me two months to learn to dance. I Prefers salsa to ballet. I dance all the time.
dialogue: Guess what?! I finally gave in and got a smartphone.
Heck Yeah! You'll love it, It might take some time getting used to though. Do you operate with tech like smartphones and computers well?

Well I have never had a smartphone or been the best with technology, So it's going to be a new experience for me but I am certainly up to the challenge. I'm going to get my grandchildren to set it up for me.
How old are your Grandchildren? My husband and i have a kid and he's crazy smart with that kind of stuff.

Well there are three, Andew, Jason and Lucy. Andrew is 8, Jason is 13 and Lucy is 18. I swear kids are amazing with technology nowadays, They can spend hours on their phones. I remember when I was little, We didn't have technology to keep us entertained, We had a ball to kick about and it would entertain us for hours on end. How old is your boy? He seems very intelligent.
My boy is 12. It's crazy how much more advanced schools are nowadays, He's already learning Algebra. Who's the mother of you Grandchildren?

Oh 12 is a lovely age, I bet your boy would get on well with our Jason. I know, Schools are really improving their quality and level of education nowadays, They have so many resources it's brilliant. My daughter Sophie is the mother, She is doing so well with the kids whilst working full time. Her partner isn't so active with the children so they often visit when she's busy with work, For me to take care of them. Do you plan on having more kids?
Me and my husband work a lot so i doubt we could handle another child very well, So well just focus on our one, Levi. Does her partner work a lot or are they just distant?

Yes that's a good decision to make, I can tell you from experience it's not the best decision to have too many children and too little time. Our Sophie unfortunately struggles with that. Well he was active at the start of the children's lives and worked part time to help with the bills but unfortunately something changed in him, He just left one day without explanation so Sophie had to get another job to pay for her bills.
Oh that's horrible! Why in the world are people like that, I hate that!

I know, Some people are just a waste of time! I can understand children are very challenging at times however you would think after the first two kids, You'd realize if you cannot take care of them. You said you love dancing, Does Levi ever partake? It would be lovely if he enjoyedSalsa too.
Haha no, He gets weirded out when me and my husband dance together. Levi is a little bit of recluse in his room, Although he's a smart young boy. Does your youngest grandchild have a smartphone?

persona: I do not play any instruments. I kayak for fun.
I would love to visit a foreign country.
I speak a little Spanish. I like to read.
I am a grad student studying Psychology. I like chocolate.
I hope to visit Spain when I save enough money.
I have a job line up for after I finish my finals. My dog walking business will be my job for a while till I get back from a holiday.
dialogue: I need to get ready for my holiday vacation.
What part of China will you be going to?
I am going to Beijing where i plan to walk along the Great Wall. Where in Spain do you hope to visit?
I'm going to the Basque country.
Oh fantastic, Do you like Spanish food? I love tapas. Hopefully you will save the money you need to go there soon.
I love tapas as well. Spain has such a rich tradition in food. I hope so too, Its slowly coming together.
Oh fantastic, Best to visit Spain in the summer. When do you start your new job and what is it that you will be doing?
After I get my degree. I will practice clinical therapy in the city.
That sounds exciting, Are you looking forward to it? Will you move house?
No, I went to school in the same city I want to practice in.
Ok which city is that?
I have been living in San Francisco for school and will also work here.

persona: I live in Ohio.
I do not have any kids. I have a musician.
I like to study languages.
I like true crime documentaries. I like Joe Kenda and the People Investigates series.
dialogue: I felt my baby move for the first time!
Wow how exciting! How many months along are you in your pregnancy?
This is month 5.
Halfway through! Has the morning sickness stopped?
Kind of... It's more or less subsided, But the fear of waking up feeling terrible is always there and probably will be for the forseeable future.
Yeah that's understandable. Have you seen any good documentaries lately?
I watched seaspiracy on netflix the other day and now i can't eat seafood so I shouldn't have done that.
I haven't heard of that one yet.. Is it about how nasty seafood is because they literally filter the water?
It's about garbage in the ocean, Overfishing, And how all the ways they tell us they are working to improve it are just set up by big business to fool people.
Why would the big businesses want to fool people?
Money... The answer is always money.
Yeah, Doesn't seem feasible that they could care about the ocean while still fishing it.

persona: My name is Kim.
I do not like hat-hair. I do not like to sweat.
I am retired. I do not like snow.
I used to work for airlines. I like to grill. I like to gamble. I cut the grass.
I live in Florida. I am old. I fit in where I live. I prefer the ocean and not the lakes.
I get bored. I miss having my schedule full with work sometimes.
dialogue: How do you spend your retirement days?
I take my dog to the beach and we go watch the birds and the other people enjoying the view.
I cant wait until Im where you are at. I really need to retire soon. I hope afterwards we can spend some time by the ocean.

Retirement isnt all that its cracked up to be. I go to the beach to get my head clear. Cabin fever can settle in sometimes since there isnt anything to do anymore aside from normal household things. It would be nice to have another person to spend the time with.
Im struggling to make it all work though, I feel I really need a change Kim. Im ready to take my bike and just get away for a while.

When I was younger I told my boss I needed toreorient my outlook on life because it was affecting my performance. He gave me time to go out into the wilderness and hike and clear my head for a month in the colorado rockies. It was definitely worth it and most of the things I learned on that trip were also things I apply when I get too bored now.
You should come over and we can grill out, Catch up, And just spend some time relaxing off our feet. I know you have been busy but I hope we can make it happen soon.
I would love to once the CDC clears everything. This virus has made retirement even more boring with there being nothing to go out and do.
Maybe the casinos are open I know you always liked going to gamble and have some fun.
Ive seen some of their daytime TV commercials and they do look like they are starting to reopen. Most of them are turning into vaccine locations though and I would hate to make others nervous.
We just need to do something Kim, Maybe just stop down when Im done waiting tables and we can have a few drinks.
I dont know if I can make the trip to Cairo.

persona: I used to be in the military.
I volunteer at a bunny sanctuary.
I work at a ship yard.
I would consider adopting a bunny for myself.
My military background help keeping everything organized.
dialogue: I should work hard and need to collect all information to join military.
I have worked in the military before and I agree, You should definitely check it out--head down to your nearest recruitment center and they should be able to help place you and answer all questions.
And it's worth it to join the military?
Yes! There is a lot of skills to be learned by being in the military. Not just job skills, But life skills as well, Like discipline.
That is true. I need more discipline in my life as i'm more of a layabout these days.
You can start giving yourself a headstart by waking up to an alarm every morning and creating a schedule for yourself--like when you will eat and shower.
Yeah. I guess if you join the military you definitely need to start making sure your butt is out of bed at a specific time.
Yes, Better for you to learn it now than later. They can also help you figure out what kind of career you would like and put you through college as well.
Yeah. I wonder if college and health is the real incentive of it all. Like other countries just have that stuff for free already, But we bundle it with our military here.
It is definitely an incentive to join the military, Even if it's only to learn those skills and receive the compensation.
I think that's why the military targets the poorest population so heavily because it feels like a lifeline out of their circumstances.
Yes that could be, But they are also the people who would benefit the most out of serving the military.

persona: I am from Alabama. I work in construction. I learned construction from my dad.
I have 5 cats. I rescued those cats at one time. They are very special to me.
I like to cook. Watching the Food Network or following cooks on Facebook is a good way to learn to cook. I cook pasta liguene.
I work hard. I worked my way up the ladder with my strong work ethic. I make good money. I am my own boss. I am happy.
dialogue: How are your cats doing?
They are doing wonderful, Thank you for asking! They have all been getting along and the one, Groucho, Has been coming out of hiding more recently, And joining the other cats!
My cat is what I call a scrap cat and he terrorizes the neighborhood. His name is Bubbles.
Oh I didn't know you had a cat, Or is it just a stray cat that stays in the neighborhood?
It's a little of both. I claim ownership but he also visits other houses that probably claim ownership as well. He's just that loveable.
Aw that's wonderful that the whole village is helping to raise Bubbles! It would be nice if more communities did that.
I've actually read where stray cats like that are super bad for the other animals and wildlife in neighborhoods so it's probably a mixed bag ecologically speaking.
Yes, They are subjected to a lot of disease that way and they disrupt the local ecosystems, Like birds, Rodents, Reptiles.
But Bubbles is just so handsome I let it slide.
Yeah and some cats, Once they are free outside, Are very hard to keep indoors and they usually get sad or angry.
I should probably formally adopt him and turn him into that kept man status.
Haha, Yes! If you do I would suggest getting him a nice large cat tree, Toys and of course a place to hide. Let me know if you keep him!

persona: I live in the city. I used to live on a farm. I'm homeless. I may move back to the country.
I have a drinking problem.
I use to teach dancing. I live in a box.
I am 45. My mother is dead.
I struggling with finding something to make me happy.
I want to open a dance studio. I need a job.
dialogue: What did you do before you became homeless?
I was living with my wife on my old family farm, But we have split up because of my mental health.
Yeah and in this country mental health issues get pushed way down on the things people actively care about helping.
It can be hard to get out of a hole once you are so far down into it. It's hard to find help.

I'd say it's damn near impossible. There's the lack of money, The stigma associated with it, The distrust of others, Etc... It's an absolute pit and very few people actually want to help people out of it.
I don't hold other people responsible for my actions and I don't expect people to help me. It's hard to find help sure, But I accept that I am responsible for myself, Not other people.

I'd feel the opposite. Mental issues are completely out of your control yet you are saddled with them regardless. I think it would do us all a world of good if there were more help out there to alleviate things that are completely out of our control.

They are not completely out of my own control. I choose to be homeless and the fact that there are not more people to help is not any one persons fault. I could get any job, But I choose to be picky so I can hold out for a better one.

Maybe thats true, But there is also the issue that your brain is not functioning like a normal person's brain so it literally tells you to go against yourself. It's telling you that you deserve to be homeless because certain cognitive functions are wired incorrectly and tell you the opposite of what other peoples brains tell them.

No it is not and I find it absurd that someone else is insisting to me how my own brain works---or rather that it doesn't work, Simply because I am choosing to be homeless. You don't know me, Don't act like you do or you are some armchair psychologist.
Maybe that's true as well... Just get help any way you can.
Thank you I will. Have you spoken with your dad recently?

persona: I have a red and blue striped race motorbikek. I have been racing on my motorbike for 10 years. I wear a helmet and safety eyewear when I ride my motorbike.
I race motorcycles.  I have a race in two weeks.
I live in Tennessee.  I will be racing in Birmingham, Alabama at Barber Motorsports Park.
dialogue: My doctor says I am recovering well from my surgery. She says that I might be able to learn to ride motorcycles if I continue to recover.
I really hope you can. I know you had a lot a lot of struggles with your heart condition. If you want you can come watch me race in a few weeks.
That would be amazing! I'm not sure if I'll be done with my follow-up but I would like to get tickets if I can. If not, Will it be televised?
Yes it will be for sure. No need to buy tickets though I can get you some for free. I know itll be good for you to get out of the house.
Absolutely. I've been cooped up so much lately, But I'm feeling pretty strong like I could make it. Is Barber Park a dirt track?
Yes it is. Its a little difficult but I think I have a decent chance. Have you ever been there before?
No, I've hardly gone anywhere but I'm very excited for you! What happens if you win?
If I do Ill win a decent amount of money and get an automatic entry into other events. Maybe we can take the winnings and take that fishing trip you always wanted to go on.
Aw, You're so sweet. I didn't know you liked fishing. If we catch anything I can cook you up a great meal.
Sounds great are there any good fishing spots in Pennsylvania?
Certainly! We have lots of lakes. Lake Erie is probably the most famous.
I cant wait until we can get together again. Be it at my race or afterwards. I hope you feel good enough to make it.

persona: I have an ex-boyfriend.
I had a birthday recently. I am 18 years old. My parents forgot my birthday. My parents are self-absorbed. I do not get along with them.
I have a pet fish named Finley. My pet fish is a Beta.
I love sunrises and sunsets. I own and use a camera. I take many pictures of the sky.
dialogue: I talked to my girlfriend and we want you to feel unforgotten, Be on the lookout for a giant panda with balloons at your front door soon.
Awww, Thank you so much! It was hard when my parents forgot my birthday but this will help!
Yeah... I mean pandas are kind of nature's dumbest animal when it comes to perpetuating their species, But they make a nice stuffed animal.
Haha, That's really funny! Did you and your girlfriend get to go out for your anniversary?
We did. It was nice to get out there and enjoy ourselves.
That's great. I hope you got to take some pictures of the sunset that night.
I think the air pollution around here really makes our sunsets pop. I guess our lung damage is the cost of a beautiful sunset.
That's unfortunate. Where do you go to take your pictures then?
Oh wherever I am with a camera I guess. That's the beauty of camera phones anymore. Wherever the mood may strike.
I would love to see some of your pictures. Do you ever take pictures in your garden?
I absolutely take photos of my garden. It's my muse really. Plus it motivates me to keep planting it year after year.
What types of plants and flowers are your favorites to grow?

persona: I garden. I do outdoor walking.
I have a dog.
I go to church every week.
I am a school teacher. I handle senior chemistry. We have lab day.
dialogue: Does you dog enjoy walks with you?
Yes my dog enjoys taking walks with me. His name is Winston. Does your cat like going on walks?
That is such a cute name! My cat does go outside, But not for walks! I go for walks myself though, I like to hike. Maybe I should get a dog then to keep me company.
Dogs make great companions when going on walks. I would highly recommend it. Do you walk for exercise?
Yes, I try to get outside at least once a day for exercise and to clear my mind. Sometimes I listen to a meditation as well when I go for walks.
That's a great idea. Taking time for yourself is very important. I walk to church every week.
That's a great idea! How far of a walk is it to Church? I have been meaning to start attending church again.
It's about mile. I think its nice exercise when the weather is good. I often take my dog with me. Church can be a nice thing to do.
Is your dog allowed in the church or does he have to wait outside? It sounds like a wonderful way to spend a Sunday.
He waits patiently outside like a good dog. Many people like to pet him when talking by. Is your church close enough that you can walk there?

I would say my church is probably about 4 miles, So technically I could walk there but I am not sure if I would want to make that trek every week! Maybe once in a while if I am feeling up for it haha.
That sounds like good exercise. Would you take your cat with you?

persona: I have cats. My cats and I watch the birds. I watch birds in my backyard. I saw a blue jay. I like to bird watch with my mom.
I did not drink coffee. My doctor said not to drink coffee.
I am sad when the holidays are coming. My kids do not come. I am old.
I am on a carnivore diet. I have had good results with the diet. My skin looks better because of the diet. I like Joe Rogan.
dialogue: You'll never believe it but a peacock has been at my bird feeder!
No way! How did that happen?! That is way too cool! Do you think it is someone's pet that got loose?
More than likely Frank across the way forgot to put his in the pens last night and this one has been over here for a hot minute stealing from my robins.
Ahhh. Were you able to track it's next location? Is Frank worried?!.
Frank is gone for the next couple days. Im gunna try to put on some protective clothing and watch a youtube video about how to catch one. This might get pretty interesting.

Good luck! I do not have much experience with peacocks. I wish I could be of more help! You will have to keep me updated on the whereabouts of this peacock! Have you brought in your little league team for a search party?
Not yet. But that was the plan. I need the kids to provide a backdrop of chaos so that I can be the calm protagonist and capture the bird in a peaceful manner.
Haha. I like your plan! It sounds almost fool-proof! Do you have a plan B?
Animal control is the plan B but Frank is real particular about who touches his peacock.
Yeah... I can understand that. Animal control tries their best, But they don't know animals like the ones who take care of the animal!
Exactly Franks state of mind. I would rather it be an ostrich. At least then he wouldn't get so uppity about its show worthyness.
Oh my! I have heard that ostriches can be quite moody and more dangerous!

persona: I'm a watch dealer cashier at a pawn shop.
I love shoes.
My parents won't let me work as a stripper. A queen paid me to dance. I strip because my parents won't buy me a Rolls Royce.
I want a dog. I would like to have a companion that gives me unconditional love.
dialogue: Any updates on your decision on getting a dog?
I've been looking at breeds on youtube, Trying to figure out if I'll get a breed dog, Or a shelter dog maybe. Where did you get your dogs?
Shelter. So many shelter dogs out there and I can't stomach the fact that they get put down if no one takes them. A dog is the best companion there is.
Maybe could be a mix of both. I've learned that cats that are black at the shelter, Get adopted less, Due to superstition. Also need a breed that maybe doesn't need miles of walking a day.
I've heard that as well. Black cats are gorgeous though. I'm not sure what dog doesn't require that much walking as they are so energetic to begin with.

In my research, Several breeds of dogs, Especially smaller dogs, Are less in need of physical exercise, Than other breeds. Border collie for example, Would pass on that, Although loved one in the past. What are your dogs like?
He's a german shepard and he's super strong. He's almost 10 years old but he can still pull me wherever he wants me to go on our walks.
German shepherds have great personalities. They can be really big sometimes too!
Oh yeah he's a monster. If you could find a german shepard in the shelter I would suggest getting one.
I appreciate your thoughts there. For my home and life, That would be too big. Medium or small size for this home! Wonder if they have smaller bred German shepherds. I'd consider that.
There is a similar breed to the german shepard that I think is smaller. They used one in John Wick 3.
Maybe I'll check that out. Have yet to see that movie. I appreciate these days, They are kinder to animals in movies, From what I hear.

persona: I am not married. My girlfriend has a chihuahua. We are mixed race couple.
I work in the west virginia coal industry.
I enjoyed playing sport when I was younger.
i have a small dog.
dialogue: My puppies went missing yesterday.
Oh man i'm sorry to hear that. I've heard that if your dog goes missing the best thing to do is find some clothing with your scent on it and leave it at the last place you saw your dog.
Thanks for the thought, They were gone for over an hour and I was very worried. They wandered back around dinner time, Of course! Lots of relief there.
I know the feeling. If my dog were to get loose at his size he'd be gone for sure. Unless he's picked up by another person and then he'd just annoy them too much to take and they'd bring him back.
I think microchipping is a good call for dogs, When they have lost their tag. When these guys get older, The vet will be giving them a microchip. Do you chip your dog?
I did. I think it's worth it as it's pretty safe for the dog and most dog owners know about the program so hopefully they would take it to get checked out if he goes missing.
I like that we agree on that. It's a thoughtful thing that can be a real life saver I think. Especially since you mention your dog is smaller, Yes?
Oh yeah... He's a feisty chihauhua and he's a little terror.
That breed has a reputation for being a little barky sometimes. Some of the best youtube videos, Are of chihuahuas growing at their owners! Hehe.
I've seen most if not all of those videos and have thought about submitting my own. They are definitely not a dog for everyone though, But he's adorable in a little psycho kind of way.
I get the feeling you are attached to that little dog. They can be such a huge presence! I end up wrapping my life around the dogs sometimes.
Painfully attached. I'm actually nursing a bandage on my arm from him right now that he gave me a few nights ago.

persona: I am dreading the holidays.
I like watching birds with my pet cats. I spend a lot of time advocating for animal rights.
I love star wars , specifically the lights and the fighting scenes. I dyed my hair like a rainbow for the last movie.
I am older than your grandparents.
I want to grow my hair very long.
Blue is my favorite color. I prefer electric blue to darker blue.
dialogue: Did you end up watching any of the Star Wars movies for May 4th?
I sure did, I watched the first 3 back to back, With my hair died electric blue!

Haha amazing! I only ended up watching the first one as I had to go and visit my parents in the day. They weren't particularly keen on my hair dye but they're used to me by now! Have you watched any other movies recently?
Im watching an old British Sci-Fi called Quatermass, There are a few of them, Its really good.

I haven't seen that before, I'll have to check it out. I'm trying to watch some more old classic films at the moment. For example I watched The Great Escape the other day and the tune has been stuck in my head ever since!
The great escape is a great film, I really like Steve McQueen in that movie. Do you enjoy war movies?

Yea he's great isn't he. I do like war movies, Though I must admit occasionally they depress me a bit, Especially if they are based on real situations where thousands of people were dying! But hey, It's important to know about those times in history. Do you like war movies?
I like the old ones where its all more romanticised. My favourite is 'The Dam Busters' about the RAF bombing a Dam in WW2.
It's funny you mention that film, My grandmother (who is really into history) told me to watch it! I will have to put that one on my list too.
Another great one is 'The Bridge on the River Kwai', About guys having to build a bridge whilst they are prisoners of war, That is an incredible movie.

Thanks for the recommendation, I'll check that out too. I also recently watched "O Brother Where Art Thou" which was absolutely bizarre but I would recommend it for the soundtrack and the fact that apparently it's a"cult classic"!.
Yes iv seen that, Its a Koen brothers movie i think?: Again thats a great movie, I should watch it again.

persona: I eat lot of chocolates.
I am 5 years old. I like to talk.
I wish to be a dog when I grow up. I love dogs.
I like to play with blocks and sing the alphabet.
I am young and my mom buys almost everything from me.
I love Legos and puzzles. I enjoy Star Wars, architecture, and car legos.
dialogue: My dog just ate one of my favorite pairs of shoes!
Oh no. I hope it wasn't one of those really limited pairs. What kind of shoes were they?
One of my favorite Tory Burch's! It's okay, Though... I do love my dog more than my shoes. Lol.
Oh no! And yeah, Puppers can be rascals. At least they werent Botegga or Jimmy Chus.
True, I guess. But still! Tory Burch is expensive! When is the last time you bought a pair of designer shoes?
About ten years ago. I had a pair of gucci slippers that my mom bought me with my allowance money.
And... What happened to them?! Do you still have them?!.
My feet got bigger and I couldnt wear them anymore. Mom has them in a cabinet will some of my other baby stuff.
Well shoot! That's so sweet of your mom to save your baby stuff. She must really love you.
She does, But sometimes I do things that upset her. Like one time. I went to open something while she was cleaning dishes and some wood stain fell out and spilled all over her ferragamos.
No way! It sounds like that was a situation where "it takes two to tango" LOL.
Definitely. My allowance went towards a new pair. Its ok, I learned a lesson.

persona: I like riding hourses. I have a fafm field.
I love rock music. My favorite band is ACDC. I like indie.

I have three horses.  I used to have cats when I was younger. I rode horses a little bit as a child.  When I was about 10, I went through a horse-phase.  I ride horses through woods and fields.  I'm not into jumping, unless there it is on a trail.
I've gone scent-bag hunting, but I like foxes and rabbits too much and I don't think I will hunt again.
I like a good old Southern meat-and-three restaurant.
I would like a food trip around the world.  I like pho with meatballs and tendon with all the toppings.
dialogue: Have you ever raced horses?
I have not. I have watched them race though. I'm too heavy to be a jockey.
I think it looks like a lot of fun! Especially the races where you have to jump but I guess that's pretty different to the kind of horse riding you like.
I like riding for the enjoyment. I like being friends with an animal and forming trust as a bond between the two of us. I live out in the Olympics and have tons of trails I can ride.
That must be so relaxing riding through the trails and being in nature. How long would a typical ride be for you?
Anywhere from a few hours to a couple days. Depends on what season it is and what is interesting.
Oh wow that's so changeable, You must really love it. Do you just ride one horse?
No the place that keeps them is a place that rents them out. I have two that I ride normally but there are others that periodically shuffle through.
That sounds great getting to ride a variety of horses - it must be a totally different experience with each one even if you're riding the same trails.
They all have different personalities and habits.
I'd say so - just like people haha!!.
Definitely! Have you ever ridden one?

persona: I like Bach. I like rock music.
I am a farmer. I have three Arabian horses on my farm. I love riding horses.
I enjoy equestrian.
I can fix a broken tractor.  I have a farm mostly for my horse, but I do tend to some crops. I have multiple Arabian horses.
I am performing a routine with one of my Arabians to the music of Bach. I love my horses and I'd do anything to care for them.
dialogue: I was able to fix my tractor. I would still like to ride horses with you at some point.
That would be awesome! I am currently training the one I plan to do that routine with.
Is that the routine where you have classical music playing? I really think you do a good job with that.
Yes! I think my horse love Bach as much as me. How are the cats?
They are doing great. They definitely keep the mice away. I wish I had space for more animals though.
Well you're always more than welcome to come by the farm, Or even keep animals at my farm.
I would love that. I love Arabian horses, I think they are very majestic. I can bring by some feed for the horses, I have a lot of spare corn from last harvest.
I think that would be great! I really love taking care of them.
Maybe when I retire soon I will look into getting a horse if you have the space for one more. Hopefully my tractor doesnt cost me any more time or money.
Oh that's right, You're retirement really is coming up soon. Are you ready?
Yeah I really am. I talked to my sister and she thinks its about time too.
I am so happy for ya!

persona: I plan to buy a home next year.
I have a girlfriend. She doesn't want to have a baby. I want children.
I am busy with my career. I have a tight work schedule. I work for a music label. I did an accounting course in college.
I have a thing for women who eat a lot.
I like watching movies. I like listening to music.
I had a golden retriever growing up.
dialogue: I took my golden retriever for a long walk to the park.
How was it?! My childhood dog absolutely loved going for long walks.
It was good! We went to the new dog park and got to visit with neighbors and their puppers. Then we went to the sculpture park and watched birds.
Aww. Sounds like a great day! I am sure your soon to be twins enjoyed the exercise.

Yes they did! They went from bouncing around and making me ill to calm and situated ready to pop into the world. I noticed that my dog also seemed to feel better about them because she wasnt watching my belly as much as she does on an off day.
Isn't it amazing how animals can sense a pregnancy?! I am so happy to hear that you are doing well! Is your daughter excited to be a big ster?
She is. She takes the dog to her room and practices taking care of a baby with the golden retreiver. Its so precious.
Awwww!!! That is so sweet!!! Have you been playing a specific genre of music for the baby?

No I dont believe in that. I think that I should be the one to actively try to calm and stimulate myself in a beneficial way so I dont have so many stress hormones involved in the pregnancy. I do listen to some classical but I prefer jazz. Plus if they cath it while theyre in there maybe the polyrithms will be beneficially stimulating.
I have heard that classical music is very calming! I admire your desire to actively calm your stress hormones. Have you take part in any mediation groups?
I go to yoga and I do my own mindfulness with the Calm App.
How do you like that app? I have always been a fan of headspace, But have heard good things about calm!

persona: I live in a city. I used to live in Canada. My home is surrounded by buildings.
I vacation is South Carolina. I don't like Florida or California.
I am not a good gambler. I can get addicted to gambling.
dialogue: I decided to visit South Carolina next month. They have a great casino and a lot of black jack tables.
Great choice! I love it there, Though I can't say I spend any time at the casino.

That's perfectly understandable given your history, If I knew I'd get addicted I wouldn't gamble either. But I've got the extra money and its a good time, So I figure I it'll help me make the trip more enjoyable.
I'm sure you will have a great time there. Luckily, There's plenty of things for everyone in South Carolina. Personally, I love the bech.
Is it worth checking out Myrtle Beach? It's only about 30 minutes from the casino and I've heard a lot of good things about it. I'm not fully sure if its worth the drive though.
Absolutely, If you enjoy the beach and can find the time.
I only like beaches when the weather is really warm, So I'll have to check the forecast and play it by ear. Is there anything else in the area you'd recommend?
That seems like a good plan. If you're into history I would definitely check out some of the museums or walking tours.
Museums could be interesting, I love southern history and South Carolina has a great history to it. I'm not a fan of walking though, Too much of it and my knees will start to ache.
Ah I see. South Carolina's definitely got a great food scene, So make sure you check out some restaurants while you're there.

Yes of course, I already had a list of a few different restaurants I wanted to try! I also won't have to worry about lunches because the casino offers free food to its gamblers! But I would like one or two more options, Would you happen to know any good seafood places near Little River?
That's very convenient! I can't think of any off the top of my head, But when I get a chance I'll find my list of favorites and send you some recommendations.

persona: I teach elementary school, like my parents did. I teach 3rd grade.
I love board games.
My favourite band is up, I've been to a concert of theirs.

I love teaching reading the most but love teaching all subjects. I have a little reading area with nonfiction and fiction books in my classroom. My students gravitate towards fictional fairy tales and sci-fi more than factual writings.
dialogue: I just read this really interesting scientific article on non-verbal communication between teachers and students that I'm thinking of including in my thesis.
That sounds so intriguing! Would you want to possibly observe one of my elementary school classes sometime?
If possible! We would have to send out consent forms, If that's okay?!.
That is completely fine! I love my students, And I think they genuinely love learning.
I will send you an email next week with a formal plan. Thanks for helping! What is the most popular board game among your classes?
They really like to play Dominoes if that counts!
To be honest, I don't think dominoes counts as a board game. It is fun though! Any other ideas?
The other board game they really love is chutes and ladders.
Oh my goodness! I used to love that game as a kid! I am glad to hear you are sharing it with the younger generation. Do they complain about not having a computer screen to play on?
No! I am actually so surprised they enjoy the actual physical board being there!
I love it!! That is great to hear!! I always worry that too much of the younger generation is attached to technology.
Yeah, I definitely try to avoid screens in the classroom. I want to make sure the students are focused and alert while class is in session.

persona: I don't have children but do have horses. My job is working on my family farm. I have a farm. Our farm has sheep, cows, and pigs on the way besides the horses. I am looking for ideas to help my horses. I feed my horses mix of grain and grass.
I like rock music. My favorite artist is Greta van Fleet right now.
dialogue: What kind of help do you need with your horses?
Nothing urgent, Just some ideas to get them to have fun and be more active. Have you ever ridden a horse?
I have! I remember the ones we used to go visit and take care of were fans of large inflatable balls. They like to kick them and bite them and roll them around.
Really? That's wonderful! Thank you so much for the idea, I'll definitely try that with them. How are your children doing?
They are doing fine. Were actually getting ready for their first visit to the horse ranch. Theyre so excited about their new clothes and shoes.
I'm sure they are! They'll have so much fun. It must be nice to get outside finally after spending a lot of time inside.
It will be. Im going to take so many pictures of them in their cute little boots with jeans and flannel. Me and the husband are going to wear clothes to match as well.
That's so adorable. Is the ranch far from you?
Its a good three hour drive through the country and hills. The scenery makes the drive feel shorter.
Yeah I love road trips just for that reason! I might be taking a road trip to California this summer actually.
Nice. California has great land for horses.

I've never been! I rarely travel because of the farm. My parents offered to take care of everything if I do decide to drive to California with a few of my friends, So the horses would stay on the farm.

persona: I'm a farmer that grows crops. My father is a farmer.
I like music, especially rock music.
I have three Arabian horses. I prefer horses to cars. I don't get sore from riding my horse.
I like pizza. I like salads. I have a farm that grows vegetables. I like veggie burgers.
I took a seminar on equality. I am learning about the LGBT+ community. I feel like the world is changing.
dialogue: I decided to take your advice and hold off on asking that girl out, But we might still hang out and grab some coffee as friends! What do you think?
I think thats a good idea, Holding off a little while after a breakup is usually for the best! Take it slow!
It was a really bad break up too. Im glad to have a friend like you. We out for pizza sometime.
Yeah definitely, I like pizza so that sounds good! I'm sorry it was so hard of a breakup. So this "hangout", Is this your first time.
Yes! Is feels right but Im so confused. I dont know ho we really feel. I really like her but its all so new to me.
How did you realize you're attached to girls?
I think I always was, I was just scared to admit it. I didnt want to put myself out there and felt I would be judged. I finally am starting to feel happy now though.
I am so happy for you and this new chapter of being happy!
You always made the bestveggie burgers, I dont want to pressure you but we should catch up and you should make those one day. Your farm has the best veggies.
Yes I will make a salad for us when we catch up, I love to use the veggies from the garden in salads! While you're over we should also go for a trail ride on my horses.
That sounds like a lot of fun. I would really like to ride your Arabian horses, They are so beautiful!
Yes they are a prize, I love those guys! I wish we all still traveled by horse back than by car, I would be all over that! Haha!

persona: I often feel isolated.
I received a heart transplant. I have telekinesis.
I believe I possess telekinesis. I had a heart transplant.
I meditate everyday.
I haven't been to Alaska before. I am interested in going to Alaska.
dialogue: I was thinking about places in Alaska that is good to visit for spiritual folk, And I am happy to make some recommendations for you. For starters, I recommend seeing and being near the Mendenhall Glacier.

Thanks for the recommendation, I've just looked it up and it seems beautiful. I find mountainous places really calming, For example I've been to the Austrian Alps before. Have you ever been to the Alps?
I have never been to the Austrian Alps, But I have heard of them! Can you tell me more about it? I'm sure it's beautiful!

Well the Alps themselves stretch across parts of France, Switzerland, Austria and Italy. Once of the most famous places is probably Chamonix in France, As that's where Mont Blanc is (they highest mountain in Europe). It's also a really famous place for skiing, Though I've never been skiing before. Have you?

Wow! Sounds much more extensive than I initially thought! What do you do when you visit there? I love skiing, Yes. It can be challenging at first, But it really is a lot of fun once you get enough practice in. I used to ski a lot when I was a teenager.

The few times I've been to the Alps we've visited various towns and gone on excursions to glaciers and ice caves and all sorts. I wish I had tried skiing when I was a bit younger, I'm worried about hurting myself now! Though I'm sure I'd be ok if I took it slowly. Would I need to buy all the skiing gear before going or can you hire it when you're there?

You can rent all of the skiing gear when you go, So don't even worry about buying any. That way you aren't wasting your money if you end up not liking it and never want to ski again. Just take your time and practice, Practice, Practice. Don't feel pressured to go down the larger hills at first. You'll get there eventually.

That's really useful to know, Thank you. I was a bit worried about spending lots of money if I only used it once! I'll have a think about whether I can get a ski trip in over the next couple of years; I should really add it to my bucket list. And I will avoid the larger hills at first; someone I know was forced by their brother to go down a tricky one almost immediately and he had a bad crash!

Oh no! Were they okay? Or did they get hurt? I have heard many horror stories about skiing accidents- lots of broken bones and even death sometimes. Being careful is so incredibly important. Safety first!
Safety first for sure! Miraculously they didn't break anything but they were very bruised. Their brother felt awful for ages afterwards!

I'm glad they were okay. Wow, I'm sure that was very scary for them. I can't wait to hear how your skiing trip goes in the next few years! You're going to love it. I just know it. And if not, At least you'll be seeing some beautiful scenery.
Haha that's true, At the very least I'll be able to be up in the mountains (and enjoy a beer at the lodge in the evening)! I'll have to start planning both a skiing trip and my trip to Alaska!

persona: I am a woman.
I exercise. I have dogs:one is a hound, one is a pitbull.
I am a currently a teacher in a school. I enjoy teaching students.
I am excited about summer break.
dialogue: Yesterday, I got a call from a person that said they have my cat. They are currently taking care of them in their home. I am planning on going to their house tomorrow, And bringing my cat back home.
Yay!! So glad to hear that. Where did they find your cat?
It was just outside their house. It was probably lost and homesick. I was so worried while he was gone, But the call I got really was a relief.
I'm sure he was, Thankfully he's safe now. Has this ever happened before with him? Or with any of your other pets?
Not where they were gone that long. They are always home for supper and feeding time. Did your dogs ever get lost from home before?
That makes sense, I wonder what happened this time? And yes! My pitbull started chasing a cat one time and I couldn't keep up with her. I found her later that day. It was so stressful!
I believe it. I bet your dogs are going to be so happy when your home for summer break.
Definitely. I'm actually planning on taking them on a roadtrip with me! It'll be their first roadtrip :).
Sounds like fun. When I was a gym teacher I looked forward to summer break every year, I hope you make the most of it.
Are you planning anything for the summer?
Just relaxing with my cats and grilling out at home. You should come over when you arent on your road trip and I can make us cheeseburgers. My secret recipe.
I'd love to, But I'm actually a vegetarian! So I'll have to pass on the cheeseburgers. I'm sure they're delicious though.

persona: My name is Blob. I like to eat raw.
I like the Rolling Stones.
I am an economics major. I am thinking about going back to school for another degree in the ecology field. I like economics. I am interested in studying science.
I am short on money because of my house I just bought. I have a mountain lodge style house. I want to decorate my new house in a rustic style.
I love nature and parks. I have vacationed in Tennessee.
dialogue: Have you done any more decorating of your new house?
Yes i have. I have used rolling stones artwork to decorate the house.
I like that artwork too, Blob. Which ones did you put up?
I put up the ones that have a rustic style.
Thats cool. I like rustic styles as well. The weathered qualiy makes it feel like they have been a part of my life for a long time.
So staci have you still been eating healthy?
Yes I have I just got finished with a quinoas salad with capers and onions.
Wow staci i wish i could eat healthy like you do.

Its not that hard Blob. You just have to hunt down the healthy stuff that agrees with your taste. I used to eat a lot of steak and eggs but I found greens that take away the craving and other savory vegetables that substitute for unhealthy options.
What kind of greens are you eating?
Right now I am using a lot of kale in my dises. As well as fried spinach.
I like spinach so i feel like that would be easy to eat more of.

persona: I work for myself. My job is walking dogs. I have three dogs. I enjoy my job.
I think scorpions are scary.
My dad was a door-to-door salesman.
I'm not really into makeup.
I don't watch NASCAR.
dialogue: I got the kindest gift from one of the people on my mail route today!
Really!? What did they give you? Is it NASCAR related?
No, I am not sure if they know my dad used to drive. They got me a really nice gift certificate to a spa so I can relax. My job has been very hard on me lately.

Aww, That's really nice of them! Do you think you'll be able to use it anytime soon? I know you've been doing lots of overtime lately. But if it helps, I can look after your dogs while you're at the spa.

I am planning maybe next weekend to use it and I was going to look for someplace for Barnaby to go. That would be great if you could watch him for me! He loves when you take him on walks with your dogs.
Yeah definitely! I love dog walking and the more the merrier! If it's okay with you, Maybe I could take the group to the dog park? Would Barnaby like that?
Yeah Barnaby gets along with all kinds of dogs. Just make sure you watch out for scorpions! I can't stand those things, And Barnaby gets jumpy around them too.

Okay, I will be extra cautious about the scorpions! I've never had issues with them, But I know their venom can be really harmful. In fact, If the song Rock You Like a Hurricane is playing at the park I'll turn right around and keep the dogs in the car.

Probably a good idea. Well thank you very much for offering to watch my dog. I think it'll be great to get away for a while and forget about the stress of delivering the mail. Especially since we had to start delivering on Sundays now too!
Like I said, It's no problem and I'm happy to do whatever I can to help you reduce the amount of stress in your life. How have your parents been doing lately? Have you talked to them about your work?

My dad's enjoying his retirement from NASCAR. He still goes on the road sometimes to do signings and meet with the fans. My mom stopped selling AVON but she can still order me what I need if I ask her. She gets me this eye shadow I really like.

That's great! I'm not big into makeup, But it seems like a nice perk to have a mom that can get you what you like. I wish my parents could hook me up, But the stuff my dad sells isn't useful to me at all, Haha.

persona: I love sports. My parents are athletic.
I speak another language.
I eat without slurping or making a mess.
I am a life coach.
I love running in marathons. I am training for Memorial Day marathon. I try to pick good causes when I run but I do non-charity runs.
I have a really high arch and get plantar fasciitis.
dialogue: I will see the doctor definitely as you suggest.
I am glad you are. Plantar Fasciitis is no joke, It can really be painful and should be looked at so you can get the help you need.
What is that? I don't think I have ever heard of it?
It is a problem with the arch of your foot. It can be painful to walk on and function with. I have a big arch and that makes me susceptible to getting it.
Wow how fascinating. How long have you had that issue?
Its been off and on for years now. I think all my running and training for marathons have made it worse but I really love doing those. Im training for a marathon right now on Memorial Day weekend.
Oh wow, How great. Where will it be located?
Its in upstate New York. Really beautiful countryside on the run too. Ive always liked competition and running is my favorite.
How many races do you run in each year?
Usually three or four. Do you do any sports or athletic competitions?
Yes i play ice hockey in the local men's league.
I thought you used to play Ping Pong as well. I remember you talking about it in the past.

persona: I'm a professional wrestler.
I've never done a marathon but I'm open to the idea.
I help out at the homeless shelter. I find helping at the shelter to be very fulfilling. I spend most of my time with my job and helping people. I meet interesting people.
I feel I couldn't be a vegetarian. I like beans I just can't eat many of them. I don't know any vegetarian recipes.
I'm thinking about running a marathon.
dialogue: Are there any local marathons you could take part in?
Yeah there's one coming up in September but I think that might be too soon to commit - maybe waiting until next year would be better. What do you think?
I think thats a wise decision. You will have more time to train and get into the sport of it.
That's what I'm thinking too - I guess I could always go for a half marathon this year, I've already got up to 10km or so on my runs. Have you ever ran a half?
Not yet. I think I might though to get a feel for what they are like and what my actual pace will be.
That's a good idea - I love the idea of it but I'm worried if I try too soon I'll fail and it will put me off sticking with marathon training.
I think that perhaps participating in a walk marathon or half marathon might get you past those fears. I did one on my own and it wasnt that bad. Thats why I'm training for them now.
Maybe! It's a big commitment either way even if it is only a half marathon. Has your husband been helping you with your training?
He has. He goes out on his short morning run and takes me with him. He goes slower so I can keep up.
That's so good to have a running buddy who can help you. I love going out on my own so I can just listen to my music and clear my head when I'm running.
I love it for that too. Its so nice to be able to get all my energy out.
100% sometimes when I start my long runs I think why do I do this to myself? But then I get into my groove and by the end of it I feel such a natural high!

persona: I love horror movies.
My son is a junior in high school and he is 14.
I've been here awhile. I'm not that old. I'm married.
I work in human resources and enjoy helping people. I have always been a people person, like my dad who worked at Home Depot. I have a child.
I value my relationship with my high school-aged son.
dialogue: I just saw that new horror movie. It gave me nightmares all week!
What was the movie about?
The chainsaw one!! From the early 2000's. Oh my goodness... Yikes!
Wow i remember that one! That one gave me nightmares for weeks.
That makes me feel better. Haha. I am definitely not a horror fanatic like you!
Yes i sure do i like them! Boy oh boy do i love em! Jeepers creepers!
Haha! Speaking of... Do you recall the movie Jeepers Creepers?!.
No i can not say that i do! Boy howdy!
You should check it out! It was definitely SCARY! I couldn't sleep for a week!
Oh wow i will most certainly give it a shot! I sure cannot wait to give it a holler!
You will have to give me a review after you watch it!
Yes i will most certainly will! We can meet and talk about how great of friends we are!

persona: Winter is my favourite season.
I like vanilla ice cream.
I collect hats.
I like ice skating, but am not very good at it.
My favourite movie is Blair Witch 2.
I have one Russian Blue male cat. the rest are all plain domestic shorthairs. One is an orange male, one is a black female.
I had a Basset Hound. I raised from puppyhood till she died at 15. I am finally at the point where I can handle having another.
I think they are actually better for kids than puppies.
dialogue: How did Basset Hound die? Was it die naturally?
What do you mean? Like I told you earlier... She died of old age. She was 15! Very old for a dog!
Im sorry I forgot. I have been stressed looking for a new job.
Completely understandable. No worries! Have you been looking for a pet for your family?
I want to adopt a cat but I want to find two so that they have another friend to be with. I heard its much better to have two cats than just one.
I remember you mentioning that earlier and I definitely agree. I used to volunteer at an animal shelter. Bonded pairs always did very well.
Me and my daughter are going out for ice cream soon want to come along?
I would love to!! Thanks for inviting me! Does the shop have vanilla?! ?!.
Of course what ice cream shop doesnt!? My wife might come with too.
I can't wait! I love your wife! I haven't seen her since the Holiday party!
Sounds like a plan. Maybe we can all go to the park afterwards.
I love that idea! I am definitely in need of some "nature time".

persona: I like board games. I like monopoly.
My cousin teaches high school students.
I love music. I prefer live music.
I have a husband. I went to a science museum last year.
I like visiting beaches in North Carolina.
dialogue: I found this new song I think you'd love!
What is it? Is it new or old?
It's an older song. Do you prefer older music or newer?
I like old and new and any genre too!
The song is Imagine by John Lennon. It makes me think of when I swam with dolphins. Are there dolphins at the beaches in North Carolina?
Oh yes! I love imagine by John Lennon. I was at the beach today and saw several dolphins. They are such beautiful creatures.
My students and I were talking about students in class today. Several of the kids say that dolphins are their favorite animals.
Those are smart kids. How many kids do you have in class?
I have 15! We are discussing marine animals right now. Aside from dolphins, What other animals do you enjoy when you visit the beach? Maybe we can talk about it tomorrow.
I like all the animals and mammals. They are all impressive in their own right.
You are so right!
If you are ever in NC, I can show the best beaches to visit.

persona: I am a part-time waitress at Jeff Ruby's Steakhouse.
I like to ride my motorbike. I have  a shiny, striped, red and blue helmet.
I don't like pizza. I have big, brown eyes. My skin is light.
I like eating watermelons.
I don't like to act unladylike.
I have 2 brothers.
dialogue: I made reservations at your steakhouse I hope you will be working.
I should be. I cant wait to see you there. Are any of your brothers coming along with you?
Seven of them are. It is John, My youngest brother's, Birthday. Have you ever met him?
I think I might have but you have so many brothers its hard keeping track of them all. Is he the one you got drunk with on the 4th of July?
Fair enough! No, That was Edward. He is always a good time.
Hes the one that helped you adopt Charlie, Right? I remember talking to him about that dog before you got him.
Yes! Great memory. He is a major dog lover, As am I now!
Oh, I wanted to let you know Im going to that place that sells those homegrown watermelons next week. I know you love them and I wa.
If I give you money, Will you get me some? Their melons are delicious!
Yeah they are. You got to try making a helmet out of one again that was so funny.
I get the funniest stares from people!
You need to take some time off from your two jobs so we can do stuff like that more!

persona: I like dog memes.
I prefer pizza to tacos. I think anchovies are yummy.
I'm a professional wrestler.
dialogue: I want to create a comics book with the future dog of my brother.
That sounds really fun, How do you imagine your brothers 'soon to be' dog will be like?
I think he'll be really small and cute with a big attitude! I love dogs so much I'm excited to get to meet him.
It will be loads of fun. Im thinking about getting a dog later in the year, Maybe after summer.
Oh really? That's awesome. Have you thought about what kind of dog you'd like?
A friend has a Yorkipoo and her boyfriend has a Rottweiler, Recently they've started to get quite friendly so were hoping there will be puppies.
Oh that's so exciting! Those puppies would be so so cute - you'd be lucky to get one.
Yes they said i could have first choice as they know i love dogs so much. I imagine a Yorkie-poo Rottweiler cross might be quite hard work but i would love to own one.
I think it could be challenging but if you're prepared you'll rise to the challenge no problem. Do you like taking long walks because i'm sure the dog would need plenty.
Yes i really like long walks, Where i live i am surrounded by forests so lots of places to walk a dog.
Oh that sounds great, It's so much fun taking a dog out to explore! They're so naturally curious.
Yes, Also it would be great exercise for me. Im wondering what to call it, I think Barabbas if its a boy, But if its a girl i dont know, Any suggestions?

persona: I am 34 years old. I am from Alaska.
I am unemployed. I practice Buddhism. I like to meditate.
I am currently enjoying being single. I left a long-term relationship a year ago. I hang out with friends.
I am considering moving to the southeast United States. I live in Alaska. I want to visit Scotland.
I would like to move to Charleston or Savannah. I love Low Country food.
dialogue: I don't think I'm familiar with Low Country food. Can you give me some examples? What are your favorite dishes?
Oh come on - you've got to know all about Shrimp and Grits and of course classic fried chicken!!.
I didnt know the south was referred to it as that. Where does that term come from?
It's a specific area in South Carolina - not all of the South!
Oh! That makes more sense. I have family in Georgia and I had never heard them talk about it. What kind of barbeque do you prefer?
Oh I love ALL barbeque but I think Kansas City might edge it for me - what about you?
I like North Carolina barbeque but Southern Alabama BBQ chicken is where its at!
Oh yes you raise a good point I love me some BBQ chicken! I could eat BBQ everyday of the week but I try to avoid too much unhealthy food!
Yeah, Too much red meat will do you in early. Doesnt make it any less tasty though.
So true. It's hard to say no but sometimes you just have to!
Very true. There are some healthy southern options. The greens and other vegetables also get a lot of good attention.
I know but they also come covered in butter - I think it's just a one way ticket to heart attack central!!!.

persona: I play guitar and violin.
I like chocolate bars.
I hate roller coasters.
I am an electrician. My dad is an electrician.
I am learning to speak Chinese. I would love to visit China.
I work on people's homes.
dialogue: I bought new shoes for hiking.
Oh great, What kind of shoes did you buy?
Just some good quality walking shoes - they're a bit boring looking but I had just been using my gym shoes when I went hiking and they were starting to really hurt my toes!
I have a pair of Army boots for when i go hiking, You would think they would be good but id get blisters if i walked even a mile in them!
Oh no, Seriously? There's nothing worse than starting a long walk and realising your shoes aren't up to the job.
Yes these are awful, I did an 80km hike a few years ago for chairty. Blisters the size of goose eggs on both my heels. I really should get new ones.
Oh my goodness they must have hurt for days after! 80km is quite the achievement though, Well done you!
I had to pop the blisters with needles, It was quite gruesome! Have you ever thought about maybe confronting your water fear? Id like to go white water rafting, Maybe you could come too?
Ew that's gross but a necessary evil I guess! And I don't know, I wish I could try and get a handle on my fear but anytime I'm near the water I just freeze up and my brain stops working!
That doesn't sound fun, I used to get vertigo, I managed to get it cured by accupuncture and hypnotism. It sounds crazy, But it worked.
Hey anything that works to solve problems is worth while even if it sounds crazy. Have you been white water rafting before?
Yes, Iv been white water rafting, Sky diving and iv also bungee jumped. One day id really like to fly a wing suit.

persona: I like photography.
I speak English, French, and Spanish. I teach languages. I am an elementary school teacher. I know tips on how to learn new languages.
I just moved into a new apartment from my parent's house. I have a studio in my new apartment. My boyfriend doesn't live with me.
I would also love to go to Spain.
dialogue: I would really like to visit Barcelona while in Spain. I think there would be go many good photo opportunities there.
Barcelona seems like a great choice. I would love the chance to do some photography there.
Yes it would be brilliant. Barcelona is so picturesque. I've always wanted to plan a trip to Spain or Mexico, They seem such amazing countries to go to. Have you ever been abroad before?
Me too, Those places are definitely on my bucket list. I haven't made it to Spain yet but I have spent time in other parts of Europe, Like France and England.
Oh wow, How was it to travel to France? It seems a lovely place, Especially Paris. I'd love to take photos of the Eiffel Tower.
It was amazing. Paris was definitely a highlight, But I would recommend taking the time to visit some smaller towns in the countryside if you can.
Oh really, I definitely will whenever I get chance to travel to France. Did you manage to get some lovely pictures?
Oh absolutely. My favorite pictures are from my time in southern France by the coast.

That sounds wonderful. I can imagine the scenery would of been beautiful over there. I am going to start a bucket list very soon with a list of all these amazing countries. I would also love to learn Spanish one day too, It would be amazing to be able to speak to so many locals at foreign counties.
Knowing Spanish has definitely been very useful, But I will say there's no better way to learn than by immersing yourself in it.

I should really take the leap one day and just sign myself up to lessons, Because it would be such an achievement for me. I work a lot though, So I'd have to try and find time when I'm not in the office to learn Spanish. How do you find the time with being a school teacher? That must be a demanding job.
Well I did already have a little background from high school Spanish classes. But I actually learned most of it just from language apps, And spent a lot of time watching spanish TV.

persona: I live in a small farming community in Indiana.
I like coloring books.
I like hockey.
I like to play blackjack. I don't place high bets when I gamble.
I have a small farm. I have a house. I have a vegetable garden. I have multiple horses and dogs. I recently got a Bassett Hound puppy and a German Shepherd. I enjoy living in the country.
I sometimes get together with friends to play cards. My friends and I don't bet real money, only chips.
dialogue: I just landed a gig as Zac Efron's stunt double in a new movie! We start shooting in Jamaica in August!
Awesome! That's excellent. Where in Jamaica will you be shooting in?
From what I understand basically all over the place! I didn't even know that Zac Efron was still a thing! How's your new puppy?
My dog's doing great! He's really getting along with the horses I've got on the farm. The dog loves getting the attention of large animals.
Oh wow he sounds like he has a good confident personality!
He is! He's probably the most energetic out of all of us, Even more so than the German Shepard. Speaking of animals - I know you don't have any now, But will you ever consider getting one?

Not anytime soon. I travel so much for work I wouldn't have enough time to spend with them. I am thinking of fostering an animal though. That way I can get to experience having a pet without all the commitment.
Oh, That's a great way to get involved. Dog, Cat, Or something else?
Either one honestly. I love both! Maybe some cats at first.
That's a good idea. Cats are lower maintenance than dogs. They're not maintenance-free, But at least you don't have to walk a cat or potty train it.
Yeah that is what I am thinking! What are your dogs names?
One's named Peanut, And the other's named Butter.

persona: I am from Miami. I like to eat salad and meat. My parents were athletic.
I have started a new job as a car valet at a casino.
I have driven Bentley's and Ferrari's. I get nervous when driving expensive cars.
I will not take the cars for unauthorized drives. I enjoy the tips I get while working.
I enjoy running. I haven't been running lately. My sleep habits have been negatively impacted because of my job. I hope to start running again soon.
dialogue: Has your new job impacted your eating habits any? Do you find yourself reaching for processed foods instead of salads more often?
Yeah, Sometimes. I have to admit that my lifestyle's been going downhill. Sleep's also not great - I'm taking some melatonin every night to cope.
Oh that's not great to hear! I'm sure taking a few naps in the day may help your sleeping pattern. Do you work at night?

I do now. My new job as a valet at the casino is a night shift. It's not great for my lifestyle, But the tips are great. All these late-night gamblers drive expensive European cars. Speaking of which, What sports car do you fancy?

Wow, Night shifts can certainly be challenging to get your head around, It can really affect your body with the change of sleeping pattern, So I can completely understand your struggles. Oh wow, I'd love to drive a Lambo aventador, That would be the dream. Just to see how fast I can go, See how much I can push the car to it's limits.
Haha, A classic choice! If you take that thing to a racetrack, You can speed that thing up to 150mph, Easily!
Wow, That's crazy! If only I got the chance!! What cars have you seen at work? Any that's caught your attention.

I've seen a Rolls-Royce, A few lambos, And this custom Bugatti they guy told me he bought with his winnings from roulette from this very casino! I bet the owners of this place are fuming every single time they see this guy drive in again with his flashy car. I wonder why he's not banned yet!
That's insane mate! I would of loved to see that. He must of won a lot to buy that car. It must be so frustrating seeing people like that winning just from luck.
