Yeah, It is. Meanwhile I'm over here parking his car and sacrificing my sleep over it. Hey, At least the guy tips well. He tosses me a $50 every time he rolls around. I guess I can't complain about that!

I can see how it can be but at least one day with all these big tips, You could maybe buy your own lambo or rolls royce. If people have money, And enough to gamble it, They're definitely going to tip well.
That's something to hope for, Certainly! I don't think I'd jump straight into buying an expensive car, Though. I don't trust my driving skills enough. Ironic, I know.

persona: I perform at concerts. I like to relax.
I grew up in the music industry.
My favorite song is You Will Never Leave Harlan Alive.
I walk two miles with my daughter every morning and evening. I have four children.
I like Darrell Scott. I think Darrell Scott did good Hank Williams cover songs.
I make apple wine. My apple wine is potent. My pregnant daughter is having triplets. My daughter's mother and grandmother are also triplets.
dialogue: Good news!! My daughter is moving to my hometown in a month! I'll be able to see my grandsons all the time!
Oh my goodness that is great news! You must be so excited about it!!!.
I am! She has been swamped with taking care of them and im more than happy to help. Plus I get to see more of them like youve heard all the old folks say.
Aw that is so sweet - i'm sure she'll be so glad to have the extra help!
Definitely. I am happy she was able to find a job and get herself over here. I live on retirement and have expendable income.
That's great she's got a job - are you going to help her with childcare since you're retired?
I am. She wants the best for them and I can help with that. Plus having her around helps me with things too that I cant do as well as I used to.
It sounds like this is going to work out really well for both of you. Has she managed to get a place to live sorted?
Not yet. We are trying to find a realtor or someone who can help us with the realtor websites.
Ugh it can be so stressful trying to find a place, I'm sure with a bit of luck and your help she'll find somewhere perfect for her and the boys.
Fingers crossed. So there are triplets in your family. I cant imagine how busy that is at times.
Oh my goodness it can be an absolute mad house!! My daughter is so excited to have hers though I think she'll need a lot of extra help when they arrive.

persona: I am a student. I enjoy school. I want to go to law school.
We built a home on my family's farm. My family has over 5000 acres. The farm has been in the family for generations. We have been on the farm for 200 years.
We have a food plot. We have cattle, sheep and pigs.
I am engaged. I like to party with friends. I am planning my wedding on the farm as is family tradition.
My hunsband and I have huge families.
I like BBQ.
dialogue: How is your wedding planning coming? Have you had any neat ideas you would like to include in the occasion?
We are going to dress the farm up with lots of streamers.
Oh that sounds so lovely - are you getting really excited?
Yeah, We've already picked out which one of the pigs to bbq for the reception!
Oh that's so exciting - I love BBQ pork! How big is your wedding going to be.
Enourmous! Are families are huge and we are also inviting all of our friends. Did you get your invitation yet?
Oh wow two big families is a lot of effort when it comes to planning - and no not yet but I'm so excited for it.
Well, My fiance is experienced with party planning so I'm leaving it up to him.
Oh that's so great - it's nice when the men can take control for a change.
Yeah, It gives me more time to study! When I get my degree I want to have farmers exclusively for clients!
I love farmers and I imagine they'd make pretty good clients for you in the future!
Well, It's a long ways away yet. I have to decide which law school to go to after I graduate.

persona: My favorite watch is the Rolex. My favorite thing is to go shopping for watches and shoes. I work for a watch dealer.
I am a girl. I like shopping.
My family doesn't want me to work for a watch dealer.
My dream car is the rolls royce ghost car.
I work at an independent watch dealer named Josh's. We sell many of the name brand watches.
I bought a new Fossil brand watch last week. I think Fossil watches are timeless. They can be both casual and dressy. I like silver colored watches for their versatility.
dialogue: I've been on the lookout for a nice watch but I haven't found anything I love yet.
You should look into Fossil watches. Like I said they're pretty great, But I don't know if they sell them at Kroger. What is time stop?
It is one of the power that I have. I can make it stop for a few moments, But that's all. I like how the fossil watches look, Which one did you get?
That's pretty impressive. I'm so busy some days I wish I could make time stop for even a few moments lol. I just got a classic silver one, Nothing too fancy. What other super powers do you have?

I mostly use my power to stop time for good, And to help people. Unfortunately I can't time travel, But I have been trying to get better at flying. I live so far away from anyone else it's hard to be near anyone else. Do you have any power, Apart from selling watches at a great price?

Haha no, I wish though! It would be awesome to control time. Move fast-forward the bad parts,Rewind to the good parts, Just pause in a good moment. That would be a pretty awesome super power. How far can you fly right now?

It depends on how the stars are aligned. I can sometimes reach ground, But other times I am stuck above the clouds. At least the world looks nice from up here, But there's not many other people like me...
Oh wow, So you can only fly straight up right now? That would be terrifying. I don't like heights at all! If I could hover a little over the ground and move fast that would be enough for me lol!
Only up and down! I move with the wind so I have to time when I come down. Would you like me to teach you some time? I've never tried, But maybe I could get you to hover a bit!
That would be pretty amazing! Only one thing, If I go to high can you hold me so I don't freak out and fall down?
Of course yes! It was scary at first for me so I'll be careful!
Okay. I am so down to try this then. Maybe I will look for a super fluffy jacket or a parachute just in case. Do you know if they sell those at Kroger? Lol.

persona: My name is Sophie.
I like to sing along with movies.
I just started 3rd Grade. I write poetry. I write about Mickey Mouse. I go to Disney World every year with my family. I like the characters at Disney World.
My Favorite football team is the Steelers. My dad likes the Steelers.
I love the movie Frozen. I think the character Olaf is funny.
I like spending time with my family and my friends. I like the summer season.
dialogue: I found a great promotion on Disney World tickets this past week and made the decision to book a trip for this coming summer.
I am so jealous! I love going to Disney World. What do you plan on doing while you are there?
Im looking forward to the rides and maybe seeing Olaf. Its been forever since I have been. What do you recommend?

I would definitely recommend seeing Olaf. He acts really goofy when you met him. The bummer cars are my favorite. I ran into my dad once and he almost fell out of the car! Don't go on the rollercoasters. They are too scary.
I am going to book a character dining experience they have one with Olaf! It sounds like fun. This way I dont have to wait in a line to see him he will come to the table.
Yes! You should do that. Maybe Olaf will be your waiter. While you are there, Would you mind giving Mickey a poem I wrote for him? I think he would like it.
I would love to! I'm planning on meeting as many characters as I can. I'm picking up an autograph book for the trip. I'll make sure to get a picture of him getting your poem.
That is so nice so you! Get as many autographs as you can. I would love to get a copy of the picture with Mickey holding my poem. I would keep it forever and ever.
I can't wait to go! I hope its not busy. School should be in so it should be that bad. I hear the wait times can get long when they are busy.

I hate it when it is busy. That is my least favorite part of Disney World. I had to wait an hour once to just get on one ride. It is not fair that they make us wait so long. They should let kids like me go right to the front of the line.
I hear they have a fast pass system th you can use, But yea waiting is the worst part. I had a friend wait over 2 hours for the peter pan ride, So I might skip that one.
That ride is a little too scary for me. It has too many pirates. I've never used the fast pass system but I will make my dad get it the next we are there.

persona: I enjoy traveling.
I go to college and am majoring in Art. I enjoy painting still lifes. I love food.
I am of Italian heritage.
I like to collect things like shoes and lingerie.
I am a dog person, especially big dogs. I am not wealthy. I foster dogs. I paint pictures of the dogs I foster.
I like wine.
dialogue: I saw a beautiful painting of a cat and a dog yesterday.
Oh, Very nice! What breed was this dog in the painting you saw?
It was aDobermann and a tabby cat. The artist really captured the beauty of the animals. They were sitting next to each other and theDobermann was looking sternly at the tabby.
Wow, That sounds like a phenomenal painting just from your description. I wonder if it's for sale. I'd totally buy it if I could afford it.
I don't think the owner would sell it. I seen it in a local pet shop while shopping for more treats for my cats. The owner said her son painted it.
Oh, That's sweet! I'd definitely want the painting to stay there, Then. By the way, Don't you have cats at home? What are their names?
The boy isSocks because he's all black except his paws are white. The girl isSassy because she seems to always have something to say and tries to get her way all the time.
Oh, I like those names! If you were to get a third cat, What would you name it?
Not sure, I would have to see the cat and it's personality. Are you fostering any dogs now?
I am! I currently have a Great Dane at home. He's a large dog, But extremely gentle.
Great Danes are beautiful animals. What is his name?
His name's Dexter! I think it's a great name.

persona: I prefer comedies over horror movies.
I don't watch horror movies alone.
I live alone.  I enjoy living alone. I am retired. I have a cat.
I have had cancer.
I like sitting around at home.
I do not have children.
dialogue: I got a job offer I can't resist. I'm going back to work!
That is awesome! Is it for social work like before?
Yes! It's at a place nearby with hours that i can totally manage, Mostly from home so I can be with my little one!
Ah, How is the little one? Are you thinking about school soon?
My kiddo is doing great thank you so much for asking! Yes, He will be attending school this coming fall, But just for half days.
That sounds good, Are you busy currently? Maybe you wanna watch a movie.
Later we have a date to watch that movie Babe, He hasn't seen it yet so we are pretty excited as it's my favorite movie.
That's great, Is it a comedy or horror movie?
It's a bit of a drama movie with a bunch of humor thrown in about the life of a pig that can talk to sheep and herd them.
That sounds like my type of movie!
It's a good movie that has been around for at least 20 years now, You should check it out!
Yeah, I will definitely look it up later, I don't have too much to do today.

persona: I enjoy eclectic music.
I help rescue bunnies. I love bunnies. I donate to a bunny charity.
I tried to learn C a long time ago, but could not understand or like it.
I don't like to be photographed.
I have a brother. I own an air plant with a terrarium. I enjoy several different music genres.
dialogue: I saved someone from drowning at the pool today!
No way! That's great! Maybe they'll offer you a job soon.
I know it happens within a second, They just slipped as they weren't looking where they were walking. Well you never know, They may do if I show myself as hard worker.
Yeah, I understand. Saving lives can be a crazy thing! How are you feeling now?
It's an overwhelming feeling at first but I'm calmer now. It feels like a really positive boost to my day. How has your day been?
My day has been fine, Definitely not as interesting as yours. I was listening to music with my brother earlier.
Oh that's good. I love listening to music, It can sometimes just transport you into a zone. Like it always improves my mood.
Yeah, What is your favorite type of music?
I actually really enjoy death metal. How about you?
I can't get enough of electric music!
Wow you've got good music taste! Have you been to many concerts?
I've only been to one, But I don't think I will go again. Too many people take photos there. How about yourself?

persona: I used to know Judy Garland's dentist.
My favorite foods are hamburgers and French fries.
I like walking. My house is close to a river and a park. I like to take walks at night.
My hobby is drinking rum. I don't drink rum with soda anymore.
I eat meat. I prefer to get my hamburgers from McDonalds.  Soda gives me problems.
I do not have kids and do not intend to have any. I have a domestic partner.
I run an electronics business that sells both online and in a brick and mortar store.  I like interacting with people.
dialogue: The weather has been lovely, Have you been enjoying your evening walks in the park? That must be very relaxing after selling electronics all day.
Yes it has been. I really like getting out and going on my walks. I talked to so many interesting people.
Good to know, I like to go on walks. But now mostly I stay at home. How was the weather outside?

It was nice and sunny. The temperature was perfect. When I got home I was able to relax in my yard with a glass of Rum. You should come over and have a drink with me! I have wine from last time you visited. Or I can come to you too.
That is a great idea. Why don't you come over the weekend. I got a new collection of wines, One of my grandson visited me yesterday and got some wine for me. I have not opened the bottles yet.
Sounds like a lot of fun. Do you still have that sparkling white wine you let me try last time? That stuff was really good.
Yes I think there is more let. You can take the bottle this time when you visit. I will show you my coloring app. I started using it recently. Great way to pass time.
Want me to pick us up something to eat since you are suppling the drinks? Its the least I can do.
Sure, You can get your favorite hamburgers and I will prepare dessert. What do you like in sweet?
How about a nice rum cake or German chocolate cake? It would go good with the wine!
You have a good taste. I'm good with Rum cakes. Will make you one nice rum cake. So tell me about your hobbies?
Besides working with my electronic store I love walks at night and spending time with my partner. I really like just being around people too.

persona: I used to live with my mom. My mother died when I was in my 20s.
I have a boyfriend. I have a sister.
I can't drink soda. I like french fries and hamburgers. My boyfriend likes hamburgers, too.
I'm having a cookout on Thursday.
dialogue: Are you all ready for your cookout?
I'm getting there, I hope I have enough burgers on hand. Maybe I'll try putting some eggs on, Like you said. Would you like to come?
That would be great fun, Thanks! Have you made any dessert or would you like me to bring some?
I haven't made any yet, Would you mind? What do you think you'll bring?
I have a load of cooking chocolate so I might make chocolate brownies if you think that'll work for the other guests too?
That will definitely work, Thank you! So are you getting ready for the hurricane? Are you nervous?

Great, I'll go for brownies then. We've got the house prepared as best we can for the hurricane, Though luckily now it is looking like the worst of it won't be coming directly through our town. I'm a bit nervous but I've been through a couple of much worse ones before. Have you ever had to live through a hurricane?
I haven't. It seems like it would be a little nerve wracking. I'm glad that you are prepared for it. Have you had any luck on the job front?

I've applied for 5 jobs in the past week so just waiting to hear back. It can be a bit disheartening when I don't even get a response, But I'm going to get there in the end! What kind of job do you do at the moment?
I'm currently working as an assistant for a architecture firm. It's pretty interesting, But I'm always keeping my eyes open. We may have a few openings here, If you would like me to check.

That sounds really interesting, Though I totally understand that you keep an eye out for other opportunities. If none of the jobs I've applied for come through I'd definitely appreciate you letting me know if any more openings become available there. I've got a lot of experience in all things admin!
I'm sure you would fit in great. We even have a company softball team and play in a local league. What position do you play?

persona: My name is Taylor. My father was a construction worker. My dad was not in the military.
I hate alcohol.  I love coffee.
I love blue. I hate the color pink. I like mountain biking. I went mountain biking recently at Mt. Ember.
I consider myself to be a bland person.

I like the idea of volunteering and helping bunnies. I have never done anything like that before. I hope to be able to foster or adopt one in the future when I know enough about them. I only know one food they may like at this time.
dialogue: Did you ever check into volunteering at the Bunny Rescue? They will be able to give you the training and adequate information you need to prepare you. No better way to learn than to do!
Yes I did! I will be going back next week to fill out an application. It looks promising!
A what do you think your donation will do.
I hope to bring about some calm and consistency to the rescue by volunteering my time. I am going to be learning as much as I can in the next few days.
Well I work in a local charity group do you do charity work?
No I have never done any charity work before. This will be my first time. Do you like what you do?
Yes I do what do you do in your spare time.
As I've said before, I enjoy mountain biking. What do you do for charity?
A take care of the old and sick for 5 hours evry week.
Oh how kind of you, I bet that takes a lot of energy to spend time and care for them. Do you volunterr for bunnies as well?

persona: I love going hiking in the mornings at the local lake/park. I enjoy the sounds of nature.
I am 18.
I like Travis Scott.
I keep fish as pets in a huge aquarium.
My favorite color is orange.
I often see koi fish when I hike.
I just broke up with my boyfriend. I have an ex-boyfriend to whom I don't want to talk. I was blindsided by my break-up.
dialogue: My sister broke her arm while we were playing basketball. I feel responsible; she tripped over my big foot.
Oh no! I am sorry to hear that. I hope she is doing okay. That's a bummer - it's probably not your fault really. I hope it doesn't stop you from playing basketball.
I was thinking I was getting too old for basketball, But this really solidified it. What other sport could I play that is good for some old ladies like me and my sister?

I still think you could continue playing basketball! But I know that Pickle Ball is a really fun sport and non-contact. My ex-boyfriend and I used to play all the time. Golf would be another good option too!
My ex husband used to play golf and he left me for the beer cart girl, So that is a sore subject for me. Maybe I will try pickle ball. What exactly is pickle ball?

Yikes. Yeah those beer cart girls can be dangerous... Pickle ball is kind of like a mix of tennis and ping pong. It's played on a mini tennis court and you use paddles. It's fun you should check it out.
Oh that sounds like it could be fun! I know you said you used to play it, Do you currently play any sports?
I play in a grass volleyball league which is pretty fun! But I mostly do trail running and hiking. That's kind of my main "sport" I guess you can say.
Good for you, Maybe you can meet a new boyfriend in your volleyball league! I have been trying out a grandparent dating app... I haven't found anyone worthy yet.
There are a lot of cute guys at volleyball so fingers crossed :) Dating apps can be so hard! But I'm sure you'll find someone. Is your older sister trying to find someone on the dating app too??.
She was on the app, But now that she broke her arm, She is finding it hard to swipe left and right! Who needs the hassle at our old age anyway haha!
Haha! You're right - you don't need no man! And after my last boyfriend I don't need one either! I just need my fish LOL.

persona: I am at ground level. I hate heights.
I am taking a Spanish class. I have been learning for about 6 months. I love studying languages. Once I have mastered Spanish I am planning to learn French next.
I love visiting different cities. I was  raised in New York but now I live in England.
I am scared of heights.
I prefer the parties in Miami Beach.
My favorite Spanish word is actually trabajo.
dialogue: Do you think that learning languages is an expensive hobby?
No, I think it's very affordable. All you need are a few books, And maybe Duolingo.
That is really helpful to reduce anxiety.
Yeah, A little bit. I can't say that learning languages is relaxing, But it isn't stressful either.
Yes, You seems to know more about learning. Are you a teacher?
I am not. I just like learning. I'm not good at teaching.
Okay, What is your profession?
I don't work. I'm independently wealthy, And I study and travel for fun.
That must be interesting, I would like to be like you.
I imagine many people would. I consider myself lucky to be able to travel all the time, And live in different parts of the world.
That is good. Can you give me a financial advice?
I'm not qualified or licensed to offer you financial advice, But I can very generally suggest that you live below your means, And invest the difference regularly.

persona: My name is Lee.  I am retired.
I like to grill.
I don't like cold weather.  I like to gamble.
I like Italian food.  My favorite food is lasagna. I don't know what plantains are.
I would love for you to come over and hang out while I grill.
My wife works during the week.  We are free on weekends.
dialogue: I have a big gymnastics meet coming up this weekend!
That's exciting! Is that to practice for an upcoming competition or is it more of a social with other gymnasts?
It's a competition happening soon. Have you seen gymnastics on tv during the olympics?

Yes I really enjoyed watching the gymnastics in the Olympics; they are all far more energetic than I am! I particularly enjoy watching the floor routines and the pommel horse. What's your favorite type of gymnastics to do?
My event is the uneven bars. It requires a lot of upper body strength. I have to spend many hours practicing.

That's really impressive, I can't imagine how much training you have to go through! Back when I was in college I enjoyed playing tennis and hockey. Though I wasn't particularly serious about it, I played more for fun. Nowadays even though I'm retired I make sure I get enough steps in every day and have a stretch every morning too. I assume you have to do a lot of stretching to avoid injury when doing so much gymnastics practice?
I spend many hours stretching so I am as flexible as possible. Have you ever gambled on who would win a gymnastic event?
No I've never been a gambler actually. I don't think I'd be very good at it. What about you, Do you gamble on sports events?
No, I could get in a lot of trouble if I was caught. I would rather spend time stretching than trying to gamble.
Haha yes that's fair enough. Well, Good luck in your competition! Are you still at college/university?
Yes, I am still in school in Italy. Do you enjoy Italian food?
Yes absolutely, My favourite is lasagna but I also love pizza, Gnocchi and of course the famous Italian gelato. I'm jealous that you are surrounded by delicious Italian food all the time!

persona: I have a husband. We live in the country.
I like nhl. I like coloring books.
I have a german shepherd named Max that is 5 years old. I don't like horses. I take Max to hockey games.
dialogue: I wanted to tell you that I contacted a breeder to see about getting a German Shepherd puppy for the farm.
That is a nice choice.
For sure. I've got a lot of horses, And I wonder if the horses will like my new dog.
It is possible though I personally don't like horse.
Ah. Hey, Don't you have a German Shepard? Tell me a little about how the puppy years were like for Max.
Max is very friendly and tender but sometimes requires a lot of attention than I can give.
Oh. What sort of attention does Max look for? Pets? Walks?
Max mostly want to stay outdoor even at night.
Ah. Have you considered setting up a doghouse in the backyard for him?
That is thoughtful, I would have to do that.
Yeah. You can even build multiple doghouses and have them spread out all over your property. Maybe you can paint each one a different color.
I would definitely try this. It's a very nice concept.

persona: My biggest fear is scorpions.
I work for the us postal service.
My dad used to drive a nascar race car. Hailie Degan is my favorite driver.
I don't go to the beach.
I have a German Shepard.
dialogue: I got my pictures taken for my new passport.
Oh cool! Where do you plan to visit with your passport?
I have no idea at the moment. I am thinking an island somewhere for the good beaches. Maybe Fiji?
Nice! I have heard good things about Fiji. How soon might you go?

It will probably be a while yet. I don't think I'll be able to afford the Galapagos like I wanted, But I am just ready to go anywhere international now that I'm going to have a passport. I can't believe you don't love the ocean.

I have been afraid of the ocean for a long time because there can be so many different creatures in the water. I worry about islands because of the scorpions. I am thinking about traveling to the mid-west soon to see a Nascar race.
Your fear of scorpions must be really intense. I get it. Spiders terrify me. Now that I have seen a NASCAR race thanks to you, I would love to see one in person some day. I'll bet the energy is wild.

I've been to many NASCAR races ever since I was young because I used to go watch them in person to see my dad. They are always exciting and fun to see with a group of people. I hope to see Hailie Degan win a race in person some day too.
Have you ever seen a bad crash happen?
Yes, I once saw a crash where three people were injured. It slowed the race down for hours. However, They are very rare.
Oh, Man. That's intense. I once saw a shark attack when I was at the beach. The guy lost his leg; there was a lot of excitement when the ambulances came.
That'd be too much for me. I love my legs and I know you do too. That's another reason I worry about going into the ocean or visiting beaches; there's a lot of terrifying wildlife in the waters.

persona: I love to cook and watch others cook. I cook a lot. I'm a vegan.
I'm single.
I love adrenaline based activities like skydiving and riding rollercoasters.
I rent an apartment and am not rich.
I don't have any pets.
I am afraid of heights.
I can play tennis.
dialogue: When do you plan to go on another hair raising adventure.
Probably this weekend! I have finally decided to abolish my fear of heights and go skydiving again!
That sounds pretty daring, And I appreciate you facing fears. Make sure to check out who you fly with though. Do you have a company in mind for the trip?
Not yet, I've been looking around. Anyone you suggest?
I am afraid of skydiving, So none that I would know of. I'm curious why you decided you were ready for skydiving.

I have already went skydiving once, It was very difficult as it was an impulse decision and I didn't have much fun that time around. This time however, I realized life is too short to not have fun with the things you enjoy!

I love pushing myself physically sometimes, And understand why you might take that on I guess. Until I get through this pregnancy, Going for calm and centered! Would love to see pictures when you go again.
Of course, I've been saving up so I can get them to record a video up there as well! How are your kids doing?

Summer is nearly here, And the kids could use a vacation, Although I need to be near my doctor in case something happens. They make me happy every day. Been thinking about you choosing to be vegan. Thinking about adjusting my diet too.

Awww, That is amazing! I am sure you need a vacation too, So maybe if your doctor says it's okay take a few days off! It was very hard at first but honestly I feel like its very beneficial for not only my body but the overall planet. Are you thinking about going vegan?
Making some small adjustments maybe, Less meat, More beans, Rice, That kind of thing. Sneaking in good food with the kids, Takes work! Maybe you can share a fave recipe or two.
Of course! I am so proud of you! My go to lunch recipe is probably a bean burrito bowl! Brown rice, Black and kidney beans, Salsa, Some vegan cheese and vegan sour cream, So delicious!

persona: I have two jobs.
My favorite hobby is reading. I've read 20 books this year.
I work in the movies. I work as a stunt double.
I help out my mom. She is my only surviving parent. I am like my mom.
I shop at Home Depot.
Shawshank was a boring yet amazing book. I like Stephen King adaptations. I want to be in one of the movies. I am haunted by The Butterfly Garden book.
I have kindle unlimited and the libby app. Billy Straight is an amazing book. I have Amazon Prime. I like Dr. Seuss's Old Hat New Hat book.
I was a stunt double for the actor playing Rocky Balboa in a remake of Rocky.
dialogue: Do you have any new stunt double jobs coming up?
No, I don't have any at this time.
You must have a lot of free time to read then. Are you reading anything good now?
I am reading The Butterfly Garden book, And it is good. How was Fatal Charm?
It was very good, I love true crime books! I'm definitely on the look out for something similar. I spend a lot of time in the library, So I'll find something.
I also love True Crime! Do you watch movies about True Crime as well?
Of course, I'll watch or read anything true crime related. My kindle is just filled with crime books. What was your experience with The Butterfly Garden?
It was so creepy it still enters my dreams. I see you like Steven King movies, But what about his books?
I love the books more! I'll never watch a Steven King movie until I've read the book. I think the IT movies may have ruined clowns for me forever.
I did not see IT, But heard it was scary!
Shawshank is actually one of my favorite movies and I thought the book was good as well. I'm surprised you found it boring.
I still thought it was amazing, But it wasn't my style of book.

persona: I have two dogs: Baron Zemo and Spike.

I have two older mustangs. I like vintage cars. I'm working on two Mustangs: a 68 and a 66 Hertz clone. I've been working on cars since 1989. I have a Mustang convertible. I work on my car after work.
I don't like crowds.
I like working out.
I like classic country.
I am a dog trainer.
dialogue: Did you take your dogs out for a walk today?
Yes! Thankfully there was enough of a break in the rain to run them around. How's your day been?
It has been busy! I volunteered at the homeless shelter this morning. Do you do any volunteering?
Sadly not. I admire those who do though! Work keeps me so busy, And then I spent time on my car to relax. How did you get into wrestling as a job?
I work out a few times a week and a trainer came over and asked if I was interested in wrestling and gave it a go! Have you ever wrestled?
No I haven't, I think I'd be terrible at it! Does it take you a long time to recover? It looks so physical and exhuasting!
No different in my opinion then working out at the gym, Keeps your mind focused! You should try it sometime, I think you would like wrestling!
I can definitely see how it would be cathartic, Although I'm so worried about getting my ass whooped I'm sure I'd be terrible. But it's all about working up a sweat, Right?
Yes, Getting beat is not a highlight but makes you want to train even harder! And working up a sweat is no joke! Ha ha.
I definitely respect the mental stamina needed, Too. I could learn some more of that, Sometimes working on my car gets me so frustrated I can't stand it, Ha!
I can see that. I have attempted to work on cars, I don't have the patience for it! I need to keep moving!
It's definitely an acquired thing. The word needs mechanics and wrestlers, Ha!

persona: I'm close with my family.
I have been to Disneyland. I love Mickey Mouse.
I work as a baby delivery nurse. I have dropped some babies. I don't get pay a lot. Money is very tight, I have to walk to work. If I switch departments I'll lose pay.
I want to return to school. I might attend school in Orlando. I might try economics as a major. I won't major in anything related to hospitals.
I'd like to learn to coupon to save money. I applied for scholarships.
dialogue: Have things improved at work?
Not really, The job is really demanding and doesn't pay very well. I would like to go back to school if I could afford it.
What would you want to study if you went back to school?
I am really interested in business and the economy, So I was thinking economics. Definitely nothing related to medicine!
That is quite a change but if you are not happy doing what you are doing then go for it. I can tell you that doing a job in an area you enjoy is worth the hassle of retraining.
I agree and hope I can follow through. I was wondering how your move into your new home was going?
It went well. I haven't got much inside yet as I don't have much money. However, I have big plans for the future for the space.
Sounds great! Does the house need a lot of work?
No not at all but I want to furnish it properly. It is just empty space at the moment.
Well, Hopefully you'll make lots of money at your new job and you'll get all the furniture you want!
I'm hoping so. I'll still have no money though as I will be spending it all on the new house!
At least those are worthwile expenses. Your an economist, So I trust you'll figure out the best way to spend your money.

persona: I love my purple hair. I enjoy watching war documentaries.
I have a  female bird that loves cheeseburgers. My favorite is cheeseburgers.
I live the holidays. I volunteer at a soup kitchen during the holidays. I love to give back. I go to the soup kitchen most Fridays and Sundays. My 4 hour shift usually starts at 10 am.
I am 33 years old. I grew up poor.
I dyed my hair purple to be different.
I drive.
I shop at Macy's. I love shopping for new clothes. My family is coming to my place for Thanksgiving.
dialogue: I love my new outfits will you help me shop again?
Absolutely! I'm itching to go shopping, Especially with summer coming up. We can hit Macy's, Lord & Taylor, And Nordstrom Rack.
Ooh, Those sound like a good idea. Might also hit up Dillards and J. C. Penny. Actually, Are those still around? I thought J. C. Penny went bankrupt a while back.

We can hit those stores, Too. I'd like to go to Hot Topic, Also, As they have cool garb that would go well with my purple hair. J. C. Penney did file bankruptcy in 2020, And they closed many stores, But they are still operating.
Oh, It's good to know they're still around. They've always got a bunch of good clearance deals. Hot Topic sounds like a must-visit as well. I've never shopped there before. What sets it apart?

I'm all about the clearance deals! I think I've got a keen eye for bargains because my family didn't have much money while I was growing up. Hot Topic has a lot of rock band merchandise, Gothic wear, Punk rock wear, Music, Accessories, And more.

I grew up poor as well. Well, Actually, Basically everyone was poor during the depression. Ooh, Hot Topic sounds great, Especially for younger folks. I'm not sure it'd fit my old geezer style, Though. I'd be happy to check it out, However.

I can't imagine how tough it was to go through the Great Depression. I'm glad you decided to volunteer for the soup kitchen, Though. You're going to feel so good about yourself helping needy folks during the holidays.

Yeah, It helps keep my spirits up. The holidays are cold, Plus everyone I love is dead and I'm without anyone to celebrate with, So I'm pretty miserable during the holidays. Volunteering keeps me occupied.
I'm sorry to hear you have a rough time during the holidays. Have you ever done any volunteer work before?

I have. I used to volunteer at an animal shelter, But that requires me to chase animals around, And I'm too old for that kind of stuff now. Ladling soup and greeting people sounds like a more doable task for me.
I've never volunteered at an animal shelter, Before, But it's something to consider. I'm an animal lover, As well.

persona: I like wine. I like dancing. I like reading.
I prefer well aged and fermented wine. I am not a picky eater. I really like Malbec.
I am at least 100 years old. I don't work. I want to enjoy life.
I never got into cigars.
I like sweet wine, but not sangria sweet. I love red wine. I prefer French wine. My favorite French wine is Bordeaux red.
dialogue: What do you attribute your longevity to?
Well, I think it has to do in part with not smoking. Also, I think the red wine has provided me with lasting health benefits.
Doctors do say that red wine is great for health. Wish I could get into red wine more, I do prefer the white. Had a great gewurztraminer this month.
What in tarnation is a gewurztraminer? I've never heard of that wine.
It's a German white wine, You say you prefer French reds. Wonder if you'll ever get curious and try more German white wines!
Hey, If it's got booze in it, I'm willing to give it a whirl! Can I buy gewurztraminer wine anywhere?

I've seen it in a handful of stores, And I'm not in the largest city, So yes. It's usually on the menu at my favorite high end restaurant in town. It's not the most expensive, But has a nice bright sweetness. What's the last red wine you've had?

I'll look for it the next time I visit my favorite wine shops. You might laugh, But the last wine I had was Yago! Sangria. I was at a friend's house and that's all they had. It's not quite up to my snobbish, Elitist standards, To say the least.
Ah, Variety is the spice of life, They say. Sangria can pack a bit to it sometimes. I hope it was a good one. The last red I really enjoyed, Was atawny port wine.
Port is nice, Too. It's quite heady and strong. So, What else have you been up to besides guzzling vino and smoking stogies? Ha!
Oh, Been chatting with a few friends with wild senses of humor. That may be you, Hehe. Lining up my week, Considering when exercise will happen. You?
I appreciate that compliment. I crack myself up, Also. I've been working a lot, Reading and watching movies after work to unwind mostly.

persona: My mom is traditional. My family is from India.
I live in a house with my parents. I live near a pool. I coach swimming.
I an still in school studying to be a computer programmer. I have to finish my degree before I can move. I graduate in 3 more years. I like my classes and find them challenging.
I want to visit the dorm. I would join a study group. I want to socialize.
I'm taking bio and don't like it. I don't know much bio. I don't have much time for friends. I am hoping for a good GPA. I want to visit the dorms.
dialogue: I got called in for a shift at work.
I hear you, That sounds rough. Hope you had enough rest. Are you going in, Or turning down the offer?
I'm going in, I could use the extra hours.
Money is a good thing, Even if you have to give up time to get it. I've got a bunch of reading to do this week, For school.
Is there any particular study you'll be doing the reading for?
I'm studying a computer coding language. Very repetitive. How about your studies?
I'm done with my studies. What made you pic computer coding as a subject of study?

Well that was quick, And so much detail there! Heheh. Coding is something my mind does very well, And it just makes sense to me, To work through. No studies, And just moved to the dorms. What's that like?
It's good. I've been enjoying my free time now and can partake in more of my hobbies. How long have you been coding for?
A few years now, Although I guess it takes a few years to good, Just like your hobbies. Tell me one specific hobby you have!
I've just been binging a lot of hbo lately. Mostly catching up on old tv shows. Do you have hbo max?
I'm not sure, Would have to check with my parents on that. Lately, Haven't been hunting for things to watch. Sounds like you may have a hobby as a movie critic some day.

persona: I am famous. I helped design the game Starcraft. I don't play games.
I like to use Twitch.
I like pizza. I don't live near the ocean.  I am allergic to water.
I have not seen another human in 5 years.  I use delivery services for everything I need.
I am making a robot. I haven't chosen the robot's voice. I want it to have options. The robot will be a servant and friend.
I have a house. I am busy.
I like Simon and Garfunkel.
dialogue: My cow is doing very well and eating well now.
That's good to hear did you give them anything in particular that helped them feel better? Did they have to see any specialist or anything that helped the condition it was facing?
I just gave it more hay I think the antibiotics have just finally kicked in so i'm so relieved because I was worried it could be a lot more serious.

I believe it, I personally don't have any pets, But for something that was a gift from your parents I'm sure it's very special and very relieving. Maybe I'll consider getting a pet sometime, So I can have more interaction with something. Does it feel good raising a pet?
Oh I love having a pet, It just gives you something else to focus on and a reason to think of someone else. I just love animals though so I'm biased! What pet do you think you'd like?

Maybe a cat. I'm so busy with everything and building my robot that I would need something that isn't too demanding. It's tough with how much work I am doing, But I think a cat would be good. Have you played any Starcraft lately, Or any other game?

Aw yeah a cat would be perfect pet - enough to keep you busy and company but not too much hassle that it would negatively impact you. I have been too busy with my cow to properly get a chance to play unfortunately! How's the robot been going?

It's been coming along fine. Working right now on response coordination an and reply input. I've had to outsource and implement a lot of different machine learning algorithms since the robot has to be able to respond to a lot of different variations. I don't enjoy games, Myself, But it sort of feels like one. I still don't know what voice it should have, What do you think, Male or female?
I think I'd prefer a male voice - I don't know why! But I like when my devices are male voices but with like a British or Australian accent.
That's true and what I was leaning towards. A british accent would sound great too.
I always set up my sat nav to have a british accent - I don't know why!
It is very soothing and easy to listen too I agree. Almost makes me wish I had a british accent myself! I think that's great advice thank you so much, I think I'll go with that!

persona: I am an Olympic gymnast. I don't read much.
I have been to Spain. I bought a yellow blouse in Spain.
I have 2 years before I retire from gymnastics.

I am young. I would like to go to culinary school. I cook a lot of Italian and garlic bread. I would love to be a pastry chef. I make a lot of earl grey shortbread. I like strawberry shortbread, Earl Grey shortbread.
I have not read the book Caste.
I am skeptical about the value of race relations advocacy.
I always bake more than one thing.
I love peanut butter cookies. I can't taste macadamia or pistachio or cookies. We made dinosaur cookies with Santa hats last Christmas.
dialogue: I've been thinking a lot about Christmas since our last conversation, I know it's a long way away but I just love the season so much!
Me too! We should have a baking competition and see who makes better cookies!
Oh absolutely!! What's your favourite kind of cookie?
You know I'm addicted to peanut butter cookies! We will have the whole year to practice until Christmas!
Duh! Had a total mind blank there! I'll keep practicing my shortbread too so I can try and take you on with that too!!!.
Haha you're on!! No one has ever baked a better shortbread than me!
Oh I like the confidence! It'll just spur me on when I'm practicing - I love a good challenge!!.
I'll keep sending you pictures of my latest creations! I expect you to do the same until our final competition!
Oh 100% this will be so much fun - i'm so glad to have a friend who enjoy baking as much as me.
I'm glad I met you. We have so many differences and similarities!
I know! It's exciting to be able to talk about such a fun range of things with you.
We'll have to get together someday and share some baking recipes and tips!

persona: I go to Disney World every year.  I like Mickey Mouse. My favorite ride is Thunder Mountain. I like Disney World better then Disney Land. I live closer to Disney World than to Disney Land.
I like the band Rascal Flats.
I have never been to a national park.  I like playing on playgrounds with my friends.
I like the movie Frozen.
I do not have pets. I live with my family. I'm a 3rd grader. I have an older sister.
I have two favorite Rascal Flatts songs.
I would love to play piano. I have tried to play the flute.
dialogue: Does your sister play any instruments or take any lessons?
No, She doesn't. What makes you ask that?
I was just wondering because you like to play music.
Yeah, I love it! My sister likes to listen to music but she doesn't seem interested in actually playing it. How is your music going?
It is going great, I have been listening to the Manic Street Preachers.
Nice. Have you started learning to play harp? I remember you saying that you wanted to do that?
Yes I have! I love playing the harp!
How are you learning to play? Are you getting professional lessons or teaching yourself somehow?
I have an instructor who is teaching me.
That would be a very good choice. I can't imagine trying to learn harp alone.
It is a very beautiful instrument to play.
I've never tried it. Maybe I'll give it a try in the future after I learn piano.

persona: I am unemployed. I am looking for work. I write. My dream job would be a writer. I was an ER doctor. I would like a relaxing job.
My daughter is thought of by some to be a child prodigy. My daughter is talented in math. I hate math.
My favorite movie is Friday!. I love the movie Clueless. I hope another Friday! movie is made.
I want to write a clueless sequel. I like fantasy and mystery books.
I like comedies.Blue Planet is my favorite.
dialogue: How has your job search been going this week?
I've had a couple if interviews. Wish me luck. I'm ready to work.
I feel that, I am having trouble looking for work right now.
I feel you. Do you make enough to survive from knitting?
I make enough.
At least you have something to fall back on. I've always wanted to be able to make things with my hands. That has to be so satisfying.
That is true. You should try out knitting!
I don't even know where to get started. Where should i start?
Go on youtube and start learning!
I don't know if i have the patience. It looks complicated.
Trust me anyone can learn how to knit.
I will give it a try. I would love to pass down some of my creations to my family.

persona: I am in graduate school studying psychology.
I love the outdoors. I learnt how to survive in the wilderness for weeks from my parents. I love hiking.
I love the Jim Shockey show.
My parents were there when I was a child. My parents hike often with me when I was a child.
I am a dog walker.
I am a professional gambler. My favorite games are blackjack and Texas Hold 'Em.
Sports betting is legal in my state. I'm afraid of getting addicted to card games.
dialogue: I just had a pretty good run at online poker. Not my best day ever, But I made 500 bucks!
Congratulations! Will you use your winnings to purchase any survival gear?
Maybe a few small items, But I like to go out into the woods with minimal gear to really test my survival skills. Have you ever tried survival with no gear?
No, I take my dog with me whenever I go camping, So at the very least, I need to bring a bowl for water.
Gotcha. What kind of dog do you have?
I have a mixed breed. Do you bring your dog with you when you test your survival skills?
No, I don't bring her. She's not really a survival dog, She's too spoiled!
Tee hee. At least she can be at your side when you play poker online!
She is definitely my poker partner. She keeps me calm and relaxed. How has your gambling been going? Makin' any money?
I hit a bad streak, So I've put myself in time out. I've got to learn to discipline myself one luck doesn't go my way.
Trying to gamble professionally definitely tests your wits and patience! I've been at it for a few years and have lost it all only to win it back multiple times.
I would have thought studying psychology would have given me an advantage playing, But I guess there's more to it than that! You seem to have found a good system.

persona: I'm a recording engineer. I live in California.
I do not like going to concerts.
I like racing. I do not like lawyers. My ex partner left me for a lawyer. My ex partner did not like Aerosmith. I want to stay single for awhile. I don't trust people who don't like Aerosmith.
My mom does not like Mexican food or fast cars. My mom lies and cheats.
I'm 46. I have kids.
I like Mexican food. I like tacos and quesedillas. My mother likes Italian food. I'm trying to get my mom to like Mexican food.
dialogue: That lady I've been dating has a friend. Maybe I could introduce you to her, If you're ready to start dating again.
Thanks but I still have a bad taste in my mouth from the ex-partner. Why don't you like lawyers?

When my parents got a divorce, The lawyer did a terrible job representing my dad, And he lost the family home. My mother got everything, Which sucked, Since she was totally responsible for the divorce. I don't talk to her much these days.
I'm sorry. It seems like there are a lot of bad lawyers out there. Do you know if your new girlfriend likes Aerosmith?

I hope she does. She expressed interest in the concert, At least. I'll report back after the concert--you can use that information to advise me on whether or not I should pursue a more serious relationship with her, Haha.
Sure. That will tell you a lot about her. It sounds like you are a lady magnet. What was it like being a construction model?

It was an interesting job. I got to build small models, And take them to architects for review. I have a whole collection of 1:1000 scale models of skyscrapers and apartment buildings I helped design. If you live in Milwaukee, You can even see some of the buildings I worked on out in the wild.
That's awesome! Sounds really interesting. I would love to see some of them. So do you do that full time?

I do, Though I'm planning to switch industries, Or maybe take a "mini-retirement", Where I quit and travel the world for a few years. Life is short, You know? Maybe I can go on an Aerosmith binge tour, Haha.
That is interesting. Where would you like to go?

I haven't really decided yet. Maybe I'll just backpack across the US. I haven't been to the west coast much, And the pacific northwest looks very peaceful and scenic. Maybe I can check that area of the country out.

Yes, I love it in California. We have ocean, Mountains, Desert, Forests and just about everything you want. You should take a trip down the west coast. It is very pretty. I spend a lot of time at the ocean and I love the mountains. You could visit Sequoia National Park, Yosemite and the Redwoods. I used to camp there every year.

persona: My name is Kelly. I live in the southwest. I work for the US Postal Service.
My father is deceased. He drove for Nascar.
I have a German shepherd named Barnaby. I like to swim with my dog.
I play softball. I'm scared of scorpions.
I live far away from Boston. I have some vacation time available at my job.
I like to drive at night. I will drive to Boston and stay in a hotel. I would like to visit my frind.
I don't have children.
I volunteer at a pet shelter. I like animals.
dialogue: How are the travel preparations going? I was thinking of eating out when you visit. What do you think?
The travel prep is going great! I love eating out. What food is your favorite?
Tend to be open to suggestions, Although love international food. There's a great breakfast place a few miles from here too. Food wise - Italian, Latinx, Asian, Any of those you prefer?
I think Italian sounds good. I bet Boston has a lot of great Italian places. What is there fun to do in Boston?
Eating is a main stay, Good to know a preference then, Italian is something we can look for. Are you into sports?
I like Nascar, But will watch hockey as well. Softball is just ok, But I know you like it.
Maybe we could find a race track, If you wanted to watch a few drivers and cars. Nascar isn't something I've spent much time on, But for you I'd be open to trying.
Thanks! I'd love to check that out while in Boston, And in turn we could go watch some softball.
I appreciate you thinking of that, Thank you. That's pretty easy, There's a park nearby, We could throw a few balls maybe, Warm up.
I'd love to play softball with you!
We can make this happen, I have the technology! Hehe. Well a few gloves and balls I suppose. Are you left or right handed?
I am right handed, Yourself?

persona: I love playing folk music.  I would love to be a professional musician. I play the guitar, piano, and like to sing. I like Bob Dylan. Bob Dylan is an inspiration for me. I am interested in how instruments are made.
I went to a Yo-yo ma and Mark O'Connor concert. I like classic and baroque music.
I don't listen to podcasts. I like to see local bands and big name music groups.
I don't like to drink much. I like Bourbon. My favorite Bourbon is Blanton.
I work as a custodian.
I have a father.
I go cycling.
dialogue: I've just watched another really interesting video about how guitars are made.
That sounds so cool! What is the most interesting fact that you learned?
I didn't know guitar strings were mostly made of steel and nickel.
That is really interesting, Are violin and cello strings also made of steel and nickel, I wonder?
Good question, Not sure of cello, But violin strings are made of different material depending on the chord. Could be nylon, Steel or even sheep intestine!
Sheep intestine! I have never heard of that. Has it inspired you to listen to more music?
No, Actually, It has inspired me to drink more Bourbon and to find out how it's made!
That is a great idea! I sure do love my bourbon, But I have no idea how it is made. You have a curious mind! What is your favorite subject to read or study up on?
I am fascinated by forensics related to unsolved crimes.
That sounds extremely fascinating. Have you ever watched the series "Mindhunter"? Not unsolved crimes, But getting into the minds of serial killers. Pretty cool.
No, Never saw it, But I will look into it... Is it available on Netflix?
Yes, It is on Netflix! It is based on the true story of when the FBI first started "profiling" serial killers. It is what the show Criminal Minds is based on, If you have ever watched that.

persona: I am from NYC.
I work in a bookstore. I don't like reading. I like audio books. I want to own a bookstore. I am having trouble finding space to rent for a business.
I don't like the color orange.
I don't have space for a chemistry set.
I am from Canada. I was never in the army. Nobody In my family was in the army.
I have completed college for chemistry.
I considered joining the military.
dialogue: Hey I know some people and I may know a good affordable place you could rent for your business.
Really? That would be fantastic! I would love to get in contact with them. Do you know what area it is in?
It is is in Brooklyn and I am sure it would be perfect for your bookstore.
That's great to hear! If this works out, You'll have to come visit when you are out of the Army, Even if you don't like books much. Have you considered any school programs for when you are done?
Thanks, Yes I will. I have been considering forensic science but not sure what the job market is like in that area.
That makes sense. Hopefully you can find someone in the industry that might have some insight. Do you think you would stay around Vancouver, Either for school or after?

I think I might travel somewhere else to look for work. I am used to constantly travelling being in the army sotat does not bother me. I suppose crime will always happen so there is demand for the work.

That's a good point! It seems like it could be a good mix of mystery and hard science if you choose to pursue it. I know reading isn't your favorite, But maybe finding a good Sherlock Holmes or other crime-solving novel could spark your interest!
Maybe I could come by your bookstore and pick up a few crime book to get me started. Never enjoy reading but that might be because I haven't found the right ones.
I would love to help you find some great books to get you started. If you're like me, You might prefer audio books that you can listen to while you travel.
That's a good idea. I think some of the reason I do not like reading is the actual reading. Listening to some audio books could make it more enjoyable for me, Thanks for the suggestion!
Of course! Getting lost in a story might also help to relieve some stress. Although I can't blame you for enjoying a good nap to recharge instead.

persona: My kids are grown and I'm 60 years old. My two kids are good, one is a lawyer, the other is a carpenter.
I work as a librarian and plan to retire soon. Being a librarian is great.
I would be happy to help my grandkids when I get them. Although, I don't have FaceBook. I like to learn new things.
I am not familiar with deep seat couches. I have an old couch that has been reupholstered.
dialogue: Since my family has had some time to enjoy the new couch, Would you be interested in coming over to try it out?
I would love to come try it out and see what the big deal about deep seat couches is all about!
You're welcome to come by anytime, But be warned that you'll have to compete for couch space with my two kids, Especially my little girl, Who is perpetually glued to the boob tube.
I'm sure they will let an old lady like me have a seat at the new couch!
I'll tell them to play nicely with you. How did your new couch come out when you had it upholstered?
Oh you know me! I can't tell the difference and a couch is a couch! Maybe trying out your couch will enlighten me to the world of couches!
Ha! How's your job at the library going? Anything fun, Exciting, Or noteworthy?
Working at the library is always a good time for me - familiar, Friendly faces and a ton of knowledge for everyone! You should come visit at the library with your kids more.
We will! My high-school aged kid has an English term paper due in a few weeks, So I'll have him drive over there to do some research.
I look forward to seeing him. I'll do my best with helping him on his paper! Helping students is one of my favorites as a librarian.
I appreciate that. Maybe you could ask him to help you learn to use Facebook. I bet your kids would get a kick out of their old mother messaging them on Facebook!
That's an excellent idea! Once I retire, I'll need to catch up with people easily somehow. It's time I learn how to Facebook.

persona: I work in construction and started when I was 16.
I like Mexican food over burgers.
I like tacos. I eat raw meat, I love sushi. I prefer meat to be cooked. The fish I prefer is squid. I rarely eat seafood.
My favorite band is Aerosmith.
I am a terrible cook. I drink beer. I like cheese.
dialogue: Hello - How has your week been going? How is the construction business?
My week was good and my business has been great!
That sounds good. I'm so glad that things are going well.Tried any good food lately?
Yes I have. I had this amazing teriyaki bowl.
What kind of meat was in it? Was it cooked or was it raw?
It was cooked chicken in a bowl.
I know you eat raw meat. Have you ever had a raw meat teriyaki bowl?
No I have not! I wonder what it tastes like!
Probably pretty bad. Hey, I've been studying Mexican cuisine. I am going to make some burritos soon and would like you to try them out.
I would love to try out some burritos!
So I'm trying to get some ideas about what makes a good burrito. What do you like?
I like a lot of things in my burritos. Chicken, Beans, Tomatoes, Sour cream, Beans.

persona: I harvested the fields for winter. I grow corn and soybeans at my parents farm. I have a pet cow.
I like country music.
I am Amish. I live in Lancaster County. I was born into an Amish community. I speak English and Pennsylvania Dutch.
I have crops. I harvest by hand. I'm into farming. I live in a community who harvests by hand.
dialogue: What kind of crops do you have?
Mostly corn and soybeans! Do you like corn?
I love corn. How much do you grow?
Me too! I grow acres of it, It's our biggest crop. I do all the harvesting by hand so it can be really time consuming. Have you ever grown your own crops?
Not to scale that you grow. Mine was just enough for me. I guess you guys do a lot of manual labor in Amish Country while you are farming!
Yeah we don't use machines - I'd say you'd consider it really old fashioned but it's just the way we do things.
I would love to visit Amish Country and see how you guys harvest. I'm seen it in movies, But not in real life.
You should come and visit me, You'd be very welcome. I could show you how differently we live! It is probably quite the culture shock.
I bet I couldn't last one day in the field! You guys would have to take it easy on me!!!.
Hahaha don't worry - we'd never expect the same work from an outsider. We're reasonable people!
That's great! I will try my best, But my best won't be good compared to you guys lol.
Hey don't undersell yourself, Your best is all anyone can ask for.

persona: I have a grey German Sheppard named Barnaby. I hate scorpions.

My dad was killed at a Nascar event when the wall did not hold up. I am suing them. My mother is becoming depressed. We are both very sad. My mother and I need to keep busy and occupy our minds for a while. I give my time to the Humane Society.
I play cards or board games.
I used to coach. I'm trying to work out consistently. I love learning.
dialogue: I bought a new video game for myself and the kids.
Hey that's sounds like fun. Now I'm curious what games you bought! I've been leaning towards board games lately myself.
Just a war strategy game. It's a lot of fun! What are your favorite board games?
I mostly lean towards problem solving games, When it comes to board games. Which war?
Very cool. Have you played backgammon? It's not a specific war so much as a generalized dystopian future where different factions are fighting. It's pretty interesting!
Backgammon yes, That's an old classic. Like checkers! Ah, So kind of a sci fi version of some universe then maybe. Some games, You can get completely lost in!
It's very true. How has your mom been lately?
Let me follow that mind of yours, You are moving fast now, Hehe. Mom has been thinking about exercising more, To help with her mental health stuff. I'm very supportive.
That's wonderful! Exercise is key to staying calm, I've found. Especially any sort of cardio.
Cardio is good. Sometimes Pilates or yoga is great too, Just to get someone in their body, And grounded. I do meditation sometimes.
Do you have access to any parks or other outdoor areas where you are? I've found that getting out in the fresh air really maximizes the experience.
Gotta keep the pets exercised, So there's a few places to go for sure. I agree, Just being around the trees and forest helps. I've been wondering how you keep all your kids busy these days?

persona: I like green living. I put solar panels on my roof.
I love cookouts. I'm involved in the women rights movement.
I work from home doing internet searches. I work in an office but I stay busy when I am home.
I have an organic garden. I try to grow and cook organic foods. It is something I am passionate about. I like an all natural simple chef salad fresh from my garden.
I love most food. My favorite vegetable is spinach. I'd like to open a store to sell my vegetables someday. I get my gardening done before work. I don't buy vegetables from the supermarket.
dialogue: My interview went well, I think I will get the job.
Oh amazing! Did they tell you when you're going to hear if you got it or not?
Still in the waiting process, Before any firm offers have been made. I'm a little nervous about it, Trying to feel confident. Been thinking about this weather, Bet your garden is growing nice!
It's hard to wait it out but i'm sure you did great!! Yeah this weather has been amazing for my garden, Some of my vegetables have been ready for picking so I've made some awesome salads this week.

An early harvest then, Although new sprouts will grow to replace. That's pretty exciting. I have to pace the job search thing, Can get burnt out on it sometimes. A little gardening and fresh air, Might do me good. I like that you're feeding yourself, With your own grown food!

I love being able to just go out and pick my own food - it makes me feel really at one with nature. I would really recommend getting outside and growing something - especially when you spend so much time behind a computer screen. It's good for your mental health.

Agreed. It's also something to be mindful of, You have to nurture and maintain it. I try to be careful about what responsibilities I take on... Can barely keep my house plants green! Still want to though.
Hey it's the effort that counts - I killed a lot of veggies before I got the hang of gardening!
I hear you, Yes, It's a process definitely. Two steps forward, One step back. I've been thinking about Romaine lettuce, Love that in salads. You have fave plants in the garden?
Oh I love Romaine too! I think my favouriteveg to grow are tomatoes though, You get to pick them when they get to your colour preference - green or red!
Tomatoes too, They are so productive a plant. Cherry tomatoes are a fave, I like how they can have a smokey flavor sometimes. Green tomatoes, Haven't eaten many. You fry them?
Oh yeah they need to be fried to really enjoy them - I quite like growing chillis too! I love spicy food.

persona: I play games.
I am a recording engineer.
I'm 46. I'm a single dad. My favorite recording artist died last year.
I play Counter Strike. I watch Counter Strike professionals play. I'm not familiar with RPGs. I'm interested in playing professionally.
dialogue: Did you look into starting a Twitch account?
No I haven't. I really need to get on top of that soon. Are there any issues that I need to look out for given your experience with Twitch?
It's easy to get bogged down with problem users, So I'd just be mentally prepared for it lol.

Yeah that's what I've been thinking. I love being a gamer and want to show how good I am. But geeze, I really can't stand some of the foolishness that I experience from fellow gamers and I don't really appreciate the "courage" people find when they are hiding behind a computer monitor.
Yeah, You're basically mixing social media with your gaming, So you just have to be prepared to drink from a firehose haha. Plus, There are some people using twitch as a platform for attention.
Haha! Firehose! You couldn't be more spot on with that metaphor! But yeah, I guess I have to take the deep dive. Cross your fingers for me! I'll be getting it set up this week.
I'll definitely spare a thought for you! How've things been at the recording studio lately?
Super busy. We've had some new clients come in that are fairly particular, So I feel kind of like a chicken with its head cut off! How about you? How's work been going at school?
There's never a dull moment! There are a few students who've discovered my Twitch stream, So I've become a bit of a campus celebrity!
Haha! Hopefully that's been a positive experience for you! Are they loving the fact that someone older than them can get down on gaming better than they do?
Oh yes, They're totally jealous of my skills! I appreciate the attention, Though. It helps keep me young!

For sure! You should take great pride in that. My dad is younger than you and he doesn't even know how to use a computer beyond just browsing the internet. And his experience with gaming doesn't go beyond Pac Man.

persona: I have a pet cow. I work for my parents who are dairy farmers. My parents have a farm. I love taking care of the cows. I am very used to working on the farm.
I like country music and line dancing.
I drive a big Ford F150 truck. I don't transport things often with my truck. I am a fan of Ford.
I hardly read.
dialogue: I did it, I bought a new truck!
Nice, What did you end up getting?
I ended up buying a Ford F-150.
Welp, I can't argue with that choice. My F150 has been going strong for years. Are you going to pull horse trailers with it?
Yes I am going to pull horse trailers with it.
It should do a good job with that. Of course, You will lose gas mileage when pulling but that is normal. Did you ever get any big dogs?
Yes I do have big dogs.
What? You went ahead and got some? I remember you saying you wanted to but didn't know you already did. What did you end up getting?
I ended up getting them because I liked them.
Yeah, What kind of dogs did you though?
I ended up getting some golden retrievers.
That sounds like a good choice. I would use them for hunting if I had some. But, All I have right now is a pet cow. He is worthless for hunting.

persona: I majored in chemistry. I owe a lot of student loans. I work in a research lab. I have a chemistry degree.
I hate orange. I don't have a partner.
I like clubbing. I think clubs are not as good now.
I work at a bookstore. My job has been hit pretty hard.
I own a kindle. I prefer physical books most of the time. I like historical biographies and self-help books. I read books on personal finance. I want to read JL Collins' book.
dialogue: What's your favourite drink while at the club?
I'm simple type so like coke and rum are. What about what is your favorite drink to have?
I like coke and run too, But I'm a craft beer person mostly. Are you going to the club this weekend?
I'm not sure yet! I Want to but i really don't have anyone to go with this weekend. But you never know i may. What type of music do you like when you go clubbing?
I like R&B and Rap. How about you?
Same but i go more towards the 90s R&B and rap mixed with a little new school. Do you plan on going to the club this weekend?
I'm thinking about it. I'm a little nervous because I haven't been many times in my life. Do you have any suggestions?
Just make sure you go with friends and make sure that the club has good reviews. Other than that just relax and enjoy yourself.
The friends will help take away the nervousness, And you are right, I need to read the reviews. Wish me luck!
You got this i know you and your friends will have a good time. How many time have you been to a club?
Only twice in my whole life!
A wow so you're a newbie. Well i hope you're able to go this weekend and enjoy it.

persona: I'm in high school. I'm a homecoming queen. I want to be a physical therapist.
I love music. I find classical music relaxing. My favorite music is chilled out Ibiza classics.
I am a runner. I use the app Strava for running. I also run and use an app to monitor my progress. I run before school while listening to music.
Club music helps me get into a good mindset for the day. Music helps me stay focused.
dialogue: Based on you question, I played different rock bands to my horses. They didn't really seem to have a favorite. Do you have a favorite rock band?
I'm more into punk rock than rock! I love Blink 182 and like listening to it when i'm out runnong.
I can see how that would energize you when you run! Are you training for any races?
I'm training for a local 10k race - I really want to try and get myself up to a half marathon level so i'm using this as atester to see how I get on with my faster pace.
Wow, That's great! I just started running and I feel like training for a race would be great motiviation.
Yeah it 100% is because you have a deadline you need to be up to speed by! You should look at local 5k races to start off with.
I've been running 2 miles lately and the extra 1+ miles to get to 5k just seems like a lot! But I do love competition and will probably give a real race a shot. Have you ever won a race?
Oh you can do it! You're so close already, If you can run 2 miles you can get to 3 no problem. And I've not won a race yet but I've been close i've got 2nd and 3rd a few times.
I'm very impressed! I won an equestrian competition once and it was the thrill of my life!
Haha nothing feels better than achieving your goals! I'm all about competing against yourself first and foremost though!
I agree! That's what I love about the new app, It helps me track myself against myself!
Yeah I love to beat myself - seeing yourself improve is the best.

persona: I am in remission.
I have many kids and grandkids.
I make clothes for my family.
One of my grandkids dropped my phone and broke the screen. It is hard for me to afford fixing it. I am not going to let my grandchildren use my phone anymore. I don't like YouTube.
I have been sewing for many years. I make things for cancer patients.
I've recovered from cancer.
dialogue: Did you cook for your grandchildren tonight?
I didn't, Their Mother took them out for some McDonalds. If it was up to me, I would have cooked, But they are so spoilt. What do you like to cook for the homeless?
I used to make large batches of banana bread. It was something that was a bit nutritious and could be packed up well for travel. I'm not a fa n of McDonalds. Home food is better.
Yeah, I totally agree. Home food it way better. You also have that sense of pride. Do you think if you have cooked it yourself, It seems to taste better? I definitely do!
For sure, Plus I like knowing whats in my food.

That is one of the main issues when eating out. Although they are somewhat transparent, It is a bit of a pain trying to access the ingredients list. Have you ever asked what's in things when you eat at a restaurant?
I don't eat out very often. When I do I try not to think about whats in the food, Knowing will make me feel bad about eating it.
I guess that is probably wise. So, Do you take care of your body in other ways then? Running, Going to the gym etc?
I jog around the neighborhood to stay in shape about 2 miles a day.
Is it very picturesque there? My surroundings are pretty standard and boring. I would love to hike down some beautiful routes.
There is a hiking trail near me, But im too scared to hike it alone in case I fall and get hurt.
Maybe you could go with some of your family, Surely you could take your kids with you, And maybe a friend?

persona: I like vegetables.
I come from Australia. I grew up in Sydney.
I have a job. My family moved here when I was 15.
I grow vegetables and tulips.
I like MotoGP. I used to ride dirt bikes when I was a kid. I used to like in Sydney. I've never seen MotoGP in person.
dialogue: The latest MotoGP event will be on TV in 7 hours, Are you going to watch?
Oh 100% I'm excited to see some racing! Are you looking forward to it?
Definitely. Wonder what new cars will be up. Love being there in person though. Been getting beer and snacks lined up for the show!
I can only imagine how good the atmosphere must be! I love kicking back with a beer to watch it from home.
You feel like you are part of something, Even if you can't be there just now. We'll have to catch up after the show, Who won, All that. Been thinking about your garden, How's that going?

Yeah we need to! It's going good - a lot of my tulips are starting to show now and it's really making me smile. I'm just waiting to see what other flowers start to show themselves. Do you do any gardening?
Mom used to have a flower garden, But I'm not much of a gardener so far. Thinking about it maybe. Tulips, I've seen some tulip fields that look like magic. Bet you have a few fave tulip colors?
Oh I love all colours of Tulips - I've been to Holland before and those guys love Tulips even more than me. I've started to try and grow my ownveg recently but that's been a lot of trial and error.
You definitely have a point. I may consider gardening, You are inspiring!
I just love being outside and spending time in nature and not stuck inside all the time!

Holland, As you mentioned, Yes I've thought about those wooden shoes they are always on about. Wonder if they're comfortable? Hehe. Trial and error, Got that with gardening. I've killed a few. We'll have to learn more!
They look a lot more comfy than a pair of high heels! And yeah gardening is allll about trial and error.

persona: My name is Sara. I am 7 years old. I have secret powers. I can freeze time. I have a wild imagination.
I love Christmas.

I am lonely. I live in an orphanage. I have friends who I think have secret powers. My friends and I all have different superpowers. I believe that we protect the orphanage. I want to find a family that also has powers. I want to use my powers for good. I am scared of supervillains.
I want to have a dog as my superhero sidekick.
I love listening to stories. I like reading fantasy stories and comic books.
dialogue: I'm trying to decide which book I want to read next.
You should read the Count of Monte Cristo.
Sounds like an interesting title. What kinda book is it?
It is a book about a saga of excellence.
I'll try it out when I get the chance. It'd be great to discuss it with you afterwards!
Yes that would be very lovely!
Does it have any supervillains or powers in it?
No it does not but that would be cool.
I miss reading fantasy stories. I used to bond with my wife and kids over them.
Yes they are very good to read.
Time passes so quickly when a book so good you can't put it down!
That is honestly so true!

persona: I am in Massachusetts. I work on roofs. I am handy with hammers. I build and fix houses.
I take after my father. My dad taught me to use a hammer. I work for my dad. I will probably own the business one day.
I have six cats. I love my cats. I got two sibling cats at one time. Four of my cats are rescues. I would get more cats.
I do not have kids.
I'd like to learn how to play guitar. I'm going to start playing the acoustic guitar.
I wanted to play the bass when I was a child. I went to a very small school.
dialogue: I had another great show the other night -- they loved my cover versions of some great songs!
That's great! What are some of the covers you played?
I've done tons of them. My latest was a metal version of "Can't Get You Out Of My Head"..
I would love to hear that, Metal is such a different feel than the original.
I think it sounds pretty good. Some people told me they liked it better than the original. That's always nice to hear.
Do you ever play your original music when you perform anymore?
Nah, Not really. It seems that people didn't like it much compared to covers. So, I just do covers now. Did you ever start learning to play guitar?
