I bought an acoustic guitar last week, But I'm still pretty intimidated to start playing it. I've been watching a lot of youtube videos to try to pick up some tips.
Nice. Who have you been watching on YouTube?
Nobody in particular because I don't know if any of the youtubers are any good. I just try to learn some basics. Do you have any recommendations?
Check out Rob Scallon, He is really good with guitar.
Ok great, I'll give him a try. Do you play any other instruments, Or just guitar?

persona: I hate school.  I don't have good grades. I have more than one parent.
I don't have that many friends. I am a 12 year old girl. I stay away from other girls.
I have long red hair and blue eyes. I don't bleach my hair. My hair goes down to my waist.
My favorite class is art. I want a career in art or design. My favorite types of art are sculpture and pottery. I practiced a lot making pottery.
I don't have a pet. I am not responsible. I don't complete my chores on time. I live with my parents.
dialogue: Are you still going to teach me pottery?

Sure! I can do, You just need to make sure you arrange with my mother when you want to come round. Or maybe, Next time you need to come around, You could set off an hour earlier and we could do it then. Does that seem okay to you?
I will get in touch with your mother and make proper arrangements. I will ask her when I talk to her if it is alright if I bring one of my small puppies that I am training over with me.
OmG PLEASEEE!!! I will make sure she lets you, We have such a big garden that your puppy will love. What is his or hers name? And, More importantly, Is she really fluffy?
Her name is Elsa like from the movie Frozen and she has the FLUFFIEST white and tan fur.

You need to get another one and call them Olaf, That would be so cute! I wish we were allowed to have dogs but my dad says it is unfair to leave them in the house by themselves when they go to work and I am at school. Can you try persuade my parents to let me get one?

If I get another puppy I will for sure name it Olaf. I cant persuade them because they are your parents and they have set the rules. But I will bring my pups over for you to visit if it is alright with your parents.

Okay I guess you are right. I cannot wait until I am older so I can have as many dogs as I want. I just think that they are always happy to see their owners and I don't seem to get on with other girls at my school so it would be nice to have someone pleased to see me everyday.
Dogs are a girls best mate. I have a Dog competition soon would you like to come with your parents?
Yes, I would love to. What type of things are they competing for?
Jumping, Dance and running a course. It is fun and there is always LOTS of puppy love :).

When I am at the park with my parents, I always see this really skinny dog running soooo fast. I bet that it would be good at the running course. I have seen YouTube videos of dogs dancing but I am confused as to how they are trained to do such things.

persona: I live in America but My family live in South America. I speak Hmong and English is my second language. I am not very good at it and use my computer and phone to translate.
I have a friend named Noah till 1 year and can speak Hmong. I have 2 friends who speak a different langues. I use Hmong but my dad is bilingual.
I'm in school and very busy. I text my family every day.
I've never been to San Francisco, but I'd like to.
I loved visiting NYC. I like all the people and things to do in NYC. I have visited New York City. I liked eating hot dogs at Coney Island.
I am visiting my mother next month for her birthday.
I'm currently in school. I'm taking my finals next week.
dialogue: I may have found a friend who wants to be my roommate in New York!
Congratulations, And that sounds hopeful. The market can be really competitive. Having a friend along to help, Is a good thing! Next, Have you found an apartment?
Well, They haven't committed to anything yet. I'm still looking for a good apartment that is close to the school.
This is the time to research it. I find with big decisions like this, Researching for a few weeks, Helps me make a decision, In a crunch. Wonder how many years it takes to become a lawyer?
Well, I've read that it takes around 7 years. That seems like a long time right now, But later on in life it won't seem that way (I hope)..
Seems like once you get started, The time just starts getting shorter and shorter. Would love to see you graduate!
Hey, You are in school. How has finals prep been going? Are you ready?
Seems kind of overwhelming lately, Sometimes texting a friend is a good thing to focus on! Hehe. Cram sessions for hours, Makes my brain hurt! I'm passing my courses great though.
What was it that you are studying again? I always seem to forget for some reason.
Right now I'm taking English language classes, To help me speak better. Just doing what they call pre requisites? The core classes, Until you decide your focus.
Well, They seem to be working really well. Your English in here is top notch!
Thank you, And I am getting help from a web translator sometimes! It helps to practice with you too. Tell me your first classes when you get to school!

persona: My name is Leigh. I am 34.
I live in a city. I like to explore the city.
I play trombone, alto saxophone, baritone, and trumpet. I want to learn to play violin. My father plans violin.
I don't run. I can't run a K. I work at a shelter. I started volunteering in high school.
I didn't go to homecoming.
I frequently visit Chinatown. I like Chinese food. I haven't eaten much Indian food. I used to be a picky eater.
I am thinking about trying to live a healthier life.
dialogue: You mentioned that you were thinking about getting on a healthier path last time we talked. I can help you with a simple diet and exercise plan if you want! To begin, You could start exploring your city on foot. Walking is really good for you!
That is a really good idea to be honest. I just feel like walking around the city along would become a bit monotonous after a while though. Do you have any other suggestions?
Maybe do it with a friend and go to the trails and other please so to switch it up. Walking will be a great start to other things. Is there other physical activities that you like?

I really like playing lacrosse. I used to play it a lot when I was younger but it is difficult with the amount of responsibilities that I have at the minute to find time. But, I ought to find time because I love it. Have you ever played Lacrosse before?
No i haven't played Lacrosse before, I've heard of it though. You should start back even if it for like 20 mins.
I really should. You speak nothing but the truth. Have you been out running lately?
Yes i just went to do.
How was it? The weather has been terrible recently, Did you manage to find a window in which it didn't rain?

It's was great! I didn't really feel like it since the weather been crazy but after i finish i felt relaxed again. Yeah i looked at the weather and seen that i had a good hour before it would start again. Do you think you would try running one day?.
I have tried running before but only in short bursts. My knees have been giving me a lot of trouble lately. I have booked a doctor's appointment so hopefully a fix can be identified.

Oh okay, Hopefully you can find some relief and fix the problem. I love running but when my knee start hurting i give myself a break. That's way i think walking would be good for you because it would help with your knee and is a good workout. How long has your knee been giving you trouble?

My knee has been hurting for a while. I would say a good 6-9 months. I think one of the problems is the shoes I wear. Being my age, I love high heels and that is not good for your knees in the long run.

persona: I am 4 years old and enjoy coloring.
My mom is a pole dancer.  My mother works until late into the night. I have a pet turtle. My dolls and turtle are my only friends.
I spend most of my time inside.
I sometimes have to eat food from the alleys.
I have a doll named Katie that is a ballet dancer. I have three dolls named Katie, Sally and Ken.
I have a turtle named Miley who tells me stories.
There is shooting every night in my neighborhood.
dialogue: I've just contacted my friend who owns the dance studio. She said there'd be no problem for your mum to speak to her.
Oh, Okay. That's cool! Do you also take ballet classes at your friends studio?
I do work out there yes, And dance at the studio. I keep thinking about being paid to teach, Although right now, I help others, I dance too. Do you like to dance?
I don't mind dancing, But I prefer coloring. I have a doll named Katie that is a ballet dancer though and my mom is a pole dancer!
Yes, Yes she is. It is cool that you enjoy your dolls, And have one that dances ballet. Bet your mom likes that too. How's your turtle?
Miley is good. She told me an exciting bedtime story the other night about a magical place in the middle of the Earth. Have you ever considered getting a turtle?
I like seeing turtles, And hearing about them. Taking care of them, With my busy schedule, Might be hard. I really love hearing aboutMiley. That turtle sounds like great company!
Yeah,Miley is a dream. She helps me feel safe in this rough neighborhood and keeps me company since I'm alone a lot.
I like knowing you have company when you're in such a situation. I send good thoughts and prayers to you andMiley. Any other dolls that you want to introduce me to?

Yeah, It's nice to talk to someone who grew up in a similar situation. You give me hope for the future. I don't have any new dolls at the moment, But I'm hoping for a new one soon. Maybe my next doll will be a dance coach, Like you.
That would be great! Your ballet dancer doll and the dance coach can play together, Like we play here, When we text. You're creative!
Yes, That's exactly what I was thinking about! If only I could find a coloring coach, ThenMiley and I would both have coach friends.

persona: I go to the gym a lot. I enjoy the treadmill and a rowing machine.
I live in Ohio. I will be moving soon for personal reasons. I am from a small town. I am moving to a bigger town.
I have 2 dogs, a springer spaniel and a labrador. I have a lab that loves hiking. I got my dogs from a shelter.
I want to find an area with nightlife and parks. I don't want to drive much. I've never been to Vermont.
dialogue: I visited a shelter the other day to check out their animals!
Good job, I think checking out the shelter for a dog, Is much better than a breeder or store. Did any of the dogs catch your eye?
There was a gorgeous labrador, Actually, Which is quite tempting. If we ever meet up we can take them for play-dates!
That's a great thing to look forward to. Love a lab dog! Tan, Black, Both are good. Some have long hair too, Reds.... Wonder how a dog would fit where you live?
I think I'd be planning on moving whenever I get one, My apartment wouldn't be great. You had any luck figuring out where you want to move to?

Still researching things, There's a lot to look at. Especially how close a new place will be to night life, Parks, For the dogs. Think at least 2 bedrooms. You're single now, That offers more options too.
Yeah for sure, Gotta take the positives I guess. You know, Sacramento has some pretty great gyms, Since you're into that. Could be worth a look.
Good to know! The standard of living there is a little so so though. Been also thinking more Southern California too I guess. You mentioned Santa Barbara too?

persona: I love hamburgers and french fries, but not soda.
I am married and i own a house. I have a husband.
I have a decent sized yard and there is a dog park in my neighborhood.
I just got a lab. His name is Ben.
I've never been kayaking. I'm not a strong swimmer. I don't like to swim.
I have trouble walking my dog.
dialogue: I was thinking about you guys and I'm wondering if you want to try to do that kayaking this weekend?
I would love to give it a go. I would need some life jackets though as I would be worried about not being able to swim.
Life jackets are always required so the place we go to will provide one for you.
That's a relief. I think I would be happier to do with a group of others until I get comfortable with it.
Kayaking with friends is a lot more fun then going alone. Im sure your gonna have a blast.
I sure it will be lot of fun. Are you excited about starting your PhD?
I am exited! Once i get it i can get my dream job. Did you attend school?
What's your dream job? I did go to school, I studied geography.
I want to be a therapist. Oh nice, What do you do now?
That will be cool. I am an actually a town planner. I design how to layout new towns.
That sounds like an awesome job. How old is your dog ben?
Ben is getting quite old now, He is 13. Hopefully got a good few more years left in him.

persona: I like cooking and eating mexican food. I like trying new food. I like cooking shows.
I have visited a lot of countries. My favorite region is the Caribbean. I like Jamaica, St. Lucia, Aruba, The Dominican Republic, and Barbados. I think cruises are the best vacation.
I have a yacht that has a satellite internet system, so I can teach from it.
I watch documentaries on Netflix. I have seen Free Solo but not Dawn Wall. I like war documentaries. I also just started to teach economics. I am a teacher.
dialogue: I am thinking about traveling across the USA.
Really? Why the sudden interest in travel?
Oh, I've been thinking about it for some time. I'd really like to see some of the National Parks. I definitely want to include Yosemite on my trip.
That sounds exiting. Any states in particular you want to visit?
Well, There are a lot of National parks in the western part of the country. Yosemite, The Grand Canyon, Yellowstone, Etc. I think I'll rent an RV.
That sounds like a good idea. I know there are some nice parks around Tennessee, Kentucky, And West Virginia?
Yes, I've been to the Smokies, And the Everglades. I think I'd rather travel further west this time though. I've never been west of the Mississippi.
Western United States is extremely beautiful so i know your going to enjoy it.
Maybe I'll even get to the Redwood forest! Have a lot more time on my hands now. When I was working I could only take short trips close to home.
I have never been but i have seen pictures in textbooks and it looks very cool.
Yeah, I've always been impressed. I think I'm going to start taking two vacations a year. One in the states, And one abroad or in the Caribbean.
I love the Caribbean. If you need information about it let me know.

persona: I received powers from surgery I had last week. My heart is outside my body, it has a metal frame so I have little worries with it beyond avoiding crowds. I also had a brain transplant and can move objects with my mind. I am adjusting after my surgery.

I claim to be telepathic, but it's difficult to use my powers to protect myself so I mostly use them to help others. People are often freaked out by me and/or my claimed powers. I claim to have saved a pedestrian by stopping a car with my powers.
I like decorating.
I am not too busy.
dialogue: Are you still going to the doctor often for follow up appointments?
Yeah, I have to. Fortunately my telekinetic powers keep things from bumping into my heart. But i still like the doctor to check things out.
I think it is best to have a doctor check everything out. You never know if need any extra help. What led to you needing a new brain?
The old one wasn't working quite right. I couldn't make anything move with it.
Was it always broken like that, Or did it suddenly stop working?
Well, It never could do that, Really, That's just a perk with the new brain. The real problem was that my telepathy started working backwards and everyone could read MY thoughts!
Wow that could be a problem. I am not sure I would people to read my mind! Has your new brain changed the way you decorate?
Yes, That's why I'm not so busy. I just tell the paintbrush to go to work on it's own, While I try to read the minds of people on TV.
That must make it so much easier than having to do the painting. Although I enjoy the feeling of a brush in my hand.
See? I knew you were going to say that!
Do you know I am thinking about at the moment? I will try to hide it from you.
You are thinking that your new chandeliers might fall on your head. Don't worry, I'll use my powers to keep them in place for you!

persona: I love country music. I have met taylor swift.
I am a manager in convenience store.
I drive nissan but I need new one.  I am considering buying an electric vehicle.
I am 40 year old woman.
I like frogs and frog legs.
I have listened to Maggie Sajak songs. I have been listening to reggae lately. My favorite song by Protoje is "Who Knows" featuring Chronixx. I like Protoje. I like Jesse Royal.
I am pro-diversity.
My house in in a shady area.  I am considering buying solar panels. I own my home. I support green energy.
dialogue: There's a green energy expo downtown this weekend you might want to check out!
Oh, That's excellent. I want to talk to some installers to check prices for solar. Did you find it difficult to choose your provider?
I did a lot of research and i found out that thetesla solar panels are the cheapest and the ones that look the nicest.
That's interesting. I figured they would be the most expensive ones out there. I guess I haven't really done my homework!
They are extremely affordable and they save alot of energy.
Are you planning to come by and get your veggies this week? We just got lots of interesting greens, And some wild-looking carrots.
You already know it i am making chicken soup this weekend so i need to find the freshest veggies.
I'll set aside some onions for you as well. We didn't get any new red onions this time, As I heard a big corporation is buying up all the red onions in the area, But we have some nice yellow ones.
Dang it, Red onions are my favorite for the soup. Its okay though i can skip out on the onions this weekend. How is Taylor Swift like?
She was kind of a regular person, You know? I thought she would be a snob, To be honest, But she was polite and smiled a lot. Have you ever met anyone famous?
I met the actor that played Michael from Zoey 101 once. He was pretty cool.
That's fun. Did you get a picture with him? I was too afraid to ask Taylor!

persona: I like eating tacos and watching nascar.
My coworkers make great tacos on fridays. I started working in construction when I was 16. Fish tacos are my favorite. I like pineapple salsa on top of my tacos.
I think it's great to spend time with your coworkers. I work in construction.
I have a race coming up. I am always ready to race. I like to go fast. Sometimes I wish I would have gone into engineering as a career so I could work on race cars as well.
I hadn't thought of doing an online course.
dialogue: I have to work this weekend but could come to a race next weekend if there is one.
Oh, That is too bad that you have to work but definitely come next weekend! I am looking forward to introducing you to all of my race buddies.
Oh for sure, I will request off so i can make it. But im sure you will have a great race nether the less. Are you feeling ready for it?
I am always ready! Yes, Please request it off. We can go for tacos afterwards. Are you planning on bringing anyone with you?
That's right your always ready, Thats the spirit. Oh perfect, You know Taco's are my favorite haha. I was possible going to bring my brother if thats cool with you.
Yes, The more the merrier! What is your brother like? Does he like racing and tacos? Nothing else really matters, Haha!

He actually wants to get into racing himself so maybe you can give in so pointers to get him moving in the right direction. And he loves taco's just not as much as me although i feel thats impossible.
I would love to give him some pointers. Has he ever raced before?
He has done a lot of go kart races but never the real thing but he seems to really be invested in getting to that point.
There really is nothing else like the thrill of a race. Does your brother have a spouse or family? That is one thing to consider when entering into such a dangerous sport.
No not right now i think he is more focused on pursing his racing career to see if he can actually become something from it. He just wants to follow his dream.
What does your brother currently do for a living? Is he very familiar with cars and how they run?

persona: I can't cook well so it is hard to eat healthy. I am fat because of travelling and trying local food.
I own a yacht. I travel a lot. I am a sailor.
Last time I ran was 10 years ago when I was 13. I'm a slow runner.
I like to go sailing. I own a boat that is in need of repairs, but I plan to go this weeken.
I want to improve my fitness. I would like to eat healthy. I used to be in good shape before gaining weight.
dialogue: What kind of exercises did you like to do when you were in good shape. Was it mostly running, Or was there something you liked to do that kept you in shape?
Anything that involved cardio really! I couldnt do any of it now to save my life, But one day at a time is how Im taking it. How is training for your marathon going?
It is going well, I am going to easily do the marathon. Maybe not a good time but I will complete it. I thought that sailing was hard work? Does it not keep you fit?
I guess it does but indulging in good food is what keeps from losing any weight. I am finishing up repairs on my boat soon, Would you like to come next week since you never been?
Sure, I have never been sailing before. Maybe I could help you learn to cook some healthy good food?
That would be amazing, I have been trying to cook up something new everyday but have yet to cook something edible. What are your specialties?
I like to make most of my meals around vegetables. You can eat as much as you want but I can make it so you do not feel like you are missing out.
Oh wow, Any favorite vegetable dishes?
Roasted Mediterranean vegetables are the best!
That sounds so yummy! Where did you learn to cook?
My parents were always into sports and healthy. I just picked it up from them really.
Well that is amazing! I think you would be a great asset for when I start a healthier lifestyle!

persona: I like wine and coffee.
I coach little league. I coach kids from 6 to 11.
I drive a mini van.
I go to photography school. I don't think photography and painting are alike.
I have a husband and 5 sons. We take turns watching the kids.
My older sons play baseball. I organize their team practices.
I always carry my camera with me. I enjoy photographing nature.
dialogue: Were you able to go out and photograph this week? I hope your boys are doing well!
I did go out to do some photography, But fell and broke the lens on my camera.
Oh no! I have heard they are expensive. I hope it isn't too much to replace it.
It was my telephoto lens that I just got. It was quite expensive but I had purchased the insurance so should be able to replace it without out of pocket costs.
That must be a relief. I would feel so bad if that happened to me. Can you work with other lenses in the mean time?

I can, But was excited to get some new shots of things that I haven't been able to capture before. There is an eagle nest with eaglets that I am trying to photograph. Can't do it without the lens that I just cracked!
That must be disappointing. Do you develop your own photos as well?
I would love to develop my own photos, But with five kids, I don't have enough rooms in the house for a dark room.
That is true. Do your boys also enjoy photography?
Nah, They enjoy sports and videogames. Shocking right??.
Hahha. Do they play on any organized teams?
Hmmm, That is an interesting question... I organize their team practices, But I can assure you they are not always organized. Sometimes it feels like I am just corralling cats.

persona: My name is Cletus Hucklberry. I work at Burger King. I am 19. I grill in Burger King.
I am drug and booze free.
I play music. I want to be a rock star. I play the electric bag pipes I invented.  I haven't played them in a week because I hurt my lips on them. I'm interested in playing my bagpipes at a cafe.
I like live music. I don't like how live music crowds drink so much beer.
I like Scottish black metal. I play Scottish metal on my bagpipes. I write my own music. I wrote a song called "Shake your Bum Bum".
I still live at home and I'm currently looking for ways to move out. I don't have a new key for my current living situation yet.
I am interested in going to a folk concert with acoustic instruments and a small band.
I like Jim Croce. I am especially fond of their song, "Time in a Bottle".
I love to sing and harmonize with others. I enjoy simple melodies and harmonies.
dialogue: I was able to make a reservation to the cafe two hours ago to see the acoustic guitarist. I was wondering if you wanted to come along, I'm sure you will enjoy the atmosphere of the event, And the food at the cafe is pretty good too.
Oh, That is great! Is it an all-ages event? Only because I am only 19, So I want to make sure I will be allowed in.
Yup! It is at a cafe and not a bar so all ages are welcome I think it would be just up your alley.
Ok, Perfect! What kind of music does this guitarist play?
They are very foksy which is why I thought of you. I've heard them do a cover of our favorite Jim Croce song.
I hope they play it at the cafe! That would be such an experience to hear it together and sing along. I think it would be a very special moment.
Me too! I was wondering have you ever played your bagpipes in front of a crowd?
I haven't played in front of a crowd. It is actually a big dream of mine but I have such bad stage fright and I worry I won't be good enough and that everyone will laugh at me.
Well if you ever want to start with an audience of one I can be your guniea pig.
I appreciate that! How about we get together before we go to see the live show?
Sounds like a plan! I really am interested in what Scottish black metal is.
It's very unique and not everyone's cup of tea if you know what I mean. I don't like to conform to the norm, I like to be different.

persona: I am a guy. I live in India. I'd like to go to and work in America.
I am studying on my own to become a programmer. I am not in school.
I am not married. My mom wants me to get married and stay in India. My mom is afraid of discrimination in America.
I want to work with Apple products to design iPhones and other products. I am looking for work as a freelancer.
I do not like snow.
I swim and hike and go for walks.
I never got into surfing. I used to skateboard when I was younger. I had a skateboarding accident.
I like to swim. I coach swimming. I took my swim students to the beach.
dialogue: I saw an employment ad for Apple while I was surfing the internet. Do you want me to send you the link?
Hey sure. Thanks for your help. Good to hear your interest in music and sports.
How is your swimming class going?
Great! My students were excited about the trip which will be having in a month form now. How is it in Hawaii? Do you like it in Texas or Hawaii?
I like them both. Texas is more practical though. Hawaii is very expensive. But it is beautiful. Where are your students going on a trip to?
Oh good to hear. Will be planning to go to beach a bit far from where we live in India. Where did you learn to. Surf a boogie board?
I learned in hawaii. My babysitter taught me as a child.
Thats interesting .. Do you have kids?
No i dont how about you.
Nope not yet. Can you tell me a bit more about your interest as a data scientist for sports or entertaining company. Looks a bit interesting!

persona: I have a boyfriend. We just rented an apartment and we move in next Tuesday. I live near a lake.
I do photography as a side business. I am good at editing photos.
I teach fourth grade. I teach history.
I speak Spanish, English and French.
I prefer muted tones of red and silver.
I go to concerts.
I like to travel.
dialogue: Have you done some photography editing professionally?
Yes, I do it as a part-time job. It is normally related to events which I get invited to go to.
My band is looking for a photographer for a concert later this month. If you are free we could use a good photographer.
That would be perfect. I do not have any planned for next month so I can fit this in easily. Is there any style you want to pictures to follow?
Just photographs of the show. You can go with any style or theme that you think will look good. We need some pictures of the show to update our website and social media.
Excellent, I think I have an idea that will make your band stand out on social media. How long has your band been together?
About 4 years officially but we are all childhood friends. So we both teach fourth graders. What are the odds!? Do you enjoy teaching?
I love it. It is one of those things I realised I was meant to do the moment I stepped into a class.
I struggle with classroom management at times but i think i will get there eventually.
Just make sure you have a clear plan going into each lesson. This will help you with the overall management of the classroom.
How long have you been teaching.
About 3 years now. How about you?

persona: I love snow. I can roll in snow. I can not go to Disney.
I want to be like Pluto. I do not know how old I am.
I would like Mickey toys. I have a lot of Pluto memorabilia. I would like to declutter, but I can't bring myself to get rid of my Pluto items.
I like all kinds of candy. I don't like chocolate.
I also have too much Mickey Mouse stuff and don't have enough space. I value my Mickey Mouse collectables. I plan on selling the highest valued collectables.
I haven't been to Disney. My parents and friends won't go with me to Disney.
dialogue: I really enjoy my Mickey Mouse hats, What are some of your favorite collectibles?
Oh my gosh I love the hats too! But I really really like the figurines oh oh and I have a snowglobe with mickey in it!
Wow, I will have to look for them when I'm there. What else do you like to collect?
Well I really like Pluto stuff too. Have you ever collected any of those? I have a watch with Pluto in it and his arms move around the clock!
I prefer Goofy to Pluto, Actually. Did you ever see him sing the song about sailing? It's so fast, And I still want to learn the words.
I don't think I have. Man I really want to go to Disney. You are so lucky!
Maybe you can go sometime this summer after all. I'm sure your parents would let you go if you offer to help them with things.
I wish. I tried so hard but they just don't to go. Grownups! What is your favorite thing to do there?
I just like seeing the characters. They are really fun to get pictures with. Did you ever meet any famous characters before? Or people?
No not really. I saw a guy once at the grocery store with my Mom that was on tv in our town. But nothing huge. Did you?
That's really cool. Was he on the news? I saw the guy from Breaking Bad once at a store too. I didn't talk to him though.
No he did a commercial for a store in our town. He wasn't really famous I guess but he owned a chocolate store or something. I hate chocolate!

persona: I live in Ohio. I am a doctor. I was trying to get a job in San Fransisco. My daughter lives there. My daughter is 3 years old. I plan to visit my daughter a lot if I move close to her.

I just got a new job. I am planning to move for my work. I start my new job in two months. I will be moving in 6 weeks to California. I will be renting when I move to California. I would like to live near the water.
I go to the park for interaction. My favorite movie is Friday. My favorite show is the Walking Dead.
I like to paint.
I like to watch YouTube.
dialogue: My girlfriend and I are talking about visiting California this coming summer. We should get together when we visit for dinner!
Sounds great as long as I can bring my daughter! It'll have to be after we get settled.
That sounds terrific. Do you think you will be able to get a place near the water, Or close to Golden Gate Park?

Golden Gate Park will be cheaper, But luckily there's good public transportation in the city, So just about anywhere is a good location. Are you thinking about visiting anywhere else besides San Francisco while you're nearby?
Oh yes, As long as we are there, It would be great to visit Muir Woods and see the redwood trees, And then drive up to the wine country in Napa.

That's a splendid idea. In fact, I'd recommend you stay in Napa rather than the city. It's beautiful up there and accommodations are cheaper. Plus you can taste lots of wine and be close to your lodgings instead of having to hike all the way back downtown!
LOL, Yes, We would certainly need a designated driver after a day visiting wineries. It might be a little difficult for you to bring your daughter though, As she is so young.
A lot of the wineries are outside seating and don't mind kids too much as long as they behave, But yes, I'd prefer to hang out just with the adults if we're doing tastings :).
That's good to know, We can plan something around that. And I'm sure there are many great parks. Do you have any YouTube videos on San Francisco and Napa you can recommend?
Huh, You know? I've never even thought about looking up videos since I kind of know all the famous places and usually just need help finding restaurants. Let me check and I'll send you some links!

Wow, It sounds like you have visited there often already. This will be our first time, So any recommendations will be really helpful. Since you like art, Do you have any museums or art festivals you could recommend we visit?

persona: I am a dog walker. I like dogs.
I have one young child and I am pregnant. I am due in 4 months.
I like to kayak. I have a kayak trip soon. I know how to kayak in rapids. I have a kayak.
dialogue: I found a kayak for a cheaper price that I am going to purchase. I don't need to borrow yours anymore.
That's awesome. Where did you find the kayak?
I found it in the Facebook Marketplace. There are a lot of interesting things there.
Interesting! I will have to check on there. I have a lot of baby things to buy soon.
There might be some there! Babies are so exciting. Do you have everything planned yet?

Not quite, But it's not my first go round, So hopefully it will be easier this time. I'm not looking forward to giving up the rapids, That's for sure! Have you got any professional advice for people who need to give up something they love for a while?
My best advice would be to find something else that really interests you and try to put more focus into that. It's easier to give something up, If you have something else to replace it.

That's a good idea. After the baby is born, I'll be super busy, Of course, But the last few months of the pregnancy are sure to be a little boring. Maybe I'll subscribe to every streaming service there is so I'll never run out of shows!
Haha There you go! Disney+, Hbo, And Netflix are my favorites at the moment. Do you subscribe to any right now?
Just Netflix, But I heard good things about Peacock. Oh, And I got Apple TV free with my new phone, And I want to watch that show Ted Lasso. Have you seen it?
I have Apple TV with my phone, Too. I don't use it often, Though. I have not seen that show yet! I haven't had a lot of time for tv lately.
A lot of work on your plate? Hope that means you've been getting lots of new clients!

persona: I play video games. I play Fall Out. I am thin and blonde.
I love music.
I wear my favorite band t-shirts for inspiration when baking. I have a great PB cookie recipe.
I'm in Jersey. I am running a marathon next week. My favorite band is Fall Out Boy.
I have at least one pet.
I played the recorder in school. I like baking and running.
I have a birthday coming up.
I love black forest cake with carrot and chocolate icing.
dialogue: How soon is your birthday so I can make your cake?
Very soon actually. It is in July. Such a good month to have it because it NEVER rains on my birthday. What type of cake are you thinking?
I like white or chocolate. How about you just surprise me.
I love a standard sponge cake. But one of my most favourite parts of the cake is the thick icing - akin of that on a kids birthday cake. It just reminds me of my childhood and tastes amazing.
My favorite is chocolate icing. I love baking cakes.
Chocolate icing, That is a great shout. Are you any good at decorating cakes?
I actually took a class on cake decorating. I'm pretty good but I am by no means an expert. Are you good at cake decorating?
I am not cook at cake decorating, No. I have never been able to keep my hands still enough, And my artistic skill isn't very good either. But, I would love to learn.
It takes a lot of practice and patience. It took me so many tries before I got the hang of it. I started off decorating cupcakes that way I didn't have all these cakes in my kitchen.
I suppose the more you have to practice, The more you have to eat or atleast distribute. It probably would have a huge impact on your weight, Right?
Yes, It would have. Thankfully I ended up giving them to my local food drive.
That is such a commendable thing to do! Are you involved in any other charity work?

persona: I love music.
I just moved here.
I am interested in nursing. I work at a bar.  I am in school to be a nurse. I pay for school myself.
It's frustrating to not have much free time.
I am shy and am not in any clubs. I want to become a nurse and get out of the bar.
I don't like my bar customers.
dialogue: How much longer until you finish nursing school?
Hopefully just a year more! How long would your master's take?
Probably about two years. That's still something in the future for me. I'm trying to sort out what to do right now. How are you liking school?
I'd like it better if I didn't have to work, Too. Would much rather focus on school. How about you? Will you work while taking classes?
I think that'd be a good idea. Half and half, If I can. I guess it really depends on class schedules and what jobs I can find. Do you have friends to study with?
A lot of people want to study together, But I'm not actually into that. I need to be able to focus if I have any hope of remembering anything! I take it you like studying in groups?
I think it depends on the subject. I think some subjects are easier with a group and some are easier on my own. Do you have time for any other activities besides school and work right now?
You mean like sleeping and eating? Barely. Anything else just feels like more work! I don't even keep house very well right now. Hopefully there will be time to clean after the semester ends.
Aw, Hopefully. That will be a nice break. What do you like to do when you have free time?
Just listen to music and read, Usually. Calm activities away from other people. As you can see I'm not a people person! How about you? What do you like doing?
I love listening to music and reading. I'm trying to learn guitar right now. There are a lot of tutorials on YouTube.
That's cool. What songs are you trying to learn?

persona: I am old and retired. I used to be a fit gym teacher. I walk to stay active.
I love cheeseburgers.
I love war documentaries.
I do not drink wine. I drink beer. I like Lagers.
I live in Denver Colorado and have never been to Detroit.
I like seeing World War 2 documentaries.
I like to go on walks with my wife.
I volunteer at the dog shelter. I am thinking about getting a dog.
dialogue: I was talking with a friend an hour ago, And they told me their Great Dane is very calm and quiet. I think that would be a good dog breed to consider if you plan on getting one. Hopefully the shelter has one that you can adopt.
Those seem like nice dogs, However they are extremely large from what I understand.
They are quite big, But if it behaved well; would it be that big of a problem? What other breeds would you consider adopting? I've noticed that most smaller breeds are more stubborn.

I think it may be a problem because since I have retired, We have downsized into a condo. I don't think that would be fair to a big dog to confine them into a condo. I was looking at one called a Shetland Sheepdog. Do you know anything about that breed?

I don't really know much about Sheepdogs, No. I know they're gorgeous animals, Though. I heard they're easy to train as well, But I have no experience with them. Is that the dog you're looking into getting? No other options?
That dog really appealed to me, But I am open to other options. Do you know of any small breeds that are not stubborn? My wife wants one that with snuggle on her lap.

I think all small dogs tend to be stubborn. I haven't really heard of any that aren't. They tend to be quite yappy and have a bigger attitude than their body. Haha. They all seem to be harder to train. Maybe if it was mixed breed with a less stubborn dog, Then it would be easier? I'm not sure. German Shepherd are pretty well behaved dogs. They're not as big as Great Danes either.
I absolutely love German Shepherds but my wife already said no to that. I think we will have a hard time compromising on this one. Maybe we should just get a cat instead haha... Kidding!

I don't have cat and never have. I would definitely probably want to get a cat if anything were to happen to my dog. I heard they're very low maintenance. Might be perfect since you're retired!! Haha.

Ok maybe that is a good point. But I don't know if I can really walk a cat. Part of the reason I wanted to get a dog was so that it would force me to get outside and walk every day. I have a step contest with my local retirees in the condo building.

I think you wouldn't have too terrible of a time walking a cat if you get it while it's younger. Just do it everyday and often and it should get used to the harness or collar you use. It'll be harder if they're older I assume.
Yes, I don't really see people walking cats in my neighborhood. I feel like my fellow veterans would laugh and make fun of me.

persona: I am a student. I am 12 years old. I hate school, especially gym. I have anxiety.
I have long red hair and blue eyes. I cry a lot at school because the boys make fun of me.
I have gym class next period. We are playing dodgeball.
I am thinking of getting a new dog. My parents will let me get a new dog. I'm not sure whether to get a puppy or adopt from a shelter.
I feel guilty for not helping all of the dogs at the shelter.
dialogue: Have you looked at the websites of any shelters near you to see what dogs they have in at the moment?
My mum keeps telling me about about a shelter close, But most of them are grown up and I want to get a puppy.
Grown-up dogs can be easier to handle, Though. Puppies like to chew on everything, And older ones are often more calm. Maybe consider it? They need homes too!
Yes, I know they do. But, I think getting a puppy to begin with would be a good start and then when I am more confident, I can rescue them from shelters.
Perhaps. Do you have much space to keep a large dog?
We have a really big garden. Also, I would be more than happy for it to stay in my room, Not sure how much my mum would be happy with that though.
That's a good point. Sometimes they could bring fleas into the house, Or even ticks! It's good if the dog can have its own bed at least.
Really? Are the transferable to humans? I would be scared if I got them.
Well, Fleas can bite you but I don't think they stay on you.Ticks are a bigger problem because they can carry Lyme disease. I have a friend who got that and she said it's pretty serious!
Oooo that sounds serious. I am sure if I was to get a dog from the rescue center, They would have made sure that they don't have fleas or ticks, Right?

Oh definitely! But you have to protect them with special collars or some drops you put on their skin. Usually you have to use the drops once a month. I'm sure the shelter even sells the drops, But you could get them at any pet store. And don't forget to buy a good leash!
I have seen videos of people being pulled over by their dogs when they have them on leashes and the dogs want to run. I am scared that will happen to me and I will get hurt!

persona: I love horses. I own a german shepherd named Barnaby.
I do not like scorpions.
I work for the US postal service.
My favorite color is grey.
I like to paint in my spare time. I paint weekly as requested by clients.
I haven't ridden a horse in the last few months.

I like inspiring youth through painting. I find clients mostly through word of mouth and via online advertising. I like painting with oils.  I do all sized paintings. I like to experiment with painting.
dialogue: If you have the interest, I would love to commission a painting of my dear Sirius.
I would definitely be interested in that! Does your dog sit still well?
He can sit still... On a good day. Can you work from a photograph?
I can. Both animals and children can be tough to get to sit still. Haha.
Sirius has a mind of his own and can get a little unruly at times. But I think I can get him to pose briefly for a portrait. What size would be best for you?
It doesn't matter to me. It depends on how much you want to pay. Haha On my end, Size doesn't make a big difference. I can make from tiny wallet-sized to large wall-sized.

I'm talking about the photo. How about an 81/2 x 11, Letter-sized, Landscape? I think it will give you sufficient detail to do the painting. As for the painting itself, I'd like something I can hang on my den wall, Say poster-sized...
Okay. That will do. After you give me the photo, It will probably take me around a month to finish the painting. Is there a particular date you need it by?
No, Please take your time. Sirius doesn't care about time all that much, And I have my other work to do. I'll get the photo to you this Friday after work if that's OK.
Haha I'm glad you have a patient dog. Okay, That sounds fine! I will get everything set up and go through my supplies.
I know it's probably hard to anticipate cost at this point, But can you give me a ballpark figure?
Hmm. It'll depend on how detailed and the colors I'll need, Etc., But I'll say $150-200.

persona: I graduated with a doctorate degree. I work in a hospital. I work in paediatrics. My phd was in medicine.
I haven't traveled far from home.
I like to go to the park, and go to my daughter's piano concerts. My daughter in on vacation in TX.
I will put in time for vacation to go to Europe. My daughter wants to travel overseas and perform. I have never had paella before. I would also like to go to Florence and Barcelona.
I exercise.
dialogue: I've found a really cute hotel in Florence we can stay in when we go there, It looks so typically Italian!
Fantastic! Do they include breakfast? I'm dreaming of Italian coffee and some pastries right now.
Yes, They do! I can't wait to try all the Italian food and explore their museums! Is your daughter excited?
Absolutely. There are some cool art museums she wants to see. How about you? What kind of museums are your must-sees?
We must visit the popular Uffizi Gallery and Leonardo da Vinci museums!! I love renaissance art and I can't wait to show her all the different aspects of art.

Wow, You've really done your homework! I heard there's a medical museum there, Which I find so interesting, But I don't think it's in Florence. Do you like that kind of stuff? I'm really into old medical instruments and the history of medicine!
We should definitely check it out! That sounds interesting and it would be great to explore different cities in Italy while we're there.
Hey, Since you know about candy, Is there any famous Italian candy we should try? Or is that just in Switzerland?
We'll have to look at their candy shops too! I wonder how different they are compared to our candy shops. Do you have any in mind?
I guess not exactly, But I'm curious if they have coffee candy or something like that. Maybe we can ask some locals for advice. Or the hotel!
Haha do you know Italian? I studied it a bit but I wouldn't say I'm fluent!
Same as you, I think. I used some apps to study, But I don't think they really helped a lot. Besides, I'd be too shy to talk to people. I'll leave that to you!

persona: I love photography. I love to take close-up pictures of my food. I know a lot about cameras.
I like kids.
I use Instagram and other social media. I enjoy your Instagram posts.
I am scared of walking in the woods alone. I think the woods on the Southside are scary.
dialogue: How long have you been into photography? What do you use for a camera?
I have a Canon DSLR I've used for over five years, But you know what they say, The best camera is the one they have with you! So I use my phone a lot more lately.
Phones nowadays have such good cameras and they are very portable and easy. But, No doubt a Canon DSLR is much better when you know how to use it!

That's true about bigger cameras -- it takes a lot of practice to get the right exposure and focus. A phone usually does all that for you! But it seems like you're a natural photographer based on your shots. You have the most important thing, Which is a good eye for framing!
They are super expensive too. But then, I guess phones are expensive too. Thank you, I am such a harsh critic of myself because I always want to get the perfect shot.

It's a good thing phones can do so many things besides being cameras, Although I have to admit I like upgrading my phones mostly for the latest camera technology. It's an indulgence to replace a phone so often, But it's amazing how much better they get each year.

I sometimes think that companies purposely don't upgrade their phones as much as they know how to in order to facilitate bringing out a new phone. And, That consumerism is, In a sense, Stopping technological advancements because companies are trying their hardest to maximise products and monetise technological advancements.

Well said! I do feel pretty consumerist when I want the latest phone, Although I treat it as my only major point of greed. I rarely replace other things I own. In fact the shirt I'm wearing is one I've had since high school!
Everyone has their indulgences, I believe they are big parts of our personalities. Does the shirt have any sentimental meaning to you, Or is it just one that has maintained quality for years?

A little of both, Actually. It's a Smashing Pumpkins shirt, But it has also lasted a long time. They just don't seem to make clothes to last anymore. They fall apart so quickly now, Unless you buy really expensive stuff.

Again, I think it is part of the business model. They make products to have a certain lifespan and therefore they need replacing, Whereas years ago they were much more bothered about their reputation - companies, That is.
Totally. And fast fashion has just encouraged us to change styles constantly to keep up with the trends. I'm glad I'm not so young anymore, So I don't have to try so hard!

persona: I don't like hummus. I'm currently incarcerated. I am scheduled to be released from Juvenile detention center in a month. I am looking forward to sleeping in my own bed. It is my own fault for being here.
I like swimming.
I've never been out of the state or the country. I'm looking forward to good food. I like all meat pizza with extra pepperoni.
I have never been impressed with Aldi.
dialogue: So what are your plans once you are released from juvenile detention?
I am hoping to be able to travel and find somewhere to build a new life with opportunities where my past can be forgotten. Any suggestions?
Have you finished high school yet? GED?
I have finished high school and I actually have really good grades. I just got involved with the wrong group of people and ended up doing something silly. My best subject is Maths.
Then you need to go on to university! You can probably get a work-study stipend. Stem is a great field to work in right now.

Hopefully they take my background into account when considering giving me an offer, And not just my silly mistakes. I really do want to go to university. I just worry that I will be judged because of what I have done in the past.

I don't think you even need to mention it. In Germany, Juvenile records are protected and confidential. I think it's the same here. I believe university administrators are mostly concerned about academic achievement. If you have any legal problems as an adult, The adult authorities will deal with it.

Oh okay, That is reassuring, Thank you! My academic records are pretty flawless because I love learning. I am definitely going to apply to university. Maybe I should use my time left in this detention to sort out my application, Could I email you if I have any problems?
Absolutely! I'm not a rich person, But If I can help in any other way--time and energy--please let me know.
Yes, That's what I meant. Just the know-how and some questions about what they might be looking for me to include in my personal statement etc. Did you go to university?
Yes I did. Heidelberg, For medicine. I'm attached to a hospital in San Francisco as a neurologist.
That is such a commendable job. I hope to be able to have a positive impact on the world at some point with my work. Do you enjoy being a neurologist?

persona: I am a doctor. I work at a center. I am looking for a new place to work.
My favorite movie is Friday.
I live in Nebraska with my daughter. I live near a park.
I have a 10 year old daughter. I am in the process of changing my daughters school and my job.
My daughter likes the park. I like my child. I only want to have one more child.
dialogue: I just asked and was told I will be here for one more year. What do you think the first thing I do when I leave this detention center should be?
I would go and see your mum and thank her for visiting you. Then go and have the best meal of your life.
You're so right. If I had money I'd take Mom out to dinner but that'll be hard. Guess it will have to wait till I can earn some money.
That is fine, You can make it a goal to keep you track and something to aim for.
Yeah. I wish I could make some money on a computer or something. Like fill out surveys and stuff. I can type fast, I think.
It might help to get you started but I am not sure if it will give you a long term income. You could always try some free online courses to gain some skills?
Yeah, But I don't know if anyone will hire me for a normal job. I've heard it's real hard especially if you don't have work experience. Do you ever work with people that were in detention before?

We all make mistakes at point in our lives. Many people are willing to allow others have a chance to improve if you just have a go. Maybe try some volunteer work while you are doing some online work? This way you can demonstrate that are suitable for normal work.
Yeah maybe. I could work with kids and help them not make the mistakes I made, You know?
That would be a great idea. Not only will it help you but think about all the other kids you might help avoid detention.
For real. It is so horrible here. I wouldn't wish it on anybody ever.
If you have learnt from your mistake then it is not completely wasted.

persona: I have 6 horses. My horse's name is Buttercup. I ride my horse Buttercup the most. My father and grandfather raised horses.
I live in a small town. I am in high school.
I want to go to law school ever since I was 11. I want to become a lawyer because my father wasn't represented properly during a property dispute.
I want to dye my hair bright pink.
dialogue: Are you thinking about becoming a defense attorney, And if so what kind of cases would you be interested in taking. Would you consider becoming a prosecutor?
I think I'm more interested in corporate/property law as a career overall, But I might work as a prosecutor or public defender for the experience.
That sounds tough. I guess corporate pays a lot more, But it's less interesting. Do you think you'll be able to have pink hair and be a lawyer? Never seen that before!
Heh, The legal world tends to be a bit conservative, So probably not. But while I'm in school, I don't see why I can't.
True! You should definitely go wild while you can. Are there a lot of people at your school with hair like that?
Not many. Blue, But not pink. I'll have to give all of that up once I pass the Bar.
That sounds pretty hard. So much reading involved! But in the end you can be like one of those lawyers on Law & Order!
Hollywood law? Nah! Real law practice isn't as exciting or glamorous. Mainly it's a lot of research, Writing, Reading, And filing documents with the courts.
Ok now it sounds really boring. But at least you'll be able to afford more horses!
Yes indeed! But horses come with their own set of liabilities, You know...

persona: I'm too young to have a job.
I have a heart transplant schedule for next month. I believe I have psychic abilities. I try to stay positive.
I have a facebook account. I like memes.
I am close with my parents.
dialogue: I have managed to lose three pounds on my new diet, It must be working!
That's great! What's your new diet consist of?
Mainly low-carb, But I eat a lot of veggies.
The doctor said I have to eat healthy and lots of veggies too.
Do you have health problems? Can you share them with me?
Yes, My heart is bad and I need someone else's.
Yeah, You mentioned that but didn't give any details. How long has your heart been bad?
I have had heart problems since I was born, So about 15 years ago.
Oh, Then you've had a really hard time of it. I'm so sorry to hear this. But you'll feel so much better once you have a new heart.
Thank you! That is what the doctors say every time. I believe every time I get a new heart I gain a part of whoever the heart belonged to.
Do you feel psychically close to that person? Do you feel that person resides in you somewhat?
Yes, I can feel their presence in the room with me. Sometimes I feel like they can control the physical world and they are the one's moving objects while I watch.

persona: I am afraid of dying alone.
I usually camp out in the woods. One day I hope to go camping on a beach.
I like to go camping with a small group of friends. I hike.
I don't camp on the beaches near me because I fear being harassed by the police. I didn't know a permit was available for beach camping. I last went camping 2 months ago.
I am planning a 2 week backpacking trip through the mountains this summer. I plan to make multiple stops on my next backpacking trip.
I have never been to the grand canyon. I want to go rafting in the grand canyon.
dialogue: Are you pretty good at swimming, We'll have life vests but it helps to be a strong swimmer!
Yeah, I'm a strong swimmer, But I'll be sure to wear a vest too.
Great! Have you done any competitions?
No, Just trained as a lifeguard when I was younger.
Oh fair enough, That sounds like an interesting job. What do you do for work now?
I teach 18th Century English Literature at the University of Chicago.
Wow! How did you get into that?

I've always loved literature. I've been reading voraciously since I was a kid, And I had really terrific mentors in high school. I went to Yale for PhD lit studies. One of the reasons I love the outdoors is it allows me to get away from the city with good books.
I see! It is definitely nice to get away from the city. What are you reading at the moment?
I reading a historical and critical study of Laurence Sterne's Tristram Shandy in preparation for my own book on the subject. Time in nature gives me a chance to think.
Ah, Have you written a book before? I love nature too, It gives such good inspiration.
I've published a couple in my discipline, But nobody reads them except specialists. I'm actually thinking about writing a comprehensive manual to survival in the wilderness.

persona: I work in a shipyard.
I donate money to charity from my salary. I volunteer at a rabbit rescue. We have lots of rabbits to look after and rehome.I do adopt some of the rabbits myself.
I live in an apartment. I would like to get started on container gardening.
I am growing some seedlings on my windowsill. We get lots of birds in our garden. I use bamboo canes and netting to protect my fruit.
dialogue: How many rabbits do you have at home now?
We have about 30 Rabbits now and a few of them are pregnant so we are expecting more pretty soon!
That's so many rabbits! How do you guys have enough to feed them all?
Thankfully, The rabbit rescue has been getting a lot of donations recently meaning that we have a surplus and to stop it going to waste, The volunteers are allowed to take it home with them.
Your apartment must be so big to be able to fit all those rabbits! I have a lot of produce from my gardens I could give you for your rabbits!
The apartment has a shared garden, And the other residents don't mind me having them in the garden, They love them. What type of produce do you have?

I started growing carrots! I also have some crunchy fresh cucumbers if rabbits eat those. I remember bumping into one of the residents the last time I visited! He said something about seeing rabbits in a shipyard container??.

They LOVE carrots and cucumber. I am sure they would be grateful to be given some. So, Thank you! Yeah, One of the residents works with me at the shipyard. And we found some rabbits in one of the containers when we were emptying them. I have no idea how they got there, But given my volunteering, I thought it was quite the coincidence.
I would love to feed them sometime soon! That's interesting haha for a second I thought you might have been breeding and shipping rabbits!!.

Noooo, Not shipping them, Or breeding to be honest. I don't have the space for any more, Even the babies that are due to come. I will need to see if some other people want to keep them. Would you be interested?
I would love to have a rabbit or two to care for! Unfortunately, I will not be able to take care of them for long!

Any relief would be great. It would give me some time to find some permanent homes for them. At the minute, It seems like not many people want rabbits, But I am sure I will be able to find some people to lighten the load for me.

persona: I visited the city.
I am a piano teacher. I play the violin, guitar, drums and piano. Teaching music is my passion.
My father was a professional violin player.
I volunteer at a homeless shelter. I like people who help with the underprivileged.
I think anyone can learn to play the piano.
dialogue: I spoke with my daughter about what you said. She said she'd like to meet you about the piano lessons.
Oh, Perfect. I am free all of next week in the evenings. Is that something that works well for you two?
That would be great! Hopefully we can come by Thursday. Do you offer lessons for both violin and piano at the same time?
I can do, Yes. My father will be around on Thursday too - I am sure he would be more than willing to help with the Violin. He is so passionate about it.
I'm so excited! I'm a big fan of your father's work. How has he been lately?
He has been well. Managed to fall up the stairs the other day and banged his knee, But that doesn't affect his violin playing thankfully. How are your parents?
Oh no, Make sure he's more careful! I haven't talk to my dad since the divorce and cheating, But my mom is doing great now with her new man!

Hopefully he treats her better. She really is a loving person and she deserves it. I try my best to help him, But he refuses to succumb to using an assistance stick. He will just have to at some point.
He seems great too. They both visit and spend time with the kids regularly, Much more than my dad ever did! Parents can be so stubborn sometimes haha.

As they always say to us, "Do as we say, Not as we do". No matter how old I get, He still maintains that mantra. At this point, I am used to it. That is such great news! I am sure that will continue, I am certain of it.
Thank you for your support! Has your father found anyone new? It's been some years, But that's okay if he isn't looking for anyone too.
I think he is so content with himself that he doesn't want to commit to anyone. He sees his friends regularly and I think that is enough for him.

persona: I believe in God.
I watch a lot of TV. I am a fan of the walking dead. I love Zombie and Vampire movies. My favorite vampie movie is Twilight.
I like to go to the gym.
I like working from home.
I live in Fort Myers, Florida.
dialogue: Have you caught up with the Walking Dead yet?
No, I haven't! Have you? I have gotten a little sick of all the zombie content lately. I have been more into romance, Is that weird? Haha!
I can never get sick of zombies. I am actually had an opportunity to be an extra on the last episode of The Walking Dead. I am the short fat bald walker at the end of the episode.
Are you serious?! I will have to watch and look out for you! Did you do this before or after your heart surgery?
Before the surgery. I actually think the excite of being on the set contributed to the heart issues.
Oh, That's not good. How is your health doing now? Do you have to do any particular exercises or eat a certain diet after having surgery?
No special diet, Just need to avoid processed foods. Easier said than done.. I used to be a fast food junkie. Now that I think of it, That probably contributed to the heart issues also!
I hear you on that one. I love my fast food as well. Nothing beats a good juicy cheeseburger and fries... With a milkshake! But you know, Broccoli and grilled chicken can be good too...
Yes, But I miss my Chick fil A spicy breaded chicken sandwich with waffle fries so much. I wish my super power was to be able to eat whatever I wanted without it harming my health.
I agree! I have never tried Chick Fil A... Is that weird? I will have to try it sometime.
Ahhh, Yeah, That is wierd. I actually think I may like the Popeyes fried chicken a little better.
I actually don't like Popeyes all that much. KFC all the way! Nothing beats a bucket of KFC chicken... The skin tastes so good. Yum!

persona: I'm invincible. I believe in God.
I dance. I do not dance for a living.
I am 100 years old. I am strong for my age.
I like the taste of red wine.

I do not like radios. I watch a lot of news. I try to balance my news watching by watching equal time from both sides. I understand media is biased, so I watch various forms. I am outside a lot. I stay on top of the weather.
I also enjoy keeping busy.
dialogue: Just got back from the doctor and he said my foot will be healed soon.
That is great. How long before you can get on your bike again?
Probably 6 weeks or more. I guess it's a sign to slow down, But I just can't wait to get back out there.
At my age I don't believe in slowing down. That is why I still dance everyday.
Well, It's easy not to slow down when you're invincible. Haha. Have you ever injured yourself dancing?
Not recently. I did get dropped once back when swing dancing was in style.
Ah yes, The good ol' days. For music. Not so much for war. We've lived through so much. What's been your favorite era?
I would have to say the 60s. They brought so much change and freedoms.
Ah agreed. They were a pleasant time. Madmen did a good job of bringing them to life again. Have you seen it?
I haven't. I don't pay for cable. So mainly I watch the news all day.
Frugal. I'll bet you've accumulated a lot of wealth over the years! I wish I'd gotten in on a few stocks knowing what I know now.
I have enough to live on but living so long has taken a lot of money that I saved!

persona: I love coffee, it's my passion.
I'm teetotal.
I have a wife and 3 kids.
I own a plumbing business.
I like reading and video games but I spend most of my time with my family. I like reading fiction and biographies the most.
Me and my family went to Disney Land.
I like games. I like old Superman comic books.
I like checkers. I like card games. I want to learn to play chess. I like to play Black Jack 21. I pay a tutor to learn chess.
dialogue: Are you having fun learning to play chess.
Yes, I enjoy it, But I'm not very good at it.
You'll get better with practice, It's a difficult game. I'd like to give it another go at some point.
Have you ever given chess another go? Or are you still too busy these days?
I'm still quite busy at the moment. I've been applying to university and working a lot to try and save some money.
I hope you get into the university of your choice. I've been pretty busy as well, We're shorthanded at the plumbing business. Have you had time for any biking?
Thanks, Me too. Oh no, I hope things get better soon! How come you're shorthanded, Has someone quit? I managed to get out for a few hours last weekend, It was fun.

Jeri left for maternity leave, And the rest of us are struggling to cover her jobs. She'll be back soon. I'm glad you got a bit of fun this past weekend, All I did was read and watch tv, I was so tired.
Maybe you should hire a temporary worker to cover her while she's gone. It might make things easier for the rest of you. Did you read or watch anything interesting?
Mostly read some of my old comics, You know how I am about my comics. You should pick them back up someday.
I do! I'd like to but you know I'm already so busy. With everything else it's hard to fit in time for my family, Let alone comic books!
I know how that is. How's your family doing?

persona: I love dogs, I have two dogs.
I tend to eat when I am bored.
I like summer the most.
I mostly run on a treadmill. I love using the rower machine the most. I'm looking to purchase a rowing machine. I'm a little tight on money currently.
I use a rowing machine. I like to run. I recently bought a rowing machine.
I have a vet I like.
dialogue: My cat that I was worried about because he was ill is getting worse.
I'm so sorry to hear that! Do you know what is wrong with them or do you have to wait until you take your cat to the vet?
I don't know, But she's an older kitty and has some chronic health problems.
Oh, I can relate to that. One of my dogs is older and has diabetes. Do you know when you'll be able to take them in to the vet?

Later today for sure. She went off her food yesterday morning and still isn't eating yet today. She's drinking water, Though, So it might just be something transient. Still, I don't want to chance it.
That's very good that you'll be able to get them in today! I find its best not to wait, Especially when they have chronic issues. Hopefully it's nothing serious!
Hopefully! We'll have to see. My vet's a good guy, Does a complete assessment, So I'll know more later in the day. She's a sweet animal and I'd had to lose her.
That's so great. It's so important to have a caring vet! I'll pray for your cat to get well soon! Why don't you tell me what the Olympics was like. Maybe that will get your mind off your worries.
It was such an exciting time for me, Really gave me an opportunity to excel in my sport. The training over the year before was the most difficult thing I've ever done, But it was worth every second!
How often did you train?

Daily, In the early morning and late afternoon, For two or more hours. Had to follow a strict exercise and dietary regimen in addition to the sprint training. Socializing was rare, Because I was exhausted half the time, And my coach wanted me in bed at a decent hour.
Haha That sounds worse than living with your parents! I guess it really did pay off for you! What kind of exercises helped you with sprinting?

persona: I am still going to school.
I work in a dentist office as a receptionist.
I would love to take one or two bunnies. I don't have a preference between boy and girl rabbits. I get grossed out at the thought of eating rabbits.
I did not really like the quail. I would use a lot of ketchup if I had it again.
I watch videos of pet rabbits on Youtube. I didn't know how to litter box train bunnies.
dialogue: How do you like your new bunnies?

I just got them. They are so cute. I really can't imagine eating them, But I'm the same way about deer. I know lots of people eat deer meat. What made you eat the bunnies? Were they pets or did you have them specifically to eat?
Yes, I had them specifically to eat but now I just have them as pets. Did you name yours?
I haven't named them yet. I want to name them something cute. Any ideas?
Did you get two of them? Hmm.. What color are they? That may help you decide what to name them.
One is white and one is black.....
You could name the white one Snowball or Marshmallow. I will have to think on some more names and let you know what I come up with. Have you figured out how to litter box train them yet?
I've read up on it a little bit, But that's as far as I've gotten. Is it very hard to do?
It's not hard but it does take time and a lot of repetition. There are a lot of great resources out there that will help you with training!
Have you named your bunnies yet?
Yes, I have. Their names are Cinnamon, Cocoa, Oreo, Hopper and Whiskers. It was hard coming up with names for five of them!
Oh, I love those names! So cute. I may have to steal one or two of those names.... Lol. So... Did you like being in the Navy?

persona: I work at a convenience store. I am a store manager and I enjoy it.
I drive a Nissan.
I am a huge fan of Taylor Swift. My favorite album is 1989. I once met Taylor Swift. I like meeting musicians.
I really like NWA.
I own an old Nissan. I need a new car.
dialogue: I am going to get my license!
That is so exciting! Are you going to get a new car as well? And by new car I mean, An old car that you love.
I guess it depends what my parents say. You're so lucky you're a grown up and don't have to ask for like literally everything.
It is not as fun as it seems, The grass is always greener on the other side! Will your parents at least allow you to drive their car?
Oh, Definitely! Have you thought any more about getting a new(er) car? Maybe we can help each other shop!
I would love to, But I don't know if I can afford it right now. You will have to give me a ride in your new car! We can go for drives and blast Taylor Swift.

That makes me feel like I want a convertible, And I've never said that before! Now that I actually have my license, I may be reconsidering the big body style. I'm a little nervous to drive a big car so soon.

You will do great! It takes getting used to but eventually you drive like you have been doing it all your life. Now the question is what song shall we sing at the top of our lungs? My vote is for August.
Maybe we can throw it back a lot and do Our Song. I love to sing it in the car with the windows down!
Who are we kidding, We will sing all the songs! We can also go to a drive through and get some ice cream, Or go to a drive in movie! Or drive to the beach! The possibilities are endless.

That really is an amazing thought! Cars are truly amazing things. Imagine the covered wagon days when it took a week to get absolutely anywhere. Now we can just drive 'til we hit mountains or ocean! Which do you prefer?
I know, Right?! I think I prefer the ocean. Nothing beats the smell of the salt air. Which do you prefer?

persona: I'm Ben. I'm grounded because I didn't pick up my toys.
I enjoy pizza when my mother orders it. I like tomato sauce on pizza.
I have a turtle named Leo that I got from my best friend living across the street.
I like what Barney sings. I like watching videos, including videos of cartoons and Barney.
I listen to my mother sometimes.
Cats are my favorite animal. I am a child. I want a cat, but my dad says no. I had a dog named Rex, but he died last year. Rex was an old dog.
dialogue: My cat has been acting so funny today! Its like she's on a sugar high, But I didn't give her anything out of her ordinary diet.
Maybe someone has been sneaker her candy.
That's a good point and very possible. Have you ever given your turtle sugar?
Yeah, But he doesn't like it. Mom and Dad said I shouldn't have given Rex chocolate. He liked it though.
Oh no, Your dog can get sick if you give it chocolate. My cat likes gummy worms but they are not good for him.
Maybe she'd like real worms!
Maybe so, But I'm not sure. I named Spook after a ghost. Where did you get the name Rex?
He was born before I was. Dad said it was because he looked like a dinosaur.
That much be a strange looking dog. I love dogs. Do you like cats or just dogs and turtles?
I like cats a lot! But I still can't get them to let me have one. They think I'll feed it chocolate.
Sounds like you might need to leave so you can follow your dreams. I bet you would take very good care of a cat!
Yeah, I can run away to grandma's house! I bet she'd let me have a cat! I'm not sure my turtle can walk that far though.

persona: I am new to the United States. I don't know anything about computer programming.

I have an aunt living in America that is also originally from Somalia. I have a sister that still lives in Somalia. I was born in Somalia. I escaped Somalia with my aunt's help because I was forced to marry young to an abusive husband. I was forced to stay at home as a homemaker while in Somalia.
I like swimming.
I go to church.
I do not currently have a degree. I do not have a job that serves others. I am interested in nursing as a career path. Nursing interests me because I want to help others.
I used to take care of children and locals who were hurt while residing in Somalia.
I have recently immigrated to the United States. I enjoy the selection of different foods in the US.
I am not great at cooking but my family cooks traditional recipes.
dialogue: I find it very admirable that you decided to take the leap to come to the US.
Thanks! I am just grateful to get away from my problems in Somalia to be honest. It is great to have the opportunity for a fresh start. What have you been up to this week?
I am studying for my final exams in programming. It is tough since I have still to coach my team and train for a swimming competition. And you, What have you done lately?
Right, I hope they go well for you! I can imagine the struggle! I have been practising my cooking, Getting a bit better at it now...
Start with easy recipes like pancakes and apple crumble. Then, Keep learn recipes it gets easier with time.
Good idea! I love crumbles.
Then, You try recipe with sauces, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, Even ketchup. They are easy but they taste fancy.
Interesting! What is your favourite recipie?
I like Chinese recipes. Twice cooked pork is one of my favorite. It requires to boil the pork before stir-fry it, It has doubanjiang sauce, Which is a spicy flagrant sauce.

persona: I milk cows.
My dad is younger than 100 years old.
I like coloring books.
I like to watch hockey with my dad.
I live on a farm. My dad got me a German sheperd to help on the farm as a birthday present. I'm training my dog. I have cows.
I do some work in the garden. I am growing tomatoes, yellow squash, okra, and bell peppers.
I make fresh salsa and jar it.
dialogue: I found a rescue cat that I adopted.
Aww, That is great that you decided to adopt it. Did you name it yet?
I've named her Fish! I went with my son to go fishing for an hour and we did not find anything. Just as we were heading back, This little cat appeared with a small fish!
What a great story, I am happy you gave Fish a home! Has she been adapting well to being home with you?
She is the cutest little cat ever. She has stayed mostly by my side these past few days and has been a great joy to have around. I hope I live long to care for her.
I hope so too! Have you made any plans to move to France?
I'm not sure I want to anymore. I'm too old to travel and here is where family is and Fish now! Do you plan to stay on a farm forwever?
Yes, I did have dreams of moving when I was younger but as I get older I realized I wanted to be around family and help out on the family farm that I will someday take over when my dad retires.
