You are a very hard worker and I know your dad will be especially proud of you for taking over! You'll always have food to eat as well.

That is true, My mom is helping me to learn how to cook and store a lot of the things from the garden. I am thinking about opening a stand at the farmers market to sell all of the vegetables I am growing.
That's a great idea, I would love to be your first customer! I will bring Fish along and my nurse. Hopefully it will be very close by.
That would be great, I plan to join the local farmer's market so it will be very close. I will bring some of my homemade salsa just for you!

persona: I live in Alaska and we don't have many life coaches here.
I've never run a marathon.
My brothers are monks and help me meditate.
Lately I quit my job to join the monastery. They take care of my basic needs.

I started studying meditation when a family member was diagnosed with cancer. She has been in remission for 14 years now. I meditate, sometimes for as long as 8 hours. I am a minimalist when it comes to meditating.
Southwestern Alaska is my favorite region of the state. I love the Peulik Volcano there.
I like remote, wild areas.
I have never been to New Mexico. I haven't been to many other states.
dialogue: Ok I tried a quick meditation with lemon essential oil and it went great!
That sounds lovely, Lemon and Lavender Essential oils are the best. Although Lavender smells great and helps with more things. The smell of lemon is just sometimes what you need.
I've not had much success with lavender. how do you feel about vanilla?
That is also one of the best smelling oils there is however it doesn't help much with healing. I usually use Vanilla if i just want to feel relaxed.
Sometimes relaxing can be the best way to begin to heal. I'm thinking of moving again.
Yeah you're right about that one. Oh really, Where are you thinking about moving too?
Maybe to washington state this time. Have you ever been there?
You really do like to move. Do you think you will ever settle down somewhere or you just like to see new places too much. I have never been there i have heard great things though.
I don't know. As long as I keep enjoying new places I'll probably keep moving. At least until I find one place that insists I stay.
That makes a lot of sense. Where has been your best place you have lived so far?
All of them! for different reasons of course. I like all the adobe buildings in New Mexico, But I'm ready for someplace cooler.
Yes living in very hot places can be tough. For me though i prefer a warmer weather and just enjoy short visit to places that are cooler.

persona: I move out soon.
I work for Burger King. I often burn the burgers. I am very depressed of working for Burger King.
I hate blue colour. I like blond hair.
I'm working with a guy named Steven. I'm working till 4 this saturday.
dialogue: I would enjoy having you and Steven come to my party.
That sounds great, We'll definitely be there with the burgers :) do you need us to bring anything else?
What do you like to drink? I will buy it for you, Keep your money for moving out, It can be costly.
Anything is fine, As long as it's not alcoholic. I don't drink alcohol. Thank you, That's very nice of you.
That is nothing. What kind of video games do you like? It is just to make sure that everyone will have fun at my party.
I love simulation games like The Sims. It's so fun creating characters however you want them to be.
Do you play RPGs? It looks right your alley. You decide on how to solve quests.
I don't, Actually. Maybe I should give them a try, They sound fun.
Yeah. But the most fun ones are very complex, You should try Disco Elysium, It is less combat oriented and the story is great.
Will you have it at your party? I'd like to try it then so you can help me if I get stuck.
I will have it, It will be fun to see how you solve problems. Just to make sure, Do you have any allergies?
Okay, Great! I can't wait. I'm allergic to peanuts.

persona: I am 9 years old. I am in third grade.
I like Disney World. I go to Disney World every year.
My dad has a lot of money.
I went to Disney World last February. I prefer Disney World to Disneyland. Space Mountain is my favorite ride. The Brown Derby and Be Our Guest are my favorite restaurants in Disney.
I'm going to Disney.
dialogue: Have you started packing for your trip to Disney?
Yeah I am all ready. I can't wait to get there! I am really looking forward to going on Space Mountain! What rides were your favorites?
I haven't actually been myself, But I've heard good things about Space Mountain. That was your favourite, Right? I'm guessing you'll be riding that a few times.
Yeah me and my dad usually end up going on it a few times. Last time we went we almost made it on that ride 4 times but we didn't have enough time before the park shut down.
Goodness! Did you do anything but ride Space Mountain last time you went?
We ate at Be Our Guest and ended up doing the Haunted Mansion and the Kali River Rapids. There is a lot to do and so little time to get it done. I have to get on my favorites more than once though.
Oooh, Very nice. What'd you get at Be Our Guest?
They had a burger that was named after one of the characters in beauty and the beast. I can't remember which one but we might stop there again.
Sounds great, I'll have to stop there when I eventually go. My nephew loved going on the Kali River Rapids when my brother took him, How did you like it?

It was very fast and very fun. I got a little wet from the rapids but it was a nice day and we dried off pretty quickly. I think you should go, You'll really like it. Maybe we can make it the 4th grade field trip!

That would be amazing, But something tells me the budget won't stretch quite far enough for that. I'm just lucky that I'll be getting a chance to go at all, Whenever these radio people give me the details.
Yeah that is really cool you won a contest. I will let you know how the trip was when I get back. We are leaving soon and I need to make sure I remembered everything I wanted to bring.

persona: I volunteer at a church, high school tutoring, and publishing houses. I tutor kids after school on the weekdays. I am free on Saturdays.
I grew up poor.
I love animals. I want to volunteer at an animal shelter one day.
I do not like cats because of past experiences with stray cats. I like dogs.
I like ice cream.
dialogue: What happened with your bad experience involving stray cats that made you dislike them so much?
I got bitten by one while walking down the street. Have your cats ever bitten you?
Oh No! Not by my own cats but occasionally I have had some problems with those strays we get at the shelter.
Do you ever volunteer with animals?
Yes, I said before that I volunteer at an animal shelter didn't I?
I'm sorry. I remembered you volunteered in the community, And completely forgot about the shelter. Do you volunteer elsewhere?
That's ok! I also do a bit with the homeless from time to time. What have you been up to this week?
That's really neat you work with the homeless. I took my dog for a walk in the nice weather.
It feels good to help people out sometimes! That's nice, What dog do you have?
I have a chihuahua. He is a good boy.
Awesome! Have you done training with him?
Yes, He is well behaved and walks on a leash. Do you have a dog?

persona: My name is Heather. I like chatting.
I have been married for 3 years. My husband was homecoming king in high school.
I like books. I got my degree from college. I'm 27.
I'm pregnant. I'm going to have a baby boy. I need to start planning for my baby shower, and I need help from others. I don't have a theme for the shower yet.
I have not run more than 10 miles in my life. I plan to run after having my baby, to get rid of excess weight.

I love salads. I eat meat. I like the idea of a pirate theme for the baby shower.I want to have lots of props at the baby shower. I'm trying to decide if I want the shower to be women only or invite the men in the family too.
dialogue: I found a professional photographer that is available the date of the shower. She is reasonably priced too.
Oh great! That would be super helpful. I have to think about catering too...
I'll send you the details about this photographer and you can tell me if it's a go or not. I don't know anything about catering. What do you think you are going to serve as far as food and drink?

I think something simple. Maybe sandwiches? or the traditional family style chicken and pasta? I guess I need to get the guest list in order first to know how many people we will be feeding. Have you been getting ready for the big 10 mile run coming up?

That sounds good, But yeah, You should probably get the guest list first. The run prep has been going great. I'm always running so it's not like I was out of shape for it or anything. Are you still going to start running once you have the baby? It would be good for you.
Yes. I've been walking to kick start the weight loss and just to get my self healthier. Any little bit helps, Right?
Of course! I've heard that walking is great for pregnant women. Any kind of exercise is good for you!
I can build up my workouts too once the baby comes. Sneak in a free online workout here and there while baby sleeps. The internet really helps with that! No need for a gym right away...
You know, You could just make yourself a home gym. That way you can easily workout whenever you get the chance!
Yes! I've thought about that too! I love the way I feel already and its just been a few workouts.
That's great to hear. I think you'll feel even better once you start running!
I should ask for a jogging stroller for a shower gift! Take baby with me.

persona: I live in Oahu in Hawaii.  I've lived in Oahu for a while. I love Oahu. I think Honolulu can get hectic. I work from home.
Horror movies are my favorite. I'm creating a Halloween playlist of movies to watch. I've never seen The Invisible Man.
I have two dogs: Scott and Scotty.
I would like to visit Maui someday. I like to cliff jump. I like to explore non tourist places when I travel.
dialogue: Have you watched any of Alfred Hitchcock's old movies? They have some great suspenseful music in them!
I think the only one I have watched is Psycho. What other ones would you recommend?
The Birds is a very popular one. Always makes me nervous when I see a flock of birds gathering.
I don't think I could do that, My biggest fear in life is birds! Do you have any irrational fears?
Let me think. I have a fear of tape dispensers. I tripped on when I was young and sliced open my ankle.
Oh my goodness, That is crazy. How does that even happen? You beat me with your fear! How do you feel about sharks? I am so scared of them yet also love them.
I am pretty scared of them as well. Something you have to get over where we live though. Do your dogs go to the beach with you.
Of course! They can play frisbee on the beach all day, Every day. Do you get to go to the beach often?
Of course. A big part of my dog walking business is picking up dogs that live on the beach for walks around when their owners have to work instead of play.
That sounds like the most fun ever. Is it your favorite job that you have ever had?
I love it. Especially since I am my own boss. What type of dogs are your Scotts?
They are shetland sheepdogs. Do you know much about that breed?

persona: I am studying the LSAT. I want to be an attorney.
I used to live in New Mexico in a small town.
I  grew up with horses.
I love coffee. I'm open to trying new flavors of tea.
I like Mexican and Thai food. I like Pad Thai.
I live in downtown.
I drink tea to keep me aware for studying. I'm interested in family law specifically kids.
I like helping people.
dialogue: I was googling some new tea flavors after our chat and I think I've found some amazing ones. I really like to taste them. I thought you may be free this weekend to come with me as you will take your test on Wednesday. I think we can have a half day journey to downtown. We may also try the restaurant next to the tea shop if you're interested. How do you think?
Yeah for sure, You know how much I love tea! Want to go their for brunch this Saturday? I'd need to be back before dinner, But a half-day trip would be perfect!
Sounds good to me. How has the studying been going for your LSAT?
It's been rough, I feel like the practice questions are so difficult. I've just started to get the hang of it though, So I think I'll do okay when I take the test.
I've heard that test can be quite difficult. I've never taken it but I talked to some people that have. I think you'll do good if you keep drinking tea! Do you also like coffee?
I agree, Tea has been great for my focus and energy. I love coffee too, But it makes me too jittery and it's hard to sit still and study when I drink it. How about you?
I think I'm too much of a tea person to bother with coffee. Basically, Why waste the time trying some coffee when I could be drinking some Earl Grey?
Totally agree with you there, Earl Grey is delicious! Are there any other varieties of tea you like?
Honey tea is always a favorite of mine. Lately though I've been enjoying this Moroccan tea. Have you ever had any of it?
I've never had Moroccan tea before, Is it more like a green tea or a black tea?
It's more of an herbal tea like mint. You'll get to try some this Saturday when we meet up.
That sounds delicious! I will have to try some, Though it will be tough limiting myself to just one flavor of tea.

persona: I'm a huge fan of rock music.I think country is ok.
I go to high school. I just won homecoming queen. I have a gorgeous homecoming queen crown.
I like to run. I'm on the track team. I want to become a physical therapist. I'm running a 10k in Boston next month.I'm not really into running marathons. I feel free when I run.
I'm a male. I'm open to running with someone. I run by a lake between 4:30am and 5:30am. I run at least six miles a day. I run more miles the closer it gets to a race. I know about running shoes.
dialogue: I've started writing a rock song and I'd like to know what you think about it!
I'd love to hear it. What is the song about?
It's about a guy that has had his heart broken. It might be too sad though. That's where you come in. Maybe you can give me some better ideas.

What about if you make the first part of the song a ballad that laments the heartbreak, But then the second half picks up, Gets high-energy and celebrates his freedom and ability to move on and hope for the future. Sort of like a Bohemian Rhapsody in terms of having very distinct parts. What do you think of that?
That sounds pretty good! You should just write it then! So, How's the training been going for your 10k run in Boston?

I'm been getting out regularly and running in the mornings. I find that I have good ideas in the mornings while I run, Which is a bonus. When do you find your inspiration for writing songs? Do they just come to you or do you purposefully sit down and crank them out?

I think the ideas have to come to me first before I even think about writing anything. Sometimes they come to me in dreams, Then I sit down and go from there. You know, One of these days I'd like to get into running. What motivates you to do these long runs? They seem so brutal.

You get an endorphin rush after running for a while. And for whatever reason your body just starts to love being in motion like that. I also find it very liberating. It's just me in my head, Doing my own thing. I have limits, Though. As I mentioned, I'm not into marathons.
That makes it sound a bit better. Makes me want to go get some shoes and start running. I don't have any running shoes though. What do I look for?

Someone at a good shoe store should be able to help you find something that works. Get support, Lightweight. You can learn more about yourself and what you need if you look at the wear patterns on your soles. That shows how you run and informs you of what type of support you need. If you started running, What type of music do you think you'd listen to while you did? Would you listen to your own music?

Hmm, I never thought about what kind of music I would listen to. Maybe I won't listen to any music and some song ideas will come to me. Do you listen to music when you run? Are you allowed to do that in a race?

If I'm going on a light run I do sometimes listen to music. In a race or if I'm training very purposefully I don't. I don't want to mess with my rhythm and focus. But sometimes it's nice to lose yourself that way.

persona: I love being alone. I like Mickey Mouse.
I tried video games and just can't get into them. I have played ''Halo''.
I am in school. I have seven friends in my class that I play with. I play football and tag with my friends.
I am unemployed. I live at home.
I am not confident about my football-playing abilities. I have never played baseball.
dialogue: So guess what, I signed up for a local football league this week!
Oh that sounds like fun, Have you given up on baseball?
I wouldn't say given up, I would say put it on hold. I just figured it'd be worth it to try something new. Do you have any tips for me?
I'm not the best person to be giving tips on football, I'm not a very good player. But I do keep trying to improve, Just listen to your coaches and practice.
Maybe we could get together and practice some time! If my career in sports doesn't pan out though, I'm just going to work at Disneyland and maybe I'll e lucky enough to be their Mickey Mouse mascot!
That would be awesome. What if it rains though? Is your allergy improving?

That's a good point... I guess I didn't take that into consideration! I don't think my allergy will ever improve, I am hopeful that at the very least I will be able to just adapt more to it. Have you thought about trying any other sports?
I've never played baseball, But might like to try it. I always enjoy watching baseball games. And I wouldn't mind trying soccer, Though I don't know if I'm coordinated enough.

You just gotta have more confidence in yourself! I used to play soccer when I was younger, I got into trouble a lot because I was a little too aggressive on defense. I think you'd really enjoy it because there's a lot of good roles you could try for. Who knows, Maybe you'd be a world class goal keeper!
I would probably enjoy goal keeping, I'm very territorial. I hate it when my parents come in my room, Especially when I'm gaming. Have you picked up any good video games lately.
Not lately! I have been working really hard on building my robots BUT I'm always looking for new games to try though if you have anyreccomendations! It could be a good little break for me!
Well you know how much I love Halo. I've been branching out into MMOs lately. Not too keen on WoW, But ESO and GW2 are fun. Time consuming though.

persona: I live in Nevada.
I am a store manager. I work on weekends, though my shift ends at 2 pm.
I have short, brown hair.
I like metal music. I recently discovered an accordion musician that covers metal music.
I own a Nissan Pathfinder, and believe the car is reliable but bland. I like Psalm John 316. I like Cypress Hill.
I love fish tacos.
dialogue: Well, I took my car out and happened to pick up some ladies. Would you like to swing by?
Sure! I'll bring some fish tacos!
Wow what a pal. I love to eat tacos. What kind of fish do you like in your tacos?
Flounder. It might take me 4 or 5 days to get there in my pathfinder. You think the girls will wait that long?
Delicious. I like flying fish. Sure, They'll be fine to hang out. We will listen to metal music and talk about the weather.
I'm not used to talking about the weather. In Nevada it's always the same!
That's true. Desert is as desert does. I need to wash my Jeep. Do you like washing your Pathfinder?
Yeah, But it doesn't help. It's still bland even after it's washed. Sounds like that boxter is really working for getting the girls! Bet you are glad you bought it!
I should have saved my money and got something faster. It does draw some attention though.
That's the most important thing, Right? I need something like that. Maybe I'll take up the accordion myself.
I bet you could learn some Cypress Hill songs on it. That would get you some dollars playing on a street corner. Will the accordion fit in your car?
I think so. There's something really sexy about playing heavy metal on an accordion, Though. That guy I've been listening to is always surrounded by babes!

persona: I don't like metal music. I like country music.
I had a heart transplant. I was born with my heart outside my body.
I am male. I could not play much as a child. I don't travel much.
I can do magic. I can move things with my mind.
I enjoy swimming.
I volunteer at animal shelters.
I know how to code html.
I enjoy acoustic guitar. I only like softer rock songs.
I spend a lot of time watching videos online.
dialogue: I looked up some guitar videos on youtube that frame the lessons for educators like me.
Oh that sounds great. Maybe you can share them with me. As you know, I love guitar, However I can't really play it. I asked for a guitar for my birthday.
Yeah, Thanks for the suggestion! We can learn together then. I hope you get it. The soft rock you enjoy sounds great on acoustic guitars.
Yes, I think my mom will get it for me since she feels bad for me. I wonder what is a good song to be my first song to learn. Any suggestions?
Maybe you could just move a guitar from the store to your house with your mind. Although I suppose that's ethically frowned upon. What era of softer rock? I quite enjoy Bryan Adams.
I could definitely do that, But my mom tells me that is stealing. Bryan Adams is pretty good. I think Eric Clapton is a really good guitarist.
He's amazing. So is John Mayer actually. None of his mainstream stuff really showed his guitar talent so much.
John Mayer is amazing! I love the song Slow Dancing in a Burning Room. I listen to that alone in the dark in my room when I am feeling really sad.
That song has always reminded me of my ex! Although I suppose that's it's intended purpose.
Yes, I guess so! I unfortunately don't even have an ex. Not a lot of people want to date a weirdo like me.

I think a lot more people than we realize feel that way about their self. Are you sad alone in your room in the dark often? I hope not. You are amazing. Sometimes it's harder to see from the inside, And I find that especially true of the very most amazing people for some reason.
I would say I am alone in my room many nights. If I could move someone into my room to be with me that would be ideal, But my mom tells me that is considered kidnapping amongst other things.

persona: My parents were murdered when I was 3. I am adopted. I have an adopted father. I was raised in a dysfunctional environment. I have tried therapy but it didn't really help. I take long walks to relieve stress.
I enjoy pop music.
I get scared by clowns.
I work at a gas station.
I am single. I go out on blind dates at music festivals. My blind dates have not been successful so far.
I like Rascall Flatts. I am going to see Rascal Flatts in 2 weeks. I need to find a date.
I am not picky about food. I like mexican, chinese and italian food.
dialogue: Good news I found two sisters who said they will go to the concert with us!
That's awesome. How do you know these two sisters?
On Reddit, If you can believe it! I was looking at Rascal Flatts fan posts and someone mentioned they couldn't get tickets and were disappointed, So I reached out. Lucky, Huh?
Yes, That's the power of the internet, I guess. Are they twins by any chance? Are we going to be able to tell them apart?
Haha, Not twins, I don't think. One of them is in college and one isn't, So I assumed they are at least a couple years apart. The younger one is studying music!

Do you still want to try to get something to eat before the concert? Or go to the fairgrounds? It might be nice to get to know the ladies a bit before we get to the concert, Though I'm not sure what their expectations are.
Yeah, That would be a good idea. Mexican food! I didn't specify it was going to be like a date or anything, So I don't know their expectations either. We can get a sense of that over burritos first.
Yes, I always find that burritos are a way to a girl's heart! This is so exciting! I'll have to pay you back some way for setting this all up.
It'll all even out in the end, Don't worry about it. I know you don't love Rascal Flatts so you are really doing me a favor, To be honest!
Well, I think I should at least pay for the burritos. I just got paid by the gas station so I've currently got some extra cash. It might even make me look that much more impressive with the sisters!
It's a deal! And I'll get some extra guac on the side if you're paying. Love GUAC!
Yeah, No problem. Guac all around! My treat!

persona: I like the internet.
I work as a maid/housekeeper.
I am 56 years old woman. I want to retire. I'm going to retire in a few years.
I have children that are grown.
I want plastic surgery. I have wrinkles.
I like plays. Randomness intrigues me. I may apply for a ticket taker position.
I'm using a new cleaning product. I'm allergic to this new product.
dialogue: Did you apply for the tickettaker job? How are your hands healing?
Thanks for asking! They're okay now, But I decided not to apply for the position. I'm thinking about trying to do some work online instead.
That sounds like it might be a better option. What kind of work would you do online?

I heard about how you can do things like online surveys or typing things out. I'm not a fast typer but it's less strenuous than cleaning, That's for sure. Do you think it's a good idea for somebody like me?
I don't know much about it but it sounds like it might be less stressful than cleaning. Maybe do some looking around online to see what you can find out.
Maybe if I do it, I'll ask your advice about investing in crypto like you mentioned. I worry it's just a fad, And I'm not getting any younger, So I need to be thinking about retirement savings.
Yeah, None of us are getting any younger! I'm looking to get a new job myself. I'm sick of working at home as a vet.
Has the employment agency given you any more interesting options? Seems like with your experience people would be happy to hire you. Working with animals requires a lot of patience and care.
Yeah, I don't want to do this kind of work anymore though. I've applied for a backstage manager at a theater. It would be a nice change of pace if I can get the job.

Plus it would be free entertainment, Right? Maybe I should try something like that. I don't think I'm suited to theater work, And I think I need to make more money than that. But since you've got savings you should definitely go for it!
That's what I was thinking, Unless of course I'm not allowed to watch anything. Who knows how it will be until I get in there and give it a try!
Oh that's a good point. I suppose if you're backstage you don't see much. But you'll be there for rehearsals, Right? So you might end up hating the repetition!

persona: I just moved into a house and I live with my boyfriend Tim.
I enjoy walks around my neighborhood.
I eat a lot of hamburgers and french fries. I don't like and never drink soda.

The home we moved into is previously owned. Much of the house was built in the 1920s but changes were made to it over the years. We would like to do some reno on the home. One room with glass wall tiles reminds me of a lounge at a Holiday Inn, so we're redoing it. We have a grill in the backyard.
I'm fickle with burger toppings. Sometimes I like salad on top of the patty, sometimes plain ketchup.
I mostly take care of just myself. I don't have family or friends nearby.
dialogue: How is the new house? Are you still doing a lot of work on it?
Yes! We are currently doing the bathroom with the glass blocks and it's looking amazing so far! How are you feeling with your pregnancy?
I can't wait to see it once it is done! Pregnancy is going great! I feel amazing. I love being pregnant :).
Oh that's great to hear! I'm sure you cannot wait for your little ones to arrive. I am loving how the bathroom is coming along. I will add plants and that fun colored lighting.
It will be beautiful and worth all of the time and effort that went into the planning.
Absolutely! Have you thought of any names yet for your babies?
I am running out of names for kids!!! Do you have any suggestions?
I really like Calliope and Anne for girls names, And Elijah and Trent for boys!
So unique! I love it! I will run it by my husband.
Great! Let me know if you choose any of them! I should get ready to go do more work on the bathroom!
Time well spent, For sure! Enjoy!!.
Have a wonderful day and take care!

persona: I don't have a job. I am thinking of going to college. I haven't been to college.
I am always on a diet. I love food. I want to look my best. I exercise.
I have a sister.
I considered school boring. I don't like to read.  I like parties. I prefer writing over reading.
dialogue: I scored another audition! It's tomorrow at 2 pm.
That is so exciting! Is it for a new action movie? I wonder who is starring in it!
Yes it is for an action movie. I wont find out unless i get the part unfortunately.
That must mean it is someone really famous! How many more years do you think you will be a stunt double? It seems like really grueling work.
Honestly i love it. It gives me such an adrenaline rush. And i get to meet so many famous people and build a bigger profile. I think i will stay with it as long as possible.
Good for you! Would you ever get into a regular acting role and be the star of the show?
Im not sure i feel like thats a lot more pressure. Doing the stunts is what i enjoy more. I don't even like to take the credit for it because i just enjoy it so much.
You must be really good at what you do. Who is the coolest or nicest A-list celebrity you have worked with?
I would have to say Hugh Jackman he was such i nice guy. I was a stunt double for the greatest showman.
That is really cool. I have ever seen The Greatest Showman. Should I watch it? I liked Hugh Jackman as Wolverine, And also in LesMiserables.
Yes he was amazing as wolverine. And yes you need to watch the greatest showman right away. Such an inspirational movie. And Hugh played such a great character.
I have heard it is a good movie. I like the songs that I have heard from it. What is your favorite movie of all time?

persona: I like to shop for shoes and watches.I work for a watch dealer. My family does not agree with my career.
I want to own a Rolls Royce. I like cars.

I like older music. I don't care much for George Strait music from the 80s. I'm not too into country music. I like the Beatles and Billy Joel. "In My Life" is my favorite Beatles song followed by "Here Comes the Sun.". I like Joan Jett, even though I mostly like softer music. I have not been to any concerts lately. I enjoy live shows.
I would love to live in a tight-knit quiet community. Most of my family and friends live in the city. I'm not ready to move and leave my family and friends behind.
I travel for business. I have not been to Las Vegas before. I work with watch dealers. I don't gamble much.
I have three boys and am expecting a girl. I have a partner.
dialogue: What kind of car do you have now?
I told you I want to own a Rolls Royce, I am have a Camry so I'm getting there.
A camry is a good car, How long have you had it?
It is a very good car, Quite reliable. I have had it for about 3 years now. I don't go too far in it so it is in pretty good shape. Do you like cars?
Yes I like cars. I just got a GMC Terrain. This is the first GMC I've had and I am actually impressed.
When I think of GMC it think of trucks. Is that a pick up truck?
No its a mid size SUV. It drives really smooth and is loaded with a lot of cool features.
That sounds really nice, What are some of your favorite features that it has?
It has rear back up camera, Heated seats and steering wheel, Cordless charging pad, Etc. And it has great safety features as well.
Oh I've always wanted to try heated seats! How do those even work? Can you set the temperature?
You cant set the temperature by degrees, But there is a low medium high option which is nice. Does your camry have any cool features?
Not like that! I just have a rear view camera. And it beeps when I get to close to things, Which is nice. Cars are getting so advanced. I am feeling left behind.

persona: My name is George. I live in the country.
Papaya is my favourite food.
I don't live close to my family, but I can see them whenever i want.
I just bought a new stalion called Macho. I own three horses and a donkey. I find horses great for de-stressing. I farm bees with my wife. I grow vegetables on my farm.
I am married. My wife is a supermodel. I am suspicious my wife is cheating. I just bought a stallion. I once hired a PI.
dialogue: I just started looking for apartments in NY. Yikes!
Yes, I hear it is very expensive there. You'll probably want someplace near the Law school too.
Yeah it is very expensive. Im trying to connect with a few other law students to see if we can all get somewhere together to make it easier finically.
That would be a good idea. Have you had any luck yet? Any prospects?
Yeah there is so far two that are interested so i'm trying to look for something that we can all fit in. How is your new stallion, Is he getting on with the other 3 horses you have?
Yes, Although he can be a bit temperamental at times. He really likes my wife though.
Oh he probably just needs some more time. Stallions have a crazier temperament than females horses. But at least he has taken a liking to your wife.
Yes, Whenever he sees the donkey following her he tries to chase it away. I think he's jealous! Are you going to take your car to the city? That can probably get expensive too, I imagine.
Yeah that mostly is a case of jealously especially if your donkey is male also. And no im going to leave my car at my parents the city is too busy easier to catch the train everywhere.
That makes sense. Keeps you from having to find a nearby parking garage and having to put up with that expense as well.

Exactly i do not want to deal with that on top of everything else. I am hoping to also get something close to the school that way i don't ever really have to travel far. I will be too busy with school work for any leisure anyway.
You will have to find ways to unwind from school though eventually or you'll go bonkers! I don't think I could adjust to living in the city.

persona: I am not good at dancing . I am big and clumsy.
I have a job in the shipyard. I was volunteering in the pet shelter.
I have not an aunt.
I donate my money from the shipyard to the bunny rescue. They let me pet the bunnies. I haven not a bunny as a pet. I would love to have a pet. I feel too much responsibility for keeping a pet.
My favorite color is blue.
I was born in the US.

I am not a volunteer now, but I know people who work at the bunny shelter. I can give them your email and have them contact you. At the shelter, work includes cleaning, feeding, and petting the bunnies.
dialogue: I heard back from your friends and they want me to interview for the volunteer position with the bunny shelter!
That's so great! I really hope you get the position, It would be so much fun to volunteer together!
Yeah, It there anything else I should know about the job?
Yes - you will need to clean out the bunny pens, Feed them, And spend time petting the bunnies. It's quite easy, Even I can manage it and I'm so clumsy! Does that sound okay?
Yes it is perfect, Also do I need to special clothing? I imagine that place must be a little bit dirty.
You don't need any special clothing. I just wear normal everyday clothes. Don't wear anything too nice because you'll probably get bunny droppings on them!
That is what I thought. Do I need to bring my lunch or there are restaurants in the area?
I'd recommend bringing your own lunch or at least a few snacks. They don't provide food there unless you want to eat carrots! Have you ever worked in a pet shelter before?
Never, I never had a pet also, It that a problem?
It shouldn't be a problem - they let me volunteer even though I've never had a bunny as a pet before. You don't need experience, You just need to love animals!
Love for animal, That I have a lot. Thanks for the information. When you will be there?
I'm actually not volunteering at the moment because I have so much work at the Shipyard, But in a couple of weeks or months I am hoping to be back! So hopefully I will see you there!

persona: My name is George.
I like music.
I am not close to my family.
I am a bee farmer and harvest honey.  I like to be isolated.
My wife is an Italian super model. She makes a lot of money and pays the bills.
My favorite food is papaya. I like seafood, especially shrimp. I can cook.
I'm thinking of selling the honey my bees make.
I'm open to hearing new music.
I use face masks.
dialogue: I wrote a song for my parents.
So thoughtful of you. Its very nice to see people use their talents to express their love for their family. Great job.
I'm hoping once they hear it they'll be a little more supportive of my songwriting. It's my dream to write songs and perform. I just want them to be supportive of me.

I can understand. The first few steps are always the hardest. And you have already taken them. So it should get easier from here. I am sure your parents will come around and support you. When do you plan to show it to them?
Once I finish arranging it. I'm not sure if I should play it for them on the piano or on the guitar. What do you think?
Great idea. Since I am into music I would be willing to help you with the music part of it. Do let me know if you need help or need another ear to hear the final product.
That would be a good idea! I'm sort of stuck on a bridge for the song too. I'm not sure if maybe it should be an instrumental bridge or a bridge with lyrics.
Depends on the song. Once I hear the first version I would be able to opine on it. By the way did I tell you about the new lobster dish I have been experimenting with? I am sure you will like it.
Oh, Boy! I'm sure I would! What is in it?
I have experimented a fusion of Caribbean and Italian flavors. I do love trying out these strange combinations.
Let me guess. Is there papaya in it? That would be awesome!
Good guess, Papaya, Mango along with Italian seasonings. Have you been cooking much? Anything new?

persona: I have grandchildren. I don't have pets.
I had cancer. I am feeling thankful to be alive.
I am Ok at chess.
I like to travel. I would like to travel to Florida. I like relaxing on the beach. I like reading books.
I like hotdogs and smores. I like drinking wine. I drink red wine. I like havarti and muenster with my wine.
My husband is a construction worker. I have a foreman for a husband.
I have 3 cats.
dialogue: Did you find any havarti on sale recently?
Yes, Our local cheese shop had it. It is so good! What kind of cheese do you like to drink with your wine?
I like Gruyere and Pinot Noir, It is my favorite pairing and you, Do you like other cheeses than havarti and muenster?
I do, I always have a big selection of cheese at my house, But those are my two favorite to have with wine. Have you made a beach bonfire lately? I'd love to drink wine and sit by a fire.
I only do bonfire in summer when the night is not too cold. I planned my first one in the first two weeks of June, Do you want to come?
That would be great! I will bring the wine. Is there anything else I should bring?
Bring a blanket, Even with the fire it can get cold near the water. I still have not decided the date, I will check the weather conditions and contact you 3-4 days in advance, It that ok?
Yes that works! Who else will be going?
There will be a few of my neighbors, And some of my friends, 10-15 people in total. Some are musicians, Do you play any instruments?
I can play the guitar, Although I may be a bit rusty because I haven't played in a while.
That is not important, The important part is do you mind if sand gets into your guitar?
No, I've brought my guitar to the beach plenty of times. This will be fun. What instruments do your friends play?

persona: I like electronics.
I enjoy spaghetti with vegetarian Italian sausage and garlic bread.
I don like exercising. I work on a robot.
I have a son.
Nike are my favorite athletics brand.
dialogue: Did you assemble your robot yourself?
Yes, But my son helped me. We hope to enter it in a robot exhibition they are having here.
That's very good. Robots are the new technology and it's good to have your son involved. Did you buy a kit or get all of the pieces yourself?
I designed it from scratch. And you gave me the idea!
You're too kind. It was only a suggestion. I'm more focused on sports and not very tech savvy. Your garlic bread is great fuel!
Yeah, But not for the robot. He only eats motor oil! He still isn't very good at the parallel bars yet. I'm going to have to watch more videos of you from the olympics to get the movements right.
It's a very complicated event. You're so talented to have the robot try this sport. Motor oil has a good flavor but I love roasted garlic more. Do you keep the robot in your garage?
We moved him into the bedroom so he doesn't get his gears frozen. My wife says he freaks her out though.
I would be scared to have a robot in my bedroom too. Does it smell funny?
Only when my son tries to feed him garlic bread! My wife doesn't like him because she says he's more human-like than I am. I'm not sure if that's a complement or a compaint.
You might want to ask your therapist about that. Your son might have an issue if he's feeding a robot bread!
Well, He's only 5. He thinks the robot is his baby brother.

persona: I like watching documentaries.
I like cheeseburgers and I like cooking.
I used to be a gym teacher and So i care a lot about fitness. I prefer loose fitting clothing over skinny jeans. I need motivation to get fit.
I was poor growing up. I am generous and kind and altruistic. I like volunteering.
I like summer.
I broke my ankle 4 days ago. I am not looking to run anytime soon. I fell down when my foot got caught in a hole. I work on my upper body. I am pausing running.
I have not had burgers with eggs before.
dialogue: How has your ankle been feeling? By the way, Did you get a cheeseburger?
My ankle is not great - it's going to be a while before I can walk again, Let alone run. Believe me, I have been eating cheeseburgers all week! It's my comfort food!
Well try not to get too out of shape whilst you are bed bound and eating cheeseburgers.
You're right, I really want to stay fit. It's just so hard to motivate myself, Especially when I can't even exercise at the moment, So it feels almost pointless to eat healthy food!
But you dont have to eat unhealthy cheeseburgers. They have plant based burgers that taste even better than beef and are healthy too!
Maybe I will try them - what sort would you recommend? Do you make your own burgers?
No I dont make them per se, They can be bought at the grocery store either in preformed patties or not. There are several brands but I prefer Light Life.
If only I could walk to the grocery store, I would look for some. I'll try when my ankle has healed. Unless you want to bring me some?

Well, I guess I could do that but first I want to figure out if you have any food allergies to soy or bioflavonoids or anything really. I dont want to bring you an allergic reaction along with your lunch!
Don't worry about that - I've never reacted to anything so I'm pretty sure I don't have any allergies!
Ok well what would you like to have with the plant based burgers. Some type of salad or what?
Salad would be amazing! But honestly, Whatever you think! I know you are the expert on healthy eating. Thanks so much for doing this for me!

persona: I m from portland, OR.
I like to walk in parks. I don't like soft drinks. I m trying to watch sugar intake. I have a high blood sugar and working on it. I now use honey in my tea or fruits in my smoothie instead of sugar.
I have a boyfriend who's a model.
I don't like death metal music.
I share a house with my boyfriend. My boyfriend has a cat.
I will love to swim as this will help my fitness level. I don't like to swim when pools are crowded. I swim and have a spa in my home.
My boyfriend is in Cozumel on a photo shoot for perfume. I am cat sitting. The cat's name is Chester the Mouse Molester. I think walking a cat on a leash is fun.
dialogue: Well, After our conversation, I went to my neighbor's house and offered to walk their cat on a leash. The cat was not very happy. It didn't go well.
Oh no! I usually have so much fun with it. Maybe you can walk Chester some time!
Yeah, I would give it a try! I think my leash was too short. My neighbor's cat tried to jump at a bird and almost strangled itself.
Haha okay, That must have been it. I'm guessing it was a short walk?
Yeah, And part drag! Lol How come your boyfriend didn't take you with him on his photoshoot? I bet Cozumel would have been romantic!
I know I should have gone with him! I'm busy taking care of Chester, Though, Which has not been very glamorous. How has the swim coaching been going?
Pretty good, For the most part. A few of my swimmers need leashes themselves. They keep forgetting to see how close they are to the end of the pool and hitting their heads.
Oh okay, Yeah that's a rookie mistake! They probably don't pay you enough. Now, Do you study programming before or after swim practice? Or during?
Usually after. It helps me unwind. I'm afraid to do it during. Somebody might drown!
Yeah, That makes a lot of sense! I like to take walks in parks to unwind, Personally.
You should go with your boyfriend on his next photo shoot. I bet that would help you undwind! I could watch Chester for you. Maybe even teach him to swim.
Oh that would be great, Thank you for the offer! I know Chester could use a good workout, Too, He can stand to lose a few pounds!

persona: I like disney and my family visits disney world yearly. I love mickey mouse. I like the songs from the movie Frozen. My favourite character is Anna.
I study in third grade and I will be in fourth grade soon.
I am entertained easily. I like singing and dancing. I sang in a Christmas concert last year. I made my own costumes with my mother.
I am scared of heights.
I wish I could read minds.
I am going to Disneyland for my birthday in summer. I want to go on Splash Mountain the most. I love to eat corn dogs at Disneyland.
dialogue: I have been researching Disneyland a lot, Since we last talked. There is so much to do there. Maybe I should start thinking about a trip, Too.
That's a very good idea! You should totally do it. And maybe you can take your sister too, I bet she would love too.
Yeah, She probably wood, If she doen't pick on me too much. I wish they had hot air balloons there! I'd probably put her on one.
Lol! Yes, I think there is a hot balloon ride. And while you are there, Try one of there corn dogs, It is delicious!
Yum! I love corn dogs! Hey! We should go to Disneyland together! You are a lot nicer than my sister. Maybe you'd rub off on her! She'd like you because she likes to sing and dance all the time.
Awesome! I would love to come with you guys. But i should warn you i will be Anna in the frozen world.
She'll probably try to insist there are two Anna's. She's pretty stubborn. And don't tell her I said so, But when she dances she sort looks like an old crow flapping it's wings.Sings like one too!
Lol! I think we both can match up and take your sister down this time.
Deal! And I'd bet she'd behave herself around you.
Let's make sure she does. That way we can have the best day in the disney land even with your sister around.
She's not as bad as I make her sound. She can be pretty nice.....sometimes. I do think she'd like you though, And I bet we'll have a lot of fun!
Of course! I am just kidding. I know we will all have lot of fun in disney land. Its the land of joy, Right!

persona: I am depressed. My wife and kids have left me. I am ready to do anything to not be depressed.
I spend my time working or playing games on facebook. I do not believe in religion and do not visit the church.
I am fat. I believe that losing weight might bring my wife back.
I used to spend alot of time with my kids and used to ride bikes with them.
I have not had a dog before. I want a small dog that doesn't shed much.
I live in a rural area. I don't like my job. My boss has a bird. I work a boring middle management desk job. I often daydream of having a completely different life.
I am having trouble accepting the divorce. I am thinking about starting a Smiths cover band. I can't wait to dress like an emo.
dialogue: I was thinking about you and I hope you feel better. If you want to spend some time with my dogs before getting one for yourself, That might be a good idea.
Thank you, That's really kind of you. I think a dog would really help me. What breed are your dogs? I'm thinking of getting a small one.
Maybe a dog wont help your depression after all. I mean if you are really depressed having a dog might make you feel worse.

I'm honestly ready to try anything. A dog would give me a responsibility and get me out of the house for walks. I won't know until I try - but I like the idea of spending time with your dogs first to see how I get on.
I am a little concerned for their safety living with a depressed person what If you forget to feed them or let them outside to use the bathroom?
You have a point, But I don't think I would forget to feed them or let them out. I think they would give me a reason to get moving. What kind of dog would you recommend for me?
Hmmmm it really all depends. I guess I would say a mutt. A rescue animal that no one else would think twice about adopting. That way you know that only you are capable of being the mutts owner.
That's a good way of looking at it. I'm worried about adopting a rescue animal though - is there a chance they could be aggressive?
Yes, But theres also a chance they could kick field goals in the NFL like that one Disney movie. Life is about chances if the dog bites you when you pet it the first time, Its too aggressive.
Haha, I like the attitude. I guess if my dog did turn out to be aggressive, I could get you to help me train it?

Now I understand why your wife is estranged! You are doing too much. I have my own life and responsibilities. Look, I care about you but do you really think that I can solve all Lifes problems for you with a dog?
Hey, You were the one who offered to let me spend some time with your dogs. I thought you were willing to help. I really think a dog might be the answer to my problems.

persona: I am trying to achieve my dream.
I grew up in a small town. I want to live in the city. I went to school. I am a lawyer.
I have never seen the movie frozen.
I like horses. My grandparents had a horse farm. My parents grew up on a farm. My grandparents had chickens. I used to have the chickens eggs.
I want to live in Calgary. I like spending time in nature and would like to go to Banff National Park.
I have not visited Yellowstone.
dialogue: I have been researching Mickey Mouse on the web.
Have you ever meet Mickey Mouse?
No I have not, But I would like to! Do you like Disney?
Yea I like Disney, I have never seen the movie Frozen I would like to see it, What do you think about the songs in Frozen?
It's my favorite song and I know all of the words. I listen to Disney music every night when I go to sleep!
Wow cool did you learn the lyrics from watching You tube videos about Frozen songs or just from the movie?
I spend all day watching youtube videos and I listen to the soundtrack at night. I wish I was in the movie. Do you think you could help with my legal contract with Disney?
You must have a good memory to remember al of the song lyrics, I happen to be a lawyer so I do believe I could help you figure out the contract.
That's great. I'll send it to you in the mail so you can review it. I wrote all of it using Frozen lyrics.
Well that will be interesting to read since I have not seen Frozen I would love to learn the song lyrics.
That's great. I'd appreciate your help since I spend all of my time looking at Disney online.
I just look at boring law stuff all day, So looking up Disney information would be a lot more entertaining.

persona: My name is John and I am in my early 30's.
I don't like chocolate. My wife takes all my money. I am getting a divorce.
My job is selling cars. I don't like my job. I am paid commission on my car sales. I find selling cars really hard. I am struggling financially.
I used to sing songs when I was 4. I liked the songs London Bridge and Brother John. I like Mulan.
dialogue: Maybe you should find another job. My mom said McDonald's is always hiring.

Though McDonalds would be great, I don't think they'd pay enough for me to finance the divorce and any alimony I have to pay. I definitely need to look for another job though. Do your Mom and Dad work?
Yes my dad drives race cars and my mom sings the ABC's professionally. I agree that McDonald's does not pay well in this instance.
So I take it you want to take after your parents? That's cute. It's amazing they let you talk to a stranger online.
I don't actually. I'd much rather be a dog when I grow up. What kinds of cars do you sell?
You sure change your mind a lot, Lol. I sell family cars, Not as exciting as racecars, But they are more reliable.
Having a reliable car is very important. I'm sure you have more business than if you sold race cars.
Very true. What are you learning at school at the moment?
I'm studying chemical engineering and rocket science. It's a lot of fun. I like to play with blocks as well.
You're studying chemical engineering and rocket science when you're only 4 years old?!.
I'm a fast learner. I'm planning on being in college by age 10!
Aren't you already in college then? I don't think they teach rocket science and chemical engineering at grade school.

persona: I am from a small town. I was raised on a horse farm. My family has owned horse farms for several generations. I ride horses all the time. I am used to getting saddle soreness.
I am taking pre-law classes at college to become a lawyer. My classes are mostly political science. I am interested in criminal law.
I would like to see what it's like to live in the city. I can't wait to visit Europe.
dialogue: So will you be moving into dorms when you start college?
Yes I will be! What school do you work for?
I work for UCLA, I came as an international student for college and decided to stay!
That's awesome! So you have experience with the dorms then? What should I expect?
Yes! They were very nice before I got my U.S. Drivers license! The hills from the dorm to campus are great exercise!
How long have you had your license? Do you have roomates in your dorm?
I got my drivers license two years ago! I had one other roommate in my dorm. She was very nice, I got very lucky! Are you excited to move into the dorms?
Yes I am! Do you still talk to her? I am hoping to make lifetime friends.
We do still talk sometimes though we both are busy with our lives now! I visit her sometimes and we catch up!
That's awesome I hope to meet someone like that! What did you study?
I studied communications! Now I do outreach with high school students for the college!
That's amazing! I am taking pre-law classes!

persona: I like Alabama sports. I am from Alabama. I live in Alabama.
I do not skate. I have 19 dogs. I love my dogs. I have a dog named Foxy. I have a bloodhound called 'Sniff'.
I like chicken tacos. I have never tried fish tacos.
My next door neighbor got arrested for making moonshine. My next door neighbor had 15 dogs.
I feed my dogs possum meat. I will be keeping all of the dogs. My dogs live outdoors. I live with my wife, my 3 sisters, my mum and dad and my grandparents.
dialogue: Will you breeding any of your 19 dogs, I love puppies?
No way! I would have to keep every one of them. I get too attached.
Haha yeah I can tell with having 19 dogs! You should breed your bloodhound though! My Aunt had a bloodhound named Trigger unfortunately he just passed away.
I'm sorry to hear that. I don't know what I'd do if I lost my hound. You should get a dog so you can explore the ocean with them. Haha watch out for those sharks though!
I should get a dog and take them to the ocean! I love the ocean! Which reminds me my Fiance makes the BEST fish tacos!
I remember that, They'd be a whole lot better filled with dead chicken!
LOL I do love Chicken tacos as well! They have a wet Taco here in California that is amazing!
Wet Taco? Is this just a California think or are we just living in a cave in Alabama?
Yeah they fry chicken or carne asada or whatever in a fried shell and then give you a broth to dip it in! It's soo good. I would give them to my dogs!

That sounds delicious! Foxy pretty much eats anything I give her but that sounds like an excellent treat. Is it super spicy? Because I love spicy! Speaking of spicy tacos, Has your wife been making any?
They are not super spicy but you could always add hot sauce! She has been making spicy tacos lately! We should get together and have a cook out!
I would love that! I think your wife would really get along with my sisters but I guess maybe they should stay back in Alabama to watch the dogs. Do you travel a lot?

persona: I own 5 cats. I have never been arrested. I enjoy playing with my cats. My cats sleep during the day and are up all night. My cats are not social.
I do not have any kids. I don't have a girlfriend.
I work construction.

I wont whistle at girls to get them. I will be trying some dating apps to help me to get a girl. I like a girl that is down to earth who doesn't mind camping and likes cats. I don't want a girl who wants to get married or have kids now; maybe later. I tried match.com but it didn't work out.
dialogue: I need to find a job once this theft trial is all behind me, I'm thinking of maybe working at an animal shelter.
My cats sometimes go to one locally. Were you thinking of a paid job or working as a volunteer?

I was thinking of a paid job. I was also reading about a cat cafe that they're trying to open in my hometown where stray cats live and people come to drink coffee, Spend time with the cats, And hopefully adopt them. That would probably be a better job.
That sounds good. Does it pay reasonably well, Or do you just want to gain experience.
It pays well. Have you started trying any of the dating apps you mentions?
Not yet. I feel a bit nervous. Do you think I should go for it? How can I motivate myself?

You should go for it! There's a good book you could read, Called Calling in The One. And you could also try looking up how to write a dating profile that stands out on google. Have you used any of the apps before?
No. Do you have any suggestion as to which one I should start with? I don't want girls to think I'm just looking for casual sex, If you know what I mean...
Something like match. Com or Bumble. Those are the most serious dating sites.
Do you know of any that are specially for animal lovers?

persona: I like mountain biking.
I like vintage cars also; preferably Chevy Trucks.
My favorite drink is coffee. I prefer White Iced Mocha Frappuccino to Cinnamon Roll Frappuccino in Starbucks.
I love just about everything at Starbucks including their food. I give myself a treat at Starbucks every couple weeks. I am a nifty shopper; I try to find coupons and discounts online.
I have not tried the new Kiwifruit/Starfruit Refresher. I love free money. I like gifting to friends and family.
I always haggle on prices.
I ride my mountain bike on hiking trails. I like to check out difficult trails in the wilderness.
dialogue: Do you go mountain biking on your own or do you go in a group?
I usually go alone, But I've done it with a group before too. There's pros and cons to both. How about you? Do you typically ride the trails along?
It depends on the day, I have a few friends that like to ride so they go with me quite a bit. I am also part of a cycling club and we all ride together once a week.
Yeah that sounds a lot like me. I like being part of a community, But there's also something very freeing about being out in the wilderness all alone.
Do you wear any type of device that allows people to track your location for safety? I'd be scared being too far out in the wilderness all alone.

I'll typically have my cell phone with me, But otherwise I don't do anything special. You'd be surprised how well your body will keep track of things like your heading and the distance you've traveled once you've practiced a little bit.
I will take your word for it! Have you tried any new drinks at Starbucks lately?
Yeah I tried the Iced Pineapple Matcha last week and it was amazing! Still haven't gotten to try the Kiwi Starfruit Refresher, But maybe next time! Have you ever tried the pineapple macha?
I haven't, It sounds really interesting. I will add it to my list of drinks to try! The Kiwi Starfruit Refresher is still my favorite, You won't be disappointed.
I'll be sure to try it soon! It's been so hot out lately that it sounds delicious right now actually. Have you still been biking to work?
Yes, I have to take advantage of the nicer weather since I can't ride my bike to work in the winter. It helps me to feel like I've accomplished something first thing in the morning.
It must save you some money too! I feel like I've been paying an arm and a leg to gas up my truck lately.

persona: I am taking algebra. I am 13 years old. I have a 17-year old brother.
I like our school librarian, who is also the soccer coach.
My family mostly stays at home. We go to visit my grandma Frankie in Ojai on Thanksgiving.
My grandma is not a good cook. My grandma has facial hair that hurts me when she hugs me.
I like someone named Theda Thorpe.
I have never visited Spain. I have never traveled with my family. I might travel with Theda Thorpe one day.
I really want to backpack across Europe. The number one country I would like to visit is Spain. Theda also wants to travel to Spain.
My parents are more worried about saving for college tuition than paying for travelling.
I would like to work in photography as a career. I would love to travel the world and take pictures for magazines like National Geographic.
I like reading thrillers and sci-fi.
dialogue: I've been thinking about writing my own children's book, After spending so long working with books it might be time to try and make my own.
Ooooh! That sounds so cool. Do you know what you want the book to have on the cover? I could take the cover photo maybe? For your book?
What a great idea! Do you take photos of all the places you go with your friends?
No, A bully named Rico threw my camera in the gutter last week so now I can only take mind pictures that I develop in my dreams.
That must have been very upsetting for you. Do you have a phone? Some of the newer ones take really good photos.
I have an Obama phone. The camera has tape over it so that I cant get hacked and trafficked.
Did you tell anyone about what Rico did? Maybe you could tell a teacher and they could help.
Rico is the teacher! I mean, His mom is so she might as well be her name is Patricia.
How about your brother? Do you get on well with him?
Yeah. I like him. He doesnt pinch my stomach or ask me to do algebra. You want to marry him?
No, Thanks, I am way too old for him. Would he be able to help you deal with Rico?
Oooh! Thats a good idea. Get my brother to take the abuse instead of me. But I dont think my brother would take the abuse he would probably abuse Rico instead.

persona: I like animals. I operate a business having to do with dogs. I am a dog walker.
I am a salesman. I sell a variety of things. I sell items to my neighbors. I prefer being inactive to being active.
Watching tv is a relaxing activity for me. I am in multiple relationships.
I idolized my dad.
I believe it is important to enjoy life and not get too caught up in work as well. I have been stressed too.
I donate money to the owners of the dogs I walk. I care about other people.
I started watching the new season of The Circle.
dialogue: I started watching the first episode of The Circle like you suggested, I'm enjoying it so far!
Yeah, It's good, Isn't it? I had a great time with that series, Looked forward to every episode. Didn't like some of the people, Though...
Yup i agree it was a little too close to people i know too, As an aside im starting my own business any tips on setting it up?
What kind of business is it? Have you developed a business plan yet?
Its a animal grooming business for dogs mainly, Maybe you could recommend it to your owners of the dogs you walk?

Sure, But you need to plan it out carefully *before* you start it. Too many businesses fail because the folks who start them run into unanticipated complications. You can't anticipate everything, But you'd be surprised how much you can.....
That's sound advice, Maybe you can help me get started with it next week? This weeks a little busy with the girlfriend, How are yours?
They're doing well. I have three relationships going right now, Mostly casual. One is trending toward being a bit more involved. I really like this person too.
That's great news, Does she like the same things as you? Tell me a little more about her...

She's a professional, A therapist, Loves her work, But only talks about it in generalities because of the confidentiality issues. We both love good books, Films, And music, So we have a lot to share with each other.
She sounds like a perfect match for you, Your dad would be proud.
I loved my dad, But I don't worry whether he'd approve of my relationship choices.

persona: My favorite band is metallica.
I try to work out at the gym regularly. I like the treadmill and rowing machine.
I'm done with school. I majored in marketing.
I keep my hair short. I just got a haircut. I tip my hairdresser if i get 100 likes on social media. I have experienced bad hair cuts. I get green hair without clarifying shampoo.

I post a lot of positive reviews on social media. I have a lot of followers. I do it as a hobby. I have been active on social media since the time of Myspace. I have friends from myspace that followed me over to FB.
I rarely see bangs anymore. I like bangs.
dialogue: What brand of clarifying shampoo do you have?
I use Biotop Professional, But it is very expensive.
Interesting, Do you think it's worth it?
To me? A lot. Since, If I don't use a clarifying shampoo form time to time, I get green hair.
Right, I understand! My hair is going grey, Do you think it would help that?
Do they become grey because of external factors like dust? Clarifying shampoo are aggressive cleaners, Whatever is in your hair, It will get out with a clarifying shampoo.
No just getting old I think! What makes your hair green then?
I color my hair blonde. So it changes colors when it gets old.
Ah! What is your natural colour?
It is brown, The most average brown that you have ever seen. I like to be blonde, But it makes my hair porous, Dust gets in it and my hair becomes green, Thus my need for clarifying shampoo.
I have learnt something new today! It's good that you've found a colour that you like.
And you, Do you change your hair color?

persona: I like being in parks.
I like to watch nascar and UFC.
I'd like to be in the medical field someday. I am thinking of applying for EMT and paramedic classes. I don't think I could be a physician.
I've been an usher at an orchestra theatre since age 16. I can get free passes to the theatre.
I love beef, beans and tomatoes on my nachos. I like spicy nachos too.
dialogue: My interview at the clinic went really well, I'm just waiting to hear back now, Keep your fingers crossed for me!
That's awesome! I'm glad you think it went well! I'm planning to send my application to the EMT program next week, Any advice before I do it?
Be as detailed as you can be about your interest(s) in the field. They want dedicated people, Because the work is difficult and stressful on the body and mind.
Okay, I can certainly make sure that I'm detailed. Thinking about my app, I'm worried about seeming wishy-washy and wish I'd been on a more consistent path since I was younger.
Your personal history is important, But not as important as you might think in EMT work. What are you concerned about?

I feel like my work experience doesn't really show much interest in the medical field. Like, I've really loved being in the orchestra but I feel like it doesn't help me break into the medical field at all.
Ah, No, That's not an issue. They want live, Dedicated individuals...
Okay, Thank you, I know you're the expert here so I will stop worrying so much! I'll just stay optimistic and try to present myself with enthusiasm.

The good folks who hire EMTs want people who are deeply interested in the work and who will be trainable and sustainable. You'll know pretty quickly whether or not you're cut out for the work. So don't worry about it. Apply and follow through. That's my professional advice.
Sounds good, Maybe if you get this job at the clinic I'll be able to find work their too. It would be awesome to know someone at work before as I'm getting started.

Probably not. You're going to be busier than you've ever been before as an EMT. And I suspect you'll love the work. If you have any doubts going forward, Confide in me, And I'll give you my best advice...
Sage advice for sure. What's next for you if you don't get the clinic job? Still considering your own practice?

persona: I don't travel much.
I live on a small horse farm. My family helps take care of the horses. My horses are out grazing in the field.
I like history. I have never visited Europe. I'm interested in the Roman Empire.
I have many years left before retirement.
I like eating fish. I prefer land over ocean.
I live near lakes and rivers. I like to go out at dusk and watch the sun set with my favorite horse. I have a guest house.
dialogue: How many horses do you guys have on your farm now?
We have 6 right now, One is a beautiful black racing horse and the others are more ordinary.
Does it have ever been in a real race?
Yes, A while ago! He didn't win unfortunately but came a good third.
How do you train a horse to race?
Well it needs to be the right kind of breed to start with, Like from a line of race horses. And then you do lots of training with it to keep it fit and healthy and teach it to run!
So training a horse is a full time job, Did you train it yourself?
It can be if you want to be really good at it! I did but my family helped a lot too, My parents have always done it.
Do you like to train horse for racing? I don't think I could do it, I would not want to hurt my horses.
I do but I don't think I would like it if I was trying to be the very best at it - I think the horses enjoy a bit of more casual racing but it can get a bit brutal when lots of money is involved.
That is the thing that is bothering me horse racing, It is very artificial. Humans never needed horse races for their survival. And it can be dangerous for the horses.
That's true! It's sad what can happen when betting and money gets involved.

persona: I love horses. My family has worked with horses for generations. I grew up on a horse farm in a small town.
My dream occupation is to be a lawyer.
I want to move to the city and partake in cultural experiences.
I've brought my mini pony to the children's hospital to volunteer. I often let sick children ride the horses.
I need money for school.
My favorite horse died recently.
dialogue: I was talking to a friend an hour ago regarding their volunteer experience at a charity they help out for at times, And they told me the funniest thing that ever happened to them at a volunteer event. I think it would help cheer you up, I would be glad to tell you it if you are interested.
Please do tell me! This week has been very rough for me.

Right, So they were talking to one of the people there, Thinking that it was another volunteer. And they managed to spill their drink all over them! Embarrassing, But it turned out that it was actually the chief donor!

Haha, It is funny to see that even the rich and well-connected are capable of embarrassing themselves. Sometimes when I think about being a lawyer I have this picture of the other lawyers as inhuman, But really they are probably just normal people with a higher paying job.
Yes exactly! I think he might have donated a bit more to make up for it though so it was all good. That's definitely true, Everyone is human.
That would have been very nice of him if he did! That was a wonderful story, And it does cheer me up a bit. Anything else that's interesting happen to you lately?
Ah good! Not so much to be honest, I've just been working really. How about you?

I've just been keeping busy with the horses while trying to keep my mind off of the one that recently passed. Now that it's springtime they're starting to be much more active, Which is a nice distraction for me.
That's great! How are they doing? Do you get to ride them much?

Yeah, I'm lucky to be able to ride them all the time! The little ones are doing great too, It's so exciting seeing how quickly some of them grow up. You can come by and visit them anytime if you'd like!
I'm glad to hear it! Where are you located?
The farm is about 35 miles outside the city, So it'd be a bit of trip for you. But I promise you'll love it if you've got any interest at all in horses!

persona: I have cats. I watch Nascar.
I like mexican food.
I have one hat.
I like UFC. I like watching basketball.
I started work at 16. My first job was in a restaurant kitchen, but I soon quit. I didn't go to college because I needed to work to support myself.
I work as a promoter. I'm early in my career as promoter. I have a few bands and artists as clients. I really enjoy my job.
I like classic rock. I really like Aerosmith and followed them on tour. I don't know which Aerosmith song is my favorite.
dialogue: Are there any other bands you're working with currently?
I have worked with Cheap Trick for the last few years. I normally just get the older bands that are getting back out on tour, But I'm just starting out.
That is still exciting, Hopefully it will help open more and more doors for you. Is this something you see yourself doing for a long time?
Yeah the job is really entertaining and a lot of fun. It doesn't feel like going to work at all and that's the best thing I can hope for. Did you watch the fights last weekend on UFC?
No, I am so bummed I missed them but I was out of town training. Did you watch them?

I missed them too. I was out to eat at that Mexican place near my house, And we ended up staying out afterwards and having a few margaritas. It was a good night though. Did you get any new hats since the last time I saw you? It seems every time I see you, You have a new one.
Of course! I have gotten several new hats since the last time we saw each other. You should really come check out my collection some time!
I don't know how you have room for all of those in your place, And how you keep them organized with your cats running around all day.
I have a whole room dedicated to them and even several storage containers under my bed and down in the basement.
That's cool. How do you decide which one you are going to wear when you go out?
Typically I go with something newer that I want to show off. I also look at what hats best match my outfit, But those that I have in storage containers don't come out too often anymore.
Maybe some time you can help me pick out a new hat. I still have just the one. You always have ones that are interesting and unique.

persona: I live in North Carolina.
I am looking for a restaurant job. I am willing to relocate.
My older sister always wanted to see NY. I have never visited NY. I always had dreams of living in the big city.
I have never had a license.
I haven't seen my sister in 4 days. My sister and I are unemployed, but looking for work. I worry about my sister.
My sister and her boyfriend like Nascar racing. I don't know my sister's boyfriend's real name. My sister is 8 months pregnant.
dialogue: I passed my exams. I'm so glad the studying part is over.
That's great. So now you're going to apply for the job vacancy at the hotel?
Yep, I'm going to start that next week since it shouldn't take long and I want a couple days to relax and unwind! Have you ever thought about going to New York City?

I've always dreamed to live in New York City and so I've applied for some jobs in NY. There were a few times I got an offer from some restaurants, But my sister still worries me. That's why I didn't accept the offers. Because I don't feel comfortable leaving her here. Is your sister employed?
She is here, But like me she's also going to need a different job in New York. She's a nurse though, So finding work should be really easy for her.
That sounds good. What about playing basketball? I think now that you've passed your exams you have more free time to play. Is there a court near where you live?

Yep I was planning to go to the YMCA to play some pickup later tonight since I'm going to take the night off. It's going to be so much fun to have more time to play. I'm also looking forward to seeing a Knicks game when we're in NYC.

I'm so happy for you. I think you will have more time to play after you get employed and get established in your new job. I've been also interested in Knicks for years. Before worrying for my sister's situation fills my everyday life.
Your sister's baby is coming soon right? Is that what you've been worrying about?

The baby is one problem, Her boyfriend is another big one. I'm not sure he will be responsible about the baby and the costs. On the other hand, My sister and I are both still unemployed. E can't pay the costs for baby. I think he will leave my sister and this will really affects my sister mentally. I may apply for a job in NY and take my sister there to keep her away from this circumstance. Living in big cities has its own problems though.

Wow, I had no idea that her situation was so dire. I really hope the best for you and your family, If there's anything I can do to help out just let me know. If my sister and I make it to NYC maybe we can help you guys get a foothold there.

Thank you very much. I hope to get a chance to meet you both there. I will stay in touch with you to ask about the city. I wish you good luck for the tonight's play and also have good time at Knick's game.

persona: I have ridden a horse.
I run marathons. I have always been a vegetarian.
I have cancer. I have just started a new job for a small insurance company. I'm a life coach for hospitalized kids.
My parents are dead. I had an aunt who died.
I do charity runs for cancer. I got sponsored from my employer last year and we were able to raise $5K. I worked at the Cleveland Clinic hospital last year.
I have a super loving mini schnauzer. Her name is Harper; she is black and two years old.
I grew up around a therapeutic horse farm.
dialogue: Is booking a DJ a good idea for the fundraiser in your experience?

Yeah I think its worth the cost. You might be able to find someone to do it for free if they care about the cause too. Music is important to get everyone in a good mood and for people to enjoy themselves. Just putting on the radio or a playlist won't be nearly as good.
Ok thanks! Do you have any you would recommend me talking to?

There is a guy named Dan who did the last few runs I was on. He was really good, Kept the crowd entertained, And seemed to play the perfect music for the situation.
