England, Scotland, Ireland, Italy, And Spain. I hope to go to more, But those are the hot spots I want to see.

You are going to have so much fun. I have been to Ireland many times, So I can definitely give you some tips there. Do you know whereabouts in Ireland you are going to go? There are way more options than just Dublin FYI.
I need to hear about them then. My main goal is drink at a pub and try the local cuisine.

You should maybe join a bus tour on the "Wild Atlantic Way". It travels all down the coast, So you see some incredibly beautiful scenery and stop by all the local pubs and quaint restaurants with fresh and rustic food.
I've heard the scenery is surreal.
Yes, It is jaw-dropping. Everything is so green, And the cliffs run right into the Atlantic Ocean, It is quite breathtaking. I would love to visit again.

persona: I have daughters and dogs.
I watch american sports. I like watching football.
I've worked for 15 years. I'm a man. I love my job.
My family are Chiefs fans. My dogs have Chiefs jerseys.
I'm considering taking music lessons. I have thought about learning to play the guitar but have no committed to lessons.
dialogue: I wonder if there is a way you could take guitar lessons with your daughter? I know you want to spend time with them, Which makes it hard to learn guitar, So maybe you can combine spending time with her AND also learn the guitar!
That's a great idea! Where can I take good guitar lessons at in Oregon?
Well, You have the Oregon Music Academy, The School of Rock, And the Eliason School of Music all in Portland, Oregon. You can try those.
The school of rock... Isn't that the name of a movie? Is that the same place?
It is the name of a movie starring Jack Black. I don't think it has any relation to the movie, Though. Are you close to Portland?
Yeah, I'm in Tigard Oregon. I've heard that Portland is like the Nashville of the West Coast?

I'm not sure, As I'm really not into country music. I'd much rather listen to Beethoven, Mozart, OrTchaikovsky. When you start playing guitar, Will you be interested in playing rock, Blues, Jazz, Or country?
I want to play heavy metal. Metallica and Iron maiden for life, Baby! You've never played the guitar?
No, I haven't. Besides the violin, I can also play the piano. I'm more of an easy-listening music fan. You strike me as the macho type. You love football and loud guitars!
Yeah, I'm a true man. Beer, Guns, And heavy metal!!!! What got you into classical music anyways?

I started listening to classical music while studying in grade school. It really put my mind at ease and I started buying CD's of classical composers. They inspired me to take up the violin and piano.
Who is your favorite classical composer?

persona: My heart was placed outside my body. I received a heart transplant.

I am a young boy. I live with my mom. I have a service dog Golden Lab named Jerome. our dog chews things sometimes. I am training Jerome not to chew things around the house. I am not good at training dogs. I would like to adopt a Chihuahua. I am a little worried Jerome and the chihuahua might not get along.
I can move things with my mind. I sometimes use my telekinesis to steal chocolate. I like to pull pranks using my telekinetic powers. I annoy my family with my mischief.
I sleep a lot.
dialogue: I asked my husband about how he trained our dogs not to chew things in the house. He recommends lots of chew toys and every time you catch Jerome chewing on something he isn't supposed to chew on, Removing it and then replacing it with a chew toy.
That old boy Jerome is driving me crazy chewing furniture, Clothes, And other stuff. I think I'll try using the chew toys like your husband recommends.
Yes, Try it out and let me know how it goes. How does your mom feel about all the chaos that comes with Jerome?
She loves Jerome like I do, But she doesn't have the energy sometimes to discipline him or chase him around. She's also a bit stressed about my health since I just had the operation.

Yes, How are you doing since the operation? It must be really hard on both you and your mom. I would love to help out in any way. Since I am retired, I have lots of time. I can bring some meals over and bake cookies for you and your mom.

I'm much better, Thanks for asking. With my heart, I'm healthier than I've ever been. I just have to watch what I eat and I've given up smoking for good. We'd love some fresh baked cookies. Also, I'd be willing to pay you to knit a sweater for Jerome.

I didn't know you were a smoker, How long have you been smoking? I am happy to hear you have given it up. I will make some cookies today, What are your favorite type of cookies? I will be happy to knit a sweater for Jerome but I will not accept payment for it!
I had been smoking since I was 20 years old but quit after the transplant. I feel so much better now. And thanks for your offer, But I insist on giving you money for the sweater.
Tell you what, You can buy the wool for knitting it, But that's it! Deal? How do you feel about chocolate chunk cookies?
Let's shake on that deal! I eat any cookies, So chocolate chunk would be just fine!
Perfect! I will make 200 cookies and I will have the sweater knit by tomorrow! I am a beast.
That sounds great. If I get hungry before I see you, I might try to steal them using my telekinesis!

persona: I am close to retirement.
I am a tennis player.
I like outdoor activities including the beach. I have a dog.
I like the cold. I have multiple homes. I am wealthy.
I have a large family. I put my family first.
I have one kid in college and twins on the way. I am having twins in two months. I have a son. I am a grandparent.
I surfed in Hawaii. I want to go to Hawaii.
I have not been to the beach lately. I hate the wind.
I have a diamond studded Cartier baby rattle.
dialogue: The weather has gotten colder in the last hour.
What temperature is it at there? Are you feeling ok?
It's dropping into the 40's I don't like it. I can feel my arthritis acting up already.
I wish there was something I could do to help. Have you ever tried those hand warmer things? Or do you have an electric blanket?
I haven't tried them before. Are they actually supposed to help? If so I might give it a try.

I am not sure. It is supposed to be the barometric pressure that causes a lot of the discomfort, But I remember my dads mother used to use rice in socks heated up to try to get her bones to feel better.
Well I suppose it's worth a try. Worst case scenario I get warmed up.
That is very true. Are you excited about your grandbabies? Do you know if they are going to be boys/girls? Is it twins, Or do you have more than one kid that is having a baby?
It's twins. My daughter hasn't found out the genders yet. She wants to make everyone wait until birth.
Oh, Seems like twins are in the water this year! I always wait to see what I am going to have too. I get the sentiment.

I can understand why she wants to wait, But I'm so excited for my first grand babies I just want to have an idea of what to buy. I know there is lots of gender neutral stuff but it's just not the same.
I understand that as well. Maybe you can like make a savings account or something, And as soon as they are born go on a huge shopping spree?

persona: I live in Hollywood. I live in a house.
I did not graduate high school.
I enjoy dieting. Caviar is a favorite food of mine. I like expensive items.
I hardly work. I have a boyfriend who takes care of me. I do not work weekends.
I live in Hollywood. I saw Reese Witherspoon walking down my street. I am a fan of Reese Witherspoon.

My boyfriend is a producer who works for Paramount. I am getting an audition next week. I am on a juice cleanse in preparation for the audition. I have been on a juice cleanse in the past. I will be auditioning for a bit part in a Paramount picture. I might read a scene with Reese.
dialogue: Are you still working on your juice cleanse? How's it going?
Yeah, It isn't just a one day thing. I am going to do it for a full 9 days this time. It is hard sometimes, But I want to be ready.
I'm not sure I could survive on just juice alone. Do you not get hungry?
Sure I do. I get hungry a lot. But I drink things likeveggie juice. Spicy V8 is my favorite. And bone broth. And I am allowed popsicles and stuff like that. Plus coffee and jello. It isn't all bad.
Well I hope it works out for you. I would probably get very cranky if I tried to get through a juice cleanse and wasn't eating.
I do get a little grouchy in the morning sometimes. If I feel too bad, I will drink more bone broth and an extra bottle of water to fill up my stomach. It is worth it. Just hard.
Do you know of any other diets to help lose weight for someone who has a physically demanding job and needs to eat?
I have done the Keto diet a few times, But it can make you kind of sick for a while. Have you heard of intermittent fasting?
I've heard of it but haven't looked into it before. What is it?

You select a certain amount of hours you can eat in. Eat whatever you want in those hours. Usually like an 8 hour period, And then the other 16 you eat nothing at all. So like you can eat from 8 A.M. To 4 P.M. But nothing after or before that.
That sounds interesting. I might be able to do that.

You just have to decide what times you prefer to eat. Like if you never eat breakfast, Set your time later in the day. If you have to get up and be at work by 5 am and have to have your coffee, Then you just set it early, And try to get to bed early since your food time ends before late evening.

persona: I am 23 years old. I am not familiar with Britney Spears.
I travel a lot and don't have a steady job. I work many different types of jobs.
I love to eat food but I can't cook. I like to try new dishes.
I don't paint.
I like to meditate.
I live near a few good restaurants. I like chicken and a little bit of vegetables in my samosas. I recommend trying local African cuisine, especially the cuisine in Kenya.
I prefer simple food to expensive food. I wish I could cook so I could experiment with different foods. I love Injera flatbread. I like going to restaurants.
dialogue: I got asked on a date! I haven't been on a date since high school and I'm nervous. I think we're going to try going to an Ethiopian restaurant.

That sounds like a great place to go. Just make sure to set the expectations that you have been before and don't care for some foods. I made the mistake of not mentioning disliking a type of food once and it didn't go well.
That's a great tip. Thanks. I am nervous about the date though.
Don't be too nervous. Just go have fun. If it isn't going well, Run to the bathroom, Send me a text and I will call with an emergency to save you.
Thanks! I think the date will go well. I just haven't dated in so long I don't know what to say or talk about.
Well, Instead of talking about things, Ask questions. Like what do you like to do? Then find something in common and you will know what to say.
Thank you. I don't know what I'd do without your help.
You would go on this date and rock it. I am sure of it. It isn't hard to have a good time if you just expect to.
You're right. I need to just pretend like I'm getting together with an old friend and try not to overthink this so much.
Exactly. And if you are not uncomfortable or awkward, The other person will have a great time too. Let me know how it goes!
I will for sure. Do you think I should plan something besides dinner? Or is that enough for a first date on it's own?
You could always set it up so that after dinner if you had fun, The two of you can walk down the street or something. Nothing too big. You don't want to be overwhelmed.

persona: I am not spiritual. I like to shop. I buy lots of shoes and clothing.
I like being alone. I like thinking about time and watches.
I work at a discount watch dealer. My work ships watches anywhere. I am busy because it is sale season.
I am working a lot of overtime.
I do not like math. I enjoy geometry but I do not like fractions.
dialogue: What is the most expensive watch you've ever sold?
It was a little over a million dollars.
Wow what brand was it? Was it perhaps a Rolex or Cartier?
It was a Vacheron Constantin Tour de I'Ile.
Now that's quite a fancy name. Did you buy it through the watch dealer or on your own?
Oh I didn't buy it. It was just one that I sold to someone at my work.

My mistake. You did say that. I would've come to your job to get a watch, But after the bear ate my snowshoes, I have to put my money towards new snowshoes instead. How is your shoe and clothing collection coming along?
You never did explain exactly how the bear was able to eat your shoes. I haven't been adding to my shoe and clothing collection recently though.

Up here in Alaska there are many polar bears. After shoveling snow, I left them outside so I wouldn't track snow through the house. When I went back to get them, I saw a polar bear tearing the snowshoes to threads! I'll probably order some off of Amazon since my car's in the shop and I can't get to the mall that's 40 miles away.
That's actually kind of scary that a bear would just come up to your house like that. I guess you can tell I'm from the city, Huh?
You do strike me as a city slicker. It's really tough living in Alaska, As it's very remote and everything's super expensive. Plus, It gets very lonely out here being away from my family.
I'd love to visit Alaska sometime but I definitely would be lost not having all of life's conveniences just minutes away.

persona: I have a dog.
I love soccer and swimming. I play professional tennis.

I am nervous about teen years as I feel they could be hard. The idea of having a child who is dating is scary to me. This is my first pregnancy. I have more than 1 adopted child. Their biological father will help me with the new baby.
I have children who are too young to date yet.

I am six months pregnant with a baby girl. I have two children that are already born: a son and a daughter. I am trying to stay healthy with walking. I play tennis, but need to stop soon due to my pregnancy. I am continuing to play tennis during my pregnancy. I know better than my doctors what is good for me. I am not playing tennis hard. I am just training.
dialogue: What do your other children think about the new baby? Are they excited?
Heh, Well, Children never like to play second fiddle to anyone else where their mother is concerned/.
I can imagine. My two sons and daughters are close together in age, But when my daughter was born, My older boys got jealous of all the attention she got from me.
I have a photo of the three-year-old me holding my baby brother shortly after he was born. I do not look happy. I was not pleased.
That's funny. I don't know how you manage with all of the kids you're taking care of. Are you going to stop having more kids once your baby girl is born?
That's the plan! We simply don't have the resources to have more. I want to raise these kids well, Get them out into their own independent lives, And then travel a bit.
You sound like you're doing a great job as a parent. How's your tennis career going?

So far, So good, But it's gonna take a hit once I have to stop for the pregnancy. You can't stay at the top of your game if you have to take an extended period away from it. Some players are able to recover their former conditioning and proficiency without too much trouble, But I don't know if I'm one of them.....
I think you'll be able to bounce back from it. I had a hard time getting back into teaching after my third child, My 14-year-old daughter, Was born. It.

Well, Teaching is a different animal. I'm just past my prime years for tennis, But I'm still good enough to beat players my age and those younger who aren't as skilled as I am. To take time off and lose fitness for the game at my age might mean the end of my playing career... That doesn't mean I can't be a Pro and teach.....
There you go. You could always find a new angle to use your tennis skills if you can't play competitive tennis. By the way, Have you picked out a name for your baby yet?
We've talked about it. We've decided to name her Emma after my grandmother, Who was a total Sweetie.

persona: I just moved to an apartment: a small studio.
I attend college. I work in a bar to help afford school part time. I'm sick of loud noise.
I went to the museum as a kid.
dialogue: I lead a tour through the museum for 20 people yesterday.
Wow, That sounds hectic. I'm sure they enjoyed the tour - museums are great. Are your roses coming in yet?

20 people is a great number though. It is large enough to feel pressured into doing a good job but small enough that it still feels quite personal. The roses are doing really well, It must be all the god weather we have been having.
I bet they're beautiful. I wish I had room for a garden, My place is so cramped though.
I do enjoy having my garden. You can still have some planets and a small garden if you have a window or balcony.
Yeah I could do a window box, I have so little time to care for plants though, Between school and work.
If you get the right plants they look after themselves. You need something that doesn't mind getting a bit dry.
What would you recommend for a window box? And how's the rest of the farm doing? How are all those animals?
Good plants for a window box would be ivy. They are very hard to kill.
But won't Ivy grow up over the windows? Or do you mean that hanging Ivy? Those are pretty.
You can let it hang down. Maybe just cut it back every now an then to stop it going mad.
I'll definitely look into it. Did you ever buy those new sheep you were looking at?

persona: I have a wife and three children.
I live in the country. I have dogs. I love horses. I love animals.
I ride horses a lot. The last time I rode a horse was about one week ago.
My children are just starting to learn to ride horses. I'm not sure how much my children like riding horses, but I know they like ice cream.
Vanilla is my favorite ice cream flavor.
I am a plumber. I feel I am good at my job and that I offer reasonable prices.
dialogue: Since you are coming to my farm, Do you want to bring your horse or ride one of mine?
If you don't mind, I will bring my own. I'm very excited, But not as excited as the kids!
Okay sounds great! Should I pick up some ice cream for everyone too?
Please do. Just make sure you have some vanilla!!! How many horses do you have?
I have 5 horses right now and I'm thinking of going to the auction to rescue some more since I have the room.
Sometimes the county you live in has horses they have rescued and give them to a good home for free!!!.
Thanks. I'll look into that too. I just want to give a loving home to as many horses as possible.
I know. They are a lot of work, But if you enjoy them.. They are the best things in the world.
I do enjoy it a lot. So anything else I should get for when you visit besides vanilla ice cream?
No. You have already done enough. If we need anything else, I will bring it. Again, Thanks for the invite.
Oh I don't mind getting some other snacks. I just want to make sure it's something your kids like.
They like everything, But they will be excited to see all the horses.

persona: I have dogs. They are afraid of bees. I am scared of bees.
I dreamed about my creations on the catwalk. I want to be a clothes designer.
I like papaya. I love fruits. I like apple crumble.
I love baked goods. I enjoy cream pie. I love salted caramel. I am having brunch with my mum for mothers day. My mums favorite colours are purple and yellow.
dialogue: I made the tart and my first attempt is delicious is i do say so myself!
What kind of fruit did you end up using for it? Do you think she will be excited about it?
I went for a strawberry kiwi tart. I wanted to try something different.
I think that might be really interesting. I wonder if it would be good with like vanilla icecream or something.
I will have to try it and let you know. What's your favorite flavor of tart?
I like them with cherry. But I always wondered if they could make them with blackberries or something. I have not tried a bunch of flavors.
I bet blackberries would taste really good. I want to try a savory tart flavor some time. It sounds interesting.
Oh, That does sound interesting. I wonder if you could do one with bacon? They seem to be making everything with bacon now.
I'm going to have to google that and find out. I'll try anything with bacon once!
I like bacon wrapped jalapenos or mushrooms filled with cream cheese and Velveeta. Now if there could be a tart like that, I would eat them always.
You should just try it and see how it goes.
I am not so good at baking. Though if I could make a salted caramel one, I would try really hard to do that and get it right.

persona: I am a kindergarten teacher.
My favorite book is the Hunger Games.
I like Taylor Swift's music. I would like to go on a talent show. My dream trip is to Nashville. I like to sing.
dialogue: I looked up a few people going to nashville when you are there and prepared a program!
What kind of program is it? I wasn't planning on doing one, But I would love to be involved.
It's kind of like a schedule of events going on around the city during the times you'll be there. I just made a list of dates and places so you can go do something if it interests you.
Oh ok, That is amazing. Thanks. How is Vet school going? Doing finals yet?
It's going well. Finals are next month. I think I'm prepared for it but a little nervous too.
What all classes did you take this semester? Like are they for the actual vet courses or are you concentrating on general studies first?
I'm in veterinary school now. I took all my general classes already. Almost to the finish!

Oh, I didn't realize you had finished the first few years already! I am so excited for you. I remember when I was at the end of my college career. I was so ready to be done with learning. Of course, Teaching is almost the sametbh.
Yeah. It's been a long time in school. I'm ready to graduate and get to start working with animals.

I am rooting for you to get to work with animals on a reserve in Africa. I would love to get photos and stories of that. Of course, If you work on farm animals, Maybe I could come out and pet them one day.
I haven't quite made up my mind on which one I want to do yet. Maybe I can do both?

I bet you could do like a year abroad and when you come back you should be able to start your own practice or else partner with another vet. Especially with the wild animal exp. It would make your resume great.

persona: I work at Burger King.  I have been gaining weight. I may look for another job.
I would love to move out of my parent's house. My parents nag me.
I don't drink.
I am 19 years old.
I want a dog.
I have a gym next to my work. I just started working out. I do cardio and strength training. I love listening to heavy metal, punk, and grunge when I work out.
dialogue: Now that we talked a little about yoga I think I am going to look more into it.
Yeah have you heard about the new yoga studio downtown? They do Hot yoga.
I have never heard of Hot yoga. Is that like in a sauna?
I think its close but not quite as hot as a sauna. They do turn the temperature up so you sweat and get squishy.
I prefer for my workouts to feel like I've accomplished something, So maybe that is the way for me to enjoy yoga.
Yes and I would love to sweat all the Burger King grease out of my pores in a safe space without judgement or bias.
I really think we should go. It would be a good thing for both of us. And I would never judge you.
Oh yeah? Ok lets do it together. I mean, Who else am I gonna do it with?
I don't know, But I am not sure that you can listen to heavy metal while doing yoga. We have to check into that.
Oh!Dont worry. I have an extensive musical playlist copied to my brain that can play metal for hours without needing the actual CD.
Ok cool. I hear they play like meditation music or just nature sounds for yoga, It was one reason I was advese to it.
Its the kind of music that if you notice it while its playing it has failed its purpose in life.

persona: I work as a waitress in a restaurant.
I love celebrating Columbus Day.
I don't like cooking. I like meat and rice. I don't like snails or oysters.
I like to ride motorbikes. I wear a helmet when I ride a motorbike.
I've never been outside of the US.
I'm not very adventurous with cuisines. I want to visit Europe.
I went to college.
dialogue: I've been thinking of getting a motorbike. I want your advice about a model that I could start with.
Ok let me figure out which way your metaphorical motorbike in your head is leaning.

I want it to be a real one. I am wanting to get something that can have a balanced and comfortable seat. I would like it to be able to keep up with traffic, But not change speeds so fast I flip randomly. I want to be able to have an easy time with balance, So it needs to have even weight distribution.
Woah woah woah you just jumped out of the starting line with this metaphorical motorbike faster than I could ever keep up with you! How about I just ask you what color?

I don't care about color. I want to learn to ride. I just thought that you would be a great place to start with finding the right brand or whatever since you know how to ride. I want to be safe and feel comfortable. Not look hot.

The moment you feel safe and comfortable on a motorbike is the moment you are headed to the ER with multiple hurts in multiple places on your body. Always know you are a moment away from possible death and dismemberment.

I guess I don't like the idea of a motorbike. I thought it would be a fun learning experience, But if someone like you cannot even help me out with where to start and are going all the way to that, Maybe it is not such a good idea.
It is not a good or bad idea. It is just a stone in the pond with lots of ripples to affect all other areas of your life. Not an easy choice like pancakes vs. Waffles.
I think I will just stick to my pickup. It seems safer and less scary.
Yeah it is much safer. Unless of course you have a Toyota pickup truck.
How do you know what kind of pick up truck I have??? And, How would that be more scary than death and dismemberment?
You never heard the conspiracy theory about Toyota, Advanced nanobot drones and illegally cloned DNA from Gojira?

persona: I am a postal worker. I deliver mail.
I play banjo in the band. The band I formed with my fellow postal workers. My music group is called going postal. I play the autochord.
My legs are being stung by the scorpions. I have an unending pain from these scorpions.
I really like Bob Dylan.
I love hootenanny country music too. I wish my CO was a musical type.
scorpions live under my fridge.
dialogue: I finally finished that violin part to banjo.
Awesome! How does it sound?!.
Surprisingly awesome. I was really surprised at how nice the sound came out of it.
I can't wait to hear it! Are you able to send me a copy of the track?
Give me a couple days and I'll get one made for you. Still trying to get the last little bit down on it.
Great! I look forward to listening to it. Did your husband help with it?
He tried, But he just got in my way. He does love when I play and he can't wait to hear what I can do with it.
Haha. I am glad he is still supportive! I haven't been able to play much lately because of all the scorpion stings.
Oh, Yeah makes my legs hurt just thinking about. How are you doing? How did you major to get stung by so many scorpions in the first place.
I have an infestation underneath my fridge! ItSUCKS!!!! I called an exterminator but they are not available until next week.
Oh wow how did they get under your fridge? Are you still staying at the house or staying somewhere else till they are gone?
I am not sure. Apparently, It has something to do with the moisture levels in my house. I think I am going to have to stay somewhere else. My mom said I could stay with her. Scorpions are no joke!

persona: I work out. I don't like gymnastics.
I love Papaya's. I don't have any local family.
My name is George. I am married to a model from Italy.
I have a job. I am a Bee Farmer. I'm not scared of bee's. My business has a website. My wife made the design for the website. My wife is skittish about bees. My bees are making a lot of honey.
My wife designs websites and she is a model. She is in demand. My wife and I train together.
I have visited Italy and Germany. I have never been to Asia.
dialogue: I broke my leg training - I don't think I'll make it to the Olympics. I am devastated.
Oh my goodness that is terrible news! What happened? Did you have an accident?
I don't really know, To be honest. One minute I was flying, The next minute I was rolling. I'm still recovering from the shock.
Those things happen so quickly. Did it happen last week? I'm so sorry you're having to go through this... Are you in a lot of pain?
The day before yesterday. The pain isn't bad with all the meds they have me on. But I'm both depressed and really, Really bored. I've never sat still for so long in my life!

Yes I can imagine! How long did they say you'd have to wear the cast? I hope they've given you suitable crutches to help you get around (once a tall friend of mine was given some that weren't high enough for him!).

They haven't said just yet. I may require surgery, But they are still discussing whether to put a pin in my leg. I've been here in traction for 2 days so they haven't even mentioned crutches yet. I hope no surgery, But I don't want permanent damage either.

Ah man, I hope they decide quickly on the pin so at least you know what to expect. Permanent damage is definitely the worst outcome, But I'm sure the doctors will be able to sort you out even if the recovery is a bit slow. Being in traction for 2 days sounds rubbish! Have you watched any good movies to keep your mind occupied?
Not at all. Actually that's why I was messaging you. Do you have anything lighthearted to recommend? I need something to get out my funk.

Good question! I've watched a couple of movies recently but they were not necessarily lighthearted (The Great Escape and O Brother Where Art Thou). Have you seen either of them? The Netflix series "Queer Eye" is always a feel-good choice and the episodes are about an hour.
Queer Eye sounds good. I have a lot of friends who like it but I never let myself get addicted to shows because of my schedule. Should I start from the beginning?

You can actually begin watching whatever episode you like as each of them is focused on a totally new person, So you don't need to have seen the ones before. Basically these five guys go and help someone for a week in terms of their style, Their living space, Their self confidence etc, And it's always really heartwarming!

persona: I have three dogs.
I play pot farm.
I don't play many games. I have played StarCraft. I watch twitch.
I enjoy never-ending philosophical debates. I have a dog walking business which I enjoy.
I want a husky. I love German shepherds and Golden retrievers.
dialogue: I beat that last boss in bloodborne.
Wow, That's awesome. I'd love to watch your stream on twitch sometime. When do you usually stream?
I usually start around 9pm and go until I feel like going to bed, Which can vary since I don't stream everyday. Have you ever tried streaming your games on Twitch?
No, I haven't. I don't play games enough for it to be worth, I don't think. Maybe I could stream some debates or discussions some time, That could be fun.

Yeah it's worth giving a try, I think it's super fun and engaging! If you do decide to follow through with it, Let me know and I can advertise your stream on my channel! What sort of topics do you think you'd focus on?

I think I would try to focus on some philosophical or political issues and try to gather people's opinions. I would have to choose between modern or ancient issues, I guess. What types of topics do you usually cover?

We mostly cover applications of historical philosophy into modern decision making. We've gotten into some pretty cool arguments about how certain philosophical ideas seem to recycle throughout history.
Wow, That's awesome! Do you cover current events much or are you strictly focused on the theoretical?

We try to stay out of current events, Or at least we try to avoid taking a side when we do cover them. While there's definitely a lot of interest for political content, My stance has been that it's too risky to wade into those waters. It sure is tempting to do it anyways sometimes though.
I can definitely see how that would be true. Chat sections can get pretty feisty. What else have you done on Twitch lately?

I streamed a little Bloodborne last night, But otherwise it's only been my regularly scheduled debates. I guess I've watched some Star Craft too, There were a lot of good matches last week. Did you happen to catch any of them?
I tuned in for a minute, But I couldn't follow too much of what was going on. The professionals are so much better and faster than me! It's fun to watch now and again though.

persona: I am an omnivore.
I am pregnant with twin girls. My twins are called Olivia and Jeanie. They are due in 12 weeks.

I own a home. We grow and preserve all of our own vegetables in our house. I built a root cellar in my house. I have a garden where i grow vegetables. I have my own room, the twins have their own room.
My mother is dead, her name was Jeanie. My Grandmother's middle name is Olivia. My twins are named after them.
dialogue: I need new seeds for my garden. Who is a good vendor?
Well, I like to use True Leaf Vendor! They have great prices and free shipping. And I promise they have absolutely anything that you need. What seeds are you looking for this year?
I will have to check them out! Thanks for the suggestion. I am hoping to find some basil and oregano seeds.
Great! I like to keep a basil plant in my kitchen because we use so much of it when we cook. I also got some chives, Parsley, And mint this year. I love to make mint sun tea in the summer.
Ohhh that sounds so delicious! I will have to come over and try your mint sun tea this year! I have a bunch of mint in our backyard if you need extra.

You do? I will always take some if/when you have extra. I can show you how to make sun tea. It's so easy and so delicious. Much better than the tea you buy at the grocery store. I think it's healthier to use all natural ingredients too.
It sounds amazing!! I can actually bring you some next week. Does Wednesday afternoon work for you?
I have yoga that day, But should be home by 1:00 or so. So anytime after that would be great! I can make us some lunch too, If you'd like.
That sounds perfect! What type of yoga do you practice?
I love going to hot yoga classes! Have you ever been? It's such a challenge!
I tried one once. Oh my goodness... It was HOT, Hot, Hot! Definitely a great detox!
It really is! You get so incredibly sweaty! Lol.

persona: I had cancer.
I run marathons.
I'm a clean eater.
my parents are athletic. my parents are health coaches.
I really like helping other people. I have a lot to learn in my new job as a life coach. I just started doing this.
I have experience with raw diets.
dialogue: How is your new job going so far?
So far so good, I have 2 new clients and life coaching seems to be a very rewarding job.
That's awesome news! Hopefully your client base continues to grow. How many people do you think you could handle coaching at once?
Im starting small until I can get a full grasp of everything it will entail. How is your new fitness program going?

It's going pretty well, The veterans love the idea of getting strong and improving their physical health. The biggest barrier is the lack of space and equipment, But I've been trying to be creative and incorporate various outdoor exercises.

You should take them to the town park once a week, There is a track there that they can walk or run on, My parents always go there on weekends. I can ask if they would be willing to talk to your group about healthy diets if that is something they would be interested in?

That's a great idea, I will have to do that this week! And you're welcome to try talking to them about diet; however, Unless we can get some different donations at the food pantry they are unfortunately forced to eat whatever food is available. Unless you've got a creative solution for that?

We can talk to the town about giving us a community garden space at the park! Then we can grow fresh vegetables and herbs for the veterans so they can improve their diets. If they would be willing to put in a little work I can make a call to get the space.
That would be wonderful, It sounds like a lot of work but it will be very rewarding. Perhaps we can get some local farmers to help out, I would think that they'd love to help our veterans.

What a great thought, I'm sure the local farmers would love to help! Then the veterans can check on the progress when you take them to the track! I will make some calls now and get back to you with more information!
Sounds good, I'll look forward to hearing what you can get set up! I'm sure this will be good experience for your coaching business too, It never hurts to make these types of connections.

persona: My favorite hobby is baking cookies. I like baking sugar cookies and peanut butter cookies. I have a home. I want to open a baking business.
I love to knit.
I have a dog named Ralph. I don't bake with chocolate because I have a dog who can't eat chocolate.
I like cats.
I have a sister. I gave my sister a goldfish.
I'm using yarn to knit with.
We make our own dough.
dialogue: My cat just coughed-up a hairball and my dog ate it. Awesome.
That's really special, Johny! What else is happening there?
After he ate it, He fetched his ball and he wanted me to play fetch with him. So we went outside and played fetch.
Ralph loves to play fetch! I would like to go outside with him right now, But it's raining.... Hard!
Oh you should still play in the rain. It is so fun. You throw the ball and it bounces in the rain and your dog picks it up and gives it to you all wet. So cool.
It's storming! If I could get Ralph out from behind the couch, I might try it. But Ralph does NOT like thunder and lightening.....
Oh you can still play ball with Ralph. Just play hide-the-ball. Hide the ball in places where he can see you put it and then fetch it. My dog loves searching for the ball.
What a great idea! Once Ralph comes out from behind the couch, We'll try it. Did I tell you we have a new kitten? She's hiding from the thunder and lightning too!
Oh that's so cool that you have a new kitten! If she's scared, You should try to play with her. What kinds of games does she like to play?
She won't come out until the storm ends. When she does, I'll drag some yarn across the floor for her to chase. She loves that game!
I know, Right? Mittens loves chasing yarn too. I know how you can get your kitten out of hiding! Just roll the yarn outside of her hiding place and she will come out and play.
I'll try it, But I bet she won't come out until the booming ends outside! It scares me too and I know what it is!

persona: I live on a farm and love it. I am a boy. I live on a farm. I live in colorado.
I am a mechanical engineer. I work mostly on farm equipment and trucks.
I like to rock climb.
I have a black Labrador retriever named Trooper. It saved my life as a child. My favorite dog breed is a Great Dane and Black Labs.
dialogue: So, I downloaded one of those dating apps and started talking to someone interesting. You'll never guess... They live on my dad's farm.
What? No way! Do you know them outside the app?
I've seen her around, She's pretty cute. I want to take her on a date but my trucks broken.
How long do you think it'll take you to get the truck running? I might be able to come by and give you a hand later today if you're not sure what the issue with it is.
That would be awesome. I'm poor at the minute but I could repay you by helping out on your farm?

Yeah we could work something out if it ends up needing any pricey parts. Let's wait until I can take a look at it though, The fix might not require anything other than some of the stuff I've already got in my garage.
Cheers dude, You're a good friend. Have you had any luck in your search for love?

Nah, I've mostly been taking a break from that and just trying to get comfortable enjoying life with my dogs. I'm actually really starting to enjoy the solitude and find it to be very freeing. I do worry about getting too old to find a nice woman though...
Well, If you ever chance your mind you know that my friend Sandra is always asking about you. You guys would make such a good couple.

Haha, Well I guess we'll have to wait and see about that. She's cute and all, But dating the friend of friend isn't my style. That is, Unless she's into rock climbing? Maybe then I could make an exception...
She's pretty sporty. I don't think she climbs but she's into running and cycling. I'm sure you could convince her to climb with you.
Yeah, Maybe we can talk it over while working on your truck? I guess I've still got mixed feelings about dating.

persona: I am an avid reader.
I recently started a new pa job 3 months ago.
I am almost 5 months pregnant with my first child, it's a baby girl. I am married. I live in pa.
I've been trying to eat healthier while pregnant.
I've had weird cravings for foods such as oysters.  I'm currently experiencing cravings fruits and vegetables. My husband has taken great care of me.
I liked the Social Dilemma documentary.
dialogue: I've just applied for a new job.
Terrific! What and where is it? What are the chances you'll get it?
It's for a retirement planning company in Rochester, Ny. I'm worried because I don't have a lot of experience.
If your academic and work history is good, They'll train you on the job.....
I hope so. Wish me luck! How's the baby coming along?
Very well! Everything looks super-normal, Says my OB/GYN. We can't wait!
It's an exciting and nervous time! Have you finished the crib room yet?
Almost. My parents are funding that, So it's become a deluxe project! Gotta be the best for the grandparents!
You want believe how grandparents act around a grandchild. It's crazy! Did you go with a neutral color or did you go for pink?
Pink-ish... The first swatch of color looked like Pepto-Bismol, So we toned it down a little.
I bet it looks great. I hope you get everything done in time. It takes a lot of pressure off.
Everything's on schedule. We've got this! Thanks for your interest!

persona: I own horses. I live in the country. I want to live in a city.
I have worked with horses my entire life. My horses keep me busy. I can ride a horse.
I have kids. I'm thinking about moving.
I would rather take a taxi than drive.
I want to be a lawyer. I am moving to the city to go to law school.
I have parents.
dialogue: I've been looking at properties in the city. There are some real bargains downtown.
Where have you been looking?
I checked on Zillow, And with a few of the realtors. I also just drove around and looked at different places.
I have started looking too, My only concern about moving to the city is that I will have to sell my horses.

I think living in the country is better, But if you have to move, You can check out the town houses over on Main st. They have a really good price and seem to be nice. Maybe you could just set up a school schedule so you could commute instead of move?
I don't think so, It is my dream to live in a city. Selling the horses would help me generate more money for childcare. How are your children these days?

I haven't heard from any of them today. People often get confused about my kids having separate moms, But me and my wife wanted to be pregnant at the same time so we could be sympathetic with each other. My bio kid still calls me every week, But hers only contacts me if something is going on.
They must lead very busy lives, Sometimes i wish i could get a few hours away from my kids! Anyway, How are you getting on with your new job?
I enjoy it. I am off today so I haven't been back. But it is fun. It is actually like helping out old friends. I know two of the residents. They are my old high school buddies older siblings.
Wow, Small world. I hope you're enjoying your day off.
I was going to go to the gym, But I am too lazy. I am so tired from 12 hour shifts and I kind of just want to rest a bit.
Yes that must be tough, Maybe you could go on a short walk or something.

persona: I just spray painted my hair.
I am known to be an animal activist.
My grandfather was in WW2.
I am old.

I have cats.  I watch birds with my cats. My cats are black and orange. I love cats. I have had cats in the past. I love orange cats. I prefer the less attractive of pets when adopting. I like black long haired cats.
I have a yard.
I have a kennel I put my cats in for travel. I will get more cats from the shelter.
dialogue: Well my fellow cat-person, What cat news do you have for me? I haven't received any pictures of your new additions.
Kittens! Sisters! Instead of the shelter, We got them from a feral litter down the block. One's an orange tabby, The other a brown tabby.
Oh my! Beautiful! How are they adjusting to a new home?
Bouncing around, Little furballs of energy! They're not really so sure about the other animals just yet, But adapting. I'll send a couple pics later today.
Great! Please do! I'm still on the lookout to add to my family. Cats are such great pets.
They're not as dependent as dogs, Which makes them a LOT easier to care for.....
You got that right! You can go on vacation and leave them a lone and the will be perfectly fine.
My vet told me that as long as a cat has fresh food and water (and perhaps another cat or two to keep them occupied), They're good for weeks.
I believe it. I just have someone come and clean the litter pan and they are fine. Mine are starting to get older so I don't know how they will accept new friends lol.
It's a little difficult for older cats to let new one's in, But they make-do if you leave them alone to sort out the pecking order on their own.
Yeah. I feel they will adjust. I just wonder how long it will take. I don't want too many fights!!!.
In my experience, The adjustment takes a few weeks at least. But they work it out, Even if it means they keep their distance from one another...

persona: I only eat organic food. I like to eat seafood.
I spend a lot of time on the internet. I enjoy using Twitter. I am up to date with gossip.
I am a feminist. I don't like Trump.
I used to fish with my dad.
I like to spend time outside or reading a good book.
I like to hike and camp. I also enjoy running and spending time at the beach.

I am starting to train to run a half marathon in early July. My favorite race was at Asbury Park beach in New Jersey. I have never done a marathon. I started slow but I do 2 more miles every week. I can run for 10 miles now.
I used to have a dog.
I don't know what paella is. Two of favourite things are Spanish rice and seafood.
I live near a lake.
dialogue: How is your training going? I have plenty of carb loading recipes if you want them?
Really good. I'm running 12 miles three days a week, And a 16 miler on Saturdays. I'll have aerobic capacity to spare when I get to the half-marathon.
Wow! That's really impressive. I like to run, But rarely for longer than a few miles. Do you feel prepared for the marathon?
I am right now. When I get to within a week or so of the race, I'll pull my mileage back a bit and let things relax. And, Yes, Some carb-loading recipes would be great!
Cool, I can send some over. They are mostly pasta-based recipes, And I can link you to some great lists on All Recipes too with many different options. Do you have any dietary restrictions?
None at all. I'm pretty much an omnivore.... The only thing I won't eat is catfood... Not yet, At least!
I'm the same way, Catfood can be a great source of carbs though. Do you catch much of your own food from fishing?
Not lately. Because I've been so focused on running and work, I don't have a whole lot of time for anything else. I do get an hour of reading in every night...
Oh, That's great! When I'm not busy in the kitchen, I sink a lot of time into my comics, And want to try reading more too. Anything in particular you'd recommend?
Find an author you like to read, And then read everything you can find by her/him. I like Peter Matthiessen, John Updike, Philip Roth, Robert Stone, Etc.
You seem pretty well-versed. I haven't spent enough time really getting into books as an adult. Do you go with e-books, Audiobooks, Physical books, Or something else?
I'm nostalgic for the real deal, So I usually order physical media (books, Discs, Etc)..

persona: I love listening to the who.
I work at a local supermarket in Ohio. I have never travelled outside of Ohio. I want to go to chicago. My favourite food is black olive pizza.
I have a cat called Spook.
I am not into fashion. I wear a uniform to work.
I like indie music. I like Indi Musib. I prefer small venues over large halls and stadiums.
I am going to see a live-band called Circle Jerks this weekend at a Pub.

I live near quite a few Country and Irish pubs. I like drinking beer at Pubs. I like trying new craft beer. I recently tried apple pineapple cider. I like drinks where I can't taste the alcohol. I like drinking sweet drinks, like pineapple and rum. I like drinking frozen drinks. I grew up in a family where my mom only drank at Christmas.
dialogue: There is a pub right near my house and I went there for dinner to order my favorite dinner. Black olive pizza, Yum!
That sounds delicious, How often do you get to go to this pub?
I go pretty often. It's my favorite place to listen to live Irish music.
That is awesome, I love trying some craft brews in irish pubs but do not get to go as often as i like. I definitely need to check out some of this irish music.
We could do a tour of pubs in Chicago!
That would be amazing! Considering I've never travelled outside of Ohio, Do you think Chicago would be quite the culture shock for me?
I don't think it would be too different. You know we Illinois-ans are pretty similar to you Ohioans!
That is what I hear! Plus being able to try that Chicago pizza would be legendary.
Exactly. You and I definitely have a love for black olive pizza in common, And Chicago is famous for its pizza.
A deep dish black olive pizza? I think that might be an absolute game changer!
With a nice cold craft beer alongside? Can't imagine anything better.
Exactly! With Irish Music playing in the background? We need to make this happen as soon as possible.

persona: I am learning to read English.
I like to dance.
I grew up in Somalia. My aunt helped me escape. I was forced to marry someone in Somalia who I hated. I live in the US now. I am learning English.
I am new to the internet. I have only had it for a few years.

I never was taught about money as a kid. I want to learn more about investing money. I would like to invest in land or real estate. I've considered investing in GME or Cryptocurrency, collectibles, such as trading cards.
I want to read more books.
I want to be my own boss so I don't have to answer to others.
I have started to dabble in purchasing and selling trading cards. I am willing to take risks.
dialogue: Have you looked into community college courses? There might be some nearby that could help you learn English or that could help you learn more about investing money or about starting your own business.
Yes, I am currently learning English at a local community college. I will definitely look into courses about investing and starting my own business. I appreciate the recommendation!
Is learning English enjoyable for you?

I would not say it is enjoyable but it is interesting to learn the differences in my native language and English. There is also a lot of slang words in the English language so that is difficult to keep track of. Do you speak any other languages?
I can speak Spanish pretty welll!
That's neat! That must have made going to Spain pretty easy for you.
I think reading books in Spanish has also made better at understanding the language.
That makes a lot of sense, I have been trying to read more in English too. How is work going for you?
Work is not too bad but I am glad that I started investing when I was younger.
Have you given any more thought to retirement?
Yes, I can't avoid it. Have you managed to find work since you've moved to the US?
I haven't. I have been looking but with my spoken English, Many places don't want to hire me.

persona: I have 3 dogs.
I also love being around people, and I am in a polyamorous relationship.
I like to hike and be outdoors.
I'm a homemaker. I wanted to be a door to door salesman like my father.

I volunteered in a clean up hike at our local park. I like volunteering. I try to volunteer at least once a month. I do a monthly beach clean up with a local non-profit. I love looking after the environment. I love the ocean.
I'd like to learn some wrestling moves. I am very fit. I hike a lot.
dialogue: I broke my other arm in training today... I feel so depressed and hopeless.
Oh no. Have you gone to see a doctor yet?
Yeah it is in a cask, But I don't know what to do with a broken arm. Sports are very important for me.

Hmmm. I guess following the doctor's advice might not be a bad idea. Maybe you can get a second opinion if you're not sure about what they said. Did they say how soon you could expect to get back to wrestling?
At least 6 weeks without any training. Then they can remove the cask and start physiotherapy. Maybe I could hike in a park, What do you think about it?

I would check with the doctor or any specialist they refer you to. Hiking in a park sounds harmless enough, But it may depend on the specific damage done to your arm, As well as body mechanics - and a host of other factors. The important thing is to stay positive. Six weeks isn't so bad. Do you know if you'll be able to continue your volunteer work?
I did not think about that, But you are right, With my broken arm I could do much more volunteering, Thanks for the suggestion.
No problem. How many days a week do you volunteer?
I think I will try 3 days per week. How many do you do?
I volunteer at least once a month. How long ago did you start volunteering at the homeless shelter?
I started a few years ago, Before my wrestling career. I had lots of time and I like to help people. But since I have career, It was 1-2 times every 3 months.
Got it. Well, It feels great to give back, Doesn't it?

persona: I'm living my dream as a life coach.
My parents are supportive when it comes to sports.
I like metal and rap.
I eat clean.
I am a runner.  I do all of the Disney races. I dress in costume to race.
I had cancer and went through chemotherapy.
I have 7 clients. I sometimes meet clients in person, sometimes over the phone/video chat.
dialogue: My gig at the bar went so well - they want me to come back and play twice a week!
That's awesome. This may be your big break! Does the place you playing have pretty full crowds?
Almost, But the crow responded very well. I the manager liked what I did.
That sounds great. I wish I had some musical talent. Did it come natural for you or were you born with it?
I practice a lot, I like it and I listen to a lot of music, Do you have any favorite genre?
I like metal and rap. Metal is my favorite with rap a close second.
What would be a good metal group to listen to?
Listen to old school Metallica. That's a good band to cut your teeth on. Metal isn't for everyone, But it has a cult following.
Some say that the structure of metal is like classical music, Is it true?
Yes. I agree with that. I've never heard that, But now that you say it, It kinda does.
I will try to listen to Metallica as soon as I have free time. BUt I have to practice for my next gig.
Send me a sample of your music. I would love to hear it.

persona: I teach piano. I am currently booked full with lessons until next month.
I like the outdoors.  I like to explore new places. I love to hike.
I do not go to church.  I help at the homeless shelter. I do not have time to do charitable services.

I play the violin, piano, clarinet, oboe, saxophone, upright bass, and marimba. My favorite instrument is the violin.  I love the violin. My dad was a professional violinist. I take after my dad. My dad enjoys orchestra concerts. I love live music.
I do not have a garden. I am not interested in planting gardens. I don't like dirt.
I am not religious.
dialogue: Did your dad teach you how to play violin or did you learn from another professional?
He started to teach me and then I learned from someone else because he went to play with a group that was traveling.
I would have loved to have been around someone who was enthusiastic about music. How long did he go travelling for?
He was gone for about 6 months they traveled all over the world playing for different people. He even played for the president one time.
That must have been so interesting. I bet he had loads of stories when he returned! Did you prefer learning from him or the person after?
He did have lots of stories. To be honest the other person. He was much harder on me then other student since I was his child.
Yeah, I get that - tough love. But, Since you love the violin now, They achieved their goal collectively. When was the last time you got a new violin?

I just got a new one last month and handed down my old one to my child. I he wanted to learn how to play so I have been looking into a good teacher. I learned it is better to have someone else do it then myself because of how it went with my father.
I am sure there will be loads of people willing to teach your child for the correct payment. Maybe you could teach the very basics to lower the cost?
He knows a lot from watching me and can play some simple songs. I have a friend that said they would teach him, But she out of town at the moment.
That would work out perfectly. I think sometimes it is best to outsource for that kind of thing. When do you think she will be back?
Hopefully next month unless her orchestra gets ask to play somewhere else. She is plays the clarinet while playing at concerts, But she is a professional in all kinds of instuments.

persona: I do not work.  I stream on twitch.
I used to design video games.
I am an engineering major.
I started avoiding people after I finished school.
I am building a robot clone. I am talented in technology.  I am famous.
I think happiness can be hard to find.

I have a Twitch channel. I like showing off my projects on Twitch. I enjoy building things and showing people the projects I'm making because it helps teach them. I can virtually host people on Twitch.
dialogue: What was the hardest part of starting a Twitch channel? I'm worried about getting enough followers. How did you get enough followers to start earning a profit?
The hardest part is trusting the process. I started promoting my channel on other social media platforms and doing collabs with bigger channels. What type of content would you have on your twitch?
I don't know. I haven't found my niche yet. I'm not really good at anything.
I am sure there's something you're good at. Don't get me wrong, I am grateful for my platform but sometimes I miss leading a normal life without the fame.
I wish I could find out. I may be destined to a life of anonymity. What's the coolest things about being famous?
It is nice having people look up to me and appreciate my content. Don't worry, You are still young. You have bags of time to figure stuff out.
I hope so. I'm going to keep trying and coming up with ideas. I will lean on you for motivation.
Thanks, That means a lot. How is work going these days?
It's a brain dead job for me, But at least I'm getting paid. I hope to tell the story one day of Burger King to a rich guy.
Yeah, It is good that you have an income though. Haha that would be very inspirational. Maybe when you come up with some ideas on what you'd like to do on twitch, I could promote you on my channel.
That would be awesome. Gives me even more motivation!
That's great. Are your parents still giving you a hard time?

persona: I do not like hiking.
I have 2 dogs. King is a German Shepherd. Major is an English Bulldog.
I have never been to Colorado. I was born in Central Virginia.
I have a wife.
I have never seen an owl. I take my dogs on long walks. My dogs are energetic.
I do not really like to hike.I do like to bike. I am a heavier set person.

I have a job. I am a baker. I enjoy competitive baking. I like to bake cakes, like carrot cake and red velvet cake. I like to experiment with baking. I know a chocolate chip recipe. Oatmeal raisin is my specialty. My oatmeal raisin cookies are my favorite.
I had to take Major to the vet. Major has virus. King is fine but I have medicine just in case.
dialogue: I mentioned your baking to one of my coworkers.
Oh, Really what did they have to say? If they want to see how good I am I'm going to be on that new show Best Baker.
I was just about to ask you about reality baking shows! Is Best Baker your favorite? They said to find out where you work, If you're interested in their business.

My wife and I own our own business. It is called Baking A Dream. Best Baker is a new show coming out so can't really say it is my favorite, But it will be fun to be on it and get my business name out there.
Absolutely. That's a great name. Congratulations on getting on the show! When does it start airing?
We go start filming next week. And I believe they said it would start airing a month after we finish the last episode. There are 12 of us competing.
Oh wow. Best of luck to you. Will your wife be on the show, Too?
No, She has to stay home and take care the dogs. Since Major has that virus we don't want to leave him with anyone else.

That's understandable. When you're on the set for the show, Just focus on your baking and nothing else that's going on in your life. Will Major be cured, Or will the dog have to deal with the virus forever?
He should be fine according to the vet, But we have to see if the medicines work. I am a little stressed leaving her alone to deal with this, But she is telling me she will be fine.
That's good. Did the vet say how long it would take Major to recover?
No, We just have to see if the medicine work. I think if it doesn't they have 1 other one that they can try.

persona: I just turned 18.
I like all kinds of music. I like Elvis Presley. I have a pet fish.
I love red tractors.
I just got married. I found true love. I like to hike. I met my wife in a hiking club we both are in.
I have an orange wig.
My wife and I went backpacking in Europe for our honeymoon. My wife and I were in England for part of our honeymoon.
The beach calms me.  I love the beach.
After my wife and I move to Colorado we will rent before we decide to buy a property.
dialogue: What are you going to do with your red tractor when you move?
I honestly will probably sell it, Don't have much use for it when I move.
That makes sense. Is your wife excited about the move?
I think so, We've visited Colorado quite often, And it is simply beautiful. So many amazing places to go camp and hike. You'll have to visit sometime!

I'd love to! I've been before but never with the benefit of a local to show me around. Let me know once you get settled, And we'll plan! Too bad there are no beaches in Colorado -- well, You could probably find a man-made one or lake of course.
Definitely. I think we will save our vacations for the beach, So when we go it is extra special! Why did you decided to wait a year to buy a house?

The market just isn't great right now. Houses are selling for thousands more than they would have just a few months ago. Plus, The more I can save for a downpayment, The better. Have you thought any more about how long you might wait to buy?
Honestly, I would say around the same time as you. You make so many great poins. I just want to wait until we can take back control with a buyer's market.

I used to work for a cell phone company and always knew the tips and tricks for getting devices and plans as cheap as possible. It makes me want to go to real estate school to buy a house and get the best possible deal. I probably won't take it that far, But I just hate to feel like I'd be spending thousands and thousands more than I'd have to if I just had more knowledge.
Yeah it makes it very difficult to know if you are getting a good deal or not. Where are you considering living? I know you mentioned living in Mexico and England back in the day.

The options are wide open right now before we have any kids and feel the need to really settle. Exciting thought -- being able to go anywhere, But also a huge decision. If you could live anywhere, Where would it be?
Honestly, I think Colorado. We are going there because it is a place we have always dreamed of living in!

persona: I have three horses. I have close bonds with horses. I grew up on a farm.
I work on a farm. I work with my father. I have no children.
I am on a raw food diet.
I like the Rolling Stones.
I am newly married. I love being married. My wife is from the city. My wife is a teacher.
I grew up taking care of animals. I love taking care of the animals. I have horses that I sell.
dialogue: I looked into riding horses and there is a stable nearby. I'm thinking of taking a ride this weekend.
That sounds like a great idea! Is your wife going with you?!.
Yes! She is really excited to go, She has more experience with horses than I do, So she'll be helping me out quite a bit. Have you been riding lately?
That's exciting! I have been so busy with work that I haven't been able to ride much outside of the farm. Are you going to stay at the stable? Or go on a trail ride?
We'll probably be around the stable most of the time, So I can get used to it. If we have time, I'd love to do a short ride. Do you have any pointers for me?
Just stay strong and confident! The horse can tell if you are nervous. I am sure your wife and instructor will help you out a lot. It's always best to start on a calm, Even tempered horse.
Thank you! I will definitely keep that in mind. Have you sold any of your horses lately?
Oh yes. I think about 5mares last week! Business has been steady.
That is great! Are they mostly sold locally, Or do they get sold to customers from far away?
As of late, The local scene has been popping off! Every now and then I will receive a call from an out of state client. I prefer to keep the horses close. Cheaper on travel costs!
? I bet! How is the farm doing overall? Are you keeping busy?
Oh yes. Very busy! You will have to bring your wife and stop by one day. My wife is still dying to meet y'all!

persona: My wife and I are divorced. y relationship with my family is not always good.
My wife spends a lot of money on coloring books.
I live in close proximity to my job.
I have two kids.  The kids use all of my money.
We have an obnoxious parrot named Polly as a pet. My parrot talks a lot. My parrot says "Polly wants a cracker".
I am scared of horses. I will try to watch Kentucky Derby horse race. I like to watch horse races.
My family life getting me down.
I am Chevrolet dealer. I like meeting different people.
dialogue: My kids asked my husband and I if they could have another dog. I am torn if we should or could add another German Shepard to the family.
Go with your gut. Have you ever had any other type of dog?
We have, But German Shepards are the best for farm life. And the kids love them. I think we might go look at some puppys later this week.
Okay. Sounds like you've got your mind made up. What makes German Shepherds especially suitable for life on a farm?
They are very good working dogs. Ours are trained to help us herd the sheep. We already have 2 females so if we do it another one I would want to go with a male. Then we can bred them later on.
Okay, Sounds reasonable. When did you start owning German Shepherds as pets?
I have had them all my life. My parents owed a farm also when I was little those dogs are so loyal. They saved my son from a snake the other day.
Wow. Sounds a lot more useful than my parrot. How is your son doing now?

He is fine. Snake never touched him. We heard Lady growl and next thing we know she had a dead snake in her month. We were afraid it might have bite her as she got a little sick after worse, But the vet said she is fine.
That's good to hear. Hopefully he'll help out with chores around the farm, If he's able.
He is a little young to be helping on the farm yet. He is only 2, But he does help me out. He likes to help get the eggs from the chickens.
Aww. What a good boy. Well, Maybe the other son, Then?

persona: I like to play board games. I have kids.
I like to go to concerts. I am a fan of walking dead.
My parents were culinary teachers.
I love documentaries. I watch vegetarian documentaries.
I will probably go to the beach on cinco de mayo.
I think we have too much stuff. I am grateful for what I have.
I am vegetarian. I like red pepper hummus.
I want to buy a house on the beach. I need to save money.
dialogue: Do you have any plans to go to the concert at the beach?
I really want to, But I don't think I can make it this time. How about you?
Nope. Some old friends from Germany are coming to visit. Do you have any vegetarian recipe recommendations that will impress them?
That sounds like fun. I'm sure they'll love being so close to the beach. My favorite vegetarian recipe is basil pesto. I can send it to you, If you want. It's really easy.
That sounds great, Thank you. Did your parents teach you the recipe?

No, It's a recipe that I found in an Italian cookbook. My kids really love it. The sauce keeps in the refrigerator for up to a week. So, I've got an easy dinner for a few nights, Which is handy with kids!
Ah i see. You and the kids should come down to the beach to visit me!
That would be wonderful. I'm sure they would love it. And I would love the easy parking. It's just so hard to find parking these days. And it's expensive to boot!
They would for sure. Do you know what beach you'd like to move close to in the future?

I don't really know. Do you have any suggestions? I need to make sure the school district is a good one. Either that or wait until the kids are off to college. But then there's paying for college to worry about. Sheesh!
To be honest I don't know much about beaches in terms of housing, I just moved to Miami beach on a whim! Ah yes, Kids are expensive aren't they!
Yes, They are, But they give back so much more. Miami sounds nice. Is it expensive to buy there?

persona: I love the Mean Girls movie.
I have a pug and a cat.
I am currently single. I like to party alot.
I am afraid of heights.

I volunteer for a group that has developed a housing project.  My group and I focus on helping the less fortunate in the community. My group and I take over abandoned buildings to turn them into public housing.
I like animals. I have a pug named Regina and a cat named George.
dialogue: I just got back from the waterslide project, I think it will be great, Even for those who may be afraid of heights, I'd love to walk you through it when you have a spare minute.
I'd be interested to hear about it, Do you want to meet up to discuss over coffee? I'm taking Regina to the vets this weekend but I'm free next.
Sounds good. We can meet at that coffee shop on Hill Street that we went to that one time. What is Regina going to the vet for?
The coffee is great there. Regina got into a fight with the cat and I think she hurt her leg running into the sofa, They get along most of the time! Do your dogs get along?

Janis and Cady get along great. The only time I saw them even get close to fighting is when I gave them one rope to play with and they fought over it. I ended up having to get two ropes so they each had their own.
Dogs can be hard work but I wouldn't change my pets for the world. Do you have any volunteer projects lined up?

Im looking at working for a new pet adoption project where we would match animals to good homes. Ive been really busy lately though with work and the water slide project. How is your housing project going?
I'd love to help with that. We're struggling with funding at the minute. Do you think a fund raising idea would be good?
I can donate some money to it and can totally help set up a fundraiser. I think thats a great idea.
I was thinking a bake sale. Are you good at baking?
I can make a few things. Nothing too fancy but I can do cookies and brownies.
I love brownies. I could make my famous strawberry cheesecake too.

persona: I like fish and chips. I like shrimp.
I am related to Christopher Columbus.  I like to watch documentaries.
I used to volunteer.
I paint.  I went to art school last year full-time.
I am traveling to Europe for a few weeks. I have European relatives.  I have been to Spain.

I am going to Spain, and will be getting around on the Eurorail. I enjoy sightseeing, train travel, and local cuisine. I am planning to eat one cheeseburger in every country. I haven't packed for my trip yet. I am backpacking on my trip.
I have never been to the USA. I live in British Columbia. I want to visit Florida.
I don't like hot weather. I like Fall season.
dialogue: I just had the most amazing cheeseburger! I have bacon and sauteed onions. Do you like bacon?
I don't mind bacon, I am a huge shrimp fan though, Even though it doesn't really go on a Burger. I do love me a good cheeseburger however.
I love cheeseburgers way too much, I wonder what they taste like outside of the US.
Honestly they are delicious. But I have not been to the USA so I cannot compare it to what they taste like in the USA. If I go to the USA my perspective of a good burger may completely change haha.
Who knows! My sister went to Germany last summer, She said the meat tasted better!
Most definitely it is very good! How often do you eat bacon? Do you put it on everything?
I do eat it quite frequently, I am trying to cut down a little on the junk food though so I can look good before my trip to the bahamas. Are you excited for your next trip?
I am! I will be off to Spain excited to take it all in, And chill on the beaches!
Oh yes, The beaches there look amazing. Don't forget to tell me what the cheeseburgers are like over there haha.
Haha I got you! I will even get some bacon and sauteed onions on my burger for you!
Please do! Do any of your relatives live in Spain?
No relatives that live in Spain, I do however have a few friends from there.

persona: I came south for the winter. I am from down south. I like travel to warm states like South Carolina, Florida, or Texas.  I like to grill southern food.
I am recently retired. I need company.
I love to grill southern food.
I have been to Oklahoma. I work part-time in landscaping cutting grass. I love to cut grass.
I like to gamble. I go to the casino every other month. I have played slot machines before. I love to visit Las Vegas. I visit casinos when I travel. I like to play table games at casinos.
dialogue: I have been looking at Cadillacs the last few days. I finally found one that I want to go test drive and hope they will take my Civic as trade in. Wish me luck!
I think they will. You always took good care of it and they will be happy to take it if you spend the money on a Cadillac.
I hope youre right. Hey have you ever gambled?ive been studying blackjack and want to try it at a casino sometime.

Yeah I go to the casinos usually every other month. I like playing the table games. I can give you a few pointers if you want. Blackjack isnt that hard to learn but you need to stay calm and remember the basics when you have money on the line.
Thatd be great thank you! We should plan a trip to Las Vegas sometime to go to a casino!
Yeah I would love to go there again. I like how warm it is there. I can show you some good casinos to go to.
I love warm weather as well, That sounds fun! I also love grilling out when its warm.
I like to make a lot of southern recipes when I grill out, What do you normally put on your grill?
I like to grill hotdogs and burgers mostly, I love pizza though as well.
Ever try making pizza on the grill?
Hm no i havent, A flatbread wouldnt be bad to try on the grill.
They make special pans for pizza you can put right on the grill. You should try it sometimes.

persona: I just finished studying. I am studying art in college and have a scholarship. I enjoy what I am learning at school and I like to help others.
I am a painter. I want to be an art teacher. I love painting. I want to be paid artist. I paint and sell my work.
I enjoy cooking especially paella.
I like to travel. I go to Europe twice a year. Christopher Columbus is a distant relative.
dialogue: After our last chat I pulled out my old paintbrushes and am going to dust off the old canvas!
That's incredible! I'm very happy for you. It's important to have creative outlets. Any thoughts on your first painting?
I might do a fitness painting to tie in for my love of the gym. Can't think of anything quite yet. Any suggestions?
I either like to paint thing from nature or from my personal life. You could always try painting a portrait of someone who's in good shape or of something you find inspiring around the gym.
That is pure genius. That way I can do my passion, But also gathering inspiration from painting someone who inspires me!
That's great! One of my early painting was of my distant relative Christopher Columbus. I could always send you some examples of paintings I have saved if you want help with getting started.
That would be amazing if you could! Would love to hear more about some of your experiences as a painter. What is your all time favorite painting?

Hmm... My favorite painting that I've created was a portrait of my late grandmother, And my favorite painting by a professional is probably Starry Starry Night. Do any pieces of art stand out in your mind?
Definitely Starry Starry Night, It is simply so iconic. Would love to get a replica to hang in my home.
You could always try painting your own imitation! It's good practice no matter what, And if it turns out well you can hang it up too.
Haha very true, As you said, It may not turn out the best. But practice is what makes perfect! Thank you for being so inspiring!
Of course! I think it's very valuable to take inspiration from your friends. You've recently encouraged me to try taking up the gym myself.

persona: I am 8 years old and in third grade. I like playing in the playground with friends. I like going to the park.
I go to disney world every year. Mickey Mouse is my favourite.
I like sorry and monopoly. I like playing board games. My favorite board game is Candyland.
I live in Ohio. I do not have a dog. My family use to have a German Shepard.
Candyland is the first game I played during our family movie and board game night. I have never played Trivial Pursuit before. I want to play a Disney version of Trivial Pursuit.

Frozen is my favourite movie. I have seen the movie Frozen at least 30 times.  I know the lyrics to all of the songs in Frozen.  My favorite character is Anna. I have seen Frozen 2 and I did not like it as much as the first one.
dialogue: I bought a Disney themed version of Trivial Pursuit! I would love to play it with you, Do you have any free time so we can schedule it?
I have to ask my mom but I think we could some time soon. I think I would be really good at that game though. Especially if they ask about Frozen.
Thats awesome i love Disney as well and in particular the frozen movies.
Ive seen it so many times I know almost every word of the movie. How are your dogs doing?
Thats awesome! My dogs are doing good, They love to go the park with me. Do you have pets?
