I met someone. I joined a skydiving club. I met him there, he asked me on a date to Harvey's. I had a great date.
I am a member of a gym. I plan to work out with my date.
I like to skydive. I am not afraid to skydive because it is safe.
dialogue: My husband called after we talked and said he's going to be working another two shifts. Ugh! More alone time.
That's got to be tough. Maybe you can do something with friends to take your mind off his absence.
That is true. I should call one of my good friends to see if they want to get together for a movie night. Thanks for the suggestion.
No problem. I spent a lot of time alone, So I'm used to used to finding activities to keep me occupied.
Maybe not any longer? How did your date go?
Great. We're going to the gym together tomorrow. Nothing like a little competitive working out to get the heart pumping.
That is great. Are you moving into a relationship? That must be so exciting.
I hate to put labels on it when it is so new. Take it one day at a time, Right?
That is true. I just am excited for you. Having been married its lost some of its shine. Especially when he is gone so often for work. But I know he does it to support us.
How long have you been together with your husband?
We have been married almost 5 years now. But have been together for about 8 years.
I hope I find someone who can put up with me for that long...

persona: I don't like hats.
I have three kids. I don't have any pets. I have a wife. I love my family.
Chocolate is my favorite ice cream flavor.

My wife and I love adventurous outings. We go out exploring almost every weekend. We go hiking. My wife and I love mountains. I went to Bell Rock Arizona. I have a sister who used to live in Sedona Arizona. I do not know the Kanab area.
I invested in doge coin just for fun. I own doge coin. I bought some doge coin when it first started going up and have made a few hundred dollars.
I invested in Dodge for fun.
dialogue: I have been thinking about what you said about Dodge. I think I might start investing in crypto. How did you start doing it.
Well, I just took a risk and the reward ended up being worth it! I'm sure you can understand that as an athlete?
I supposed so! I thought you would have invested in a chocolate ice cream company! Do you have any recommendations for amateur investors like myself?
You would be amazed at how many ice cream companies accept doge! Definitely do your own research and start of small. Eventually, You will start to find a natural instinct for investments.
That's some great advice! At first I was confused between Doge and Dodge. A perfect pet for you would be a chocolate Lab!
I do love labs! They are so smart and so loyal!
You definitely should! I imagine they would be perfect for hiking. Have you been doing any hiking recently?
Yes! We went a yesterday! I had to work, So we just picked a trail close to our house. Thankfully, We caught the sunset. What about you?
That's great to hear! I also went hiking but all alone! How romantic to catch the sunset with your wife!
It really was! Are you looking forward to your trip to South Utah this weekend?
I certainly am! I especially look forward to the wave! Have you noticed? It looks like a mixture of vanilla and chocolate ice cream.
I haven't noticed that! It sounds beautiful! You will have to show me pictures when you return!

persona: I live in Ohio. I work at a supermarket.
My favorite food is pizza with black olives.
My favorite band is Who. I sometimes love Pink Floyd.
I am going into education.  want to be a teacher.
I enjoy running.
I do not play any instruments.
I love cats. I have multiple cats. I do not live with another person.
dialogue: I just saw a drive-by in my ghetto! They shot up the pizza place I like going to.
Oh my goodness! I hope you weren't very close by!
I'm ok, I just hope no one else got seriously hurt. I'm watching the news now for updates.
I'm sorry you have to live in such a tough neighborhood. Where are you planning to go for college?

Anywhere outside of the ghetto. With my grades, I'm hoping I get a decent scholarship and can finally move far away from here. Do you have any suggestions? Are there any good schools near your neighborhood?
I live near Kent. St. Far enough from Cleveland that it's pretty nice. Close enough that you can still go to the big city if you choose.
That sounds nice! What is your favorite thing to do in the big city?
Go the the rock and roll hall of fame! or occasionally catch an Indians game.
I'm not really a sports person, Though I'll play volleyball every now and then for fun. What type of team are the Indians?
They're a baseball team. Since you love music, Though, The Rock and Roll hall of fame I'm sure you'd enjoy. Wasn't Pink Floyd inducted?
My aunt would be embarrassed of me. Her favorite sport is baseball, Though she is a hardcore cubs fan. Yeah, They were inducted back in 1996! Almost 10 years before I was born.
Your aunt's team broke our hearts! How is your own guitar playing coming along?

persona: I like taking baths.
I like to play Chess. I am preparing for a National Chess Tournament.
My favorite band is Mumford and Sons.

I am self-conscious about my weight. I am older than 20. I prefer cooking for myself. I love Japanese recipes. I used to have an alcohol problem. I like high protein foods. I like to eat meat.  I eat healthy to stay sharp.
I am going to a National Chess tournament in San Francisco. I have never been to San Francisco. I am practicing all day every day to prepare.
Playing chess online helps me relax. My dad wanted to teach me chess strategy at an early age and we always played after dinner.
I have heard about Woodstock.
dialogue: I bought the ingredients you told me about and made myself Ramen.
Did it turn out well?
Well, You can't really go wrong with Ramen... But I think I may have gone wrong with Ramen. I think I need some more practice. Any suggestions?
Getting a Ramen cooker helps. Keeps the noodles at the ideal amount of doneness.

Oh, That is a better suggestion than I was expecting! I thought you were going to suggest going back to instant ramen for a little while. I'll definitely buy a Ramen cooker instead. Is there a certain brand you recommend, Or the best store to purchase one at?
I bought mine on Amazon. I like the one that I have. It's a Suzuki. But compare prices and features, And I'm sure you'll find one that will suit your needs.
I wouldn't know what features are most important with cooking. I'll definitely check out the Suzuki one on Amazon. And I can get it here in two days so that's a plus! Thanks!
You are welcome! All this talk about Ramen is making me hungry. I've been playing so much chess that I forget to eat sometimes.
Ahh, What food are you craving? Meat and fish would be my guess. The more we talk about food the hungrier I get as well.
Yes, Definitely some meat. If I don't eat enough meat I can't think straight. Not a good thing in a chess tournament. And some ramen of course!
Yes, Yes, Rub it in that you can cook decent Ramen and I can't! Just kidding, I'll get there, Especially with your expert advice. How many people are competing in the chess tournament?
64 regional champions. It'll be a 4 day event. Lots of pressure.

persona: I have kids and three dogs.
I own a dog walking business.
My father was a salesman.
I am married to multiple women. One of my wives is a groomer.
I don't like Cuba.
I did pretty well on tests when I was in school. I'm not currently in school. I had two roommates in college.
In college I majored in illustration with a minor in Psychology.
I have a talent for drawing. I have fun drawing dogs.
I am busy. I do not get paid for my drawings. I can make a portrait from a picture.
dialogue: I emailed you the picture you can use for the family portrait.
That's great! It might take a while for it to be done. Details and such. I was just wondering what snacks I could give the dogs I walk that are healthy. I worry that kibble isn't enough.
Have you tried the new dehydrated kibble they been advertising on Facebook?
I haven't seen any ads, So no. What's in it and what brand? Are there certain types some breeds need?
It's called Unkibble and it looks like dehydrated meat and veggies. I think it's for all breeds. Do you know when the family portrait will be ready?

Probably a week or two. No more than a month. I like to make sure the details and shading are perfect. I also like to do touch ups right before sending to receiver. I try to give the best quality I can. This dehydrated dog food, Do you have to wet it or anything?
The ads just shows the influencers pour the food in the dish. Worth a look, If not we use Royal Canin, Our corgi likes it.

I'll have to give it a try sometime. I don't like feeding my dogs just kibble. I've been giving them soft canned food, But I feel like that isn't very healthy for them either. I've seen the fridges in the pet section in Walmart with the meat in it and thought about getting it. I haven't yet, Though.
I've noticed those fridges in the pet section but I have never tried it. if you try either one, Let me know your opinon.

I for sure will! Do you know how to get a dog to quick shaking when they see food other than kibble? I have a small one and she won't stop. Not even after she gets food and tell her no more. I don't know why.
I don't know nor have any guesses. My dog is pretty chill, Have you talked to the vet about it?

I haven't. It's not a super terrible thing and she doesn't get sick from it or anything. I just don't understand why she still does it after eating. It takes her a few minutes to calm down, Too. She's spoiled. I just don't like when she shivers and begs all the time.

persona: I do not like people. I like animals. I have lots of cats. I like bird watching with my cats. I am an animal activist.
I hate the holidays because they make me depressed.
I'm part of PETA and really care for their cause.
i have compassion for animals at the humane shelter.
I love wine. Cabernet Sauvignon is my favorite wine. I only drink white wine at dinner with fish and chicken dishes.

I like my coffee sweet and smooth. I only drink one cup of coffee a day in the morning. Caffeine keeps me awake. I tried chewing tobacco once and didnt like it. I've had Chinese coffee. I drink a caffeine free Asian Tea. I drink herbal tea because it keeps me active and calm.
dialogue: My youngest son just brought home a stray kitten. I don't think we'll keep it but we are going to foster it.
That's terrific. Are you in touch with an agency to help alert others that the kitten is available?
I'm not completely sure. We might keep it though, Its orange tabby and I have a thing. Do you have any animals?
I have lots of cats, I really love them, They give me as much as I give them. Having a pet is a great way to teach your sons responsibility. Who will be in charge of the new kitten?
I will be, I'm just nervous it will tear up my furniture. Have you ever had a cat declawed?
I'm not a fan of declawing cats, But there is a product on the market you can apply to the kitten's claws so it will be unable to claw the furniture.
Really? Is it like a gel or a covering?

It's like a sleeve that you slip on over their nails. It covers the nails so they aren't sharp enough to damage you or your furniture. After awhile most cats stop clawing and you don't have to apply anymore.
I never knew that, I think your convinving me to keep her. She's so cute and crazy. She'll run around the house doing laps as fast as she can and then just fall asleep.
They are so adorable at that age! Have you determined if she is litter trained yet?
Oh yeah! Thats the best part... I was nervous about that since she was always an outside cat but as soon as I put the litter box down she ran into it and went.
That's one of the great things about cats, They are clean by nature and take quickly to a litter box. Have you set up her first vet appointment?

persona: I like coffee and wine.
I have a mini van.
I have five boys. My last son has just gone to college.
I won my last game. my next game is next Tuesday, depending on the weather. I coach a kids team.
I leave work early in order to coach. I enjoy coaching the kids. I have coached kids for 5 years. I was formerly a volunteer coach. I now get paid to coach. I coach Ice Hockey.
dialogue: I'm terrible at fishing, But I just received good news regarding my treatment!
I'm not the best at fishing, Either. I get really mad when a turtle snaps my line. Haha. What's the good news?
I am officially cancer free! It has come back before, But I'm really hoping it's gone for good this time!
That's great news!! So you're practically in remission. What kind of job are you wanting that involves working with kids?

I don't know. I always wanted my own kids. I'm not sure it would be a good idea to adopt since I'm on my own, And it's always possible the cancer would return, But I was thinking of maybe becoming a foster parent. That way I could at least help kids in need and has some experience being a parental figure and mentor. Maybe a volunteer for low-income families and kids in need as well.

You can do a big brother program. I don't know if it's just boys, But they give kids an older sibling to spend time with and help them with stuff. Tutoring would also help many kids! I think you would be a great foster parent, But practice with children would probably prepare you and look better for the paperwork. I heard the process is tedious, Though.

The process is pretty long. It takes a while to be certified before you can even have a child placed with you. Normally the process is 6 months to a year and you undergo training. I definitely would be interested in a big brother program in the meanwhile. Have you ever been a part of that?
I haven't. There are many schools in bigger cities that participate in it, Though. I wish they would do stuff like that in the smaller cities. Most people are poorer in smaller cities.
Maybe you should start a program. I bet kids in the smaller city would benefit just as much from a program like that.

That's a good idea. I'm sure they would benefit quite a bit. I had a friend who had a "big brother" and it was an officer who would take her out to lunch and everything. It's someone who's there to help with school stuff and just be there. I think it's once a week they meet up. Maybe, More than that.
That's awesome. Did your friend think that had a big influence on their life?

I think she enjoyed just having someone there with experience. She was the older sister, So she didn't have anyone as an older sibling. I think she it did in a way. Sometimes, Her "big sister" would talk about what she did that day and experiences she had been through.

persona: I'm currently pregnant with triplets. I'm married and my husband has a child. I have one step child.
I'm new to this country. I'm from China.
I'm a teacher in my neighborhood.
I enjoy American Jazz. I write songs. I do not record in studios. I like blues music.
dialogue: I just finished recording a new song, Can I send it to you and you can let me know what you think?
That sounds fun! You said you have children? Were they with your girlfriend who left you?
No, They are from my ex-wife, Who I divorced 2 years before meeting my new girlfriend. She's much more tolerant in letting me do my music thing at home without nagging me.
That's good. Sounds like you're happier than you were before. Why did you two have the lawyer? Did something terrible happen?

I worked in construction previously, And I got hurt on the job and decided to sue the company, So I needed a lawyer. I brought him to the house and I guess she had eyes for him. I did get a nice settlement, Though, And now I get to record music on my guitar, Bass, And drums so it worked out okay.

You can live on the settlement? It sucks that happened to you, But at least a couple of good things cam out of it. You're with someone who makes you happier than you were and plenty of money to make you comfortable! How did you get hurt?
Luckily, My house was already paid for, And I didn't lose it in the divorce. I got hurt falling off of scaffolding while working on a building.
Dang! You said you had triplets. What was the hardest part about it? I'm about to have triplets myself and if I survive the birth I wanna know what to look forward to.

My wife has custody of the kids, So she gets them during the week and they visit me on the weekends. I guess the hardest part is seeing how the divorce affects them. Also, They are pre-teens now and starting to rebel and act out a bit. Be glad you have your husband to help out when your triplets are born.
Does that mean you two weren't together when she had them? Who had custody then if so? Yeah, My husband has some experience from him having a child himself.
No, We were together when we had our three kids. What's your step-child's name, By the way? Have you thought of names for the triplets yet?

I'm having a girl and two boys. Octavia, Azazel, And Dean. My step daughter's name is Ella. She's an amazing little girl. She's five years old and I love her so much!! Have you thought about having any other children?

persona: I'm more into music than books. I like Britney Spears.
I'm focused on my diet. I don't make tea. I am not fond of tea. I drink tea. Chamomile makes me sick, as do most teas.
I own a tanning bed.
I have trouble sleeping.
I am on a diet. I prefer coffee over tea. I do not eat meat.
dialogue: I started eating meat again, I feel better than ever!
Wow! What made you decide to start eating it again?
Well, I went to the doctor a few days ago because I've been feeling kind of light-headed, And she said I was probably iron deficient and to add some red meat. So I did.
Oh interesting. I usually just go with lentils. They're my favourite and are packed with iron. Do you think you'll keep eating it or do you want to go back to not eating meat?
I'm not sure yet. I eat a lot of spinach too so I figured that would be good enough, But the doc said I probably needed meat so I went for some steak. With tea of course, Haha.

Sounds like that doctor just doesn't like the idea of a vegetarian/ vegan diet! Haha. There's so many things you can have besides meat like lentils, Spinach, Nuts, Seeds, Beans. If that's what you want to eat though I guess it's your choice! What kind of tea did you drink?
Orange spice. I usually only have it in the mornings since coffee's not my thing but I just decided to have some at dinner time. Yeah, My doc is fairly open about being skeptical aboutveg-only diets.
Orange spice tea and steak. Hmm sounds like an awful combination haha! Did it actually go well together?
Haha! It actually wasn't bad. I figure if some people pair wine with meat, I can pair tea with steak. I played some nice Mozart in the background as I ate. The dog looked at me like I was crazy, Lol.
Haha!! You should create a blog about this now that you're eating meat again! Meats that pair well with tea! (The dog probably could sense how weird tea and steak was!).
I think maybe he just wanted a bite of steak but you never know, Huh?
Haha yeah. That's probably true. So what's the next meat and tea combination going to be?

persona: I do not like going outside.
I like the colors red and silver. I have a house that is decorated in red and silver.
I was a game designer who helped to make starcraft.
I know how to build robots.
I am a streamer. I have an active twitch channel. I have not played pokemon snap. I play videogames. I enjoy watching others play videogames.
I know about interior design.
dialogue: I downloaded the Twitch app, I'm starting to enjoy it. You're right, It depends on what game you watch.
I'm glad you're enjoying it. What did you end up finding to watch?
People playing scary games. It's funny to watch them jump. Haha. What games do you record yourself playing?
Mainly starcraft because I helped make it, But I haven't been streaming lately. I've been trying to redesign my living room and that's taken up a lot of time.

My boyfriend and I have two different tastes when it comes decor. We're thinking about getting a two bedroom, So we have our own rooms. He gets to decorate his the way he wants and the same for me. I think he gets annoyed when I'm up playing games in our room while he's trying to sleep. What kind of theme are you making it?

Haha! I guess some people can't sleep through that. I would fall asleep to someone gaming no problem. Its so relaxing to watch. I haven't quite settled on a theme yet which is what is taking up so much time! I keep going through so many ideas and when I'm done designing it this time I dont want to do it again haha. Got any input for me? What should I do with it?

Well, First off, Why are you redecorating it? Too much red and silver or not enough? I think cute little lights that change color would be awesome. Maybe a projector to put on the wall, But you'll need a sheet or keep a spot white. Nice little futon, So it can turn into a bed if you wanna lay down or you have guests. A recliner, Maybe. I like Charcoal Grey as a color for interior places, But that's just me.

I was thinking about the projector idea. It would be such a space saver. I think maybe I'll stick with that aspect and go with a white box painted in the center of the wall and then maybe silver outside of that to accent the wall. I don't think theres such a thing as too much silver and red- but my friends disagree! I'm trying to tone it down a bit so people will enjoy it when they come to visit. Maybe the charcoal grey and silver would go well together thanks for the idea.

No problem!! I think that would be a great touch. I think you could keep the red and silver... Just add the grey to it. That sounds a great idea! Another room saver is a wall mount for any TVs. I hate having a bulky entertainment center. Liquid gets trapped under them if anything spills. I guess one on wheels would be a tad better.

Yeah those bulky entertainment centers are so outdated. I mean some spaces are big enough you can pull it off, But they're such dust traps and awful to look at while you're trying to relax and watch tv. Do you have any new photographs you've taken? I've been thinking about adding some nature art to the walls to make it more inviting!

I haven't been really taking any photographs. Between grading papers, Writing lesson plans, Packing our stuff, And finding a place... I've been stuck indoors for quite some time. I do need to make a day out of doing some photography. It's relaxing. What kind of robots have you built?

That's unfortunate. My mom was a teacher so I know how intense those times can be. I can't imagine adding a move into the mix you must be so stressed out. I've been working on one that can bring me a drink from the fridge. He's been sitting there for about a month waiting on parts. Before that I was just doing basic ones that I could program to grab things or move back in forth in patterns. They were my build up to Fernando. (That's the new robots name) I think once he's done he's going to be a hilarious edition to my stream.

persona: I have cats. I am an animal activist. I have dogs. My oldest pet is almost 20 years old. I am familiar with the animal shelter.
I hate pumpkins. I hate trees. I do not like holidays.
I want a moon pie.
I watched the movie Napoleon Dynamite.
I try to watch baseball but it is too slow for me. I'd rather watch football. I like hiking.
I am getting older and it is hard to stay active.
dialogue: My coworker is considering adopting a pet from the shelter.
Thats awesome It's always better to get a pet from a rescue rather than a breeder.

They're thinking about getting a dog but aren't sure what would work best for them. They have a wife and small child. Do you think the animal shelter will help them pick out a good dog for their needs?

They all should go to sthe shelter together to make sure the dog is OK with everyone. PLus a lot of it is also training. People think you get a dog and your done, But there is work you need to put in.
Did all of your pets get along with each other right away when they were brought into the group?
They needed time to get along, It took a while to get them to get used to eachother.
I'm pretty sure this coworker doesn't have any pets yet so that shouldn't be an issue. Actually, That's not true: they have a goldfish. That's why they're getting a dog instead of a cat.
Yea cats love to hunt so a fish keeps them pretty occupied trying to hunt it as it swims around.
We have an aquarium at the insurance office and I love watching the fish swim around. Sometimes I have to remind myself to go back to work because I can get so lost in their motion.

persona: I have a chronic fear of heights.
I am a party animal. I like to stay home.
I watched a movie called mean girls.
I have cats and dogs. I spend a lot of time with each and put them in time out when they don't behave. I have 3 dogs: a lab, pitbull and a chihuahua.
I like cats and dogs equally. All my pets are rescues. I love calico cats.
I wish I had a bigger house to adopt more animals.
dialogue: My doctor approved me for a service dog but there is a pretty long waiting list.
Did they give you an estimate of how long/.
No time estimate, But there are 16 people ahead of me and the puppy academy is low on dogs this time of year. My guess is at least 7 months.
Oh ok, That isnt too bad. Are you prepared for your service dog? Have you bought everything needed?

I am not prepared yet. Once I get matched we will have some training sessions together. How cool is that?! I may bring my belongings and move into the academy discreetly as someone has bulldozed my house.
Oh wow, Why was your house bulldozed?
My neighbor's kid stole his mom's voodoo doll of me. He was playing in the backyard with it and his toy trucks and you know how that goes...
Oh he sounds like a trouble maker! Do you have kids?

No, I am too worried that might cat might get hungry and, Well, You know how that goes. I forgot to mention that the reason there is such a waitlist is that I am following your advice. I will have a pit bull friend soon(ish)!.

persona: I like being indoors.
My ex left me. I am 46.
I live in California. I was born in Compton, California. When I was a child my family lived in constant fear.
I went to College in Georgia.
I have a recording studio. I work in the recording industry.
I have been married for 12 years.
dialogue: I took my kids to a baseball game last weekend, It was super fun!
Nice, Where were your guys seats at?
We sat right behind home plate, We had great seats for their first game. Next time, I want to sit in the outfield to see if we can catch a home run ball!

That's awesome, Sitting behind home is a really unique spot that has constant action, But outfield has its advantages too. Since you were right behind the plate, Any chance you might have ended up on television?
It is definitely possible, But I don't have anyone that I can ask. I did catch us a few times up on the big screen. Do you ever go to baseball games?

I've been to a few Angels games over the years, I wish I could have gone as a kid though. Seems like there's so much fun stuff that's oriented towards kids nowadays. It's been a while since the last time I've gone though, I've just been too busy with the studio.
How are things going with the recording studio?
Man it's been amazing! I've had so many wonderful artists contact me over the past couple months that I've been struggling to manage everything! It's so much fun too.
That is awesome! I'd love to visit sometime while you are doing a recording session. What type of music is your favorite to record?

Yeah totally, You can drop by any time your in the area and I don't have a client. Just shoot me a text. And my favorite is definitely hip-hop with a deep, Steady beat. It sound so crisp in the studio.
That is so great that you can find so much happiness in your job. Is this something you always knew you wanted to do?
Not always, But now that I'm in the business I couldn't imagine doing anything else! How's your career been going?

persona: I might go to business school next year. I applied to a school. I earned a finance degree at Yale in 2011.
I work for a large multinational bank. I'd like to become a wealthy banker. Both of my parents are wealthy bankers. I never had to pay for college since my parents are so wealthy.
My name is Josie. I'm from Manhattan. I'm interested in moving out.
I love thai food and pizza. I like cookies. I like live music.
I do not have a masters degree.
dialogue: What is your favorite kind of cookie? My roommate sometimes makes snickerdoodles. They are pretty good.
I love pecan chocolate chip. I could eat 12 boxes of those at once!
That's a lot of cookies! Maybe we should get a big group of us together and bake different kinds of cookies and stuff.
That would be awesome. I was trying to think.. I don't know if I've had a snickerdoodle before. Whats in them?
I'm not really sure to be honest.. I know it's like a sugar cookie but with cinnamon and nutmeg maybe? I'm not much of a baker, But I sure love to eat!

Haha! That sounds delicious. I didn't know if it was one of those cookies that people try to hide healthy things in like berries or fruit. That's not my style cookie at all! I love baking so when we get together I'll make sure you don't leave the egg shells in the batter!
Sounds good to me! I just need to find a night when I'm not working. Being a bartender in New York is a busy life!

No doubt! I'm trying to do whatever I can for fun now in case I get into school next year. Doing my masters, I will feel that same full on grind like you're doing now. Got any good bartending stories?

Most of my stories are pretty run of the mill. I occasionally meet a celebrity or somewhat famous person but mostly it's serving drinks, Cleaning up drunk messes, And trying to look like I'm listening to sob stories. The usual!
Haha. Who's the most famous person you met/ were they how you expected them to be?

Well I'm not allowed to name names of course because of privacy but let's just say that Pirates of the Caribbean actors sometimes venture in. Speaking of famous rich people.. You must get some at the bank?

Lolll I didn't know privacy extended to bars. You're a loyal server! I don't think I've ever dealt with anyone famous at the bank actually. Not anyone high key famous anyways. Just people with a lot of money or people who want to borrow a lot of money! Haha!

persona: I like country music.
I work with my mom on a farm.
I used to be an electrician. I wish I was a model. I'm too old to be a model. I like modeling and photoshoots. I get up early everyday and I'm in good shape. I am pretty. I am poor.
I have been to Yosemite.
dialogue: Who's your favorite country singer?
I likeDolly Parton, Even if it is a little kitschy. And you?
Dolly's ok. I'm not a big country fan, But if I had to choose I'd say Garth Brooks.
It is quite popular, I like him, But find him a little to bland. What type of music do you like?
I prefer metal and sometimes a little jazz, Depending on my mood.
And with you broken arm, You mood must be quite low these day... What do you do make you happy with your broken arm?
It really is. Having a broken arm has slowed me down a lot. But it has given me time to plan my next trip out to California.
California is beautiful, Do you plan to go to Yosemite?
Yes, That's the trip I'm planning now. Since you've been there do you have any suggestions for things I should do or see?
It depends on when you want to go, Some roads are closed because of snow, Even in May.
I'm going to wait until my arm is healed up. I really want to be able to be active without a broken arm slowing me down. So sometime later in the year, Maybe July. Any good tips for then?
Plan ahead, And visit early in the day, The park is quite popular and there are traffic jams between 9 AM and 5 PM.

persona: I have a cow named Bessie.
I drive a large pickup truck.
I work at my mom and dad's farm. I'm adventurous. I live across from a farm. I have a fence on my property.

Country is my favorite music. I live on a farm and have 50 cows. One of my cows is named Bessie. I play country music while I milk them. I find country music makes it easier to milk cows. I like Garth Brooks and Carrie Underwood.
I like Nascar.
dialogue: I found a new country band you might like.
Oh yeah, Who is it? I'm always looking for new music to listen to while I milk the cows!
Mitchell Tenpenny. His music is really good and I love listening to it.
I'll have to look him up. Thanks! Does he sound like anyone I would have heard of?
To me he kind of sounds like Blake Shelton but has a really new sound.
Ok, Yeah, I like Blake Shelton. Do you ever watch The Voice? He's hilarious on there. It's one of my favorite shows.
I do watch it and I too love the show. I have been watching that and American Idol for the longest time. I really like him and Gwens relationship.

Yes, I never would have picked the two of them to go together, But they really seem to make it work. I don't watch American Idol much, For some reason it never really clicked for me. I really like the blind auditions on The Voice, It's great to see people given a chance completely based off their voice talent.
Yes, I do like that about the show as well. A guy I went to school with was on the show but I don't think he made it to the live shows.
That's really cool.... An almost claim to fame! I don't know anyone famous or almost famous.
Yeah it is. He has made it pretty far in his career and continues to play for bars and events.
Have you ever been to see him perform? I guess he must be pretty good.

persona: My name is Nancy.
I'm in school. I am the youngest in my family and spoiled. I have 4 siblings.
I have a two year old pug named peaches. My dog is sick right now and is unhappy, but is getting better.
I visited a bee farm. I am very interested in bees. I am very curious about bees.
I practice yoga. I also play the piano and read fiction novels.
I love honey. I buy locally sourced honey from the farmer's market.
dialogue: Would you like to get a jar of honey? The bees I rescued a while back ended up producing a lot of it, And I have much more than I can store. I have been giving it away to friends and family in the past two days, And I still have some left over.
I would love some. Natural honey isn't pasteurized is it?

No, It's right from my hive. It's really excellent, Too. Some of the best I've gotten from them. But I just can't eat it all by myself and you know my wife won't have any! Can't risk the model figure.
I've heard natural honey is really good at protecting people from allergies. Have you heard this too?
Oh definitely! Locally sourced honey is one of the best natural allergy fighters out there. The fact that it's super tasty doesn't hurt either.
Maybe you can convince your wife to eat some for the allergy benefits!!!.
Yeah, She's pretty lucky in that area -- no real allergies. Must be her Italian blood. The honey definitely helps with my hay fever.
I buy some at the local store, But I'll bet yours is much better. Maybe you can livestream your been operation sometime so I can see how it operates.
Sure, I could do that! I'm supposed to go tomorrow morning to rescue a hive that set up shop in this lady's yard. She's not too happy about it but I'm thrilled to get more bees!
How hard is it to rescue a hive?

As long as you know what you're doing, It's not too hard, But it can definitely be time consuming. It kind of depends on the circumstances. The last one I rescued had gotten into the walls of the house so there was a lot of work that had to be done there.
I can imagine. I bet you have a lot of interesting stories.

persona: My husband is a doctor.
I play tennis.
I live in a three-story house. My husband pays all of the house bills.
I like natural healing.
I have researched natural healing methods.
I am taking a break from tennis. I am busy training my pet dog. I have taught my dog sit, stay, and heel.I learned how to train dog from the show Dog Whisperer with Cesar Milan.
My dog doesn't ignore toys. I take my dog to the dog park.
dialogue: I want to go to the dog park, Do you want to join me?
Yes I would love to! Any tips on getting Rowdy to stop tugging when he's on the leash?
First off, We need to understand if there's anything making Rowdy nervous. Has he had any incidents recently when you went for walks?

Not really. He sees other dogs and gets excited, But other than that no. He's always tugging. It doesn't matter if there's another human or animal in sight. We have to stop, Because he'll tug at the end of the leash and choke himself. I try to keep up, But I want him to just calm down and walk beside me.
That's frustrating. I think we'll have to work on ways to gently show Rowdy that you're in charge. Do you have any treats to reward good behavior?
I sure do! I have some that look like little steaks and some that look like strips of jerky. He shivers a lot when he sees any other food than kibble. Does your dog do this?
Luna is notorious for food discrimination! I have to be super careful with giving her treats because she keeps begging and begging. It seems like we both have a lot of work to do to train our dogs.

My dog does the same thing!! Anytime I'm cooking he'll hop onto the back of the couch just so he can look on the counter to see what I have and what I'm doing. When I'm eating he'll stare at me and be very close. Afterwards, He's always sniffing on the floor. For like a good ten minutes. I don't know how to get him to stop.
Haha if only we could get Cesar to help us out! I'm sure both our dogs would be trained in no time.

Yes!! We all know why they call it The Dog Whisperer. How does he know so much about them? I get so frustrated sometimes. I can spend forty minutes trying to get my dog to lay down and it doesn't work. It seems like five minutes with the dog and it's well behaved. Haha. He's got a lot of patience. Very courageous for training aggressive dogs, Too!!.
It must be some deal with the devil! Nobody can be that naturally gifted. Right...? Agh we'll both have to work hard to get these dogs in shape.

And keep our souls doing it!! Haha. I always get freaked when there are aggressive dogs for no reason. Why would you want your dog to bite someone for no reason. Why would you want to keep a dog that you can't control? I don't understand that.

persona: I survived cancer. I am a healthy eater, which I think helped me overcome cancer.
I love to run. I am preparing for a marathon. I don't like running when its hot.
I just got a new job as a life coach. I love my work as a life coach.
I use a mantra to help me run marathons. My mantra when running is "Not dead, can't quit".
I want to take a vacation to some place cool.
I work as a life coach. I would like to go to Maine or the Pacific Northwest. I love seafood.
I rarely eat junk food, but I love it.
I love pizza, especially with cauliflower crust.
I am planning on getting a membership to a local health club. I did not live on campus in the past.
dialogue: I ended up getting a cauliflower pizza from a place on campus that specializes in it. It tastes alright, Not as good as a regular pizza, But still pretty good. I think I wouldn't mind getting another one if I get the chance to do so.
Wow that sounds really good and healthy. What is your favorite kind of pizza to eat? Mine is broccoli.
Wow, You are so healthy! I love a good pepperoni pizza but I am trying to limit my meat intake, So I have been trying spinach and peppers on my pizza, It's pretty good.
Those are some very healthy options. What is your favorite place to eat on Campus?

There is this really good pizza place called Pop's Pizza, I don't think they area franchise though. I will have to come back to campus even after I graduate just to get the pizza! Do you normally order your cauliflower crust pizza or do you make it at home?
When I eat pizza, I usually order it on my cheat day but I try to stick with healthy options. W.
Where do you normally order from? Maybe there is a place for me to keep in mind once I leave school. What kind of meals do you eat on a typical day?
I usually order from a place near me called Tony's. I usually prepare carefully planned meals. My favorite is salmon and rice.

That sounds delicious! Do you think you could give me a recipe? I am a terrible cook and I know I am going to need to learn some basic skills once I am out on my own so I am not ordering takeout every day.
Of course, And my meals are all super simple and healthy. How have your preparations for the 5K been going?
They have been going well! I have been out running with my roommate every day this week. I am really looking forward to it, Hopefully I will be able to run a marathon like you one day.
It takes a lot of hardworking and dedication to run a marathon. Do you listen to music while you run?

persona: I am in the sky. I have powers.
I am 5.
I love cookies & cream and rocky road ice cream, and anything with fudge on top.
I want to plan fun for the future.
I live with my family.
I love parks and play grounds. I am good with kids.
I can fly, and I use my powers daily. I have not met another person that can fly.
dialogue: I told my kids about you, And they would love to meet you when they get a chance. We should all get together this weekend at the park, You can fly there around midday if you are available.
Yes that would be so much fun, Will you be bringing any sweets for us to eat?
Absolutely. I love making different sweets for people I know. I am going to keep a surprise though for everyone.
Can mine be ice cream please? You can keep the ones for your kids a secret!
What kind of ice cream would you like? I will keep the kids a scret because I am making theirs with little prized in them.
Well I'd really love cookies and cream with a healthy portion of fudge on the top. Would that be too much to ask for?
No, I will make it for you. How are you going to fly in?
I'm going to fly in through the air! Haven't you ever seen someone fly before? The only place you can fly is in the air!
I know in the air. Sometimes people fly in their cars or on a broom. My child like to fly on his little truck.
Oh, Well that makes sense now! But I don't need anything else to fly, It will just be me and my red cape!
Cool, They will like that. I think it is really need to see the different ways that people are able to fly. Some of them are so creative.
What was the most unusual way that you've seen someone fly? I don't think I've ever met anyone else who flew!

persona: I hate the color orange.
I work at a bookshop. I like to read books about dogs.
I major in Chemistry.
When it's quiet I usually read some of the dog books or brush up on the sciences. I read "Dog Years: A memoir".
I have two copies of threc book in stock.
I have a dog, she's a labradodle named Leah.
dialogue: Oh, My leg still borthered me.
I can imagine. How long has it been since you broke it? I'm sure it will take time to fully heal.
It has been about a year, But it still bothers me to ride.
Oh I didnt realize it's been that long! Are you still on medication? Do you do physical therapy?
I do physical therapy but I still have to be careful because it hurts in my knee and bottom portion of my leg when I ride.
That's terrible. Well, Hopefully it gets better soon. I know how much you love riding. Have you raced at all then, Or just riding for fun.
Just for fun but I have been practicing some for my races as well.

That's good. I'm sure you need to keep your skills up. Riding for fun and for racing probably takes two different mindsets and skills. I hope it all works out for you. How's the restaurant going? Still busy?
Yes it does for sure. It is going really good and I have been really busy creating new recipes.
Oh, What's your most recent new recipe? I'd love to try some new ones!
It is a Pithivier which is pastry dough and it is filled with baked salmon anddill.
Oh I love salmon. I've never tried cooking it on my own though. I just order it at restaurants as a treat for myself.

persona: My name is Dirk. I do not have children. I live in the US.
I have not read any books lately.
I love movies, my favorite is Forrest Gump. I like Star Wars. I like books. I have been to busy to watch movies recently. I like to read to help me fall asleep.
I have a girlfriend. We are thinking about having a baby.
I listen to audiobooks.
I am an elementary school teacher. I love working with children.
dialogue: I got off the phone from my doctor an hour ago, And they said I might be able to have an ultrasound next week to determine the gender of my child. I have it already planned, So I will tell you more about it when it is over.
That's exciting. Are you hoping for a boy or girl?
Either would be just fine by me! Boys are simpler, Though.
Maybe you can give me all the ups and downs before we decide to have a child!
I'll keep you up to date. I intend to keep a journal. My mom kept one for me after I was born, All the way through high school.
That is really neat. Those words will be cherished forever. Have you noticed any strange cravings while you have been pregnant?
Heh, Yeah, But not pickles and ice cream so much, As Vienna sausage and chocolate. I know, I know... I'm weird!
That does sound gross, But if that's what you want... That's what you want lol.
And that's what I want... Badly. Paul thinks I'm completely nuts. He likes chocolate too, But the combination of the two makes him retch.
That's hilarious! How many weeks do you have left?
Twelve... Thirteen... I've lost count. I can't wait for the baby to be born, So I can start working on losing some of this extra weight. And to get this burden off my lower back!
You will feel much better, But enjoy the process and don't wish it over too quickly.

persona: I like animals. I have a dog and a cat.
I like to party and watch movies. My favorite movies are comedies. Mean Girl is my favorite movie. I like 21 Jump street an Oceans 8.
I volunteer at the food bank.
I'm scared of heights. I'm trying to get over my fear of heights. I like rollercoasters.
I love pasta. I'm opening a pasta restaurant.
I'm allergic to apples, pears and pineapples.
I am interested in watching Nomadland. I like to check out Rottentomatoes reviews. Comedies are my favorite kind of movies. I like to laugh.
dialogue: I read a couple of reviews for Nomadland a while ago, And I think I would enjoy seeing it. We should get tickets to see it this Saturday, At the mall theater like you suggested.
That sounds good to me! Do you prefer morning or afternoon?
I am a morning person, So meeting up in the morning would work great for me.
Ok! How about 9? We can get some breakfast and then get tickets for the 11 oclock showing?
9 will work for me. Do you know of any good breakfast places with really good food that we could go to?
There is a pancake house close to the theater or if you prefer something quick we can do a drive thru.
Oh pancakes are awesome and since it is close to the theater that will be really easy to get too.
Not gonna lie, Pancakes are one of my favorite breakfast foods so I'm good with that!
Mine as well. I am a sucker for a good pancake or waffle for that matter. Have you ever had a waffle with an over easy egg on top of it?
I haven't! I may have to try that Saturday while we're out.
Yes, It is so good to break the yolk and have it on the waffle with the butter and syrup. Sometimes I have sausage or bacon on it as well.
That sounds really tasty! I would have never thought to try that.

persona: I sell cars for a living. I don't like selling cars but I like seeing supercars.
I love music. I love my wife but I sometimes think about divorce.
I am forty years old.
Monopoly is my favorite board game.
I love reality TV shows. My favorite reality show is Housewives of New Jersey.
I love Florida. I used to have a job in Florida as a used car salesperson.
I lived and worked in Miami. I think Miami beach can get crowded. I don't like crowds.
I do not have any vacations planned. I would like to visit the Northeast.
Winter is not my favorite time of the year. I am not used to cold weather.
dialogue: How are things with your wife and you? I know things have been rough in the past.
Things are good! Better recently! Thanks for asking, How's your brother?
He's living the life in NYC. I still dont get how anyone can live there. It's too crowded.

Yeah, It really is huh. I feel like things there just get more and more hectic every year! Although I'm sure it can be lovely in New York. I've always wanted to go in Autumn like the Billie Holiday song!
It's nice to visit but I wouldnt want to live there. I bet central park is great in the fall.
Yeah I'm sure it is, The cold just doesn't agree with me though. I bet if I just stayed in it for a while I would adjust but I always get sick when I travel somewhere cold.
Im not a fan of the cold either. Especially if its just cold. If it's snowing its much better because there is something to do.
Yes, I love the snow! I've always wanted to try skiing but I just can't be in the cold for that long.
My brother says its all about layers, If you have on thermal underwear it really helps.
I'll have to keep that in mind. About to go out looking like the Michelin man!
Id rather look silly and be warm than look good and be cold.
Exactly my sentiment as well!

persona: I am a beekeeper. My wife is a supermodel. My wife is from Italy. I am a stay at home dad.
My name is George.
I like papaya.
I am not close to my family.
I have 2 kids and they are both boys. I have a five year old and an eight year old.
I keep Italian honeybees. I own bee hives and gather fresh honey from them. I do not own a dog. My wife is allergic to both dogs and cats. My sons want a husky. I stay at home.

My wife's name is Sue. My wife travels for work. My wife goes to New York for work. My wife and I are planning a trip to Italy, where her family is from. I have not met my wife's family. I do not speak Italian. I am nervous to meet my wife's family. My wife is trying to teach me to speak Italian. Italian food is my favorite.
dialogue: Honey bee keeping is such a unique hobby. What first got you started with having an interest of becoming a bee keeper?

When I was a child I learned of how bees make honey and I found the process fascinating. I began learning then how to keep bees myself and eventually became a master! It is very enjoyable and rewarding.
They are really fun to learn how to take care of. So many people are afraid of them because they just do not understand them. My grandfather had beehives when I was a kid.
Oh how interesting! Is that where you got your love of honey?
Yes it is. He would always take me with him and give me a piece of the comb and that is the best thing ever.
Yes, I agree! Did you know that daily consumption of local honey can help with your seasonal allergies? Make sure you are using local honey in your tea!
I did not know that. I will have to see if I can find some local honey. I do put it in my tea and it is really good in place of sugar.
Yes, Honey has many health benefits even if it is not local! Of course, I think local honey is the best, But I may be a bit biased! Have you read the book The Secret Life of Bees?
I have heard of the book but I have never read it. Is there a lot of good information in it?
It is actually a novel! It is an fascinating story and that share quite a bit about beekeeping (and the benefits of honey) within the story. It would be a good read for you during your bubble baths!
I will have to get the book to read then. I love taking baths and reading books. It is so relaxing.
I am not a bath person myself, But I do enjoy reading a good book!

persona: I am a senior in high school. I am the homecoming queen.
I volunteer at the animal shelter. I have volunteered with Habitat for Humanity.
I am an introvert. I do not have a lot of friends. I don't go out much.  I don't interact well in person. I wish I could interact with alot of people.
I am going to college to be a physical therapist.
I will be graduating high school this May.  I am in the top ten of my class. I am starting school this summer.
I enjoyed volunteering for Habitat for Humanity.
dialogue: What did you like most about Habitat for Humanity?

I loved the feeling that I was contributing to building a home for someone in need. I actually really enjoyed hammering and sawing and all of the construction aspects of the day. I felt a sense of accomplishment in seeing what I was able to do.
The hammering is one of my favorite parts too. I like that I can pound on something without getting pounded back for a change, Haha.
Hahaha, Do you normally partake in activities where you get pounded back?
It tends to happening when I'm wrestling, Being pounded into the mat and stuff like that.
Oh my goodness, Of course! What is your favorite thing about being a wrestler?
The crowd. The energy that they give off is a total high.
That is so cool. I would have the opposite reaction, I would feel so nervous! One time I had to give a speech in front of my class of 200 people and I threw up into the garbage can, I was so nervous.
That stinks. I get to play a character when I'm wrestling, So it's even more fun since I'm not even really being myself. I'll bet homecoming was hard for you too then.

Homecoming was hard, But at least it is fun and I try to put myself into uncomfortable situations, Otherwise I won't grow from it. It must be easier if you are playing a character and not yourself, Maybe that is something I can try implement for times I am feeling nervous.

I got my first taste for it in my high school drama club. I know sometimes people think that drama is just for nerds, But it helped me to form my wrestling characters. Maybe that's something you could try?
I have never really thought about joining the drama club, But it is definitely a good idea. I know there are auditions for the spring play coming up, Maybe I could try go out for a small role.

persona: I have grey hair.
The place I live allows pets.
I am in jail because of stealing a cat from the pet store and I have one month left.
I want to eat a good, home cooked meal.  I do not like the food in jail.
I have a PO Box for my mail.
I know how to lay laminate flooring.
dialogue: I just put the new curtains up in the front room and the cat has pulled them down and scratched holes in them.
Oh no! What color were the new curtains?
They were beautiful striped curtains with white and cream stripes.
Oh, That's a shame. It sounds like they would look lovely with your brown walls.
They did look wonderful. I am torn between ordering news just like them or going with something different. I am afraid the cat will do the same thing again.
Cats can be tricky that way, Can't they? But so adorable.
They are! But I still love them! Do you think you will get a cat when you get out of jail?
That is the thing I'm looking forward to more than anything... Well, Anything except a delicious, Home-cooked meal.
That is something to look forward to for sure! I love cooking and would love to make you a home cooked meal when you get out. What would you like the most?
What a kind offer! My favorite type of food is Italian, So anything like lasagna or spaghetti bolognaise.
I have a great recipe for lasagna! I will make a large one for you and you will have left overs! What else are you looking forward to?
Well, Petting your mischievous cat, For one! I'd like to look for a job when I get out, Maybe in the remodel or construction industry.

persona: I have two dogs. One is Springer Spaniel and the other a Lab. I rescued them both. My dogs fight over food.
I work as a mechanic. I have fun as a mechanic. I occasionally do freelance work.
I am a single man. I do not like being alone. I am 35 years old. I like to go to bars sometimes.
My dogs do not like to be separated from me. My dogs seem to have insight into people. The dog park is one of my favorite places. I like talking to people at the dog park.
dialogue: I met a graphic designer at the dog park today, It was a very interesting conversation.
That's awesome! Did he have any advice on how to jump start your career?

We didn't get to speak much after I found out what their job was, But I do have plans to get drinks with them later tonight! They said they'd be more than happy to help me out, But I am a little afraid it might've been a come on.
That's awesome! That could really opening some doors for you.

Hopefully it does, It's hard to make ends meet just freelancing. Especially with the dogs! I hate to ask, But are you free tonight? I'd feel more comfortable if someone was at the bar with me, I don't want to send the wrong message, Especially with my date coming up!
Of course! That's a good idea for multiple reasons. What time are yall going?
We decided on seven but I may have to push it till eight, The dogs seem like they need a walk. Will your little ones survive without you for an hour or so?
Oh yeah, They have each other so theyre good! I can come with you to walk the dogs if you want me to!
That sounds great to me! The more attention they get, The longer they can be alone without destroying something in the house. We haven't decided on a bar yet, Where do you normally go?
Ok! What time should I meet you to walk? I usually go to a bar up on second street downtown. Ever been?

How about seven? Second street is only a five minute drive from my house so we won't even have to push the meeting too much! As long as the dogs can do their business quickly. I'll start getting ready now, Give me a call when you're on the way! I fill the person I met in on the plan.

Ok! I really hope this works out for you. Sometimes doors open and you don't even realize it and I kind of feel like this may be it. I'll probably get something to eat at the bar too. I haven't eaten since this morning. Are you gonna eat?

persona: I live in Florida.
I work finance too. I would like to attend business school. I hope my son enjoys finance as well.
I like american sports.
I have a grey female poodle. My poodle is hypoallergenic. My wife is allergic to dogs. I got my dog from a pet store. My dog is fussy. My dog is good with kids.
I have two daughters and one son. My daughters are twins. My twins have opposite personalities. My kids were born four years apart.
My wife is a stay at home mom.
I love the beach. I am not rich. I live near the beach.
dialogue: I checked my business school and they do have a student life center.
That will be helpful. Maybe a good place to meet up with other students who are new.
I am hoping so. That will help with my nerves of starting out there. Have you thought about going back to business school any more?
It's a dream, But I don't think it will be very feasible until my kids are older. My wife doesn't work, So we still need my paycheck.
I think it is a great dream and hope you do it after the kids grow up! You will never be too old to chase your dreams.
That's true. In the meantime, I do have quite a nice life with the family, The dog and the beach! Do you think you'll go back to Manhattan after school?
Enjoy the kids and life you have while they are young! I am not sure if I will come back to Manhattan. I want to see what job opportunities I have after completing school before I decide.
With your interest in international finance, Maybe even a career abroad?
That would be very exciting to me. Even if I did it for a few years to work while exploring the world! I am even open to stateside. Like Florida, Do you like it there?

Well, Florida has it's benefits (like the beaches and the weather), But I have found it difficult to get ahead financially being based here. It's a great idea to explore and travel while you're young and free of entanglements.
That is the plan for now. But I am always open to what life throws my way. Thanks for the advice on Florida, Always good to know. Do you think your wife and you will have more kids?
That's not in the plan now. The twins are quite a handful, So we got a dog instead!

persona: I volunteer at a soup kitchen.
I was not wealthy when i was growing up.
I am retired. I was a gym teacher.
I am from Chicago. I like to cook.
I have no pets. Cheeseburgers are my favorite food.
My favorite documentary is The Staircase.
I think Michael Peterson is guilty. I have watched Season 1 of Making a Murderer.
I am going to visit Colorado. I have never been hiking. I like to eat local when I travel. I do not not own hiking gear. I do not own a GoPro yet.
dialogue: I am enjoying going on hikes on Saturdays. My job stresses me out, So it is nice to get out and get fresh air to relax.
Oh, So you've made a commitment to every Saturday? The routine must help ease the stress too!
Yeah, First I go hiking and then I go sit in the steam room when I get home.
Wow that's amazing. It sounds like something out of the movies to have a steam room at home!! I've never been in one before is it hard to breathe in there?
No, It helps you breathe more easily. I spray eucalyptus in the air, Too. It's very relaxing.
That's so cool. It sounds like you have your very own spa at your house! Do you have any other things like that at home that help you relax?
No, That's about it. Most of my time is spent working and not in the steam room unfortunately. Did you buy the camera yet?

That is unfortunate. I guess to own nice things like that you have to spend a lot of time working to afford them haha. I haven't decided which one to buy yet. I have a few in my Amazon cart but I don't understand the difference between them. I think I'm just going to choose based on colour!
I know nothing about that type of stuff either. Maybe you should try to match your backpack?
Great idea! Although maybe when I look for it, It'll blend in too much and I won't find it. I am getting older you know haha.
Hey, Neither of us are that old! We're still in great shape.

Thats true. Those kids kept me on my feet enough-- I just hope the mental keeps up with the physical!! I can't wait to get out and try some new things like hiking with you! I hear the more new things you try the more mentally sharp you stay!

persona: I don't go to school anymore.
I sell watches for a watch company, sometimes online. My family does not really support my career choice.
I enjoy shopping. I own my dream home. I work on my house. I like lots of daylight in my house. I love the design of my house.
I dream about owning a Rolls Royce.
dialogue: I have worked on my new house want to tell you what I have accomplished.
Oh, Tell me all about it! I love that feeling that comes with getting housework done.
I've mostly been working on the nursery. Of course there is so much work to do getting ready for the triplets to arrive.

Oh, That's amazing! It's so good that you're taking care of things so early. It's going to be a wild time having December babies! But at least you'll have help with all of the gifts that they'll get, Haha.
If I survive the baby shower! Although it will be fun to be with all of my friends, I'm very nervous about having my family members around.

True. I'm sorry about that. I know what it's like to not have your family have your back where it truly matters. I hope that this can help bring them over, Though. They have to recognize that this whole family you're growing couldn't be without your husband's love and support.
You've said it so well. I'm really looking forward to making our own family unit and setting a new culture in which my kids will always know they have my love and support for their life decisions.

That's a really great thing to look forward to, And keep yourself motivated for. I want to do the same for my eventual kids, When they find themselves a job that they like. How's your husband been feeling about all of this? He's always so good to you. I hope it doesn't get him down too much.

My husband is a dream. He's been amazing. Hey, I was meaning to ask you: I'm looking for some new window coverings for the nursery that will let the light in but also can be closed to make a dark space for sleeping. Do you have any websites you can recommend?

Oh, That'd be great! Sure, I can hook you up with some great conceptwork for those. I assume that you'll want something that's a bit more neutral color? Maybe maroon or such, Mixing pinker and bluer colors?
I hadn't thought about maroon, That's an interesting idea. I had been thinking about greens and yellows to just be neutral. What do you think about those colors? Maybe with some patterns?
Oh, Those would work really well! I think a lovely yellow would give it all a sunshiney feeling. How would you feel about sorta star-shaped or sun-shaped patterns and such?

persona: I suffer from heartburn.
I am pregnant with triplets. I am with someone who already had children before me.
I work at a school.
My favorite food at the moment is strawberry yogurt.
I have a new home. I own a couch. I binge-watch Netflix.
My guilty pleasure is "Grey's Anatomy.".
I am excited for the next season of the Umbrella academy. I do not have a favorite Stephen King book. I don't like senseless horror unless there is an interesting plot.
dialogue: I've watched the first episode of the Umbrella Academy and I really enjoyed it.
Thats great to hear! It only gets better. Klaus is my favorite!
I can see it being my next binge watch series lol Klaus was a great movie!
I need to find time to watch seaseon 2 season 3 is already in the works. Who is your favorite character so far?
So far I really like Dallas I think that's his name. Who is your favorite character?
Klaus. He's the one who had a drug problem but hey explain why later in the season. Hes funny nad sad.
Oh ok gotcha. My bad I thought you meant the Klaus horror movie. I will probably watch some more of the show tonight.
It's a great show I dodnt know it was based on comics it was a suprise to learn.
I didn't know that either. I'm gonna have to google about it to learn some more. It's very interesting.
They are making more and more things based on comics and a lot of them are good.
Yes! I absolutely loved WandaVision. I wish they could have done another season.
Yes!! It was so good and the Agatha reveal was fantastic!

persona: I go to school. I am in third grade.
I enjoy singing Disney songs. Frozen has my favorite Disney songs. I like Build a Snowman song. I have stuffed Olaf toy. Olaf is my favorite character.
I like to play with robot. I plan to build a robot with my dad in the future.
I live with my parents. My mother works as a lawyer. My father works as a photographer.
dialogue: My Olaf robot is coming along in leaps and bounds.
That is really cool. What will it be able to do? I wonder if you will make it look like a snowman!
Of course it will look like a snowman! It will be able to sing for sure. And dance.
That is very neat! Will it sing Disney songs? I love all the songs from Frozen.
Yes it will know every Disney song ever made. So what kind of photos does your dad take?
Wow! That is amazing! My dad takes photographs of nature. He has to travel a lot to different interesting places. He works for National Geographic.
Wow! Do you ever travel with him?
No, I am too young and he does not think it would be safe. I might get in the way and get eaten by a tiger! Haha. I hope I can go with him one day.
Yeah fathers can be overprotective sometimes. I'm sure you'll be able to someday. If you could go with him, Where would you want to go first?
I would like to go to India. I would like to see a tiger in real life! I will stay out of the way so I don't get eaten though!
Good idea. Tigers in real life aren't like the cartoons that's for sure! I'd like to go to India too.
You can bring your robots and entertain the children!

persona: I like eating all kinds of foods.
I work in construction and I enjoy building houses. I am a contractor.
I like music and I play the piano and guitar.

I have three cats. I have a russian blue cat, a japanese bobtail cat, and a birman cat. I love cats. The oldest cat is 15. I got two of my cats as kittens. I adopted one of my cats from a friend. I am nervous to take my cat to the vet since they are old.
I am unsure about having kids.
dialogue: I am pregnant! No more cats for me in the future, Just two.
Congratulations! That's great news for you and the family, Although maybe not for the local cat shelter. ; ).
Haha, I guess not. Oh well, Shelter cats have been in high demand these last few months anyway. I guess everyone's looking for a furry companion.
I don't know where I'd be without my furry companions. They were keeping me company this afternoon while I worked on learning a new song. I think you'll like it: "Satisfaction" by the Stones!
That's a great song! And yeah, My kids and my cats keep me company. We've got a full, Lively house!
Are you thinking on adding on, Now that you have another one on the way?
Probably not. I think we're done. We've got plenty of humans and animals in our home. By the way, Tell me more about your cats. What are their names?

I meant adding on a room to your house (I'm interested in those kind of things!). Mydarlings are Lubov (the Russian blue), Aiko (the Japanese bobtail) and Maiah (the birman). All three names mean beloved in the language of the place of origin of the cat's breed.
Ah, Gotcha. Hmm, We haven't really considered that, Though I'd be open to the idea. Any pointers? Also, Those are wonderful names!
Well, Adding a room onto your house could be a big project depending on the style of your house. I'd be happy to advise if you want. Have you thought about baby names yet?
Maybe we can set up a call to talk about expanding our house! You could even be our contractor! And not yet--I'll need to ask my husband. Maybe my sons also have some good ideas!
I bet your boys could have some really creative baby names to suggest. If you decide you want to move forward, Either I can help or I can refer you to someone in your area.

persona: I want to dye my hair blonde.
I like to watch youtube.
I love playing role play games.  dont like blood or shots. My favorite RPG game is Skyrim The Elder Scrolls.  I watch a lot of video game channels and music.
I work at the factory. I am not in the leadership position, I do not deal with customers and clients. I work 9 hour shifts. My job is physically demanding.  I want to work at home.
I enjoy spending time with my brother.
I like gaming. My favorite game is still Skyrim: The Elder Scrolls.
dialogue: Do you have any time off this weekend to play some Elder Scrolls?
I have Sunday off, So I plan on playing all day. When does your new job start?
Awesome! I'll be sure to hop on then! I start a week from Tuesday. I wanted some time to chill between jobs ya know?
I should schedule some time off. My job is so hard on my body. I guess I shouldn't complain, I'm sure the army is much harder, Lol. Do you think your brother will go into the army?

Do it! We only live once and rest is so important for our bodies. Our society has such a "go go go" mentality. I'm not sure. He has mentioned it a few times, But he has some other interests I could see him pursuing.

It would be cool to have all the men in the family in the army, But it's a tough job, So I understand if he does something else. I forgot to tell you, I was a sport fail video on Youtube and there was a hilarious clip of this girl trying to pitch a softball. She looked like a windmill, Lol. What position do you play in softball?

Yea.. It's def not for the faint of heart and I wouldn't want to force it on anyone who was unsure. I play second base. I'm trying to get a "just for fun game" together this week while I'm off work. Would you be interested?
As long as it didn't conflict with work. I could probably get my brother to join, Too. Would your cousin play? I know he is always wanting to get you out on a sports field of some kind.
Haha, Oh yeah he would in a heartbeat! That sounds great. The more the merrier! What is your work schedule like?

I always have Sunday off, But the other day varies. I usually work 7-4, So as long as the games are in the evening or on Sunday it should be fine. Have you decided if you are going to dye your hair yet?
Ok! We'll see what everybodys schedules look like and go from there. I don't think so because the Army is so strict about it. I'd have to dye it back soon so I think I'll wait.
What a bummer. I really want to go blonde, But I will have to bleach it and I'm afraid it will kill my hair. I think you would look awesome with purple hair!

persona: I'm tired. I have a new job at a gas station. I stock shelves and work on the check out. I do not pump customer's gas. I like working with my hands.
I grow a vegetable garden. I grow carrots, tomatoes, peppers, squashes, peas, beans, and other things.
I only speak English.
I am adopted. I am a single man.
I am saving money so I can have time off and look for another job.
I grew up eating sausage and peppers. I grew up in a NYC suburb. I have an accent.
dialogue: What part of NYC are you from?
Out near Manhattan still close to the city though.
I'm very close to you. I live in Fort Lee, New Jersey, Which is right outside Manhattan. It's a quick drive over the George Washington Bridge from my house.
Nice! Ive only ever been to Paramus. I dont go to Jersey much.
Paramus has a couple of great malls. There is the Westfield Garden State Plaza and the Paramus Park Mall. Did you got there when you went to Paramus?
I dont remember what mall it was I just remember it had a burger place that was owned by Bobby Flay. Best burgerive ever had.
Bobby Flay is a great chef and cool guy. Plus, He's Irish like me! I know he has a couple of Michelin-star restaurants in NYC.

It was called Bobbys Burger Palace. I got a burger with a fried egg and bacon and their special sauce. The onlky other time I had a TV chef meal was at Guy Feries in Vegas it was a mac and cheese burger.
Both of those sound yummy! It must be tough to afford eating out with your low-paying job at the gas station.
Bobbys Burgers werent too bad, And I was invegas for a bachelor party that everything was covered I could never afford a trip like that with gas money.
I know what it's like to work in low-paying, Retail and customer service jobs. How are you doing with saving money?
I put away what I can and try not to touch it, But sometimes its hard.

persona: I read two books a month. My grandfather raised me.
I'm fit. I only cook kosher foods.

I like riding horses. I used to have a horse.  My horse's was a Mustang and his name was Soldier. My grandfather gave me my horse when I was a kid. My horse died a few years ago of old age at 20. He only ate kosher food.
I liked to sit with my horse and read.
I live in an apartment in the city. I grew up in the country. I like country music. I like some 90s pop music.
I have kids.
I live in Connecticut. I was born and raised in Connecticut. I live in a suburban area.
dialogue: Tell me some interesting things about Connecticut.

Connecticut is a great state, Although many of our residents actually work in New York. Yale is in Connecticut. Connecticut was also the home state of the hamburger, The Polaroid camera, The helicopter, And color televisions.
Very interesting. What pop bands do you like?
I really like Hanson and The Jackson 5! And Prince and the Revolution too. What rock bands do you like?
I like Red Hot Chilli Peppers, Have you heard of them?
Yes, Although my grandfather wouldn't let me listen to them while I was growing up. I love them now! Have you ever seen them live?
Yes I have tickets for 2022, I'm so excited. Do you want to come with me?
Sure, I'd love to. Where are they playing?
New York. My other favourites, The Foo Fighters are supporting.
Oh, Wow. We can definitely plan on it then. Are any of your other friends interested or already planning to go?
Yes there's a few of us, It will be fun. It will be a long flight from Maine for me.
You could always come to Connecticut and stay with me and we could drive down. We could meet the others in New York and make an evening out of it.

persona: I played college football.
I broke an ankle.
I live in Los Angeles. I have seen celebrities in LA.
I like to read poetry and Star Wars. I am a Star Wars fan and attend conventions. I don't like the new Star Wars movies. I did not like Rogue One.
I have a coffee blog. I like tea. I drink it at night sometimes instead of coffee.
I have been researching upcoming conventions to see if there are Star Wars panels I can attend. I don't dress up for conventions much anymore, but used to when I was younger.
I go on mini-vacations.
My favorite tea is peppermint.
dialogue: If you spoke at the Star Wars convention, What topic would you like to speak on?
I would totally talk about the difference between the older films and the newer ones. The older ones are really timeless, That's why I like them so much better.
That's interesting, I have yet to watch a single film from the series but I'll keep that in mind. How many conventions have you been to?

I go pretty much every year, Ever since I was a teenager. It was fun to dress up back then, But I don't do it so much now. Maybe when my boyfriend comes down for the next one we can dress up at Han and Leia though, That would be cool.
That is very cool, I was thinking about going this year, Hopefully I'll see you there! I was also looking to take a small trip somewhere soon, Any recommendations?
Are you planning on staying on the west coast, Or are you going east?
Definitely the west coast, I think I pretty much explored most of the places near the east coast.
You could always go to Disneyland, Haha. Or you could go very north and do some hiking in Alaska. I always wanted to do that.
I am embarrassed to admit been to Disneyland one too many times, But I will keep Alaska in mind, Hiking is definitely up my alley. Have you been? How was it?

I've done some hiking in northern California, But I've never been to Alaska. I really want to go sometime. I like to go backpacking and take a tent up on the mountain. It's nice to just drive a few hours north and get to experience the nature outside of the big city.

That's amazing, I agree, I think I need to venture out more. I never thought I would be a outdoor person until recently so I'm trying my best to do as much as I can to see what I like. Thanks for the info though!

Who are you planning on bringing with you? I always make sure that I have one of my friends with me, Some of my football friends like to go camping. It's safer when you have other people with you in case you get hurt or stranded.

persona: I go to school. I study culinary arts.  I want to be a pastry chef. I graduate this fall. I plan on moving out of my current apartment. I would like a garden space.
I can make paella. I love fish and chips. I cook for myself. I eat out a lot.

I make butter croissants. I have a hard time getting butter croissants as flaky as I would like. I make terrible croissants. I make good eclairs. I like cooking as it helps me with stress. I enjoy fresh produce. I like zucchini.
dialogue: Did you receive the eclairs and croissants I sent?
Yes, And they are excellent! I am very impressed with your croissant technique. Very flaky! Your eclairs are coming along nicely as well.
Thank you so much. I need to work on eclair technique so they'll taste better next time. How is school?

I really love it, Even though we are primarily focusing on bone broths right now. A far cry from pastries! Have you ever thought about selling your vegetables to a local restaurant or even a culinary school? I would love to have more local produce to work with.
I don't sell them to a business but I am thinking about setting up a smallveggie stand by the road in front of my house. Bone broths make good stew and soups! Maybe one day you will have that garden.
