Yes, I hope to have a yard someday soon! I should come by your place when you set up your stand! I'll be a great customer! Where do you do most of your sales now?
I sell mainly through Facebook Marketplace and I sell to family, Friends, And coworkers. I would love your help in setting up a stand and I would love you being a customer.
I would love to help out! I am pretty busy with school, But I have Mondays off. Maybe I could bring some of my pastries to sell alongside your vegetables?

Oh that would be so good. We could start a small little road side farmer's market complete with homemade pastries. If you help me set it up, I'll help you set up your garden when you are ready and moved.
It's a deal! I'm so glad we connected and have so many common interests! You don't happen to grow zucchini do you?
Not yet. I do remember you said you have a sweet spot for them. I will definitely be planting some for you next year. I would love some zucchini bread.
As soon as you are able to grow some I will definitely make us some zucchini bread! It tastes so much better with fresh grown zucchini than the kind from the store.

persona: I have kids.
I am in a world domination group.
I am a housekeeper. I painted for 20 years. A lot of my abstract paintings are in our local museum.
I miss painting. I have arthritis in my hands. My bones hurt.
I occasionally sell my paintings.  I am an artist. My best pieces are abstract pieces.
I like several artists including Pollack, Picasso and Miro. My art is inspired by Picasso. I haven't done much painting lately.
dialogue: Have you ever seen a doctor about your hands?
I have seen several. They do what they can and I have tried several medications but painting is just something I can't do anymore. That doesn't mean I can't still enjoy art.
Have you looked into holistic type medicine?
I have not, Is there something in particular you would suggest?
I was just thinking about those oils for pain. Can you paint with a wrist brace on?

I have tried the brace, But the arthritis is not just in the wrist but also in the finger joints, I just don't have the brush control to get the effects that used to be so easy. Age has not been kind.
What was your favorite thing to paint.

It's hard to articulate exactly, But that is the nature of abstract paintings. I just went with a vision and focused on balance and tone. I think I did some great work in my heydey. Have you tried painting?

persona: I live in a rural area. I'm a farmer. I have a rural farm with a lot of land. I do most of my farming my self.  I employ a few people to help. I think farming is easy.
I have a dog.
I plant potatoes and wheat. I love mashed potatoes.
My favorite movie genre is comedy.
I have not seen the movie Slap Shot.
I like to watch hockey at home and eat poutine and drink beer.
I've been married 21 years. My wife and I are happy together.
dialogue: I decided to download the movie Slap Shot. I'll let you know how it is.
Yes, Please do! I've been wanting to see it! When do you plan on watching it?
I am downloading it now. I hope to watch it this evening. Any movies you would recommend while I am looking for other things to watch?
Well since you like hockey, You might like watching the Mighty Ducks movies, If you haven't already seen them. I love those movies! Have you seen them?
No. I will add them to my list! Do you get much time to watch movies since you have to take care of the farm?

Yea, Weekends are my free time to relax a little bit with my wife, So we'll watch a movie or two during our time. We need to have you over some time so we can give you some more info about farming, Would you like that?
Sure. What do you farm? And, Do you have any animals? I have never had any pets growing up so I love when I get a chance to play with any animals.

I raise and breed livestock such as cattle, Sheep and horses. My dog Remo helps me get the animals in order, Drives me insane sometimes. When you come over to check out the farm I'll introduce you to the animals. Have you ever thought about getting a pet?

Sometimes. But, I really like to be able to come and go without having to worry about a pet. I spend most of my time working on my skating and it would be unfair to a pet to leave it alone as much as I am out.

That makes sense, And very smart. Pets need a lot of attention and don't allow you much time to relax. Speaking of which, Tell me more about this relax sleep you've been learning. I'm really interested in this, How is that going?

It is interesting. I am trying to so I feel more refreshed when I wake up. I have only been at it a few days. They say I need to give it about a week before I will notice anything different. I will keep you updated though!

Yes please do!! I could definitely use more relaxing sleep techniques!! My wife and I are actually looking into purchasing a new mattress so I'm hoping my relaxation and sleep will get better immediately.

persona: I have a massager. I'm a gym trainer and am at the gym often. I train older ladies at the gym. I love doing the treadmill and rowing machine.
I have no kids. I have 2 dogs - border collies.
I have never seen any Star Wars movies. I like action movies.
dialogue: I finished painting the baby Yoda for my new grandbaby's nursery.
Oh, That's exciting! I'm still not too sure what the baby Yoda is exactly. Is your daughter excited for the baby?
Yoda is a character from the "Star Wars" movies. My daughter Rachel is very excited to have the baby! I really hope she comes to visit once the baby is born. She hasn't come by the house in a while.
Well excellent! I guess you've been familiar with the Star Wars characters for a long time. When are you going to give the painting to her?

It's been over 40 years since I saw the first "Star Wars" movie. It's considered science fiction, But it has elements of comedy and lots of cool action scenes, So you'd probably like it. I plan on giving it to Rachel at her baby shower.
Oh wonderful! I'll need to add it to my list. I have been meaning to watch more science fiction movies for a while now. Do you have any other recommendations in the genre?
I sure do. In the science fiction genre, I'd recommend the "Matrix" trilogy,"Inception", "The Happening", And"Jurassic Park"..
Oh great! I remember when Inception and The Matrix were huge in theaters. Speaking of which, Have you seen anything in theaters lately?

No, I haven't been to the movies recently. I only go out of the house for essential trips, Because my leg is killing me and I walk really slowly. I could use a gym trainer like you to help me with physical therapy and basic workouts, But I'd rather do them at home than in a gym.
That makes sense, I could definitely set you up with some at-home exercises and stretches you could use to help. Would you be alright with purchasing some additional materials or equipment?
That would be great. I could afford to buy some exercise equipment, But only what I need and not top-of-the-line stuff. What should I buy?

For the time being, I can send you a list of beginner work-out instructional tapes that should be good to get you started. Later on, You might want to look into purchasing a used treadmill or elliptical.

persona: I like watching documentaries.
I live in pennsylvania and have a husband.
I started working as a personal assistant 3 months ago.
I like to read a book every week. I like harry potter. I prefer the Harry Potter books to the movies. I don't have a favorite Harry Potter book.
I used to read Shakespeare in school.  I like Nora roberts books. I like shakespeare. I like books better than movies.  I loved being read to as a kid.
I have moved before.
I like stuffed crust, Sausage and mushroom, cheesy bread.
dialogue: I got the kitchen unpacked now and I am working on the living room. Slowly I am getting my house back in order.
That's good to hear. How is your daughter adjusting to the new space?
Shes doing great, Slowly getting used to the place.
That's great. Are you out of school for the summer now?
No, Not yet. The kids break up in a few weeks.
Oh, I see. I'm sure you're looking forward to the long break. I wish I could have the summer off, But being a personal assistant never stops. Have you been reading any good books lately?
Yeah, The books called the secret. I know you said you down have a favorite harry potter book but you must have one that you like a little more than the others.
Oh, I'll have to look into that one! I do love a good book. As far as Harry Potter goes, I honestly don't think I could choose a favorite. I love them all so much!
What do you love most about it?
I love the fantasy of it. It's like an escape from the real world. It's so magical and mysterious, I love it. You said you started reading Harry Potter, Which book are you on?
I'm reading harry potter the goblet of fire. What are your thoughts on that specific book?

persona: I don't like sports. I am fat.
I don't have a favorite color.
I'm an atheist. I'm a woman. I like the color blue.
I watch olympic potato throwing. I spend a lot of time watching videos on Youtube. The only sport I watch is cricket.
I use facebook quite often. I like facebook.
I have never been to Atlantic City but I would really like to.
I like to explore nature.  I like battered and fried vegetables. I'm not on a diet. I mostly eat potatoes. I like cashews and nuts. I'm considering going on a diet.
dialogue: I saw a sign up sheet at my local grocery store for a 5k run. I think I'm going to sign up for it!
Oh really? That's so exciting! Are you ready for it?? Do you have any training before the run?

I don't feel ready for it! The most I've ever run is 2k and I found that challenging enough. I'm planning on steadily increasing how much I run so I build up my endurance - hopefully I can get to a point where I can run 5k easily!
That's a very smart idea! I hear that it's relatively easy to build stamina through regular cardio vascular exercise. Do you like to swim too?
I never really learnt to swim, I tend to just splash around in the water. Are you good at swimming?
No, But I am seriously considering picking it up since I haven't swam seriously since I was little. It is hard to find motivation some times though.
Yeah I feel that. I try to eat super healthy (chia seeds and lots of antioxidants) so I don't have too many calories to burn off. Do you eat healthily?
My spouse is vegetarian and lactose intolerant so really mostof the options available in my house are healthy. So, I'd say relatively haha!
I sneak a brownie or cookie every once in a while, You've got to treat yourself.
True that, I binge eat a bag of chips every now and then!
Oooh what are your favourite?
I like thinner sliced barbecue chicken potato chips. What about you?

persona: I am new here. I have a family.
I like Mickey Mouse. I have been to Disneyland. I am planning another trip to Disneyland. I like to read.
I have brown hair. I work on a maternity ward at a hospital. I work the day shift. I am only permitted to wear scrubs to work.
Because I am older, I prefer warmer clothes than scrubs.
I shop on Amazon.
I have a big collection of vinyl records from my parents. I like the Rolling Stones, like my parents did. I like The Eagles. I like country music. I like Travis Tritt.
dialogue: I tried one of the bath soaks from Amazon that you recommended the last time we talked. It really helped me to relax after a long day at work!
I'm so glad to hear it helped! Are you off from work now, Or still have some shifts?
I worked over the weekend so I am off today and will be back at it tomorrow. How about you?
At least you have the day off! I'm off also, Finally. Going to listen to some music? Do you have any vinyl records? I know you said you liked them, But I can't remember if you mentioned any.
Yes, I have quite a few vinyls that I like to listen to here and there. I have just about every Eagles record they ever put out! Have you added anything new to your vinyl collection?
That is amazing! Believe it or not I actually found one in pristine condition at Walmart this morning! It was a Disney record, Funnily enough. Have you added anything new yourself lately?
No, But we did just get a new vinyl store downtown so I will probably go check that out next weekend since I have it off. When are you going to Disneyland next?

Oops, I meant Goodwill, Not Walmart. And that sounds so exciting! I'll have to look into that. We will probably be going around my youngest daughter's birthday in a few months. I'm so excited! You ever find any good deals for records on Amazon? I haven't even checked, Honestly.
Yes, You can definitely find good deals on Amazon, But sometimes they are way overpriced on Amazon too, Especially newer records. Do you ever visit Disney World or do you stick to Disneyland?

persona: I listen to death metal.
I am a swim coach for my local pool. I like to stay active.

I'm from india. I like indian cuisine and holidays. My favorite indian food is broccoli and tofu in garlic sauce, chicken tikka masala. I usually marinate my broccoli and tofu in garlic sauce dish. I enjoy the beach.
I have a traditional mother. I am free spirited.
Chicken tikka masala is one of my favorite foods. I like food that isn't too spicy. I make naan at my home at least once a week.
I have two younger sisters. I have family dinners with my siblings.
I like museums. I like art.
I haven't visited a spa in a long time.
dialogue: I spoke with my sister yesterday. She definitely wants to check out the museum!
Sounds like a plan to me! Maybe we can hit up the spa afterwards for facials.
That sounds so awesome! The spa is just a block or two away from the museum right?
Yes, It's super close by. They have a fantastic pool area too.

I'm pretty excited. It just dawned on me that just a couple more blocks away is Curry in a Hurry. We can visit the museum, Get a facial, And then enjoy some Indian food! The walking we do will offset the meal.
Well this sounds like it's turning into quite the awesome day. I hope they have chickentikka masala, It's my favorite.
I am certain they do. They also have a "Walk on the Mild Side" menu that is less spicy, Which is perfect for me.
Oh good, I like things that aren't too spicy. Even after growing up in India I've never gotten used to things that are too spicy.
Do you ever miss India or does your mom always keep a little bit of India at home to keep it fresh in your mind?
My mom tries to stay very traditional. We eat a lot of Indian food.
That is really cool! I sometimes wonder how I will be as a mother. My husband says I will be great and have the perfect temperament, But it's just so scary for me to think about.
I think as long as your heart is in it, You'll do great.

persona: I am a college language student. I speak spanish and am going to learn french. I only study languages.
My favorite word in spanish is trabajo.
I like camaros and bumble bee from transformers.
My dad has a mustang.
I am in a band. I play the french horn. I play the mellophone.
dialogue: I finally decided what school I want to attend!
Oh really? That's so exciting! What school are you looking at?
I want to attend New York University! What do you think? Does this sound achievable?
Um, Heck yeah! Especially since you've already been accepted into such other wonderful schools. I wish you luck, But I'm sure you won't even need it! Why NYU?

Well, Ideally I want to get into Parsons but I don't think I'll get accepted with my background and previous areas of research so I'm going to NYU for a bachelor's and then I want to try to attend the graduate school after!
I'm sure you'll make it and do great! You seem very bright. What do you want to major in? Physical Therapy? You thinking about any minors?
Thank you! I appreciate your vote of confidence. I want a minor in Psychology but I already know my workload is going to be so heavy! What are you minoring in?
I'm sure you can do it! I am minoring in Music. It is definitely extra work, But it's something I enjoy, So at least there's that!
Oh yeah! You told me you play the mellophone that's so interesting. I've never met someone who plays the mellophone before.
It's pretty fun! You said you play the flute, Right? How long have you been playing?
Since middle school I believe. It's fun but I really want to pick up the clarinet but I never feel like I have enough time.
I don't blame you. Any Ivy League-bound kid is super busy. Do you think you might try in the summer?

persona: I own a yacht. I rent my yacht out to AirBnB. I like to sail on my yacht. I have sailed to Spain, Hawaii, and Australia.I travel around the world.
I like tea. I love food. I like strawberries.
I don't know many people.
I am 23 years old. I have a close relationship with my family and I like the outdoors.
I've been on the ocean since I was a child.
I like to eat out.
dialogue: My garden is dying. I have to start over.
Sometimes a new start is a good thing, What are you going to plant this time? I have to get the yacht ready for the weekend more guests.
I'll probably start with tomatoes as they're more likely to survive. Where are you sailing to?
Tomatoes sound great! Oh i'm not sailing I have a booking you know for the AirBnB, Make sure she's ship shape as they say.
Ah that makes sense! I don't think I could stay on a yacht, I'm terrified of the ocean. Do you like the sea?

I do I love it very much, There's nothing better than a wind powered yacht cruising the high seas. You become very in-tune with nature that way. That sucks that one of your fears is the ocean but it's good to have some fear for it. What kind of museum do you work at?
I work at a natural history museum. I arrange displays and come up with new exhibit ideas which is very fulfilling, But it's hard work! Do you go to museums often?
That sounds like an amazing job! I travel lots so I like to visit museums when I can in each place.
I love hearing about other museums, But I absolutely hate travelling so I've only been to the one I work at!

That's the bonus to working in a museum though right, The exhibits change or some travel around the world from museum to museum. The best part of travelling is getting to see other cultures, Foods, Art etc I will agree the rest is just stressful.

That's true. Though it's only a small museum and we don't have a massive budget to get new exhibits in all the time unfortunately. I think I like the idea of travelling, But because I'm a bit deaf I just feel stressed whenever I have to travel anywhere!
I always find planning helps to ease travel stress, Having a travel buddy. You said you like to cook, What's the best thing you can cook from scratch.

persona: I enjoy going to the park. I'm searching for a new job at a hospital. I am a surgeon. I have a 12 year old daughter.
I live in North Carolina.
I have a daughter that loves grilled meat. We do not work on the weekends.
My daughter struggles with math.
I make tasty brownies. I drink alcohol.
I am not a very good teacher. My daughter recently began studying algebra. I have a bachelors degree in Chemistry. I went to medical school. I don't have a lot of time.
dialogue: I've been reviewing some Algebra concepts, I think I can help your daughter!
That's great, Thank you. Have you been cooking recently?
I popped a bagel in the toaster an hour ago. Does that count as cooking?
Ha I guess so! What did you eat along with it?
After a lot of thought and consideration I decided that a banana and a cup of coffee were the perfect side dishes to complement the bagel.
That sounds delicious. I made waffles this morning.
I had a neighbor who had a dog named Waffles. He liked to bark at night, Every night.
I love dogs. I want to get a spaniel!
I'm afraid of dogs. They have big teeth. All it takes is one bite and I could lose my hand.

persona: I hate the color orange. I think fashion is dumb.
I don't go to the gym.
I work in a bookstore. My mother is disappointed. My parents kicked me out of my house. My parents disapprove of my job. I have a chemistry degree.
My dog is very agile. I spend a lot of time with my dog. I don't have time for dating. I travel to canine competitions with my dog.
I participate in a competitive team sport. I travel to participate in sports competitions.
I enjoy reading thrillers. I write book reviews. I enjoy my job. I hope to open my own bookstore. I went to college.
dialogue: What did you study while you were in college?
Well, Mostly Chemistry with a minor in inter-personal media communications. What about you?
I haven't gone to college yet, I have found myself successful working at restaurants. Did you participate in competitive sports at college?
Yes, I played short stop for my colleges baseball team! Though, I really wanted to join the chess club.
Awesome! I always have a good time playing chess, I recently started playing it during my off time and have been having a blast. We should play chess together sometime. How is your dog doing?
Ol' Baba Yaga is doing just fine! He's so small I emptied out the bottom bookshelf in my room and he just sleeps there haha!
Oh my god, That is so cute! I'm thinking about getting a dog myself, How much effort does it take to take care of Ol' Baba Yaga?
He's a very high maintenance boy but that's just his personality and breed. Most dogs are pretty relaxed once they get through their puppy phase as long as they're trained right.
Thanks for the advice, Ill make sure to train my puppy right away if I do end up getting one soon. Have you had any canine competitions that you've attended recently?
Not very recently we've just been taking it easy ol' Baba Yaga and I.
Yeah, Sometimes you need to take some time to rest and reset to comeback better in future competitions. Have you read any new books recently?
Yeah I read a lot of books recently!

persona: I have a German Shepard called luke and a pit bull called duke.
I prefer mustang cars. I own two vintage mustang cars.
I work as a construction worker. It is my day off. I have a decent wage from my job.
I have dogs.
I have a job. I don't usually work on the weekends.
I like plain pizza. I also like pineapple and black olives on pizza.
dialogue: Have you been caring for your cars recently?
It's been raining the last few days, So I've been keeping them safe in the garage.
That's good! How often do you drive them? Do you drive them to work at all?
Never to work. There is too much dust on the job sites. I take them out most weekends when the weather is good.
Ah, So how do you commute to work normally?
I have a Ford pickup truck for my everyday driving. What kind of vehicle do you drive?
Oh cool! I drive a Lincoln Zephyr. How's your job been lately?
That's a sweet ride. Work's crazy busy. All the overtime you can handle. It feels like we're building a new house every couple of weeks.
It definitely is. So comfortable. Pickup trucks are cool though. And wow! That sounds like a lot. Are you off right now or on a break? I do work a lot, But only part time.
Today's my day off for the week. What do you do for work?
Ah, That's great! I work in aT-shirt shop and help screen print. I'm already off for the day.
What is the craziest shirt you've made?

persona: I like to have TV in the background.
I would like to work from home.
I have a hearing disability.
I have four cats and one puppy. I might adopt a bird. I may get an exotic bird. I have not looked into specifics of having a bird.
I spend a lot of time taking care of my pets.
I used to run.
I like to stay inside. I like to read. I like to play games. My favorite book is the bible.
dialogue: What are some of your favorite games to play?
Life and Monopoly are my two favorite. I like playing them while having a movie night.
I like Monopoly too, But my friends won't play it with my anymore because I'm a bit too mean. I like to make really outlandish deals.
I like to make no deals and hoard as much as possible. I guess I'm a little mean at Monopoly too, Lol. At least my cats like me!

I've been looking at some pet shelters and decided that a cocker spaniel is the way to go. There's a breed specific rescue in my area that just got a mom with a litter of puppies. Thinking I may have to go and adopt one. I need some company when I'm working at home all day. The tv can only help so much, You know?
I can definitely understand that. I like keeping the TV on as background noise, But having my fluffy friends keeps me busy.
Have you decided if you're going to add anymore to your family yet? I know you've got your hands full already.
I've been considering a bird. I've never had one and don't know much about them yet. First I would have to figure out if my dog and cats would even tolerate one.

I had a bird growing up. Just a budgie (parakeet) nothing super big. I heard that you have to be very careful with them around dogs and cats, Because they are so fragile. We only had one bird for a little while and didn't have any other pets at the time, So he could fly free around the house. He was a great little friend.
Hmm, I'd hate to have to keep him locked up all the time. Wouldn't seem fair to a bird.
You could always have a designated room to be a free flight room, That could work. But yeah, I understand not wanting to cage them all the time. But if you got a bigger bird, It might be ok.
Yea, It's something I definitely need to look into further! I hope you can get the dog you're looking at, They're so sweet.

persona: I like hiking and watching the sunset.
I turned 18 yesterday. I just got a pet betta fish as a birthday present from my parents.
My favorite color is orange.
My boyfriend broke up with me two months ago. I feel sad about my breakup. My boyfriend left me suddenly and he is weird.
I will be attending college.
I am thinking about becoming a social worker. I want to work with children and families.
I am not a great cook.  I am making spaghetti tonight. I enjoy comfort foods.
dialogue: I actually got a chance to go out yesterday. I did some window shopping.
Good! You've been wanting to. See anything worth saving up for?
I'd like to get into long distance running, So I saw a pair of running shoes I would like. But it would take me a while to save up and pay for them. Have you been window shopping recently?
I have, Yes! I was looking for larger aquariums for my fish. They are too expensive for me, But I am hoping I can talk my parents into getting it for me.
I bet your fish would appreciate it! So have you been hiking lately? I'd love to try it sometime.
Not recently. I got back together with my boyfriend and he has been wanting me to spend time at his place the last couple of days. It is hard to keep up with men and hobbies LOL.
That is why I just don't get into relationships, I can hardly take care of myself, There is no way I could keep up with another person! Are you glad you are back together?
Very glad. I know he is weird, But sometimes I get so lonely and it is nice to have someone there. Maybe I can talk him into hiking with me so I don't have to give that up.
That sounds like something relaxing for you two to do together. You should take him on one of your favorite hikes.
I think I will! What about you. Been doing any cooking lately?
Yes, I made spaghetti for myself last night. I wish I could afford more food so I could really branch out with my cooking.
Do your foster parents like your spaghetti. Maybe you can talk them into getting some new ingredients so you can make something new for the entire family. Rice dishes are often cheap AND a hit!

persona: I know an Italian restaurant that needs servers.
I like gymnastics. I like team sports.
I like Italian food. I like garlic bread. I eat a lot of carbohydrates. I'm on a new cardio regimen.
I work out. I do lunges.
I don't like the Yankees. The team I love is doing pretty well so far this year.
I didn't play many team sports as a child. Team sports help you learn about yourself.
I love pasta and chicken alfredo.
dialogue: I am going to see a basketball game this weekend. Then, I am going to try this new Italian restaurant with my sister.
Oh that sounds like a great time! What do you think you'll order?
Ooh, I'm hoping they'll have some Gnocchi for me to try. It's really hard to find a good Gnocchi around me.
My mouth is watering already! Hey, I hope you don't mind if I ask the waiter to pull up a seat. I am dying for some Italian food.
Of course come on through, Maybe they'll have a slice of Tiramisu or two.
Haha ever the poet. I might have to follow your lead and go for a run or something. Italian carbs are sooo good but they won't burn themselves off.
True that! I will join you for that run any day. How do you feel about a good swim though?

It's supertiring but I love the feeling of a full body workout that I get from it. Oh! We might have to wait a bit before we hop in the pool if we end up with leftovers. Italian food does not last long in my house.
Gotta hide it. Italian left overs may be the most sought after left overs. Probably the gold of the left overs world.
So true. It's a good thing that I don't have it all the time! Otherwise I'd be broke and fat.
I am considering taking a course in Italian cuisine so I make a mean chicken parmesan.
That sounds well worth whatever it takes to burn it off. I'd love to grab a bite next once you master the chicken parm.

persona: I visited Alaska not that long ago. I love Alaska.
I do stunt work. I was a double in the movie Cliffhanger 2. I have a day job. I had a small part in Cliffhanger 2.
I read a lot about meditation and religions. I eat kosher food. I was raised Christian.
I have a strong body. I like HIIT training. My favorite time to exercise is in the morning.  I do HITT exercise before 7:30 each morning.
I work as an EMT.
I had a spiritual awakening about a year ago.  I worked with the spiritual coach Abraham Hicks.
I read The Secret and enjoyed it.
dialogue: Tell me more about your spiritual awakening.
Well, It had a lot to do with the location and the accoutrements of the event. A very strange experience indeed.
Where did this experience happen? Does the environment make much difference?

At the time I was in the hills outside a small village in Peru. I payed for a 'Shaman' to take me into the hills so that I could have the experience that I was looking for. I would say the location matters a lot. You always want to be in a safe location during your spiritual awakening.
I agree. I am very spitirual but I think my journey has been more gradual than an awakening experience. I feel more grounded and centered with every day that practice.
I agree with that sentiment. All things in moderation right. Do you find that yoga helps you to feel more spiritual, Or in a sense, 'closer to god'?.
I don't believe in a god per say, But I do feel much closer to the earth and myself during yoga.
Oh I bet, Especially in Alaska I'm sure that feeling must be amazing!
During the light hours of the year it's wonderful, But we have months of darkness where I live and it can difficult to maintain that sense of spirituality.
I'm sure! It must get pretty sleepy over there. Months of hibernation huh.

Haha yea. That's one of the reasons I had to quit my job because it was very difficult to keep my sleep schedule on track when there is no daylight. I'm sure you could handle it though, You seem tough.
I could try but I'm afraid I would also just spend days asleep haha.

persona: I go to basketball practice.
I have an older sister.
My mother is a dentist and volunteers at a clinic. My mother is my best friend.
I've started in a diner part time.
My older sister is going to learn how to play piano.
I live three blocks' distance from the homeless shelter. My sister leaves a three-block distance from the homeless shelter, too.
I like Travis Scott's music. I would love to see Travis Scott in concert and to travel to Italy.
dialogue: I have booked 3 new clients for piano teaching. I am volunteering at a homeless shelter too now. Maybe you can join one time.
That is great! As for volunteering, I would love to sometime. Maybe after basketball practice tomorrow?
That would be awesome if you could come! What time is practice over?
Since school is off, Our summer league has earlier practice. It's supposed to be over at 2:30 PM.
Perfect! Definitely if you can come you should! How is basketball going? Team looking good this year?
I don't want to brag or jinx us too much, But we are looking pretty good. We have a couple all-staters on the team! I think we are going to be the team to beat!
Love to hear that! Keep grinding you are a beast! What position are you playing this summer?

I am going to spend most of my time as the 2 guard, But I move to 3 in some sets. They said if we win the league, We can play in a district wide competition and if we win that, We could represent our team against international competition. It's not quite Italy, But I could play an Italian team!
Is the tournament going to be held into the states? You need to get to Italy as soon as possible! It is amazing!

I guess they alternate and this year it's going to be in Texas, But next year is supposed to be in Europe. If I'm still playing, Who knows? I heard they have pro basketball leagues there. Did you attend any games?
I did not attend any games, I mostly took in the food and music which was fantastic!
Oh, I can't wait to go. I keep nagging my parents about it. I think they are really considering it. Our neighbor Mr. Puccini actually has relatives there and said we could get cheap lodging.

persona: I have three horses that I used to rent a stable for before I bought a farm to house them at. I have some chili.
I live in Kentucky on a horse ranch. I love riding. I have 3 Aabian horses named Siegfried, Beowulf, and Hector.
I live in Kentucky, on a horse ranch. I have goats and a pig.
I fell in love with horses as a kid and have maintained my passion for them.
dialogue: We have planned a trip to Kentucky after the baby is born!
That sounds like a hassle but you can't go anywhere without her haha. I'm sure you guys will have fun. I would love to have you guys over at my ranch.
That sounds like a blast! I'm sure the baby would enjoy it.
The horses are very gentle so I'm sure she'd like to watch them. I think it would be a good exposure to big animals for her.
What are your horses names?
Siegfried, Beowulf, And Hector. Hector can be a brat sometimes but they're all good at heart.

What awesome names! I really hope the baby enjoys the company of horses. Though, It might be a bit too much to get enough land and then take care of the horses on top of the baby. Maybe when she's a bit older we'll look into it more seriously.
It is a lifestyle. You kind of have to go all in with horses for them to thrive. But hey, You can always come to the ranch for a free trial!
I'll definitely have to take you up on that. It's been so long since I've been to a horse farm!
Awesome! You'll have a nice, Hearty breakfast waiting for you each morning! You'll need it too because I might ask for your helpmucking the stalls.
Of course! I would love to get my hands dirty in there feel free to call on me at any time.
I'm excited to see all of you!! Oh man... I have so much work to do to get the ranch ready. It'll be worth it though.

persona: I do not hike. I hate hiking.
I only have time for the gym. I need a good workout and would like a change of scenery.
I do not like dogs. I'm not sure if I'm ready for the long-term responsibility of a pet. I'm more open to getting a dog as a pet than a parrot.
dialogue: I am going to take my dogs out for a long walk after I grade papers.
That sounds like a great idea. What kind of dogs are they?
Honestly, I've heard it called Heinz-57 - they are mutts from the shelter. You been thinking more about dogs too?
Nah, I don't think I'll ever be a dog owner. I might consider a cat.
Dogs, Parrots, You do have your preferences! One step at a time I suppose. So cats you are open to?
Yea. I''ve heard that they are low key and not too much work unlike dogs and parrots which want your attention all the time.
From the work I've done at the shelter before, They all have different levels. Dogs are definitely need direct interaction yes. What do you enjoy doing, Overall?
What do you mean by that?
I am trying to understand things you enjoy, As we discuss things you may not be so keen on. What hobbies do you have?
I like to lift weights. I might try to get into yoga. I also travel.
I have a set of weights. They are dusty now. Where did you last travel to?
Why are they dusty? I went back packing in Europe. Probably why I am so over hiking right now.

persona: My father had cancer.
I like to sew but haven't had time for it recently. I'm looking into an embroidery project. I have never used a sewing machine.
I am from New York.
I went to school at Yale. I plant to go to business school. School is important to me.
I've been researching business schools lately.
I like the south because it's warm. I want to attend college in the south.  I have not chosen a college yet. I love Florida. I have been to Disney World at least 30 times.
I love crazy quits. I'd like to see some historic quilts in the textile museum.
dialogue: I found an amazing used Singer sewing machine at a yard sale! It needs some work but I can't wait to use it for quilting.
Oh perfect! I have some clothes in desperate need of fixing if you'd like to help me out.
Of course! I'm always up to help a friend in need. And plus with sewing I never regret a new project haha!
Excellent! Speaking of new projects, I would love to see what that machine can do. I have all sorts of quilt designs in my head, Just waiting to be released.
Oh man, Once you see it's capabilities I'm afraid you're gonna fall in love with it.
Oh uh... Too late, I'm already in love. It's going to be tough to separate me from your sewing machine! I have a feeling that quilting is my true calling.
I'll have to take you to my local museum I can show you all the historic textiles we have. I find it pretty inspirational if I find myself in a rut.
I would love that. I could probably spend an entire day there!

If you're into that sort of thing I recommend going to your local antique store or thrift shop/flea market so you can familiarize your self with all of the different stitching patterns and what they mean - fabric wise.

That's an excellent suggestion. I will have to explore more of the stitching world sometime. There's something inherently relaxing about losing yourself in the patterns. Though I'm sure you know that full well.
A truly calming experience! I almost think of it as a form of meditation.
I can totally see that! It's great to have simple things you can enjoy like that. I know I need more of that with all of the school stress I currently have.

persona: I like movies. I am scared of clowns.
I am single.
I am adopted, my parents are old.
I like bugs. I am afraid of apathy. I am afraid of Republicans.
I trap wolf spiders in a cup at the station. I let wolf spiders free outside after I trap them. I love finding ladybugs.
My favorite movie of all time is Fargo.
I work at a gas station. I pump gas at work.
I worked at a circus. I am freaked out by clowns.  I am freaked out by lions.
dialogue: I am working on getting registered to vote.
That is great! Voting is such a wonderful privilege! I see that you like most types of bugs. I love spiders. What is your favorite?
I love ladybugs, They are so cute and small. I think you mentioned liking them as well right?

I do! I love the beautiful patterns on their shells. From what I have heard, They do bite but I have not had one bite me. I think that would be better than a lion bite though! LOL. I see you also do not like lions. What is your favorite animal?
I like small cute animals like cats or little dogs. I don't have any pets right now but I would love adopt one day.
I have a dog. She is great! My parents really like her. I know you did not get along that well with your parents growing up, But do you stay in touch with them at all?
No, They were abusive and cruel and I have no desire to contact them. I think it's wonderful that your parents adopted you and that you're close with them.
Yes, They were great parents! I'm sorry you had a hard time with yours but at least your Aunt was good to you. Do you feel more safe now that you are in the U.S.?.

persona: I do not play chess.
I like to watch nascar. My dad was a nascar driver.
I work for the US Postal Service.
I am married. I have a german shepard named Barnby. I have 3 children.
My favorite color is grey.
I have been to the Grand Canyon. I am tasking a trip to Dayton beach soon.
I have a sister.
I am a race fan.
dialogue: I really had a great time at the golf club.
Did you? How long have you been golfing?
Years now, But it's taken awhile to make progress. There's a lot to know. I was thinking about how I'm glad you like dogs too. How's your dog doing?
Bamby is doing great. We just went for our evening walk. What are your dogs names again?
Rambo and Woofer. Poetry isn't it! Hehe. It's fun to name your dogs something a little silly, Makes me smile.
I can only hope that the Frenchie is the one named Rambo! I think it's great.
Just looking at that dogs makes me laugh, I mean, Frenchies are a sight to behold, Their features! I love them.
I bet! One used to go with its owner to the bar I liked in college. It would always sit at the bar in a stool.
They can be pretty domesticated, Almost regal sometimes. And then they get zoomies, Run around the room like tornados!
Did you take them on your trip to the Grand Canyon?
Usually a kennel is what I prefer, So there's just less mechanical stuff to manage on trips. You like travelling with yours?
As much as I can. Hard to take him on a plane due to his size though. I have a great dogsitter though.

persona: I am a finance graduate from Yale.
I like beer.
I have friends who help.
I am good at math.
I love spending time in Miami. I was on the sailing team.  I am thinking about buying a sailboat.
dialogue: I went to Miami last night. It was a lot of fun!
Awesome! What did you do?
I relaxed on the beach of course! It was rather crowded but still enjoyable. I have to get this tan somehow!
No surprise there. Beaches are the best place on Earth. Unfortunately, I usually can't get a natural tan. I end up burning.
Agreed! Hmm sunscreen will be a must if you get that sailboat then. Or a giant hat.
True that! Sunscreen, Hats, Wetsuits, The works. I love the sun but sometimes it's like my enemy. Did you see anyone sailing at the beach?
Yep, Plenty of people sailing and drinking beer. You just can't stop some people from having a good time.
Oh how I long for that feeling. Are you going to head back to Miami anytime soon, Or what are you up to today? Cooking up something delicious on the grill?

There's always something tasty on the grill! I make sure to keep one in my car so I can grill no matter where I am. I have some tri-tip cooking right now. And I will definitely come back to Miami soon.
You can't go wrong with tri-tip. Definitely my favorite meal. What's your favorite food?
That's a good question. It's hard to decide on one food but I'm extremely partial to stuffed mushrooms. They have to be filled to the brim with goodness though!
There are some great restaurants in Miami next time you go. There's a place right near the beach that has amazing seafood, And also stuffed mushrooms, Stuffed peppers, And other delicacies.

persona: I go to the gym and lot. I like using rowing machines and the treadmill. I am very disciplined.
I like going to the city. I have two dogs.
I like punk rock. I'd like to learn how to play an instrument.
I visit the city. I see concerts.
I want to go to Carnegie Hall. I don't like classical music.
I'm thinking of learning to play bass. I love punk rock. I like the Ramones and the Clash.
dialogue: What is your favorite punk band?
I love both the Ramones and the Clash.

Great choice! I was thinking about doing a cover of some punk rock music. It might help me branch out from the classical world I've grown up in. Figured it might be cool to do a one man band and cover all five of the instruments I know. Maybe edit it and post in on YouTube. Do you know any singers that might be willing to collab? I won't dare sing myself.
I would like to do that with you. I can sing pretty good!
That's awesome! Is your range more like a tenor or a bass?
My range is very broad, I can do both tenor and bass.

Amazing! I'll work on putting together an arrangement. If it goes well, Maybe we could even perform in person some day, Though of course, We would need other musicians to play some of the instruments live. I'm getting ahead of myself here, But we could create a whole band! And eventually, As you get more comfortable with your guitar or bass learning, You could debut some of those skills as well.
That would be great! I would love to both sing and play bass. I think our band would be very fun to see live.
We just need a name! Any ideas? You're the punk rock enthusiast!
How about Carnegie Punks? It's a reference to the two main styles of music that influence the band.

Oh, That's a great idea! Some of the songs could start out with a classical intro on the piano, And then, BAM! The other instruments come in and we rock out hardcore. I can practically hear it already!
Yeah, That sounds very unique. I think our band would be a big hit!

persona: I take dance classes every week. My favorite dance is the salsa. I like dancing to live music.
I have visited Santa Monica when I was young in 1989. I love the beach.
I listened to my favorite band New Kids on the Block when I was younger.
I like board games. I have brothers.
I work the night shift at a retail food store.
I listen to a podcast.
I am familiar with many pop boy bands. I am familiar with K-Pop music.
dialogue: I got scheduled to supervise the kids in the after school detention this week. I might not be able to make that class with you.

Supervising those bad kids sounds like a real drag. That's too bad, But the class this week is for ballroom dancing, And you can maybe come to next week's class, Where we'll be learning the Argentine tango.
That sounds great! I will plan for next week then. I don't think it is too many doing detention duty, A lot of the kids just need a little help and attention.
Cool. I could show you how to dance the salsa, Too, At some point. What subjects do you teach to the fifth graders, Anyway?
Salsa would fun to learn, Thank you! I teach 5th grade homeroom so mainly English, Science and Social Studies.
Got it. When do you get out for summer vacation, And will you have to teach summer school?
There are opportunities to teach summer school but I will not be taking those this year. A nice relaxing summer is needed. Do you have any plans for this summer?

Good for you. We all need a break from work, And being off during the summer is one of the best benefits of teaching. I'll be working full-time at the store still, But in my downtime, I'd like to go to the beach, Possibly at Santa Monica again, With my brother.
A trip to the beach would be great for you, Especially if your brother could make it. Sometimes we have to make time for little trips away! Maybe take a few board games and play with your brother.
It really would be fun. Actually, Though I like board games, I think I'd rather play some drinking games and chill out to a podcast or some Netflix!
That would be fun as well! Does your brother like to dance as much as you do?
He's not much of a dancer, But I did go to a New Kids on the Block concert with my parents and brother and he was dancing there!

persona: I spent time in Manhatztan when I was younger. I used to walk a lot.
I work in finance in Manhattan. I work as a broker. I love my job. I graduated from Yale in 2011. I am planning to go to business school.
I own a BMW. I have bought a new car. I have a G-Wagon. I like Teslas.
I am dating a nurse.
I like to expand my knowledge by taking classes.
I hate needles.
My husband sells cars.
dialogue: Did you get hired right out of school for your current job?

I did! Yale has great opportunities for internships. I actually couldn't attend my graduation because that was my first day of working full-time at my company. Have you thought more about going back to school? Whatever school you decide, You should definitely check what their connections are.
Good for you! That's a good point. A future employer would probably want to know that I went to a reputable school. I need a change in my life because what I have right now isn't working for me.
Where would you hope to work with your nursing degree if you don't want to work in a nursing home anymore?
I'm thinking working in a hospital might be better. It's depressing to watch all these lonely old people slowly declining with no one to visit them. It's taking a toll on me emotionally.

I bet! I feel like it would be just as stressful working in a fast paced hospital with emergency cases, But then again, You must have the heart and personality for it. I can hardly stomach stocks crashing, I can't imagine looking at graphs like that and knowing it's a person's vitals.
You're right, It takes a lot of heart to be in this profession. How do you like your job right now? I'm sure that it can get just as stressful.

Well, I'm still hoping to get into business school, But it would be paid for by my current job. It would be nice to have a little break from the long-term hours, And after completion of the program I'd automatically receive a raise, And also be eligible for all types of promotions. I love my company, But I'm definitely interested in finding out what other positions are out there.
You have to do what's best for you. It's smart to keep an eye out for better opportunities. I hope the program works out for you.
It sounds like we are both hopeful for better opportunities. This year is the year! I can feel it. Do you have any other goals for this year besides bettering your employment situation?

This has to be the year! There's no other option. I'm hoping to be able to win back custody of my kids. It's unfair that their mother just took them away from me without the option of even being able to visit them.

I know. I'm sorry to hear about your situation. Once your financial status changes, And you make better money, I think they will definitely have to take that into consideration! I know you haven't been able to visit the kids, But do you at least get to talk to them?

persona: I have a new pet fish named Nemo. My fish is a boy. My fish is orange and black. I have an orange aquarium for my new fish Nemo. I have two fish other than Nemo. Nemo is my oldest fish. I think it would be funny to play music for my fish.
I like museums. I have an ex.
I love the color orange. I like to eat oranges. I prefer apples and peaches. I like orange fruit.
I like to visit museums.
I am 18 years old.
dialogue: I've been playing this music for my fish every day for the last week! I don't think it's really doing anything.
That is so funny. I have always wanted to play music for my fish. How many fish do you have?
I have 2 beta fishes. They are both males. Males will fight each other, So I have to keep them in different tanks.
I think I've heard that before. Beta fish are so interesting. Besides Nemo, I'm able to keep my fish together.
That's good that you can keep them together, Much more economical. How old is Nemo?
Nemo is already 2 years old. I'm hoping he'll live a long time because he's my favorite. Anyways, I hear you work in a museum?
Yes, I do! I am a tour guide in the Holocaust museum in Dallas. I love my job.
That's so cool. I go to museums all the time. History is so fascinating.
Yes I have always loved learning about the past, And what our past relatives and historical leaders went through.
Has being partly deaf made your job harder at all? I feel like it could make giving tours difficult.

It certainly can be a little difficult when people ask questions, But I have found that over time I have gotten better and better at reading lips, So I can sort of predict what people are saying as they speak.
Being able to read lips is so interesting. I could never. I would probably have to rely on expensive technology. That definitely seems smarter and cheaper.

persona: I play basketball.
My favorite rapper is Travis Scott.
My mom is a dentist.
I am unemployed. I am applying for jobs at restaurants.
I love to read.
I am having an interview for a job on Friday. I have two job interviews at restaurants coming up. I'm interviewing to be assistant manager. I'm nervous about my job interviews.
I like to go out to lunch.
I like to dance to Travis Scott.
dialogue: I got the Travis Scott tickets!
ThAT'S AMAZING. I can't wait. I'll let work know I need those days off if I get the job. Thank you!
No problem. I'm so excited.
How are your jobs going?
The bookstore's been quiet, Which is nice. It gives me more time to browse the titles to find books to read.
Quiet sounds good. If I get a restaurant job, I'm sure it'll be anything but quiet. Restaurant management is a tough gig.
I always hear about how many restaurants don't make it. Must be a stressful industry to work in.

Most of the ones I've applied for are pretty established and successful. The tough part is the turnover rate with the wait staff and bartenders. I understand; it's not usually a long-term career unless you want to get into management. There's good money in it, But it can be stressful.
I think the high paying jobs always come with a bunch of stress. I'll stick with my easy job at the bookstore.
You're right about that! Is that what you'd like to do longterm or is there something else you're interested in?
I have a simple life. I want the easiest job that i can get which pays the bills.
There's nothing wrong with that! I always wanted to be an astronaut. That obviously didn't work out as planned.

persona: I am a high school student and I just won Homecoming Queen.
I do track and field in school. I want to start racing for charity. I enjoy running, and hope to run a 5k this year.
I listen to classical music while doing homework. I am currently getting straight A's.
I'm going to college. I have scholarships. I want to save my money for college. I do not have a tractor. I want to be a physical therapist.
I am competing in a charity race.
dialogue: Are you watching the tractor rally on youtube.
Hell yeah I am! I love me some tractors. I just wish I had the space and money for one.
They are great! I want to buy one and name it after my actual nickname Dirty Red!
Haha Dirty Red... You rascal! Hmm maybe I should take on pole dancing for some side money. These bills won't pay themselves.
Girl, You do not need to do that, You are going to college on a full ride with those grades!
You're right, You're right. Maybe just the weekends then lol. Hey, How's your sister doing? I know she's been having a tough time since the accident.
She is doing well! She said she is waiting for you to purchase a tractor so she can go riding!
Great to hear! Ah, Those sweet afternoon tractor rides. That's the American Dream right there.
Without a doubt. Sitting on the farm, A littleiced tea in hand, Staring at that pure and powerful tractor.
Brings a tear to my eye just thinking about it. I know both our parents would be proud if they saw us living like that.
Most definitely! Althought my parents want to disown me because I paid for college by pole dancing. It's like chill out, I saved you so much money.
More power to you! I just hope mine wouldn't react the same.Sigh... They just don't get what it's like for us.

persona: I have a demanding full time  job in insurance.
My father served 10 years in the army. My mom is no longer alive.
I play softball as a hobby.
I only speak English.  I want to learn French, I like the way the language sounds when spoken. I went to Paris with my mom when I was in high-school.
My dad did not come to Paris. My mother and I spent the whole day visiting the Eiffel Tower.
My dad is in the military.
dialogue: Did you have any softball games since we last talked?
Yeah, We played last night! I started at second base and we won 6-4. We were actually behind until the last inning when we pulled ahead. My teammate hit this huge home run.
That is really great! How many games to you play? If I have time, I might want to watch one.

We usually play once a week; I can't really handle more than that since my job sucks up so much of my time. Anyway, If you want to come to a game, That'd be sweet! We play again next Tuesday at 7 PM at the field downtown, If you can make it.
Ok. I know it's been so busy and I've been cramming as much French as my mind will take. I think I've sprouted a beret out of my head!
Ha, I bet! It's still on my list to learn but I have no idea how I'll find the time. Have you given any more thought to going to Paris? You really should go!
I think about it all the time. Do you remember much about it? I hear it's pretty inexpensive in the fall, But I think I would have to take off some time for school to do it.
It's been a while since my mom and I went, But I do remember that it was beautiful. The Louvre is amazing. And the Eiffel Tower is just so worth a look.
Maybe I can ask my counselor about it. I know there are study abroad options and I think I will know enough French to get by initially.
Oh, You'd be totally fine! Even back when I went, Just about everyone in Paris spoke English so you'd be all good even without being fluent in French.
That's a good point! You have me really thinking about it. You know what, I think I will call my counselor and then attend your softball game to tell you all about it!
Sounds like a great idea to me! Especially the part about you coming to my game, Haha.

persona: I am a teacher and waitress and don't have any pets.
I love mean girl movie.
My hobby is racing motorbikes.
I work with food bank volunteering.
Our school has a therapy dog Dr. Woofington McBark, he is 5 and a black lab.
dialogue: I left Roscoe at home and he tore up his dog bed!
Oh no! I wonder if Mean Girl had something to do with it and set Roscoe up to take the fall haha.
Ha! That is definitely one way to look at it. But it was probably Roscoe. He had that guilty look on his face, You know?
I sort of remember. I wish I was home more and could get a pet. Such good companions. Dr. McBark will have to do for now, But he has made me decide I want a lab if and when I do get a pet.
I imagine he must be such a well-behaved dog! Labs are so sweet. I'm sure you'll have a pet someday. You see Dr. McBark at school lately?

Yes, I see him around pretty often, But I try not to interfere with him too much so he can save his energy for the kids who need him. I'm going to schedule him to come to my class so the kids can read to him soon.
That's great! I'm sure they'll be really excited. Would be nice if we could get a therapy dog at the food bank. I'm sure a lot of people could use that comfort.

That's true! Maybe you have an idea in there somewhere. Sadly, So many ideas that help the community require more funding than folks are willing to put in. It's so sad. It's so easy to see income disparities when I look at the kids in my classroom. It doesn't seem fair.
It's not fair at all. I'm grateful that I'm able to at least make some difference, I just wish there wasn't a difference that needed to be made!

Yes, And in my state teachers are so underpaid. That's why I have to wait tables too. I thought the purpose of society was to ultimately find a way where people can enjoy their lives instead of work work work. But no, Instead all of the money lies in the hands of like 5 individuals. It's so gross.
It definitely is. And being a teacher is such an important and difficult job too. There's no reason a teacher (or anybody) should NEED a second job!

Exactly! A reliable salary is nice, But when I take what I make and break it down by the hour, It's indentured servitude basically. Not to mention the supplies and things I buy out of my own pocket because there's no room in the school budget for them. It's all such a mess. I'm sure you see so much of this and much worse at the food bank. If I ever got rich, I'd give so much back to my community. Truly! I wish everyone felt that way. Maybe seeing all the kids in my class makes me more empathetic to the struggles.

persona: I am rich. I eat off golden plates.
My favorite color is green.
I bought Bitcoin for fun.  I am nervous about buying Bitcoin.  I did not buy Bitcoin as a main investment. I made my money investing in real estate.
I don't have a goldfish. I have only had one pet, a cat.
dialogue: I taught Nemo a trick! If he learns a few maybe people will pay to see him perform.
I didn't realize you could teach fish tricks. I would like to see it. What kind of trick is it?
Nemo can twirl and do somersaults! He is very food motivated.
That is amazing! I would never attempt to train a fish. I haven't even tried to train my cat, And she isn't stuck in a bowl lol. What else can you teach him?
I don't know if I have taught him, But when I approach the bowl with food, Nemo blows bubbles, Almost like he is trying to talk. It's quite amazing.
I should come by sometime and check that out. Have you thought any more about maybe investing?
I have, But am worried about losing money. Any thoughts? Right now I have some money earning 25 basis points in an online bank account.

I would advise that if you do decide to do it, Only put in what you are ok with losing. I am so nervous every time I check mine, And I am regretting putting in so much. If I had started smaller, Maybe it would be more fun.

I am thinking of perhaps just doing anS&P500 index ETF. I believe I can start with as little as $100 and do $50 additional each month. Do you think that makes sense for a risk averse investor like me?
As long as you could stand to lose it, Then yeah. It would be perfect. I was told a bit late to only invest what you can afford to spend.
That is good advice. For me, That would mean don't risk losing my goldfish!
Yeah exactly. But I have almost doubled my investment. I did see it dip really low twice though and so now I am nervous it will go down and not back up.

persona: I skateboard. I have skateboarder friends.
I watch football.
I have a girlfriend. I want to impress my girlfriend with a poem. I like the poem.
I use youtube for movie recommendations. I prefer drama and romantic movies, and do not enjoy science fiction movies like Star Wars. I have never seen Titanic.
I drink black coffee.
My girlfriend loves chocolate covered strawberries.
I live near a candy store. I live in a house.
I have a dog. I love animals. I love little fluffy dogs. I have a fear of big dogs.
dialogue: I wrote a new poem that I would like to share with you.
What is it about? Is it about your Dog or about dogs in general?
How did you guess?!? It's about Max, Of course. It goes -- Max is my Chewbacca, I am his Han. He is my wing man, I am his all. I love Max.
I love star wars, It sounds like you do.
Oh I love almost all of it. I didn't love al the recent ones, But give me 1 through 6 any day! And Max seriously looks a little like Chewbacca!
I would love to hear your poem so I can tell my girlfriend it.
Oh, I already said it, Well it's a work in progress and I hope to add verses before the last line. "Max is my Chewbacca, I am his Han. He is my wing man, I am his all. I love Max.".
My girlfriend also loves chocolate strawberries. Does your store sell them?

It does! If there is a fruit that can be dipped in chocolate,Silly Sonka's is the place! I don't know how they didn't get sued, But they have a crazy Willy Wonka clone they callSilly Sonka. It's hilarious... And delicious.
Cool. There is a store around the corner called silly sonkas's. I will have to check them out next time I go out for coffee.
I highly recommend the "Heart of the Ocean." It.

persona: I'm Charlotte, I've been to Canada.
I work as a librarian. I am 60.
I live in the south and want to go North.
I enjoy music. My daughter does not play music. I travel often and my daughter sometimes comes with me.
I will be retiring in a few months and plan to travel once I do. I've always wanted to travel north. I want to go to France, and then Belgium. I enjoy Belgian chocolate.

I speak Chinese and French, but could stand to study French some more. My daughter is 18, going to turn 19 next year. She's thinking of taking some time off before college. I helped my daughter study French in school. I took Chinese in school and I love it.
dialogue: I researched those countries you are thinking about travelling to. They have a lot of interesting places to visit!
It's amazing to think about just how much history there is! I wish I could stay longer to see it all.
I am betting you could set up a map where you could visit the biggest attractions or most important event places and see a lot. At least in France for sure. When do you plan to go again?
I'm going this summer with my daughter. It works since she doesn't have summer school. I'll see if I can bring you back some Belgian chocolate!
Oh that would be A MA ZING. I have never had any real real Belgian chocolate. I have tried the fake stuff sold here, But I feel that everything is better where it originated.
I imagine the real thing is a life changer. You have a point. Maybe I'll try some authentic French bread too.
Oh yeah, They have so many kinds, But I heard it is best fresh so you gotta get it early!
There's no other way! Haha the bread might expire before I could bring you some back so sorry, No bread for you haha.
That is fine. I would be so happy to get some of that chocolate. I have always daydreamed about trying it fresh at the factory though haha.
In that case, Maybe I could steal you away for the summer. We aren't getting any younger. The time is now, Ali! You have to fulfill your dreams!
You know what? I love that idea! I will start putting back some money and I will be glad to go. Just gotta see about a passport.
Probably best to take care of that sooner or later. I know traveling can get really complicated, Really quickly. I'm excited for this trip!

persona: I like old school hip hop music. I take dance lessons once a week. I am one of the oldest people in the class. I'm learning to break dance which has been a goal of mine since childhood. I wish I had started dance lessons when I was younger but enjoy the opportunity now.
I really like New Kids on the Block.
I was born in the 1980s.
I do not work.
I have 8 babies. My kids and I enjoy dance. I can't afford to pay for dance lessons for all my kids.
I enjoyed going to New York.
I like the show Dance Moms.
dialogue: I think I found a job I want to apply for.
Oh, Thats amazing! What's the job?!.
It is for a paralegal!
Wow that's right in line with your interests eh! I don't even really get what they do lol. Do you know the specifics of the job?
Basically I will be a secretary for a law firm. How are you and your kids planning to spend the summer?

That's neat. Will that help you if you get into school for law? Kids are planning on driving me crazy this summer I think haha. Hopefully there will be a lot of beach days with their friends to keep them busy but nothing concrete is planned yet.

It definitely will help me advance towards my goals! It will make for a busy summer, But I am excited for the challenge! It sounds like you and the kiddos will have a lot of rest and relaxation during break. That's always nice!

Yeah, It's hard to always find something affordable for all of us to do so we go for the free and cheap adventures. Luckily the older ones think they're too cool to hang out with mom and would rather visit with their friends which gives me a bit of a break--Do I sound like a bad mom? Haha.
LOL no, You don't sound like a bad mom at all! Even though I'm lowkey obsessed with everything law related, I promise I am not at all judgmental.

Haha!! Sometimes I feel like it because they are so overwhelming, But I love them more than the world! I guess thats one thing I didnt think about when I saw their cute faces was--this is a lot of work and a long road! Do you have any ideas of fun family activities? Anything from childhood that was a good memory?

I sure do! Have any of you ever had the pleasure or riding horses? My family farm offers horse riding lessons for anyone interested, Free of charge. If you're interested I can pass along the details a little later. I'm actually just leaving the farm where I train my current horse. She did well on the hurdles today. I definitely recommend a little horse therapy. You might even like it more than that old school music you love lol.

Wow that would be amazing for the children! We've never been able to afford anything like that! I don't know about loving it more than my music, But the way you make it sound theres definitely some competition there!

persona: I travel the world. I like Mexican food. I have been to the Antarctic. I have a yacht. I like adventure. I rent my yacht out. It costs $5000 a week to rent my yacht. My yacht fits ten people.
I do not know about bitcoin.
I have a job but am thinking about changing to a different one. I enjoy being outdoors.
I would enjoy going to an Aerosmith concert. I wanted to go to the concert but did not. I am hoping to go later this summer. I enjoy rock concerts. I haven't been to a rock concert in 10 years.
I enjoy the culture of my local community.
dialogue: I talked to my friends about going to the concert on your yacht and they're really excited.

That is great to hear! They get to avoid all that nasty traffic and just enjoy a nice relaxing cruise to the port which is only two miles from the venue! I am kicking myself a bit for not getting tickets sooner, But I know they are heading a little further south in a month or so and may get tickets then.
That is sad to hear I wish you were going with us! Live music is always better than listening to a soundtrack in my opinion!
I'm just glad you talked everyone into the Yacht. Skipper Tim will be the one piloting the vessel and you couldn't ask for a better person at the helm! You may never want to travel by car again.
I do like driving! I'm a big fan of road trips! Do you always travel by yacht?
It really depends. I like to keep her in the ocean so I don't venture much into the rivers or lakes. So if I am doing business or pleasure away from the sea, I will be driving instead.
Very cool! When did you get your first yacht?

I had been renting one with friends for a few years, But I finally splashed some cash about seven years ago. Best investment I ever made to be honest. It's allowed me to travel so much. If I ever leave my job, I need something that gives me a lot of flexibility with travel!
Wow that is so cool! I am still saving to buy a house I can't even imagine purchasing a yacht!

Well, I got a little lucky with stocks, But don't think I didn't work my butt off. Your ship (even if it isn't a yacht) will be coming in soon! I can feel it. I don't know much about Bitcoin, But I just read that it was really looking strong.
Haha thank you! Hopefully one day I will have my own yacht and my own home! The stock market can be a good way to make money!

Just have to follow the trends. You are doing pretty well to hop on Bitcoin, But pay attention and know when it's time to abandon ship. Another boat metaphor! I can't help myself... Throw me a life preserver.

persona: I like to watch UFC and NASCAR.
I always have horchata when having Mexican food. I prefer chai tea to chamomile tea.
I build homes for the low-income families. I work in construction. I have been working for 4 years. I love building homes.

I do not garden. I like making food with fruits and vegetables. I eat Hispanic food. My favorite Mexican food is carne asada. I have eaten it ever since I was a kid on the 4th of July. I like making salsas, jams and jellies.
I like to buy from the farmer's market. I sell jellies at the farmer's market.
I like reading.
dialogue: Got anymore salsa recipes I could get from you?
Definitely! I have a very good mango salsa recipe if you want that!
I sure do! Maybe I'll consider growing my own mangos if the recipe is as amazing as I hope it is.
Definitely! Mangos are one of my favorite fruits you should grow me some too!
Haha I'll get multiple mango trees just in case. You can try my version of your recipe too! Hopefully it's decent.
That sounds amazing! Maybe if it's good enough I can sell it for both of us at the farmer's market!
That's a win win situation! How has the farmer's market business been lately?
I've been doing very well! My granddaughter has been coming with me and helping me set up and take down my stand!
That's adorable. I'm sure she's been super helpful. I would actually like to help you out there one of these days. Maybe I'll find something else there for me to start growing!
That sounds great, You're welcome to come any time! What would you like to find there!
I'm hoping to find a fruit that grows well in my growing zone and is sturdy so I won't have to worry about it dying.
Awesome! Are you hoping to find a fruit that grows on trees? I've always wanted an orchard but don't think I'd be much good at taking care of it!

persona: I am in a family of musicians.
I like walking and exploring.
I live in California.
I volunteer at a shelter. I like volunteering.
I respect the military. I chose college over the military.
I have siblings in the entertainment business.
I have a brother who is in the army.
I have never traveled outside of my state. I want to travel to Mexico. Mexican food is my favourite. I prefer spicy food. I have competed in a spicy food eating competition.
dialogue: Have you thought about what you want to specialize in if you join the army?
I'm really into the technology side of things. I would like to help save lives but also not risk my own so I think tech is good for me.
That's so cool! Is that what you're majoring in in college? I'm not very good with technology!
I'm a Military Technology Major. I'm liking the classes I'm taking. Haha that's ok everyone has their own thing they're bad at.
I never was good at school! Do you like being in college>.
It has its good and bad moments. I guarantee that you wouldn't be a fan of these late night study sessions!
That is for sure! Do you have to study a lot?

I have a lot of material to brush up so I can keep good grades in all of my classes. I want to retain the material too so studying is a daily routine. Hey, Do you want to grab a bite sometime? I could use a break from studying.
That sounds great! I think we're a little far away from each other though! I don't get much time off from the army!
I know, I just really want to see you. Let me know if you ever get extended leave and head up my way.
I definitely will! It would be nice to visit California! I haven't been there in a long time!
I'm not sure what the weather's like in Canada right now but you'll be in for a treat down here!

persona: I am from Italy. I grew up in Rome.
I have a new house. I am a homeowner. I am a mother and I have a male partner. I am expecting triplets: three boys in a few months. I am pregnant. I find pregnancy to be physically taxing.
I have not traveled in some time.
I enjoy going to Disneyland. I want to take my kids there.
I have recently moved to a new house.
I like to walk through wooded areas the most.
dialogue: We had three deliveries in one night on my last shift. It made me think of your triplets.
I still cannot believe I'm having triplets, Have you ever delivered triplets before? I am so tired all the time!
Nope! Maybe you'll be my first. From what I've heard, Being tired is your new normal. Oh well, You'll have three loving faces looking up at you every day to make up for it.
This might be bad to say and don't tell my husband this, But I cannot stop thinking how expensive this is going to be. Having one child is already expensive, But three at once. I am freaking out!
That's valid. I'm sure he'll be putting in extra shifts at work to make up for all the expenses you'll have. Disneyland might have to wait for a while unfortunately.
I didn't even think about that! When is the next time I can go to Disneyland? I might never get to go there again!
Ah, Don't worry. I'd be happy to treat your whole family to Disneyland at some point to help you all relieve some stress. I've earned quite a few rewards during my visits.
I appreciate that so much, But I can't ask you to do that. Just the fact that you would even offer means so much to me. Thank you.
Please, It would make me so happy to see you guys happy. Think about it. I'd be happy to babysit every once in a while too.

Why are you so increible to us? I'm not going to lie, I'm pretty sure I'd take you up on that babysitting sometime. Especially if the husband and I want to have a date night. But I promise I won't overdue it. We have already been looking at babysitters in the area.
Oh, Stop. I'm just being a good friend. You deserve some time to yourselves! It'll be really crazy with the babies for a while so you'll have to make the most of any time you can get.
Not just a good friend, But a great friend. I want you to know how much I appreciate you. Thank you.

persona: I am retired. I have grandkids. I am 40 years old. My children are in their 20's.
I do not like to eat at Burger King. I like McDonald's.
I like it when my children moved out of my house.
dialogue: Would you write me a letter of recommendation for entrance into a job program?
Sure, I can try! What kind of job program are you looking at?
I'm looking for a job program that would get me into a field that earns a lot of money and provides benefits. How long have you been retired?
Not long -- about two years now. But it's given my lots of time to myself, Which I've enjoyed. I can see why you'd want to leave Burger King. Are you parents finally okay with you quitting?
I think they will be okay with it, Once I move out. Time to yourself sounds so nice. Do you like to spend time with your grandkids? Do you take them to McDonalds?

I was sure glad to see my kids go haha but I do like to spend time with the grands. They like the park that's down the road from me and yeah, We go to McDonalds sometimes, Too. I love those milkshakes and fries!
McDonalds is so good! I like it better than Burger King. I'm sure your grandkids like them, Too! So your children are close to my age. Did your children move out initially to go to college?
They're all in their twenties, Yes, So not too much older than you. Two of them left to go to college and the third one left when he got a job out of the county. He's an aircraft mechanic.
Wow, An aircraft mechanic! That sounds really cool! So you retired at 40. That seems like a young age to retire. What field did you retire from?
I was a teacher, But my husband was military, So we spent lots of time traveling around the country when our children were young.
And now it sounds like you'll get to travel around the country with just your husband, No kids!
Honestly, I just want to sit at home a lot of the time. Too much moving around when I was younger. I just want to sit by the lake and relax for a spell.

persona: I started working is PA.

I am expecting my first child so I don't have time to volunteer. We still don't know the sex. We will probably paint kid's room in lime green. I am nervous about getting a child. My husband is very excited.
I've been pregnant for one month. I have morning sickness. I do not know if I am carrying a girl or boy.
I like rabbits. I used to volunteer at a dog rescue. I prefer bunnies to dogs.
dialogue: So, Do you have any news on your baby preparations? Any new decorating occurring?
Besides figuring out the paint colour we have chosen the crib and a changing table, But lots more to do! Were you fully prepared with decorating before your kids arrived?
