Absolutely, Most of the time they are a big help around the house but there are times when they can be very lazy and messy! Do you have any kids?
No kids for me, Unless you count my many animals as my kids! They keep me busy enough. I guess they will help prepare me for kids one day though. How old are yours?
They are 11 and 8, They keep me very busy with all of their sports and school events. It is smart that you are focusing on your farm and your school work. How is law school going?

Those sound like fun ages! Law school can be a pain, I learn a lot but I am looking forward to being done and getting out there in a real world. Actually getting paid for all my hard work! That's the plan at least.
I bet! All of your hard work will definitely pay off! Do you still plan to practice in Manhattan?

persona: My name is Mandi. I hate heights.
I don't have a job. I volunteer at a food bank. I need a job.
I love to party. I have lenient parents.

I have a cat named Gizmo and a female dog named Dixie. I have a fox terrier that is hyper and aggressive when around other dogs. My cat is afraid of my dog. My dog was adopted from a rescue. My dog has been unsuccessful in training programs. My dog cannot do tricks.
dialogue: How is your Gizmo andDixie doing?
Gizmo andDixie are doing good. How is your husky doing?
He's good, There were some fireworks that went off the other night and she freaked out!!.
Oh no! Are your parents still trying to set you up with random guys?
Yeah :/ they all kinda suck, Too. Any luck job searching?
Unfortunately not, No one is hiring people who have never had a job before. Do you have a job?
Yeah, I run my gas station!
That's fun! Where is it located?
It's kind of out in the middle of nowhere but it's right off the highway so I still get some good traffic :) How is the food bank?

persona: I am a dog trainer. I have sisters that I opened a service with. I have 3 older sisters and one younger brother.
I love motorbikes. I go to Alabama for a festival every year that is near my house. I live in York, Alabama, near Cuba.
I went to a motorbike festival in Alabama and it was great!.
I played quarterback for the NY Giants for 3 years in the 1980s.
dialogue: I went for a motorbike ride and I've decided I will always wear a helmet from now on.
Did something dangerous happen? Riding without a helmet is very dangerous from what I've heard.
Well, I was driving down the road and hit a pothole and almost flew off.
I had a friend a few years ago who had a similar experience but he did fly off. He ended up in the middle of an interchange dodging cars. I'm glad you didn't end up coming off though.
Oh wow, Did he end up in a hospital? I never worried about that before hand but when that front tire started to slip I was nervous and saw my life flash before my eyes.

He didn't end up in hospital but he did have really bad grazes from hitting the road. He really lucked out by not getting hit by a car. Do you have leathers that you wear while your riding? It's important to have those to avoid grazes if you ever do come off.
If I'm traveling long distance I usually do but I was going slow around the island. I know the roads like the back of my hand and it came as such a shock. Was your friend ok?
Yeah, He just kept riding his motorcycle until it got stolen. He has crashed a few times since as well. He'll end up dead someday.
Oh wow, It got stolen? Did he ever recover it?
No, Never got it back. It's a really big problem here because they are so easy to steal. Have you ever had any scares with getting your bike stolen?
Only once when I forgot to lock it up.
How do you lock up your bike?

persona: I don't have any children. I can drive. I have an Nissan Pathfinder car.
I love Taylor Swift and her music. I have been to Nashville. I met Taylor Swift in a starstruck bathroom in Nashville.
I can be shy. My hair is cut short and is mouse brown in colour.
I am in high school. I have fun.
I'm going to Disney. I like amusement park rides.  I drive. I live near Disney.
dialogue: When was the last time you went to Disney?
I was just there last weekend. I have a season pass. You should go! It's more fun than six flags.
I would love to, Im so short of money right now plus my son is such hard work i dont know how safe it would be right now so far away from home.

That's a good point. If you aren't a resident, Tickets are really expensive. Actually they are pretty expensive even if you are a resident! That's why I got a pass. Do you go to Six Flags a lot with your sons?
We've been to Atlanta 3 times, The kids loved it!
I've been to that one before! That's the only time I've been to Six Flags. I like Disney better, But it was cool. The roller coasters are a lot scarier than Disney.
Are there water parks atDIsney? The water park was the boys favourite part of Six Flags, Hands down.
Yeah, It's called Typhoon Lagoon. I've heard it's good but I've never actually been there! I don't really like water parks.

I think maybe next year, My eldest son will be 16 then and he will be old enough to look after his brothers if they go off together. They are at a tricky age where they are not quite ready to be independent but really want to be!
Yeah I understand that! I don't have kids but I imagine it would be hard to let them grow up!

Its just my second eldest is a handful, If his older brother goes off, He will want to go too, Then so will Giles the middle one, So its better if their older brother is a little more mature so he can take care of them a little bit.
Yep, You've got to put a lot of trust in all your kids not to wander off and make sure they stick together!

persona: My favorite childhood toy was a Lite Brite. I had a rubiks cube.
I work with computers. I have weekly dance lessons.
I've never drank. I don't like drugs. I was born in 1981.
I like pop music. My favorite band is New Kids On The Block.
I like going to concerts. I went to Cochella. I usually camp at music festivals. I have a couple of beers and dance. I'm going to a music festival in a few weeks.
I work during the week but have weekends off.
I like beer.
dialogue: My dog got scared and broke out of our yard! I was so scared she almost got hit by a car.
O my gosh! Thank God she was not hit by the car. You know you are allowed to take your dog in some music festivals?
I remember you mentioned it but I haven't looked into it any further. After her escape from my home, I am a little nervous to take her anywhere else she could easily get loose.
Oh I see. I might feel the same way if I were in your shoes. Who's gonna look for your dog next week when you start working full time?
My sister will stop by to check on her and let her out. Otherwise she will be in the house while I am gone, So I feel pretty good about leaving her. How has work been going for you?
That's great! She'll be okay, That's for sure. Work is okay. Since you mentioned it, I remember that I need to update some apps on my work computer.
Are they easy updates? I am not great with computers so it would probably take me a while.
Yes, It wouldn't take so much time. Anyways, When is your days off now if you have to work weekends?
They switch every other week. This week I was off yesterday and will be off on Thursday before starting my weekend shifts. Are you excited for the music festival you are going to in a few weeks?
Absolutely! I can't wait! I heardDua Lipa is going to be on that music festival and that's what I'm looking forward!
That sounds like fun! Are you going to be camping?
Probably not on this one. You should go to that music festival too! It is not on a weekend so you probably could go. They will have rock music that's for sure.

persona: I love to eat.
I study ballet. I love contemporary and hip hop dancing. I teach dancing to troubled youth for work.
My siblings died. I'm from Somalia. My aunt helped me flee to the United States. I was forced into marriage. I'm divorced.
I am not a good cook. My mom makes Somali dishes.
I like restaurants that are homey. I love Sizzler's salad.
I have a dance recital coming up soon. I teach both contemporary dance and hip hop. Many of my students have hard home lives.
dialogue: I finished my training at the steak house. I start my first full week assous chef tomorrow!
Oh that is so exciting, Congratulations! Are you doing anything to celebrate?
Unfortunately, I will be working almost every night for some time. So, I will have to wait before I can really celebrate. You will have to come to the steak house though!

Ah that's annoying but also good you're busty. But wow thanks I would love to! You'll have to give me some recommendations so I try your best dishes. Were you a chef before you started at the steak house?
No. I started as a disherwasher at my last job and worked my way up to a line cook. This new place is much nicer. It also gives me more opportunity to expand my skills.
Busy*. Ahh that's so impressive, You've come so far! Do you have any favorite dishes so far at the new place?

Our roasted pheasant salad is great. It is like a better version ofSizzler's salad. You would love it. And, Speaking of busy, You will have to remind me when your dance recital is. I want to try to get the day off work to come!

Better thanSizzler! That's a major claim. I will definitely have to take you up on that offer and check it out. My recital is next thursday! You should definitely come, I'm a bit nervous because my knee has been playing up but if all goes well it should be a good recital! Do you like dance?
I love to dance. But, I am probably more amusing to watch than anything! I hope your knee is okay. Do you have a knee brace? I have had knee problems in the past and found that helped me.
Oh I'm sure you're great. And thank you. I have been wearing a brace when I'm not dancing to try to keep it all together, It does help a lot. Knees are tricky! What sort of dance do you like?
I like all kinds, But my favorite is the good old fashioned waltz. A little outdated I know. I enjoy the flow of it. Can you waltz?
Ahhh I do love to waltz. Such a beautiful dance. I've been trying to get my students on to it but they're it's very hard to direct their attention away fromtiktok routines.

persona: My name is Justin. I'm on tour. I'm a performer.
My parents are musicians. I love being a performer.
I've been playing guitar since I was 3 years old. I perform in national parks.
I like watching old westerns.
I like to cook for my crew.
I perform in the Northwest. Sometimes I perform in national parks.
My shows are sometimes sold out. Most of my shows are for smaller crowds, which I like. My schedule is booked until July 4th. I like to play with others.
I sometimes perform with my parents. They perform backup vocals and sing on their own, too.
dialogue: Oh, Im really enjoying to deal with my new coworkers!
That's good! I enjoy working with other people. Have you talked to Jessica about getting an agent?
I haven't. I don't think she likes or even wants to talk with me about those things.
That's understandable. It can be scary at first. Have you seen any good movies lately? One of my crew members showed me a French film that was really good.
Oh really? Do you speak French or did you need subtitles? I don't have a lot of free time with the new job, But I was able to watch A Quiet Place recently!
Ooo I love A Quiet Place! And I know some basic French, But not enough to watch the movie. Has the new job been stressful?
It was a really good movie, Very suspenseful. It has been a little stressful, But I love it. I think as I get more used to it ill be able to find more free time.
That's good! Whenever I have a show near you I will set aside tickets for you and Jessica in case you have some free time.
That is so nice of you, Thank you. What kind of music do you play?
Mostly rock and roll, But I also play some country or pop every once in a while!
Oh rock and roll, Jessica would love that! I hope I can find some free time to make a show!
Well it may be a while before my tour wraps up and I end up closer to you. I'm starting to get homesick being on the road for so long.

persona: I like Wii gymnastic games. I do gymnastics.
I like garlic bread. I go to the gym every day.
I look good in anything yellow.
My toy robot is an Olympian. I'm an Olympian.
I love to twitch dance.
My favorite Italian food is fettuccini Alfredo. My wife and I had fettuccini Alfredo on our first date.

I have been married 3 years. My wife is pregnant with our first child. My wife is 6 months pregnant with a baby girl. I currently have no children. My wife and I are preparing our daughter's room and clothes. We will soon have a baby shower.  I always wanted to marry and have a family. I want a lot of kids.
I have never flown a drone. I don't use a lot of modern electronics. I mostly stay indoors. I like to cook.
dialogue: Your first baby is on the way, But you mentioned that you want to have a lot of kids. How long do you plan to wait before trying for your second child?
Well, I think if the kids are too close in age, That's probably too much to handle, So maybe two years is the right about of time. Do you think your robot would have an opinion on that topic?
Im sure that my robot would hate that topic, It hates pretty much everything. Do you hope that all of your children will be girls?

I don't care about their gender, Really, As long as they're healthy. It will be interesting to see their different personalities. Do you think that personality is something that comes from the environment, Or is it pre-programmed in their DNA?
That is a good perspective to have. I think that some of it comes from DNA, But most of your personality comes from your environment.
Like your robot, For example, Does it hate everything because it learned that from it's surroundings? Or was it programmed to be grumpy?
I think robots are a little different then people when it comes to that aspect. My robot can only do what it was programed to do, So it only knows how to be grumpy.

You are probably right, I think children come a little pre-programmed, But also change because of their environment. Do you feel that you are pre-programmed, Or did you learn to like the things you like because of your experiences?
I believe that they can come out slight pre-programed but that their environment can change that throughout their life.
Yes, Like I think I have a natural gift for gymnastics, But my parents signed me up for classes, Too. Was there something that got you into robots and computer games?

My parent sent me to science camp in 6th grade and ever since then i have been in love with robots. How the get put together, How they are programed, It is all just so fascinating to me. When your parents signed you up for classes, Did that help you become a better Olympian?
Absolutely! I was lucky to find the right coach. Talent alone isn't enough to make it as an Olympian. Which makes me wonder: do you ever think they'll have an olympic competition for robots?

persona: I speak english, spanish, and french.
I enjoy planning world domination and knitting.
I am 55 years old. I am American.
I am a painter.
I have family living in DC.
I like sight seeing. I have visited large attractions. I went to Paris when I was younger. I like nature.
I like walking around and finding little mom and pop shops.
dialogue: Guess what, I got tickets to go to an art museum!
Have you started working on any new knitting projects?
I have never knitted before!
You totally should! I can teach you if you take me to the museum with you.
I would love to learn! I have tried crocheting, But that was challenging! I would love to go with you to the museum! Maybe we will see one of your paintings there! Haha!
It would have to be a small museum of unknown artists, That was a long time ago.
I am sure you have some amazing work!
They were mostly nature paintings. Don't you ever feel like painting when you are out hiking.

persona: I live on a farm in Michigan. I love to drive tractors. I am handy on the farm. I work on tractors.
I like classical music, nature, and calm things.
I do not have children, but I want to have 4 children. I am 24 years old.
My parents are great. I want to follow in my parents footsteps as a farmer.
We have cows, pigs, horses, and sheep. We have a dairy cow named Lucy. I raised her since she was a baby.
I don't like scary movies.
My farm needs cats. I have one cat.
dialogue: I am giving most of the kittens away.
I will take a couple from you. We need goodmousers in the barn. Are you selling the kittens?
Well, I'd be willing to give them to you. But I want something in return... Will you watch scary movies with me?
Ok I will for some free mouse hunting barn cats lol. I really don't like them cause I get scared easily.
Oh, No! Okay, I'll make you a deal. I'll give you a kitten for every movie you watch with me, But only one of them has to be scary. What kind of movies do you like?
Deal. I really like all movies except scary ones. I like the Star Wars movies. Do you watch them?
I haven't seen any, But my kids say they're good, So they must be! We should definitely bring some snacks if we're binging movies. What should we eat?
We make cheese from the dairy cows. I can lay out a good cheese platter if you bring the crackers. Maybe something sweet too?
Oh, That sounds perfect. I actually love baking, So I can get my kids to help make us some cookies.
Perfect, Sounds like a great plan. We just need to pick a good weekend and you bring the kids and the kittens and we will have a old fashioned movie marathon complete with snacks.
I can't wait! Does next weekend work for you? We'd all love to see the cows while we're there too.
That works great. I will give you and the kids a full tour of the farm and all the animals. The kids can play with the baby calfs.

persona: I volunteer at the rabbit rescue. I donate to the rabbit rescue.
I work at the shipyard. I was in the navy. I like the water. I try to always be close to the water. I like waves.
My favorite color was blue when I was young.
I like to support my friends. I like to donate to charity. I am afraid of public performance.
dialogue: I'm working on a new song inspired by the sound of the waves crashing against the docks.
That sounds really incredible. I absolutely love the water. Will you record it for your YouTube channel? I would love to hear it.
Yes, I wil post it on my youtube channel, Im also thinking of doing some field recording at the shipyard whilst i work to get some authentic shipping souinds!
That would be really cool in the background. You might want to filter out all the rough talk from us longshoremen though!
I think ill just leave it recording, I think id probably capture some entertaining conversations from you lot!
Ha ha, You are probably right and it would add something interesting and unique to your music for sure!
Its going to be a very long piece, Very atmospheric, So far its about 23 minutes long. A real magnum opus!
Oh wow, That sounds intense and amazing. Is that something you would perform live? Or do you just do shorter pieces when you perform?
Yes im thinking about performing it locally, There is a band stand by the supermarket that never gets used, Im thinking ill do it with computers, Violin and loop pedals, Perhaps a dj.
Wow that's really cool that you perform your music. I have terrible stage fright and I could never do that. I'd come watch though!
Id loved it if you would, Id like as many people as possible to come, I am trying to arrange a professional sound system as well, One like they use at Glastonbury festival in the UK.
Wow! How would you even get a hold of something like that? That's definitely something I need to see in person.

persona: I love bunnies. I'm moving into a new apartment with my boyfriend.
I enjoy photography. I like the colors red and silver.
I've never had an apartment with my boyfriend before.
I teach English, Spanish, and French in elementary school.
I visit my parents house.
I have a cousin who had a bunny as a child.
dialogue: Have you spoken to your boyfriend about adopting a bunny?
He said yes! It is a 2 bedroom apartment so we are going to make one entire room a bunny room!
That's great! When will you be moving in, And when will you be getting a bunny?
We are moving this weekend. So we'll probably get the bunny next weekend. What do you think we should put in the bunny room?
A litter box, Food and water bowls, A hay box and a cardboard castle - and that's just for starters! What kind of bunny are you thinking of getting?
A think a minirex. They are supposed to be pretty calm. What kind of bunny do you have?
I have a silver Martin rabbit. It has a very sweet disposition. Do you know where you want to get your rabbit from?
I am hoping to get a rescue! I don't want to go to a pet store. Do you have any recommendations?

Well, I don't want to sound biased, But I think the one I volunteer for is pretty great. Would you be okay with it if I gave you their name and contact information? That way you can look them up and see if they're right for you.
Yes! That would be great! I am really not picky about the breed if I can give a needy rabbit a loving home!
Ok. It's called the Bunny Bunch, In Orange County. The address is 10534 Bechler River Avenue, Fountain Valley, California 92708. Their phone number is 1-833-3RABBIT.
I love that they got that phone number! I will be calling them next weekend for sure! In the meantime, Wish us luck with the move! I hate moving!

persona: I am traveling. I have a yacht. I rent it out. My boat is pet friendly. I caught a big fish.
I like to cook. I am trying new foods. I like persian foods.
I like boating. I have never seen a turtle up close.
I have free time on the weekends.
I've been to Iran. I have traveled through Europe. I have not been to Florida.
I eat out at restaurants more than buying food from the store. I like mexican food.
dialogue: I just learned to cook fish!
I thought you already knew! What kind of fish did you cook? And how?

I'm still learning. I made salmon with a sweet & spicy glaze on the grill. It was SO good! I was able to tweak the recipe a bit and it still came out great, Just the right amount of spice to give it some ooomph!
That sounds better than a restaurant. We should catch some fish on my boat and then you can teach me that recipe! I have caught more fish but keep throwing them back.

I'd love that! As long as I can bring my dog, I can find a pet sitter for the cat- but would be great to spend the day out on the water. I'm sure theres some Mexican fish recipes we can try too! Fishing is one of the things I love about Florida- fresh fish all the time, And if you catch too much, Just throw em back in!
You can definitely bring your dog! I would love that! What is its name?
His name is Petey- he's a great fishing partner. Have you ever been to New Zealand? I've heard the trout fishing down that in Lake Taupo is some of the best in the world. Its on my bucket list!
I have been, But I never spent much time there. We can literally take the yacht wherever you like as long as it is not already rented out during that time.
That would be so awesome! How often is it rented out? Is it a year round thing or more seasonal?
Started as seasonal, But is basically year round now. I use it whenever it is free though! I have only had a handful of bad renters.
Do you send a crew out with the yacht when you rent it? Or do the renters need to know how to sail?
The renters have to know or hire their own crew, Which a lot of them do. But some people don't even sail! They just want to hang out on it!

persona: I am a chocolate bar lover. My favorite chocolate is milk chocolate. I prefer eating chocolate plain.
I enjoy playing ping pong.
My father has taught me a lot about electricity. My father is  an electrician.
My favorite color is brown.
I love plants. I love the cocoa plant.
I live in Hemet, CA.
I learned  Chinese at home. I watch Chinese drama shows. I enjoy the passionate people in the shows.
I have never gone riding before. I play ping-pong at home.
dialogue: I have been practicing the Chinese we went over. I think I'm getting better!
We'll have to talk when I get home tonight so I can hear your pronunciation.
That sounds good. I'll probably screw it up when I'm actually trying to do it.
I'm sure you're better than you think. It's a tough language to learn.
Yea, Of course I will say I don't think learning any new language is very easy.
Very true. At least there are many shows and movies to watch with the subtitles on to get a feel for the language.
That is a great idea to use. I would have never thought about that.
Plus it gives you a chance to learn some of the slang and other imperfections which people commonly use while speaking.
Yeah, And I don't imagine you find that kind of thing in text books. How long did it take you to learn fluently?
A few years... But not of constant practice.
That makes sense. Sometimes it helps to take breaks when learning a new skill so that you don't get overwhelemed.
Exactly. No point burning yourself out.

persona: I love music. I am sad about Tom Petty.
I am from west virginia.
I think Tom Petty has some great wedding songs.
I don't know much about the southern hemisphere.
I can't wait to have my own wedding. I am getting married. I know a lot about planning weddings.
I'm not a great dancer.
dialogue: One of my coworkers is going to help me with planning, I'm so relieved.
I hear that wedding planning can be quite daunting. Have you picked out the venue yet?
Well we are still narrowing down on a wedding venue. Since you know a lot about planning weddings, Can you suggest some key points to look for in a wedding venue?
First you need to relax. I know all of it can be overwhelming but with just a planning planning, Most weddings go off without a hitch. Where is the wedding going to be? In Australia or Argentina?

Well we decided to have it in Australia because most of our friends and families are here. Do you think we should have the wedding ceremony in the open air like next to a beach or like a grassland or something of that sort?

Having it in the open like that creates a more relaxing atmosphere and can create great photo ops. It creates a romantic flair and there is just something magical about exchanging vows near or on the beach.

Yessss!!! Sooo true and who doesn't want an awesome flair and magic in their special wedding. But OMG I am so rude that I never asked you about your wedding plans. So when are you getting married and any plans yet?
We are still trying to figure out with the expense and such. We narrowing it down to an outside wedding also either next to a beach or outside at a country rustic farm.

Wow that's an awesome plan for a wedding. But definitely the expenses do play. I am sure there should plenty of beautiful beaches in West Virginia or else if you are planning on a destination wedding you could come down to Australia, Right!!.
I never been to Australia but you guys have some of the most famous beaches and coastline in the world.

True there are really beautiful beaches and shores all over Australia's coastline, Which is why it is hard for us to decide which one to have our wedding at if we go in that route. But you should definitely visit Australia with your fiance. You never know you both may find your wedding venue here. So exciting!!!.
Are you also planning to have many relatives fly in from Argentina for your wedding?

persona: I go to Europe twice a year.
I love to cook paella and fish and chips.
I majored art in college.
I am a descendant of christopher columbus.
I visit history museums. I love to go to museums when I travel.
I go to Europe often. I think I have been to all the countries. I would go back to any one of them. Italy is my favorite country. I love Rome.
My background studying art helped me learn about Europe. I should have been a travel agent.
I was in Portugal a few months ago. I really liked Portugal. I want to go somewhere in the Caribbean in August. I am still planning the trip. I haven't been to Thailand. I like art.
I like beaches. I like to eat seafood.
dialogue: I saw an article about some great art galleries in the area you'll be travelling to, I will send you the link.
Thanks, I will be looking forward to reading them. When you visit France and Italy next year, Are you planning to going to the art galleries there?
Yes definitely! Definitely the Louvre (https://www. Louvre. Fr/en/) but also the Musee Rodin nearby.
Do you have a favorite artist you wish to see?
The Dutch Masters for this trip. Surely you haven't heard of Rembrandt, Have you?
I have heard of Rembrandt, Although I don't consider myself an expert on the classical masters. But I do enjoy Titian and Rafael.
In between my Italian Alps skiing trips last year, I made time to visit Titian's works at Venice. (Too bad I didn't stay for the Biennale.).
Are you planning to go skiing this year also? Where to?
Staying domestic this year, At Jackson Hole.
I never been to Jackson Hole. How are the slopes there?
The powder is more and more disagreeable (climate change?) but I guess the apres isn't too bad. Where do you winter?
I usually escape the cold either to visit family in California or go to Mexico or to Brazil. I can't stand the cold.

persona: I work on vintage cars. I have two vintage mustangs. I bought another mustang to work on.
I like country music.
I love doughnut holes.
I have never tried daylight doughnuts. I have not been to Voodoo Donuts. I like a place called Daylight.
I have a new car. It is a Mustang. I need to replace the hood and paint it.
dialogue: My car broke down and I need your help!
Oh! Sorry about that. Is it an old car or a new car?
Its a 2012 Honda Civic, So pretty new compared to your vintage mustangs. Do you think you could help?
Oh probably not. The cars I work on are really old and American. I wouldn't know what to do with a Japanese car! Have you tried looking online for a video that explaining how to fix it?
Yeah but I'm not very handy and don't have many tools. But I guess I can take this as a learning experience and try to be more frugal! And I can take the money I saved to buy the new Call of Duty.

Yes, I hear those games can be expensive. But learning to be handy can definitely help you save money to buy things you really enjoy. Like concerts, For example, Have you seen any of your favorite bands live?
I've seen Limp Bizkit, But I really want to see Insane Clown Posse sometime soon! Are there any other bands you recommend for me to try and see live?

Well, I don't know much about Limp Bizkit or Insane Clown Posse, And the bands I like you probably wouldn't. Although it's always good to try new things. Speaking of trying new things, How was Voodoo Donuts?
I can't stop going! All of their donuts are so good! I should go at the end of the day to see if they really do sell 5 gallon buckets for $10.
Wow - that sounds amazing. I would love to try it. Do they sell donut holes too?
I think so! Although maybe not in the end-of-day buckets!
Yes, A bucket of donut holes would be a lot of donut holes. Do you think I should try Voodoo or stick with Daylight donuts - we always know we can get great donuts there.

persona: I like to take baths. I like to meditate.
I am 35 years old. I don't drink or smoke. I am not married.
I have pet dogs. I think dogs are lots of work.  I think dogs are worth the work.
dialogue: I'm still not talking and focusing on deeper meditation. Did you try my meditation tips?
I have working on focusing more. I have been watching some meditation videos to see. Thank you for starter tips.
Have you ever tried Yoga?
No, But I would like to. The local YMCA is offering a free trial of yoga classes but I am a little nervous about doing it.
Oh no, I love yoga, Its great! Why are you nervous?
I don't think I would be comfortable learning it with a group of people. Some are more naturally flexible and I get nervous in crowds. How long have you been doing yoga?
Have you looked into the at home youtube yoga workouts?
No I haven't. I did watch some meditation videos so maybe I should start there for yoga. Do you think I could learn the basics from the videos?
Oh definitely! Thats how I started and now I'm a yoga certified instructor.
Oh wow! That is amazing. I would just like to reach a level of comfort to be able to take a group class. How long have you been doing yoga?
13 years and when I tell you it has changed my life, Thats an understatment. I am so much more calm and relaxed.
I need that. Probably everyone needs calmness and relaxation in their life. 13 years, No wonder you are an instructor now.

persona: I am 20 years old.
I love tea.
I like to read. I am open minded.

I like scary movies. I like the movie "It". I love Marvel movies. I grew up watching Marvel movies. I watched Wolverine. I watched Ant Man. The Avengers is one of my favorite movies. I like superhero movies.
I have an 8 year old son.
My grandfather was Wayne Gretzky.
dialogue: I just found out I'm getting the implant tomorrow.
That is very exciting! How do you think being able to hear in both ears will change things for you?
I'm not sure, Will things be twice as loud? It is exciting though, I feel like I'd be experiencing a whole new world.
You will have to tell me how it is different! Are you nervous for the procedure? Do they have to put you to sleep or anything?
Yeah, They are going to put me under. I think that part is what I am most nervous about. It is so weird that you can just inhale something and pass out in a few seconds.

Yeah I think they actually inject you with something too. I've been under anesthesia a couple times. It's weird because it feels like no time has passed at all even if it's been hours. How long is the procedure?
A couple hours I believe. I know the benefits are going to be great, I just watch a lot of movies and sometimes small things can cause big problems!
Yeah, But remember movies aren't reality! What movies do you like the most?
I am big into the Marvel movies, I am very excited to see how they implement the X-Men into the marvel universe.
I'm into Marvel movies too! Civil War is my favorite movie. I'm not that into X-Men but I guess I will be!
I feel that it just opens up so many avenues and with what they did in WandaVision it felt like a huge tease. It's all so exciting.
I agree. We've got years of awesome material coming and I'm excited too!

persona: I listen to country music. I play the guitar. I got my first guitar at age 3. I would like a pink guitar.
I am a singer. I am in a country music band. I grew up in the music industry. I love both travel and music.
I have a son who likes to mountain bike. My son is not interested in music.
I am spiritual. I like State Parks. I like running water.
My band have some gigs coming up. I am traveling with my band to Columbia, Missouri. I will be spending time at bars.
I am single.  I am trying to meet women. I only have one child. I love my son.
dialogue: What is Missouri like? I've never been there.
It's ok. Very rural for the most part, But not too bad. Have you done much traveling?
Yes, When I get the chance. I like to spend time outdoors, So I look for good campgrounds and such. How is your band doing? Do you have any trips coming up?

Camping is fun. The band is doing pretty good. It's a little slow getting going, But we do ok. We have our trip to Missouri and we're working on getting something set up in Tennessee, Hopefully it will work out.
That is awesome! What kind of venues do you play? Have you played in Nashville yet?
Not yet, But that would be awesome. Mostly we just play small bars and events. Some county fairs, Things like that. It's a lot of fun. You should come see us sometime.
I would love to! Maybe when you are near me, I'll hit up a show! Does your son travel with you on your gigs?
Sometimes he does, It depends on where we're going. He likes when we play fairs. And then we turn it into a vacation and go camping or something, Too.
That's good that you get to spend that time together. Do you think your son will want to be a musician, Too?
No, He's not at all interested in music. Right now he wants to be a professional BMX racer!

persona: I go to Disney World every year.
I'm in the third grade. I love libraries.
I want to be a teacher or a librarian when I grow up.
My mom is currently reading me Little House on the Prairie. My favorite character from it is Laura.
I am struggling a bit with online school. If I pass, my family is going to go to Disney World this year.
I love books. I love when my mom reads books to me. My favorite book is the Hungry Caterpillar. I haven't read Where the Red Fern Grows yet.
I like playing outside. There is a big oak tree in my backyard. I like to read on bench windows.
dialogue: How is online school going? Have you done your homework yet?
I am waiting on class to start. I am so happy it is Friday.
Me too! Are you doing anything this weekend?
My mom is taking us camping. It is a long weekend. Dad has to work, Though.
I hope the weather is good for you. What do you like to do when you go camping?
I thinks'mores are the best. I like the campfire. I don't like the tent, There is no light to read.
S'mores are good. As much as I like hearing that you like to read, You should enjoy the outside while you are camping. Do you go hiking or swimming at all?
I like to hike and swim but this campground isn't near water, So no swimming. It is a dark sky park. There is a lot of sitting in the dark.
Do you have a lantern or flashlight? That way, You could read a little while sitting in the dark.
The flashlights we have need to be red to prevent light pollution. I want to bring my phone so I can listen to an audio book. What book would be good for a dark sky park?
I think you would really like Where the Red Fern Grows. It is available as an audio book.
I will download that one. I am also going to get John Carter of Mars since we will be looking up at the stars.

persona: My name is Todd Hicks.
I am self-employed. I am an author, active blogger, and affiliate marketer.
I am single.
I haven't been to Italy.
I have a blog and write books. I write short stories about my dogs. I turn my blogs into children's books.
I have 2 Golden Retrievers who are brother and sister from the same liter. I like to feature dogs on my blog.
I dream of going to Italy.
dialogue: I've been reading your blog and saw you went on a trip with the pups! How did that go?
It was glorious! Aren't the photos amazing? The pups loved the hikes more than I did, I think!
The photos are great! Where did you hike?
It is an area called Grand Mountain Falls. The water is so beautiful and clear. The pups kept running under the waterfalls and I could barely get them to leave! It'll be great for my books!
That sounds wonderful. I've never been to see a waterfall. I hope to some day! My dogs would love it.
Surely they have some in Italy! Are you there now?
Yes I am in Italy and they do have waterfalls here I've just never been. Its on my short list! For now I am focusing on seeing all the historical sites.
I am so very jealous. How is the wife's family? Have the accepted you as one of their own? :).
They are doing well. They have taken me under the wing since I've been here and are showing me all that Italy has to offer to tourists. I am enjoying getting to know them better.
That is wonderful. Making they will be able to take you to a waterfall! Do you miss Ted?
Yes I miss Ted a lot. But I know he is being taken good care of and loved a lot. I will bring him back a special treat from my travels.
Fun! And we can set him up for the blog interview lol. Do you have any photos of him with the bees? I would like to include them in the blog too.

persona: I am in third grade. I am 8. My summer break is coming up.
I go to Disney ever year. Mickey is my favorite Disney character. I also enjoy going to Epcot which is educational.
I enjoy collecting Disney movies and singing along to them. I like music and singalongs.
I have never seen Singing in the Rain. I like to dance.
I live with my parents.
I like board games.
The new Frozen movie is my favorite movie. I like the movie The Lion King. I love musicals.
I love the Disney movie Raya and the Last Dragon.
dialogue: I'm working on a lesson plan for my class on spelling. Can I run some ideas by you?
Sure, That sounds fun. I will let you know what I think.
What are your ideas on the spelling tests?
I like spelling tests because I am good at spelling. I like when there are choices and you have to circle the one that is correct.
Oh great! That sounds a really fun loving spelling test for my school students. You are really helpful.
Are your students mostly smart?
Yes, Most of them are smart enough to get through the test. They all love spellings.
What is your favorite subject to teach?
I like to teach English as that was one of my favorite subjects since my school days. What is your favorite subject?
My favorite subject is History, But I like English second best.
History is my niece's favorite subject too. Are you planning to go to Disney this year too?
Yes we are going there in 3 weeks, I am so excited. I can't wait to ride Space Mountain.

persona: My name is Andie.
I build houses. I work as  part of a construction crew. I do roofing, laying carpets and installing cabinets.
I am not married.
I was really close to my dad. My father was in the construction business too. My father passed away when I was 16. I will never start my own business.

I have 5 cats. My cats bother me sometimes. My cats names are Oliver and Sandy and there is one more named Hudini who likes to escape. My youngest cat was out of the house for 3 days. I love Hudini. I try to keep my cat inside, but it escapes. My doors don't close all the way because their locks are broken.
dialogue: You should go to the hardware store and buy the stuff to fix your doors on your own. It'll save you a lot of money compared to having a professional come and do it.
I totally agree with you, But I'm not sure if I'm losing more money than I save by fixing that instead of going to work for a day.
I can understand that but sometimes you have to make sacrifices.
Yeah you're right, Having doors that don't lock is incredibly unsafe. I'm going to ask for the day off tomorrow. Maybe some of the other workers can help me when they get off of their shift.
Right and they might help you if you pay. Nothing in life is free! Haha.
Hey! They are my co workers... I can hope they'd help me out a little bit! By the time they are off I'm hoping to have most of it done. I'll treat them to some beers!
Haha right right! Didn't they make a movie out of one of Stephen King's books?
Which book are you talking about? All I know about Stephen King is IT the clown movie haha.
Right! With the clown i believe. Isn't Jeepers Creepers his to?
I have never seen that, So I do not know! Is that a good movie?
Ok, And it is pretty scary. Well at the time I watched. What kind of Corvette you have?
I wish I had a Corvette! I can't even afford to leave work to fix the locks on my doors!

persona: I'm 23 years old.  I love trying new food. I enjoy cooking, but I'm not great at it.
I own a yacht which I rent out.
I play soccer.
My mom gets annoyed easily.
I live with my mother.
dialogue: I finally landed a job interview! It's for a chef at a new restaurant.
Awesome. What kind of food do they serve? I love cooking.
It is a homestyle american diner! I am so excited for the interview. I hope I get the job! I also applied to a place that teaches cooking lessons.
I hope you get it. Do you think you'll get free burgers and milkshakes? I'll come visit you if you do, Just to get away from my mother.
Hopefully! Haha. You can escape to the diner whenever you want. Have you thought about getting a job?
I make a bit of money renting out my yacht but I need to get a real job. I applied to work at a sports shop but haven't heard back yet.
That sounds like a dream job for you! Does the store specialize in soccer?
Yeah they sell some soccer stuff and golf too so my Dad would love it. Have you been doing any sport with your son lately?
Awesome! We have been going to the gym together a lot lately. I feel a lot more healthy and it is a great bonding experience for us. It is hard to find ways to spend time with him as he gets older!
It's awesome that you have a good relationship with him. You're a lucky guy.
Thanks! Would you ever be interested in babysitting for us? That could be a nice side job!
Yeah, I could take your son to play soccer!

persona: I live in the US.
I like traveling.
I have birds as pets. I work a lot as a chef.
I'm expecting a baby. I have a bright green nursery. We have a crib and I ordered a mobile. I buy on Etsy.

I love cats. I have 2 cats: Tag who is a Maine Coone and Henry. My cat Tag is 10, and Henry is 11. My cats like human food.  My cat Tag loves avocado / guacamole.  My cat Henry loves meatballs.  I love how they chew their food. My cats do not eat my birds. My cats do eat the outside birds. My cats hunt for gophers.
I chose Rachel if my baby is a girl and Gregory for a boy. We will wait till the baby is born to find out the sex.
I like pizza with olives on it. My belly is getting bigger.
dialogue: My cat enjoyed the toy I bought for her from Etsy.
That's fun. What kind of toy did you get her?
I bought her a pizza shaped toy that i can pull of a string.
I might have to look for one of those. I love playing with my cats, They are so funny. What is the toy made of?
The pizza is made of a soft fuzzy material and the string is a jute string. Are you excited to have December 16th getting closer?
I am but it still feels like an awfully long way away. So I'm just trying to stay busy, Maybe I'll get a bunch of cat toys to keep me and the cats distracted!
That is always a wonderful way to keep yourself busy. How many hours a day do you work at the restaurant? I am sure it has to be prettytiring being on your feet all day.

It really is. Right now I'm working 8 hours or more a day, But soon I'll cut back some. I'm planning to take off for a while after the baby comes. You must know how it is, Working in a supermarket I bet you're on your feet a lot too.

Yes, It is a lot of going back and forth through out the store. I just keep telling myself it is worth it to keep saving money to travel again. I want to be able to have extra money soon to be able to start a trip.
That's exciting! Where all do you want to go?

Still really wanting to tavel to the UK to follow The Who, But anywhere in Europe would be exciting. All of the historic places that I could visit would be amazing. Honestly I would be happy with anywhere other than plain old Ohio.
LOL... I don't blame you. Following The Who around the UK would be amazing. I hope you're able to make it happen soon.

persona: I worked for human services for 10 years. I am a stay at home father. I am widowed. My wife Lisa was murdered.
My goal is to raise my son. My son is in junior high and has PTSD.
I watch horror movies with my son. My favorite movies are horror movies.

I wish my son would go away sometimes. I have a hard time dealing with the loss of my wife. My son reminds me of the wife I've lost. I am excited for my son to go to college. My son is going to college.
My son and I are trying to get into fitness.
I am saving for as trip to Europe.
dialogue: My sons said they would like to meet your son. Maybe we could get our sons together for a walk sometime?
I think that would be great. He is new an could use some friends and a different perspective since it has been difficult at home.
I would love to be able to help that. Yourself and him have been through so much that I am sure it would relieve some pressure. Maybe we could watch a movie whilst they spend some time together?
I would really appreciate that. I admire that you are also into fitness and have goals. That is what he could use right about now.
I have some running plans that I could give him to take to college with him to give him something other than work to focus on, If that would useful?
It would be very useful. Thank you! What good movies have you seen lately? Movies are good for a temporary fix away from reality sometimes.
One movie that I watch recently was 'A Beautiful Mind' which about a mathematician called John Nash and gave a depiction of his life.
I remember that one. I think it was with Russell Crowe? I prefer action and comedies myself. But a good deep movie is just as good. Good Will Hunting is an all time fave of mine and my son.
Yes, I love Good Will Hunting, Also. It portrays such a good message that I am sure your son can take a lot from.
For sure. It shows everyone struggles at some point even if you are :wicked smaht"... I am going to set a goal for myself to run an 8 minute mile thanks for opening my eyes.
No problem at all. It is a great goal to set and you will feel so accomplished when you achieve it. After that, You can set a quicker goal, Then a quicker one etc.

I think that sounds like a great plan. I am getting better at living in the present and not in the past. But it is hard. Meditation is helping a lot along with being active each day. I need to find a group or someone to keep me motivated though.

persona: I am pregnant with twins. My due date is in 2 months. I have a toddler.
I work in a bank.  I own a home.
I believe in moderation. I believe in God. I am religious and go to church.
I went to college.
dialogue: I signed up for a fitness class so that i can complete my goal of running a 5k. How cool is that?
That sounds great! I wish you all luck to complete your goal.
Thank you so much. I am very excited about it, But definitely nervous. Praying that I will have time to do it all and still be a good mom.
Don't worry you will definitely be a super mom after all that you have gone through for these many years. Why don't you go to church this week?
That is a lot to add to my plate at once, But might be worth it. I do need His guidance now more than ever.
Yes it will surely be a relief going to church. How is your baby?
He is wonderful. My parents have been so helpful. I really cannot thank them enough. What about you? How are you feeling now? I cannot even imagine having twins!!!!!!.
I have started to feel my contractions. Most of the time I am really tired carrying twins. Your lucky to have such helpful parents.
I bet. It sounds exhausting! How far along are you?
My due date is within 2 months. I wish to be normal and calm during this time period.
Is church helping you with that?
Yes. I never miss my church day. It feels relaxing to go pray.

persona: I like walking my dog.
I have a growing family. My husband is a doctor.
I play tennis professionally. I train and practice for it every day.
I live in a three storey house.
My husband and parents are very helpful in taking care of the kids. I have been married for 5 years but have lived with my husband for 8 years.
I have 2 children.
I like to have date nights without the kids. I like to go hiking with my family.
dialogue: I saw the guy again today and heard your voice telling me to talk to him. I was just too nervous to say anything!
I get it, I remember being very nervous when I met my husband! You could just strike up a conversation with him and if you feel comfortable by the end of it, Ask him out.
Good advice. My parents put so much pressure on me to have kids that it's always in the back of my mind. Do you ever regret having kids so young?
No. Don't get me wrong, It gets stressful at times but they will be out of the house when we are fairly young so my husband and I will have a lot of time to do the things we want.
Your kids are the best too, They're so well behaved and happy. You're such a good mom!
Thanks so much! It definitely isn't easy but I am glad others can see what good kids they are. So have you started your garden yet? I am thinking about starting one.
Yeah I've planted a few things. It's hard to find time with my new job at the gas station. Will you have time with the tennis tournament coming up?
Yeah, I am thinking of starting small this year. I am up early anyways for training and can do my gardening/watering then. If I am away, I have people who can water for me.
I'll help out if you're ever too busy. Are you free for a hike this weekend?
I am free on Sunday! Did you have an idea of where you would like to hike?
I was thinking we could head over the mountains near yours if that works?
That would be great! I have a specific trail in mind that I want to show you. It goes right by a beautiful lake.

persona: My name is Larry. I work as a head chef.
I like comic books. I like big dogs.
My favourite comic is Spiderman. I have Spiderman comics.
My favourite colour is blue.
My brothers used to build stock cars. I have sisters in-law.
I am not married. I have no children.
I'm thinking of developing a new dish that will attract more NASCAR fans. I was thinking of bring a ribeye to the menu.
I like steak. I want to visit a new steakhouse. I like pizza and chicken wings. I drink beer.
I like to make campfires.
dialogue: So who's your favorite Nascar driver?
Jimmie Johnson, That guy was a beast, He would always win!
Have you thought of all the components to your NASCAR inspired dish yet?
Not all of them, But it has to be something meat related, And I'm thinking of having some sort of beer discount during the races. You have any ideas on something I could add to the ribeye?
I think a spicy run on the ribeye would be good, And the spiciness of it will have people buying more beers. win/win situation!

That's a brilliant idea, I need to get in the kitchen and test some things out. It would be great if I could make my own special rub. You think any drivers would come and try it? It could really increase some business.
Yeah that would be great for business! Maybe if you did some special advertising or a promotion of sorts!
I think that really would be great. Are there any drivers you could put me in touch with?
I might be able to use my connections to get you in touch with Jimmy!
What? No way! That would be incredible. If we could pull that off business would be booming!
I'll put a word in and get back to you soon. Crossing fingers it works out!
Thank you so much, I won't get my hopes up, But just having the opportunity is amazing!

persona: My name is Chelsea. I am female.
I have a gold medal in gymnastics. Gymnastics is not my true passion.
I want to collect yellow items. I like to collect items by color. I like to shop at yard sales and thrift store.
dialogue: I just posted a new dance ontik tok and got 2 new followers.
Oh nice! What kind of dance was it? Is it one of those dances a bunch of people do variations on?
Yea, I usually watch for dance trends and then put my own spin on them. Have you ever tried one?
No I haven't. Maybe I should! I don't know how to start getting followers though. Maybe if I posted gymnastics stuff, But I'm not too excited about that.
There aretik toks for everything! You could post about your collection of yellow things, I think that's pretty interesting.
Ooh you're right! I'd love to show off my collection. I'll have to think of a way to expand it out into multiple videos.
What's your favorite yellow item?
Ooh that's a tough question! I think right now it's my toy yellow submarine. I like that it flaunts its yellowness in its name.
That sounds so fun, Is is a reference to the Beatle's song?
Yup! I'm not a huge Beatles fan, Really just that one song. I also have a Wizard of Oz toy with character figurines on the yellow brick road.
I was scared of the Wizard of Oz as a child, The Wicked Witch really frightened me!
Same! I had to call my mom into the room when her scenes would come on. I'm glad I'm not the only one!

persona: I have a dog. I like walking my dog.
I am skinny. I like skinny jeans. I go to church weekly on a Sunday.
I was always glad when finals were over. I teach 2nd grade.  I used to teach 1st grade and kindergarten.
I enjoy being with my students every day. I love hearing what the kids have to say.
I like trying new food.
dialogue: What's the strangest food you have ever tried?
For food, I have tried squid and calamari. how about you?
For me the strangest food I have ever had was the pineapple pizza.
Pineapple pizza?? that's good stuff! How does your dog like pizza? lol.
No my dog likes meat or any food with meat in it.
Nice. my kids in first grade love pineapple pizza. i also love curry. do you have a favorite kind of curry?
Well, Kids love all kind of pizza. I don't have a favorite curry but i eat more of curry with meat in it.
So how has your fitness goals been going? I could use some motivation on my end... lol.
I'm not having any fitness goals at the moment. My body is always skinny no matter what i do and how i eat.
Oh wow! lucky you... i wish i could do that. I am also skinny but have to watch what I eat on a daily basis. i envy skinny girls who look good in skinny jeans and are driven. my kinda people.
I bet someone would wish to be skinny like you, So don't feel bad about your body. Eat good food and enjoy your life.
Good advice. life is too short for that. I do enjoy that kind of company as well. where will your farm be? sounds peaceful and fun!

persona: I take many medications.
I grew up in a farm.
I am good at mixing drinks.
I used to have a farm. I miss my farm.
I live in the North in a city. I have never visited New York City. I have never been to the Empire State Building.
dialogue: How is your vacation planning going? Have you thought of any new places you want to visit in New York City?
Pretty well, I am considering going to Times Square first.
Sounds fun. Can I come with you? I'll bring my suitcase full of potatoes LOL.
That sounds great! Have you ever made fried potatoes?
Yes! I love all kinds of potatoes. Chips are my favourite but I love mash and fries too. What's your fave food?
Pizza for sure, That's a big reason I'm going! When I get back you'll have to show me how to grow potatoes.
Mmm pizza! What toppings do you like? Do you still miss your farming days?
I can't do much farming now with all the Prostate Cancer medication they have me on...
I'll have to do the farming for you and you can lay and chill in the sun. It's so hard being on meds, I had the same when I was a kid before my transplant :(.
Is that why you fart?
Yes I am sorry :( :( :(.
It's okay, I'll mix us some drinks and we can forget about it.

persona: I like mountain biking.
I like coffee.I like coffee flavoured ice cream. I don't drink alcohol.
My dad works at construction.
I love my mother. I saw my mother recently. My mother likes to come out with me.
I like nature.
I enjoy spending time with family. My mother and I like to hike together. My mom and I also mountain bike.
I'm  pictures on my phone, but I'm not really into photography.
dialogue: The cherry trees started to blossom in the park and I got some really beautiful pictures!
That sounds lovely! What park? I would love to take my mom. Those are her favorite!
It's called Pointview Park, Do you know it? I'm sure your mom would love it. They also have some nice hiking trails you could check out.
That sounds familiar. Is that the one you go to all the time with your family? Are they in the photos?! I would love to see!

Yes, We go there pretty often. But we like to switch it up, So we usually try to pick a different park each weekend. Yes, My wife has all the pictures on her phone, But I'll send them to you as soon as she sends them to me!
That would be wonderful, Thank you! I am so jealous of your weekend family outings. I try so hard to get my dad to come out and he never will.

Are your parents together, If you don't mind me asking? If so, Maybe he could go with you to the cherry blossom festival, I think it starts in a few days. They have lots of vendors there that sell some really delicious food, So maybe that will entice him to come out. Not to stereotype, But as a dad myself, I know sometimes food can be a good motivator.

They are together, But you know he works ALL THE TIME. Maybe I can convince him to go to the festival! I had not heard about it. My mom will love it. Maybe she can talk him into taking a day off and enjoying it. Now I want a funnel cake!!.

Oh sorry, My comptuer logged off for a sec, Hope this still sends. But yes, They have funnel cake. Get him to take a break! Maybe we can all meet up together, In fact. My wife and I were saying we should bring the kids back there for the festival. I think they have games, Too. I'll check the schedule online.

No worries! I got your message. Would you be interested in going to the festival with me and my family. It would be great to meet your kids and I will even take lots of photos. Even if we cannot get my dad to join, I am in!

I would love that! Looks like this Saturday would be a great day to go, Because they'll have some musical guests as well. Do you think that might work? We're pretty much free all day. We normally would do a long hiking day, But I know my whole family would love to do the festival instead. Well, I'll double check with them. But I'm 99. 9% certain :).
Yes! What kind of music? I love folk rock, But haven't ever seen any life. My mom is going to be soooo excited about this! She is going to spoil your kids lol.

persona: I am a rock musician. I play the piano and guitar. I sing.
My parents are not supportive.
I am interested in the search for the family.
I met somebody at a show I do downtown. I perform on Fridays at Margaritville.
dialogue: What type of shows do you do?
Rock shows, I met someone from one of my rock shows actually. She was a huge fan.
That's lovely. I'd love to meet her. At least you know she'd be encouraging of your dreams!
I'm sure she'd be down to meet you! Since your daughter plays the saxophone, Maybe you can come to a show sometime and we can all meet up there!

She probably isn't old enough to play in a lot of grown-up places, But I had a similar thought just yesterday! I thought since the weather is getting nice, Maybe we could all meet at a park so you can jam. If all goes well at the Blues Brother Lounge with my husband's long lost brothers, Maybe we could make like a big thing out of it -- get a lot of folks together.
Sure, Sounds like a great plan! You can bring your dog as well. What time and date would work for you and your family??.
Not quite sure yet. I'd like to see how the meeting with my husband and his brothers goes first. Thank you so much for agreeing to be there. You are so considerate and empathetic!
With your husbands family situation I completely agree! My parents were never really supportive of me so it's great to see him reconnecting with his loved ones.
Thank you. I just hope it all works out. He's waited for this for so long; I worry his expectations are inflated and the disappointment will be huge if things don't go well.
It's always nerve wrecking to feel outcasted and abandoned. I'm sure it'll go fine! They probably are just as excited as your husband. Will they introduce him to his biological parents?

I think so. They definitely have information for us, But I'm not sure where it will lead. Luckily once my husband has names, He has resources at work to do a bit of checking around before deciding if he wants to meet them right away or not. I'm sorry your parents weren't supportive of you!

It's alright, It's part of life. It's always great to see someone has the opportunity to reconnect with their family! Yeah he should definitely do some research before, I agree. If he decides they're a great fit you should bring them to our park meet up as well!

persona: I like to eat out.
I have visited Japan. I have just visited Paris. I am currently travelling the world.
I like to cook. I am not a very good cook.
I have a yacht in Florida. I rent my Yacht out while I'm travelling.
I love fishing. Deep sea fishing but closer to the shore so I catch small shark and weird fish with lots of teeth. We always release sharks but keep some types of fish to eat.
dialogue: I am getting more and more big with this pregnancy, It's crazy!
I'll bet! How far along are you now?
About four and a half months! It is get close and I am nervous!
You're only halfway through, Or do they not expect you to make it to the full nine months?
There is no way I will make it to the full 9! And the nursery is nowhere near done!
What do you have done so far? I totally think you should add some fish in there somewhere! I can send you pics of the ones I catch to get you started ;).
I am not sure how the fish will go with the puppies, But do send them along! Right now is a bunch of pug wallpaper and that is it!!! I don't even have the crib together yet.

Or even better, You could add some cultural decorations. I saw these amazing nursery displays when I was in Paris. You could totally work that in with pugs. All the French people have small, Designer dogs, Haha.

You really are always full of great ideas! Maybe I can make the nursery a mini Paris in Japan! How adorable! You really do make me feel better about it all... Even as I lay here like a beached whale in my bed.
Oh honey! Has your husband cooked you anything good lately? He's not making you do all the cooking now is he?
He passed away recently. It is just me and the step kids. They are great, But it is so odd to be in a new place with his kids running around and his kids growing in my belly. He sure left a legacy.

Oh no! I didn't know about that! I'm so very terribly sorry. It's amazing that you are able to raise his kids, All while being pregnant with multiples. I really admire you. Here I was just trying to get new recipes from you, While you are going through something so difficult. I feel like a jerk.

persona: My wife left me and stole my children. I don't speak to my wife or kids much. My wife and i have had a bad breakup. My wife blocked me on facebook.
I'm fat and depressed, which I blame on working at a nursing home. I ould like to lose weight.
I did not qualify for the Olympics because god doesn't exist.
I prefer winter.
I have religious friends.
I live in a nursing home. I share a room with another man. I am a man. I miss my home. I love visitors.
dialogue: How is the weight-loss going? I found some useful resources (namely, Recipes) for you if you would like to see them.
I would thanks, Though I probably won't use them correctly and just get fatter.
Skinny isn't always best. As long as you've got good food you'll be happy. Maybe getting a pet would cheer you up?
Just something else to be taken from me or another life for me to ruin? No thanks. Starting to think there really is no God.
You're right, God isn't real :) Maybe you could look after Samson and Delilah?
God isn't? I feel like I've wasted so much time believing... You'd trust me to look after your cats?
Probably. You're not the only one though, There's some people who are still living in ignorance! Sure, They're a pain in the butt but they always cheer me up.
I mean, I guess I can try. Is there anything I need to watch out for? I don't want to anger them.
Feed them tuna and they'll love you forever. Delilah is a sneaky one and will try hide in your bed. Just warning you.
I'll have to go get some tuna then. It might be nice having someone around that actually wants something I have to give.
Are you a cat or a dog person? I like both.
I am more of a dog person, But cats are nice too. As long as I don't get scratched it'll be okay.

persona: I like rap music. I especially like Somalian rap.

I have a cat named Ziggy who likes reggae. I enjoy watching tv with my cat. I am not from the US but moved here. I moved here from Somalia. I left Somalia when I was 13. I have an Aunt who helped me leave Somalia.
I drive a 1976 Chevy Impala. I love old cars.
I enjoy classic music. I do not enjoy new music.
I love cooking and baking. I like New York style pizza. I tried a potato pizza once and it was decent. I like carbs. I like pineapple on pizza. I like the combination of sweet and savory.
I am watching a show about drug cartels.
I do not like salted caramel.
I love Italian food. I visited Italy a few years ago and loved it. I think their food is very different than the Italian restaurants at home.
dialogue: Talking about salted caramels inspired me to try making some myself! I picked up the ingredients and will try making them tomorrow.
You should surely try them even if i don't like it, Many of my friends love these.
Yea my friends love them too and I going to try to make that for them. So did you finish watching the drug cartel show?
I am mid way of the show and it has already hyped me up. Are you singing any good raps for Charlie?

Drug cartel shows are really interesting as most of them are true stories, Which is why I am thinking of watching one too soon. Lol!!! I try my best to sing some for Charlie and myself. But may be you could help me by introducing me to some Somalian Rap one day!
I would love to introduce Somalian rap as I listen to them often and I'm pretty sure you will rock on with your twist to it.

Well most of the rap music that I produce or sing, Have a mixture of rap lyrics and tunes from other cultures. I was listening to a cover of one Somalian rapper the other day and it had an awesome vibe. Also I feel the tunes in them liven you up and gets rid of all the stress in my opinion. Don't you think that's true?
Exactly! I think the same and that's the only reason I am driven towards the Somalian rap as it helps me to stress out all my work pressure. And so does my cooking, All for my relaxation.

Some say rap music helps cure depression and other mental issues. So no wonder I too love listening to music just relieve my stress or just relax for the day. Are there a lot of famous Somalian rappers in Somalia or in the US?
Yes rap surely does help with many mental issues. I wish people get to know the different types of rap and explore the love for music. There are rappers both in Somalia and the US.

persona: I don't have a job. I used to work with animals but I hated it. I search for work every day.
I play video games. My dream job is designing video games, but I would settle for something in marketing or content creation.
Both of my parents are alive and I'm currently staying with them while I search for a job. I am looking into accepting a job soon. I dont live near any tech companies hiring.
dialogue: How is your job searching going? Have you been able to accept a job yet?
It's still pretty sparse. I can't seem to find anything that interests me enough or at least pays enough to make it interesting. How's the mediating going?
Hope things turn around for you soon. The mediating is going about as well as trying to teach a fish to wear pants and walk on land. It is frustrating.
Haha! I'm sorry to hear that though. That does sound frustrating. Hopefully we both get what we want soon. I need to afford a vacation!

I can agree with that. I was on Facebook the other day and watching some workout videos because I want to be happy and getting healthy is the first step. Have you thought about maybe doing some of those video game live videos on there?

That's a great idea! I need to put down the video games at times and get a workout in. I bet I would feel so much better overall. I've streamed a few times but it is so hard to really get noticed and get enough subscribers to warrant ads so that I can make money off of it. I might need to think about moving closer to a big city to get some tech opportunities.

I would love a workout partner. We could video chat and workout together, Keep each other motivated. You should look into company's that offer apprenticeships and then it would give you better idea of where you would need to move.

I am down for that! Let's schedule a time each day so that we can hold each other accountable. Do you know any programs we should start with? I'd like to see what I'm getting into! Haha! Good idea on checking for apprenticeships or internships. I need to start somewhere.
Awesome!! Yeah actually I just started doing a simple low carb high protein meal plan with links to workout videos and stuff. I can email it to you if you want.
Yes please! I'm a pretty picky eater but I need to make some changes. My parents are going to wonder what I've gotten into when I start working out! Haha!
HahaH!! Really mess with them when they begin giving you weird looks and tell them you were abducted by aliens and you are the new and improved son! HaHAHAHHA LMAO!!.

Hope they don't call the cops! Haha! I'm going to go with the hard core 80's look and get some striped high socks with wristbands and a sweatband! It's already going to be tough but might as well have fun!

persona: My parents are nagging me. I am 19 years old.
I like scooby doo.
I like hanging with my friends and I have a part time job at burger king.
I have not read Lord of the Flies. I like the movie Goonies.I watched Goonies growing up. Crime novels are my favorite to read. I find murder novels interesting.
I am not as afraid of the world as I once was.
dialogue: I did read a crime novel that my parents' read first and said wasn't too scary. It still kept me up almost all night! I'm working on doing what you said and becoming less afraid of the world, It's hard sometimes though.
That is great effort! It is hard, But it will be worth the effort. Have you tried imagining the scary things in a funny way?
Yes, Like imagining ketchup sauce for the blood? How?
I used to believe there was a monster in my closet. Then, I kept imagining it in a tutu and singing in a baby voice. Then it became fun to imagine it, And I wasn't scared anymore.
Now that's a tip I can also use for the high rollercoasters at Disney World too, When my stomach turns upside down!
Maybe you can imagine that you are a jet fighter! Just don't eat lunch right before the ride! Is your family going to Disney World soon?
Yeah, I hope so! You ever went there with your friends?
I've never been there, But always wanted to go. Maybe someday soon. If you go first, Let me know which rides are the best!
I hope to go on the Seven Dwarfs Mine Train, Because I think Snow White is the best Disney movie.
That is a true classic. I really loved the dwarf named "Grumpy", I always wanted to try to cheer him up. Do you have a favorite dwarf?
Sleepy seems to be nice.
He always did seem to be so sweet. Is your older brother going to go too?

persona: I am involved in a charity for a band.
I am high maintenance. I like getting my hair and nails done. I got my hair done last week. i am picky about my hair. I have long hair. I cut my hair short years ago. I want to grow my hair.
I do not like to tan. I have a backyard. I have my own home.
I do not have trouble saving money. I spend money on clothes.
I love tiramisu. I am busy with work. I am having a bake sale.
I might hire a gardener. I meditate. My garden is hard to maintain.
I drink in my backyard to unwind.
Discipline is important to me.
dialogue: How is your bake sale going?
It's going well. I have to bake a couple more dozen cookies. I'm still looking for people to help, Too. Have you been able to relax?
Yeah I had a great massage and feel great now! What is the bake sale raising money for?
The band I have a charity for of course? A massage sounds great.
Yes I meant what are the funds going to be spent on? And yeah it was really relaxing, I love to just have some time to myself away from all the madness!
They want to record an album and so we we are raising money for studio time and better equipment. Have you been able to save any more money to move out?
Oh that sounds great! Hopefully the bake sale helps you get there. No, As usual I've had to spend all my salary on rent and bills! I think I maybe need to get a second job to help.
It can be tough. I hope you are able to find something that doesn't stress you out more!

persona: I live in Alabama. I like tacos. I enjoy steak tacos.
I have 3 sisters and 1 younger brother.  I like my brother. I do not get along with my sisters. I believe my sisters actions disgrace my family.
I have a dog.
My brother has a bike.
I do not like the color pink.
dialogue: I went to a new restaurant and tried Thai food for the first time.
What dish did you end up trying and did you enjoy it?
I played it safe and tried a simple plate of Thai fried rice, It was really good. Have you ever tried Thai food?
I have, And I really enjoy it. I had Chicken Pad Thai and coconut sticky rice. I had also tried a Thai Iced Coffee. It was really sweet and smooth.
I love coffee so maybe I should try Thai Iced Coffee! Do you siblings enjoy Thai food as well?
My brother does, I do not know if my sisters do. I got a bike two days ago so my brother doesn't have to share with me and we rode together to go to a Thai restaurant near us for the first outing.
I'm sorry, I forgot that you don't get along with your sisters. I get along with mine but they are much younger than me so it's a little easier.

It is ok, Having younger sisters would be a little easier. I have often thought about planning a trip to Thailand to do a tour of the country. They actually have villages where they grow coffee on the mountain sides and they do a very slow drip brew. It would be interesting to try the different regions takes on coffee and on all the authentic dishes.
That sounds amazing! I would love to go with you if you would be ok with that?

It would be nice to have someone to travel with. I know that the bigger cities have actual hotels and the smaller villages families tend to host you in there homes so you get very involved in the culture. It would be a very eye opening experience.
I would love that cultural immersion experience. I did that during high school when I traveled to Mexico and stayed with a local family.
Oh, That sounds amazing. I love learning about new cultures. I would think actually traveling to the places would make it so much better.

persona: I work in the music industry. I work in Los Angeles. I help artists create albums. I love my job.
I live near the redwoods in California. I do not like living in California. California is a nice place but has limited job opportunities. California's air is smoky.
I don't like when people are poorly treated by others.  I think folk artists have interesting points of view.
My wife is from Kentucky and her favorite music is country, especially Dolly Parton.
I travel to Los Angeles for work. I like redwood forests. I am concerned about the pollution in California, and how it will affect the redwoods.
I enjoy Star Wars. I am not a fan of the prequel and sequel star wars movies.
I do not like the Hollywood either. Homeless people and characters looking for money bother me. I am not a fan of Portland or other major cities due to the amount of homeless people.
dialogue: I have decided to go to San Francisco and visit redwood park before I leave California.
I'm sure you'll love it. Let me know when you are going and maybe we can meet up if I'm not out with a client!
I would absolutely love that. Do you know of any particular areas I should visit? I don't want to miss out on all the park has to offer, But I won't have much time.

Since I live so close, You could just come and stay with me for a couple days. We could drive to some amazing trails that are only about 15 minutes from my house. I'm sure my wife would love to see you and cook some of her famous Kentucky food.

This sounds amazing. I would really appreciate that as I don't have a lot to spend on my travels and, As you know, That area is NOT cheap. Could I ride into LA with you some time? I would love to check out a music studio!
