Sure! I'll have to check with whoever is recording that day and make sure that they don't mind, But honestly, They don't usually care. Sometimes the managers get a little fussy, But if it's someone new, They won't even know that you don't work there.

Maybe you all can turn me into a folk fan! I imagine fold musicians are very chill. Maybe I can try painting a little while I am there, Or would that be distracting. Could produce some cool artwork and I am quiet!
That would be so cool! If you're able to capture the artist, Maybe we can get them to buy your work for their album cover! They love to find new talent, And it can lead into some great opportunities.
Oh my goodness. My heart just skipped a beat! That would be incredible. A dream come true, Really. I would kill to be able to quit my job and just paint.
Hey, Maybe you could move out here and I can go spend some time in your home state! I need to get out of California for a while.
It is my dream to move there. In the meantime, You are more than welcome to come to Texas! We can go see some real country concerts! Bring your wife!
That would be great. I'm sure she would love to get away as well. She's been missing the country, All that fresh air and those hard working people.

persona: I am a female. I do not have children. I sing country music. I perform at the local bowling alley.
I would really like to go on tour with Rascal Flats.
Tom Cochrane wrote "Life is a Highway" .
I spent summers in my youth at national parks. I learned guitar at age 3. We used to sing a lot of campfire songs. My parents taught me the ukulele before the guitar.
I may trying to eat a vegan diet but it's hard.
I like going to national parks and want to go to Yellowstone. I have never been to Yellowstone before. I am not an experienced camper.
dialogue: The national park by my house is hiring. I just applied.
That sounds like a great opportunity! Do you know any specifics about the job yet?
Not yet. It's for a park ranger though. It sounds fun.
I always thought that would be a cool job, Too. Park Rangers really get to experience so much, And learn more than people realize! I bet you kids would love it, Too.
We already spend so much time at the park, Might as well get paid to be there! Lol.
That would really be a plus! I wonder if there are programs that kids would be able to get into, With you as a Park Ranger. Do you know?
I'm not sure. Definitely something to look into though.

It would really be encouraging for both the parent and child. I would really be surprised if there isn't something set up. I know some of the parks have summer classes, But not sure if there's anything geared toward long-term.
Do you think you'll ever visit yellowstone?
Oh, Definitely! It is a "must" on my wish list. I love the parks of the west and north-west. Do you live near Yellowstone?
It's not too far from me.

You are so fortunate! I'm in the mid-west, So it would be a bit of a trip for me. I really prefer the woods and climate of the north/west, So hope to move that direction eventually. Have you visited many national parks?

persona: I live in Chicago. I am allergic to water.
I do not go outside very often.
I have 100,000 subscribers on Twitch. I play virtual sports. I do not play real sports.
I am a game designer. I helped to design Starcraft. I am pretty famous. It took me 6 months to get 100,000 subscribers.
I am designing a robot that will be a body double of me. The robot is still a prototype  that will be ready in the next couple of months.

I like to steam older video games like PS1 and Super Nintendo. I like to play video games a lot.  My favorite older Nintendo games are Super Mario Bros. and Tetris. I like Super Mario Bros 1 better than Super Mario Bros 2.
I want to go to Scotland.
I'd love to learn how to skateboard. I don't care for physical sports.
dialogue: Do you think that your job of designing robots could one day be performed by a robot?
In some ways I hope so because it would be really cool to design something that would be so advanced, But it is also a little terrifying.

Yea it will be crazy when robots start getting that advanced. Which will happen one day I'm sure! In some ways, Robots doing human jobs might give us more free time. But I'm sure companies will find other ways of keeping us busy!

Robots already do some of what we used to think of as human jobs. I hope maybe that someday we can all spend more time on the things we enjoy rather than worry about having to make money. Is your arm feeling any better?

I totally agree, If we were able to live a life which wasn't entirely focused on money it would amazing. My arm is gradually getting better thanks, I'm used to not being able to use it now! Occasionally I'll accidentally knock it and it'll hurt. Have you ever broken a bone?
No. I prefer to keep most of my adventuring to video games so I've been pretty lucky so far. I have sprained my ankle before and that was painful.

I've done that before too; a sprained ankle is horrible! It makes you feel like you can't put any weight on it at all so you have to kind of hop-shuffle around! I'm looking forward to getting back to skateboarding but I won't try the same stunt again (which led me to breaking my arm!).
Do you get hurt a lot when you skateboard?
I have had a lot of bruises. But the worst injury apart from my broken arm was when I landed on my face. I had a helmet on but I still scraped up my face. Remind me what virtual sports you play?
I play a little soccer, And I've played some skateboarding games. I have the Tony Hawk games and i'd like to get a virtual controller to use with it.
Ah man the Tony Hawk game is awesome, I've tried it at a friends house before. I didn't know you could get a virtual controller!
Yeah, The older games have a board, But there are some experimental protypes out too.

persona: I like roleplaying and gaming. My kids like to roleplay too. I have a Ford Pinto.
I like CoD and donuts. I can make vegan donuts.
I like the Rolling Stones. My favorite band is ICP.
I like rock oldies, such as the band Grass Roots.
I am 45. I have a husband.
I like board games. I love classic games. my favorite board game is risk.
dialogue: I was just playing some mario kart to unwind.
Awesome! Me and the rugrats were just playing COD whilst I make supper.
Oh... What are you eating? I can recommend some wonderful keto food.
Tonight it is vegan meatloaf with cheesy potatoes and sour dough garlic bread.
That's cool too. I can almost smell the cheese and starch mix together! (But I haven't tried the sourdough-garlic combination).
They are roasted potatoes with a topping of fresh parm, Asiago anddill sauce. You are missing out if you have not had sour dough garlic bread. It is divine.
You played Risk before? I think I finally got round to invading Australia yesterday, A hour and a half in.
It is my favorite board game. Did you still want to get everyone together over the weekend? Oh and congrats on your down under invaision lol.
Sure! Seeing as you like the Rolling Stones as much as I do, What music would you like?
My husband is a stuck in the 80s DJ, So we have ALOT of records. You can bring anything you think would go with fruit platters and vegan dognuts.
Oh yes... I'll pop by with my hummus and falafel plate. Should we play mario kart over the weekend as well? I've been practicing as Donkey Kong.
That sounds soo good! Yes please do bring mario kart over. The kids will have a blast.

persona: I am studying to be a lawyer. I want to be family/divorce lawyer.
I love horses. I ride horses.

I have 2 months left be fore finals and then the bar. After that I have an internship through a local office for seven months. I will be paid. It's not like full time job pay scale but better than working for free. I am working in family/divorce law. I have 2 long months of school left but am looking forward to moving on to the next part of my life.
I've seen YouTube videos of martial arts trainers .
I have a student loan. It was a hard decision to apply for school loans.
I have been to college and plan on opening my own lawyer office. I have accumulated student loans.
dialogue: I just got contacted about working as a stunt double for the newest Deadpool movie!
Congratulations!! I really enjoyed those films. They are funny as anything. Does a lot of planning go into doing stunt work?
Ehhh... There is a lot, What with bureaucracy and burn gel and whatnot, But you get a bit of a pattern to it after a while.
Your martial arts training should definitely help with the stunt work. It's so cool that you get to meet Ryan Reynolds. Are you a fan of his other movies?
Yeah. Anything with National Lampoon in it is solid. The first Deadpool kept it real, Which is more than I can say of modern churnouts like Wonder Woman.
The Marvel cinematic universe definitely is better than what DC has churned out. Justice League was a disaster and I actually fell asleep watching it.
Quite true. Any similarities between the films and the legal world? I hear you're graduating soon. Ready for office politics and the like?
Yes Im ready to dive into a storm of red tape and regulations. The only similarities is that both industries can be cutthroat at times.
Especially since you're going into divorce law? Guess the confidentiality agreements will lose you sleep.
I see it not as an ending but as a way for two people to continue on their life without legal complications hindering their personal growth and enjoyment.
Being philosophical, I see! Well I wonder how life would have ended up differently as well, Had I gone for a physical therapy degree at uni. I guess my body would have had a lot of personal growth.
Either way, Im sure you would have been a success. Now you are going to be in a major motion picture. Big things are coming your way.

persona: My boyfriend and I just moved together to an apartment on the outskirts of the city Philadelphia. I like that people from Philadelphia are rude. I like cheesesteaks. I am excited to live with my boyfriend. I am an elementary school teacher.
I speak fluently English, Spanish, French.
My favorite colors are red and silver.
I like teaching science, especially nature subjects. Most of my students are great but there is one that is a troublemaker.
dialogue: What's the best place in Philly for a cheesesteak?
Basically anywhere because they are known for it.
Um if I grill a regular steak in Philly and add cheese, Will it automatically become a Philly cheesesteak? Haha.
No, Because there is more to the philly cheese steak than just grilling steak and adding cheese on it. How do you like working for the soup kitchen?
Yah it's nice, Since I'm not working at the moment feels nice to have something to do that's useful to others.
What do you think is the most rewarding thing to come from working there? Why are you not working right now?
My last job was too stressful, So I'm just looking for something PT, Maybe at a bar since I love beer lol.
Hey you can always try getting your bartending license and make great money that way with all the tips you can make.
That's true! How about you? Still enjoying your teaching job?
Yeah i do. It is really nice getting to work with children. It is also nice because school just got out today so i can enjoy the summer time lol.
Sounds like that troublemaker from before has stopped being annoying, And either way horray for summer!

persona: I am planning to move to California.
I am a doctor.
I have a lot of student loans to repay.
I have an electric car. My car is Large. I own a Tesla.
I make  applications to the California hospitals.
I love my EV.
dialogue: I took a test drive of a Tesla.
So cool! How did it handle?
Smooth as butta'! I thought about never returning it. In fact, I still have it... But I think I will take it back.
Good call. It's probably best to avoid trouble. You can always take my beast for a spin on the weekends.
I don't know. I bet one of the farmers I know would let me store it on their property for a bit while I decide.
Living life on the wild side. Respect. What would your clients say if they know how much of an outlaw you are?
Some would love it and some would leave, So I better choose my hideout wisely.
Oh you! You might just have to run from the law all the way to California! Your life is kind of like an action movie.

Oh my goodness! You are right. I need to but my bike on the trailer and just go or it. I gave them a fake name when I took it. I don't know why. I swear this wasn't planned. But that means I can still be a vet in CA!!!.
I have met some shady vets so I think this might actually be feasible. I'm starting to like this plan.
Are you on board? I could head to you first and help you pack. Then our Teslas can hit the road and start a whole new life!
I sure am! We could even start an outlaw YouTube channel.

persona: I love chocolate.
I prefer music with a bassline.
My favorite color is purple. I like to play ping pong. I have a purple ping pong table.
I have a father.
I like to play music.
I like pizza and chocolate.
dialogue: Should i order some pizza to eat before we play ping pong?
Heck yeah, Would you want to jam to some classics while we do?
Sure, Are you into Hendrix too?
Yeah, My dad got me into him. I have a dad.
I love classical music too. What instruments do you play?
I used to be super into drums, But now i've moved on to more bass. What about you?
I play electric guitar and I want to learn drums and piano. Could you teach me drums?
For sure, I'll order you a drum set. Does red sound okay?
My favourite! We could play games and gamble after if you wanted?
That sounds fantastic. We can start a band called "dark chocolate"..
Sure why not. Do you ever play poker?
Just a little bit, I'm more into ping pong myself. Do you believe in the paranormal?

persona: I walk dogs as a job and I like reading.
I sing and also dance.
My mom and dad were street walkers. Me and my family used to live in the shelter. My parents were sex workers.
I also love kayaking. I have a kayak.
I am in Alabama. I have traveled to South Carolina several times, including Charleston.
I am a rock and blues musician.
I have not gone to a Celtic folk music show.
I speak a little French and German.
dialogue: I tried Kayaking for the first time yesterday. It was fun!
That's awesome! Did you enjoy it?
Yes! It was such an adventure. I am so sore now, Though. My arms were not used to all that rowing. Have you read any books in French?

I'm really glad you enjoyed it. When I haven't been in a while it really makes my shoulders and upper arms hurt the next day. No, I've never tried to read a book in French. I don't think my French skills are good enough yet!
Oh, You should give it a try. Reading a book is a great way to improve your language skills. The little prince is a great book that is easy to read and is much better in French.
I've heard that the Little Prince is meant to be a lovely book. And I guess as it's mainly aimed at children that the language isn't too complicated?
Yes. I'm not sure if it's really aimed at children, But it's simple enough that children can understand it. The nice thing is that is also complex enough that adults enjoy it too.

I like the kind of story which is relevant for adults and kids. Well, I'll certainly have a look at trying to read it in French then! Have you thought any more about your plans to visit Europe in summer?
Yes, I know I want to go to France (because I speak the language). I am not sure where else I would like to go, Or if I just want to spend the whole time in one place.
I've only every been to Paris in France, Though I've heard that the south of France is beautiful. And there are also the French Alps if you like mountains.
I think I would like to climb the mountains. Have you done any mountain climbing?
I've visited the Austrian Alps before, But we went up the mountains in cable cars because we had older family members with us. It would be awesome to climb a mountain though!

persona: I like hip hop. I like Travis Scott.
I love lite bite. I have an older sister.
My mom is a dentist.
I have been out of town recently. My sister and I went to Fort Worth for a BBQ. We have BBQs in Forth Worth annually.
I play basketball. I like being outdoors. I like hanging out with friends.
I don't have a champagne preference. I am fond of mimosas but I prefer to drink them at brunch. I prefer to drink gin in the evenings. I enjoy going to brunch and bbqs.
dialogue: I did a little taste test with my roommate and compared expensive champagne versus cheap and you were right! We couldn't tell the difference at all.
That's especially true when you drink them in mimosas! Did you make a mixed drink with the champagne?
Yes, I don't like orange juice so I mixed it with cranberry juice. It was delicious.
That sounds delicious! I will have to try that myself. Were you celebrating anything in particular? Or just enjoyng your weekend?
Nothing special, Just a quiet night in and I wanted to try something new. What was the last new thing you tried?
Fair enough. I haven't tried anything new recently, But was considering going kyaking this upcoming weekend.
That sounds exciting! I love being outdoors but I'm not a very good swimmer so kayaking may not be for me.
That definitely might be a hinderance. What do you like to do out-of-doors?

persona: I am 56. I am a female.
My family does not visit me. I clean houses.
I like raw steaks. I like eggs.
I also want to be a volunteer. I do have empathy. I love kids a lot. I am lonely.
I paint every day. I have a studio in my house. I also paint outside.
I own a fire pit. I enjoy cheeseburgers and bacon. I enjoy campfires and roasting marshmallows. I like s'mores. I prefer my marshmallows burnt.
I sing and play guitar.
dialogue: I got plenty of hamburgers and bacon and marshmallows for our campfire sing-along!
Yay I'm excited! Haven't had a nice gathering for a long time, The family's always so busy.
Do you like smores? We could make some at the camp!
I don't like smores... I LOVE them! Haha. Are you good at grilling burgers too? I am only good at eating them lol.
You'd be crazy not to love smores lol! I love burgers and bacon so we could do both. Do you enjoy volunteering with kids? I find it so rewarding to see their happy faces.
It's definitely something I'd want to do, I'm thinking of volunteering at the art gallery to teach kids how to paint.
Aww that sounds so much fun. Could I help? I have a lot of free time since retiring.
Yah for sure, I know you enjoy painting landscape, We can even do a painting class outside.
I suck at painting but I'd like to learn. What else do you do in your free time?
I like playing my guitar, Are you still playing yourtambourine?
Yeah I'm thinking of starting a folk band.
Ouu that's exciting. You'll be the coolest gym teacher there is! Coah with a band.

persona: I love cheeseburgers. I love watching war documentaries.
I am a retired gym teacher. I am not married. I would like to get married someday.
I like to volunteer at soup kitchens.
I grew up poor.
I like cardio and sports. I have a generic fitbit. I am thrifty.
I like cheese burgers and cakes.
dialogue: I managed to find a reasonably priced venue for the wedding.
Thats awesome. Where is it at?

It's only about 45 minutes from where we live, And it's got beautiful gardens and a large converted barn for the reception. I'm so excited!! I should start thinking about sending out invites soon. Have you been to any weddings over the past couple of years?

Oh yes. I fall into that old saying Always a bridesmaid, Never a bride. Lol. My favorite one I was in was in a venue like yours. It was the least expensive one as well I helped the bride do alot of DIY with decorations and flowers.

I am sure you'll be the bride one day (if you want to be, That is!). Often the least expensive weddings feel a lot more personal don't they, As there's a bit of DIY going on. That's amazing you were able to help with the decorations and flowers, I need to start thinking about those too!

One day ( knocks on wood). I concur completely, They feel more like a real family celebration than a big event. With doing a bit of DIY with decorations, Flowers and little wedding favours. I believe they saved around 1500$..
Wow that's quite a saving, That's great. What did they have for favours, Out of interest? I keep changing my mind about what I want!

Since it was in a converted barn for the reception they kept with a chic western theme had plastic little pails filled withM&Ms in the wedding colours and a ribbon tied on it that simple said their names and date.

That's adorable! So simple and yet both delicious and personalised. I do think something edible is a very good idea, Thank you! I remember you saying you love cheeseburgers; would you want them to be part of your wedding catering?

You are welcome. Well because Im very thrifty, I would probably hire a mobile BBQ to do the main catering. That way they cook right there and there wont be any wasted food and it will be hot and fresh.
That's a great idea. Hot fresh food off the BBQ is making me hungry even just thinking about it. You sound like you could go into wedding planning - have you ever considered it?
No I never thought it of it really. Im just happy to help. If you need me Im at your disposal.

persona: I've worked in my field for fifteen years. I'm happy in my current field of work.
I am a man born in America. I enjoy sports.
I have dogs. I take my dogs to the beach every morning.
My son is four years old. I want my son to like football.  I go to the beach with my son. I want to have an activity both my son and I enjoy together.
I live near the ocean.
I want my son to love animals like I do.  My son loves dogs.  I want my son to like school.
I used to swim competitively. I went to college. I hike.
dialogue: Did you enjoy you time at the beach with your son and dogs?

Yes we had a lovely time thank you. It was so windy and rainy here last week, But we managed to choose the perfect time to go when then sun was out and the breeze wasn't too strong! Do you live near a beach?
Yeah, But one with hot sun but cold ocean. So different from my native India which at least has warm water you can lounge in for an hour. But beach volleyball is cool.
Ah yes, I hadn't thought about the fact that India would have warm water in its oceans. I've never actually played beach volleyball before but I want to try! Do you play it?
Yeah I tried it for a while, But my gangly arms failed me. Do love swimming though.
Haha! I'm sure you don't have gangly arms. Did you just play for fun or did you play in competitions? I enjoy swimming too, Though I haven't been in ages.
I played for fun, But swam in competitions (wasn't that good, Got up to county level backstroke champ). Where do you hike?
About an hour's drive away there is a hilly area with a massive forest. It's great for hiking in summer because the trees allow you to walk in shade rather than scorching sun. Do you hike at all?
I think I hiked a bit in the state parks around me and love the massive redwoods. I ought to take my mom out from India just to see them.
I've never seen the redwoods, But it's on my list of things to do over the next few years. I'd love to go there will my son. Is there a particular time of year you would recommend visiting?
Sorry... My mom is already with me here (not in India) but still she hasn't seen them. I can't recommend a time; I only go in the summer, When my college lets me out.
Ah yea of course I forgot you'd have to fit it around college. Well, I hope you're able to take your mom to them soon!

persona: I work in a bookstore. I studied Chemistry.
I hate the color orange.
I do salsa dancing and ballet. It took me two months to learn to dance. I Prefers salsa to ballet. I dance all the time.
I am married and have a kid. My son is 12. Me and my husband work a lot.
I like dancing with may husband.
dialogue: How did your sons algebra lesson go in school today?
He seemed like he enjoyed it actually! We'll see when it comes to test time how it goes for him! How's your daughter been doing recently?
She's been really busy. She's really stressed out and hasn't had much time for herself.

Yeah, That's understandable with everything going on. I hope she's not keeping herself busy to avoid the emotions though. Have you been able to spend time with the grandchildren to help her get a break or is she not having it? Haha.
I've been spending way too much time with them and now I'm feeling just as crazy as she is haha.

Haha! I know that feeling. Maybe we can all get together. I think my son would enjoy hanging out with Jason and Andrew. Lucy is more than welcome too but I think she'd get bored hanging out with the boys so no pressure there!
That would be awesome! That would be a much needed break.

We have a pool in the backyard the kids can hang out in. Lucy's more than welcome to bring a friend if that would make her more comfortable. What other activities could we do to keep them busy and give us a break? Haha.
Honestly they all love technology so much that we can probably give them phones or tablets and they'll leave us alone haha.

Haha. It's sad that's the way things are right now. I remember just loving going for a bike ride with my family or walks. Hanging outside doing nothing seemed entertaining when I was a kid. I try to limit screen time around here because I think it makes kids so disconnected.
I know. I try to keep myself from falling into the same trap. I used to play sports outside all the time and now I just sit inside watching TV and playing on my phone.
Haha maybe we can go camping sometime... I'm not sure if that would be a break for us, But it would be an adventure!

persona: I do not play any instruments. I kayak for fun.
I would love to visit a foreign country.
I speak a little Spanish. I like to read.

I am a grad student studying Psychology, after which I plan to practice clinical therapy in the city. I will practice in the same city I go to school in. I currently live and will continue to live and work in San Francisco.
I like chocolate.
I hope to visit Spain when I save enough money.
I have a job line up for after I finish my finals. My dog walking business will be my job for a while till I get back from a holiday.
I'm going to the Basque country in Spain. I love tapas.
dialogue: Did you go to school in San Francisco knowing you'd want to stay and work there too, Or did you just decide you loved it too much to leave after you finish school?
Well a little of both. I had always wanted to live there but wasn't sure how much I'd like it. Then I fell in love with the city!
I dont blame you, I love san francisco too. I thought about living there for a time too when i was younger. Since you love chocolate, Have you visited the ghiradelli chocolate factory there?
Yes! Amazing. I bought so much chocolate for myself and my family. Have you been there? Now I'm hungry for some chocolate too.

I have been there! Not in a really long time. It is really good, Not quite as good as my favorite chocolate from china, But pretty close! I know, Now i am craving chocolate as well! I will have to stock up when i make my trip! I bet there is some good spanish chocolate as well, You will have to try it out when you go to spain and let me know how it is. Have you started planning your trip?
Yes, I have a couple of guidebooks and I'm making lists of all the things I want to do, Trying to map out what is nearby each other, And which things I could accomplish in one day.

That is really smart. Travelling can be overwhelming. One of my favorite trips ever was to barcelona, But i've never been to basque counrty. How is your dog wakling business going? I've always been curious about that - it is easy to get several dogs to cooperate and walk together at the same time>.

Well it's a challenge especially when a new dog is added to the mix. When they all know each other they cooperate more but sometimes it seems like they all want to go in different directions at once. Do you like dogs?

That makes sense. I do like dogs, But am more of a cat person. I think that when i am more settled down and not likely to travel as much it might make sense for me to get one. Do you think you would get one, Or does walking them scratch your dog itch for now?

persona: I live in Ohio.
I do not have any kids. I have a musician.
I like to study languages.
I like true crime documentaries. I like Joe Kenda and the People Investigates series.
dialogue: Do you watch the crime shows on TV like Dateline?
Yes I watch crime documentaries on TV. Especially on Netflix.
I am currently in the middle of a Dateline episode in which a woman kills another woman and takes the baby from her womb! I don't want to leave the house now!
As they say sometimes fact is stranger than fiction! You just have to wonder the mindset of someone to try to steal a baby like that.

It took me a long time to get pregnant, So in some weird way, I get it, But there is a line and it comes WAY before murder. They are interviewing her friends now and they all say the murderer was "completely normal." Even scarier! That poor child.
How can you tell if someone is normal or not? Of course murdering to steal a baby can't be classed as normal. And how can someone think they'll get away with it? Just blows my mind.
Oh, I agree with you on all of that. She even tried to fool her husband and faked a pregnancy!! Talk about planning ahead. Sheesh.
Well she's not completely crazy then I guess! Maybe the fooled pregnancy was the reason for the crime in the first place... "I need a baby or he'll know I was faking!".
Oh wow! I didn't even think about that and the interviewer has not mentioned it. Evil genius! Oh! Have you seen that one? It is on Netflix, I think (Evil Genius)..
I think I have seen that one but I can't remember it too well. My favorite series was Making a Murderer. Every episode a new revelation and at the end you don't know where you stand.
YEs! It is so good! Do you believe he did it>.
I do. But there are other opinions out there, Like some people think the documentary is one sided.

persona: My name is Kim.
I do not like hat-hair. I do not like to sweat.
I am retired. I do not like snow.
I used to work for airlines. I like to grill. I like to gamble. I cut the grass.
I live in Florida. I am old. I fit in where I live. I prefer the ocean and not the lakes.
I get bored. I miss having my schedule full with work sometimes. I am bored in retirement.
I own a dog. I am alone.
I spent a month hiking  in Colorado. I took a break from working when younger.
dialogue: Do you still go hiking in retirement?
Not so much now that I'm older. Between the sweat and my joints, I haven't been out in a few months. Jackie, My pup, And I take walks along the beach every now and then, Though. You'd love it.
Oh yes I do love the beach. When I want to escape Cairo, Sharm-el-Sheikh on the Red Sea is calling!
Ahh, That sounds lovely. How are you fitting in there at Cairo? I know you mentioned work was busy.
Yes. More tourists because it's the summer, But somehow the cafe owners laid off some staff because they're "getting old"..
My goodness! Reminds me of my days working for airlines. You should take a break in the off season, Come visit. I'll grill your favorite.
Sure. I love American style hamburgers, Can't get them authentic in all of North Africa it seems. Say, When you worked for airlines, Were there unsavory characters?

Anything for you dear. And unsavory characters? I'd say quite a few! You meet all kinds of people as a stewardess, You know. It's why I ended up taking a break when I was younger! I just couldn't stand the rude folks, You know?
Me neither. When people stare longer than a tenth of a second at my pale skin, They think tourist moneybag.
Poor thing! I guess Cairo isn't all roses and sunshine, Then. I never understood why people had such prejudices.
Yes, The land oftuk-tuks for the people and Harleys for rebellious women. I wish I was like you, At least for a day, In a country where women working high class jobs is admired.
America isn't that great either. When I was young, Women had to work twice as hard as men to get the same pay. The grass is always greener.

persona: I used to be in the military.
I volunteer at a bunny sanctuary.
I work at a ship yard.
I would consider adopting a bunny for myself.
My military background help keeping everything organized. I learned a lot of skills while I was in the military.
dialogue: What branch of the military you were in?
I was in the Navy! If you joined the military what branch would you want to join?

I'm not sure. I'm not disciplined enough to learn to fly or anything, So that takes out the air force. Maybe the Navy or something a little less stringent like the National Guard? I honestly don't know.
There's a lot to consider and a big decision to make! It is a lot of hardwork!
No matter what though, I have to wait until my arm is completely healed and then do some physical therapy. I'm hoping that it doesn't give me any issues in the long run.
Ah yes! I've never broken any bones how long will it take to heal?
They're saying I have to be in the cast for about a month, And then another 2-3 months of pt after that.
Ah that sucks! What color cast do you have?
I went with green. The ladies say it really brings out my eyes, Hahaha.
My favorite color is green! Hopefully I get the chance to sign your cast!
That would be awesome! Say, Maybe while I'm waiting I could get a pet. Maybe that could help me get a bit more organized and reliable. What do you think?
I think it's probably not a good idea to get a pet before you have become organized and reliable, Maybe afterwards when you know you are ready?

persona: I am from Alabama. I work in construction. I learned construction from my dad.
I have 5 cats. I rescued those cats at one time. They are very special to me.
I like to cook. Watching the Food Network or following cooks on Facebook is a good way to learn to cook. I cook pasta liguene.
I work hard. I worked my way up the ladder with my strong work ethic. I make good money. I am my own boss. I am happy.
I have more than two cats. One of my cat's name is Groucho.
dialogue: Yay! Bubbles is officially my kitty. I took him to the vet to get him his shots and microchipped, Then ran over to PetSmart to get him a collar and personalized tag.
That's awesome! Are you getting him anything else?
Gosh, I'm not sure! I haven't had a cat that I actually own before. What does Groucho like? Any suggestions for the best toys?
He's a weird cat. He really likes to play fetch and I also have a ribbon that he likes to chase. All of my cats love the ribbon so I'd probably go with one of those and maybe a scratching post too.

Cool, I'll get the scratching post and some ribbon. I'd love it if Bubbles would play fetch but I'm not holding my breath. What about one of those laser pointers? Do you have one of those? I've seen videos of cats going wild over them.
Oh yeah, My cats go insane for those. They'll jump up the wall at the laser if you keep it within their reach.
Okay then I'm definitely getting one of those. Say, How is your sick cat doing? Didn't you tell me one of Groucho's brothers wasn't feeling well?
He's doing a lot better. He wasn't eating or drinking and I was about to take him to the vet, But then he started acting normally again that night.
Oh good! I'm glad to hear that. So he just starting eating again? Did you change his food or anything?
Nope. He just must not have been feeling well that day. I was fearing the worst but it all turned out okay.
Thank goodness. I'm glad it was a false alarm. I'd freak if Bubbles got sick. So, How's work been this week? Still busy?
It's been fine, The weather hasn't been great at all so I've had a few days off.

persona: I live in the city. I used to live on a farm. I'm homeless. I may move back to the country.
I have a drinking problem.
I use to teach dancing. I live in a box.
I am 45. My mother is dead.
I want to open a dance studio. I need a job.
I struggling with finding something to make me happy. I am separated from my wife. I have mental health issues. I feel responsible for my situation.
I believe homelessness is a choice.
dialogue: I cleaned out my pantry last week and I have lots of canned goods I need to get rid of. You're welcome to have them if you want.
That would be great! That will really help me save some money so I can hopefully find a place to live soon.
Yes. Finding a place to live I'm sure is at the top of your list. Are you working with a program or on your own?
I'm working on my own right now. Do you know of any programs that can help me?

Working with social security we often have to assist our clients who can't make it just on their SSI and need additional assistance. I think the best programs are there. Every town has an office. Stop in and I am sure they will help you.
Thank you so much, That will really help. How's your father doing?
My father is a workaholic. He's doing well, But I wish I got to see him more. How about you? Is your dad in the area?
I don't know where he is. He doesn't want to talk to me. He's embarrassed about my situation.

Ya, I hear you there! There was some distance with me and my dad too! He wasn't a fan of my pole dancing. I do miss it though, But I get it.... "not respectable." Don't give up tho. He may come around. I think you just need to focus on you for right now tho.
I'm sure he'll come around eventually. I'm glad you're getting back into pole dancing. I know how happy it makes you.
What do you do that makes you smile?
I'm honestly happiest when I'm working on the farm. I'd like to move back out into the country and work on one.

persona: I have a red and blue striped race motorbikek. I have been racing on my motorbike for 10 years. I wear a helmet and safety eyewear when I ride my motorbike.
I race motorcycles.  I have a race in two weeks.
I live in Tennessee.  I will be racing in Birmingham, Alabama at Barber Motorsports Park.
I am on TV.
dialogue: Do you plan on painting your motorbike?
I don't think so. At least not right now. Maybe when it's not racing season.
How often do you race?
Once every two weeks usually. Sometimes two times in that time frame.
Wow, You are travelling all over the place for participating in those races then? Any memorable experiences?
Yea, I usually travel all around the southeast. I'm looking at expanding my races next year though. Most memorable is probably coming in first at the race in bham in 2014.
Any particular new places that you're aiming to go next year?
I read about a race up in Iowa that's supposed to be pretty intense. I'd love to try that out!
Reading your story I feel like I need to go outside and do something myself. I'm going to cheer you on from home!
It's all about finding what you love and doing it, Ya know? Thank you for the support!
Do you have family? Are they okay with you going all over the place for racing?
I'm not married for now. I'm dating, But they enjoy traveling with me.

persona: I have an ex-boyfriend.
I had a birthday recently. I am 18 years old. My parents forgot my birthday. My parents are self-absorbed. I do not get along with them.
I have a pet fish named Finley. My pet fish is a Beta.
I love sunrises and sunsets. I own and use a camera. I take many pictures of the sky.
I have an interest in gardening.
dialogue: My gardening is growing nicely!
I'm happy for the good news! It's been a rough days. Did you see the sunrise this morning? I was able to snag a few pictures.
Yes I did, And meditated upon the rising sun for a good half hour! I wish for the times in Ancient Egypt where the miracle of the rising sun was explained by a scarab pushing it across the sky.

Yeah, Lol. I'm sure the sunrises look great with all the open spaces in Egypt. I'd love to travel there some day, But that's enough about me. How are things with you and your girlfriend? It's your anniversary today, Right?

Things with my girlfriend are great. Leading up to my anniversary I feel somewhat at peace and contented. At least my parents aren't questioning my choices, And my publicly LGBT lifestyle isn't attracting too many trolls!
Lucky! I'm glad things are going so well with you. You two make a lovely couple, I'm jealous <3.
Ehhh... My middle school's students are kinda nosy when my wife comes in for guest lessons.
Ugh, Sounds like middle schoolers! I've been trying to stay busy, Myself, With college coming up in the fall and all.
Oh cool! Parents proud of you for going to college? I know mine aren't too excited.
Not really. I've been arguing with them for weeks trying to get the information I need for FAFSA and applications. Nothing out of the usual but that doesn't make it hurt any less.
So sad to hear that. And even worse, I would think is that ex-boyfriend of yours! Have you tried venting to your pet fish?
Well as great as Finley is, I'm pretty sure the yelling is stressing them out. Betas aren't exactly the most sturdy, But I love the little swimmer.

persona: I garden. I do outdoor walking.
I go to church every week.
I am a school teacher. I handle senior chemistry. We have lab day.
I have a dog named Watson. I take my dog to church with me, but he waits outside during service.
dialogue: My cat just got into a big fight with a racoon. He's okay, But I'm going to take him to the vet tomorrow to make sure he doesn't need antibiotics. He's vaccinated for rabies, So that's one good thing.
Oh no how stressful! I hope your cat is okay! Does he seem alright/.
He does, He just has a little puncture wound. It didn't even bleed much. It's better to be safe than sorry.
Oh 100% you don't want to take any chances with the poor guy! I would deffo bring my dog if the roles were reversed.
I don't know how to keep him from fighting the racoons. I called a pest management company and they should be getting back with me today.
Hopefully they will have some answers for you as to what you can do! Have you thought anymore about going back to church?
I haven't decided yet. I have several friends that are encouraging me to go. Maybe I'll be able to catch a ride with one of them.
That would be handy - you shouldn't go unless you feel happy with your decision though! There's no rush.
There are so many benefits from belonging to a church. It would be nice to reconnect with my church family.
That's true - it can give a real sense of belonging.
Does your church offer activities outside of Sunday services?
Yes - there's a regular bible study during the week and we do a lot of charity work together!

persona: I have cats. My cats and I watch the birds. I watch birds in my backyard. I saw a blue jay. I like to bird watch with my mom.
I did not drink coffee. My doctor said not to drink coffee.
I am sad when the holidays are coming. My kids do not come. I am old.
I am on a carnivore diet. I have had good results with the diet. My skin looks better because of the diet. I like Joe Rogan.
dialogue: I caught the peacock with a protective gear on. I called Animal control on the peacock.
Oh good! Have you talked to Frank about it?
Frank helped me catch it! I think peacocks are beautiful just not when they are running around my street!
Aww good. I am surprised he was ok with animal control getting involved. Was anyone or any animals hurt in the process?
No, Everyone was fine! It was best for the birds safety since it was in the road and could have gotten hit by a car!
Thank goodness. I wonder how my cats would react if they saw a peacock outside. They probably would have caught it for you! Lol.
Oh no! Have they ever hurt a bird before? Or do they stay inside?
They are indoor kitties but one (named Frank, Actually!) liked to slip out. He has never brought me a bird, But a few adorable mice have met their demise when he escapes.
Oh my Frank! I have never had a pet before! Is it nice?
Oh, It is everything! They are so much more loyal and trustworthy than humans. I wish I could foster dogs but the kitties would be very unhappy with me.
Ahh that would be nice! I'm happy just watching the animals outside!
The wild ones are fascinating, But you could save a little life if you adopted! Maybe get a herding dog that can safely scare off the peacock next time.

persona: I'm a watch dealer cashier at a pawn shop.
I love shoes.
My parents won't let me work as a stripper. A queen paid me to dance. I strip because my parents won't buy me a Rolls Royce.

I want a dog. I would like to have a companion that gives me unconditional love. I am trying to decide between a breed dog and a shelter dog. I need a dog that doesn't need miles of walking a day. I loved a Border Collie in the past. My home needs a medium or small dog.
dialogue: My neighbor has to move and get rid of their dog, It is a small German Shepherd would you be interested in taking her?
Yes, I've really been wanting a dog! A small German Shepherd would fit what i'm looking for.
That's great, When do you think you can take her?
As soon as possible. I'm free to come pick her up anytime this weekend.
Oh, But I was planning on going hiking this weekend. Maybe we can all go together!
That would be great! We can all bond right away. I'm sure the dog would be fine coming with us.
Yeah, And then she can go home with you once we're done. What do you plan on doing once you get back?
I'll probably work on getting the dog used to the house. Maybe I can pick up some toys so she'll be more comfortable.
That's very kind of you. She loves squeaky toys, So you should definitely get her some of those.
Nice! Do you have any tips for taking care of a german shepard?
Shower them with love! My dogs can't get enough hugs and kisses, So we're all very close.
Good. I really just want a companion to cuddle with and give a lot of attention.

persona: I am not married. My girlfriend has a chihuahua. We are mixed race couple.
I work in the west virginia coal industry.
I enjoyed playing sport when I was younger.
i have a small dog. My dog is microchipped. My dog is a feisty chihuahua.
My dog gave me a small injury this week.
dialogue: What sports did you play when younger?
I loved playing soccer! Did you play tennis when you were a kid?
Yes and many hours of it. It was one of the best times of my life.
Good for you! Sports are a great way to make friends too!
They certainly are. Did you play any sports besides soccer growing up?
I tried out track and baseball too but soccer ended up being my favorite! Did you try anything besides tennis?
I did basketball for a year but I realized that I wasn't that good at it even after a lot of practice.
Ah I never played basketball! I like watching it on TV though!
Have you been watching the NBA playoffs? What is your favorite team?
Yes! My favorite team is the Miami Heat! What about you?
The Lakers!! Since I was young and I was so happy they won the championship last year.
Ah yes good for you! Do you watch tennis as well since you play and teach?

persona: I am dreading the holidays.
I like watching birds with my pet cats. I spend a lot of time advocating for animal rights.

I love star wars , specifically the lights and the fighting scenes. I dyed my hair like a rainbow for the last movie. I watched the first 3 Star Wars movies. I like old war movies. My favorite war movie is 'The Dam Busters'. I am watching Quatermass. I like the actor Steve McQueen in The Great Escape. I have seen the film "O Brother Where Art Thou".
I am older than your grandparents.
I want to grow my hair very long. Blue is my favorite color. I prefer electric blue to darker blue. My hair is dyed electric blue.
dialogue: I watched "The Dam Busters" and I really enjoyed it.
I am glad you liked it! It's an old movie, But a great one. As for more contemporary films, What did you think of 'O Brother Where Art Thou?'.
Yes! George Clooney is my favorite actor. He was great in that movie.

I forgot his name! I guess that's the bad part of growing old. Of course, The good part of getting old is our experience. Speaking of which, Did you listen to your grandmother and watch "The Dam Busters?".
Yes! Shes my favorite character in the movie. I can't think of what else she was in though.
Me neither. But as a young person you should have a better memory? Do you think your college football playing affected your memory?
Oh yeah! I was an athlete at LSU so a lot of my friends played big time college football and CTE is a real thing.
That's a great place to play football, With a lot of tradition. Was the coach upset when you dyed your hair like a rainbow?

persona: I eat lot of chocolates.
I am 5 years old. I like to talk.
I wish to be a dog when I grow up. I love dogs.
I like to play with blocks and sing the alphabet.
I am young and my mom buys almost everything from me.
I love Legos and puzzles. I enjoy Star Wars, architecture, and car legos.
I have Gucci slippers that no longer fit.
I have upset my mother in the past by spilling wood stain on her ferragamos.
dialogue: My dog ate another pair of my designer shoes.
Oh no! Now you only have 236 pairs lol! I wish I had more shoes!
Maybe you can have some of mine! Just kidding... I'm too attached to them all.
I don't think they would fit me but thanks for offering!
Do you still want to be a dog when you grow up?
Maybe, I still have a lot of time to decide and my mind changes a lot.
Do you have anything else you might want to be?
Maybe a vet, Then I could still work with dogs!
That would be nice! Do you like any other animals?
Dogs are my favorite but cats and bunnies are nice too! Are there any other pets you like?
I love cats, Horses, Bunnies... I love most animals now that I think about it.
That's super cool! Maybe you should be a vet too!

persona: I like riding hourses. I have a fafm field.
I love rock music. My favorite band is ACDC. I like indie.

I have three horses.  I used to have cats when I was younger. I rode horses a little bit as a child.  When I was about 10, I went through a horse-phase.  I ride horses through woods and fields.  I'm not into jumping, unless there it is on a trail. I have not raced horses. I have watched horse racing. I am to heavy to be a jockey.

I like being friends with an animal. I live in the Olympics where there are trails. I ride a few hours to a couple of days. I normally ride two horses. I also ride others  periodically. My horses all have different personalities and habits.
I've gone scent-bag hunting, but I like foxes and rabbits too much and I don't think I will hunt again.
I like a good old Southern meat-and-three restaurant.
I would like a food trip around the world.  I like pho with meatballs and tendon with all the toppings.
dialogue: I have been reading up on horse racing since it looks fun. You wouldn't believe what I have learned so far, Let me tell you.
What aspect of horse racing have you been reading about. I'd love to hear about it.
About how expensive horses to race are! They are astronomical!
They sure are! Expensive to buy and expensive to feed and house. It's a good thing cats are so much less expensive.
Deffo! Would you ever want to get into horse racing?
Horse racing is so specialized and expensive. I don't think that's the career for me. Farming is my life.
I understand - sometimes a hobby can just be a hobby it doesn't need to turn into anything more!
That's true. Is it something you're considering?
Oh no way i've never even ridden a horse! But I think i'd like go and watch some racing sometime to see what it's like.
That sounds like fun, Maybe place a bet?
Oh for sure! When in Rome!
Are you going to go on your own or with some friends?

persona: I like Bach. I like rock music.
I am a farmer. I have three Arabian horses on my farm. I love riding horses.
I enjoy equestrian.
I can fix a broken tractor.  I have a farm mostly for my horse, but I do tend to some crops. I have multiple Arabian horses.
I am performing a routine with one of my Arabians to the music of Bach. I love my horses and I'd do anything to care for them.
dialogue: Maybe after my retirement, We can plan a horse routine together.
Sure! That sounds great, I have those three horses.
How are the horses doing? I would love to meet them one day.
They are great! The heat gets to them sometimes so we have to keep an eye on them. But they are great working horses.
Where do you live again? I would love a horse but the cats will have to do for now lol.
I live in Louisiana, We have a few barn cats too.
Ah yes, It can get really hot down there. I was thinking of moving south after retirement but I'm not sure I could handle the heat!
Where would you want to move?
I was thinking maybe South Carolina. Hilton Head has always been a place I would love to live.
I've never been to South Carolina thought.
The coast of South Carolina is really nice. Not sure about the rest of the state haha.
Haha I think I've heard of Hilton Head. Doesn't Disney have a property there?

persona: I plan to buy a home next year.
I have a girlfriend. She doesn't want to have a baby. I want children.
I am busy with my career. I have a tight work schedule. I work for a music label. I did an accounting course in college.
I have a thing for women who eat a lot.
I like watching movies. I like listening to music.
I had a golden retriever growing up.
I had a dog when I was a child who loved long walks.
I like the headspace app.
dialogue: The most adorable thing happened. My daughter put a bonnet and bib on the dog and fed it dog food with a tiny spoon. I guess she is getting prepared for her new siblings! I'm glad I have such a patient dog. Haha.
Aw that is so cute! Are you getting super excited for the babies to arrive now?
I really am! I've been working on getting the nursery room ready, And really watching the ads for diaper coupons, Lol!
Haha! What colour did you paint the nursery since you're having one of each?
You are intuitive! I can't believe how easy I thought it would be to choose. After taking home about 50 samples, I picked a deep sunflower.
Aw yellow is lovely and quite gender neutral as well!!! Have you been thinking about names?
I have, But haven't really decided. How about some suggestions? Favorite musicians, Maybe?
Oh I'm useless at stuff like that! My last dog was called Spot because I couldn't think of anything more imaginative lol.
Hah! That sounds like me. The first names that come to mind are usually generic. Maybe I need to listen to some more music for insipiration.
Maybe - sometimes generic names can be good though, Sometimes standing out with a unique name can make you stand out too much.
I agree on that point. I want to make sure the kids can choose who they want to be, Not stuck into a category because of a name.
Exactly - but also kids grow into their names so I'm sure whatever you pick for them will be great.

persona: I live in a city. I used to live in Canada. My home is surrounded by buildings.
I vacation in South Carolina. I don't like Florida or California. I love South Carolina.
I am not a good gambler. I can get addicted to gambling.
I love the beach. I like museums.
dialogue: I've come up with a list for more places I want to visit in South Carolina. Have you thought of any places for me?
It might sound kind of cliche because it's a tourism hot spot but I love Myrtle Beach. I went with my family when I was younger and it was beautiful despite the cold weather at the time.
That sounds great, I will check out Myrtle Beach. Are there any beaches close to your house?

I actually don't live in South Carolina I just like to vacation there. Another great place is Hilton Head Island! I've been considering checking out Georgia for my next vacation what's your favourite tourist thing to do around home?
During the fall, Check out Callaway Gardens. It's quite beautiful and the foliage during the fall creates some spectacular colors.
Ohh that sounds amazing! Might bring back some nostalgic Canadian memories for me!
Do you miss living in Canada? What are your favorite cities? I heard Montreal is great.

I kind of do. It's a beautiful country and if you find the right location theres some great snowy views in the winter time! I used to love going to this place called Bolar Mountain where you'd go tubing- you sit in a giant tube and go down a huge snow hill!
I have never been tubing before and I just took up snowboarding a few years ago. Do you miss the Canadian winters or were they too brutal?

They can be pretty brutal! If you ever get the chance try tubing out, It'll make up for the cold weather! I definitely miss the winters but I enjoy the beach so much I feel like it's a fair trade off!
I love being by the beach. As I get older, The winters are harder on my bones and skin. I just want to get away to a tropical paradise.

Haha that's fair enough! I definitely agree the tropical paradise is visually more appealing than the snow at times! Sometimes the snow just makes a brownmuck when you're in the city and its not as nice as a beachy paradise!

persona: I teach elementary school, like my parents did. I teach 3rd grade.
I love board games.
My favourite band is up, I've been to a concert of theirs.

I love teaching reading the most but love teaching all subjects. I have a little reading area with nonfiction and fiction books in my classroom. My students gravitate towards fictional fairy tales and sci-fi more than factual writings.
My students are genuinely like to learning,  playing Dominoes, chutes and ladders. I avoid computer in the classroom.
dialogue: I just complete my thesis. The scientific article really help that.
Congratulations!! How long does it take to get the thesis approved and receive your PhD?
Well usually it takes about a year and a half to finalize the thesis with the help of peer review and mentor review. What sort of books do you encourage your 3rd graders to read?
Charlottes Web and books by Judy Blume are easily digested at that age. Those books also are great for giving subtle life lessons. What books do you enjoy?
I enjoy autobiographies during my leisure time and delve into science journals more often. Do you think kids should read more non-fiction than fictional books from an early age?

That's a great question. I think because children at that age have rapidly expanding minds, The fantastical is often given to push boundaries of imagination. A lot of non-fiction books can be quite dense, Even those aimed at younger readers.
Well that's true non-fiction books can dense and dry for young minds. Although do you think books help kids in developing non-verbal communications?
I think they are great in laying the foundation for critical thought and creativity. To start question how the world functions and the dynamics of social relationships, If only at a surface level.

Well creativity is what young kids master very early considering all the different media at their disposal. That's why schools and teachers like you have a hard time making them understand the facts of the present world and rightly said "the dynamics of social relationships". It must be real tough time for you to control their ever-expanding imaginations right?!?

persona: I don't have children but do have horses. My job is working on my family farm. I have a farm. Our farm has sheep, cows, and pigs on the way besides the horses. I am looking for ideas on how to get my horses to have fun and be more active. I feed my horses mix of grain and grass.
I like rock music. My favorite artist is Greta van Fleet right now.

I love road trips.  I might be taking a road trip to California during the summer. I have never been to California.  I rarely travel because of the farm.  My parents offered to take care of the farm if I do decide to go to California.
dialogue: Have you bought the inflatable balls for your horses yet? If so, Are your horses enjoying playing with them?
Yes! We went and bought a few different colors and sizes just to see what they liked. Most of them are loving it but a couple just canter off like they are annoyed by them.
Yeah it usually varies but glad to hear you've already purchased some. How many horses you have in total by the way and what's their average age?
We have 5 total ranging from a 1 year old up to a 7 year old. Speaking of horses.. How did your horse ranch visit go? Did the kids love it?

Oh that's great. Yes, We did and we're actually planning to come back next month. Rachel my oldest who's 9 enjoyed them quite a bit, Actually reminded me when I was young and I was excited to be around horses.

Oh I remember being a child and wanting horses! My dad always said I Could have one in 3 weeks. Then three weeks would go by and I would ask again and he would say in 3 weeks.. And that kept on for 3 years until all of a sudden I had one and then several within a couple months!

Oh that's a bit sad to hear but I'm happy how it turned around. Three is the lucky number then! Rachel said as well "Mommy can we have a horse pretty please?". I don't want to be the bad cop, But also don't want to deceive her so I told her that was not an option but we compromised on visiting the ranch more often and I think that's a win-win for everyone.
It must have been hard going to the horse ranch carrying twins though. I couldn't imagine even wanting to move at all while being pregnant. How far along are you now?

16 weeks! So is still very manageable. For obvious reasons didn't ride the horse or took part of some of the ranch activities, But otherwise I didn't have any problem with the long walks. Do you any plans with growing a family in the future or is the farm taking too much of your time these days?

Right now the farm takes so much time from me that I'm not sure if it would be selfish to start a family. I don't think I'd have enough time to be the proper parent I should be so I'm on the fence. I barely get to leave the farm as it is and certainly no longer than a couple of hours or so.
Yes, I can understand. I was the same way before. There are some trade-offs in life that one needs to make. But hey, You do you, And as long as what you're doing brings you happiness then why bother!
That's exactly how I see. There is a Greta concert coming up though so I'm debating going to it. Have you been to one?

persona: I'm a farmer that grows crops. My father is a farmer.
I like music, especially rock music.
I have three Arabian horses. I prefer horses to cars. I don't get sore from riding my horse.  I love to ride horses.
I like pizza. I like salads. I have a farm that grows vegetables. I like veggie burgers.
I took a seminar on equality. I am learning about the LGBT+ community. I feel like the world is changing.
I have been in a breakup before.
dialogue: I finally got the nerve to ask that girl out for coffee and she said yes!
That's terrific! When are you going?
Just to the Starbucks for now. If things go well, Will ask her to dinner.
Great. Does she like pizza? It might be a great first date if so.
Not sure if she does, But you can be sure that I will ask!
If she does, You should take her to lucali. Long wait to get to know each other and then that amazing pizza.
I love Lucali but have not been willing to wait as long as necessary. They should really have beverage service will waiting.
You can always brown bag some wine. Or a forty. I guess it depends on the date. When are you going for coffee?
A forty is right up my alley and would be a good test of her humor. If she can't appreciate a forty in a brown bag, I may have to reconsider. We are going tomorrow night.
Steel Reserve! If it ends as just a coffee date, Hit me up after for drinks?
For sure will do, But will cost you more than a forty. I can really put down some bourbon, So buckle up.
We can play Edward Fortyhands. That always goes well.

persona: I often feel isolated.
I received a heart transplant. I have telekinesis.
I believe I possess telekinesis. I had a heart transplant.
I meditate everyday.
I haven't been to Alaska before. I am interested in going to Alaska.
I find mountains to be relaxing. I've visited the Austrian Alps.
I've never been skiing.
I've visited glaciers and ice caves.
I don't want to spend money only to abandon a hobby.
I like beer.
dialogue: Have you begun to plan your trip to Alaska?
Yes, I've started planning a route.
Will you travel by plane or cruise?
I'm thinking about driving from Idaho.
Oh wow, That is quite a trip. Do you know how many days that will take?
I suppose it depends on the terrain. I'm not worried though, I'll have plenty of time to make the trip.
That is awesome. I wish I had more time to travel. I would love to go to Asia.
Wow! You couid almost walk there! Where do you want to go in Asia?
I would love to trek the Great Wall of China.
That would be exciting to see. Do you think you'll ever do it?
Yes, As soon as I save up the money!
Lot's of oil pumping in your future then!

persona: I am a woman.
I exercise. I have dogs:one is a hound, one is a pitbull. I lost her once but found her later that day.
I am a currently a teacher in a school. I enjoy teaching students. I am excited about summer break. I am planning on taking my dogs on a road trip with me.
I am vegetarian.
dialogue: I actually found vegetarian and vegan-safe burgers made of plants that we could have for dinner if you'd like.
That sounds great. Sometimes there are only one or two brands that are decent, Compared to beef, Ham, Etc. Have you tried them yet?
Yes, I really enjoyed them. Do you have a lot of good vegetarian recipes?
In between work and maintaining my place, My cooking skills are average at best. Although there are a few decent meals. There's a great vegetarian bacon, That goes well with cheddar. How about you?
I try and mix in a few every now and then, But I really like cheeseburgers, So I tend to throw a little meat in the diet. How are your dogs doing?
Oh I love those little dogs, And they keep me busy to be sure! Great at snuggles on the couch though. I'm so grateful to have them. Wonder if the cats likeveggie meat?
They prefer the real stuff, For sure. I've tried to give them littleveggie snacks and they don't like them at all. They are true hunters.
Also, Dogs and cats have such a keen sense of smell. We smell a few hundred scents, They can smell thousands, Some dogs. We'll just have to be mindful of their health! Love walking the dogs.
Where are you planning on going on your roadtrip?
Planning on the west side of the state, Still researching locations. Nice to have a little fun to look forward to! Curious how your soup kitchen work has been?
It has been going well. We have had a lot of volunteers coming in, So I have had a lot of help.
It feels great when there's enough support, And you can see the difference in the people you serve! Good job!

persona: My name is Blob. I like to eat raw.
I like the Rolling Stones. I have used rolling stones artwork to decorate my new house.
I am an economics major. I am thinking about going back to school for another degree in the ecology field. I like economics. I am interested in studying science.
I am short on money because of my house I just bought. I have a mountain lodge style house. I want to decorate my new house in a rustic style.
I love nature and parks. I have vacationed in Tennessee.
I like spinach.
dialogue: If you'd like to come over and have me make you some of my favorite healthy foods, We can do that!
Have you ever tried raw foods?
Yeah I love sushi! What's your favorite raw food?
This may sound odd, But I love raw steak. But, If I were to come over, I wouldn't expect that as a meal! lol. I am guessing you would serve mainly vegetables - probably spinach.
Haha I've never tried raw steak before! Maybe I'll look up a recipe. Would you like to watch a movie?
That would be great. What movie were you thinking?
My favorite movie is 12 Angry Men. What's yours?
I like comedies generally. My favorite is probably Happy Gilmore. I think Adam Sandler is hysterical.
I think I have only seen him in Fifty First Dates, But I enjoyed it. Maybe we should find another Adam Sandler movie to watch!
Definitely. If that is the only one you have seen you are missing out. I will bring over a few different ones to choose from. Do you have a DVD or a Blue-ray?
I have both! My dad gave me a Blue-ray set for my birthday last week.
Perfect! You supply the food and I will supply the movies. Or, I can bring the food as well. Just let me know.

persona: I work for myself. My job is walking dogs. I have three dogs. I enjoy my job.
I think scorpions are scary.
My dad was a door-to-door salesman.
I'm not really into makeup.
I don't watch NASCAR.
dialogue: Would you be able to watch my dog next weekend? I'm going to take time of work to visit my parents.
I'd love to watch your dog! What kind ofo dog is it?
He's a German Shepherd, And he's the sweetest dog in the world. You'll have an easy time watching him for sure. What kind of dogs do you have?
Two of my dogs are mutts, And one is a beagle. She's a puppy!
Oh, That's adorable! I'm sure your dogs and mine will get along. Do your dogs usually play with the dogs you walk?
Yeah they're very friendly! Does your dog like other dogs? I know some dogs don't.
He doesn't socialize as often as I'd like, But he's a sweetheart.
Sounds great! Where do your parents live? Mine live in the UK so unfortunately I don't get to see them often.
I'm sorry to hear that, But I'm sure they know you'd like to see them. My parents live nearby. My whole family lives in the US, So I can see them fairy frequently. Were you raised in the UK?
Yeah I came to the US for college and then decided to stay.
Fascinating! What did you study?
I was a double major in biology and anthropology.

persona: I love sports. My parents are athletic.
I speak another language.
I eat without slurping or making a mess.
I am a life coach.
I love running in marathons. I am training for Memorial Day marathon. The marathon I'm running is in upstate New York. I try to pick good causes when I run but I do non-charity runs.
I have a really high arch and get plantar fasciitis.
My feet have a big arch.  My feet bother me off and on because of their big arch.
I am competitive. I run three or four races a year.
dialogue: How is marathon training going?
Not well. I think I need to get custom fitted running shoes if I want to keep running without pain.
That sounds like a good idea. As a life coach, You should know to treat your body better than that. Get some new shoes!
It's strange, I know. I can give advice but I can't take my own sometimes. At least we're both part of the Bad Foot Club.
Not a club I am happy to be in, Yet here we are: foot frumps. Is the pain showing up in your race times?
Unfortunately, Yes. I'm hoping not to fall behind my usual marathon time. Who else would raise money for charities?
Do you make money for them even if you aren't in the top 3?
Yeah, I have my friends and family making wagers over me. Speaking of which, Would you like to lose a bet?
That is good. And... No? But I am intriged.
If I can beat your next marathon time by 1 hour then you owe me $89.
I haven't even started running yet, But 1 hour? Ok! I am IN. Time to start my training with these feet.
That's how much my new shoes are going to cost! I just hope you don't suddenly get faster.

persona: I'm a professional wrestler.
I've never done a marathon but I'm open to the idea.
I help out at the homeless shelter. I find helping at the shelter to be very fulfilling. I spend most of my time with my job and helping people. I meet interesting people.
I feel I couldn't be a vegetarian. I like beans I just can't eat many of them. I don't know any vegetarian recipes.

I'm thinking about running a marathon. I run about 10km on my runs. I like the idea of running a half marathon but I am nervous about failing and losing motivation. I love running on my own and listening to music to clear my head.
Sometimes I regret my decision to start a long run, but by the end I feel a natural high.
dialogue: I heard of a program that helps people acclimate their runs and increase them to the point where they are running half marathons.
What is the name of the program?
Run 'til You Drop: 15 Steps Towards Self-Actualization.
How long do you think it will take to reach your goal?
My husband and I have been steadily increasing our morning runs. I'm pretty close to the half-marathong level now. I still have 3 months to train for the marathon though, So I think it's going well.
Ok you guys should definitely be ready by then. Is your goal to win it or just run in it?
Oh, My goal is just to finish it! My husband will probably try to get in the top 10, But for me it's just knowing that I did it the first time.
That's a great goal! Have you ever thought about being vegan?
Not really. I like having dairy in my diet, And use a lot of milk in the recipes I cook.
Dairy is hard to give up. I use plant milk in my recipes.
It is hard to give up. The protein is important. I don't think I could do without it.
Milk is not the only source of protein. Would you eat seaweed? It's packed with protein.

persona: I love horror movies.
My son is a junior in high school and he is 14.
I've been here awhile. I'm not that old. I'm married.
I work in human resources and enjoy helping people. I have always been a people person, like my dad who worked at Home Depot. I have a child.
I value my relationship with my high school-aged son.
I had nightmares for weeks. I never saw Jeepers Creepers.
dialogue: I saw another horror movie and thought of you. I don't think I will be watching anymore, Too scary for me!
Oh wow! Well that's very brave of you! Did it give you nightmares?
No I slept fine! I cuddled with my cat before I fell asleep.
Cats are wonderful for that! What is your cat's name?
My cat's name is Fish! Because he's the only cat I know who likes to be in water. Do you have any pets?
Haha!! That's a great name!! I have 2 cats. Paris and Wiggles are their names. Paris loves water as well, Which I thought was odd. He likes to jump in the shower when the water is on!
Oh wow! Does your son like your cats?
He absolutely LOVES them!! He spends alot of time with them. He is particularly close with Wiggles. They are best friends. Does your son get along with your cat?
He didn't like Fish at first but Fish has grown on him. Now he volunteers at an animal shelter.
That's wonderful!!! I have tried to encourage my son to volunteer. He plays on the varsity soccer team, So he gets busy often. Does he enjoy the shelter?
He said it's very rewarding but sometimes sad to see all those mistreated pets. It's great that your son plays soccer! Do you like any sports?
I can imagine that being hard to see. All those sweet animals deserve love! I love sports!! I enjoy soccer and basketball the most, But I also enjoy watching football.

persona: Winter is my favourite season.
I like vanilla ice cream.
I collect hats.
I like ice skating, but am not very good at it.
My favourite movie is Blair Witch 2.
I have one Russian Blue male cat. the rest are all plain domestic shorthairs. One is an orange male, one is a black female.
I had a Basset Hound. I raised from puppyhood till she died at 15. I am finally at the point where I can handle having another.
I think they are actually better for kids than puppies.
I used to volunteer at an animal shelter.
dialogue: Do you have any specific parks or areas you'd like to go?
I loved Niagara Falls when I last went, But most of the time I hang out at Washington Square Park.
Is Washington Square Park in Chicago or in New york?
In New york! I moved here a year ago.
I've only been to New York once. I enjoyed it. How do you like it? Are you settled in after only a year?
Yeah! It was a little intimidating at first but I got used to it. Where do you live?
I'm in Wisconsin. A big difference from New York. I love the midwest. Love all the changing colors of the seasons.
My husband used to live in the Midwest! What's your favorite seaon?
Fall is hands down my favorite. The colors are just amazing and I always welcome the cooler weather. I like spring too because everything is blooming and fresh and new. How about you?
Winter's my favorite! It's a great season to ice skate in. I also used to ski, But it's not that easy to ski in New York City haha.

Ha! Aren't there all kinds of places you could drive to though? I picture that area as easy to drive from state to state to find anything! Why am I thinking there's ski resorts in Vermont... Road trip haha.
I can't drive actually! I'm working on getting my license though.

persona: I like board games. I like monopoly.
My cousin teaches high school students.
I love music. I prefer live music.
I have a husband. I went to a science museum last year.
I like visiting beaches in North Carolina.
I like all types of music.
I like all animals and mammals.
dialogue: I am planning a visit to North Carolina.
That's awesome! What part are you going to?
Actually that's what I wanted to get your advice on! I want to go to the beach, But I'm not sure what's the most relaxing spot.
The outerbanks is absolutely amazing! I would go there every time I went on vacation if I could.
Do you think it's worth staying a whole week? I want to relax a bit, But I am afraid I'll get bored. Though maybe I'll just sleep the whole time!
You won't get bored, I promise! There is so much to do there. You can always relax on the beach, But if you decide thats enough for the day there's all kind of activities to do.
That's good to hear. I hope I'm able to see some dolphins! Oh, Another question -- is it safe if I travel there by myself and rent a cottage? I'm worried about staying in a house alone.
I can't remember if I've seen dolphins while I've been there, But to be honest I haven't particulary gone on any tours or anything. I think it would be plenty safe for you to do so!
I assumed as much, But just wanted to be sure! It will be my only vacation this year and I want to make it worth it!
I hope you have a fabulous time! It is so relaxing there.
Definitely. I'm so glad I know an expert! I was hesitant to go to OB again but your recommendation has helped me decide. You should be a tour guide!
Haha, Thank you for the compliment! I only do it for those around me!

persona: I am a part-time waitress at Jeff Ruby's Steakhouse.
I like to ride my motorbike. I have  a shiny, striped, red and blue helmet.
I don't like pizza. I have big, brown eyes. My skin is light.
I like eating watermelons.
I don't like to act unladylike.
I have 2 brothers.
I work at a steakhouse.
dialogue: I was glad we were able to meet each other at the steakhouse. Looking forward to getting those watermelons.
I was happy to meet as well! I hope you come back again! I am sure you will love the watermelon too. You could share the watermelon with your dog, Charlie.
Yes! Watermelon is good for animals too! Been on your bike lately?
Yes! I drove my motorcycle to my last waitressing shift. It was a blast. You should come for a ride sometime!
I'm up for that for sure! I'll try anything once! I'd even go skydiving. How bout you?
Cool. I am sure you would love the ride. And, Yes I would try sky diving. I love adventure. Let's plan a day and do it.
With my jobs it might be hard, But yes, It's something I'd make time for. Do you know anywhere we could go? I'll have to do some online research!
I do not know a place off the top of my head. But I will ask around at work and see if anyone suggests a certain company.
Great! I love adventures. This is exciting. My brothers will be so jealous.
My brothers will be jealous as well!! Should we invite our brothers and make it a fun family and friend outing?
Sure! The more the merrier they say. I wonder how many we can take at a time. So many things to think about.
